Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: artbeneva
Reviews.Content: The entrance and location are grand. The food good, the service average and the rooms need rennovation. The rooms clearly need a facelift and updating. Excersize room very small but the spa treatments were excellent. Overall, it is average. The Fairmont orchid on Kona is in a league of it's own. Not even close to the same experience. Hope they get it cleaned and updated.

Reviews.Title: “Well..........”
Reviews.Author: Mikael J
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, very good and service-minded staff..... The hotel had good shops, and we enjoyed the small shopping-centre nearby, with complimentary car-service from and to the hotel... We took the bus to and from Queen Kaahumanu centre, which was very enjoyable! =)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with superb service”
Reviews.Author: thecruiseladySeattle
Reviews.Content: We were not staying here, unfortunately, but visited twice and loved it. I had arranged a tour of the villas as I have sent clients here, and they are absolutely wonderful with private plunge pool etc. We also were able to tour Ko which has still not opened but will be soon. The great news here is that it will also serve lunch as presently lunch is available only at the poolside location which is very casual though terrific and we definitely enjoyed it. We had drinks and pupus in the lobby bar one evening and the music was fabulous. Just perfect for the stunning location at sunset. Above all, the hospitality is just beyond compare. Every single staff member I encountered was incredible and my name was even remembered from previous visit! Vastly prefer the Wailea area to Ka'apalua and the Shops at Wailea are so much nicer than Whaler's up north. Will hope to stay at the Fairmont soon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within paradise”
Reviews.Author: loopies
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay and I'll be back again! It is absolute heaven at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We spent most of our time at the adult pool which gets sun all day long. Expect slices of pineapple, cold face towels and water refreshments delivered poolside throughout the day. One day we rented a cabana pool side which was luxurious - included unlimited non-alcoholic drinks throughout the day and a fruit tray in the afternoon. It's pricey at $150/day but 15% off for Fairmont Presidents Club members. A lot of properties in Maui charge a 'resort fee' on top of the room rates but the Fairmont does not which is why their rates always seem higher, I guess the resort fee is built in. Self parking is free. Lots of free extras like yoga and exercise classes etc. We went for the breakfast package our last two nights - you can book online as part of your room rate. The cost of the breakfast is $32/person (plus tip) but we paid $35 extra/night for two of us. The breakfast buffet is phenomenal!! Just go and stay here, you wont be disappointed. Even if you can splurge for a few nights, it's so great. Wish I was still there right now...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding services”
Reviews.Author: thesupr
Reviews.Content: I will remember this resort for its hospitality services. Most really go an extra mile for resort guests. The beach front is small but no "overpopulation", which was the case in the neighboring resort. Pools are quite good as well. My colleagues enjoyed the bar, the hot tub, and I enjoyed the slide. The restaurants that I tried offered excellent food. I was just confused as regards to the breakfast offering: standard vs the "non-standard". The buffet should just encompass everything that is in the buffet. I find also good that they offer shuttle services to nearby locations. I felt safe and at ease that I can go anywhere nearby and get back in a jiffy. What was missing: I never got registered into the President's Club. I was waiting for it all week.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated family fun in sunny Maui.”
Reviews.Author: well-travelledmom
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel has the kind of dramatic lobby that lets you know you've arrived somewhere special: it overlooks the lobby bar, gorgeous landscaping with pools surrounded by perfect palms and the beach and ocean. The Fairmont feels like a country club and the warm service reflects this aesthetic. You are treated as a special guest. At Christmas time the lobby featured one of the tallest and most beautiful Christmas trees I've ever seen decorated with lights, ornaments and starfish. The hotel also offered a menorah lighting for Jewish guests which we participated in with other families. The rooms are beautiful and are all suites with living rooms as well as bedrooms. (We took two rooms which was an enormous amount of space for the four of us.) The pools are very clean and plentiful, swim-up bar and poolside dining are available and good. One highlight of our stay was a massage on the beach in a spa cabana--decadent and relaxing. The beach is beautiful with calm water and good service ( chair and umbrella set-up) though no food service, which was disappointing. You had to get your own drinks and lunch was only served around the pool area. For dinner, the hotel's fine restaurant was very, very good, and to sit outside under the stars and have the wonderful food and wine was magical and memorable. My husband and I had a romantic meal alone one night and brought our daughters (10 and 14) another evening. Maui is a sunny, pretty, happy island. We went on a fun snorkeling excursion and got up at 4 am to watch the dramatic sunrise over Mount Hakealaka (though we did not bike down). But the best days were spent at the beach and enjoying the pools. There is a path connecting The Fairmont to The Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea. We walked to the Four Seasons one day for lunch. The Four Seasons was more of a scene with LA hipsters and New Yorkers on top of each other. The Fairmount feels far less crowded and low key. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: room777
Reviews.Content: We booked here to celebrate my birthday and we stayed in one of the 3 bed villas which was perfect. We had the privacy and flexibilty of your own place but the support of a hotel. Private beach, beautiful grounds, a lovely coastal walk to the shops, pools, slide and great restaurants. The only issue and it wasn't really an issue was the Internet was sometimes a little slow but who cares about that on holiday. The villa included a hire car and breakfast, I do think they should include Internet as for14.50 a day this is minor and petty not to include it. We were a 25 minute drive from the airport and 5 minutes from further restuarants and shops so a perfect location. Staff and service was good. Each bedroom in the villa had wonderful sea views and the beds were so comfortable. Each bathroom had a big, luxury bath and walk in shower with double sinks. Fitted out kitchen and BBQ for those gorgeous warm evenings to hang out by you own pool while you cook the steaks!

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Africa55
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations in every way! The hotel grounds are beautiful, the beach is great and the rooms are spacious and luxurious. The service is outstanding too. One day we wanted to eat lunch outside but weren't able to because it started raining. No big deal, but the waiter bought our lunch! Now that is great service. The hotel is a little more $$, but is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “spoil yourself at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: billyp
Reviews.Content: Spoil Yourself At The Fairmont Kea Lani 40 years ago, the height of luxury was a clam shell sink and a humble hot tub. Fast forward a few decades and things are decidedly more extravagant. At the Fairmont Kea Lani, I learned how far luxury has advanced. You can sense something special is about to happen when you drive through Wailea on your way to the resort. The grass seems greener. The aroma of flowers is stronger. White egrets flutter about manicured lawns. Then...the Fairmont, Hawaii's only all suite and villa oceanfront resort. Lush gardens tumble down to the sea. Heart-melting Pacific Ocean views await. 2 activity pools are connected by a 140-foot water slide. Another pool off to the side for quieter pursuits. At your suite, you enter a richly furnished living room. The suite is tempered with earth tones. An airy, clean-lined aesthetic prevails. Insider tip: Book one of the suites higher up for a more spectacular view of the deep blue sea, and the romantic sunsets. Shortly afterward, the welcomes arrive. Cards from the front office. The 5-star service is impeccable. I don't know who makes the mattresses, but sleeping in the bed feels like sleeping on a cloud. It's only appropriate that the bed is on a raised platform. The rainfall shower opens directly into the main part of the bath but is contained in a separate tiled area. Designer bath products for tub bathing are welcome accompaniments. Escape to the expansive balcony. Lounge on the chaise and indulge in the cherished concept of doing nothing. Or...grab pen, paper and order up your favorite cocktail. This is the perfect environment to lay out the chapters for your next mystery novel. Romantics will want to check into one of the oceanfront villas. Complete with private plunge pool and exquisite views of the Pacific. Amenities and activities abound. How about pampering yourself in one of the spas? One unique treatment combines exfoliating volcanic pumice with purifying ginger, olena, wasabi, lemongrass, mahimahi tea and tropical oils. Or kiss away an afternoon on the sandy beach. Take advantage of a full range of ocean activities: snorkeling, sailing, kayaking, stand-up paddling and scuba diving. Outrigger canoe trips available daily. The resort's signature restaurant is Ko(sugar cane). Ko features a mix of cultures and flavors. When renovations are complete, the area will be blessed by a local Kahu(Hawaiian minister). In the meantime, I indulged by dining at Nick's Fish House. The name does not convey the high quality of the meal I received there: A heavenly crab cake, succulent rack of lamb and a slice of decadent New York cheese cake. Go ahead. Treat yourself to the hedonistic way of life. Check in and prepare to be pleasantly fussed over. This is a resort worth leaving home for. After my stay, it's gonna take a while to wipe the smile off my face.

Reviews.Title: “All time fav!”
Reviews.Author: allamerican7777
Reviews.Content: Best atmosphere for relaxation and family fun time.

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's View - Honeymoon Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™ve never been to the island of Maui, as I had not before this fantastic adventure, you may feel as I did every day I woke up to paradise thinking, â€œThis is simply too beautiful to be real.â€� The scenery steals the show here and took my breath away each time I rounded a new corner, but where I chose to lay my head at night was unforgettable as well. ARRIVAL My fiancÃ© and I arrived at the Kea Lani at night. Our expectations of this trip were at their peak because we were here not only to review the hotel, but also to be married on the beach and honeymoon in the exquisite beauty of Maui. Arriving at night had its advantages; the glow of tiki torches lit up the wandering paths and deeply set the palm trees and Hawaiian evergreens in shadow. Later I observed that every night at dusk, a runner lights the Kea Laniâ€™s hundreds of torches by hand, often with a following of excited children. The grand entrance, I noticed immediately, is open to the air on two sides, clear to the ocean behind the hotel. A valet and greeter welcomed us Hollywood movie-style with leis for us both. My fiancÃ©â€™s was a deep brown nut-strewn one and mine a stunning and sweet-smelling strand of pink and white fresh flowers. Check-in was friendly and fast and within minutes we were escorted to our room. Even in the dark, I could tell this hotel was special. LOCATION The Fairmont Kea Lani resort is on 22 acres, fronting Polo Beach in the Wailea area of Maui in Hawaii. The grounds are, bar none, the best Iâ€™ve seen. Their tropical beauty maintains an ideal balance of manicured and natural beauty. ROOMS Every room at the Kea Lani is a one-bedroom suite. This is as ideal for couples as it is for families. If your family is a little larger, youâ€™re traveling with another couple or you just crave the vacation home feeling, the resort also has large private two- or three-bedroom villas steps away from the ocean. The villas have full kitchens, tons of space and private lanais with a plunge pool and grill. I pay particular attention when I travel to whether or not a hotel room has the comforts of home as I find this makes a tremendous difference in how much I enjoy myself. The Kea Lani is the first hotel or resort Iâ€™ve reviewed that has ALL the comforts of home in my list. Each newly-remodeled suite is spacious with at least 840 square-feet of room to relax. The sitting rooms here make excellent use of space and sport a sofa bed as a bonus. Leftovers from the delicious on-site or local restaurants can be refrigerated in the mini-fridge and heated up in the microwave. Each room has a private lanai (balcony or patio) with comfortable furniture. The beds are heavenly soft and I left the sliding door open to enjoy the sound of the waves hitting the beach every night as I slept. The bathrooms here have an amenity Iâ€™ve never seen in a hotel before, a clothes hamper. It is the extra touches here, like the hamper, that help make the Kea Lani special in a sea of luxury hotels in Hawaii. The roomy, tiled shower without a door is also a favorite made possible by the tropical climate. Double pedestal sinks and huge mirrors with good lighting complete the room. The Kea Laniâ€™s suites and villas are tastefully decorated. They feature colorful Hawaiian art and modern design without overdoing the tropical theme. The sofas are comfortable and the media capabilities, including nice flat TVs, ipod docks, speakers and wireless internet allow for quality working (if you must, but don't even think about working if you're here on your honeymoon) or peaceful down time. THE ALOHA SPIRIT Rarely do I find a resort that does such a good job of welcoming its guests. In Maui, everyone is family. At the Kea Lani, everyone is long-lost and much-loved family. Because my visit was much longer than usual, I was able to interact with many staff members, every one of which was friendly and personally interested in my stay in a truly genuine way. The number of people who went out of their way to see to my comfort was astonishing. I also had the opportunity to see this same experience between the staff and other hotel guests. If for no other reason, the exceptional aloha spirit here is a reason to choose this hotel. CULINARY EXPERIENCE The Fairmont Kea Lani has four restaurants to choose from, allowing for casual or elegant dining, depending on your mood. The food is outstanding and not unreasonably priced. For guests seeking the ultimate romantic dinner, I strongly suggest private cabana dining at Ko, the Kea Laniâ€™s pool-side restaurant. This dinner is absolutely perfect for a wedding day (as was my experience), an anniversary, or a proposal. The customizable four-course dinner can include the most delectable sushi I have ever tasted, called â€œOishi,â€� and fresh Hawaiian fish baked to soft and buttery perfection. When you combine this with the fastidious service and intimate setting, it is dining perfection. OUTRIGGER CANOE EXPERIENCE When you visit, donâ€™t forget to take advantage of the on-site activities at the Kea Lani. The website does not go into a lot of detail, but the concierge will fill you in on choices, times and prices. My favorite is the outrigger canoe experience. Two experienced, knowledgeable and fun guides take up to four guests on a canoe ride off the shoreline. The guides entertain with Hawaiian tales and local facts while they do their best to teach guests how to row in sync. While none of us in the boat ever did catch on to harmonious rowing, we were lucky enough to have the once-in-a-lifetime experience of hearing the music of a mother, baby and escort whale as they actually swam under the canoe. MY RECOMMENDATION Do not miss this adventure! The Fairmont Kea Lani makes my list of the rare resorts that earn all five of my review stars. Further, this will go down in my personal history as the best trip I have ever had. My husband and have gathered our video reviews on YouTube.com/TravelbyLori. Search "Lori Metze" on Examiner.com to see my other written luxury hotel reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time...”
Reviews.Author: DNB25
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, we stayed last March of 2011 and had an amazing stay. I'm shocked by all of the negative reviews, and I think it has a lot to do with the construction happening at the hotel. We got an amazing deal booking through American Express, and by using our gold card we got breakfast included, which was a $70 value. The breakfast was fabulous, fresh.. Always busy but expected at a busy hotel. Lunch, drinks and dinner are expensive, but so is everything else nice on the island! Maui is not cheap! We had an incredible dinner at Nicks with amazing fresh fish, great service and a beautiful view. I loved the low key vibe at the hotel, with couples and families.. There was nothing pretentious about the hotel.. Just nice people. I felt comfortable and felt like I could relax.. Unlike the Four Seasons... I payed $95 for a mediocre blow dry at the salon and $25 for a drink. Yikes. Lastly, to keep in mind when booking this hotel, is the high season.. Spring is definitely the best time and value.. March April, May... You can pay twice as much in the Holiday or early winter. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Average 3-star resort, pretty loud and crowded, poor service”
Reviews.Author: kismika
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this resort because Fairmont is well known for a great service and excellent accommodations, but this particular Fairmont resort in Maui is FAR AWAY from being a 5-star resort. I wouldn't even rate it as a 4-star, definitely a solid 3-star with nothing luxurious, average accommodations and service that needs a lot of improvement. First of all, the resort is simply old, with run down amenities and poorly cleaned. I couldn't help but notice dirty mirrors all over the resort, dusty shelves, stained pillows in the lounge area and dirty silverware in the restaurant. After a while it became disgusting to know that Fairmont charges almost $800 + tax in January for an ocean suite during a full blown construction of a restaurant while guests have to carry disinfectant gels to wipe hands, silverware and everything else that comes in contact. Check-in personnel always looked bored and unmotivated, rarely smiled and looked irritated if any guest would approach with a request of some kind. We traveled in a group of 6 and I spent quite some time in the lobby waiting for the entire group to gather up thus having plenty of opportunities to observe the behavior of front desk. Pretty disappointing for a resort that claims to be a 5-star property. Take a 10-minute stroll down the beach to the neighboring Four Seasons and get completely blown away by the most attentive, friendly and amazing customer service offered by Four Seasons not only to their guests but also to visitors who just stop by for a short visit. Next time I will definitely stay in Four Seasons and would highly recommend anyone to consider it over Fairmont. Now moving on to the accommodations. Rooms are spacious with large bathrooms, no complaints here except that even ocean facing suite is so far away from the ocean that you will never hear even a distant sound of the ocean. Instead, most of the ocean suites are facing swimming pools so what you will hear late at night and early in the morning is a swim pool pump that either cleans the pools or pumps the water, I have no idea what this pump does but it is really irritating. Taking a nap in your room during mid-day proved to be quite challenging because rooms appear to have super thin walls so you either hear screaming children by the pool or blasting TV in the room next door or a cleaning crew dragging chairs in the suite above you. The hotel is kid friendly so you will see and hear a lot of children 24 hours a day no matter where you are. I don't have problem with children and it didn't really bother me, but if you are a kind of person who like peace and quite or a honeymoon couple on a romantic getaway, don't expect anything romantic or peaceful at Fairmont. On the other hand, if you are a family traveling with children, Fairmont would be perfect as your child would most likely find tons of friends within 10 minutes of arrival. Restaurants on the property are extremely overpriced and not delicious. Besides charging ridiculous prices expect to receive a poor, slow service. Ordering a small bowl of soup that they charge $18 arrived with a plastic spoon with an explanation that they "run out of regular clean spoons" so your $18 soup during dinner is served with a cheap plastic spoon. That happened twice during our stay. After second time noone ordered soup anymore because it is kind of ridiculous to come down all dressed up to a fancy restaurant for dinner and get plastic spoons. Beach area was so-so and not really inviting or clean. I don't think they clean the beach daily, more like weekly. They have employees working on the beach who suppose to bring and install beach umbrellas if you order one. On one such occasion, the Fairmont employee brought an umbrella and while digging a hole in the sand to put the umbrella in, he was continuously either talking on his cell phone or spitting on the sand around the umbrella. All of this while we were standing, waiting and observing him spitting in the sand. I have no further comment about this. In summary, I would personally never visit Fairmont ever again, at least not at this location and would seriously re-consider my future visits to any other Fairmont. Perhaps they were a great brand in the past, but over the years all of this have changed and they no longer can be called a 5-star property. So unless you are getting seriously discounted price to stay at this location and not paying more than $200/night, I would skip this resort all together and stay elsewhere. There is plenty of choices on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of paradise”
Reviews.Author: rummedings
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Fairmont in one of the lovely villas. The villas are very spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and living-room inluding kitchen. Location is very quiet with excellent beach-view. Although the hotel was fully booked the atmosphere was very relaxed and not all stressfull. Avoid breakfast if possible, since the 70 bucks for 2 are definitely not adaequate. Price-Level for the bars and restaurants is from over perspective overpriced (minumum 160US$ for dinner 2) but normal compared to other locations in Hawaii. The dinner at Ko-restaurant was delicious and much better than Ferraro's or Duo at 4 season. Overall a lovely experience and definitely higly recommended if you're perpared to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Stay AWAY! May as well be Satan!”
Reviews.Author: Chef_Miki
Reviews.Content: We may as well have been in downtown L.A. The rooms are beautiful, NO doubt. The Staff was adequate, but nothing to write home about. The "Fairmont" experience is supposed to include you hearing your 'name' a minimum of 3 times per day. I think we heard our name 3 times in 10 days. Service was not the best to say the least. Basic services were taken care of, no question, but fell far short of 'Fairmont' standards. Food on property was ridiculously expensive, and quality was questionable. I don't mind paying $50 for dinner, but please, give me a quality meal. And God FORBID you are a smoker!!! We booked our trip, and booked a smoking room. With ZERO warning, we arrived, only to find they had converted the ENTIRE property to NON-smoking. YAY for you non smokers, but please, we really are humans after all! The Fairmont has decided to allow 3 'smoking areas' on the 30+ Acre property. They have made sure they are about AS FAR from civilization as you can get! Do NOT try to sneak a smoke on your lanai...they have rooftop patrols! It is a 20 minute walk to get from your room to a designated smoking area. All in all...about 45 minutes round trip! I found a spot outdoors where I was away from the building (out by a road!), and was stopped by security and told I was breaking the LAW. WARNING...You must be 10 FEET from a Public area, not a MILE as the Fairmont would suggest. NEVER EVER EVER again, will we stay at Fairmont Kea Lani. I haven't even brought the renovations into play, as I know they will be over in the next year or two. I love the serenade of Jackhammers and Saws in the morning. (NOT!) Great rooms! But overpriced, over-rated, and WAY too many interruptions! Go elsewhere if you want peace and quiet!! Never again! I am MOST angered with the fact that we booked a smoking room, then to be treated as though we had leprocy, and had to walk 20 minutes. For you non smokers, you may celebrate, but think the other way around please. If you booked a non-smoking room, only to be told you had to walk 20 minutes to find your fresh air, you would not appreciate it either. NEVER, EVER again! Fairmont...SHAME on you. Absolute and Total irresponsibility in customer service. Don't let them down play the construction....it is INTRUSIVE!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: drivebymama
Reviews.Content: Stayed February 2012, receiving nice leis on arrival. The hotel is not as large as the Orchid (thank God) and provided more personal and intimate service. Parking was free. The restaurant was excellent and the only one open due to renovation which we really did not hear noise or see problems. The beach boys were amazing. We did the outrigger canoe which was free and saw a whale breech and many other whales. An amazing time. We boogie boarded often, free and excellent. The pacific kayaking was amazing and cost $35.00 to $40.00 dollars for an hour. Snorkeling showed some fish, not a lot but enough. We did not try the paddle boards and brought our own snorkel equipment. Swimming and playing on the beach was safe and easy access. The sunset view was amazing. Our only complaint was that our room was over a banquet room with a wedding for two nights. We complained and they moved us and provided very generous compensation. The staff is very professional, helpful, courteous and I would go again. My favorite place I have ever stayed. We also stayed at the Fairmont Orchid which I felt did not compare. Exceptional service, gracious staff. This was a special time for a special occasion that I will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kari R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at the hotel and LOVED it. The rooms are beautiful and big, bathrooms and balconies are WAY better than most. We loved the turn down service at night , fresh towels, shampoo etc. for the AM. The staff was great, from the valet to the cleaning ladies. The pools were beautiful as well as the beach. On site dining was great. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great, but fell short”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: If you're considering a trip here, absolutely do NOT go until renovation is 100% complete. If your experience is like ours, they'll downplay it when you book, and then take a "well, we told you so" tack if you mention it later. The rates simply are not justified with the inconveniences. Even if you could ignore the noise, both in the room, and around the "adult" pool and the closed-off areas, there are plenty of other annoyances, like threadbare carpet in the halls, half-complete upgrades all around. That being said, the grounds are generally nice, if crowded, and the staff is very friendly. I'm sure it will be very nice once the construction is done. When we booked the room, we were assured that all the rooms are the same. They are, inside, but the "very nice" garden view we were expecting based on what we were told when we booked turned out to be a parking lot, over the HVAC plant, and right by an elevator that the bellman admitted was under construction during the day. When we asked to move to a quieter spot, we were moved to a room next to a loudly humming electrical room adjacent to an ice machine, by yet another elevator, and overlooking a spot where there was a loud corporate party going on. I have to assume that was some kind of FU from the desk staff for daring to complain. After a sleepless night, we were moved to yet another room that, while quieter, still had a relatively poor view. Despite repeated requests, they never were able to come up with a satisfactory room for the entire ten nights we were there. Perhaps it was because we had pre-paid, and they knew there was nothing we could do about it. Or maybe it was that they had overbooked with obnoxious corporate parties. We are President's Club members, and have stayed at the Orchid before and had a wonderful experience. But we'll definitely think twice before choosing Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable all suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: daruten1
Reviews.Content: When it comes to room size, you cannot beat this hotel...gorgeous, large, up-to-date bathrooms,,,large bedroom with his and her closets and spacious living room with outside balconies...it doesn't get better than this! All this while other hotels only provide bed and bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Just book it.”
Reviews.Author: YardleyMan
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort. Not going to repeat other reviews so just pros and cons Pros: Beautiful grounds, Huge room with awesome bathroom, great staff, the lounge at night with sunset, happy hour drinks, music, and any food from any menu on campus available for you to order, nice beach, better resort than the Four Seasons next door. Cons: Need another bar closer to beach, slow drink service at adult pool Food was great too. This is the place to stay in Maui. FYI road trip to Lahaina for the day as the shops and restaurants are really good there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at the Fairmont in July 2011. We were with a large group from work, and we all had a great time. The rooms are HUGE with separate sleeping and living areas. The bathrooms is enormous with a cool open shower and separate bathtub. The king bed was comfy, linens were high quality, the overhead fan was perfect, and the turndown service each night was awesome - we came in after dinner each night to the lovely sounds of Hawaiian music on the tvs. Every staff member we were in contact with were exceptionally friendly and helpful, especially the young lady who checked us in. It's a shame I can't remember her name, but she was very gracious and accomodating. The adult pool had a few kids around, but it was quiet and peaceful each day. The pool bar served great rum drinks .. a bit pricey but hey, you're on vacation in one of the most beautiful places on earth! We took walks each day, ended up at the Shops at Wailea one day and had lunch at KAI Wailea sushi bar. This was probably the least enjoyable part of our vacation ... we waited 10 minutes to be seated, even though there were only 3 other people in the entire restaurant. Unfortunately, the server seated us right next to another couple, even though .. yep, the restaurant was EMPTY and we would have loved a little privacy. In any case, the Sapporo was refreshing, and we enjoyed lunch plates. The food was ok, nothing spectacular. We also had sushi at Sansei in Kihei... loved it so much we went back another night. The sushi was fresh and delicious; the cocktails and sake were perfect, and we had a fun time singing a few karaoke tunes. We didn't expect the karaoke, so it was a ton of fun! Had lunch at Moose McGillycuddy's one afternoon and enjoyed pork quesadillas and healthy-sized bevvies. Sat at the bar and had a great time chatting with the bartender who's wife and newborn popped in for a hello. Nice, nice folks. The place was charming and it gave us a break from the higher cost food and drink at the Fairmont. We also visited the Maui Ocean Center and Aquarium- great time, beautiful layout in the park and the staff was very informative. We went in the evening for a special function, so not all of the exhibits were open, but the aquarium itself was awesome. A definite must-see when in Maui. The first few nights of our trip were spent in Lahaina, and it was nice to get the contrast between there and Wailea. Both spots were amazing, but we definitely enjoyed the laid-back atmosphere at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We're members of the Fairmont club, and will most certainly come to the Kea Lani again next time we're in Maui. Everything was absolutely top-notch and awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: NLMaui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night for our anniversary ..we live in Maui so this was a special thing for us...The service here is excellent although the hotel looks like a scene from the movie Aladin...seems to be a great place for families..really fun casual atmosphere, while still creating an element of sophistication and fist class service..Mahalo to all the staff who work hard and do a great job!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing and very helpful - we got alot of advice about what all to experience in the area, not only on the resort but "local" restaurants, maui flea market, and other acitivities The food was amazing and so fresh

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: travelinNuts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb! The service was excellent, the grounds were beautiful, and the food was great! We were traveling during the Fourth of July week with two small children. The resort never seemed overly crowded even though, judging by the parking lot, there were a lot of others there. We especially liked the spacious rooms- the separate bedroom and HUGE bathroom were very nice. Also, the balcony was one of our favorite places. We often got takeout from local restaurants and enjoyed it while looking out over the beautiful grounds and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good vacation stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Likes_To_Travel050
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is a wonderful place to stay on Maui. The grounds are like an oasis; lush and beautiful. Our original room looked into a neighbouring building but the staff responded immediately and moved us to a higher floor with a view (something to be careful about, for sure... Avoid room 297/98 and push for the top floor, rooms 497/98). It was disappointing that someone thought that a "deluxe ocean view" meant a view of a condo building but they were nice about fixing it. The staff were wonderful throughout the resort; terrific service. My wife used the spa and said it was excellent, though she preferred the Four Seasons (from last year) just down the beach. The food was average at best, worse when you consider the prices paid. However, the reasonably priced Cafe on the Terrace level was much appreciated. The shuttle service to nearby Wailea/Makena amenities was also appreciated. Room was very roomy and exceeded my normal Fairmont expectations; lanai was wonderful. overall, a little dated, but roomy. Having a large lanai space and two separate rooms were big features to us and a definitie plus. The resort was busy but I hardly noticed; my wife spent time at the beach and pools and said it was much more noticable for her. Room noise was not an issue at all. Overall, I would stay here again due to the room, lanai and resort staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but.....”
Reviews.Author: Michelle Q
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort, but, we went over christmas and new years, would never do that again. It was packed, and they were extremely understaffed to handle it. The staff was great by the way even though they were swamped. If you are looking for quiet, and dont have kids probably should not go here. And pretty expensive for everything. The complimentary car service staff was the best. Overall we would not go back, prefer Kaui,

Reviews.Title: “always great”
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several time over the years and have always enjoyed our stay. The sraff is always friendly with a great aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Best place to stay in in Maui”
Reviews.Author: fedebeek
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful location! Great service, great common areas. The best beach on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Peachtravel
Reviews.Content: The only negative I can share about the Fairmont Kea Lani is having to leave. Fantastic service, beautful views in a spacious all suite property. I can't think of one complaint. We were there while renovation is going on but knew that ahead of time so the occasional sounds of construction were not annoying. Loved having so much room, it felt more like an apt than a hotel room. There are also villas available, which are larger than the suites and have private patios and pools. The grounds are beautifully kept, the pools are cool and refreshing and the beach, while public, is scenic and relaxing. The adult pool is a quiet escape but there is very little service there so if you want to have cool drinks and/or food delivery sit by the larger pool areas. Suggestion- it would be so nice is a bar were located close to the beach since there is no service there.

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss - can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioprincess
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort, but it won't be our last! As other reviewers have noted, the public areas are sensational, as are the rooms. The location on Wailea is superb, and is a welcome change from the high-rise chaos of Kaanipali. We were fortunate to stay in a 2 bedroom villa right by the beach, with its own plunge pool and little courtyard. We felt so at home that we truly didn't want to leave. Each room was beautiful, each with its own large and beautifully appointed bathroom, and the beds were fantastically comfortable. Each and every staff member we spoke with was so friendly and helpful - they epitomised "aloha" - and as so many of them had been at the hotel for many, many years I can attest that they too are happy there. Being whale season, we were treated to innumerable sightings of whales breaching just off the beach, which was truly magical. Our kitchen was well-appointed, and when we arrived we were delighted to have a basket brimming with the essentials to get us started. The restaurant was lacking vegetarian options, however we found that the room service menu was more extensive, and we gladly enjoyed private dining in our courtyard every night. The public pools were very good, and we were especially glad to see a separate adults pool. We enjoyed the delights of the swim-up bar! Our family sail and snorkel to nearby Molokini was a highlight. All in all, we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Fairmont -- and found ways to cut the cost too.”
Reviews.Author: Voyager45
Reviews.Content: We initially chose the resort for its beautiful and spacious pool area. The grounds around the free-form main pool look down a gentle slope to a spectacular beach -- a memorable sight. Even when the hotel was full, there were always plenty of lounge chairs. The adult pool really meant it. Half the people there seemed absorbed in their Kindles and barely went into the water. Some who did get wet barely moved. For a swimmer, it was heaven. In contrast, the main pool at the Four Seasons resort nearby lacked the Fairmontâ€™s magnificent view and felt surprisingly closed in. At the other luxury competitor nearby, the Grand Wailea, the main pool area offered endless water slides and might thrill a 10-year-old more than an adult. But the Fairmont offers more than a good swim. Except for a few villas, accommodations are all spacious suites offered for the price of rooms in some places. The suites seem to be very similar, with location determining the cost. Though the living room furniture is a bit dated, the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The large bathrooms have separate showers and tubs and two sinks. Soundproofing must be very good; in a whole week, we were never even aware of a neighbor. Some of the cheaper suites overlook parking lots and the like. We decided on a â€œpartial ocean viewâ€� suite, which seemed to be the sweet spot in terms of value. Our suite (617) actually offered a very generous portion of ocean view, especially from the terrace. Every terrace â€“ OK, lanai â€“ at the resort seems to be about the same size, large enough for a chaise longue, a dining table and chairs for four. The resort also has a convenient upscale deli. Most days we prepared our deli lunch in our kitchenette and ate on the roomy lanai , enjoying our generous slice of ocean view and saving a nice piece of change. The resort serves an abundant breakfast buffet in a beautiful setting overlooking a pool. The list price is $30 a head. Though the resort doesnâ€™t seem to promote it too aggressively, the same thing is available as a prepaid package for about half the cost. For dinner, we had very good meals at the resort. Visiting the Four Seasons, we had even better dinners at Spago and Duo -- for more money, of course. A welcome bargain was a pleasant dinner from the deli enjoyed on our peaceful lanai just after sunset. Other money savers: The resort invites you to join the â€œFairmont Presidentâ€™s Club.â€� The price is right: nothing. But among other benefits, you get free Internet access, which would otherwise cost $14.95 a day. Also, each residential floor of the resort has its own free washer and dryer. You donâ€™t really need a car. Cab fare from the airport is $55, but for another $10, the resort arranged for a car service to meet us. (The return trip was $55.) The Fairmont offers a free shuttle service to nearby locations, but many, such as the Four Seasons, are only a short walk away. We rented a car from the Avis desk at the hotel (about $80 for the day) to drive to Hana. The famous drive is indeed spectacular. More experienced travelers told us you could get most of the benefit by driving only half way, which we did. Some guidebooks advise starting at the crack of dawn to avoid traffic on the difficult winding road. Perhaps that is wise advice in the busiest season, but we ignored it and found the traffic was quite manageable. From start to finish, service at the hotel was efficient and exceptionally friendly. A couple of emails sent before we arrived were answered promptly. More generally, Wailea itself is an excellent choice. It really is in the dry and warm part of the island, which is crucial; youâ€™re not going to Maui for the opera A few quibbles: As in most hotels, the bathrooms could use more hooks and towel racks. The pool area could use a few more umbrellas for shade, and a picky traveler might welcome a restroom nearer the beach. Though a renovation project is supposed to be completed by April, it caused a some irritating noise at the adult pool. But overall, the Fairmont was close to ideal. So thanks to all the conscientious reviewers at TripAdvisor who helped steer us to the best winter vacation we ever spent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality under difficult circumstances.”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: We were departing Maui when our flight was first delayed and then (after making us wait at the airport 12 hours) cancelled for mechanical failure. At 5:00 am (after a night of uncomfortable chairs, no food, crying babies and angry adults who had missed connections) we were loaded into shuttles and sent to places unknown to rest until the next flight that evening. At 5:30 am the shuttle dropped us and another two couples off at this hotel. As fatigued as I was, the beauty of this hotel awed me, but it was the friendly, sympathetic hotel staff that really stand out in my memory. One of the staff (seemed like he was a manager) greeted us with ice cold water bottles, and presented us with "welcome back to Maui" lei's. Wow! He told us not to worry about check out times but to feel free to enjoy the amenities until we had to leave. The suite was fabulous: spacious, the bathroom was as described by others - luxurious, and the bed was so comfortable it felt like a dream (even if I was super tired I know a good bed when I feel one!). We slept until 10:00 - we could have slept longer but couldn't wait to explore this beautiful place. We ate at the poolside cafe - food was very good. Expensive (good thing we didn't have to rely on the $8.00 voucher from the airline) but no more so than the many good restaurants we had been to in Maui. We decided to indulge ourselves with the couples massage (something I always wanted to do) and it was amazing! The massage was wonderful and the spa was very relaxing with beautiful surroundings. We then enjoyed the adult pool and the swim up bar. All the staff were great. Sadly, our day came to an end and we had to board the shuttle back to the airport. Back at the airport we overheard conversations of the poor travelers that were put up in other more basic accommodations. We were so lucky to have had such a great day and all due to the hospitality of The Fairmont Kea Lani! We loved Maui so much, we were reluctant to leave...then were granted a special "bonus" day that has become one of the highlights of our trip. We would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Wedding/ Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cyberta88
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, and beautiful location. My husband and I got married in Maui on 9/10/11. We decided to stay at the Fairmont. It was a fair price, good ratings and the pictures on their website looked captivating. It's in Waleia which is so beautiful. We were right next door to the Grand Waliea and the Four Seasons, which was accessible by a walking path overlooking the beach. The beaches are not private in Maui, but it seems they're pretty private at the hotels. Not too many people which is great if you want to relax without all of the noise. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The rooms are suites, which I loved...and our room had an ocean view!!!! We didn't get married at the Fairmont, but I did see several wedding taking place on the property. We did however get a couple's massage in the cabana near the beach which was heavenly. Great restaurants, shopping and sightseeing nearby. I would stay here again! Definitely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BrendaM17
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Fairmont are huge, though the decorating could use an update. The bathrooms are very well-appointed and include a separate stand-up shower and soaking bath. The large entryway include a giant wet-bar, microwave, and mini-fridge. We had a top-floor suite with amazing views of the water and the sunset. Though we were back from the water we slept with the balcony doors open and fell asleep to the sound of the waves each night. The Fairmont Kea Lani is located on Polo Beach. While the beach is not private it certainly feels that way. Plenty of staff are present to help you set down a beach chair and umbrella Food at the Fairmont is pretty expensive. We ate at the Fish Market and everyone had a good meal. The breakfast buffet in the morning is $30, so I suggest heading to their deli instead. You'll still probably end up spending about $15 bucks, but they have great pastries and make a very good latte. If you happen to scuba dive, they have a dive shop right on the resort affiliated with Prodiver. I had an excellent experience diving with them. They have sites right off of Polo Beach or you can take a boat out to the Molokini crater (you'll need to drive to the Kihei boat launch if you take this option). Construction is ongoing at the resort, and the noise was noticeable both from my room and at the adults-only pool. I found it rather distracting. I really enjoyed this resort, but I had the opportunity to check out the grounds at several nearby hotels and if I return I may venture somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: edaao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2012. Rooms were spacious; two rooms, and clean. The bathroom is quite large and the walk-in shower was nice. My husband and I just kept feeling like it is a nice hotel, but not as luxurious as other Fairmont's (in fact the most disappointing). The other's we have stayed at are in Seattle, Whistler, Vancouver, BC, and Bora Bora. So, those are all very nice properties so maybe that is our problem with the Maui location. The architecture is strange, very middle eastern and the hallways reminded me of a Best Western or something. When you walk down these VERY long hallways, all you see at the end of them are EXIT signs and a door. No decorations on any of the walls and usually you would find a table or chair or vase or something at the end of the hallway. We got an "ocean view" room and do not recommend paying the extra price. The hotel is located pretty far back from the beach so it's not like you can hear the waves crashing or anything. You can see the ocean from all the rooms except the ones in the very front of the hotel. Definitely not worth paying more for a full ocean view. Our deluxe ocean view room (we moved due to noise in our first room) had a great view of another hotel and if you looked to your left you could see the ocean but the majority of the view was of that other hotel (Polo Club?). The best view is from the beach so just go there! :) The pools were nice, a lot of families having a great time going down the slide. But, again, I expected an attendant at the pool that would lay out your towels or get you settled with towels and bring you a drink (as the other hotels did) but the attendants (other than the pool waiters) just rolled up towels and left them on a table for you to grab yourself. Not a big deal but not as "fancy" as other Fairmonts. My friend actually ordered a drink from the adult pool and waited over an hour for it. There is a nice beach and we could watch whales jumping any time of day. The food is very expensive but it's like that all over Maui. A cheeseburger by the pool is $20, the drink on special is $10. But, you can take a free shuttle to the Shops of Wailea (or drive) and have other options to eat. One thing that was spectacular at this hotel was the front-desk staff. They made sure we were happy and accommodated the whole time. But, all-in-all, we were not that impressed. I would go back and don't really have anything terrible to say but would try a different hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hawaiian hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbetterthanwork
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Kea Lani. We liked it the first time- liked it even better the second time. Perfect room accommodation for parents traveling with kids no matter their ages. Rooms include large bedroom, bathroom and outer sitting room. The pool area is spacious. The views from this hotel are magnificent- particularly the sunsets. The beach has plenty of chairs. There is a beautiful walkway connecting the Kea Lani to the adjacent properties. Whale watching from the hotel was excellent. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1213Tx
Reviews.Content: I don't know what to say that others have not said. My family of four loved it. The staff was very nice, the room was great and we loved Maui. I love nice hotels and travel quite a bit and the Fairmont stood out as great. I really wanted to stay at the Four Seasons but over Christmas they would not accept a reservation for only 5 nights. We were happy we ended up at the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location in the Highlight of the Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: insecret9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7 night business/pleasure stay. We always expect great things from a Fairmont property and by-in-large were not disappointed. As other reviewers have described, it is perfectly located near 2 other beautiful properties, shopping, golf, etc. The lobby is gorgeous and the highlight of the property. All the rooms are suites and well appointed. There were a few flaws. They are in the middle a very modest renovation, including their celebrated restaurant Ko, and it was noisy at times and unfortunately our meeting room was near the renovation. On site food at Rex's Fish Market was marginally above average. All in all, a terrific spot and while our experience was far from perfect, worth the price. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: coachbgil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from one of the best hotel stays ever. We went to the Kea Lani because of a conference and now can't imagine staying any place else in Wailea. While the views are outstanding, the suites beautiful, it is the friendly professional staff that makes this resort a stand out. We hated to leave ... but we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: ShockedC
Reviews.Content: We live in Hawaii but took a three day vacation to Maui and stayed at this hotel. It was a lovely setting, when the sun came out :) I was childless on this vacation so was excited to hang out at the adult pool but with the restaurant construction it was louder than the 'family' pool, so I hung out there. The staff is what really makes this hotel stand out. Despite being put in the 'basement' (garden level) as my husband called it, our room was lovely, just perfect, gorgeous bathroom, everything you could want. The staff was SO friendly, saying Aloha to every guest who passes really makes a guest feel welcome. And I loved the abundance of towels, water, cold towels, and pineapple chunks that were handed out. I didn't sleep well at all in this hotel, not sure why... However, be braced for how pricey everything is, from drinks to the spa. I know its Maui and I know its a resort, but it did drain some of the fun. Despite that, you won't regret staying here! Especially with the kiddos.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: tineadam1017
Reviews.Content: This place is just amazing. I've just been there for 5 nights, and was overwhelmed by the amazing service, the 'digs' (=not, they only have suites available...), the view, and really by the friendliness of staff. I attended a conference in a neighboring hotel, and found my 'own' staff much nicer. We were offered a conference rate, which was the only reason I could afford (to share) the room, but was worth every cent! Although I don't particularly like luxurious resorts, I would be more than happy to return to this one! And if you go, say hello to the whales I saw from my balcony...

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon while the remodeling was going on, we did not even notice anything, the hotel stay was great beyond expectations.

Reviews.Title: “great time, would not stay anywhere else in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: ecutler
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Fairmont--felt it straddled the divide perfectly between stuffy (St Regis Princeville) and 'fake' resort (Wailea Marriott). It was our anniversary and we were upgraded to a poolside suite with chocolates. This room did not really have great views since it was on the 1st floor, but the convenience was unparalleled. This suite type was recommended for families but I would say it's great for anyone who doesn't want to constantly walk through the lobby in their swimsuits. We walked the oceanside path every morning, and contrary to other reviews that say there are too many kids, the pool areas of the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons were far noisier. Amenities (free snorkels and boards, free wireless with pres club, free parking) were great. Early seating menu at Ko was very affordable (for Maui). Pool areas were lovely, especially the slide. We spent almost no time at the adult pool since it was tucked far away from everything and right under the restaurant. The upper kids pool was relatively quiet. I found the staff very aggressive in cleaning up abandoned chairs littered with towels from the beach and the pool so seating was always available (contrary to other reviews). For cons, I would say that the carpet could have been a touch cleaner; there was dark buildup around the baseboards, and our room was consistently serviced quite late in the day after lunch which was a little inconvenient for napping. I did not find the furnishings dated. The hot tub also could have been policed a little better--since the weather was somewhat cloudy, you could find up to 10 unsupervised children in there, which is strictly against the posted rules. Everything else was a pro--having a fridge was great and the keurig pod coffee machine was wonderful. Based on our experience and the goodies we got to celebrate, Fairmont is definitely my new preferred hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “If only there were a few more poolside chairs....”
Reviews.Author: divisaderoguy
Reviews.Content: There are actually plenty. Especially if management enforces the stated policy (in the thick service directory in the room) of not allowing guests to mark chairs with towels and magazines and then disappear for hours. But during a recent holiday stay, annoyingly, there was no evidence of anyone being asked to observe this very sensible courtesy. Hard to make many more complaints about this hotel, which sprawls over a a large beachside plot. The rooms, all suites, are as comfy as can be, with lots of intelligent features (plenty of plugs to recharge things, two routes for bathroom access, a bar with sink and microwave as well as fridge). Service, when called upon, was excellent. The hotel breakfast buffet was a bit of a zoo, given the season, but very good. The restaurants were expensive and not any better (or worse) than their equally expensive counterparts in the nearby hotels and malls. And - just be aware - the big suites and other facilities make the hotel a magnet for families with multiple small children. So a romantic hideaway this is not, once you are outside the confines of your room.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay . . . . heaven!”
Reviews.Author: LeVoyageGal
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff from housekeeping, concierge, front desk, food & beverage as well as the deli was beyond wonderful. We were always greeted with smiles. The villa was beautiful and clean. Loved having a wading pool to relax in or lounge by on a chair. The grill was a great touch for a family cook out. My family and I were there over Christmas and it could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a friendly Maui vibe”
Reviews.Author: PauliePie24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends. Ocean view rooms were terrific - like an apartment. Staff were top quality and the whole place had a great Maui laid back vibe. If you are heading to Maui I wouldn't hesitate to highly recommend this venue.

Reviews.Title: “This is true paradise!”
Reviews.Author: acountrygal
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is a wonderful resort! Beautiful, comfortable and luxurious! The staff is truly top notch making every guest feel like a VIP. The breakfast buffet is "oh so tasty" with incredible choices every day! The suites are spacious with breathtaking views and all the amenities you can ask for! The only negative of our stays here, are that they never last long enough! Can't wait till next year!

Reviews.Title: “Location makes this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: NAFTAflyer
Reviews.Content: I find Lahaina too busy and touristy. This hotel is away from busiest part of Maui. Scenic location that gives you a real sense of the magic of Hawai'i. Located in a quiet bay which has a wonderful place to swim in the ocean. Trails connect the Kea Lani to the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. Beautiful grounds and nice lobby area that serves drinks and snacks. Every room is a suite. Rooms are a little dated but well maintained. Service is very good. Nick's Fishmarket restaurant is highly recommended and ground floor deli/pizzeria was very good. This hotel prides itself on service. They really bend backwards to accommodate guests. The Pizzeria stayed open late to make a pizza for me. It was a nice touch. Good restaurants and shopping are located nearby in Wailea. Only issues is that the Fitness Centre is a bit small for this size of property and can get busy but equipment is new and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & best concierge service I've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during early January. An excellent property in good condition, a fabulous suite, world class dining at Ko restaurant, a lavish breakfast buffet.... throw in a good sized beach and well maintained pool areas, and to top it off, first class, attentive service! Last but not least, the concierge service is outstanding, best I have ever experienced in fact. We loved our stay and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: TanteBabs
Reviews.Content: Well, all I can say is god bless conference rates, because that's the only way I can afford the swanky Fairmont Kea Lani. I'm not sure I have anything to add to the 1000+ reviews of this exquisite property, but just want to warn folks that one of the restaurants (which happens to be located under my room) is undergoing renovation, so we're having to put up with a bit of construction noise. However, we're really not in the room for much of the day, so the inconvenience has been minimal. We're in a huge suite with a roomy lanai, so instead of spending every cent we have at wildly expensive (but worth it) restaurants every night, we're also enjoying a few romantic dinners of fruit, cheese and wine on the lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Like going to heaven”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: We spent our 20th anniversary at the Kea Lani. The staff was amazing, the suites comfortably large and beautiful. There are 3 pools, including an adult only pool, and direct access to a beautiful beach. The only problem for us was that the food at the restaurants is very expensive, really overly expensive. We had such a wonderful time and will always remember it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peggydavidandkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our daughters, ages 8 and 10. It was perfect. Hotel is really very nice and the pool and beach are great. Ideal location -- less than 20 minutes away from many, many beaches -- all a bit different from one another and none particularly crowded (despite the holiday week we visited). We had a suite for the 4 of us, with plenty of room. Really nice having the extra living space. Also the outside porch was like an extra room. Overlooked the pool and a bit of a view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but a few points to note if you don't have kids in tow...”
Reviews.Author: sneakyright
Reviews.Content: For families, I can't imagine there is a much better hotel than this. But for younger couples looking to get away from kids, this is may not be the best place. They have a very nice lobby bar that is unfortunately closed half the day, and adult pool area doesn't serve drinks and kids hang out at the only swim-up bar. I'm kicking back on vacation and it just seemed like too much of a hassle to get a little day drinking going. The main pool and beach areas were swarming with kids but that may have been more of a product of the month of December than being a Disney land regularly. The beach area was great. Our room was beautiful and spacious - basically a suite. The bathroom was impressive as it was like a wing unto itself. There are so many big mirrors in there that you may learn more about yourself than you want to when you get out of the shower. The beds were a little too firm and the blankets were not breathable and way warmer than you need. Housekeeping rushed some emergency dry cleaning for me in less than 24hrs which was sincerely appreciated. The food and service was great all around but the lunch menu was disgustingly overpriced. I had a Ahi sandwich for lunch at the Beach Tree in Four Seasons on the Big Island for around $20 in a beautiful setting by the beach and it was probably the best sandwich I ever had in my life, but charging $25 for a poolside wrap with kids screaming about? I don't think so, Fairmont... The location may not be as convenient as Lahaina but it is less than 30 minutes from anywhere you need to go (Maalaea bay, Makena beach/cove, airports, etc). If you are a shopper, there is a big mall in walking distance and there are also plenty of restaurants nearby (be sure to have breakfast at Longhi's).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: maseratimo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hawaii (quite far from Italy!) but my friend of the American travel agency was right: excellent resort. We spent 6 nights at the end of October. Even if there were some restructuring we did not have any problem. Very nice and large suite, excellent double sinks bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: EA_Hauber
Reviews.Content: We visited the Kea Lani in early December, a great time of year to take advantage of off-season rates. It was our third visit to the Kea Lani in the past six years, and out first family vacation in three years. I know the island of Maui very well and have stayed at a number of 4- and 5-star resorts across the island over the past two decades. Now, as a parent of two little girls (ages 2 and 5), when choosing hotels, the challenge is to find the right balance between luxury and family friendliness. We don't have the opportunity to take family vacations very often, so our hopes and expectations were very high. I'm delighted to say that the Kea Lani delivered on all fronts. Recently refurbished, the accomodations are fresh and beautiful and spacious, which gives everyone in the family some much-needed elbow room.The landscaping is lush and vibrant and the resort's three pools offer something for everyone -- a very large split-level pool with a waterslide and swim-up bar, a small shallow pool for toddlers to splash around in, and a peaceful adults-only pool for those who want a bit more tranquility. Both the accomodations are the grounds are extremely well-maintained, down to the smallest details. From the time we made our reservation until the time we bid farewell as we left for our flight home, the staff was warm, friendly, professional and very helpful. We definitely recommend taking advantage of the bed & breakfast package. It's a great value. The food and drinks at the resort are not inexpensive, but they are high quality and bountiful. The morning buffet gives everyone in the family a chance to choose their favorites -- and try new dishes, as well. I travel frequently for business and have been fortunate to stay at many luxury hotels. What sets the Kea Lani apart from some other resorts I've visited (in Hawaii and elsewhere) is its thoughtfulness and its consistency. So much attention to detail is given that it truly creates a seamless vacation experience, where all you need to do is sit back, relax and enjoy. The family-friendly aspects of the hotel make things much easier for parents. From the toddler pool to kids' menu options and play area at the main restaurant, these small touches make a world of difference, along with a staff who treat children very kindly, We had a fantastic trip, filled with happy, lazy days in the sunshine. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani Resort (11/24 thru 12/7/2011) and had the best vacation in our lives. Although we have visited Maui over the last 29 years, this was the first time that we stayed at the Kea Lani. It was absolutely unforgettable and so very beautiful and relaxing. From the moment that we arrived to the moment that we drove off, your Kea Lani staff made us feel so very special and a part of the family. They truly turned our special moments in lasting and precious memories that we will always cherish. All the staff was fantastic and we could tell that they truly loved working there and assisting the guests.

Reviews.Title: “White Oasis in a Spectacular Setting”
Reviews.Author: Christina W
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is one of the top resorts in Wailea, Maui. All rooms are suites with microwave and fridge and generous lanais. Bathrooms have double sinks with a large, walk-in shower that needs no glass. The grounds consist of gardens and expansive lawns and the entire resort is fronted by one one of the best beaches you will find anywhere. There are three generous pools with one being adults only. We got very good rates because of the construction, which we barely noticed. The hotel has many conveniences like a deli, resort clothing stores, boogey boards and snorkelling equipment on site. Staff will do practically anything to enhance your stay. We had a private family dinner on the lawn. There is great shopping and walking near by. On Christmas Day a spectacular buffet was set up on the lawn. One beef I have is lack of shade. The resort has an endless supply of beach and pool towels. I wish they were as generous with umbrellas. Anyone who needs one should get one. Included in daily rate. That simple. Fewer people want to bake in the sun. Don't charge for this. However, this is my only complaint about this "heavenly" place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Bendreola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days after Thanksgiving. They were giving half room rates because their restaurant is under construction. The construction was not a bother, we barely noticed. They still had 2 restaurants to eat at. Make sure you join the Presidents Club before you go (it's free) so you can get free Internet in your room. Otherwise they charge you. They were very helpful in answering all questions, giving directions and setting things up. Our flight to leave was at 11pm, so they let us use a complimentary hospitality room that we used to take a shower and freshen up, since check out was at noon. We splurged on a villa, it came with a car (convertible mustang and a full kitchen and a private plunge pool. They even gave us some staples to start with (French bread, cheese, jam, fruit, pancake mix, etc.) and stocked the fridge with juice and water!! Could hear the ocean from our room! Very relaxing and quiet part of the island. Had a massage in the spa which was very good and relaxing; only thing i wish they had was a dry sauna (they had a steam sauna) We are planning on coming back here next year!! loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, great beach!”
Reviews.Author: emilyfoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October because we got a fantastic discount due to some construction on one of the restaurants. We just loved it. We were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite with a lanei and we could hear the ocean when we were having cocktails in the evening. The adult pool was lovely, even with the construction going on right next to it. The service was great and we had lunch delivered to our cabana by the pool a couple times. Drinks were very expensive but that was no surprise. We were traveling with my parents and my dad has a food allergy and they took it really seriously and went above and beyond to accommodate him. The beach is really nice and well groomed and the staff will set up chairs, umbrellas and tables for you. We also had dinner at the main restaurant by the pool under a cabana one night and it was fantastic. Fresh fish! I would stay here again in a heartbeat, even without the construction discount. It's pricey but so luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: 154943Mark
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 kids under 5) stayed 2 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani Dec 18th &19th and had a great time. The buffet breakfast was excellent, dinner at the casual Ko restaurant was also terrific - the fish was great. We loved the swimming pools and our 5 year old had a blast on the waterslide. The hotel is located right on Polo Beach which is an awesome beach for families (waves aren't too big, good enough for some beginner boogie boarding). Overall the hotel was beautiful and our room was impressive - big balcony, huge ensuite bathroom, and spacious living area. The renovation of the new Ko restaurant didn't bother us at all, even though our room was directly overlooking the renovation we didn't hear any noise. . If you eat at the hotel you can expect to spend a minimum of $130 for dinner (2 adults, 2 kids) and $80 for breakfast buffet. We didn't try the Polo Beach Grill during our stay but rather picked up sandwiches from Subway in nearby Kihei. Overall this was a great hotel and we would definitely recommend it as a great spot to go.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: suziepi3
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. So amazing that I felt uncomfortable because I didn't feel "ritzy" enough to be staying at such an expensive place. I never ate there because they are quite expensive but had my husband and i decided too I'm sure it would have been good. The shampoo and conditioner they give, the free ones that come with the hotel are the best freebies I have ever had..smelled like rose. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: Sanja B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this great resort. Upon check in, I politely asked not to be put into ground level room as we had a rat enter our ground level room at a different resort we had just stayed in prior to coming here. Without hesitation we were given a third floor room with ocean views. The rooms are extremely spacious with separate lounge area. Two TV's, one in lounge area and another in bedroom. Loved the little convenience store on site. Great, fresh food and snacks. It was nice to have free self parking and we also got free WiFi with our sign up to Fairmont membership. Pool area and the grounds were extremely well kept and clean. Highly recommend this resort. You will not regret it...

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Walkabout34
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here (Dec 5-12, 2011) and have never had better service in any hotel anywhere. Everyone was polite and friendly and went out of their way to make our stay great. From the bellman who brought in our bags and spent several minutes showing us all the details of the room, like which switches went to what light/fan and the fact that when the sliders to the lanai were open the air automatically turned off. The presidents club line was nice as we didn't have to wait terribly long before check-in. They even gave us a gift since we were celebrating our 20th anniversary, it was far and a way more than expected. I like the juice they gave us at check-in and inquired about it later to see if we could buy some from the store...turns out its made specially for them but they said to stop by the front desk whenever we wanted and they would bring some out and even went and got some for us right then! We were there between holidays and there weren't lines for anything. There was always at least 2 chairs next any of the pools we went to regardless of the time of day. The beach was great too as they setup an umbrella and chairs (complementary during the remodelling) for us, and there was lots of room there too. We even used the snookering equipment and one time a wave crashed over my wife and I and we lost the goggles and snorkels. She found hers right away but mine were gone. We explained what happened and the staff were very apologetic and informed us that they had to charge us $30 for replacement cost if it wasn't turned in. A while later we went back to the room and there was a message waiting that the mask and snorkel had been found and turned in and we wouldn't be charged. Sweet! The food at the restaurants was good albeit a bit pricey but no more than other restaurants in Wailea. If you want cheaper food go into Kihei. We also saved money and bought cereal and milk and kept it in the fridge for the week. The wait staff at Nicks Fish market were not very good, however the food was! We had great service and attention to detail at the relocated Ko. My wife has a gluten allegry and they went out of the way to make sure she got great food and replaced anything on the menu with something she could eat and even the gluten free bread was good (and you cant say that very often). The grounds were well kept and neat and clean as were the rooms. The only sign of construction was around the adult pool where there was a wall erected and occasional sawing and hammering but it wasn't bad and sometimes you didn't even know anything was happening. There was also a day when there were painters on the front of the hotel but unless you were walking to your car you didn't even see them. The hallways were clean and had fresh paint and carpeting. Would recommend this place to anyone as I've never had such friendly service anywhere and I've stayed in some very nice/expensive hotels for work. Oh, during the remodelling you can use the service elevator (which is faster and more continent) if that matters to you. My wife called the spa and got right in whenever she wanted and had great service and thoroughly loved it. The ONLY negative would be the parking was quite tight if you self parked so the valet parking may be the way to go if you get a larger rental car. Overall we were completely satisfied and then some. They even gave us a bottle of cold bottled water just as we got into our car to leave. Mahalo for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently fantastic”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler5210
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned for another week at the Kea Lani having been there in August, 2010. We could not have been happier. Everything starts with the service which is truly phenomenal. From the front desk to all those workers you meet everyone is warm and they all work to make your stay memorable. The rooms are huge with great amenities including fridge, microwave, coffee pot, kettle, two flat screen tvs, great bathroom with tub and standup shower. Balconies are spacious and views terrific. The breakfast buffet is great. The beach is one of the best in Hawaii, Polo beach. Great spot for snorkeling (on both ends of the beach), boogie boarding and just relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: rsr218
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful week spent at the Kea Lani. The staff was wonderful, the hotel was absolutely stunning and our room was exceptional. I will definately return to this hotel. Wailea has all the amenities as Lahaina without all the traffic. The beaches are beautiful and many restaurants to choose from. There are also great restaurants in the nearby Kihei that are much more affordable. I would recommend this property to families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel, if only...”
Reviews.Author: veggierunner
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani from Dec 6-10, 2011. Our room was on the 7th floor, facing the parking lot.
