This didn't bother us much as I enjoy being able to watch the sunrises from our room, and we spend most of the day and sunset outside. I slept well in this suite, however my husband complained of noise caused by some kind of generator outside. The initial welcome at the Fairmont is a definite WOW! We were greated by the valet parking attendants (complimentary on the first day), welcomed with leis, and tropical beverages, and we promply escorted to the check-in desk. The bell-boy took us to our room, and gave us a tour and introduction to the resort on the way and also gave us a tour of the features of the suite we were in. The suite itself was lovely, and huge. We really enjoyed our stay until day 3 when I awoke to find a small cockroach on the counter of the kitchenette area!! We had to leave early that morning for an excursion, and when we returned to the hotel, there was a second larger roach in the sink of the kitchenette! I prompty called front desk to report the situation and was transferred immediately to a manager who apologized, had housekeeping come up immediately to attend to the situation by removing everything from the kitchen counter and spraying. The manager also offered to switch our room, but we opted to stay in the suite because we did not want to go throught the hassle of moving half-way through our stay. The next morning we killed 2 more roaches before leaving again for another excursion. The next day the hotel had our room treated professionally. The manager also compensated us with $100 credit to the hotel when I asked for compensation. They also agreed to a 7pm check-out time for our last day. We did see another roach on our last day in the sink when we were leaving. I noticed that housekeeping kept putting the plug into the sink so I wonder if they are coming out of the plumbing system somehow? Overall, depsite the pest control issues we had a really nice time. I think that hotel management handled the situation adequately considering the circumstances, however I do suspect that they knew that there was an issue with this sute beforehand. We did enjoy using the various ammenities at the hotel, however found it to be very pricey. For example, lunch for 2 with an appetizer and cocktails was around $100. Manicure and pedicure came to $115, and room service dinner for 2 without beverages came to $100. The highlight for us in terms of food was Ko and the breakfast buffet. We loved the beach and the adult pool area. I took a yoga class when I was there and found it to be too gentle for the style of yoga that I am used to which is much more vigorous. We visited during construction, however this did not really bother us at all. If if were not for the pest control issue I woul have rated this hotel a 5, however in general I think my spouse and I prefer an atmosphere that is slightly more casual (such as the hotels on the Ka'anapali strip).

Reviews.Title: “Truly a beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: hms16
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! After spending the 1st 6 days at another hotel in Maui I was leery to come (had a such a great time at the other hotel)....... and we were not disappointed at all! First time staying ont he Wailea part of the island. A more "resorty" type feel then Kaanapaali and loved it!!!!! The hotel to put it simple is gorgeous.... loved the room especially the size of them, all the facilities at the hotel, grounds, bars and restaurants, locations, and free transportation was a great perk! From the moment we arrived we were greeted with wonderful service. They greet you with a flower lei for the ladies and beaded lei for the men and nice fruity cocktail! Thats a way to start a vacation! The lay out of the hotel makes everything accessable and easy to get too. Make sure to take advantage of the free transportation they provide in the Lincoln SUV.... really comes in handy so you do not need to drive everywhere. So make sure to enjoy happy hour at the lobby bar..... awesome spot to watch sunset. Make sure to get there early as it fills up! Loved all the pools..... especially the pool with the swim up bar. The bar staff is wonderful and so entertaining! Take advantage of the great amenities at the beach as well..... get an umbrella and chairs set up for you and then check out a Body Board and snorkle equipment. If you snorkle to the right of the hotel there is beautiful coral, fish and we even saw a ton of Hawaiian Sea Turtles! As for the rooms they are wonderful and large as are the bathrooms! The hotel was just so beautiful it was hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: NancyK2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Fairmont Kea Lani in an ocean view suite and I have to say this is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at. Every room is a suite (840 - 1,000 sq feet). We had a partial ocean view with a nice sized balcony. Each room is a suite (or villa) that comes with a separate bedroom, refrigerator (small one, but big enough for food/drink), a microwave, krueps coffee maker, wine opener. The bathroom has two sinks and the bedroom has two closets. It also comes with bathrobs, slippers and fresh water left each night for us. There were also two huge flat screen tv's with DVD/blue ray players. The hotel also offers complimentary snorkel gear and boogie boards. The Luana Lounge has happy hour every evening 4p-6p with drinks that are 50% off. Breakfast buffet is all you can eat for $25 each. We had the opportunity of seeing a villa while we were there and they are FANTASTIC. Ocean front/view 1, 2 or 3 bedrooms with a dipping pool. A villa comes with complimentary breakfast buffet each morning, a rental car and the concierge will stock your kitchen for you. It's also good to note that the Kea Lani/Wailea area has better weather than the Kaanapali area (at least when we were there) in the wintertime. The northern part of Maui can have more rain than the south part, where Wailea is located. I would highly recommend the Fairmont Kea Lani to anyone that can afford it. And keep in mind the extra added touches that they give you when you price out your trip.

Reviews.Title: “I come back year after year.”
Reviews.Author: jeffkov
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property. Large suite style rooms, great grounds, and very peaceful. There is a microwave and mini fridge for those days you don't feel like eating out, but there are lots of great restaurants within walking distance. They also have a car service which is very convenient if say you would like to have a couple of extra drinks. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise by the sea”
Reviews.Author: ddie
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel. It is truly beautiful. Very open from the front all the way to the beach. The walk to the beach is beautiful. I stayed in a stunning suite which was pricy but so peaceful and relaxing. The grounds are stunning and beautifully manicured. Rent a car as you have to travel to go anywhere and the area is quite remotish. The restaurants are delicious and breakfast is super. The spa with the hydro bath is pampering. The gardens are lovely. I took a helicopter ride and the vistas of waterfalls and terrains are magnificent. You can buy a DVD copy of your flight. There is shopping nearby. Just wear wedges, sundresses, flats and bring 2+ bathing suits. There is a Safeway to buy fresh fruits and snacks but it is fairly near the airport so buy before getting to the hotel. The grand wailea is walking distance and also lovely. The staff are pleasant, professional and well groomed. It is a great quiet place for couples and families. Great golfing but honestly the beach is serene and the pools with waterfalls are lovely and I spent most of my time reading, soaking up the sun. There is lots of other attractions and something for everyone. It is pricy but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Augie1966
Reviews.Content: We love ths hotel and it is the only property we consider when in Hawaii. Rooms are great for family (our kids are 12 and 16). The pool area is excellent with plenty of grass area for beach chairs. The beach is great for swimming, body surfing and snorkeling. We also rent stand up paddle boards from the guys on the beach property. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Maui Dream”
Reviews.Author: SarsotaSlim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently vacationed in Maui for a week. We usually stay in the Lahaina/Kapalua area when we visit Maui but an opportunity to stay in Wailea for the first time. I was a little reluctant because some of the reviews were not very positive but most were and, after all, it was a five star hotel, The Fairmont Kea Lani. What a surprise! It was the best trip we have ever experienced. All the rooms are suites and this is a great amenity. The bathroom was large, separate sinks, Roman shower, and best of all, a separate toilet room. Nicely appointed with large screen TV's in all rooms and all the electronic adapter equipment for any equipment we brought with us. The staff was very attentive and timely. The concierge was very helpful and was able to make all my golf tee times as requested and even at a discount from regular pricing. While valet parking was offered (and given free the first night!) we opted for the self parking since we were going to be in and out quite often and it was so convenient. The hotel is perfectly located with its own beach and is wonderfully landscaped. The restaurants in the hotel are very nice and offer a large selection. However, you can easily drive to numerous nearby restaurants and the Shops at Wailea are within walking distance. While nothing is perfect, this hotel is a keeper. The only less than appealing issues for us were A) The food and beverage prices in the hotel were a little high for us, B) There were more children than we expected (early November???), and, C) The parking spaces in self parking are way to small for any comfortable parking. Yet, overall, it was a great stay and we would definitely consider the Fairmont Kea Lani as our first choice on our subsequent trips to the island. Fairmont really knows what the client is looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning property - Must stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: floridayogi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon. Our suite was beautiful - huge bathrooms. Since they were doing renovations, we only paid 1/2 the normal cost so the value was unbelievable! We didn't hear any construction noises, etc. The service everywhere on the property was superb. Loved the breakfast buffet which was included in our stay. The hotel is located in a great spot in Maui - excellent for morning runs, snorkeling, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the second week of our two week honeymoon (after a week in Kauai). First off, it is not strictly for honeymooners or couples, there are families here. We were not bothered by that, even after coming off a week in a small (and awesome) resort in Poipu, Kauai. Overall, we had a great time here. Room - By far the nicest room I have ever stayed in. We were on the top floor, facing the ocean, and had a huge balcony. We walked into a foyer, with a full living room/office, a massive bathroom and bedroom, and one of the best views in the place. As a regular business traveler, I have been through the good, the bad, and the great. This room was GREAT - we barely ever wanted to leave the room. We sprung for the full ocean view suite (we got a discount because of the construction which was barely noticeable and did not bother us at all) - the upgrade was worth it. The bed was comfy and the room was quiet. Staff - Everyone, from the valets, to the front desk folks, the bartenders, the pool boys/girls, the concierge, the cleaning staff, and the servers at breakfast was great. We did have one questionable server late one night at dinner, but we can shake that off. Everyone else was nothing but nice and helpful. Activities - They have their own beach, which while it can be crowded, was never so full that we didn't have our own chairs/umbrella and plenty of privacy (even if people were around). There are 3 pools, and even with families around, we didn't feel crowded. Plus, there is a slide from pool to pool. My wife and I are 27, but even we both enjoyed it. Food - The buffet breakfast was a normal breakfast, but it had great selection and good service. Not the best in the world, but a great selection of food, coffee, and juices to start each day. Amenities - We also got a massage at the Spa while we were there, and I can highly recommend that. The price was fair, and the service was great. Location - Wailea was perfect. It did not feel very crowded, had shopping and tons of great restaurants, and made anyone on the island accessible within 30-45 minutes (with the exception of Hana which you NEED to drive to one day). Side note - if the weather is nice, and you decide to drive the road to Hana, please please please... regardless of what you "hear"... drive the entire way around the island. We had a Mazda 3 and made it with NO issue. I would also suggest highly the "Revealed" series of books... they gave us the info that we should drive the entire way (and go to Haleakala for sunrise) and it was amazing). I could not imagine only driving half (to the 7 Sacred Pools) and turning around. The only thing that should prevent you from going the entire way is rain. Overall, we had no complaints about this hotel and would recommend it to friends, family, and others. The service and staff were great, and the room (its amenities and view) was the best we have EVER stayed in. The price, especially given the construction discount, was fair, and worth it. While I understand this isn't a small place (its a full resort), and its not super quiet (there are families and a decent number of people) - even after a stay at a 40 room resort in Kauai with peace and quiet - this resort was still great. I would highly recommend and hope to make it back again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: patmiller320
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here the beginning of December 2011. We absolutely decided this property was top-of-the-line....especially after walking the others in the Wailea area. It's not that the other properties weren't nice, but rather the Fairmont was absolutely wonderful. The room was a partial ocean view and the largest room I have ever stayed in (other than Dubai, of course). Huge bathroom, large bedroom w/2 queen beds & large flat-panel TV, sitting room with wrap-around sofa, desk, 2 chairs, large flat-panel TV and credenza with loads of space. There was ever a separate room with a wet bar and electronic safe. Then the bathroom is an extraordinarily large room with double sinks/mirrors, large soaking tub, huge shower. Pools and beach are extraordinary. Balcony is the largest I have ever seen, complete with large round table, 4 chairs, lounge chair for laying down on the balcony, and small table for side of lounger. Best part is the walking/jogging trail which fronts the ocean and meanders throughout the Wailea area in total. You also enjoy the buffet breakfast (it's wonderful) and the free parking--all make for a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: audra27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second part of our honeymoon. It was during Thanksgiving week which may have contributed to the crowds of children. We definatly felt outnumbered by children. The hotel itself is beautiful as are the rooms. We had a partial ocean view which was a stretch. The bathroom was huge and well appointed. The service at this hotel was great also. Housekeeping came to our room twice a day and replaced towels and turned down our bed at night. We had breakfast included in our package and the food was great. Children running around the restaurants though, was not really our cup of tea. It was difficult to get a chair at the pool or beach because of the large crowds. The adult pool was uncrowded and nice and peaceful. We got a great deal because of the renovation that was going on, which didn't affect us at all. The construction was behind the adult pool and was not noisy or bothersome. This place is beautiful, but I wouldn't stay here for full price.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: TomWall60
Reviews.Content: This resort is a 10 plus in every way. If you are looking for a classy experience where the staff, rooms, ambiance and overall feeling yo get is over the top, go here. The resort is a true resort. When you arrive, everyone knows your name and treats you like you are so special. The rooms are large, modern and clean. Nightly turn down service is provided. They don't charge for things like umbrellas and beach lounges. There is no resort fee added as many hotels add. The managers only know how to please you. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and dinners in the restaurants are well worthwhile. We have stayed at twp other highly rated Maui resorts and visited a couple of others. The best they can be rated is a 7 compared to Fairmont's 10 plus. For a great Maui experience, don't mess around, just go to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! They authorize what may be your DEBIT card for $100 x number of nights you plan to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ScenicWeddings
Reviews.Content: Nice location, but service stinks! Also, they don't tell you when you check in that they are going to authorize the card you give them! We paid in full for our stay and on day 2 of a 5 night stay, our debit card was debited $760 in case we were going to charge anything! It took us wasting time with the manager at the front desk to get it reversed! Not to mention that front desk staff lied to our faces and said that all hotels do that! NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Not for active vacationers”
Reviews.Author: xbigarmx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 days in Maui, and there were some mixed feelings about this resort. I will give you my pros and cons: Pros: Nice clean rooms that were up to date. Hotel is in a nice area in Wailea, close to Kehei and some other nice beaches. We had a great dinner at Nick's Fish Market on the property. The staff were all very nice for the most part. For our day-trip to Hana, they gave us a cooler and guide CD to borrow. Cons: The beach is average at best. Also, we have stayed at many luxury resorts before, and have never had an issue with getting water toys (snorkel gear, kayaks, boogie boards, etc.). Other resorts will let you keep these for your entire trip, and is included in your resort fee. Not the Fairmont. Here you have to check it out each morning, and have it returned by 4 to avoid a 20 dollar charge. In addition, they do not have a lot of anything. We were told most days they were all out. Other days, we were told they would not rent them out because of conditions. All this even when we told them we were going off property to another beach. Food and Drink here are WAY overpriced. I have no issue paying $15 for a drink, $20 for a sandwich, or $4 for a coffee if they are at least decent. Everything here was what you might expect from a 3 star hotel. Also, the Happy Hour only includes well drinks, so don't get your hopes up. (This does not include dinner at Nick's which was well worth it) Conclusion: We came during the remodel promo, so we got a good deal. Would I ever stay here for full price? Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_petunia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for a wedding. We got a good rate at $199, due to the wedding and the renovation specials. Unlike many hotels on Maui, there is no additional resort fee. Self-parking is included. We had a suite (I believe all rooms are suites) on the far end, main floor of the hotel (room M79). We were four friends sharing a room (one couple and two singles), so the suite set up worked nicely for us. The couple had the bedroom and the two single gals shared the sofa bed. Our room was on a corner and appeared to be larger than other rooms at this rate. - Entrance area was huge and included a wet bar with a small fridge, sink, microwave, coffee maker, kettle, cupboards and a closet. - Bathroom was enormous. Two sinks, tub, shower & separate toilet. The shower, while open to the bathroom, was around the corner a bit, so it was very private and worked well (along with the separate toilet) for the four of us sharing the space. - Bedroom was a good size with lots of closest space, a door to the bathroom and patio doors to the lanai. - Living room was also very large, with a pull-out sofa bed, desk, entertainment centre & patio door to the lanai. The entertainment centre came with cables to hook up iPods, etc. The sofa bed, while convenient, was not overly comfortable. Not the worse sofa bed I've slept on, but it certainly wasn't the luxury of the king in the bedroom. - Lanai was a good size with a table & four chairs, plus a lounger. We had a glimpse of the ocean and had greenery directly in front of us. To one side, however, was the service entrance to the hotel. It wasn't a big deal, but it did spoil the ambiance a bit on the lanai to turn around to see cars & tarmac. The renovations at the hotel were a minimal inconvenience. One restaurant was closed, but we did not notice excessive wait times at the other restaurants. There was construction near the adult pool and brunch area, so it it not as relaxing as it could be - sounds of power saws as you are lounging by the pool. But after a while, it fades into the background. The hotel has a number of specials on to compensate for the inconvenience. There is an evening happy hour (4-6) with half price appetizers and select drinks.I also believe the brunch may be discounted at $25 (?) per person (all you can eat buffet). The brunch was good value - lots of selection, fresh food, and plenty of it. We went to another resort for brunch one day, and it was nowhere near as good. The pools are lovely with good service. I had a couple of meals by the pool (mainly meal-sized salads) and they were great. The adult pool has some nice little extras that I didn't experience at the upper pool. Servers brought around trays of fruit, etc. We didn't spend a lot of time on the beach, but it is a short walk from the hotel. Smaller beach, but nice. The snorkeling gear was free of charge (may have been a renovation deal), so we checked out the snorkeling just off the beach (to the right). We saw a huge turtle and lots of fish. Pretty decent, considering it was free and convenient. I wasn't involved in the wedding planning, but it seemed to go well. The wedding was held in a courtyard with a lovely fountain. It worked well for the size of our group. We had a nice dinner afterwards at Nick's Fishmarket. We were very pleased to have the use of a room after checkout. Checkout time was noon, I believe, but our flight didn't leave until 9pm. We stayed by the pool for the day and then were able to use a room for an hour or so to shower & change before our flight. All-in-all, this was a lovely resort, offering the quality of rooms and service you would expect from a Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - and we got it at a steal!”
Reviews.Author: fanatix
Reviews.Content: I booked the Fairmont Kea Lani via luxuryhotelexperts.com - they had some nice complimentary items, like free breakfasts, upgraded room when available, and a welcome basket. The Kea Lani was also offering half off on rooms due to renovation work going on for their signature restaurant - Ko's. We arrived at around 12noon and were greeting with leis and a cold guava/pineapple drink - yummy. Our room was not ready yet (check in isn't til 4pm), so we decided to check out the beach, which was beautiful! We got upgraded to a partial ocean view, which was lovely! It was on the north side of the hotel, while the renovation/construction was occurring on the south side, so we heard no noise whatsoever. They gave us a choice of 2nd floor towards the pool, or a 5th floor partial ocean view which could be ready in 20 minutes, and we took the latter. My family really enjoyed this hotel. 2 LG TVs. Mini frig, microwave. At $234 per nite, it was a steal for Wailea. 840 sq feet, 2 TVs, and large bathroom with walk-in shower (no shower door, just a tile wall, which I prefer!). I loved all the little things, from the his/her bathrobes, towel hamper, to the 2 pedestal sinks with a place to hang a hand towel on each end. And, lots and lots of space to put toiletries. His and hers closets, a full length mirror, and dimmer switches on each bedroom light. My husband loved the 2 TVs, and the one in the living room had a box underneath that was a connector box, so you could hook anything up in a flash to the TV. Perfect for people like us, who like to bring gadgets, like a Mac Mini, on vacation. We also had free internet access via the President's Club (free to join - just join before you get there so you can get your free access). They had a complimentary washer/dryer on our floor (I suspect there's one set on each floor), but it was clear on the other side of the hotel - in the noisy wing, so we didn't use it. Buffet breakfast was free for my husband and I. I paid something like $10 for my child's buffet breakfast. Good hearty breakfast with lots of variety, but for me, I got a bit bored with it after the 2nd day. I guess I'm not much for breakfast. My daughter loved the asian steamed buns - on her last day, she managed to eat 7 of them - one for each year she's lived! Lots of fruit, made to order omeletes, and other standard breakfast items. For asians, they had miso soup and rice as well. We had dinner at Ko's (relocated until their new area is completed) twice - via their fixe prix menu, which was very affordable, given Wailea standards - it was $39/pp, and they had a kids menu also. We also took advantage of Happy Hour at the casual Polo Beach Grille and Bar. 1/2 off on appetizers and some cocktails, like the Mai Tai classic I had, which was delicious! Just a few nits...Sofa pillows were smelly - had them removed - housekeeping told me that was due to the feathers. Hmmm.well, so long as they weren't in the room, I didn't care. Lanai was not very private. Also if you stood or sat near the railing and looked down from the lanai, you could see a white elephant - not so pleasant to see in your view. The sliding glass doors to the lanai are very outdated, along with the rug in the hallway. Not sure why they didn't bother with renovating these items. Lastly, during renovation, one of the elevators were being renovated. The other one is very slow. The Kea Lani offered the use of their service elevator, and that was a lot quicker to use many times. The door to the room is very heavy - so be careful if you have a young child. Polo beach, which is primarily used by Fairmont Kea Lani clients, was simply gorgeous. Nice, soft sand, and has a good shallow section before it gets deep - much nicer than Ka'anapali. There was some wind in the late afternoon at this time of year, and that made it a bit cooler than what I would have expected. The Kea Lani was offering free umbrellas, lounge chairs, boogie boards and snorkel gear during the renovation too! The swimming pools were great and one has a slide. There is a pool bar as well. My daughter loved the slide and she and my husband spent time at the pool, while I opted to lounge on a chair on the grass, overlooking the ocean, and that was perfect for me. All in all, we received excellent value. Ordinarily we wouldn't be able to afford this place, but thanks to all the specials, it was within our budget. I understand this place used to be private residences that were later sold to Fairmont, and hence the suite layout. I'm so glad we decided to stay here, as it offered much more space than Grand Wailea or the Four Seasons, which are both just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: happysaclvc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second trip to Maui and the Kea Lani. We are President's Club members and we used several certificates we were sent. There was a problem when we checked in late our first night using the certficates but the next morning two staff worked everything out and the manager called to apolgize for the mix-up. The rest of our stay was the best--a beautiful beach, spacious suites, gorgeous pools, snorkeling with the turtles, complimentary canoe ride, wonderful service from a gracious staff including evening turn-down service, perfect massage, good food, plus picture-perfect sunsets. There's a relaxed atmosphere and they made us feel they cared-especially the bellman who took us to our room when we had our check-in problem. He knew we were tired and concerned about the problem but assured us that in the morning it would all be worked out, his empathy for us felt like it came from his heart and his faith in management was well placed. Our family is already planning our next trip to the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort especially with younger children.”
Reviews.Author: sherman3
Reviews.Content: The kea lani, recently renovated is is good resort for families with children. The rooms are all suites which allows extra space. We are here during the thanksgiving holiday and even though the resort is full it doesn't feel overcrowded. While here we also visited the grand wailea, a zoo. The grand wailea for me is too busy and reminds me of Disneyland. When booking use a travel agent for discounts and package air deals. Hope this helps. Safe travels

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: MeganIsaac-Renton
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our mother-daughter trip to the Fairmont Kea Lani. We were there in November, 2011, over the American Thanksgiving weekend, so the hotel was crowded, but we still enjoyed our stay. The hotel location was great, with a lovely swimming beach immediately in front of the hotel. The pools were nice, and we really appreciated the adult-only pool. We also liked that the activities (e.g. fitness classes) were all complementary. The wifi is free as long as you're a President's Club member (the Fairmont loyalty plan, which is free to join, and actually gives you a few nice perks). Later in our stay, we moved over to the Hotel Grand Wailea, and all of the activities were extra charges. The facilities at the Grand Wailea were nicer, but we definitely felt nickeled and dimed there! We had to pay for all of the "extras", and the food there was crazy expensive ($2.50 for a boiled egg at Cafe Kula!). Of all the hotels in the Wailea area, the Four Seasons resort is by far the nicest. We wandered over there for many of our meals, and we found the staff to be extremely friendly and attentive. We also thought that the restaurants there were absolutely spectacular (Duo and Ferraro's)... it's just too darn expensive to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Barbie726
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Kea Lani for 9 nights. The hotel is beautiful with lovely gardens, pools, grass areas and a semi-private beach. It was especially nice because we had a room with a fabulous view of the ocean and could hear the waves at night. The only downside was that meant our room was also near the pools and it was a bit noisy at times - especially on the weekends. There were a lot of families with small children so it was noisier than I remember on our last visit. I believe this is partially due to the incredible rates that were offered due to the renovation on the restaurant Ko. The construction wasn't too bad but we were grateful not to be at that end of the hotel. The elevators were the only real problem since one of them was out the entire time but the hotel was great about letting the guests use the service elevator. The best part of the hotel is that all of the rooms are suites and you have a flat screen TV in the living room and the bedroom. The bathrooms are large and well appointed. The rooms have new furniture and have small refrigerators which makes having breakfast in the room easy. We would also have a cocktail on the balcony watching the sunset which is so wonderful. It is hard not to enjoy yourself in such a beautiful location with wonderful weather. We had room service a few nights which was great - good food and service. The food in Ciao Cafe and the pool restaurant/bar were great and the service was always friendly. We had dinner at Longhi's and Tommy Bahama's at the Wailea Shopping Center and enjoyed both. We also went to Duo at the Four Seasons Hotel for dinner and the food was average and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “paradise...”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel48222
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and have high quality furnishings. We were very happy with our deluxe ocean view our room (including the bed) & our view. We appreciated the fridge, microwave and coffee and tea pots! The hotel has a relaxed formality that's fitting with the islands. The service is excellent overall. The restaurants are okay but a bit over priced for what is being served. Their morning buffet is average but you can't beat all the fresh tropical fruit! The hotel itself and the grounds are gorgeous- a mix of Asian and Hawaiian in tone. The landscaping is beautiful as are the sculptures! You can use the valets for free for your first night which is great when you're unloading your suitcases, etc. Their concierges are very helpful so by all means ask them about what to do, where to eat, etc. We didn't find the hotel construction bothersome and they're great deals to be had on food, cabanas, spa treatments, etc. during their construction period. We made sure to ask for a room away from the current construction!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenals
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our fifth stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Our family of 5 (kids age 8, 6, and 15 months) enjoyed our time there as usual. The suites are perfect for families! They provided a crib for the baby in the room and our 2 older children slept on the pull out sofa. If you have a baby, make sure you ask for a pack and play at the pool. They will set it up next to your chairs at no cost. Our older children love the slide at the pool. We have been to the Grand Wailea and no doubt they have better slides but it is a lot more hectic there. We prefer the laid back vibe at the Fairmont. You can sit at the bottom of the slide and watch your children come down in the same spot all day. The beach is great and the resort offered complimentary boogie boards because there is contruction going on. The construction did not bother us because our room was on the opposite end of the hotel. If you want to go to the "adults only" pool it might bother you though because the construction is right next to it (and is kind of loud). As far as food goes, we love the breakfast buffet (and so do our kids). We have eaten at Ko and did not think it was that great. Nick's Fishmarket is pretty good but not great for kids. We think this hotel needs another option. Cafe Ciao has sandwiches and pizza to go but there should be a good family restaurant too. We LOVE the new MonkeyPod Kitchen that opened down the street and wish the Fairmont had something like this. We also find ourselves heading to the Cheeseburger place at the Wailea shops a lot. The hotel has great service. They provide a complimentary shuttle that will take you around Wailea as well. Overall, a great place to stay on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “You got to pick this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Dnmeek
Reviews.Content: Currently here and it had been terrific! Best looking resort between four seasons grand wailea and Marriott... We went to check all of them out and by far the fairmount kea lani has them beat! The staff is great and super friendly and very accommodating to our needs. Wailea is for sure the most luxuries spot on Maui great location for the fairmount kea lani! I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: toni c
Reviews.Content: We stayed four times at the Fairmont in Maui and every time it was a wonderful experience. No resort fees, free parking and lots of nice touches. Very clean, nice special sheets, very spacious rooms and big bathroom soaking tubs. They are everything they claim to be.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered Luxury, the Best Service!”
Reviews.Author: Michael Y
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Kea Lani the last 3 times we've visited Maui, and each time it simply reaffirms that this is the right place to stay in Maui. The staff is the best in the islands -- warm, engaging, and always ready with tips and insider knowledge. One bellman told me to "forget the mainland weather forecasters" who always seems to call for "some" showers -- every day was sunny, gorgeous, just plain paradise. For a couple, the "adult" pool brought welcome, quiet relaxation, but if you have the kids the main pool has plenty of activities. The staff at the beach is quick with an umbrella and beach chairs (and cold water if asked). And one added bonus -- despite being 100% occupied, the resort NEVER feels crowded or claustrophobic (if you walk amongst the other properties in Wailea you'll understand what I mean). And the rooms . . . the redecoration of the rooms is a hit. 2 big flat screens, one each in the living room and bedroom. Nice, comfortable furniture. Huge lanais --the envy, I think, of every hotel. Bathrooms with the double sinks, huge tub, and walk-in shower make the stay amazing. But throughout, it's about service, service, service. Whether the front desk, the bellmen, the Concierge, or housekeeping, this place is made special by how great the staff is at doing their jobs with professionalism and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 11th anniversary on 11/11/11 at the Fairmont. The upgrades to the hotel have been wonderful. Everything is clean, modern and the service was just spectacular from the concierge to the baggage handlers to the pool servers to the front desk. Nick's Fishmarket, one of the on site restaurants, has a varied wine list, great servers and delicious food with some different local preparations than your standard mac nut crusted mahi mahi. All their rooms are suites with PLENTY of room and the grounds are beautifully landscaped. While they do have construction going on at their Ko restaurant, the noise and disruption were certainly held to a minimum. We booked our trip through Blue Hawaii Resorts after searching and searching for the lowest prices. Their prices could not have been beat, in fact, when the Fairmont lowered their prices, they came back to us and let us know. Tommy provided amazing service and I would HIGHLY recommend using them for ANY Hawaii travel. We have already used them again for our April Kauai trip.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: gma06
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and from the moment we arrived - welcomed at the front drive with a cool drink and beautiful flower lei - until we left, we felt pampered and catered to. We had a beautiful (huge) suite with a balcony overlooking the upper pool and ocean. I loved that pool lounges could be reserved and held for 2 hours while we had a relaxing, delicious buffet breakfast. An added bonus, because renovations were going on, beach rentals (umbrellas, boogie boards, snorkeling gear) were complimentary. Several times a day, while lounging by the pool, we were offered pineapple and cold, refreshing cloths. There were daily kids activities (most of them free) and a Hawaiian Cultural Experience that was amazing. The staff was wonderful, no request too small. We are now spoiled and planning out next trip to Maui - or course, staying at the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a surprisingly great experience”
Reviews.Author: 4coolcats
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Kea Lani and it won't be our last. The staff was gracious and exceedingly helpful, the pools were wonderful, and the food was lovely. The location was an added bonus as it has the feel of a much smaller resort. Many extras were thrown in because of the renovation and it was a welcome surprise. Having just spent a week in Waikiki at the Hilton with their surly staff and overpriced everything the Fairmont was such a pleasant surprise. Our room was spectacular and always seemed to have just been made up. A truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel even during renovations.”
Reviews.Author: bryandshan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in an ocean view suite. All rooms are suites here and even the garden views looked nice. Had a renovated room which was very nice. My only complaint is the shelf behind the sink makes it hard for ladies to really do the hair md make up. Since it's Maui, I decided to go without makeup! Food was great an Nicks and the have the Ko menu available the main restaurant which was also great. Very good fish. Amazing actually. Lunch at the Polo Beach bar was fun and the bartenders were great. Mary at Luana Lounge took really good care of us. Service was excellent at every turn. Went to the spa 3 times. They had specials during renovations, you could hear some banging but for half off, I was ok with it. Would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE my stay at Fairmont...no resort fee!”
Reviews.Author: maniac0511
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont for 5 nights for our wedding at Gannon's and part honeymoon. First time when we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted with leis and the lobby was just very airy and grand. Our room was nice (partial view), the only complain I have is that the room smelled kind of damp from the humidity. Other than that, I was very please. Since it was our honeymoon, we were comped with a bottle of wine and dessert. They also sent us strawberries covered with chocolate to the room while I had make up session for the wedding. The staffs and service were great. The hotel property wasn't flooded with kids or crowd, it felt just right to get peaceful time to relax. They also provided amenities such as snorkling gear, boogie board as a complimentary to guests. Free parking was also great, but we didn't choose to pay for wifi since we have 3G anyway. We would definitely stay at Fairmont again when we have the chance. The ground and location were perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape for the family.”
Reviews.Author: Frank E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani in July and had our best family vacation. From the moment you enter the lobby, you are greeted by helpful staff. The view of the property was what first impressed us. You look out over Polo Beach, with Molokini/Kooholave in the background. We had a ocean view room that allowed us to sit on the patio and enjoyed the natural sounds of the ocean at night. There was great snorkeling right off the beach to the right. I would recommend snorkeling in the early am. Try snorkeling around Wapato Pointe to the next hotel property, the Four Seasons. You will see sea turtles and lots of fish. You can take a short walk back to the Kea Lani. This is a great place to take kids. They have a wonderful waterslide and pool. Also, Drew Brees and Ryan Grant were staying there. That was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding and honeymoon experience!”
Reviews.Author: Irina A
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding on Sept 5, 2011 in Maui and decided to stay at Fairmont Kea Lani for both our wedding and honeymoon. We are very happy we made that choice. We had a wonderful time and loved everything this hotel offered to us from a beautiful suite with a spectacular view to a great breakfast buffet. We had a special champagne and strawberries room service with a card a day after our wedding which came as a surprise. The hotel was almost at full occupancy but we felt we got a special treatment that was very appreciated. I would recommend this beautiful resort to anyone who is looking for accommodations for a special occasion or just a peaceful rest. Thanks, Fairmont Kea Lani. We hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: yanks250125
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 13 nights for our honeymoon in October and November. When we pulled in the bell boys are there and waiting to escort. Told them we were checking in and they ran to get us leis. Helped take our bags out of the car and we were able to go check in very easily. Front desk told us we had been upgraded to a partial ocean view room. I did the simple process of joining the Fairmont President's Club, so we got free wi-fi and free morning paper every day. The bell boy (Royce) gave us a quick tour of the hotel, which was extremely helpful. He showed us the main things, but didn't bore us with the minor details which we would have forgotten anyways. He took us to our room. When we entered the room, the hotel had set up decorative fresh flowers scattered on the floor, champagne on ice, and chocolate covered strawberries on a dish for us as they knew it was our honeymoon (I told them when I confirmed the room 2 months earlier). The room was only on the 2nd floor, so the view was limited. The room is very large, with an enormous bathroom, 2 sinks, 2 huge mirrors, and huge tub. The toilet is in it's own enclosed room off of the bathroom itself. Balcony is very large with a table, 4 chairs, and a lawn chair. The bedroom and living room are separate. There's a fridge, coffee maker, and small sink to make up a small kitchen. The fridge didn't have a freezer, just an area to keep items cooler, or frozen longer. The microwave was nice too. The bed was very comfortable and there's plenty of pillows. Also plenty of drawers and closet space for an extended stay. If you open one of the sliding doors to the lanai, the air conditioner automatically shuts off, and vice versa. I had the thermostat set to 65, but really doubt the actual temperature in the room ever got below 70 until maybe after 8pm. It wasn't a problem though. We didn't notice workers doing any construction, but the site was clearly noticeable to one of the sides of the hotel but only as you looked out from a balcony above it. If you were on the ground you wouldn't have known there was any construction. Never heard any machinery or anything. The Concierge is extremely helpful. They helped book several things for us. You charge the activity to your room (if you want) and they give you the ticket for the event. We did a luau at the Marriott. I guess there was a threat of rain in the area so they moved it indoors so it wasn't all that good. Nevertheless, our concierge took care of all the arrangements and answered any questions about doing activities. Also did the outrigger canoe ride that goes out from Polo Beach right at the hotel mornings at 6, 7, 8, and 9. My wife and I weren't sure what to expect, but it was fun. For only 45 a minute ride, and for free...it's well worth it. The housekeeping was fabulous. They came to the room several times a day. The morning one is maybe 10am-12pm where they make the bed, refresh toiletries, all the basics. Then they come again at maybe 3pm to check on towels, coffee, etc. Then again will come from 6-8pm for their turndown service. Here they prepare your bed for night, leave the radio on some soft music, and leave a card with the forecasted weather for the next day. Weather is always the same though, 85 and partly cloudy. As you know for any hotel, you need to have your "Privacy please" card on your door if you don't want to be interrupted because they come to restock and clean everything several times daily. So if you're in your room, put the card on your door handle. You'll never go without towels or supplies, they are on the ball. The pools are great. Because of the time of year, it was never full of people and we were able to get lawn chairs whenever we needed. The pools are open 24 hours so use at your own will! We did just that. We went out a couple mornings before sunrise (still on east coast time) in the pools and hot tubs. There's 2 main pools, an adult only pool, 2 hot tubs, and a kiddie pool. I knew there were 2 hot tubs, but my wife didn't. I didn't know where the 2nd one is, but she found it towards the end of our stay. It's somewhat hidden between the 2 main pools. The hot tubs are huge and very nice. The water slide is also nice. Not too quick of a ride and not too short. Good for people of all ages. The water is nice and warm in all pools. We were in the pools for a few sunsets and that's a treat. At sunset, someone blows into the conch and they go around and light the torches. It's pretty cool. There's plenty of towels set out and 2 stations to rent all of the equipment you may need for a while outside or at the beach. The beach itself was OK. Sand is really clean and soft. The water is really clean, no animals, seaweed, or rocks. The surf is weak so it's easy to swim around. We didn't snorkel, but sounds like there's some good stuff to see not far from where most people swim. Excellent view of the sunset also! We went and got the breakfast buffet 3 or 4 times during our stay. It costs $25 plus tax per person but I'd say it's worth it. There's tons of hot food, breads, pastries, and fruits. Also there's cereals, and an omellette station. Only complaint would be that the food got cold very quickly once you went to your table. By the time I finished eating my eggs, my bacon was cold. They brought you the fresh juice of the day (free), usually a cranberry-orange or alike sort of juice. We ordered room service on our last night and it was excellent. We ordered it right at prime time for dinner (6:30 pm) and the restaurant promised it to our room by 7:15, which is what we expected for ordering at that time. They had it there at 7:00 and the server did an excellent job setting it up on our coffee table in the room. He put a table cloth down, set up all the silverware, glasses, plates, dishes, etc. Sure it was expensive, but they also added a service fee and a delivery fee. It's explained on the menu in the room. The location of the property is excellent. It's away from all of the business of the town of Kihei (5 minutes away) with all the restaurants and shopping. You can definitely tell you are in a nicer area when you enter Wailea. The grounds of the hotel are kept extremely clean. Also you are about a half hour from the airport, but near the airport in Kahului are many other shops and restaurants. We went up that way nearly every day to do this or that. Overall, this was a place of beauty. We got a discounted rate because of the construction, but I would definitely have paid full price. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the immediate greeting at check in with the lei and fruit juice. We had a nice ocean view over the tree tops from our room. Can't beat the huge rooms and huge balcony. Loved the bathroom, and took advantage of the soaker tub. Our room was always well stocked with all amenities (including extra coffee). The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly. The guys at the bar at Nick's were super friendly and chatty. The guys at the beach that helped with the umbrellas and snorkle gear were also very nice. We were also pleasantly surprised at the price of the drinks by the pool (thought the prices would be steeper). The food was good, but not outstanding (we ate at the Polo lounge and Nick's), with the exception of the buffet breakfast. The hotel was pretty quiet until the weekend (when there were a couple of conferences and a wedding booked). Even over the weekend, nothing ever seemed too crowded, and we were still able to relax in peace. No complaints whatsoever for the rate that we'd booked at (we were able to get the renovation rate of about 300/night for our whole stay). This is definitely a 5* property and this was definitely a 5* experience. If you are paying full rack rate, however, some things to note: Before we booked we were aware the restaurant was being renovated, and figured it would not be noticeable. It was very noticeable, and there are also renovations going on with the elevators (which we were not aware of until we checked in). The noise was not an issue for us but it could have been if we were in a different room - ie there are rooms that look over directly into the renovated area. We were somewhat disappointed with the room service food. It could have just been because we had very high expectations. ie- we were probably expecting the best chicken wings, pizza and soup ever because our bill was 85.00 - 12.00 of this which was a service fee?? The housekeeping was good, but not perfect. After a day at the beach I'd got sand all over the shower, and the next evening I noticed that a lot of it was still in the shower. The drink service by the pool was very slow until the end of the day. Not a big deal for us, but may be for others. We took a walk to the other hotels in the area (Four Seasons and Grand Wailea). I'm extremely loyal to the Fairmont brand, so I never considered booking any other hotel. I've had bad experiences in the past at Four Seasons (Prague and Budapest), but the grounds at the Four Seasons Wailea were very impressive. We sat at the bar there and had a salad and glass of wine (both excellent) - the staff were lovely. I could see potentially trying that hotel on a return trip. The Grand Wailea looked more theme park-ish and probably would be more suitable for a trip with younger children/teenagers. I will return to the Fairmont once again to see the completed renovations. Would like try one of the villas, as those look particularly peaceful and private, and definitely have the best views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruingirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kea Lani for 10 days during the summer.I got a great deal through AAA, so decided to bite the bullet and take an adventure. There is no "resort fee" or cost for parking, which is a plus. Also, they have free activities for guests and it seemed like lots of Hawaiian crafts that they do with kids outside during the day. There are 2 pools (one adults only). It is a short walk to the beach if you are staying in the main hotel, so you have to plan ahead because it's not a quick trip back to the hotel. There is a small stand down by the beach where they provide free beach towels for guests and you can rent an umbrella for the quite pricy cost of $45.00 per day. The young men down at the beach were there to help guests and were fantastic - so helpful and friendly. One thing that's a plus deciding to stay at the Fairmont is that there are no surprises. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the room roomy and quiet, and the surroundings peaceful. I liked being close to the very quaint and less touristy town of Kihei, as I am tired of the ultra-touristy Lahaina. Plan on spending lots of $$ to eat at the hotel or choose some fun places to eat in Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Ecstasy”
Reviews.Author: thebigeasytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani = the ability to mentally transport one from the rigors of everyday life to a place bliss and delightfulness (is this a word). Well if not, it is in my mind. Everything that you've read in the other reviews are true. I won't bore you with the details already mentioned. What I will share with you is that we had a friend in town who was staying at the Grand Wailea. Money aside, she indicated that she found the service to be much nicer in paradise (Fairmont) and that she would stay here on her next visit. The Grand Wailea had fabulous shops. The service and hospitality, at this hotel is out of this world. There are many places we can stay, but only one place we will stay on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a first class hotel and a staff that's so professial and kind.”
Reviews.Author: Brianhdallas
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arive you are treated like you just bought the place. The front desk, the bellman the rooms are amazing. The waiters we so fantastic and helpful I never wanted to leave this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful customer service!”
Reviews.Author: teraheath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights in oct and i must say the hotel exceeded my expectations even if maui in general was a dissapointment to me. The hotel staff really went out of there way to acommodate my friend who has some walking medical issues and required a scooter to get around. The complimentary free transportation to anywhere in the wailea area was indeed a bonus made even better when the staff was willing to transport the scooter which was very heavy to and from the luau at the marriot and dinner at the grand wailea. The suites were lovely and the grounds and lobby and pools were gorgeous.The breakfast buffet was wonderful. The hotel does not nickel and dime you with a resort fee or charge for self parking and even better it is laid back and not pretentious at all . Highly reccomend staying at the fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “A Mediterranean Oasis on the shores of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Jay A
Reviews.Content: This property is quite large. The architecture is that of a Moroccan motif which at first seems odd in Hawaii but somehow works nicely. All rooms are comfortable suites with a bar, family room, desk, lanai (patio), bedroom, and a well-appointed bathroom complete with two pedestal sinks, tub, and walk-in shower. We particularly enjoyed having Mai Tais on our lanai while watching the sunset. The nightly turndown service was a nice touch and we were provided clean towels and water also. The on-site restaurants, swimming pools, beach, lounge with nightly entertainment all help to make this hotel a nice, comfortable stay. The staff are all very friendly, gracious and happy to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: sunchica27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the great experience to stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani for our honeymoon. The open air concept is perfect for Maui, and the view was absolutely beautiful! We were able to utilize the hotelâ€™s free snorkel gear and bogie boards as the hotel was under renovation during our stay. The renovations were not intrusive in the slightest. Yes you will hear some noise during the daytime, but honestly we only came back to change or shower, never once was our sleep disrupted by the renovations. The staff was very kind, and the woman at the front who greeted us with a lea, was a fun touch! Both Nickâ€™s and Ko were delicious! I was able to buy these beautiful pearl earrings by a local vendor in the lobby, I love them! The location is great, we were able to explore without feeling isolated. Without a doubt I would recommend this hotel to anyone, family (as there is a separate family friendly pool), couples, or friends, there honestly is something for everyone at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rumbling_along
Reviews.Content: We stay there every year for 3 weeks and each year it is predictble...great service, wonderful staff and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BeanieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay in Oct at the Kea Lani couldn't have been better. We were excited just from photos online and were not disappointed. We loved our suite and will probably never go back to regular hotel rooms. Spacious bathroom made it easy to get ready without being on top of each other. We had an ocean view of Molokini; so great to wake up and see it from our balcony. Excellent service all around. The adult pool was serene and peaceful but we spent most of our time on Polo beach right in front of the hotel or in the family pool with the water slide. The beach provided great snorkeling with sea turtles visiting daily. The hotel provides complimentary snorkel gear, boogie boards, chairs and umbrellas, use of their workout room. There is no resort fee or parking fee for hotel guests; like that! I loved the turkey cobb wrap at the Pool Grille. Breakfast buffet had more than enough to choose from. Gorgeous landscaping. It was fun to watch the torch lighting each night. Located close to Big Beach; to me, the most beautiful beach I've ever seen! It was wide, soft sand, clean, warm, clear water. Also walkable distance to nearby luaus along the beach path or to the Shops (mall). An absolute gem of Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: tk211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October and this was by far the best hotel we stayed at during our 10 day trip to Hawaii - we also stayed at the Royal Hawaiian in Honolulu and the Grand Hyatt in Kauai. The service here was impeccable. We were able to lounge all day by the pool - a bento box with a lava flow was a particularly nice way to spend an afternoon with a good book. Everyone was super helpful and the property is lovely - we hardly left the resort the entire time. When we come back to Hawaii, this is where we'll be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy7439
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in September / October we had the best holiday it was so relaxing the staff were great and very helpful. The room was spacious and very clean and tidy. We had an ocean view suite and the view was amazing of the pool area and the ocean. The kids loved the pool area and the slide. Very enjoyable and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “White Palace in Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Rancher_10
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in October in a wonderful suite overlooking the southern part of Maui which gave us fantastic views of sunrise and sunset. The room was very comfortable with a nice big bed, a separate living room with a nice sitting are and a big screen t.v. (which we didn't watch). The bedroom has a big screen as well. The bathroom had a great walk in shower, a big soaking tub and two sinks. Plus there is a kitchen area to mix drinks and make coffee. And then there is a nice lanai (outside terrace) to suntan on. If you want to relax, go there. Plus the hotel staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The people at the valet stand told us about places to visit and good restaurants to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Maui Resort Stay”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for our first anniversary for the first week of October. Two caveats for this whole review - we didn't pay anything close to the rack rate; we got a deeply discounted room. So, some of the things we wrote off because we got such a deal might have bothered us if we had paid $550 a night. Also, we booked in October because it's the shoulder season, which means way fewer people and almost no school-age children. That being said... We got in to the Fairmont at about 10PM; it is about 45 minutes from the main airport in North Maui. The part of the island it's in, Wailea-Makena, is home to all of the nicest resorts (Four Seasons, Grand Wailea) and golf courses. We got there, our car was valeted (everywhere on the island has free valet for the first day in the low season), we were given beautiful leis, and a bellhop gave us a brief tour before showing us to our room. Our partial oceanview suite was at least twice the size of our Manhattan apartment. Some reviewers on here claim the rooms were outdated, but I can't imagine how. Flatscreen TVs in the living room and bedroom, ipod dock in the bedroom, huge marble bathroom with couples sinks/vanities, and of course, the lanais. Everywhere on the island talks up their lanais (read:balconies), but our suite had a big, wraparound deal with separate entrances from the living area and the bedroom area. The beach at the resort is quite nice - soft, white sand, and not too many tourists, because Wailea is upscale and more expensive. Some locals did show up (all beaches in Hawaii are "public" but Polo Beach is hard to get to and there's nowhere to park if you're not at the resort), but they were completely respectful. Our daily routine was to wake up at 830, walk down to the beach and reserve chairs and an umbrella, walk back up to the store/cafe on the ground floor and buy breakfast and juice to bring back to the beach, eat at the beach, and then rotate between ocean/beach chair/pools for the day. When we were there, the beach chairs, umbrellas, and water equipment (boogie boards and snorkel gear) were all free. Don't know if I'd have paid for it all a la carte, but it was great to have. We did snorkel on the rocks near the beach at about 6am and managed to see two giant turtles just being turtles. The pools were nice, too. Again, low season = tons of open chairs and umbrellas, so we never had to worry about the sun. There were young children, but they were always with their parents and never bothersome. We didn't actually spend more than a few minutes at the adults-only pool because the main pool was so large and calm. Above the main pool is another, smaller pool with a swim- or walk-up bar, and there's a waterslide which I'm happy to say is quite fun. There are also a few hammocks strewn across the property, which are perfect for lying in with your partner and just watching the ocean roll in and out. Sunset is beautiful from any part of the property; we watched it both from the beach on blankets and from the bar/lounges up near the entrance of the hotel. The main building is built in to a gently sloping hill, and the pools and rental houses on the downslope. That means you've pretty much always got ocean views from the pool/bars. We didn't spend many meals at the resort as we elected to drive around - you need a rental car in Maui if you're staying in Wailea, or almost anywhere else - but we did have dinner at Ko, and it was wonderful. The famous seafood restaurant on the premises looked very overpriced. There's tons of great food all over Maui that can be had for less than $100 a head. What else? The bed was really comfortable, the hotel filled our room with orchids, champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries at my request and did a great job with it, the entire place was perfect. I recommend this place without hesitation. Minor gripes: The beach chairs were not as nice as the pool chairs. If I was paying for them, that might be annoying. Um, I hurt my foot because I'm not used to flip-flops? Can't really blame that on the resort. Must dos: Book the canoe trip! It was so much fun to go out on an outrigger canoe with some locals, paddle out for a bit, and take a dip in the ocean away from shore and see some more turtles.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva50
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Kea Lani while attending my son and daughter-in-law's destination wedding. I must say the hospitality was outstanding. I give the entire staff; from the bellmen to house-keeping 5 stars for 6 days of outstanding customer service! My only concern was the arbitrary changes in my room rate. We initially made the reservation and received our e-confirmation which included a guaranteed room rate, weeks later when I called to verify and confirm our stay, the rates changed. I had to find my original confirmation to sort-out the confusion. I also purchased a two night stay as a gift for my son and his new bride. I instructed the Kea Lani reservation agent to collect any/all additional monies for meals and excursions (over and above the cost of the two nights) directly from my son. Here I am post wedding six weeks later and my credit card reflects charges for the Honeymooners extended stay! That wasn't the agreement Kea Lani and I contracted, nor what my confirmation reads...I am completely exasperated by their inability to deliver behind the scenes what they deliver so well up front; wonderful hospitality. My recommendation? If you stay,,,take documented confirmation of room rates and details of conversations. Whatever you do, don't use your credit card to hold a room for another party, or you might end up with a Kea Lani Hang Over!

Reviews.Title: “Was that Heaven or simply paradise?”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddess123
Reviews.Content: Whatâ€™s not to love about the Fairmont Kea Lani? We stayed there during their renovation sale for a huge discount. Upon check-in they showed us to our deluxe king room, which was decent enough, but directly overlooking the construction area. As Iâ€™ve unapologetically stated in past reviews, I am nothing if not a bona fide princess when traveling and felt that viewing and hearing a construction site was unacceptable and not my idea of paradise, even for the amazing deal we were getting. Our very friendly and attentive bellman called the front desk, and for an additional c-note we were upgraded to the most glorious suite I have ever stayed in. It was a wraparound suite on the top floor, affording us an unobstructed 270 degree view of paradise. The bed, climate control, linens, fluffy robes, and ginourmous bathroom were all fantastic. Lovely tasteful decor, beautiful pools and grounds, charming and helpful staff. Our room had a mini fridge, microwave and wet bar so we were able to store food and eat some meals in the room which was nice. The pluses far outweighed any minuses, but to be complete in my review here are some of the less up sides. Itâ€™s spread out and some of the rooms are far down very long hallways. EVERYTHING is pricey. All the food and drinks cost a lot. We were able to partake of many of the specials they were offering during the renovation sale, but I understand that normally one has to pay for chaises and umbrellas. And the rack rates are quite high for what you get in a standard or deluxe room. There are a lot of children and families and the resort can be noisy because of that. There is, however, an adults only pool which is very quiet and serene. However, the only hot tubs are located by the other pools and often occupied by groups of children, so if thatâ€™s not your thing, you might want to stay elsewhere. We stayed in the Kilohana suite which was an amazing room and possibly worth it at any price (easy for us to say since we paid about 30% of the rack rate...). All in all, this was one of the most delicious and special hotel stays I have ever enjoyed. And if money is no object, definitely go for the Kilohana suite. Iâ€™ve attached photos and a video.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl1627
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by stating that the only reason I gave the Fairmont Kea Lani a 4 Star rating is because I've saved the 5 Star for the ULTRA luxurious Four Seasons next door. But make no mistake, the Fairmont is an all star luxury hotel and resort. Stayed a week in September 2011 and loved it! This being my third trip to Hawaii. Our stay started off wonderfully as we arrived 10pm Maui time, 4am our time, exhausted. I usually self park to save the valet fees but was so tired I would've given my life savings for valet parking at that point. Pulled up to the Fairmont and the Valets had our name, told me that check in night was complimentary and took care of the car, the bags and even the front desk. We literally walked straight up to our room. Which we were upgraded from a garden view to an ocean view. The suite was huge if a little dated. But I loved the 2 big flat screen tvs, IPOD station, and DVD player. The beautiful marble baths and our spacious and fully furnished lanai. I really enjoyed the mini fridge and coffee maker also. Sat out every morning on our lanai in my Fairmont robe with a cup of Hawaiian java. Also liked the in room WI-FI. Just make sure you sign up for "Fairmont's President Club" before you go and it will be no charge. The staff was warm and friendly. I noticed the grounds keepers working early in the morning would shut off their blowers or whippers as we would walk past and say Aloha. The concierge desk was incredible. I broke my underwater camera 2 days into our trip and went to them to ask a good place to buy one. They not only recommended a good place but called to verify prices and stock and then wrote directions on a map for me. We didn't each much on the resort as I always find it pricey and this time was no exception. We did do the buffet breakfast on our first and last day there. It was good and plenty of variety....and their french toast quite possibly the best I've ever had. The pools were great for my 6 year old daughter. She could touch bottom everywhere and loved the waterslide. Couldn't get her off it. And I saw quite a few grown men screaming down it during the week too. The beach was beautiful. Water clear to the bottom. In the morning the water would be warmer than the air temperature and it was just heaven! Never had a problem getting a place to sit either poolside or on the beach. My daughter went to Kids Camp one morning and although no other kids were registered that day she had a great time with Ms. Bonnie. Built a working volcano on the beach and made a wonderful souvenir box with sand from 3 different beaches and shells on the top to spell my daughters name. I'll review some of these places elsewhere on the site however some great places to eat if you have kids....Monkey Pod Kitchen in Wailea and either of the Cheeseburger in Paradise locations. Although the one in Lahaina on the water has a much better view! We also did the snorkel cruise out of South Maui to Molokini Crater. Express first thing in the morning....only boat there for almost an hour. Incredible. Highly recommended. Best souvenir shops...ABC stores. Best clothing to take home....go to Tropix. They carry Maui Built line of clothing exclusively. They don't do internet or mail orders. It's exclusive to those who actually shop in their stores. Bought men's, women's, and children's shorts, t's and hoodies. Love them all and wish I had brought more home with me. All in all the Fairmont Kea Lani did not dissapoint. Awesome place to stay if you have kids. Will not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “My kids are begging us to take them back!”
Reviews.Author: travelbaseballmomnj
Reviews.Content: We took our children here at the end of our vacation. They absolutely love it. So did my husband and I. The service was amazing. We felt pampered...Poolside service was attentive. They brought us cool wet facial towels to refresh ourselves with. Happy hour poolside featured half price appetizers and featured drinks. Water sports were a blast here. We boogie boarded our entire stay. I think that I actually heard my husband giggle......as we were tossed by the waves. The suites were spacious and the bathrooms were beautiful and spacious. The robes were cozy and the bath products even left my 16 year old son smelling wonderful.....The breakfast buffet was outstanding...definitely worth the money. Nick's Fish Market was fantastic. Try the oysters .......the preparation was unusual and delicious. I can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quentin A
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Maui a week ago and I can't say enough good things to everyone I know about it!! The Fairmont was actually not our first choice when we were setting everything up originally. We had our eye on the Four Seasons (which is right next door, as it turns out) but our travel agent recommended the Fairmont and it turned out saving us right at $1000 to stay there instead which was a no brainer. The Fairmont is ALL suites. You can't get a regular room in this hotel so that's obviously a good sign! The first night we got free valet service which was nice after our 8 hour flight from Dallas (we were wiped out). The lobby has a very open feel and was beautiful. Big fountain right in the middle, an awesome view of the pool area and ocean (and sunsets around 6pm), and lots of local decor. The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful! The consierge could pretty much give you any information you could need about local restaurants, entertainment, etc. The guy who helped us to our room (his name was Wilson, that's how well we liked him, we remember his name haha) was really friendly and knew a lot about the area. He shared some helpful tips about what restaurants were a good value in the area, where to do our shopping, etc. The resort was in Wailea which is the Beverly Hills of Maui. It's definitely nicer than Kihei (though Kihei has great shopping and restaurants, we spent most of our money in Kihei) or Lahaina. My only complaint about the hotel was that they were rennovating and had one of the 2 elevators closed down for maintenance so it was quite a wait somtimes for the elevator. Oh and when we told them we were on our honeymoon they gave us a card good for a free dessert and free bottle of wine at the Ko Restaurant (which was nice) but no other upgrades or any other amenities I'm used to for honeymooners... The rooms were the highlight of the resort for us. Yeah the rest of the resort was nice...but the room was just HUGE! It was SO nice. I can't say enough about how impressed we were with the room. I'd say the room was probably about 800-900 square feet!! The entry area had a sink, coffee maker, large mini-fridge, microwave, etc. Then you go into the living room which had a long couch, ottoman, large TV table with flat screen, DVD player, and surround sound stero (very nice Denon stereo system with sub-woofer). There was a very cool charging station at the entertainment system area where you can charge your ipod, etc. and a selection of cables for this as well. I was able to plug my ipod in and listen to our own music on the Denon stereo system. There was also a desk over in the corner of the room as well. Here there is a large sliding glass door to the balcony (BIG balcony with table and 4 chairs as well as a lounge-style chair) with an awesome ocean view (ocean view suite, cost a little more, but WELL worth it). Then you make a right into the bedroom that has 2 nightstands with 3 drawers in each, a dresser with another flatscreen TV, iPod dock alarm radio, and 2 his/hers closets. King size bed (a little bit on the firm side but still comfortable). The bathroom was huge with double vanities, an enclosed toilet (nice little room so you have good privacy), a jacuzzi tub (large), and a separate shower (full marble, big enough for 2 people easily). Just a super impressive room. The hotel grounds were just awesome! 3 pools to choose from, 2 hot tubs, water slide, swim-up bar, etc. The path down to the beach was lit at night with tiki torches, and during the day there is a station open where you can get towels, sun screen, or complimentary boogie boards you can check out. The resort really had EVERYTHING covered. The first day we were there the waves were pretty intense and they had a nice sign with a flagpole so you would know if it was safe to swim or not. The beach was very nice but the water wasn't quite as nice as Mexico (see my other review of Riu Palace). Probably due to the noticibly more intense surf. The restaurants there at the resort were all nice. We ate at all three. Polo Grille is actually by one of the pools and has a swim-up bar. The food is fairly typical "bar & grill" faire but still pretty good. They had happy hour from 4-5pm where the drinks and appetizers were half price (which made them reasonable), otherwise the drinks were $12-$20 and the appetizers $10-$25, so the prices were a bit steep.
