Nicks Sea Market was a very nice restaurant with a good atmosphere, the service was a bit off the night we visited but I sensed that we were coming at the end of the evening and the service is probably better during the usual dinner crowd, and the food was top notch (albeit $150 price tag). The Ko restaurant serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner and is their "middle of the road" offering. Breakfast was awesome there (we had the buffet) with LOTS of options and great quality (but the $50 price tag for 2 was a big steep). Dinner was pretty decent but still around $100 and definitely not worth it. We ended up checking out restaurants off the resort more often than not. Matteo's is right up the street from the resort and had AMAZING pizza. They're a little italian place with a great atmosphere and service. The pricing was much more reasonable than the resort. We also heard Cafe O'Lei in Kihei was really good and reasonable as well but we never made it there. We ate at a place called "Cool Cats" in Lahaina twice...it was just a great spot with great burgers so we couldn't resist! It's right in the heart of the shopping district in Lahaina (right across from the harbor). There was SO much to do in Maui! We took an all-day trip to Hana and the far side of the island (7 climate zones during this trip, it was amazing). The Ocean Center in Lahaina was pretty cool as well. We took a katamaran over to Molokini crater and did some snorkeling which was awesome! This was really just the best experience I've had vacationing and we plan to go back within 5 years. I secretly plan to retire in Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mkleiman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here for our honeymoon, excellent choice from the minute we arrived we felt like royalty. We stayed in a kilohana signature suite with by far the best ocean view ive ever seen. Comfortable beds, 2 flat panel lcd tvs ipod charger and more. Breakfast buffet is an absolute must. The food is spectacular all around. The pools and polo beach nearby are amazing (you must must must snorkel off to the right of polo beach, excellent coral nearby). Overall the service was impeccable, major shoutout to Royce, Anton, & Porche for making our stay extra spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but customer service was meh...”
Reviews.Author: SRPZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary. At check-in, our anniversary was acknowledged & we were given a voucher for a free dessert but other than that, nothing. Nothing special in the room, no card or chocolates or anything special like other hotels have done from our experience. And definitely no upgrade, even though we're President's Club members. They put us in a room on the bottom floor facing a road which had service people going back and forth along the path near our balcony., somewhat intrusive and un-romantic. I have to say though, the rooms are very nice, very spacious, very comfy. Loved the bathroom, huge with nice soaker tub and walk-in shower. The balcony was nice and large as well with nice patio furniture. The hotel itself was beautiful, the pool area was nice but we've seen bigger and better, and the beach was gorgeous. Our best experience staying here was in the lounge. We were treated very well, and the ambiance was very relaxed and romantic. We had our desserts here and they were delicious. We would definitely consider coming back if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon finale”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee180
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the third and last leg of our Hawaiian honeymoon in late September, and the Fairmont made it really hard to go back home. We were greeted with cocktails and leis, and the service was really attentive and pleasant. The rooms were well-appointed and spotless. We enjoyed the pool with the waterslide, the lovely beach, and the fitness center (which was fairly large and varied in equipment) while we were there. Dinner at the Fishmarket and Ko's were both very tasty, and we were given a complimentary bottle of wine and dessert at Ko's because we were honeymooners, which was a nice touch. At checkout, because our plane did not leave till 10pm, they provided a hospitality suite for us to change, so we could still enjoy the pool during the day. Only sticky thing was the fitness classes- I did not take money to yoga class, and a tip was expected, which was awkward and embarrassing because I was not prepared. Overall, loved it and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: dthba8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Maui where we spent 7 nights at the Fairmont. Even while undergoing soft renovations, I can report that you could hardly notice the renovations which are primarily to the restaurant Ko. Only downside to renovation was one of the elevators was not working which was inconvenient at times. The staff is wonderful and the hotel suites are big with a kitchenette. Tip: Sign up for Fairmont's Presidents Club membership before you go so you have free WiFi and the WSJ delivered daily to your room. Daily happy hour is currently available in luana lounge and pool bar from 4pm -6pm with live music. Must try the breakfast buffet and go to Nicks & Ko for dinner. Also for those that like to run or walk in the AM, they have a path near the beach entrance that takes you around the point to the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent even with renovations....”
Reviews.Author: aliapis
Reviews.Content: There was an initial room change that did not satisfy, but come the morning the Asst Manager called up and had everything taken care of and it was perfect! I have read the other reviews and found that the Hotel is so beautiful and large that children were not at all an issue. We were on our honeymoon and found that it was perfect for our event. Ko resteraunt is amazing food and should not be missed even if you are not staying at the Hotel. There are renovations going on at the hotel but you don't notice it at all. The rooms are 840sf and they are a bit dated but overall the value is excellent. Valet parking is complimentary your first night and there is an excellent parking lot that is conviently located. If you are a Fairmont Presidents member you will receive free Wifi. There are peddle bikes that are complimentary at the hotel for a 2 hour period each time. The beach kiosk has several ocean toys, also complimentary. The Ciao cafe in the Hotel has everything that you could need, an upscale corner store. The hotel is at the end of the Wailea promanade which makes for an great walking/running ocean front trail!! You can stop off at various great hotels to check them out or stop for a coffee or cocktail! The staff is lovely but we must give a huge thanks to Nic for making our stay so amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: madera99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 days at the Fairmont Kea Lani. The entire stay from check-in to check-out was perfect. Here are a few highlights: 1) Location- there's no better place in Maui than Wailea! The beaches are great and the Fairmont's location is the best on the island 2) Rooms- a huge room with two rooms and large bathroom and lanai makes for a very comfortable stay 3) Pools- wonderful pools that were uncrowded and the service with towels and drinks/food was easy and convenient. 4) Service- everyone at the hotel was friendly and were wonderful hosts 5) Attention to Detail - from check-in (complimentary leis and drinks) to check-out (suite available to for late check-outs with late flights), you can tell the hotel has thought of everything! Because I believe this hotel strives for perfection- I do have two suggestions for improvement: 1) the elevators are very slow! We waited for elevators all week. We often waited 10 minutes for one. We even used the elevators on the other side of the hotel and found them to be slow too. I believe one of the elevators was broken all week. 2) the water pressure in our shower was very poor. Many luxury hotels offer 'shower spas' or two headed shower fixtures- the shower in our room had very low pressure. I believe it was an 'eco' type shower fixture that uses less water- but it doesn't save any water if you have to spend twice as much time in the shower getting clean. Thanks for a GREAT STAY. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ...agoodday
Reviews.Content: We both found the grounds beautiful, the white buildings cascading down to the shimmering sea. The suites are okay -- the carpet in our suite and the hall outside was pretty ratty, but it looks like this is being replaced on other floors, so probably will be completely replaced eventually. For the most part, service was fantastic, which made the poor service by the middle aged male bartender at the swim-up bar stand out as worse than it probably was -- Highlight was the early morning canoe experience -- complimentary service with an amazing staff of two who not only gave us a safe and fun experience, but also filled us in on some local history and legends.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii2011_11
Reviews.Content: I am looking out on the balcony of my room at the fairmont right now. When you walk in to the Fairmont, you see the ocean and their amazing pools. Room is big with two tvs, a balcony, a huge bathrrom, a mini kitchenette... The pools are fantastic (there's a water slide!) They have snorkel gear and body boards for free that you could use in the ocean (which is right there!) Amazing service, great location ; lots of shops, restaurants, hotels and a general store not to far away. Most luxurious hotel i've ever been to. Wonderful for everyone to enjoy...having a blast!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within paradise...”
Reviews.Author: Tumeki
Reviews.Content: My partner and young 20 something's and planned our trip right back from february 2011. I can put my hand on heart and honestly say our stay with the Fairmont Kea Lani Hotel was truly outstanding. Were from New Zealand so coming to Maui was a big decision and happened to come across a great deal with this Hotel via bookit.com; which made the decision even easier. As you enter the premises I knew we were in for a great holiday, so with much haste I parked the beast and made our way to the front desk. We were promptly greeted by Nick who was a pretty friendly chap, (John Cena look a like IMO) who quickly sorted our room, keys, layout of the hotel and what was happening and who was where - top notch service if I may say so. Before he let us on our way, he advised we've been upgraded to an ocean view room free of charge. Nick my friend, you made it for us right there and then. After our winding our way to the 5th floor, we entered our well- presented room. Entry way with a hidden safe, sink, coffee maker, fridge, microwave etc. Living room, comfy long spacious couch with a massive 50" LG LCD screen, denon home theatre etc and a walk way out to a very large balcony holding breakfast table with 4 chairs and a sunlounger. Bedroom - omg yes! Massive huge king size bed, it was so very awesome to sleep in. It was one of those beds that grab you when you jump in and say to you - ok night night sleep well. A+ for the bed that's for sure! Turn around and what's sitting opposite the bed, another huge LG LCD screen - a mans throne waiting for his king! Bathroom - the bathroom in this place is to die for, everywhere you look is marble marble marble. Walk in shower is like 3m long (again marble!) very open style, spacious. Large bathtub, his and her sinks, towels, mirrors, faucets, taps - the list goes on. Note: The free safe was a very nice asset - well used and gave us peace of mind with large amounts of U.S cash. As for the hotel itself, it has a lot of character with the Fairmont Touch added, kind of dated but I think it gives off a huge sense of history. 3 swimming pools, loads to explore, 3 restaurants which unfortunately seem very over-priced for the food being served but your paying for convenience. Plenty of times we drove to Kihei for supplies or dined out locally as there is some really great little eating places within Maui The biggest plus for both of us at this Hotel are the staff who work here, they really do make this place and I think a lot of it goes un-rewarded at a corporate level. Many times did I see higher than thou executives demanding this and that without so much as providing a thank you or any gratification for services rendered - possibly the signs of true America we hadn't come across yet being a couple from New Zealand. That being said, this didn't sway us in any way - Fairmont you truly have some amazing people working at the Kea Lani and the service they provid is amazing. The conceirge, front desk, in suite dining, breakfast, house-keeping, Valets, bell-boys etc (I'm sure I've missed someone) all of you smile, do your best to help and come across so genuine - you made our 7 nights so well worth the decision to come to Maui, Hawaii! If Fairmont management do ever come across thus article - please look after your staff in some way because they deserve some form of acknowledgement! Thanks for an awesome holiday - Kala and Rhys

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani in September. We booked in for one night as our stay overlapped so we decided to treat ourselves to some luxury. Wow, luxury it was! We pulled up(all 7 of us) and were immediately presented will a drink and Lei's. The bell hop took care of our luggage and by the time we were checked in he was at our door drooping off our luggage. The rooms had all of the comforts of home and more. The grounds were beautiful and maybe next time we stay we will be able to afford a villa. They also looked amazing. The kids liked the pool and waterslide. They had waitresses serving poolside drinks and snacks which is a very nice option. The beach was just amazing, amazing! There are free rentals for boogie boards, snorkel gear, towels,etc. This beach has got to be Maui's best kept secret because it really wasn't that busy. When I imagined a beach in my head, this is exactly what I had pictured. I will say that the dinner meals at the restaurant were not really up to par for the price that we payed for our meal. Steak was very large but also very tough. Not worth $50 IMO. My daughter had some sort of stir fry and thought it was quite gross. I also heard another customer across from us complaining about her food too. Breakfast buffet was probably the most amazing buffet I've been to but the birds were something else. If you do partake in the breakfast buffet, ask to be seated neatly inside, in a corner where the birds can't get at you or your food! Great,great hotel!! Wished we could have stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not best ever”
Reviews.Author: LAcurlgurl
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a very nice hotel, but falls a little under the ultra-luxurious first class hotel of a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. We went during their restaurant renovation so rates were dramatically reduced which made the trip excellent value. The renovation work was no bother to us at all. Since we were traveling with our baby, having the oversized bathroom and living room/bedroom suite set up was ideal. The hotel was extremely accommodating to us. We had a crib, pack n play and diaper pail in our room, which were all also cleaned daily. They had no problem sending up extra towels and were very accommodating to clean our room on a few moments notice when our daughter was not napping. The pool staff was also very accommodating- there are pack n plays to use at the pool and they blew up and held onto our pool toys for us. The pools were very nice, and we really enjoyed the baby pool for our baby. I wish the water temperature had been better controlled though- it was really too cold for some days. The grounds are fantastic with a lot of nice lawn areas to play in. There is also a paved path along the beach which goes through all of the Wailea resorts- great for running or walking. The beach is beautiful with great snorkeling right there heading towards the Four Seasons. Renting snorkel gear and beach chairs/umbrella was easy. All of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I also loved that there was complimentary washer/dryer. Especially when traveling with kids, this was fantastic (as much as I hated having to do laundry on vacation). Breakfast buffet was excellent- tons of variety, lots of fresh food, really great. We tried all of the restaurants and the food and service were both great. I had a few small complaints. First, the poolside cabanas are ridiculous. For $75/day, there should be more than just a shade cover. Either the cabanas should really be something wonderful to really entice someone to rent them (with TV, fans, frig/food, more space/shade/privacy), or they shouldnâ€™t be rented for a fee at all. The cost of food is obscene, but we found this to be the case everywhere in Maui. We could not even have lunch for under $40. There were also some small things about the room- the cottage cheese ceiling, the furniture, that did not appear to have just been renovated. Several things in our room didnâ€™t work- the TV, the safe, the drain on the tub, the frig- all of these were addressed and fixed, but I was surprised and annoyed that so many little things were not working properly. This is a great place to go with kids and a lot of value in the suite set up.

Reviews.Title: “FIrst rate resort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: divapm
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that they are under renovations (which you don't even notice mostly) it was a top notch experience from the welcome when we arrived through the entire week. The suite was huge with an ocean view and the biggest balcony I've every seen at a resort. K-Cup coffee maker, hot water kettle, fridge and microwave and sink made the day start great and then we got breakfast at the buffet (which was huge!) Concierge was so helpful on many occasions and the pool and beach staff were so helpful. I really loved being here. I recommend becoming members of the President's Club (which is free) because you get free Wi-Fi instead of the $14.95 a day--which is a great perk! They also have shuttle service (free!) to anywhere within 3 miles which worked great for dinners and shopping. Just call and they come and pick you up! Bonus is the local artists/craftsmen which they let display in the lobby during the day. I congratulate the manager--he is obviously encouraging his people to excellence and it will show in how much you enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: vistaatraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently did a short 4 day getaway to Maui and selected the Kea Lani after reading tripadvisor reviews. We have stayed in Wailea which is our favorite Maui location, many times usually at condos. Signed up for the Fairmont President's club after reading here that free wi fi is included. Upon arrival we were told because we were President's Club we would be upgraded to a Beachside 3 Bedroom Villa on the Fairmont Property. Staff and service was excellent, we had hot water issue in the Villa and it was attended to immediately. (Apparantly they were trying some new water efficiency device that was not working.) Ate at Nick's Fish Market and though pricey, atmosphere, service and food were great. Construction noise can be heard at the pool but did not bother us as they are working on a new restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Can I just stay there forever?”
Reviews.Author: Steffie22
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Kea Lani in September and I loved just about everything about this hotel. We received a warm welcome upon arrival. The valet informed us that valet parking was free the first night and then that we could park the car in the free guest parking at no charge. So, no pressure at all to use the 20$ valet parking. Quite frankly, we did not really use the car. It takes no more than 20 minutes to walk from Kea Lani to the nearby hotels and the Shops. So we walked instead of taking the car. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to go just about everywhere you wish. We had a garden room on the ground floor. Richard the bellman was very helpful in prensenting the room, the activities, the restaurants, etc. The room was big and very clean. The bed was very comfortable. I found that all staff members were very helpful and always smiling. They all seemed very happy to work at this hotel. The grounds are very well maintained, the gardens are full of flowers and the renovations never bothered us. In fact, we barely noticed them! Breakfast buffet was good, many healthy choices. There is a happy hour at the lounge every night and we enjoyed the live music, while sipping drinks waiting for the sunset. The pools are nice but we prefered spending time at the beach which was very clean and big enough so it never felt crowded. The spa could be better though. Services were good and full of attention but I did not really like the space. It's small. There is a steamroom, showers, amenities, etc. I wish there were different baths, so you can have some thermal experience or just relax in the baths before having your spa service. One plus, they have complimentary self-service laundry. Very convenient when you are there for a long time or travelling around the island and wish not loosing time at landraumats. Overall we just loved this hotel and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: otakunoai
Reviews.Content: 10 days stay at this hotel. good serivces and good view

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort. Beautiful rooms, grounds And great staff. Worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Canadawj
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Kea Lani We are in our late 20's and I travel for a living so I've stayed in many different hotels. Also I was previously a travel agent.Â  Location: in beautiful Wailea. Like how the shops are a quick 2 min drive. Smaller beach but more than big enough to accommodate the hotel guests. Beautiful grounds. Big. A quick 5 min drive to Keihi where there are great restaurants.Â  Check-in: Wonderful. We got leis as soon as we checked in then we were greeted with a nice refreshing drink. The bell hope takes your luggage then shows you to your room.Â  Valet: free for the first 24 hours then $20 a day afterwards. You can also self park for free.Â  Rooms: big and beautiful. The bathroom has access from The living room and master. 2 vessel sinks. A huge soaker tub and nice big shower with rainfall shower head. Water closet for the toilet. Bedroom has a super comfy bed with 2 closets. We had a door to our big balcony off our bedroom. The living room had a large "L" shaped couch and a huge TV with a DVD player and electronic hook ups. There was an iPod player as well in the bedroom. The room has a mini fridge and microwave as well as another closet with a safe next to the entry door. The balcony was huge. Had a table set with a bug table and 4 chairs as well as a lounger.Â  Pools: The pools are very nice and a good temp. The water slide was pretty fun. You can access it from the upper pool. We enjoyed that. Never had an issue getting a chair. Â We also got nice lemon scented towels to cool off with. They also came around with some pineapple. You can sit at any chair. There are cabanas to rent as well. Lots of seats around all 3 pools. The service around the pool was great. They also have water coolers to get glasses of water.Â  Beach: nice and a bit smaller then some of the beaches I've seen I. Maui but still more than big enough. No problem getting chairs And you can get free equipment from the beach stand. Snorkeling gear, boogie boards etc... The towels you can get grab. They don't make you sign them in or out as other places do. Â  Staff: great. They are so nice and helpful. The valet were especially nice calling us by our names and asking us if we needed help and remembering when we came back And asking how our trip was. It was nice.Â  Restaurants: we didn't eat at Nick's fish market as I don't eat seafood. We heard you should make a reservation there tho. We did eat at the Grill by the pool. Food was good. Pricey but your at the Fairmont so you should expect a price like that. Lunch (hot dog and burger) with a pop and a $5 beer came to $45. We came in expecting that. We did go to the shops of Wailea And drove down to South Kaelia to eat a few times. We did try the menu for dinner at Ko which is being served out of the buffet/ international restaurant. It was very good but pricey. Again we expected it. The buffet breakfast was $50 for 2 and was soooo good. They had lots of food and juices to choose from. You won't get bored.Â  Check-out: was quick as we did it on the TV Overall: beautiful big hotel. They really take care of you. Nice grounds. We enjoyed the pools and beach. Great big rooms and a super comfy bed. We would definitely come back and would recommend it to our family and friends.Â  Also I have never seen such a clean resort. No dirt anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ! need I say more”
Reviews.Author: reidwb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night stay in the Fairmont and I can not say enough good things about it, the rooms are out of this world - massive, clean with everyting you could possibly want including a Microwave ! The location is just stunning with a lovely footpath along the front of the hotel all the way to the shops a Wailea. The service and staff were excellane they just coudl not do enough for you. Only thing I would say is make sure you have a car as you wil need it to get around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jenjenkay
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Fairmont Hotels but I must admit that I think the Fairmont Kea Lani is absolutely perfect. I love how I'm treated like family by the staff. I could not have asked for more. The new renovations to the room is wonderful - very warm and inviting. I loved that every single room was a suite! I see changes in the hallway, as well - not so stark and white any longer. If you sign up for the Fairmont President's Club, you get free access to wireless internet. I loved being connected for free. Also, I loved that there was exercise clothes, shoes, everything all laid out for me and ready to use. If I didn't know better, I'd think it was brand new! Beds were super comfortable...the only distraction was hearing the waves crash onto the beach, but that was a welcome distraction. The only thing I didn't have a chance to do that I didn't get to was going on the slide - it looked like a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Capone
Reviews.Content: Love the Kea Lani...the only reason they didn't get an excellent is I thought the rooms needed a little updating. BUT...they may have updated since I was last there in 2006. I was also a little disappointed when I had reserved an ocean view for my honeymoon...the only ocean I saw was a slight glimpse thru the palmtrees outside our balcony if you leaned far enough over. I learned my lesson to call ahead and make sure I am getting the view I paid for. Other than that the pools are beautiful, the open lobby and the bar overlooking the resort. Looking forward to returning to the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvanhP
Reviews.Content: At first, I was worried about the renovations but they were hardly noticeable and caused no issue for us. The only issue I could perceive is the beeping that you could hear if you were @ the Adults only pool, from heavy equipment backing up (hardly anything to complain about, there are several other pools if it bothers you). From the moment we checked in, we felt very relaxed and attended to. We were greeted with leis and our porter happily showed us to our room while giving us a quick tour of the hotel. The staff is great; Servers at the pool were friendly and fast. Front desk attendants and valets were very helpful. Beach attendants work hard to setup umbrellas and chairs and also cover your lounge chair with fresh towels (sad that people don't tip them more often). In the afternoon, there is live music in the lounge where you can sit and enjoy cocktails & pupus, listen to music, as you watch the sunset. Our room was great, it had a wet bar, office desk, living room, large balcony with full seating and very large bathroom. The bed was super comfortable... i wish i had it at home. The beach was beautiful and complimentary snorkel equipment, umbrellas & seating, and boogey boards were provided. Towels were always abundant and there wasn't any corny towel system where you had to sign for them or turn in "towel cards" like some of the other resorts. Great stay topped off with a great checkout perk... When we checked out, we requested a later checkout and were happily granted a 2PM checkout. Our flight was late in the evening, the red eye, and we intended on laying on the beach / by the pool, as long as we could, on our last day. Later on that evening, after a long day of sun, I asked the front desk if there was somewhere we could change and freshen up. She offered us a hospitality suite (empty room) to shower up and change. It was fantastic. I couldn't imagine sitting on that trip home without getting a shower and a fresh change of clothes. Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui, and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: uscgirl1991
Reviews.Content: I heard good things about this hotel and certainly was impressed by the hotel's photos but the hotel was even better than we expected. The rooms were large and very nice. We had a deluxe oceanview room and the view was exquisite. Clearly details are important to the management team. When we arrived, we were promptly greeted with leis and the staff had made notes that it was our honeymoon. I had made a comment on facebook regarding the general manager's golden retriever and they had made a note about that and the assistant manager made arrangements for us to meet. Meals were expectedly pricey, but then again, everything in Hawaii is pricey. The pools were fabulous. The beach was beautiful. We were there during there renovation and I must say - I wouldn't have known construction was going on. Very clean, quiet, no construction workers running around, etc. The staff was really helpful. Probably the best service we've ever received at any hotel. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great grounds, renovation work not a problem”
Reviews.Author: 2FlyingYorkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and had a great time. We had a deluxe ocean view room, and it was perfect - spacious and well laid out. The room was very clean and seemed brand new. There was a nice roomy entryway area with a coat closet and a kitchenette with a microwave, a refrigerator, a sink, a tea pot, and a coffee maker. It was great. Next to that was the living room area with a sofa big enough for two to lay on, a huge television, a desk with two chairs and a couple of stands for storing stuff. The lanai was big enough for a table with four chairs and lounge chair, and there was a beautiful view overlooking the pools and the ocean. We could see down into the construction area as well, but it really wasn't distracting at all. They've done a great job disguising the work in progress. The bedroom was big and had plenty of drawers for storing folded clothes, and there were two more closets for the hanging clothes. There was another big television in the bedroom as well. The bathroom was also huge and we had plenty of room to spread out, dry our swimwear, etc. They did a good job of making sure we had plenty of towels and toiletries during our entire stay. The whole suite make a loop, so it was easy to get around the place. Unlike some other places we stayed on our trip, the curtains here actually got the room really dark so the sun didn't wake us up too early. All in all, it was a really great hotel room. The grounds were quite lovely. There were plenty of lounge chairs out by the three pools. There were artists visiting the hotel every day to show off and sell their work, and there were several shops in the corridors to pass the time in. The little market/cafe was nice to have as well. The beach was really well kept, and it was a fun place to go for a swim. The breakfast buffet was pretty good - there were lots of fresh fruits available, great fruit juices, and yummy pastries in addition to all the normal meats/eggs/potatoes that you find on a buffet. We also had dinner at Nick's, and it was decent (not great, but good). We had spent a lot of time debating whether to stay here or at the Grand Wailea before our trip. We happened to get stuck at the Grand Wailea on an extra night in Maui due to a canceled flight on this trip, and I'm so glad now that we chose the Fairmont over the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: WaterfallSun99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, after a long flight with 3 transfers couldn't wait to check into our room. We were really excited upon arrival. The property is beautiful and we were pleasantly surprised that we received an upgrade to a room near the pool. We also received complimentary desserts and a bottle of wine. Kudos to their staff at this point and many thanks! However, from that point forward the experience progressively declined. We are severely disappointed with the response and lackluster performance of the front staff for all the inconveniences we were experienced (backaches from the hard/slopey bed, cigarette smoke from the vents circulating in our room morning and night, ants, hematomas, etc...) We have never experienced this with other four/five star hotels. So far, the positive experience was that our room was cleaned twice daily. We also really enjoyed the food at the restaurant Ko.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation. The renovation? Not an issue. It's a true 5 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: BryanS2011
Reviews.Content: Wish I was still there! This was an amazing getaway. We'd never been to Hawaii and had heard great things about Maui, specifically Wailea. For those that have never been, you can consider the Wailea area to be the "Beverly Hills" of Maui. Doesn't mean I especially like it or dislike it, just expect things to be more "quiet" and expensive. However, drive up the road to Kihei and you have plenty of great, affordable restaurants. Just know that mostly EVERYTHING (restaurants, shops) closes at 9PM. But back to the hotel. For those worried about the restaurant renovation, don't be. The noise is only coming from one area of the hotel and doesn't affect evenings AT ALL. Only time you'll hear a distant noise is at 10AM. Our room was DIRECTLY above the renovation site... and we still weren't bothered. I was shocked as we're LATE sleepers. Overall, the rooms are AMAZING (free coffee, free refrigerator, free microwave & separate bath / shower in bathrooms), and if you're a member (or make sure to sign up BEFORE checking into the hotel) of the Fairmont President's club- you get free wireless internet. Combine that perk with not having to pay a "resort fee" which most places charge (around $30 / day)... it's a really good deal during the renovation. The staff was also fantastic. Nick, the night manager, was very attentive to every detail and made our overall experience perfect. We highly recommend this hotel and we're looking forward to returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: MeliC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a great time. The entire resort in very family friendly: h20 slide, breakfast buffet, beach and activities for kids.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are great for a family with married children”
Reviews.Author: m2swim
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth visit to this hotel. We had stayed in the regular rooms in the main building but needed more space with the extra family coming this time. There is ample room for the two married kids and their spouses in the suites, negating the need to get three separate rooms when staying at the Kea Lani. The main bedroom is downstairs and is very similar in size with the other rooms. The two bedrooms upstairs had ocean views but shared a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot, Incredible Suite with a View of the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: NancySantaFe
Reviews.Content: They were doing renovations on the hotel, and so they upgraded us. The first room they took us to was a beautiful suite with a gorgeous view, but it was right over the heavy equipment where they were renovating. They then happily changed our room to a much better one. The bathrooms are huge and luxurious. The beds, very comfortable. I managed to also get free wireless which usually costs $14 per day. My only complaints are: About 50% of the pool real estate is taken up by cabanas that need to be rented. The rest of the chairs are mostly in the sun - it can be hard to find an umbrella. The breakfast buffet was delicious, but some days it would take them a long time to bring coffee. We thought that by going at the end of the summer there would be less kids, but that was not the case. Been there, done that - would have liked it to be a little bit quieter. But all in all, the hotel is gorgeous, the staff was very friendly, the rooms were wonderful, the pools and grounds beautiful, and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “NO.1 !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenMax
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 7 days at Fairmont Kea Lani and we are so excited about our stay at this hotel/resort that we cant wait to go back. We travel many times a year and stay at lovely and luxurious hotels and resorts around the world but so far Fairmont Kea Lani is definitely THE BEST we ever been to!!! From the moment you arrive you feel welcome by the staffÂ´s relaxed atmosphere which is very special for Hawaii. We stayed in a suite with partial ocean view and it is definitely worth paying the extra money for since you have great views from the balcony from sunrise to sunset. We also had 2 very nice and romantic dinners at the hotels Ko Restaurant (which is being renovated at the moment) and our 2 waiters Rachel & Roland made our dinners very special and enjoyable in a way we have only felt on Hawaii (nobody is busy with their mobiles, blackberrys,emailing etc.) There is also a very nice Fitness center with modern Technogym equipment which we find very important on our holidays since we LOVE good food but do not want to gain a lot of extra weight :-) There are several pools and one adults only which we used a lot. At this place you find icewater free of charge and the staff comes around with cold towels during the day. If you want to order lunch by the pool you can also do so! Eventhough there were lots of kids around the hotel it was not a problem at all and we never felt disturbed. We like to do some snorkeling etc. during our vacations and the hotel offers several choices from snorkel equipment to diving excursions etc. Another important thing that made os choose this place was the free self parking and that they do not charge a resort fee, many hotels and resorts have so many hidden charges like this but not Fairmont Kea Lani. We can only recommend this place, you will love it!!! Kind regards from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not for everyone (pro's, contra's + few tips)”
Reviews.Author: talula001
Reviews.Content: I can only confirm all the good things that have been written on this forum about this hotel. But the hotel will only guarantee you a splendid holiday if you know what you are choosing for. Many pros : - location : excellent beach in front of the hotel - service : excellent (as you expect from Fairmont), from check-in to check-out (everything went amazingly smooth, despite the enormous size of the resort) - rooms : this is in my opinion the biggest plus of the resort. Rooms are huge, and actually more like mini studios with seperate living room.Rooms are among the biggest in the state. - price : the Fairmont is less luxurious as compared to its neighboors the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons, but it's prices are much more affordable. - weather : this part of Maui is the most sunny part of the island, so do not look elsewhere if sun is what you're after Some contras : - the beach is excellent, but it is not a white powdery beach as is advertised in some brochures. It is a golden coloured beach. - the resort is very big (as most resorts in Wailea) : this is very good for families, but may be not the best setting for couples - Wailea is very expensive. Food will cost a lot and there are not alternatives (unless you have a rental car and to Kihei in the north, a drive of about 10 minutes) - the resort is very nice and luxurious but does not feel very intimate and even feels a little bit outdated - although it is the sunniest part of the island, it is also the least scenic area of Maui TIPS : - become a member of the Fairmont Club before arrival in the hotel : online registration is free and will give you free internet access during your stay - the drive to the top of the Haleakala crater (90 minutes drive from wailea) is a MUST : unbeatable scenery. And choose sunset instead of sunrise. As such you will not have to get up in the middle of the night, and have the added bonus of watching stars after sunset. Arrive 90 minutes before sunset, so you can still see the scenery in the light (otherwise the crater will be in the shadow of the setting sun). And after sunset, stay another hour to watch one of the most spectular skies filled with stars. Dress in layers :) - A 5 min drive to the south of the hotel will bring you to Big Beach : a spectacular golden beach with big waves

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, attractive common areas, and a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ecoaggie
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani is a wonderful upscale property in Wailea that will make your visit to Maui extra special. The Wailea area is a bit of a drive from the major airports (youâ€™ll want your own rental car), but it is very beautiful and worth the extra distance. The first night of valet parking is free. After that I recommend using the free on-site lot that has easy access to the hotel complex. The rooms are nicely appointed and very spacious. There a numerous unexpected amenities that add an extra special touch. The staff throughout the property is professional, friendly, and helpful. The recently remodeled pool area in particular has an attentive staff and is a great spot for family fun. There is a separate â€œadults-onlyâ€� pool area for those that want some peace from the little ones. The general landscaping is lovely and the private beach area is very nice, albeit a bit crowded. For those interested, there are recreational activities, multiple retail shops, restaurants, and spa treatments all on-site. There were also many local artisans that set up booths in the lobby areas on a daily basis to sell their wares. Many areas of this sprawling complex have been recently remodeled, are currently undergoing renovation, or are scheduled to do so in the near future (in fact, there are some areas that could clearly use a facelift/sprucing up and hopefully receive it soon). Consequently, there are some incredible specials being offered during these periods of construction that, depending on the amenity that is unavailable at the time, may make for a terrific bargain. During our stay the only current construction was on one of the many restaurants on site. We hardly noticed it wasnâ€™t available and greatly appreciated the >50% per night discount we received as a result. Iâ€™m not convinced that I would return at full-price, but at the special discounted rate the Fairmont Kea Lani could hardly be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MiaMcCloud
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel. The rooms are very spacious, the service was excellent & the pools are the best. We spent everyday swimming in their pools! As soon as we got there, we were greeted by leis & drinks. Our room wasn't ready yet so they upgraded us for free to an ocean view suite. Awesome! Our 7 yr. old daughter got a beach bucket & a tiki-tiki necklace from the lady helping us at the front desk & that brought a smile to her face. The beach right next to it was gorgeous. Great place to go boogie boarding. They have a beautiful koi pond where kids get to feed the fishes there in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “We were married here and had a fabulous time.”
Reviews.Author: Pinkyr71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and thought it was a very nice resort. It was our first trip to Hawaii, so we didn't have anything to compare it to, but the service was great and the grounds were beautiful. The only thing we had a problem with was that it was quite a distance away from a lot of the activities we wanted to do while in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: AMR0225
Reviews.Content: Hardly noticed the renovations, the area is nicely boarded up with a bamboo fence and even sitting out at the pool all day you can't really hear the noise because of the ocean, waterfall, etc. The staff was very friendly and so kind to our two children, very accommodating. The complimentary pack n play out by the pool was great for the baby's poolside naps. Also the new policy of reserving lounge chairs at the pool worked well for us. You can reserve them for two hours and if you haven't returned by then they will give them to someone else. We didn't have any problems with this. The villa was great with the kitchen and having a washer/dryer in the room is very convenient. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “No Need to Leave the Resort”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: We spent two week in Maui, and the first three nights at the Fairmont. This resort, by far, was the favourite for our kids. Because of the renovations, there were a number of free perks, such as the beach umbrellas, boogie boards, snorkeling equipment, etc. that you would normally have to rent for $10 per hour or $45/day. We took full advantage of this. The rooms, as everyone says, are spacious, clean, and comfortable. The balcony was actually a lot larger than what I was expecting, and allowed our family of four to sit outside comfortably and lounge about if we wanted to. The bed was comfortable for us. The kids had the sofa-bed, but we also requested a separate roll-away, just so there weren't any issues. This came at no charge as well due to the construction. The construction during the day was pretty loud. If you were down by the beach, you couldn't hear it. The beach was great. The food was great, flavourful, and yes...expensive. Earlier reviews stated there was only wired intenet access in the room. In fact, there is wireless everywhere, and it works quite well. We did not take advantage of the shuttle, since we did not have to or want to leave the resort for anything. We figured if you want to explore Maui, then there is no need to pay for high-end amenities that you're not going to use. Prior to coming here, I'm not sure I would have paid for all the little extras. After having them, I don't think I would want to vacation without them. They really do make your vacation a much more pleasureable experience, and the Fairmont did everything to make our vacation comfortable. It's a very good hotel in a wonderful location, with great ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “For families not couples”
Reviews.Author: Lorne_Alexandra
Reviews.Content: The lOcation was great; walking distance to other resorts for meals, shops at Wailea. The grounds were well maintained. The employees were lovely, very friendly and helpful. The guests were mainly families and clearly the resort is designed to accommodate this demographic. The rooms were large and cleaned twice daily. As adults without children we would not return to this lovation.

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Room927
Reviews.Content: Terrific property, great staff, beautiful grounds, luxury room...what more could you ask for? Nothing! And they even comped a bottle of wine at Ko because of our honeymoon stay. Thank you very much. The renovation didn't bother us because we were not on the wing that was affected. Some people in that area were grumbling from the noise...but not us. High end resort rooms with the kitchenette bar sink, refrigerator and microwave made snacking easy. You could put a bed in the bathroom and stay there....it was that large. Not a hint of a complaint we dined at Nick's and had a memorable meal...breakfast buffet was included the room package and very nicely presented. And hidden away on each floor is a complimentary washer/dryer...allowing me to pack 3 days worth of clothes for a seven day stay. I had to buy the detergent, but so what? Packing light was well worth the $5 for laundry soap. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent”
Reviews.Author: karen_22us
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days and it is very luxurious - we were upgraded to an oceanfront view as we checked in early. One downside was the renovation which was right outside our room but it didn't matter because most of the day you are outside. The bathroom was lovely as it had two sinks and had a section for the living room and bedroom which felt right at home. The staff were friendly and accomodated our needs. I didn't like the pool as it was small - there was the wet bar (small) in one section and another for adults and one for the family with kids (alittle bigger than the other two). You definitely need a car to get around as there isn't anywhere to walk to buy local food which was a downside for us - I'd rather walk to somewhere to grab a cup of local maui coffee or something to eat instead we had to drive to the Shops at Wailea (higher end shopping center). The beds weren't comfortable at all as I would wake up with backaches. Overall it was a nice hotel minus size of the pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “very busy, unless you have children”
Reviews.Author: charley48
Reviews.Content: i thought the grounds, the staff and all were very beautiful, but i were coming here for peace and quiet...no way. the ocean is a good spot to body surf, boogy board, but you have to take numbers to get a wave. it was so crowded when we were there!!! i can't imagine finding any peace and quiet, even in the adult pool. if you have children, like most of our family, they would love it. it is haven for kids... the rooms are very large and nicely appointed. the rooms we had with the ocean view, were to kill for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great spot!”
Reviews.Author: turista08
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beach, great place for families. The pool slide was a lot of fun and the food was very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....amazing views and scenery”
Reviews.Author: Monk657
Reviews.Content: Just what you'd expect from the class of hotel. Great and friendly staff. Atmosphere is great and lots to take pictures of. Lots of pools on site to find a spot and swim or sit poolside. They also have a great little shop "Caffe Ciao" to buy little groceries, wines/alcohol, desserts and take out food which we found very useful. Our room was big and clean and liked the bed turn down service which we didn't expect. TIP***Sign up for a president's club membership thru Fairmont before you get there to get free internet access in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: zen103
Reviews.Content: I just got back this morning after staying for the first leg of our trip on Maui. Grounds where fabulous and the suites where just right for the 3 of us. We got upgraded to the 5th floor ocean view suite which was very nice of the manager, Matt .Nice welcome basket in the room and the girls at the desk where very welcoming after a long flight from Boston. The complimentary shuttle is great if you want to go the shops down the road. Would definitely recommend this hotel.I wish we where staying here longer but we where off to the Fairmont Orchid on The Big Island after 3 days in Maui. We didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal_NT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani three times since 2008 and are returning again before the end of this year. The hotel is an all-suite hotel and the rooms are beautiful and spacious. However, we have always stayed in one of their oceanfront villas which are located just steps from the beach. Service is always above and beyond at this hotel. We always feel like we are among family when we visit the Kea Lani. The villas have been remodeled this year and are lovely. They offer plenty of space so it is easy to travel with several family members including children and grandparents or two couples and kids. In the two bedroom villa there are two master suites - one upstairs and one downstairs. In the three bedroom villa you have an additional bedroom with two queen beds. They keep your refrigerator stocked with bottled water and Hawaiian fruit juice and both regular and decaf coffee for the coffee maker. Upon arrival there is milk, a loaf of french bread, fruit, Half & Half, pancake mix, coconut syrup and other items already stocked in your kitchen. The villas have twice a day maid service which includes cleaning up the kitchen after meals or the grill located on your patio. Each villa has their own washer and dryer and detergent is provided. Each villa also comes with its own plunge pool, a table with four chairs and two chaise lounges on the patio which makes for a nice way to relax and enjoy a glass of wine at sunset. The grounds are beautiful. One thing we like about the Kea Lani over places like the Grand Wailea is that the grounds are not as large so you do not have to walk what seems like forever to get from the hotel lobby to the beach. We also enjoy walking the Wailea Beach Path which is located just above the beach. During whale season you can usually see whales in the distance during your walk on the path.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: hockeyboy752
Reviews.Content: Let me just star with a description of the 3 wailea hotels. Four seasons is a fancy place for honeymooners or for old kids with family. Grand wailea is a place for a family of five to go on a vacation for a week to a waterpark. But, the fairmont is the best. When we arrived, we had friendly staff and the entrance to the hotel is definetly exciting. We were so excited to get to our room and see the surroundings. 1. The rooms- the rooms are simpley great. Two room suite with a couch, tv, desk, wet bar, and the couch is also a pull out bed. The bedroom is gorgeous with either a king or two double beds, tv, alarm clock, two big closets etc. The bathroom was great. The walk in shower is great and the bathtub is superb. Two sinks, mirrors, seperate room with toilet, and towels plus two bathrobes 2. Restaurants- kea lani restaurant has excellent buffet with pancakes bacon sausage hash browns etc. Omelette station and fruit bar are both great. Caffe ciao was the place we ate the first night and wow did it make a good impression. Only tried ko simply because nicks fishmarket is overpriced and im not a fish guy. Ko was excellent. I prefer the sunset dinner special. The pool bar and grill was great. Takes a little while for servers to get to you but is worth the wait. The swim up bar is also great. 3. Pool and Beach Pool- pool was my favorite spot. Ipper and lower lagoon, 140 foot waterslide, swim up bar, two hot tubs and baaketball net. The pool is great for small familys. The beach is much more calm then pool. Bodyboard rentals are a bit pricey but r worth it. The rest of the beach is just a regular beach. 4. Our experience will never be forgotten. I want to go back here so bad in the near future and hope i can. The fairmont kea lani made our 2011 trip to maui the best ever! 2. Restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect, including the price”
Reviews.Author: Gerry12_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent overall, but service lacked a bit....20% service charge added on to just about everything...beautiful place, but next time I'll shop around a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “great, all suite hotel in a more secluded area..our second time!”
Reviews.Author: momshefchick
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (the kids are young adults) have stayed at the Fairmont two times now and we just love the place. Wailea is a bit more exclusive and away from the tourist area of Lahaina, but most things are just a short drive, as the island is not all that big. The staff is friendly and helpful, the restaurants are fabulous and the pools (especially the adult poo) are clean and the water temperature is just right. The suites are spacious and well kept. The only thing that we didn't like is the bathroom. For a family of four adults there is no privacy while showering. The bathrooms are large and two sinks are very helpful, but an open shower with no door makes it difficult for more than one person to use the bathroom. Of course everything is pretty pricey, but it is Hawaii. We don't mind paying the big bucks as long as the food, service and surroundings are top notch...and at the Fairmont Kea Lani everything is just that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Wonderful Service, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: CAFunMom
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating out 20th Anniversary and several birthdays. I have two tall teenage children, a boy 16 and a girl 18. There was no way we could stay in one room. A friend had suggested the Kea Lani, and it was perfect. We had the Kilohana Signature Suite, which was fabulous. We had room 402. It has a large master bedroom, a large family room with a pull out queen sofa bed (and we added a rollaway), a mini kitchen, and a wonderful bathroom. They did not show pictures of the bathroom, and they should. It is very spacious and nice. It was a corner suite with a balcony that wrapped all around. We stayed her 10 days and used room service for dinner twice because we had the best view on the island. The concierge was very helpful and set up appointments for us before we arrived. There is a free canoe (outrigger) tour that comes with all rooms. Definitely sign up; it is really fun. CostCo is right near the airport, so we purchased a few things for breakfast and lunch (stored in small fridge) as well as boogie boards. There is also a cafe/deli, which is reasonably priced for Maui. There are great restaurants at the hotel as well as within walking distance. The hotel also has a free first come first serve shuttle car service so that you don't have to drive to nearby restaurants. It is very helpful so that you can enjoy that beautiful hawaiian sunset with a cocktail! We did have a car. The hotel gave us free valet for one night. We then parked it ourselves without any problems. The parking spaces are really small throughout Maui, so be careful renting a huge SUV. The hotel is still being remodeled, but nothing bothered us. It was a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Big & Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tia_tait
Reviews.Content: We don't typically go for the fancy hotel holiday, but thought we'd give this one a try. as a sum up; beautiful grounds, fantastic choice of dining, courteous and helpful staff, nice (if quite small) beach, and a very clean room. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and perfect for kids!”
Reviews.Author: FamfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beginning of August for 8 nights. We were really impressed with the rooms - offering lots of space to stretch out in as well as palatial washrooms with double sinks and separate walk in shower. The pools and beach were perfect - the beach is small, but never crowded. We always found loungers at the pools and the pool staff were really helpful in setting us up. There were plenty of chairs at the beach (complimentary, though umbrellas are at a cost of $10/hour or $45/day). What made this the perfect resort for us was the programs for kids. Our daughter was too young to take part in the Keiki Lani program, but there were daily complimentary activities that she was able to participate in such as hula dancing, jewelry making, face painting and lei making. The "Kids Under Five Eat Free" program was also a nice touch, though the restaurants are quite expensive. This program is not available for room or poolside service though. The pools are perfect and are set far away enough from the adult pool so that the adults could enjoy pool time in peace! We bought some groceries from the Safeway in Kihei and ate breakfasts on the Lanai almost everyday. Ko Restaurant was also very good and they offered a prix fixe menu before 6:30 at a great price of $39. The resort offers a complimentary shuttle that takes you around Wailea - they brought us to the neighbouring hotels for dinner (Mala at the Mariott and Ferraros at the Four Seasons - both excellent with great sunset views) as well as to the shopping centre down the street. The gym is a sufficient size with a number of cardio machines (it was never busy when I was there) and is open 24 hours a day. The resort also offers complimentary fitness classes (aquafit, yoga and pilates). We did sunset yoga a couple of times and I found it to be a great class, especially with the Maui sunset and splashing waves as a backdrop. My travel partners also took part in the Outrigger canoeing experience and my husband really enjoyed it - wear swimwear if you go as you have the opportunity to snorkel while out at sea. If you are a President's Club member, your wifi access is free. They also offer President's Club members complimentary bike rentals! The only constructive criticism to offer would be to decorate the stark white hallways (though a reno is soon to be underway). The elevators were often slow as well as full, and the stairs are difficult to find (even some of the staff had difficulty explaining where they were). Overall, a really wonderful stay; we felt welcomed by the great staff and really enjoyed the experience. We hope to make this resort a regular spot for family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back again.”
Reviews.Author: Suzieqqq
Reviews.Content: All the rooms at this hotel are all suites with a small kitchenette and microwave and refrigerator. There was an extremely large marble bathroom with two pedistal sinks and shelves above them were convenient. There was free internet in the room, coffee and tea. The trip was memorable and we were treated like royalty. They knew our names at the concierge desk and offered cold punch upon arrival as well as a lei for me and puca beads for my husband. They also transported us to the nearby shopping center and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JuneDuke12
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for me in March of 2011, and promised that it was the best in Hawaii and he loved it. I think it might have appealed more for families. I found the open air lobby to be very windy. The hallways leading to the suites (the hotel is all suites) were stark white and devoid of any pictures, etc. Very sterile. I found the suite to be small, in need of a better cleaning service, and unattractive. The breakfast had a lot of sandy, wet people with children, messy landscaping next to the tables, dirty grout in the patio, etc. Just not my type of place. I went next door and checked into the Four Seasons, which I loved.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: kak032
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort! When we go back to Maui, I will be staying at the Fairmont Kea Lani

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort”
Reviews.Author: TimRegan
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th trip to Hawaii and yet our first visit to Wailea. Now we're trying to figure out how to end each of your vacations at this little spot of paradise. From the moment you drop your car off with the valet (not to be seen again for days due to the fantastic, complimentary shuttle (limo) service provided) you're in a resort of top quality with great service at every level. Front desk, concierge, bellmen, housekeeping, bar staff and everyone in between made it their personal mission to ensure that we had a great time--and we did. The rooms are all spacious and clean, bathrooms immaculate and very well appointed. The pools and pool staff are also top-notch and so helpful that you never have to lift a finger. Great restaurants and golf abound and all just a shuttle away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway for my husband and myself!!”
Reviews.Author: talyho3k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying in a 3 bedroom villa on the ocean at Kea Lani. The villa was absolutely beautiful and was situated in a beautiful spot with a view of the ocean. The rooms were so beautiful, stocked with everything needed. There was a full kitchen stocked with juice, water, and milk. They even gave us a grocery bag full of fruit, granola, pancake mix, bagels, jam and coconut syrup! Not only that, but they cleaned the room in the early day and restocked the refrigerator, and then came back to turn down beds. We really enjoyed the restaurant (Ko) where we ate. We also had a private chef one night and that was truly awesome! The concierge, and all the staff working there could not have been more helpful and nice. All in all, it was a perfect experience. We were so impressed with the Fairmont. We will definitely try to stay at another Fairmont in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani and were not only very satisfied but we were also pleasantly surprised at our experience. The reason was in Feb 2011 we stayed at the Maui Four Seasons and though it is a fab place to stay, we found the proximity to the ocean, the cafe/market and the availability around the adult pool area to be far more accomodating at the Fairmont. The concierge desk was more than helpful in booking and handling our reservations. The dining experience on property was better than expected (we never expect much from hotel restaurants, even the most highly rated and these were quite good.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family!”
Reviews.Author: Txeagle777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week this summer with our three kids - 14, 11 & 7. Over all it was a great place! Definitely get the breakfast buffet added - well worth it. The cons - even with the renovations, the furniture and the rooms seem a little "dated". For the price, it is somewhat of a let down when first arriving. Location - absolutely beautiful; however, far from most of the activities we had planned and we also had a hard time finding places nearby to eat. PROS - The grounds are beautiful, the beach is very nice! We were fortunate we had a couple of days with waves that were a lot of fun and a couple of days of more calm water - snorkeling was a treat and there were turtles not far from shore! The pools were great, clean and the kids enjoyed. We didn't have any trouble getting chairs any time we tried. (We were there early summer). As for service, it was excellent at every turn - front desk, wait staff at breakfast, bell hops, and all the people at the pool and beach were very helpful and accommodating. We also had an absolutely beautiful view from our room and the sunsets were fantastic. I think the keys points are, yes the rooms feel dated and for the money and "4 star" viewpoint this might be a problem for some. BUT, for a family, the rooms (suite) was fantastic, bathrooms were great (very large which was helpful), the fact that it wasn't kid chaos like the Grand Wailea made it well worth it and our vacation very pleasant! We will stay again on the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “FABulous - again and again”
Reviews.Author: shopperjo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kea Lani three times now. It is wonderful. the views, the location. Maybe I would say that about everywhere on Maui, because I LOVE Maui. Especially the Wailea area.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovesherveggies
Reviews.Content: The property has been remodeled and all electronics and furniture updated. The pool is wonderful too. There is nothing not to love about this hotel. All suites, an adult pool, housekeeping is terrific, service is impeccable, incredibly beautiful property, amazing snorkeling out the back of the hotel beach, no hub-ub, no fighting over chairs, just beautiful and wonderful. We'll never stay at the Grand Wailea - all of the crowds and people are insane! The Kea Lani is the place to be - perfect location, service - get the breakfast included if you can because it is certainly worth it. There's nothing we didn't love and we've been here twice and would stay again. They don't nickel and dime you and have a FREE washer/dryer on the odd floors of the hotel as a courtesy for guests. There is also no "resort fee" like the other hotels. The food at the pub is just pub food and Nicks is good but not excellent. Everyone here is happy, no BS. I couldn't/wouldn't recommend any other place!

Reviews.Title: “OK on short notice”
Reviews.Author: Kelly R
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Maui and staying at a Fairmont. We had a lot of special occasion going on - 60th birthday, 30th wedding anniversary, 2nd wedding anniversary, 1 son getting out of the military, 1 son in the military going overseas for 2 years. Our travel agent was very well aware of these situations and she made sure the Fairmont was aware of these situations. For all of these special occasions I expected more of the Fairmont than just 2 "free" desserts for the wedding anniversaries. Let alone they got the names mixed up. It's the details that count and for the amount of money I don't expect screw ups. They screwed up one of our rooms - wrong beds. As I was about to call my travel agent, they gave us a different room which was better than the original - a much bigger suite. However, it was somebody else's room that hadn't checked in yet. The room had a welcome card addressed to somebody that wasn't me, along with a plate of fruits, cheese, and crackers. It also had a roll away bed in it. When I mentioned this to the bellboy, he discreetly called down to the front desk and removed the card and bed. But we were "allowed" to have the food. But the real clincher for me was the centipede scurrying across the living room floor! It took several stompings to kill it and not by any hotel staff. We had 6 people staying in 2 rooms, and originally were only given 4 "free" breakfast buffets. After the centipede incident, 2 more "free" breakfast buffets were given. Watch out for the extra tips put on your "free" breakfast buffets tickets that you sign. Even though tips are INCLUDED in the price, and you sign the ticket WITHOUT adding a tip, magically tips appear on your final bill when you check out. Scrutinize your final bill BEFORE paying it! The Fairmont does nickel and dime you to death. Nothing is free beach wise except for the chairs. You have to "rent" everything including umbrellas, snorkel gear etc. For the price they already charge for the rooms, you shouldn't have to rent an umbrella for the beach. The front staff is not very forth coming on information about what the Fairmont does and does not provide. I found out on my own about a beautiful walking trail down by the beach, ocean and other resorts. We found out from a bartender that the Fairmont provides transportation to and from shops and restaurants outside of the property. This would have been nice to know BEFORE we got our rental vehicle out of valet parking. Even if you make reservations ahead of time and let the transportation department know when you will need a ride, they don't keep your schedule. It's more like first come, first served. When we did use our rental vehicle, it was nice that you could ask the valets for water to take along, and they provided it free of charge. But yet you had to ask, they didn't offer. The front staff is not consistent on their information that you ask for either. We needed to use the business office to check in on our flights back home. One person said we had to pay for it, another person said no we didn't have to. My husband and I each had a spa treatment. I'm not an expert on spas, but I was not impressed, especially by the facilities. The facilities were not especially discreet, you had to walk out into the reception area from the dressing room to another room to wait, then back into the reception area down a long hallway to the treatment rooms. My treatment table was broken at the headrest. I tried to raise it just a little and it completely fell off. This spa was not designed nor was the staff trained to accommodate plus size people. The treatments themselves were ok but definitely not worth the price. My person must have been fairly new because she was very nervous and didn't handle the covers very discreetly. For spa treatments, go somewhere else. All in all, the Fairmont Kea Lani was OK. Location wise, you can't go wrong, it's a beautiful area. The rooms were nice and adequate (especially after the centipede was removed), the bathrooms fine. But if you want to feel like a valued guest for your money, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: shysleepyshirley
Reviews.Content: The one-bedroom suite was spacious. Property was decent. We have to admit that it does need some upgrade but we heard the hotel has a renovation plan in place. It was between Grand Wailea, Four Seasons and Fairmont. In the end, we chose Fairmont because we knew that we were not going to be in hotel (activities were planned every day). We did have the chance to visit the neighboring properties (Grand Wailea and Four Seasons) and they were indeed very nice. Pools there were pretty busy compared to Fairmont. With the prices in mind and the planned activities, we believe Fairmont was a better fit for our trip. Concierge was helpful with dinner reservations and directions. Good value as well. We do not have complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JerrySpigma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for a week in late July. Just wanted to share our favorites about the Fairmont. The rooms are all suites and HUGE....bathrooms too. Will easily accomadate a family of five or six. The pools are great. We were with our nine year old, so we stayed at the two family pools all week. The slide was a hit, as well as the swim up bar. The beach is very clean and we didn't have a problem getting a chair at the pool or beach. The service was great throughout the resort. Would recommend Fairmont, if you are looking for a family friendly upper scale resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but hotel is not for foodies!”
Reviews.Author: hiya78
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are extremely spacious (you could probably do a cartwheel in the bathroom!) with large balconies which is nice if you decide to dine in your room. The beds are incredibly comfortable. If you go during high season (Christmas for example), it is VERY hard to get a spot by the pools (especially the adult pool) and annoying that there are a bunch of cabanas that you can rent for well over $100 that sit empty most of the day while there's no more space for hotel guests already paying just to be there. The restaurants are nice, but not notable and there isn't a lot of variety between their menus, so you will want to plan for many dinners off the resort if staying for a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: jacknmacksmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kea Lani with our two young kids for second time this year, but our first time during the summer. Had a tremendous time. The renovations to the suites are really nice and I hope the flooring is the next thing to be updated. The addition of Keurig coffee makers and updated electronics is also appreciated. We moved to a villa half way through our trip and as per usual, it was a delight. We ordered the Kea Lani BBQ as a birthday treat and it was really special. I am also glad to see that Ko is going to be renovated soon. It's just not a great restaurant and seems out of place. My only other suggestion for this resort is to improve their fitness facility. It's an adequate size, although a bit small, but the problem is the way it's set up. Why are there coverings on the windows? It makes it super dark and I don't get the reason. It's not like something wrong is going on in there so why hide it? Take off the coverings, face the treadmills out and maybe spruce it up with some new equipment and paint on the walls. Also, make sure the hand sanitizer dispensers have sanitizer in them or get rid of them entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to spend time with the family.”
Reviews.Author: redbellybutton
Reviews.Content: As with all Fairmont Hotels, we found the property beautiful, the staff exceptionally friendly and the service excellent. Our family of three stayed at the Kea Lani for a few days before heading over to the west side of Maui. We loved the extra large suites that make traveling with a family so easy - everyone had their own space. The balconies were a pleasant surprise, as was the mini fridge and the extra sink. The pool areas are very child friendly, but there are "adult only" areas that allow those traveling without children to get away from it all. The big sandy beach was great for boogie boarding, swimming and relaxing. A well maintained resort willing to go out of their way to make your stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Great service !”
Reviews.Author: Smallfry519
Reviews.Content: After a terrible flight, it was great to be greeted with such fantastic service at the fairmont. Every employee went out of their way to share the aloha spirit. The beach was beautiful and the least crowded of all the hotels on the strip in wailea. The rooms were spendy, but the expeience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation at a fabulous resort!”
Reviews.Author: kikrejam
Reviews.Content: This our second trip to the Fairmont Kea Lani. This trip we stayed in an ocean view 2 bedroom Villa. The Villa was fabulous. There were 6 of us, three sharing the upstairs bedroom, two in the downstairs bedroom and one on the pull out sofa in the living room. The bedroom downstairs had a king bed , a closet between the bathroom and the bedroom and a bathroom with two sinks, a walk in shower and a bathtub. Upstairs the bedroom layout was similar but with two double beds. At the top of the stairs before entering the bedroom there was a huge walk in closet. There was also a side patio with two chaise lounge chairs off of the upstairs bedroom. Also downstairs was the laundry room, kitchen, dining area and living room which opened to the patio complete with outdoor furniture, gas grill and plunge pool. From the patio you looked out to the ocean. Each bedroom and the living room had an LCD TV, the one in the living room complete with a Blu-Ray surround sound system and any possible connection cord you would need! The beds were incredibly comfortable and the pull out sofa was much more comfortable than what you would normally find. Each day the Villa was restocked with water, juices, milk and coffee.
