This a top notch property! Every employee we encountered was terrific; from housekeeping who addressed me by name to the pool, the bartenders and the front desk. One night after returning late one person was looking for some Benadryl. The Ciao Deli shop was already closed. After inquiring at the front desk and the gentleman checking the back, he did let me know that Ciao Deli had it and even though it was closed he said not to worry since he had a key to everything! A few moments later security met me at the front desk with a box of Benadryl in their hand with simply a receipt for me to sign. Now thatâ€™s service! We had no problems getting seating at the pool. We went on the Hawaiian Canoe Experience which is free to guests. I highly recommend doing this. We also took advantage of being Presidents Club members and used the free golf clubs to play the Blue course. We visited the Spa and fully enjoyed our messages. Nickâ€™s restaurant on property is top notch. Other restaurants we ate at that were also top notch were Mamaâ€™s Fish House and Capische (we used the Fairmontâ€™s Free Shuttle to get back and forth to Capische). Overall the Fairmont Kea Lani is a fabulous place to vacation in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 Stars: We liked it but will try one of the other Wailea properties before we book here again.”
Reviews.Author: sterry4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a last-minute trip to Maui and wound up at the Kea Lani because the Four Seasons, our first choice, was booked for several of the nights we'd planned to stay and our dates weren't flexible. Still, we'd heard rave recommendations about the property from friends and felt confident it would still be a great hotel. It was a nice hotel, but it lacked that wow factor and true sense of luxury that I expect in a resort like this. If I could, I'd rate my stay 3.5 stars. Overall Aesthetics: It's pretty, but not breathtaking, and is in need of updated decor in some places. I believe they are working on this, though. The entrance and lobby are sort of blah, in my opinion. Service: It was great. The staff are all very friendly, prompt and accomodating. Poolside beverage service is slow (When is that not the case, though?), but that's my only complaint about service. Room: We had an oceanview room, and it was worth it. We ate breakfast on the lanai almost every morning. I loved the space and amenities in the suite-style room. The refrigerator and bar area came in handy. The best part of the suite was the bathroom. It's very spacious, and well-decorated, for the most part, with a huge tub and a ledge in front of the mirror for all those cosmetics we ladies drag along. ;-) Ours was in need of some updating, though. The marble was tired-looking and the bathtub should be a jacuzzi. **Pet peeve: I need a full-length mirror. There were plenty of mirrors in the bathroom and on the backs of the doors, but none of them were full-length. No one wants to stand on the edge of the bathtub, or a chair, or have their legs cut off at the ankles.** Also, there were little details all over the room that needed attention. Vents that needed dusting, door frames that needed repainting, electrical cords that could have been hidden better. That sort of nit-picky thing. The turn-down service in the evenings was great. The attendants come back through and tidy up, turn down the bed and leave the radio on with soft Hawaiian music. A nice touch. Pool and beach: The pool is ok. (I am extremely biased about pools, though, since staying at the Grand Hyatt on Kauai. THAT'S a pool.) The cabanas were a joke, though. If I'm going to pay $150 per day to rent a cabana, I want something with a little style. These looked like those cheap pop-up tents you buy at a discount store. Honestly, the place would have looked better with more umbrellas and fewer "cabanas". The hotel beach was cute. Swimmable and a lot of fun for the kids and sunbathers if you don't feel like loading up the car and getting out that day. I had no problem getting a beach chair, but umbrellas need to be reserved if you want one. You can also take the sidewalk and walk to the beach behind the other two hotels. Very convenient. **Tip: If you are driving to another beach, you can rent beach chairs from Caffe Ciao Deli. Also, ask for beach towels at the front desk.** Restaurants: The food and service were both great at Nick's Fishmarket. Ko was good as well, but we didn't enjoy it as much. I recommend getting to either one at sundown, though. Very nice view. I loved the little deli, Caffe Ciao. They have a great selection of sandwiches, coffee, pastries, fresh fruits and cereals. If you're missing your coffee shop from home, you'll like this place. They also sell sundries, wine and gourmet gifts. The breakfast buffet was anti-climactic. So, so average. It lacked in variety and presentation. Spa: Painfully average. The service and both my therapists were great, but other luxury hotels have set the bar way too high for the Kea Lani to compete as far as the facilities and variety of treatments are concerned. Other comments: Valet service and internet service. Please, bump up the price of my room $50 per day and tell me these two services are complimentary. I hate being nickel-and-dimed to death. It sort of spoils the luxury experience. So, overall, we liked the hotel, but would definitely stay at Four Seasons or Grand Wailea on a return trip to Maui before we decided to stay at the Kea Lani again. My honest opinion is that this is a great hotel for a family or for newlyweds who want to stay at a Wailea resort. The suite-style rooms are great for parents with young kids and so is the pool. The price is right for luxury on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room and pool!”
Reviews.Author: christina_c74
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fairmont through Amex Travel so this was a package deal with air and car. The Fairmont was a beautiful hotel and breathtaking as soon as you pull up and walk into the open lobby. What drew me to the hotel is that it is an all-suite property. It was me, husband and 5 year old son so we wanted to make sure we had enough room for the week. I originally booked a room with two double beds but they insisted I booked a King. They were accommodating and got the double-room ready pretty quickly. The rooms were spacious and perfect size for the 3 of us. We booked the Fairmont suite which faced a nice grassy area on the southern end (and a wonderful tiny view of the ocean!). I loved that there were double doors dividing the living room and bedroom. The bathroom was HUGE with a lovely soaking tub, separate water closet and double vanity. Very functional! There was a nice partial-kitchen set up with Keurig machine, sink, fridge and microwave. Wi-fi was an extra $14.50/night and even our 3G signals were weak. Self-parking was free but beware, the lot has very narrow aisles and narrow spaces so be careful. I guess they want to make it extra worthwhile to splurge on valet parking. I enjoyed the lanai â€“ it was spacious and had comfortable furniture. I quite enjoyed my morning coffee out there. :) And the grounds were absolutely lovely -- lots of native plants and flowers everywhere. As many other guests have stated, eating at the hotel was expensive (even though our son ate for free). After the 2nd meal there, we realized we would need to eat elsewhere sometimes. We decided that going easy on the breakfast and/or lunch was the way to go so we picked up some light groceries at the Safeway in nearby Kihei. We spent a LOT of time at the pool area. Definitely heed everyoneâ€™s advice about snagging an umbrella early in the day (like, 8am) if you require one. The pool was really nice and my son had so much fun swimming all week. The main pool is mostly 3-4 ft so it was very accessible. My husband LOVED the waterslide. The pool staff was super helpful and came around to take drink/food orders which was great. The upper deck pool, where the waterslide entrance was, had a swim-up bar. And, Happy Hour is 4-6! 50% off certain drinks!! :D I agree with everyone that Polo Beach, although close and accessible wasnâ€™t the nicest in Maui. The Fairmont staff was nice all around. I found we got exceptional service in the Polo Bar & Grill and at Ko Restaurant. And the bell service was prompt and helpful. Not sure about the rest of the island as Iâ€™ve only visited Wailea, but we noticed that clouds would roll in and the wind would kick up around 2PM (this happened 5 of the 7 days we were there). So try to get your sunning in the first part of the day. Also, the last two days of our visit we noticed there was an overwhelming fishy smell being blown in from the ocean. It wasnâ€™t just on our end of the hotel, it was blowing through the lobby and even other parts of Wailea when we were out and about. Maybe thatâ€™s a normal part of being in that part of Maui but it was quite strong.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and you have to pay for shade at the pool”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaFamily03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for a week in June 2011. Overall the property was fairly nice, although at 20 years old it is starting to show its age. The food was good but very expensive, so we mostly ate out at other local restaurants. Two major complaints: First, instead of providing enough umbrellas for the guests to enjoy shade at the swimming pools, this hotel thinks it is a Vegas princess and decided to cram a bunch of "cabanas" (just very large umbrellas and chairs, nothing more) with reserved signs around the pool. If you want one, you must fork over $150 a day. Most of them stayed vacant for the week, whereas the umbrellas were all taken early in the day. Be prepared to bake in the sun. Second, we got very poor service at the Nick's seafood restaurant. We had to ask to speak to the manager because we could not get anyone to come to our table for over 30 minutes. Even the manager took a long time to show up, and he didn't even introduce himself. He gave a weak apology and walked away. Clearly other people were having problems with the service too, so stay away. We have stayed in Hawaii at other places and got a better value than this place. One minor complaint: the small beach is not very nice and the water was very cold in June.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute tranquility”
Reviews.Author: SMSWFoaF
Reviews.Content: Great property with wonderful beach and super pools. This place is Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: THebagels
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by our days here! From the moment we arrived we were treated like gold. The staff is genuinely so nice and helpful and willing to make your stay in maui the very best. Nicks restaurant was delicious. We went to the four seasons for dinner one night and regretted that we didnt just stay at nicks for a second dinner. We are already dreaming of ur next visit to the Fairmont kea lani and we are so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff - beautiful beach and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: OtisNC
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Fairmont were so gracious from the moment we arrived, draping a fresh lei on us, offering a free night of valet parking, and kindly showing us multiple views from multiple rooms to help us make our selection. The breakfast wait staff were friendly and quick, the food is great, and the beach is gorgeous. The rooms are a little outdated, but are apparently about to be refurbished...and they are spacious son you don't feel like you're at all pressed for room. Comfy beds. We are having a wonderful time and, so far, would recommend this hotel highly! Peter and JulienHans

Reviews.Title: “impeccable customer service and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: chizzoy
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights for a quick getaway with the family. booked it through costco travel (most economical package i could find). as a fairmont president's club member, i was treated as if i had booked it directly with the fairmont hotels. the front desk, concierge, and valet staff were very cordial and did their best to always greet you by name. poolside service was great. the hotel is going through construction right now but i know they are offering up very good packages during the facelift. the decco is a bit outdated but not very noticable because the whole resort is still a treat and beachside. i stayed at down the street at the grand wailea and if my children were older/teenagers, they may like that better. personally, that resort is too big and it seemed like a trek to get from the pool to the garden side rooms. for any 4-5 night trips and you want something nicer, book the fairmont. although in future, we plan to do something longer and find a timeshare if taking the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Maui-the most romantic place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: rainforestbc
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just recently returned from our first trip to Maui (Jun.3-13) and we stayed @ The Fairmont Kea Lani. We are Fairmont loyalists due to the fact we usually always receive superb service within a beautiful environment. Kea Lani was no different and in fact exceeded our expectations! To begin; at a very reasonable price we were upgraded from a deluxe ocean view suite to a 2 bedroom ocean-front Villa with private plunge pool, barbeque, full kitchen & 2 full bathrooms & private laundry. Amazing! We were even greeted with a welcome bag of mostly Hawaiian goodies. Considering this was our 1st visit & a "2nd Honeymoon" (although our 1st honeymoon was Costa Rica), it fulfilled our dreams! The service, including; housecleaning (exceptional!), turn-down to concierge, room service, valet, restaurants, pool-side, etc. etc. was nothing but top-notch! Yes, it can be "pricey" but it is the Fairmont and like they say, "You get what you pay for". If one really wants to get "nit-picky" our only complaints would be the following: 1) table service @ breakfast (where the buffet is also served) is very slow & the coffee tastes weird. Twice we ate there & both times service was lacking & the coffee was nasty. The servers appeared confused regarding who were buffet guests & who were table service guests. We saw some guests get so frustrated they up & left. We usually stuck to room-service on our private lanai (AMAZING!!!) or made our own or ate elsewhere. 2) I was NOT impressed with my Spa service. We had read in advance some negative feedback about the Spa but we felt we would give them a try due to the fact everything else was so amazing. I booked an 80 min facial & it rated maybe a 3 or 4 out-of 10. I felt the entire time my therapist really didn't connect, talked too much & it seemed she was more concerned about trying to sell me products than provide a relaxing, spa-like experience. She even chose not to give me the facial I requested (although I mentioned it twice). It was far too clinical & sales-pitchy. She even left me over $500 worth of products she recommend I purchase at the desk! I am traveling, what do I want with a load of additional, heavy cosmetics & electrical appliances!!! Ridiculous. I felt I could have washed my face with soap & water, applied my moisturizer to my face & I would have felt better & it wouldn't have cost me a bundle or wasted my precious vacation time. Very disappointing. My husband had an 80 min massage & rated it about a 7 out-of 10. Better than my service. We still have to say..."The Wickaninnish Inn" in Tofino, BC is still the spa leader in our book....& we've been to many spas ;) ...3rd & last) Diving lesson: My husband took a diving lesson booked through concierge, in 1 of the pools & he was totally disappointed. He kept telling the instructor that the mouth piece was damaged (bitten by a previous student) & didn't fit correctly but the instructor ignored him repeatedly. Part of the cost was a dive in the ocean following the lesson. My husband wisely declined! Very disappointing for him as this was something he was very excited about experiencing. 4) The carpets in the main hotel rooms/hallways really need updating & the beautiful bathrooms in the Villas need additional LIGHTING. If a woman is trying to put on makeup or a man is trying to shave it's also impossible to see!!! The upstairs bath has natural lighting from 2 windows which helps in the morning at least. Also, there is a real need of additional towel racks/hooks. Also, valet stands in the Villa bedrooms would be helpful as well as a wall mirror situated near the windows in both bedrooms & a small one near the hallway entrance front door. The walk-in closet/safe area needs refurbishing. The kitchen in the Villas should be automatically stocked with champagne glasses (we had to request these from housekeeping) & a pair of kitchen sheers would be very useful. As well, we didn't see recycling containers anywhere in the suites??? We are avid recyclers so we found this a bit disturbing. So that is it! Other than those few critiques, our stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani was MAGNIFICENT!!! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: jodeepups
Reviews.Content: We attended in June with my Husband's company on a business trip. The evening we arrived we were greeted and treated like we were Royalty. Everyone was very friendly. Our room was clean and spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable. The turn down service was exceptional. The breakfast buffet was awesome. The omelettes were wonderful. The birds are definately a nuisance. They fight with you over your food. The music provided for the business conference dinner was by a local who is awesome. We even bought Howard Ahia's CD. Meals are pricey. I'm glad we were not responsible for paying them. The grounds are beautiful. The beach is gorgeous too. The chairs are free out on the beach. The umbrellas had a fee. We also found out the day we were leaving that 2 famous people were spotted around. One at this resort and one on the beach. A nice outdoor mall and restaurants are just a mile down the road. Also a Starbucks nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mcoopersmith
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Maui in June 2011. The property is beautiful and you can see the beach from the lobby. There are three pools, one is an adult only pool. The property is open, clean and very spacious. The staff was very accomodating and super helpful. They even offer hospitatlity suites to use after checking out if you have a late flight and want to enjoy your trip to the last minute. Most of the people brought families to the conference which was easy at this hotel. The rooms are all suites so you have plenty of space for the family. Each room included a full balcony, living room, large bathroom with seperate toilet, large garden tub and shower with no door. Food and drinks at the hotel are very expensive. All rooms also have a refridgerator, microwave and wet bar sink so you can bring your own alcohol and food to save money. Wailea is not too far from the airport and there are several beach towns near by if you want to get off the resort. We added a few days onto the trip to make a vacation of the time which I highly recommend. We will definately be back next time we come to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place o relax”
Reviews.Author: HRHmum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pretty and rooms were spacious and had great views. We had a corner room so the balcony wrapped around 2 sides which made a great outdoor space to relax. They provided a shuttle to local restaurants and attractions which meant you didn't have to worry about having drinks at dinner and driving. The restaurants on site were nice. Thought that Nick's Fish Restaurant was a bit over the top - they would refill your water glass after every sip which was annoying but the meal was good. The recommendations from the front desk were right on as far as where to go and what to see. They made all our reservations and were very helpful and pleasant. Great pools, nice spa, and loved the on site laundry facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th Trip and We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: headdocs
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the Kea Lani with prior visits in 2001, 2003, and 2007. The recent remodel was well received - nice upgrades to furniture, TV's, draperies, though the bathrooms are essentially unchanged. Next is an update to Ko Restaurant and a coat of paint over the rest of the year. The breakfast buffet remains over the top with good pool and cabana service. This is the best hotel in Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Dated - Not a Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: abol
Reviews.Content: To sum it up quickly - stay at the Four Seasons instead. The Fairmont looks very tired and although they recently refreshed the rooms, the rest of the hotel still needs a remodel. Dirty hallway walls, dirty hall carpeting, filthy chairs in the lobby, cracked sidewalks, bare and dry grass, etc. This was a nice property when it was first built, but now I would say that it is barely a 4-star hotel. We had a number of problems - at least one a day - which the front desk managers always gave a little attitude when we brought them to their attention. Also, when you check in, they try hard to get you to pay to upgrade your room, saying they are having a special, etc. They even pull out an iPad, show you the view of the room you booked, and then show you the view of the upgrade. Everything is a fee. It is completely different from the Four Seasons where everything is included such as cabanas, kiddie pool toys, etc. The Fairmont is always looking for a way to charge you for things. Also, eat at the Four Seasons for breakfast instead - their buffet is $5 more, but is fantastic, vs. the Fairmont buffet, which tastes like hospital food. The concierge is hesitant to give you recommendations for off-property restaurants. Each time I asked for a suggestion, they only talk about on-property dining. The kids programming - hula lessons, lei making, ukelele lessons, etc - did not have hotel staff overseeing and instead just had these people show up and they did not seem engaged at all. One person even told us that the concierge manager has changed at least 8 times and they do not run this program well. I will say that the pool staff and bellmen are wonderful and were very friendly and helpful. Overall, I would not stay here again and wish I would have paid slightly more for the Ritz or Four Seasons. We've been to Maui over 30 times and this is the only time that I felt disappointed about our accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Our Dream Wedding: They Made It Come True”
Reviews.Author: Jaball2011
Reviews.Content: Let me say, if you are planning a wedding in Maui. This is the place. The best pool in Wailea with a great waterslide that was exciting for everyone. They gave us a great group rate and our room was the best in the hotel. Polly and Jasper helped us with our wedding and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Free golf club rentals and internet. The room was amazing, I only wish we could have spent more time there. KO and Nick's Fishmarket had great food. Pricey but so is everything is Wailea. Drinks were strong, fresh and tasty. The pool bar was great!! Live music in the lounge was great everynight with breathtaking sunsets. Our wedding reception in the Lobby Mezz. and was out of fantasy book. The staff helped us every bit of the way. They delivered our left over cake and table flowers to our guests. They got my bride some advil for a headache. The music was from a harp and violin and was First class. The music was truly amazing. Food was timely and amazing. Being from Santa Monica prices were comparable for us. This is a 5star resort, the best thing is to prepared for the best but be prepared for LA/NYC prices. My bride had her hair and makeup done at the salon and also used the spa. She said it was the best facial she ever got!! They made our wedding a dream come true. There wasn't a single negative. Truly amazing. We are planning to go back already!!! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2011011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel and everything about it was perfect. The lobby is inviting, the front desk staff were very helpful. The rooms were beautiful suite rooms. Lots of living space. The bed was very comfortable. The staff would greet you in the hallways and ask you how your stay was and if there was anything they could do for you. The pool was great and the only drawback was the lack of available chairs as people would "reserve them" first thing in the morning by leaving towels etc. There could be more umbrellas at the adult pool and the cabanas were lovely if a little expense to rent for the day. This is an expensive property but well worth the money. The breakfast buffet was very good and the restaurants were incredible. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!”
Reviews.Author: applegateml99
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed here during our trip through Hawaii. This was our third stop and I was really excited to stay at another Fairmont. We stayed at one in NYC and Vancouver and they were exceptional. This one was not. All the staff were great, very friendly and helpful. The hallways need some paint but no biggie. Our room was ocean front, large and clean but something was missing. It could have been bad airflow but I'm not sure. The room had a faint odor but I thought it could be the cleaning products. There was turn down service but nothing extra. All the other hotels we had stayed at left little gifts or notes. There was nothing special. The beach was awesome but paying $10 an hour or $45 a day and you have to stop using it at 5pm is not so good. Plus, $150 for the cabana pool side is RIDICULOUS! They give you free water and fruit but it wasn't worth that much money. Breakfast buffet was decent but the birds wouldn't leave you alone and this is the only place where the staff was a problem. The first day we were seated and no watior came over for about ten minutes. We had to ask a waitor to get ours. She finally came but it was like her job was a burden. The other days service was fine. I didn't like that some of the food wasn't covered to protect it from the little insects. If I hadn't stayed at other Fairmonts and other FANTASTIC hotels in Hawaii I wouldn't notice the difference, but I did. Next time we will stay at another hotel, maybe the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Coming Back - This time 15 Nights”
Reviews.Author: Caliwags2008
Reviews.Content: We spent 15 glorious nights at the Kea Lani, our eighth visit in the past 10 years. After some frustrating dealing with the Fairmont Presidents Club people in Montreal, over my platinum membership and misleading information about whether they mailed the packets, we finally arrived April 19th and were treated as royalty as always. We rented a cabana at the adults pool for most of our time there and were able to strike a deal around the normal charges. The hotel is suffering in occupancy like most but we loved it because in the "old days" you would have to lay out your towels by 7:00 am to reserve a lounge around the adult pool. The front desk personnel are outstanding and always greeted us as we walked by going in or out. Also, didn't know that my handicap placard allows free valet daily during our stay. In the past despite the placard, we have been charged. Valet people are ok. Several times we called down ahead of coming down to the lobby and still waited for the car including them taking people who gave tickets in front of us. But overall the staff is warm. Love Nicks Fishmarket, although price is high. Funny story. Although I'm a Browns fan, my daughter is a Jets Fan because of her love of QB Mark Sanchez. When we went to Nicks, I texted her at home and sent her a picture of a table for 14, telling her (a joke) that they were setting up for Mark Sanchez party. (My daughter had told me that he was in Maui). Lo and behold, after sending that text, who walks in with his party to sit there? Mark Sanchez!!! Couldn't believe the coincidence. I'll keep coming back as long as they continue to upgrade me to Platinum. They said they wouldn't next year despite my annual two week stay. We'll see. Love the Kea Lani

Reviews.Title: “Been there every May for 10 years now."”
Reviews.Author: PaulR312
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about my experience in May 2011. At check in, they upgraded our room and because we are President's Club members, we were able to get the third night free. That was completely unexpected. The staff sent up a bottle of champagne to "thank us" for returning. Complimentary one-hour canoe ride was a great kick-start to the morning. Accidentally left my ipad behind in the room and not only did they find it, they overnighted it back to me. Wow. They will have my business for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand what everyone is complaining about!”
Reviews.Author: Dj_turtle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon 2 weeks ago. I was kinda nervous from all the negative reviews, but our stay was nothing short of EPIC! The staff was super friendly and so on point! They were there At the drop of a hat when we needed them, and non-existent when we didn't. I'd love to see where the complainers stay. We always stay at 5 star resorts and the Fairmont was as good as any, if not better. It seems like the complainers expect the hotels to wipe there [--] for them to give a good rating! Thank you everyone at the Fairmont! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable and outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kamorgan
Reviews.Content: The staff at the resort provided us with the ultimate in customer service and pampering. I would like to commend the following staff for their " Above and Beyond" approach to our needs: Rooms manager: personal attention to our reservation was much appreciated. Throughout our discussions your professionalism and attention to detail indicated to us that we were a priority. We truly felt welcomed and well taken care of. Thank you for the opportunity to enjoy the villas - it was the ultimate in luxury and we enjoyed every moment of our time. 2) ( front desk): staff were attentive, accommodating and provided the very best of customer service. Throughout our stay we continued to be greeted by name and made sure that our account was looked after. all staff are an excellent front of the house ambassador. 3) ( bellman): was always smiling when we met them throughout the week.all staff were so kind and showed us all the features of our villa and managed all our luggage, golf clubs etc with a bright smile and a laugh. We immediately felt at home in our villa. 4) ( in room dining): set up and served our in house dining experience and truly treated us like royalty. The dinner on our lanai was by far the highlite or our trip. Thank you for providing us with the opportunity to celebrate the an anniversary and celebrate our long standing friendship with close friends. We all felt that that night was magical and we would be telling our grandchildren about the evening. 5) ( suite attendant / housekeeping): very attentive to our every need and attention to detail and obvious pride was evident. At no time were we left wanting or needing anything in our villa, they took very good care of us. I could continue on for several more pages about our fantastic experience at the Kea Lani. Suffice to say that we will definetley be returning to the resort next year, as this was by far the best vacation we have ever enjoyed. The staff, location, ambiance and overall feeling of being pampered all contributed to our fantastic vacation. Please convey our gratitude to all of the staff and management for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our kae lani stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnnjacquie
Reviews.Content: This was our third time visiting Maui. Last trip we spent in kaanapali and kept finding ourselves driving to wailea. Thus time we decided to stay at the recommended fairmont kae lani. Two of our good friends separately recommended this hotel. We were so happy with our choice. Room size is amazing. Bathrooms are great! The staff was way beyond pleasant ... Everyone that worked there said aloha. The most prestine beach and great scuba instructor "Alec". We went next door for dinner and found it to be more than pretentious. That is not the case at the kae lani. We can't wait to plan our next trip back to Maui and will definitely be staying at the fairmont again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon resort !”
Reviews.Author: NTexascouple
Reviews.Content: A little on the pricey side but the service & personalities of the staff make it worthwhile. Great food, beautiful landscaping & a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, top notch all the way”
Reviews.Author: zybergrrl23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the last three nights of our honeymoon. It's an all suites hotel and the rooms are divine. The bathrooms are a woman's dream complete with a fancy California open shower, huge sink, fabulous plush robes, etc. The list goes on and on. The hotel has an allergy program which is the best if you have an allergy. You just register your allergy with the hotel and every time you go to a restaurant or bar at the hotel, they make sure to cook and prepare your food/drinks in a special kitchen and deliver it by a manager to certify that it's safe for you. Seriously? I couldn't believe it. This gave me (and my hubby) huge peace of mind since my gluten allergy is pretty severe. The pools were beautiful and we loved the swim up bar. The ambiance was gorgeous, overlooking the ocean. The beach had great waves and you can walk to several other hotels in the area. The bed was cozy, service incredible. Really, there was NOTHING to complain about. It was paradise and we will always go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping...”
Reviews.Author: maxinmomma
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Kea Lani and I'm dying to know what they spent the $50 million on other than the flat screens. The rooms are slightly rundown and smell (but they are large). I realize it's hard to combat humidity, but if every other hotel has it figured out, get with the program. They need to add moldings to the hallways with carpet, there is something just gross about that line of dinge where carpet meets stucco in the hallways. The great thing about this resort is the room layout if you have young kids. We booked a poolside king room on the ground floor so we could go in and out easily after the kids were asleep and during the day. Our rate was just under $700 per night. It will be the last time we stay at this resort. Since we have young kids who are not great swimmers, we LOVE the kiddie pool. We would have done 4 seasons, but their kiddie pool has the little slide which ends in a pool that is just a little too deep for our little ones. We are fine with resort prices for food, etc. but you do end up feeling annoyed about it when you realize how much more you get at the four seasons. The service at the pool is horrid. We booked a cabana in advance for several of the days of our trip and I found myself having to walk up to the pool hut and ASK for stuff all day as we never got service. We ended up canceling the last day of our cabana. NIck's was yummy as usual and they brought out an anniversary desert for us which was very thoughtful. I think it's a great hotel if you have toddlers or babies but if you are on your honeymoon, etc. I think you are better off next door. But come to NIck's for dinner or polo beach to layout :) Oh last note, the fitness center SUCKS. I think they are trying to push the adidas thing in room, but I love being able to work out on vacation and this was just sad. No bottles of water, no towels (they were out), all the cardio machines face a wall. The cardio machines didn't have a cup holder big enough to fit the cocktail glasses of water they had, weird. No ballet barre or wall area to stretch. They should take some cues from the gym at the Wynn in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: afamonthego
Reviews.Content: We are leaving in the morning after 7 nights at the Fairmont.in Maui. Excellent experience and would stay here again for sure! The room was perfect for a family with 2 young kids. The pools are awesome and having the beach just steps away was perfect. We could go back and forth from the pool to the beach. Polo beach which the hotel sits on is beautiful. The sand is like velvet and the water is crystal clear! This hotel is first class and worth the extra it might cost. We splurged on the room and saved by not eating meals at the hotel restaurants. We are sad to leave and hope to return some day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch rooms and grounds but service could use a tune-up”
Reviews.Author: Luv2NonRev
Reviews.Content: We spent the first part of our honeymoon in Maui, staying 6 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani. The fact that it's an all-suite property is one of the top selling points of this resort. Rooms: The rooms were top notch and I give especially high marks to the bathroom which was very up-to-date and generous in size. The room had a small wet bar area complete with an empty fridge instead of the typical "honor bar" that most resorts have. We liked this amenity. The room also had a very large balcony complete with lounge chair and a round table with chairs. Because of the size and direct ocean view of the balcony, we found ourselves spending more time out there than we typically would on a hotel balcony. Resort Grounds and Restaurants: We liked that the pool area had an adults-only pool in addition to the pools that are open to guests of all ages. The beach is very accessible since it's just past the pools and villas. We originally were going to stay at the nearby Grand Wailea before changing our reservation so we spent some time checking out the grounds of it and another neighboring resort, the Four Seasons. We thought the Fairmont was the best of the bunch. The Four Seasons had no beach area and a small and cramped pool area while the Grand Wailea was packed to the gills with kids. We didn't get to see the rooms of either resort so I can't comment on that aspect of them. We had a fantastic meal at one of the resort's on-site restaurants, Ko. The tempura battered ahi sushi roll appetizer was to die for! For dessert, we found the Hawaiian shaved ice with red beans to be a tasty and somewhat healthy choice (compared to other dessert possibilities). We did not eat at the hotel's signature restaurant, Nick's Fish Market. Service: Our only critique of this resort is regarding the service. We had two unsatisfactory experiences with the staff and they both occurred the night we checked in. When we arrived at the hotel, we found the valet staff to be great but the front desk attendant was somewhat unwelcoming of us at check-in; he barely said anything more than "photo ID and credit card." He also seemed annoyed when we we inquired about the difference between two room categories: Ocean View and Ocean View Deluxe. We asked because we may have wanted to pay for an upgrade - it was our honeymoon, after all - but the front desk clerk's attitude and lack of information prevented us from seriously considering this. We did arrive after 11pm so one explanation could be that they don't have their A-staff working the overnight shift. Not long after we got to our room, we wanted to ordered room service since our travel schedule forced us to forgo dinner. I pushed the "room service" button and the phone rang about 20 times before I hung up. I called back a few minutes later and encountered the same problem. I then called the front desk who took my order. When I asked why nobody answered the room service line, they explained that the front desk handles the orders late at night but the daytime room service staff must have forgot to forward the calls to the front desk when they left for the evening. Although this seemed like a reasonable explanation, I was surprised that something so basic could slip through the cracks at a resort of this caliber. Furthermore, I got the impression that it wasn't a seldom occurrence, although I obviously can't confirm this hunch to be true. When I called a little later to check on my food (using the "front desk" button - not the "room service" button) I was told it was on its way up. After 10 minutes I called back to see if there was a mix-up and it turns out they were still preparing it. I expressed frustration about the conflicting answers since it was late at night (12:30am), we had been traveling all day and we wanted to get to bed as soon as possible. What followed was a bit bizarre: the front desk was completely apologetic about the mix-up on our order status (I think it was the same guy who checked us in) however, he called back about 30 minutes after our food arrived to inform us that the meal would be comped. So, in the end, the hotel did make it right for us and, thankfully, these two negative experiences did not define our stay at this property. Final Thoughts: Nice property, decent location, great rooms and food, lack of service befitting a resort of this quality is its only true weak spot.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: dlabine
Reviews.Content: We were reluctant to go to Hawaii because we couldn't find any hotels with great reviews. Well, the Fairmont Kea Lani in Maui is by far the best hotel we've been to. We traveled a lot to Cayman Island and we canâ€™t even compare the hotelsâ€¦ We booked an Ocean View Deluxe suite (room 328) and it was amazing. 2 double beds and a sofa bed were included. Spacious Bathroom, private balcony, microwave, 2 flat screen TV. As far as beach, the Fairmount has its own private beach but donâ€™t expect the 7 mile beach from Cayman Islandâ€¦ Nonetheless, plenty of chairs were available on the beach, and the ocean is gorgeous. My only complaint is that they have way too many pool Cabanas. There are about 10 or 15 around the pool which leaves very little space for regular chairs with umbrellasâ€¦ we had to set our chairs on the grass most of the timeâ€¦ oh and by the wayâ€¦ those cabanas go forâ€¦ wait for itâ€¦ $150.00 a day!!! The breakfast buffet was good. Great choice of fruits, meat, breads. A family of 4 can enjoy breakfast for a little under $100.00 a dayâ€¦ As you can see, you can rent a car and drive a little to get to less expansive breakfast place. Overall, we were very satisfied with this hotel and will probably return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlTravels26
Reviews.Content: We traveled here with our two young children (11 and 5) following a week in the Lahaina area. This was our first trip to Wailea and it was fantastic. The beach is one of the best we've visited and the sunsets warranted a daily timeout on the lanai. We stayed in the Kilohana Suite and our view was really terrific. However, I've stayed in nicer rooms and for the money we paid (the most we've ever spent at any hotel), I expected the room to be a bit fresher and more updated...that was a bit disappointing. The dinner at Nick's Fish Market was terrific with impeccable service. It was a lovely hotel with a fabulous beach and we would probably return, although we would consider the Four Seasons next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rindge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani with our two boys ages 13 and 16, their first time, our third time staying here. The suite easily accomodated the four of us especially with an extra rollaway bed for $30 extra per night so each boy could have their own bed. When we arrived we asked to be moved up a floor which Tami who checked us in cheerfully did. The service every place from the valets to the restuarants was exceptional with many of the staff remembering us by name. My husband and the boys enjoyed the breakfast buffet, while my favorite was the mango stuffed french toast. The sushi at Ko was very good. Our boys loved the pools with the water slide and water basketball. It was hard for us to get them to leave the resort to do anything else other than golf! My husband and I enjoyed the walking path for morning jogs. The resort location is perfect for stunning sunsets also. The only negative in my opinion is the $150 charge for a cabana. It was hard to find chairs with shade because the umbrellas got taken right away and most days many cabanas were empty all day because people obviously did'nt want to spend the extra $150 per day. We only opted to rent one once and you do get great service, but I did'nt find it worth the extra cost. Also the night before we left I went down to the front desk to inquire about a late checkout because our plane left at 10:30pm. Tami told me late checkout is usually 2pm, but after checking her computer she gave us until 8pm. We were very thankful and impressed! We checked out the nearby resorts while we were there and we would definately return to the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a gorgeous location”
Reviews.Author: pickoutagooddream
Reviews.Content: We were married on a beach in Maui and stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani. This place is a slice of heaven. We had the honeymoon and breakfast package, and enjoyed their breakfast buffet everyday (even though we're not big breakfast eaters). We can't emphasize enough how great the service was here. The waitstaff remember your names, and our bartender even made a wedding gift for us! We had a private cabana dinner from Ko the night of our wedding that was amazing. Our food was perfectly prepared and it was very romantic. We had a couples massage at the spa which was great, and I had my hair done at the salon for our day after photography session which looked good too. There's a great running/walking path behind the hotel that we went for a morning run on that was gorgeous. Each place we ate while on Maui was at the recommendation of either the concierge or our great waitstaff. Take your car into Kihei (a short 10 minute drive) and eat at Cafe au Lei and 808 Bistro. YUM! Also, if you join the Fairmont President's Club, which is free, you can use bikes or golf clubs for free from the front desk! This is a family resort, but there weren't so many kids running around that we felt like we were at Disney. I like that they have both an adults-only pool and a kids pool. We were able to watch sea turtles right off of our beach one day. We hated to leave the Fairmont and are anticipating our return. If you want to relax in luxury, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return for trip #3”
Reviews.Author: dsg55
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Maui with my husband in 5 years. I did not want to leave....we had a Deluxe Ocean View Suite and it was fantastic....we did not want to leave...the restaurants all have great food, the employees of the Kea Lani are always so helpful and kind. The adult pool is wonderful. We do not have kids (love them), but it was so nice relaxing and enjoying the great weather at the adult pool, Looking forward to another trip in 2012. Thanks to all of you at the Kea Lani....

Reviews.Title: “The Kea Lani is paradise!”
Reviews.Author: hellonewman61
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Kea Lani and it was every bit as fabulous as we remembered. We choose the Kea Lani when we come to Maui because the rooms are large enough (like mini suites) to accommodate our family (kids ages 15 & 9) for a week without making us feel cramped. Waking up every morning to the incredible view from the balcony is always breathtaking. We also appreciate the large bathrooms, the oversized balconies and the empty refrigerator! The staff at the Kea Lani couldn't have been more friendly, pleasant and helpful. Every member of the staff we ever walked passed - from housekeepers to groundskeepers - would greet us with a friendly "Aloha!!" - 100% of the time. Our housekeeper greeted us by name each morning we left our room. She was lovely. Rooms are kept spotless and (more importantly) sand free every day! Concierge were so friendly and helpful - sending us on our snorkel trips and hikes with clean towels and taking them from us on our return. The food and view at the pool restaurant is spectacular. Highly recommend! Also, Cafe' Ciao is the best place to grab breakfast (Macadamia nut muffins are to die for), snacks and even grab take out and a bottle of wine to take to the beach or your balcony to enjoy sunset. We love the privacy of Polo Beach. The attendants are quick to set up your umbrellas and chairs each morning. When compared to the mob on Wailea beach in front of the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons, the Kea Lani crowd on Polo Beach is far less. Good snorkeling to the right around the bluff as well. The pool was very crowded and it was almost impossible to get a chair, but we spend our days at the beach and let the kids swim in the (always) empty pool at night so that wasn't an issue for us. LOVE LOVE LOVE he Kea Lani and are already planning our return next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great option in Maui, but not without a few minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: ewrpex87
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Kea Lani with our two kids, both under ten years old. Things we liked: Suite layout is great for a family of four as it provides privacy for the parents and a room the kids can have as their own. Loved having a microwave and refigerator in the room. Food at the resort is fairly expensive, so this allowed us to hit a nearby grocery store and have more economical lunches. Lunch by the pool was very good, but $60 to $80 a pop, the cost could run up. Kids were so tired some nights they were fine with something small. Beach is great. Plenty of room, plenty of chairs. Kids loved the pool area and the swim-up bar. Hotel staff was very friendly. Breakfast buffett offered variety and an attentive staff. Nick's Fishmarket and Ko were both very good options. Things that could have been better: It was way too competitive for chairs by the pool. Before 7:00 a.m., most of the chairs near the upper pool were gone. Some went so far as to set up their spaces the night before. So either you need to play along or be resigned to getting a chair somewhere on one of the lawns away from the pool. Most days we hit the beach first but the day we did go to pool it was frustrating to be there at 8:30 and not get a chair, only to see that chair go unoccupied until well after noon. The nightly turn-down service should be done earlier with better communication. We were up early and back to our room after dinner early. The turndown service didn't generally get to our room before 9, which meant we rarely used it. The resort seemed fairly quiet at night which I assume meant others were on an early schedule as well. The few times they did come they didn't recognize that our kids were using the sofabed and didn't set up the bed for them. The Polo Lounge on our first night (March 25th) had awful service. One over-worked waiter couldn't get the orders straight and made numerous errors on our bill. He forgot several items and getting his attention was an issue. He didn't bring my wife's drink, then brought it as we were leaving. Never dawned on him to not charge us for it and we didn't feel like trying to get him to understand the issue. On most nights the lounge was quiet. Not sure if the issue is trying to staff to a generally low level of usage which leads to problems when it is busy or a low-level of usage because of a bad experience when it is crowded,. Thought the room was great, but we never went back to the lounge to sit for a drink because the experience the first night was so bad. Few minor misses didn't dampen our interest in returning. We loved the hotel and found most of the other guests we encountered to be pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation, Fun and Food!”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimersx5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for our first family vacation. It was an incredible experience and we can't wait to return. The youngest and his dad loved the easy ocean access for views and body surfing, Mom and Grandma enjoyed the quiet pool environment and huge drink/snack selection as well as hand-and-foot service, and the teen loved the freedom of hoping back and forth. The suites were perfect; we had two for our family of five. The huge bathrooms, connected bedroom and living area, perfectly-sized kitchenette, and three good-size closets left plenty of space for clothes and toys with room left over for play. Not only were the rooms gorgeous, but the personal lanais offered fantastic views of the landscaping, pool and ocean. We bought some snacks at the General Store in the nearby Shops at Wailea and stored them in our room for day-long trips, and also visited the swim-up cafe and brunch buffett (a great value with the breakfast package, plenty of options for kids and adults) for food at the hotel. In hotel activities are numerous and include a wonderful cultural canoe experience (book in advance!) and the oppurtunity to take kayak-snorkel tours right from Polo Beach. The hotel is five minutes away from everything else in Wailea (including the three amazing golf courses) so activites there are easy to access. We went to Maaela Bay and Lahina (about 30-45 minutes) and across the island (about 45 minutes) but the drive was so pretty we didn't even care. Overall, the experience couldn't have been better! We loved the Fairmont and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back in a second!”
Reviews.Author: Wunderbar5280
Reviews.Content: Flanked by two flashier sisters, The Fairmont doesn't have the mega pool of the Grand Wailea, or the oh-so-plush grounds of the Four Seasons, but it's a charmer with more open spaces for the family. The all suite format is great for traveling with kids, and it never felt crowded, even during the spring break we were there. The building does need some updating, but the rooms were well appointed and the lanai was spacious enough for a chaise lounge and a table for four. There are no real standout restaurants there, but we were eating out every night anyway. A minor complaint is the beach is very sandy- you've got to swim out a bit to get to clear water. Overall, a good "value" for Wailea, and a stress free stay. Would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very very Nice, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: TASfromAUS
Reviews.Content: 3 couples chose to stay here - very nice hotel and was magical with the whales out front of hotel blowing water and jumping up. Mothers teaching their babies - very nice. We were upgraded to a corner suite which was very nice. We had a good time, but think that the hotel is overpriced for what you pay for. Very disappointed that we had to pay US$100 to hire a cabana around the pool. For this you get water, soda and a fruit platter!!! As a result most of the cabana's were empty and they chase you away if you haven't paid for it. Outdoor spa set up is one of the worst I have ever experienced. It is a write name system and someone wrote theirs ahead of ours for longer than the time prescribed so ours got put back or cancelled - I could choose. I found the spa girls to be very very unhelpful considering this was a $400 excercise!!!!! Disappointed. We had a very wet morning and as a result the breakfast as a schamoozle. There wasn't enough tables for guests - its a very large hotel!!!! They were totally flummoxed!!! Probably wouldn't spend the money to stay there again. Nicks fish market was fantastic though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds...”
Reviews.Author: IAFamily4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our spring break trip to Maui and Oahu. Enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Kea Lani Maui for first 5 nights. Weather was PERFECT. Mid 80's, clear blue skies, gentle breezes (for most part!). Humpback whales a-plenty, could see many competition pods from our balcony. We loved sitting on our balcony each evening to watch sunsets, tiki torches being lit, listening to the ocean and gentle breezes. Activity at pools and restaurant below us was never obtrusive in the evenings, just added to the whole ambience of the resort. Whole package was so relaxing. Great mix of guests-families, friends, couples young and old, Our room was cleaned daily by housekeeping and beds turned down at night. Bathroom was very spacious. Enjoyed Ruth Crist's, and an italian restaurant right around the corner which I can't remember the name of.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to saty!”
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a few times at this hotel. Time and time again we have had a wonderful and peaceful time here. We travel with young kids and they also quite enjoy their time here. The pools are beautiful and well kept. The kids enjoy the water slide between the upper pool and the bottom. The adult pool is quite and serene. The grounds are beautifully kept. Yes, the hotel is not a new hotel and while they have done a nice job of renovating the rooms, it is not a brand new hotel. The room are all suites, a welcome option when you have young kids. The bathroom is very spacious, nice and clean. The rooms have a small fridge, microwave, cofffee maker, and kettle. The location of the hotel is absolutely great. The ocean views, the beach, and the proximity to shops at Wailea are all great. Eventhough the hotel was pretty booked over spring break, it still didn't feel like a crowd. Yes, the pool chairs got taken quite early in the morning, but we always managed to get some. The food is fresh and done well. I see people complaining about prices, but I find generally the price of food at all hotels are on the high side (and we do travel quite a bit). Also, we have always found reasonablly priced items on the menu here as well ($10 sandwiches at the deli- really a good size sandwich that my husband can't even finish). So I suppose you do have a choice, if you chose to go to a $50 dinner, then of course you pay that much and more. I don't understand why people are complaining when they make the choice? The service we have always found to be quite friendly. Everyone, the bell boys, reception, concierge, pool guys, and waiters all treated us really well. Can't really think of anything bad to say about their service. Overall, we would stay at this hotel again and do highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: oilerfan07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights at the hotel from March 2-10. The Kea Lani is a wonderful hotel. It is not the Four Seasons - and we weren't expecting it to be â€“ when I booked the Four Seasons was about 1/3 more per night (and the Fairmont is not cheap!) - if the Four Seasons is a 5 star then the Fairmont is a 4 1/2 star. The service was excellent - the housekeeping staff did a very good job and referred to us by name, the guys at the beach hut were very friendly and helpful and the poolside service was excellent â€“ simply raise the blue flag on your lounge chair and someone was there to take your order â€“ and in between they brought glasses of ice water, iced towelettes and slices of fresh pineapple. The hotel has a free shuttle that will take guests anywhere in the Wailea area which is nice for not worrying about driving after dinner with drinks and a bottle of wine. We checked in about 10 pm, they provided complimentary valet parking for our first night and then we used the free self park. The halls may be a bit dated and in need of a facelift but the rooms have all been renovated and were wonderful â€“ spacious, convenient suites with nice amenities (Keurig coffee makers, fridge, microwave) and big lanais with new chairs, tables and loungers. We bought fresh papayas and pineapple and enjoyed our coffee and fresh fruit every morning on our lanai. I notice some people commenting on the prices â€“ yes they are high if you paid them everyday but not out of line with what I would expect to pay when staying at a hotel of this calibre - $10 to $14 for poolside drinks, $10 for a gourmet sandwich or $7 for a big slice of pizza at the deli. We had dinner once at Nickâ€™s â€“ not cheap, but one of the best meals in terms of service and food that Iâ€™ve ever had. We also ate at Spago - a tip - enquire about early bird fixed price menus, we had a 3 course meal for $49 pp. Also recommend Matteoâ€™s â€“ a casual pizza and pasta place only a 15 minute walk from the hotel (we had the hotel shuttle take us and then walked back to the hotel). Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. For us it was a bit of a splurge but now we are spoiled and wonâ€™t be able to stay anywhere else next time we visit Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gottotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont Kea Lani Maui in September, 2010 for 7 days and we loved every minute of it. We were greeted with beautiful lei and drinks and were escorted to a spacious room with a beautiful view (partial garden and partial ocean view). Upon arrival we were given a card with the invitation to KO restaurant with complimentary dessert and a bottle of wine (Honeymoon gift from hotel staff). Our room was cleaned 2x a day and the staff was very amicable, polite and helpful when needed. The resort has a private beach with complimentary umbrellas, snorkeling equipment and boogie boards. Beaches are gorgeous, and don't miss the sunsets, it's the highlight of our stay!! Food at resort is delicious; however, it is pretty expensive. Eating and drinking at hotel may be a bit pricey, but you are on vacation so indulge yourself! We enjoyed very much restaurant Ko, we ate there many times during our stay. If you want to experience Maui definitely rent a car and drive around and explore surroundings and the beauty of Hawaii. Maui is not a big island, but there are so many things you can do for few bucks if you have a car: drive to Haleakala summit(amazing), drive Hanna road(oh-oh), explore Lahaina, drink local coffee, stop by breakfast spot in Kihei "Kihei CafÃ©" best breakfast ever, watch surfers and make sure you stop and enjoy the breathtaking sunset in Maui. We definitely will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Popcorn ceiling in my room. Really!? For that price?”
Reviews.Author: artladyla
Reviews.Content: You know, I wanted to give this place a 4 rating but as much as we enjoyed our stay it just wasn't. There are wonderful things about this hotel but it is so overpriced for what you get. And EVERYTHING is an additional charge. Want to sit under an umbrella at the beach?, that's going to cost you. And the food was not that great. My twenty dollar hamburger, thirty dollar breakfast... the room is a nice size, a suite! and pleasantly decorated but the shower smells like sewer and the electrical outlets are old... I wouldn't be complaining but but for the price you pay? It is a beautiful but slightly dated hotel with a beautiful location and gorgeous grounds with two pools and large lobby. And as I leave there, I feel broke and a bit taken advantage of. Have they ever heard of that pesky recession that hit us recently? Something tells me they don't really care...

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani exceeds expectations (not to mention they helped me with my wedding proposal)!”
Reviews.Author: jf13canada
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited the Fairmont Kea Lani from Feb 25 - March 5, 2011. I had not been to Hawaii in 20 years and she had never been. Originally we had booked at the Westin, but decided to cancel that reservation and book at the Fairmont (knowing that the Fairmont has yet to disappoint). Prior to departing, I notified the hotel that I was planning on proposing while in Maui. They asked if I needed any help with the wedding proposal. I told them my plan and they were immediately on board with it! To summarize, I wanted to arrange a "fake movie night" at the hotel and have them convert a ballroom into a movie theatre and show a movie. The movie that would be shown would be the first movie my girlfriend and I saw together (years ago....). 15-20 minutes in, the movie would have technical difficulties and then a slide show (consisting of pictures of us from over the years) would play. I explained this to the hotel and they told me to give them a couple of days and they would see how they could refine/assist with the plan. A couple of days later, I received an email explaining that they would leave a hand written note under our hotel room door 3 days prior to the "movie night". This note would be an invitation from the General Manager inviting us to the Friday night movie night. They also told me in the emal that they would essentially look after the small details and that I had nothing to worry about. We showed up in Maui on the 25th and as planned, a note appeared under our door (as promised). After a very special dinner on the Friday, we walked over to the Orchid Ballroom. At the entrance was a man in a suit who asked us if we were there for "Movie Night". He escorted us into the ballroom (now converted into a theatre with drapes and velvet ropes etc and chairs etc....). Upon sitting down, he offered us popcorn and drinks etc... She had no idea this whole "movie night" was fake. We sat down and enjoyed the private screening (obviously no one else was invited to the movie night). Fast forward a bit - after she "said yes", we went back to our room to call our friends and families and share the news and we came back to find a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a congratulatory note from the staff at the Fairmont Kea Lani. I can say this with all confidence that there is no other hotel chain in the world that I would have trusted with this unique wedding proposal. More so, the staff at the Kea Lani were just as excited to help out with the planning as I was to propose! One other quick story - one evening we were heading out to dinner in town and while taking the elevator down to the lobby, the elevator got stuck for about 5 seconds. No big deal, but we felt we should probably notify the hotel. Upon arriving in the lobby we told one of the front desk agents (and he asked for our room number). We certainly did not make a big deal of the incident but rather wanted to give them the 'heads up'. Upon arriving back to the hotel from dinner, we had, not one, but two voicemails from Fairmont staff just checking to make sure we were ok. I know this may not seem like much to most, but I doubt many other hotels in the world would provide this sort of service. A couple of other quick points - food at the hotel is great. Rooms are huge - every room is a suite (bedroom and a living room), 2 TV's, huge bathroom, spectacular balcony/views. Breakfast buffet is fantastic. Coffee in the cafe is amazing. While sitting at the pool, staff walk around handing out fresh pinapple and cold, wet towels. The staff are incredible. I can't think of one time where I walked by an employee and they didn't say "Aloha" to me. All in all - highly recommended. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Nice as we expected”
Reviews.Author: Lii7
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for the second part of our honeymoon and we were disappointed, especially compaired to our first hotel. When we checked in we asked if we could have a room upgreat since it was our honeymoon and they lied and said they were full (the hotel was at about half full). The room was quite large but the furniture was in need of an upgrade. A large frustration was the lack of free parking availible for guests. Not only were the spots quite small and hard to park in. But there were minimal spaces and when we drove the car we always worried that there would be no free spaces when we returned. We found the service ok, but considering it was a Fairmont we felt it did not live up to the standards we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - but not as touted”
Reviews.Author: TonyG51
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a Fairmont Hawaii tour. We went to the Orchid on the big island and then came to Maui and stayed at the Kea Lani. Honestly, the Orchid was better and we don't think the kea lani is worth the price. I'm confused about the Fairmont brand in general. I think they are trying to be in class with the best hotels, such as Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. If you stay at the Kea Lani with those types of expectations, you will be dissapointed. We had high expectations after reading reviews and being past guests of the Fairmont on the big island. We payed a lot and figured that this would be a mind blowing hotel, possibly the best we have ever stayed in. It wasn't. The attention to detail just isn't there for the Kea Lani. Don't get me wrong the hotel is very nice, but if you are trying to compete with the four seasons you have to be at the top of your game. There are so many things "wrong" with the Kea Lani that you would never see at the four seasons. It all comes down to attention to detail, like clean the dirt out of the corners type of stuff. The best hotels don't wait until something is horribly worn out or out of date before replacing it, they are proactive. This hotel is not. When trying to be a great hotel you should never let things get to the point people complain before you do something about it. Things should be perfect all the time, for every guest, in every room, in every part of the hotel. For around 500 dollars per night things should be clean and in perfect condition. They just aren't. I know the hallways are about to get remodeled and boy do they need it. They are strangely big, empty, old feeling and super dirty. It feels like you are walking through an old Aladdin themed hotel in vegas. Dirty, ugly hallways walking to your room do not give a good first impression. The elevators are old and have a strange smell. I know there is only so much you can do about "old" but there is never an excuse for dirty. Especially in the halls. We stayed on the "K" floor and it sucked, if the manager reads this go take a critical look at the hallway and be honest with yourself. It's really dirty. If you compare the Fairmont to the hotels in Kaanapali, it is way better....But also much more expensive. So I'm not sure who they are trying to beat. If they are trying to beat the Hyatt or the Westin, they did, but it's not worth the price. If they are trying to beat the Ritz or the Four Seasons they failed. The food here is very good, but very expensive as expected. We ate off property most of the time. The beach and the Snorkeling is very very good here. I would go back just for the snorkeling to the north of the beach. The workout room is not good. Don't expect to keep up with your workouts here. There are only a few machines in there and no free weights, just your typical hotel rack of light dumbbells. The pools are ok, but way too close to the main buildings. It makes for a lot of noise and it seems like this hotel has a lot of "bad rooms", rooms that are right next to the pool or just above a restaurant. We saw people moving out of these noisy rooms all week long while we were there. Thankfully we had a room away from the pools and restaurants. If you get a room on floor 3, or right next to the pool, don't unpack get moved immediately. It seems like the biggest draw of this hotel are the 2 room suites. Just like an old embassy suites setup. They are nice but why should I see black mold in my shower for 500 bucks a night? Lack of attention to detail. My summary is, nice but not worth the price. I would rank this hotel in the same class as the Hyatt in Kaanapali but for the money the Hyatt is a much better deal. If you really want to be pampered and stay in the super ritzy Wailea area of Maui, bite the bullet and stay at the four seasons. Or be economical and stay at the Marriott. The Kea Lani is strangely in the middle as far as quality but at the high end on price. Oh and the Spa sucked. The locker rooms are way too small and have poor amenities. It is almost like the spa here was an afterthought and shoehorned into the hotel. The spa at the Westin is much better and again half the price. My wife got a massage and said 'that was a waste of money".

Reviews.Title: “White Heaven”
Reviews.Author: loriswan
Reviews.Content: Once again the Kea Lani does not disappoint! This is our 2nd stay in 3 years and the resort just keeps getting better! The refurbished rooms are fabulous. The new decor is modern and sleek. We had adjoining rooms with a beautiful mountain view. Our balcony was huge, surrounded by beautiful flowers. It is such a pleasure to have all the space offered in our rooms. The staff were excellent. The conceirge booked everything we requested in advance. The complimentary canoe trip was a highlight for our family, they paddled us out to the whales within 50 feet, righteous! The use of the Free BMS mountain bikes were available everyday. The Free use of the Taylor made golf clubs made the Wailea driving range so much fun. The housekeeping staff used our names everyday, greeting us with hospitality. The pool staff is very attentive. I love this property because you never really have to worry about a thing. You feel pampered right from check in when you are greeting with a beautiful lei and cold drink. Book your Paddle board tour or kayak tour with the conceirge held right in front of the hotel on Polo beach. This outfit with Bob, Chris and Gary and their hard working girls really make your day special. Why would you want to stay anywhere else! This is a 5 star resort with a welcoming feeling of relaxation. Everyday is paradise at the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “A True Piece of White Heaven”
Reviews.Author: lkirtio
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea on the the island of Maui, with my family and my boyfriend. This my second time staying at the Kea Lani, and I was yet again beyond impressed with everything! The staff were helpful, friendly, and courteous. The hotel itself is beautiful and was the perfect place to stay, which helped make the perfect vacation. My boyfriend has never stayed at any resort type of hotel before, and I am afraid that the Kea Lani has ruined him for any other hotel stay, as nothing will ever compare to it's luxurious and relaxing atmosphere. Amongst it's many attributes is the buffet breakfast served at the Kea Lani. The food is quite possibly the BEST breakfast fare I have ever tasted. In fact, my boyfriend still talks about the excellent eggs benedict and the scrumptious apple crepes. On top of the delicious food, the activities offered by the Kea Lani are absolutely perfect. I highly recommend the canoe ride, and the kayak tour off of the beach. The rooms at the Kea Lani are perhaps one of its best features, with new furniture and bedding...even the pull out couch was comfortable! Most importantly, the Kea Lani provided the perfect location for a romantic and relaxing getaway, mixing just the right amount of all things wonderful! My words do not even begin to describe how wonderful the Fairmont Kea Lani is. You will just have to visit this wonderful hotel, and fall in love with it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Jstevenson1981
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Fairmont Maui and really enjoyed the whole experience from the moment we checked into the resort. It was a long way to travel from the UK but more than worth it! Our suite was located on the 4th floor and had spectacular views of the sea. The room was very large and had a huge bathroom with all the standard amenities you'd expect of a 5 star resort. We only ate in the hotel on two nights but the service and food on both occasions was excellent. Definately try the catch of the day in Ko restaurant! The resort also has a lovely beach and we were lucky enough to see whales in the distance on more than one occasion! All in all a fantastic holiday and fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: YYCTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and a beautiful area of Maui. Friendly staff and very clean, well kept rooms. The bathrooms are huge and very nice. Great big flatscreen tv's. Make sure you are a President's club member before you arrive as it comes with lots of extras including free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “We've been coming back to the Kea Lani yearly for well over a decade ...”
Reviews.Author: CitationExcel
Reviews.Content: We've enjoyed staying at the Kea Lani every winter for 14 years. We've seen this beautiful property go through many stages of renovation over the years and we are always eager to see what's new. The new pool deck really IS cooler in the hot sun! Nice work! The lounge chairs were added in an earlier year and they were a huge improvement over the original white chairs. At this point we couldn't be happier with the pools ... so happy in fact, we spent almost all of two weeks spending at least a few hours poolside every day! The pools here are not nearly as crowded with lounge chairs as neighboring hotels and the grounds have all kinds of open grassy space around the pools ... there's just more room at the Kea Lani pools. Fantastic service from the bartenders at both Ko and Polo Beach bars as well. Warm welcomes and great drinks and conversations as always by Marty and Kaz and Tom and the poolside servers as well. The remodeled room, the same Kilohana suite we have had in many previous visits, was a nice tuneup. The new mirrors, the flat screen TV in the bedroom, new drapes and colors were very nice and the new lanai furniture was significantly better than the old pieces. Can't wait to see the fresh paint and carpet updates in the hallways next year. We've renovated enough of our own facilities to know it's a work in progress if you want to continue serving customers so it's no disappointment to us it's being done in stages. The standards of the hotel are such that we expect next year many of the improvements will finally be completed. The concierge desk was, as always, competent and cheerfully helpful. Going to places like Mama's or Sarento's we found ourselves with beautiful tables front row seats to the beaches. Restaurants paid attention when those girls called them on our behalf. Bellmen were hustling for the car whenever we appeared and greeted us warmly by name. Check in took five minutes ... no issues ... we were in our room almost as fast as they opened our car doors. Valet parking the first night is free ... a nice treat to weary travelers. While last year we were less than impressed with the food at Ko this year was a complete reversal. I don't know if they switched up the menu or not but we went back on more than one occasion ... the food was excellent this year! All in all a happy two weeks for us and I will be booking next year's two weeks in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “What more can be said of the greatest spot in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: DanielKOBrien
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Pricey but not a bad word to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, but the food and rooms were substandard.”
Reviews.Author: BubbaBeans
Reviews.Content: First of all, the people that worked at this hotel were fabulous. Our kids loved the warm greeting and the flower leis they got, and I appreciated this touch as we had arrived late and were pretty tired. This level of attention was a nice little pick-me-up for the kids. And check-in was a breeze. Our bags were handled, our car seats were checked, and our room was ready all within minutes of our arrival. And the lobby was quite beautiful, with a large fountain and high, open ceilings.
