Again, this was very much appreciated as we were all exhausted and needed a little boost. My enthusiasm was stifled a bit when I saw our room. It was a suite, with ample space for the kids to sleep (fold out Queen couch), but the overall feel of the room was dated and dingy. It had an odor of mildew, and didn't present itself as a very clean room. That uneasy feeling was exacerbated a few days later when my wife and I both got food poisoning. We had only eaten at the resort up until then, so we felt certain it was the food there that made us sick. It is a testament to the staff that this experience didn't ruin the week for us. We were able to enjoy ourselves despite the illness (and save money on food!) but were always suspicious of the overall hygiene of the place. So, staff was excellent, but the facilities were below par. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, nor will we be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you love opulence..this is for you!”
Reviews.Author: Nativegirl10
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hawaii many times and have always stayed on the North side of the island. We decided to try the south side (Wailea) since it has one of our favorite beaches...Big Beach. The all suite Faimont Kea Lani is everything you would expect from a four star hotel. Less expensive than it's well known neighbor the Grand Wailea and just as nice. Grounds are lush and tropical, with great pools for all ages. Rooms are all-suite with a small kitchen if you prefer to eat in some nights. If you prefer to dine out, Nick's seafood house on the property is fabulous. If you really want a luxurious vacation, this is a perfect spot. Wailea is the most recently developed area, so everything is manicured and pristine. A little too pristine for my tastes. Driving the streets in Wailea, I almost feel as if I am in a country club....BORING. If you are a golfer, however, they have some excellent courses nearby.The one good aspect of Wailea is Big Beach just down the street a few miles from the resort. If you dare, Little beach (nude beach) is adjacent to Big Beach and is way less crowded. Honestly, I love to experience Hawaii in it's purest form. I enjoy and prefer the North West side of Maui. Lahaina, Kapalua and Napili. For me, Hawaii is about discovering new beaches, trails and wonderful restaurants. I tend to shy away from the overly popular places like Mama's fish house, opting for smaller quaint local favorites. Staying at a four star hotel is nice, but I would rather spend my money on experiences like diving, ziplining and dining out.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good !”
Reviews.Author: Albinilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights after the days we stayed there, we found it was a good place where the guests could choose for the tour.The location was good and comfortable. The room was nice and clean but not very large.The room was decorated modern facilities and quite suitably.The staffs were helpful and friendly. Only the price was a little expensive compare with the other hotel we have ever stayed before. However we highly recommend .

Reviews.Title: “I thought they had renovations”
Reviews.Author: alberta09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont Kea Lani for 7 days in February. It has a world wide reputation for its first class service and this was evident everyday and every encounter during our stay. Everyone was helpful, friendly, and accommodating. While the service is excellent, we were surprised that the suites and overall appearance did not look like there was extensive renovation. The elevator was so old and grungy looking our office elevator looked better, the paint on the hallway walls were needing a fresh coat of paint - while our suite was large, it did not look like it was renovated - or I suspect the furnishings were from the other rooms that were actually renovated. The room we were in actually did not smell nice - like damp...All teh other facilities were great and in my mind, if the service is excellent, you tend to overlook the other minor things - but, did they really renovate?One thing I will not recommend though is Nick's Fish Restaurant - poor service there and overpriced for what they serve. Go to Mama's Fish House instead or Sansei.

Reviews.Title: “so many good things- only two complaints”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kei Lani in early February of this year. It was our first time to Maui. We got our flight and car rental on points so wanted to splurge on a hotel. We agonized many weeks between the Fairmont, Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons. The reason we chose the Fairmont was due to its location in Wailea (weather was suppose to be more predicable in Feb) and that we could get an ocean view room for the same price as the Four Seasons lowest end room. Overall the Fairmont has so many things going for it. The grounds, pools and beach was excellent. The location in Wailea was great, close to other hotels, restaurants and a bit of shopping so you never got bored. I liked the self parking- ie you didn't feel like you had to valet park every time you went in and out like other hotels in the area- ie more freedom. The atmosphere at the hotel was really relaxed and the service on all fronts was great. We went to all of the restaurants that were open and they were good. As part of our hotel rate we got the breakfast buffet included. It was very nice-lots of fresh fruit. But if you had to pay for it each time it would be really pricey. I only have two complaints about the hotel: First was the so called renovations. I am in the design industry so maybe I'm a bit picky on details. The funny part was I thought we got one of the rooms that had not been renovated. But I figured, chill you are on vacation. When we left I asked the front desk when they were going to renovate as I thought how spectacular it would be and we would return again next year. Then they told me that had already renovated. I was a bit disappointed as all I could tell that was changed was the drapes and the furniture. Important things like the carpet, paint, fixtures, fittings, and doors were all in pretty rough condition for a 4.5 star hotel. A lick of paint and some new carpet would have been a huge improvement. Two positives about the room was that it was huge and the full size balcony complete with table and chairs which was really nice in the evening. My second complaint other was how expensive drinks, food and snacks were at the restaurants and cafe. Seven dollars for an americano is crazy! Also all the nickel and diming on the rental of beach umbrellas ($40 a day), boogie boards etc. The pool was filled with reserved only lounge chairs which were very nice and empty because they charge for those too. I tried really hard not to let this annoy me as I was on vacation. But beware don't expect any extras when you pay a premium price for a room. On the positive side if you are not worried about the two items above then the other 10 plus great things kind of cancel them out. Overall it give this hotel a 4 our of 5, but I'd give the rooms a 3 or a 3.5. Please Fairmont change the carpet and paint and I will be back in a second! A bit on the island and location. I loved the location we had great weather, warm, a bit less touristy and quieter than other parts of the island. We took day trips everywhere including the road to Hana- wow. The Ritz Carlton at the north of the island was really nice- quiet and the ocean on this side is a deeper blue- beautiful. We spent a lot of time watching the grey whales- spectacular. We did some snorkeling which was good but not as good as the Mayan Reef in terms of visibility. I'm in love with Maui and now want to see the other islands. We went to the Grande Spa at the hotel next door and it was great. I think if I went back to Maui I might consider the a couple nights in Wailea at the Kei Lani or Four Seasons (which was over the top nice!) and a few at the Ritz Carlton to mix it up. When you go rent a convertible- it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Mistake...Regret this choice”
Reviews.Author: CaCoast
Reviews.Content: I booked through Costco Travel, paid what I consider a very high price for one week and was told I had an upgraded room. However, it was in the parking lot above the children's play land and behind a public parking lot as well as a 10 story condominium and outside of the central grounds.. Even with that situation it was not bad until I had to listen to loud engines running constantly because the Tour Buses park back there, the young men ride their scooters without mufflers, people parking and fixing their cars and then late one night someone blowing the loud horn shell right next to my lanai And, the landscape personnel began using an electric hedger right outside my door before 6 am. It woke me and I could not go back to sleep again. . I had requested a QUIET Room, that was a priority. This was also a bad location for a solo female traveler because someone could easily enter this suite especially being next to this public parking lot on a low level.. Noise, Noise, Noise . I called and was told I could move if I paid $220 a night more, I'm already paying a few hundred a night. I was then told I booked a low rate room because it was through Costco, but I was NEVER told that prior to arrival. I spoke with several people at the front desk, not too interested and had an attitude. The manager called me and agreed to move me without an additional cost after I threatened to never come back to this resort again. That was perfect until the third morning when I realized I shared a wall with the ELECTRICAL ROOM and there was work going on from morning until late evening, drilling, hammering, banging against the wall. Oh, and at night there was a big party below me for a corporation and it continued for many hours beyond 10 pm. Remember, I requested Quiet? I have a chronic illness and went there to relax. It was a very stressful week dealing with bad attitudes from employees, rarely a smile nor any hospitality nor concern. The front desk personnel always seemed bothered if I asked a question and acted indifferent and annoyed. The concierge desk was not better. This is the first vacation where I was really happy and anxious to LEAVE ! We have traveled to Hawaii and Maui for over 22 years and never experienced anythiing like this in the past. I will NEVER return to this Fairmont property again. Formerly a Human Resources Management Generalist, I would encourage this hotel to make some changes immediately, provide staff training and perhaps treat their staff better. If I was treated with this disregard then I imagine the staff is not treated well either. So, if you want to pay $500 to $1000 per night maybe you will have a nice room and better treatment but if you want to pay a little less don't expect much. My spouse and I planned to return here in the fall but will never return to this "resort" again. The pool is beautiful . The Four Seasons next door treated me extremely well when I was there and I also had dinner at Spago's restaurant which was wonderful. And again I was treated very well as one would expect. Fairmont Kea Lani is a failure in the hospitality industry IMO. Are they offering Costcobad suites that they cannot otherwise fill and that are the worst locations? Beware ! Buyer Beware !

Reviews.Title: “When Can I Go Back?”
Reviews.Author: lamolp12
Reviews.Content: GREAT hotel and FABULOUS service!! The grounds were goregous - a truly beautiful hotel with amazing fresh flowers everywhere. The service was absolutely impeccable. The friendly and helpful employees gave this hotel an extra special touch. Every day staff would walk around the pool area giving guests ice water and fresh pineapple. All three pools were very relaxing and well kept. The beach area was somewhat small, but I never felt cramped. Great hotel and I can't wait to go back already!!

Reviews.Title: “I would move here if I could!!!”
Reviews.Author: jptsr1
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, impeccably kept grounds, beautiful semi-private beach and outstanding food. I stayed here with my wife and 2yr old and had an outstanding time. The rooms were a little dated and everything was a bit pricy but the overall stay was incredible! Iâ€™d definitely recommend it and plan to go back when our bank account recovers.

Reviews.Title: “Livin' the Suite Life at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: pamperedschaaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for 6 nights, from Feb 4 through Feb 10. We were originally booked for 8 nights, but had to delay our trip due to the giant snowstorm that hit Chicago. This was our first stay at the Kea Lani and we booked through Costco. When we knew our flight plans had changed I called Costco and they contacted the Kea Lani to see if we could change our reservations. Unfortunately, we were not able to extend our stay because the Kea Lani was booked for the two additional nights we needed, but the Kea Lani did refund our money for the two nights that we weren't able to get there. The Costco travel agent was very excited about this (we had travel insurance so I wouldn't have lost out). The Kea Lani is a class act and the agent said that not a lot of hotels would do that. Even though we had a lot of hassles to start our trip, that was a nice touch on the part of the Kea Lani. We arrived late at 9:30 and we were exhausted. The hotel looked very inviting when we pulled up and check in was quick and easy. We had to wait for our luggage for about 10 minutes and it seemed like forever. The bell man was friendly and had lots to tell us, but I just wanted to get into bed. The room was very clean, spacious and impressive! We were on the far side of the property right next to the elevator in the k wing and across from the loud ice machine, I was a little worried that we would be able to hear everything, but figured that I would sort out any issues in the morning. The way the room is set up w/ the bathroom. closet and hallway/bar next to the hallway it is so quiet! In all six nights we were never bothered by any noise. It was one of the quietest and most comfortable rooms we have ever stayed in. I was also a little worried about my son and daughter sharing the pull out sofa bed, they are age 8 and 10. They LOVED having "their own room". They loved everything about that suite. My daughter ended up getting a fever/flu type of sickness so we spent more time in the suite than we had planned and I was so glad to have the extra room. It was nice to let her sleep while I enjoyed reading out on the lanai. We also got take out several nights for dinner when my kids were tired and we ate out on the lanai. We had pre-paid the breakfast buffet for myself and my husband as part of our package. We also paid $14.00 per child on a few of the days we were there, but other times we just picked up breakfast for the kids when we were out. We stocked up on juice, water, beer, soda at Costco and were very glad to have the fridge in the room. We never did use the mircrowave for anything, but it was nice to know it was there if we needed it. Regarding the breakfast, it was nice and we enjoyed the wide variety of items, but I was kind of over it after about 3 or 4 days. I wish the there was a better ocean view from the restaurant. It is a nice buffet but sitting poolside is a non-event in my book. I would love to have an oceanview to enjoy my coffee and watch the sky, surf, and whales. I'm not complaining, but we have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Kauai and the Kea Lani breakfast location pales in comparison to the Gran Hyatt's. I felt like I just wanted to fuel up and get on with my day to go to the beach or walk on the Wailea seaside path. With both my kids getting sick we really didn't plan any dinners at the Kea Lani restaurants. We did get drinks at the pool bar and they were great. I have enjoyed yoga at the Grand Hyatt in a lovely little garden studio and I was curious to check out the fitness center and yoga at the Kea Lani but the location didn't look very promising. I will admit that I didn't actually enter the fitness studio or take a class but thats because I would rather enjoy the views and walk the beach path through Wailea. I couldn't help but compare the Kea Lani to the Grand Hyatt and other properties I have stayed at. I have to say that I would describe the Kea Lani as "understated elegance" it just has a certain quietness about it. I found the architecture growing on me, the white is very soothing and the tiled pools are beautiful. One night when I watched the sunset after the rain I turned around to look at the Kea Lani against the pink sky and the green grass and it was really very stunning. Polo beach is beautiful and the sand was very fine and soft, the setting is beautiful but the surf was very big the week we were there so we spent limited time in the ocean and didn't get to try snorkeling or the outrigger canoe that I was interested in. Between the sick child and the big surf we just kind of took it easy and didn't over do the activities. I am already planning my trip for next Feb and I will definitely be enjoying the suite life again next year! I hope that we will be able to spend more time in the beautiful Polo beach next year.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: badcab
Reviews.Content: I called Kea Lani about my Ovation package. I was told that there were vacancies. I then made my non-refundable plane reservations. Flying from Virginia to Hawaii is a lot of airfare that was not covered by the package. I knew that going in. However, it wasn't until all the booking was done that I called the Kea Lani back and was THEN told about the $600 upgrade I would have to pay. I was very unhappy because I had spend $3000 on this package already and had to pay extra for the airfare. I was not told ahead of time that I'd be required to pay an upgrade. However, I do understand that there was a notation on my certificates that might have told me that. I never saw it but I believe it was there. Still, I mentioned the Ovation package when I called for availability and was not told. That was frustrating. However, I chose to come anyway since I had already booked my nonrefundable passage. I stayed my first 3 nights at an Outrigger hotel and came to the Kea Lani on my fourth day. As we pulled into the circular drive (so that I could run in to see if we could check in earlier than scheduled), the "greeter" came screaming out to the car (where my husband was waiting) saying, "You can't park there! You can't park there!" It was very embarrassing. I said that I was sorry and pointed to the sign that said "Unloading" and told him I was checking to see if we could unload. He made us move the car anyway - not in a friendly way. He then, as I made my way across the lobby, screamed "WAIT!" I turned to see what the problem was and he was running after me with a lei in his hand that he promptly threw around my neck saying "Aloha." I wasn't in the mood to be "aloha'd" at that point. Then we were shown to our room. It was on the 2nd floor above the children's pool. All I could hear was happy children screaming. I went down to the front desk and apologized but said that we couldn't stay there. We didn't need a "view" of any kind, we needed quiet. I even joked that if I'd wanted to hear happy screaming children, I'd have brought my own. I was told politely, but firmly, that I'd have to pay an additional upgrade to get a different room. So, instead I asked what the cancellation policy was because I'd just stay the one night and return to the Outrigger. It was quiet and peaceful there. I was told that the "director" told the "manager" that the Fairmont would keep my Ovation certificates and my $600 if I cancelled or left before the end of my 4 night-stay. This is when I got really angry and asked how in good conscience they could hold my certificates and money hostage. I was not happy with the room, I didn't need a view, I just needed QUIET. I was eventually upgraded for free to a room on the 6th floor. The outcome was adequate but what I had to go through to get that was sub par. I needed quiet because I was recovering from a stress-induced medical condition. This situation did not help me at all. Customer service isn't about forcing the customer into an outburst before you take care of a problem. It's showing genuine care and concern about the problem and trying to compromise on a way to work it out. I'm a reasonable person. I would have taken my certificates and used them at another facility eventually. In fact, I had to cancel at the Sonoma last Christmas due to my medical condition and they couldn't have been any kinder. So I didn't understand this situation at all. The staff bordered on supercilious and snooty. Almost all of them. I don't think I ran into one staff person to whom I felt I could engage in a meaningful, genuine conversation. Your Kea Lani staff may need some education into what it means to be "helpful" rather than pedantic and rude. My rental car was vandalized the first night. However, since we did not "valet" park it, there was nothing your security would or could do. I have to tell you, the entire resort seemed to be geared toward forcing us to shell out money hand-over-fist rather than seeing to our comfort. There is certainly more, but I hope I've conveyed my dismay sufficiently to end it here. For the record, and for my commentaries about this hotel in the blogging world, I'd take the genuineness of the staff at the Outrigger, plus the quality of the living space (even though their a/c didn't work) over the Kea Lani. In the future, that is where I'll stay. I sent this letter to Roy Crane, Director of Rooms, who seemed apologetic about his staff and offered me 2 nights at a different hotel which I really appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “always the best”
Reviews.Author: codytucker
Reviews.Content: our fifth trip to the Fairmont and boy they did not let us down. We love this hotel and the staff is wonderful The rooms are huge as is the balcony overlooking the ocean. Whales every day and wonderful sunsets to watch. Lots of room at the pool and on the grounds overlooking the ocean. Did i say we love the room, a suite with frig and microwave and sink. The bathroom is very large with two sinks and a wonderful walk in shower. We would live there if we could. We had to leave to attend a business meeting at the Hyatt after 4 days, what a step down. This is our favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani: Near-great hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Kea Lani following four nights in Kauai. We chose the Wailea area (and enjoyed it), having stayed in Kaanapali years ago. (We visited Kauai first on this trip.) Beautiful location, grand and sprawling grounds and pool areas, received Fairmont President's Club upgraded view as we requested. Can't quite put my finger on it, but for all of its qualities, the Kea Lani just misses being five-star in my opinion. I agree with some of the other comments that the rooms (while very large and well equipped) seem dated in some way, despite the recent renovations. Maybe it's the very tired-looking carpet (even if it is new), maybe it's the bedding (mattress was way too saggy on the edges for a new hotel), maybe we were spoiled by the friendliness of the staff at the Koa Kea in Kauai and didn't find quite the same "aloha spirit" at the Kea Lani. In fact, I'd describe the front desk and concierge staff as a little icy. All in all, a fine choice, however, if you're looking for large suite-style rooms (especially for families) and good pools and facilities. We did not check out the Four Seasons or the Grand Wailea, but chose the Fairmont in the first place because of a favorable promotional rate. So if you can find the right price, enjoy the Kea Lani!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect Hawaii to be...”
Reviews.Author: calty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely from the moment you walk in and see the ocean from the lobby. It is well situated with a lovely private beach. The restaurants are good but there are many great local restaurants from fine dining to a local sushi restaurant which is more modest in price and has fantastic fresh seafood. The rooms are the exceptional value as they are all suites with room to spare and great updated bathrooms. Given its size it is a quiet hotel where you can feel like you are in paradise. The hotel staff is attentive and very willing to help. And there are free washing machines on every floor. Although it is pricey, you get value out of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Villas are FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationer78
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 3rd visit to the Kea Lani on Maui. It never seems to get old for me. I traveled this time with my husband, our 4 year old son, my brother and sister in law and my 7 month old niece. We stayed in one of the newly renovated villas (#28). This was our first time staying in a villa and let me just say it was FANTASTIC! The 2 story villa had a beautiful kitchen (fully stocked with pots, pans, cooking supplies etc..), a great living area that walks out to an outdoor patio complete with grille and private pool! There are two bedrooms. One downstairs with gorgeous bathroom and one upstairs with another gorgeous bathroom. The bedrooms/bathrooms are very similar to that of the suites. They are spacious and contain all the luxuries you would expect from a first class hotel. My family very much enjoyed the living quarters and made use of all of the space! I would also like to recommend if you do stay in a villa that you have the "chef" come over and cook for you! We had dinner right on our patio one night and a Fairmont chef came over and cooked us up some mahi mahi and chicken along with other sides. It was a delicious meal and super fun because we could entertain the kids in our private pool and all eat together as a family. The renovations at the main pools are fabulous! The new marble like tile surrounding the pool is gorgeous. The service at the Fairmont Kea Lani is top notch and the people are as nice as can be! This is my favorite vacation spot and I can only hope to return again someday!! It is a great place for romantic couples as well as a great place for kids! They have something for everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent staff, great food”
Reviews.Author: wanderinghaunt
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort. The suites were large and spacious, with bathrooms to die for. We had a corner unit with a wrap-around balcony. Everything was clean, neat and in perfect order and the suite was looked after morning and evening. They were generous with the towels, and the rate included all kinds of extras like an excellent yoga class in the morning, complete with mats and towels. Parking was free and the first night of valet was free as well. Service, as always, was excellent, and the bellmen were very helpful. You did not have the feeling the hotel nickled and dimed you at all. The restaurants were also excellent, and we really liked the breakfast buffet with an omelet stand -- it was the best buffet out of all the hotels we stayed at, and for a comparable price. The pools were lovely. Polo beach was on the smallish side, but there was a coastal walkway and Wailea beach was not far away along it. Only two small annoyances -- neither the bathroom sink nor the tub completely kept the water in when plugged (we never complained or they would have fixed it in a moment, I am sure), and they charged $10 per hour for an umbrella on the beach. Whoever heard about a per hour charge for an umbrella? I'd rather pay a flat rate for the day and have done. It was a bit odd, too, considering the rate was so inclusive otherwise. My husband and I both loved this hotel and would return in a heartbeat,

Reviews.Title: “Best resort to stay at if in Maui”
Reviews.Author: LAKWethersfield_Ct
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hawaii and especially Maui many times. Stayed at many excellent properties on my Hawaii trips. The Fairmont Kea Lani, if not the best, is one of the best. Located in Wailea, less than thirty minutes from the main airport. Located near shopping areas and lots of restaurants at reasonable rates. The resort is an all Suite property. Lots of room. LIke most Fairmont properties, service is excellent. I stayed at many Fairmont properties over the years, all have been excellent. This property does not have a GOLD Floor. Great Breakfast buffet ($30.00). Lots of pool space. When we were here in December, felt like we were at our own private pool. Staff comes around pool area with complimentary pineapple slices and water. Staff really friendly Doorman and bellman very friendly. All thank me for coming to their resort. You felt that they really appreciated you for being guest. Right on the beach. You can walk along paved walk to all other major resorts in Wailea. Great views including seeing Whales on this walk. When people think of staying in Paradise, they might be describing Farmont Kea Lani. Self parking is free. I asked for late checked out to 2:00pm. No problem. Can't wait to go back. Right on the Beach. you can wok

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: andyDenver
Reviews.Content: rooms were awesome, big, huge, well appointed, huge tub, big bathroom, great balcony, spectacular view of the ocean from all the rooms. Lobby was dated, elevators and hallways very worn out, but they are redoing both this year. Pools were decent, but nothing exciting. Beach area was good, and accounting for some shared beach with another hotel, very long. Sand was powdery, no rocks. Water was smooth once you got past a break, but big enough waves on the break to do some solid boogy boarding. We had a rental car, so did not eat one meal there, food looked good but cannot comment. Do take advantage of the room fridge and grab groceries from the Safeway, their sushi was very good believe it or not, and a great way to save money. Island of course is pure magic, so with a rental car use the great rooms to get quiet and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. Hard to avoid cigarette smoke though.”
Reviews.Author: SeattlePH
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The hotel is everything you'd expect. We had to move rooms twice, though, because we were pit in a smoking wing and were smelling smoke through the hvac.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: Of all the amazing hotels I've ever stayed in, this one is the best, hands down. Ridiculously beautiful, luxurious suites. Huge bathroom, bar space with a microwave, large living room, 2 closet bedroom. Spectacular ocean views with a DOUBLE balcony from living room to bedroom in each unit (with outdoor table & chairs for 4 plus a lounge chair). It's the first beach hotel that I've ever stayed at where I actually wanted to spend some time in my room, rather than living on the beach. And the beach is nice too. I still can not believe that it was actually less expensive (at our conference rate) than the not-nearly-as-nice Hyatt on Maui. I can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jade22607
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to maui and after reading several reviews we decided to try out the Fairmont Kea Lani. Best decision ever made. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was great! The food there is a little higher than we expected but we went into town several times to eat. We did not want to leave after 8 nights and definetly will stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on gorgeous Polo Beach...”
Reviews.Author: carmeloNstella
Reviews.Content: The start of our stay was NOT auspicious, our room apparently camewith a hire car, but Avis had lost our booking and the staff were the rudest we had ever encountered. It took an hour and a half to convince them to call the hotel and sort the situation out. Thankfully the Fairmont staff were sincerely apologetic and the manager greeted us personally once we arrived at the hotel. We were upgraded to a 3 bedroom villa with private plunge pool and recieved a welcome pack with enough food for breakfast for a week! We felt duly compensated :-) Now I had heard some bad reviews about the Fairmont though all appeared to be pre-renovations. We have experienced absolutely no problems so far. The room is gorgeous, bath products above average and the staff are very welcoming and friendly. I love that there is an adults pool with under 18's excluded though there is a huge pool with slide for the kiddies. The hotel is on the beach and guests can use the chairs and towels down there. One thing I've noticed with Hawaiian hotels is that you do PAY for every little extra from the poolside cabanas to the use of snorkels and body boards at the beach *ripoff!* NOTHING is complimentary, not even the inroom wifi. We've stayed at far more expensive resorts and at least they offer you free watersports, poolside shade, even iPods and foot massages... Nevertheless, so far we are extremely happy with the Fairmont and would definitely recommend it to potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SurLeNil
Reviews.Content: This is my family's fourth visit to the Kea Lani and the first since they did their room refurbishment in the Fall. Over the years we have come to love this hotel for a variety of reasons. First, location. Wailea is a wonderful community. Quiet yet plenty of great restaurants and shopping -- all within walking distance. Additionally, Polo beach is one of the nicest beaches around. Plenty of waves, sandy bottom, attentive care from the Kea Lani helping set you up on the beach, excellent views of Molokini and migrating whales. Second, the rooms. This is an all suites hotel. We normally get two connecting suites for our four person family. This gives us plenty of room. Also, the bathrooms are exceptionally large allowing everyone to get ready in the morning without tripping over each other. Finally, the hotel and the staff are just wonderful. The lobby is large, open air and has a classic Hawaiian feel to it. The staff are attentive and seem to genuinely care. I see the same people year after year so it feels a lot like visiting old friends. Bottom line, you will enjoy staying at this hotel and experiencing all that Hawaii has to offer. The only draw back is the price. Don't expect a bargain. You get what you pay for and in this case paying a premium is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: JustUs19020
Reviews.Content: Room was gorgeous, staff made us feel welcome from the minute we arrived. The resort wasnt crowded and we never had a problem finding lounge chairs or reservations at the restaurants (we have read it is quite busy at other times of year). Easily our most enjoyed vacation; we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: mersedeh1970
Reviews.Content: Over all the hotel was very nice. The rooms were nice size rooms but more on the older side. The staff were very helpful and prompt. The restaurants were great and the food was amazing (didn't love the breakfast buffet). Even though there was a renovation on the pool, It could still be nicer. The older kids were bored in this pool. There is no pool like the Grand Wailea pool. The internet service was awful and they know it.

Reviews.Title: “Best visit yet”
Reviews.Author: jacknmacksmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for a couple of weeks before Christmas. What a great time to be in Maui. No crowds, no fighting for pool or beach chairs, and lots of peace and quiet. The hotel recently renovated their grounds, suites and villas and the improvements are fantastic. We stayed in a villa for the first time, but having seen them on their website, I have to say the update is a huge improvement. Everything looks a little more modern, new and well kept. The only thing that needs some work in the rooms is the artwork. They still have these washed-out old South Pacific prints on the wall that just don't go with the decor anymore. However, that is minor. The service this time around was phenomenal. The keiki club for the kids was great and Miss Bonnie was a big hit. There also seems to be some improvements on the pool chair situation. They seem to have gone to a first-come first-serve system with no holding chairs, which works just fine. The slide could stand with a thorough scrub, but the kids didn't seem to notice. Housekeeping staff and pool staff were very helpful and check-in and out was a breeze. There were only two things that I think the hotel should take note of. One, I sent a package through the concierge on the 15th through FedEx. It was supposed to get to Canada on the afternoon of the 20th and I paid a lot of money for it to do so. Unfortunately, the young lady working at the concierge desk I guess did not realize that Canada is a separate country from the United States and thus requires an International waybill. Long story short, the package was returned by FedEx to the hotel on the date it was supposed to arrive in Canada. Rather than calling me in my villa and asking if they should resend it, which they should have done, they chose to resend it. The package did not arrive until the 26th, the day after Christmas because of this. Grrr. Concierge staff represent the hotel and they should be very careful in choosing staff that are not just friendly, but smart and able to handle things for guests. The only other quibble is the their restaurants. The morning restaurant is great and the Polo lounge is good for lunch. However, Nick's Fish Market is only open for dinner, and in my opinion is very overrated and too expensive for what you get. The hotel's dinner and lunch restaurant, Ko, is not bad, but it's stuck in this dark little corner and if it rains they move it even farther inside. We went to the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea for almost every meal in the evenings. They need to do something, or make some major landscape changes, to make dining a pleasurable Hawaiian experience. It would be nice to look out over the ocean, see the sunset maybe. Still, all in all it was probably the nicest stay we have had there and for a place to stay with family, it is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: alaska7133
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We had the same experience as last time. Great service, great rooms, great food. One thing that doesn't get mentioned much is the wonderful snorkeling right off the beach to the north. All you have to do is walk into the water and start swimming a little north and you are right in the middle of turtletown and wonderful coral and swarms of fish of all sizes. Saw more turtles than ever this time. Not much effort for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “A truly classy hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Sharka
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay last week at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Sure the room rate is not cheap compared to some other beachside hotels in Maui, but all in all I feel like weâ€™ve got our moneyâ€™s worth. Pros: 1) Suites are all newly refurnished. They now have nice flat screen tvs, new Denon sound system, new sofa, new lighting and new coffee tables (comparing to the older review photos). Too bad I didnâ€™t get a chance to take a picture, but they are all tastefully decorated and very functional. Free ipod dock/speaker in room for your use. Not sure if the carpet was replaced (the one in my suite was a light beige color) but it was clean and room service vacuumed everyday. Our babysitter from NannyConnection.com commented on how the new furniture looks so much better than the old ones. She also said the Kea Lani has the most tasteful Xâ€™mas decoration of all the Maui hotels (she has been to enough to know â€“ and I actually agree with her after visiting several other hotels) 2) Wet bar / empty fridge / microwave oven came very handy for feeding children / eating takeout. Housekeeping will provide cutlery/plates for free if you call and ask. There is also a coffeemaker + electric kettle + coffee mugs on wet bar. There is also a free ice machine + free self-service laundry machines (not coin-op) on every floor (you need to buy your own laundry detergent though) 3) Service in the hotel was very friendly and spot on. Concierge, bell staff, pool/beach staff always offered to help unsolicited when they saw me alone with my toddler (offer to help carry grocery / personal items) Poolside waiters always showed up and introduced themselves once we have settled at the poolside loungers. Itâ€™s friendly, efficient service, but not over-the-top mind-reading service like the Four Seasons. (Itâ€™s ok by me, since the room rate also reflects that) 4) Room is very well laid out, with huge bathroom that connects to both living area and bedroom. It works very well for families with young children who need to nap/sleep early. You can use the bathroom discretely at night without waking up the children. 5) Lanai is also very well laid out. A big round table for 4 allows al-fresco dining on the cheap. Also a great place to enjoy wine/champagne at sunset. (There is a real pimpinâ€™ wine store in Wailea if you want high-end wine, for cheaper wine Kihei Safeway has a good selection) There is one reclining lounger in the lanai as well. If your room has a bad view (the lowest rate rooms face the parking lot) there are a couple of large picnic tables on the lawn area should you want to eat takeout food outdoor. We used it twice (enjoyed coffee right before hitting the pools) for breakfast â€“ we didnâ€™t see anyone else using them at all! 6) We had a standard ocean-view room (not the deluxe ones), itâ€™s set back a way from the beach, but at night if we opened the lanai doors we could still hear the crash of the waves quite clearly 7) Cribs and high chairs are free of charge to use in-room. 8) Expansive grounds. Unlike the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea, the Fairmont does not pack loungers on every inch of real estate. It has a lot of manicured lawn area for children to play / run on. 9) All 3 freshwater pools are newly refurbished. They did not feel crowded at all during our stay; in fact one morning we had the lower family pool all to ourselves! 10) Poolside umbrellas are free (even though you need to rent a poolside cabana â€“ I think they provide free fruits / ice if you rent a cabana). There was no shortage of free shady poolside spots during our stay. We were not charged for the use of beach umbrellas since it was low season (thatâ€™s what I was told) There is a free cold water dispenser by the pool hut (so you donâ€™t have to buy bottled water if you donâ€™t want to). There is always a pool guy making rounds offering free cool towels, free pineapple skewers, etc. 11) Technically all beaches in Hawaii are public, but given Polo beach is a small beach (compares to other popular ones), very few non-guests go there. Itâ€™s almost like having a private hotel beach. Quality of sand (very very fine, no water shoes needed) and water are the same as the other beaches. There is no trash at all on Polo Beach. 12) No resort fee. Self-parking is free and the lot is a very short walk (literally 30 seconds) from the lobby. They donâ€™t have towel cards like some hotels, you can take as many pool towels as you need and return them whenever. (They donâ€™t nickel and dime you on the small stuff) Cons: 1) Restaurant food was not that tasty considering the price they charge (I am ok with paying more for convenience of dining in hotel grounds but I demand quality). We had one breakfast buffet and one lunch at Ko. The breakfast buffet at Fairmont was very lackluster for $30pp. If you are going to pay that much money anyway, you might as well go to the Four Seasons breakfast buffet next door (quality of food + service was outstanding there) Same with Ko, the food was ok but the service was terrible (busboy spilled water twice on the table). For the same price the lunch at Ferraros beats it by a mile. We got room service one night and the quality of the fish dish was very lackluster as well (although delivery was prompt). We didnâ€™t dine in Nickâ€™s Fishmarket so cannot comment. 2) TVs and Denon A/V system are brand new and have HD capabilities, but they only connected them using standard component cables, so we were watching HD DVDs on a HD TV at standard def! Very minor complaint but the Fairmont really should fix this! 3) Free in-room internet only for 24 hours if you join the Presidentsâ€™ Club. Enough to send/check occasional emails but not to work. Wi-Fi in lobby is free though. Cell phone signal is a bit weak in-room and stronger at Polo beach (I think the closest cell reception tower is actually located at the Four Seasons) 4) You need to swim around the rock outcroppings (almost to the Four Seasons side) in the ocean to get good snorkeling â€“ again itâ€™s such a minor minor nit-picking Some prior complaints I want to address: 1) Self-parking space is tight â€“ Over-exaggeration. The actual spaces are standard size, but they are set parallel to each other (not at an angle like most supermarket parking lots in the west coast), so it requires the driver to have some minimum driving skills (i.e. how to back up a car properly) to be able to park. Those spaces would be considered generous in size in NYC 2) CaffÃ© Ciao food prices are high â€“ Well you are paying for the convenience of not leaving the hotel. I thought they were acceptable ($3 for one large tasty muffin and $3 for a cup of coffee, also quite tasty. Think Cali Starbucks prices). There is free self-parking and a free empty fridge in room, you are welcome to drive 10 mins to Safeway or Foodland in Kihei to stock up whatever grocery items you need to save money 3) Beach is small â€“ Yes itâ€™s smaller than the other more famous beaches like Wailea, Kama'ole I/II/III, Makena Big Beach, etc, but itâ€™s still pretty darn big (stretches across the entire front of Fairmont + Polo Beach Club condo). Honestly how much ocean/sand does one person need? 4) Ugly architecture â€“ Really a matter of personal opinion. We visited the Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Ritz Carlton, Hyatt and they are all very cookie-cutter, architecturally. At least the Kea Lani has got its own style. The only truly architecturally Hawaiian hotel in Maui is the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. We got over the only real â€œproblemâ€� (lackluster restaurant food) by eating out more (which we would have done anyway, for the sake of variety). In particular â€“ takeout at Coconut Fish CafÃ© / CafÃ© Oâ€™Lei, ahi poke at Foodland, formal dining in Capische, Pacificâ€™O, Longhi, Ferraros and Haliimale General Store all deserve honorable mentions. All in all, this is a great hotel to stay at â€“ I highly recommend the Kea Lani for families with young children. For families with older children, you might prefer the Grand Wailea for its crazy pools and slides. For couples sans bebes Four Seasons will offer you more pampering. For us, the Kea Lani really hit the sweet spot!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property, quiet room, great food and outstanding staff!”
Reviews.Author: bpettinger
Reviews.Content: Located directly on the beach with an oceanfront 1.5 mile walk along some of the best scenery and consistent weather in the world. My wife and I were very impressed with the friendly and knowledgable staff and the quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: cordpar
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here. We love the hotel. The rooms are fabulous. On this trip we also stayed at the Ritz Carlton at Kapalua.I love Ritz Carlton, but the rooms there do not compare to the suites at Kea Lani. I am also a big fan of Ritz Carlton service. Yet, I have to say the service at Kea Lani was outstanding. We had a problem with the internet connection and the Jimmy, the tech person spent a long time taking care of it and fixing the problem. He did an outstanding job helping us. That was just one example of our Kea Lani staff exceeding our expectations. When we come back to Maui we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as Expected”
Reviews.Author: dwalters872
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a two week anniversary vacation to Hawaii last week, visiting three islands, the last being Maui. Although the other hotels (Marriott on the Big Island, Outrigger in Honolulu, and Austin Kannapali) proved to be very nice, I had saved the Fairmont for last, and to celebrate our anniversary, expecting luxury and outstanding service. To say it was exceptional would be an understatement. I had selected it over the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea due to recommendations I had read, both on this site, as well as several travel publications. My wife could not have been happier. The two room suite was perfect, and we had a glorious view of the grounds, with the beach and ocean in the distance. EVERY staff member went out of their way to ensure that our every need was met. Of particular note for excellent service was Eric, the car service driver, who provided several outstanding recommendations for dinner plans. Although the Fairmont was expensive, it was well worth the cost. From the pool staff who were constantly checking to see if there was anything they do do to make our visit more enjoyable, to the pool side waiters who seemed to remember your name after your first request, the staff was exceptional. Be sure to ask about the complimentary canoe ride provided by the staff each morning. It was one of the highlights of our visit. Although we had not planned on returning to Hawaii quite so soon, I suspect that we may very well be returning to the Fairmont for our tenth wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: vetters14
Reviews.Content: The largest rooms in all of Maui with enormous bathrooms and a living room/suite for each room. The staff is extremely accommodating and friendly and I love that there's a kiddie pool (with a great waterslide) and adult pool. The beach in front of the Fairmont is also really nice and not overcrowded. I stay here whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas style Arabian knight monstrousity!”
Reviews.Author: Dianadriessen
Reviews.Content: Poor wailea, first of all your sleeping on an ancient Hawaiian burial ground. The Kea Lani really imposed it's will on the environment here. Simply an eye sore. You can see this Vegas style hotel from the top of Haleakala!! Does not belong in Maui, and the service is definitely no 4 seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani Villas”
Reviews.Author: scowan002_10
Reviews.Content: In general, we had a wonderful stay. The manager ( Mark) greeted us warmly and offered his card and number should we have any queries. What a nice touch! With the exception of one person, the entire staff were amazing! Dinner at Nicks and KO is a must The villas were lovely and I would recommend them to anyone wanting to control their meals while away. We ate breakfast and lunch at the villa and went out for dinner a few nights. We booked a 2 bedroom ocean view and were upgraded to a 2 bdrm ocean front. The accommodations were slightly dated for the price but overall we were very happy. ( I assume when the renos are complete they will be lovely) Again, the staff were amazing. The pool attendants ( Giovanni and James in particular) were fantastic!! They take very good care of you ( be sure to tip them well .. they deserve it) The only difficulty we had was with linking our 2 seperate reservations so that we would not have to move part way through our stay. Looking forward to our stay next year ( in the newly renovated villas :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great experience!”
Reviews.Author: mknoebel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for our anniversary trip. We were treated to an ocean view upgrade which put a smile on our face every time we looked out at the beautiful Maui views. The room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities we needed. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel! Great suites, nice grounds, and a good beach”
Reviews.Author: SilkyRichmond
Reviews.Content: Overview: Pro`s - Great suites, awesome beach, luxury feel. Con`s - Pricey for ocean view rooms. Check-In: * Upon arriving at the Kea Lani, you definitely are greeted with a feeling of luxury. The lobby is very nice and we were given leis (kukui nuts for me and real flowers for the wife). While I was at the desk, my wife was also offered a cool glass of pog. They were nice touches and an enjoyable start to your stay. * We had booked an ocean view under the renovation rate and were advised they had upgraded us to a deluxe ocean view. I asked the clerk to show me on the hotel grounds map where the room would be and was shown a nice room on the 6th floor facing directly out to the ocean. Room: * The room was very nice and had a fantastic view. The balcony is huge and has sliding doors to it from both the living and bedroom spaces. * Rooms are a good size (around 900 square feet) and are set up in a neat square pattern. You enter into a little foyer that has a wet bar area and fridge. Off to the side is a door to a big bathroom and directly ahead is the living space. The living space then connects to a bedroom that can be closed off and you can also access the bathroom from the bedroom. Feels like a little apartment. * Our room had a nice big couch and desk in the living space. Desk was handy since I had to do a bit of work on my trip (yes I know, very lame). Good size tv`s in both the living space and bedroom. * Bathroom was also very nice with double sinks, big bathtub, water closet, and a nice open shower area. Pool: * Only the adult pool was open as the other pool was being renovated. This made it pretty tough to find space unless you got down there fairly early. But they did set lots of chairs and cabanas elsewhere around the grounds whcih was good. * The pools are set quite far away from the beach area which is a bit disappointing. Some other resorts do have them set a little closer which feels nicer. Beach: * Beach was very good and has a secluded feel to it. As all pools were not open, they were providing beach umbrellas and chairs at no charge. Beach attendants would set them up for you and place a clip with your name on them. You could leave, but if you didn`t return in about an hour or so, they would be recycled to someone else. It was a good system and it was nice to see the attendants being diligent to keep tabs on use. Too bad they didn`t also enforce this system up at the pool. * Also was nice that they were not charging to sign out boogie boards and snorkel equipment. Parking: * Parking lot did fill up later in the evening, but we were always able to find a spot. This was very convenient and it made it easy to zip into Kihei or down to the Shops at Wailea for dinner without having to worry about not being able to find a spot. Food: * Places are pricey, but its Wailea and a Fairmont and is expected. But the little cafe does have decent prices on some very good sandwiches. Conclusion: * We loved the hotel. Your room feels very cozy and like a little home away from home. * We definitely would recommend this hotel to a friend. We would even consider returning and staying in a non-view room where you are still getting a good sized room at a fair price on a luxury resort. ** See my reviews of Hotel Wailea and Westin Maui for comparatives

Reviews.Title: “Still a Crown Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Rannynm
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this all suite luxury hotel that is undergoing quite a bit of renovation this fall - starting with the pool and extending to all its rooms. The renovation was definitely needed and will make a great improvement in this already great property. It's difficult to compete with the extraordinarily excellent service at a Fairmont hotel and the Kea Lani is right up there. People remember your name, what you like and don't like. It's almost like staying at a small boutique hotel. We loved our room. Having a suite is always a pleasure and this one comes with a small kitchen area as well which we took advantage of, stocking up on wine and munchies so that we could enjoy those on our balcony at sunset before venturing out for dinner each evening. The only small complaint I might have was that the carpet seemed quite tired and I understand that it is the one thing they are not changing in the remodel - a mistake in my eyes. I loved the double closets, the separate shower and bath. My partner disliked the bed. He is fussier than I and found it lumpy and uncomfortable. In terms of location, Wailea offers a traveler a first rate experience. There are no condos there unless they are privately owned so there isn't a lot of tourist traffic in, out and around them. I love the "boardwalk" pathway that extends along the beach in front of all the other hotel properties. It's a great place for a morning run or walk. Food at the hotel was pretty good - better than most hotel food but we preferred to get out to other restaurants not hotel owned most of the time. Mama's Fish House, of course, Sansei for suchi, Tommy Bahama for asian influenced everything, and the small fish houses along the shore. Would we return? Refer a friend. Absolultely, after the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: cruzrmomma
Reviews.Content: Got a construction deal, so price was great. Don't know if I would pay full price for this hotel. Rooms are enormous and nicest rooms we'e stayed in! Huge balonies with table and chairs-which was great to order appetizers or pizza and eat them at sunset on the balcony! Also nice for breakfast-they bring linens with room service or you can order from the deli and they bring linens also. Pizza is great there! Pool side dining was crazy expensive, so go the deli and get something there. Adult pool was great, but lacked music. We walked over to the Grand Wailea and they had music playing, which made it more festive, but guess people come here for the quiet. It is a very quiet hotel, so if you are looking for that, it's great! Beach is nice, a little small. Loved the complementary beach chairs, boogie boards, parking, etc. They have a breakfast buffet that is really good and keeps you full through lunch! Not a lot of action going on, but had a nice relaxing feel to it. If you want action an more noise, go to the Grand Wailea. This hotel is great for couples and families with small kids. Teens would prefer the Grand Wailea. We really did love our stay here, the bellman were especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Roomy Room and Stuffy Staff.”
Reviews.Author: kimerik
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by telling you that we booked a room at the Fairmont Kea Lani for our honeymoon. We booked online and got the renovation sale price of $189.00 a night. When we got to the front desk at 6:00pm (after our flight landed) we were told that the hotel was very busy because of the sale. We mentioned that it was our honeymoon (even though we mentioned it during the reservation process) and the attendant told us we were very lucky to be staying at the hotel for that price. I felt very patronized by the comment and didn't appreciate it. We were put into the lowest level room facing a street that is noisy and were disappointed. She said that given our rate, we didn't qualify for any upgrade or view. The Fairmont did nothing to recognize us as honeymooners and we felt slighted and insulted. The room itself is very nice with a separate bedroom and a bathroom that is just as big as the bedroom. Yes, the furniture is slightly dated, but it's very charming and clean. Hawaii is not a modern place and the bamboo/rattan furniture is definitely part of the experience! The mini-fridge and microwave are essential. Make sure to stop at the Safeway grocery store to stock up on drinks and lunch. They have the best prices for food on Maui. WiFi is offered for $15 a day and there is a DVD player in each room. The bed was very comfortable and having a separate bath/shower was convenient. The Breakfast buffet is $25.00 per person and is very good. I would suggest going once at least. There are omelettes, eggs benedict, breakfast meats, pastries, fruit etc. The only other place we ate at was Ko and it was marvellous. We really enjoyed our dinner there are the 3 course menu at $39 is a very good deal for what you get. Maui is notoriously expensive for meals and I found the restaurants in the area to be quite pricey. Going into the town of Lahaina for dinner gives you some more options if you don't want to pay $40 a plate. The beach is beautiful and there are very helpful attendants available to help you set up umbrellas and chairs. There is also some snorkelling equipment and boards for rent as well. These are all complimentary and are a great added value to the hotel. There are plenty of umbrellas and chairs to accommodate everyone. Overall, Wailea is a beautiful location at the Kea Lani offered us a great room. That said, I would not have paid more than I did for the experience I had. I would have been disappointed had we spent more. Next trip, we will probably stay in Lahaina or Ka'napaali to be closer to a variety of restaurants and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “maui with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: longingtogetaway
Reviews.Content: Just recently came back from a 6-night stay at FKL. It was really great, and certainly met if not exceeded all my expectations. We got a great room rate/car rental/daily breakfast pkg since they were renovating pools. I was a little concerned bc I thought two pools would be open but only one was open when we arrived, but in the end it worked out bc we actually spent more time out and about at other beaches rather than at the resort pool. As a little bonus, the second (lower-lagoon) pool opened the day before we left so we had a 2 days to enjoy the newly renovated larger pool + keiki pool. Nice to have cold towels and fresh pineapple slices served to you at the pool, too! We traveled w/ a 16 month old, which is why I chose the FKL over others in Wailea area --- suite w/ mini kitchenette! You definitely get alot of bang for your buck at this luxury resort. I wouldn't call it "5" star-luxury, but certainly 4, if not 4 and 1/2. The staff is really exceptional, from the front-desk, to bell, to valet and housekeeping. The housekeeping was terrific at maintaining our room 2x daily and providing us w/ extra towels (also daily) since we had 3 adults in the room. Nice comfy beds and the bathroom is "gi-normous!!" My son also had a chance to feed the koi fish one morning, which was really neat. Kids just love that! Also, "keiki" under 5 eat for free at most of the restaurants. The staff refers to you by name, which is nice and personable. The front desk gave us a little "Keiki Lani" sand bucket w/ shovel for my son, which turned out to be his best souvenir from the trip. I really didn't come across any rude staff during our stay. Everyone was extremely nice and accommodating. I really liked that they would always ask, "is there is anything else we can help you with, Mrs.....?" and they actually were sincere about it!! The resort never felt crowded, though it was "a full house". I believe it was because a couple of floors were closed off (renovations?) so, it was still at only half capacity. We had an ocean-view room on the 3rd floor were we had awesome views of the sunset everyday. There was noise daily (except Sun) bc they were working on the upper-lagoon pool, but since we spent most of our day away from the room, it wasn't really a problem for us. Polo Beach is nice, though small. We actually didn't spend time there (waves were too big for our little one) even though rental equipment was free. We visited Ulua Beach down the street in Wailea, and drove all the way out to Napili Bay Beach two times bc we find this beach w/ golden sand and crystal blue waters quintessentially, "Hawaiian." In comparison to other Wailea hotels: we stayed at the Grand Wailea on our honeymoon and really enjoyed it, but at that time (in 2008 - early recession) it was not crowded, so it was FAB. However on this trip, the GW it was a "zoo." We walked over to the GW from FKL via the nature path (about 20-25 min walk) and it was just swarming w/ people, there wasn't an empty chair near the pool, it was loud and hectic. It more resembled a Las Vegas resort in the summertime, which I don't look for when I visit Hawaii. I guess that's why people like the FKL. It's more serene than the GW, and better priced than FS. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which was included in our package for two adults. Even though we paid for the 3rd adult, it still turned out to be a better deal than eating out breakfast every morning plus is SUPER-convenient. The buffet has everything you can want for breakfast and the fresh guavas and pineapple were amazing! So are the juices. Some reviews below have complained about "the birds"...which yes, are a bit of annoyance. But by day two we learned to cover our food w/ a napkin anytime we got up to go to the buffet and our food was fine. All in all, the poolside breakfast buffet was still and nice experience for us. We didn't eat at any Nick's or KO, which I now regret. The Ciao deli is overpriced, as expected. We ate out in Kihei (tons of reasonably priced eateries/restaurants ----- Cafe O'Lei has great food for decent prices), and at the Shops at Wailea. Also, Joe's at Wailea Tennis Club is great. The free laundry machines were very helpful if you are staying for several days. Parking is a bit of a pain (ridiculously small spaces and very hardly any aisle). However, I remember that was also a problem for us at the GW. They do give you complimentary valet for the first day. Overall, I felt that the positives far outweighed the drawbacks. I did not experience any "nickel and diming" as a result of the renovations, beach umbrellas/ beach gear were free. I also had no need for internet, which is extra (I had a tech-free vacay!) If you need to print out your boarding pass, they will let you do it for free at the business center. Bottom line is: I feel I got what I paid for!!! Would definitely come back! PROS: - NO resort fees, - NO extra-person fees IF less than 4 people/room. - mini-kitchenette, HUGE bathroom/suite - amazing location - polite, accommodating staff, great service - peaceful, not crowded. - nice pools, well-kept grounds - they offer a "hospitality suite" to use for approx 1 hour CONS: - internet is not free, unless you have presidents club, which is free AFTER your first stay at any Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: zoepoe_10
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is renovating and it can't be soon enough. The rooms seem very dated and the furnishings have seen better times. The bed was saggy. They have no WiFi. We were also given a terrible room facing the road with no ocean view. When I mentioned this to the front desk I was told it was because I booked through hotels.com. There is alot of construction noise around the pool area. Make sure you are getting a significant discount before you reserve a room here. The other hotels in Wailea would be worth a try until this renovation is complete. The location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Jiri1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the locationa called Wailea are just perfect. It cant be better actually. Imagine huge tropical garden and 4 tworld class resorts in the middle. Fairmont is one of them. Its all suites hotel so you will get not a hotel room but appartment for all your family. I cant complain about anything except prices. Some of the services are really expensive...if you need them. Breakfast we had in the package (not always included, pric eon spot 30 usd per person) was very good with all what you need. In front of the hotel is small beach fine for swimming but quite often with big waves. The bus going to Kahului stops at Wailea shops (free shuttle provided) and runs every hour. Rent a car for at least 3 days to discover Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy - everything a Hawaiian vacation should be”
Reviews.Author: akmmba
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui to get married - with our 11 year old son - and stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani. It felt like home, only better. Our suite was large, beautiful, comfortable, and had a separate living room with a pull out sofa for the boy. The location was not to be beat, beautiful beach right out front with snorkel gear, boogie boards, chairs and umbrellas. The pool was gorgeous, and the staff were friendly and brought chilled towels and pineapple on a regular basis. The staff throughout the hotel called us by name, definitely up to Fairmont standards. NIghts were quiet and peaceful, the bed was better than our bed at home. It was so hard to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: vacation0410
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10/3 to 10/8 and paid the Aloha Renovation rate of 199.00. We found this to be a fantastic deal. We booked a moderate room which means we got a room with a view of the mountains and the the parking lot which we expected. We were a little disappointed we did not get upgraded. The walls of the lanai are fairly high so when you are sitting down you don't really see anything but we did hear slight traffic noise. Our room was newly renovated so everything was clean and updated. I would suggest asking for one of the renovated rooms when booking. The small kitchen area with microwave, sink and small fridge were perfect for saving money on meals. There are no dishes or silverware but you can call room service and they will deliver them to you. There is also a free washer/dryer on each floor which we used once. Very convenient, but you do have to buy detergent in the gift shop. They were working on 2 of the pools but the newly renovated adult pool was available. They let kids use it too as it was the only pool open at the time. We spent most of the time at the beach, all equipment such as snorkels/fins and boogie boards were free of charge due to the renovation. I used the fitness center a couple of times, nothing too impressive. We ate at KO one night, they had a 3 course $39 dinner special. It was good, it is an outside restaurant overlooking the pool. Judging by other reviews, if we had paid alot more and stayed in an older room, we would have had a different impression. Overall, for the price we paid, we were extremely happy with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “HUGELY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Activities2010
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that I chose to stay at Fairmont for my entire 6 day trip to Maui and got an ocean view suite because The Fairmont had arguably been deemed the most luxurious or one of the most luxurious places to stay in Maui, and I had visited the lobby and the common areas when I went to Maui a few years back and liked it. However, after my stay as a guest, I wish I had not wasted my money on the Fairmont. I prefer a "luxury resort", but in this case, a condo in Kihei or a hotel in Lahaina would have been comparable in terms of the quality of the rooms. And they would have been a FRACTION of the cost. The only thing that sets this place apart from regular hotels or condos in Maui is the lobby. I admit it is grand and beautiful. The pool is pretty too, but I'm not one to travel to Maui to stay in the resort pools. So everything beyond the lobby was extremely dissapointing. Parking: I have to stress that the parking lot is ridiculous. This resort is not cramped for square footage, but the Kea Lani parking lot is structured as if Fairmont couldn't afford to give it's guests one more inch of turning radius in the lane to park into a narrow door ding causing stall. Every time we drove back to the resort at the end of another fabulous day exploring and relaxing and having fun, the parking lot would just annoy the living daylights out of me. You have to shoe horn your car in. For the lack of a better word, it's just lame. It's so cheap feeling for this supposed "luxury resort", an complete indication of how Fairmont cuts corners. Rooms: A few minutes after we checked into our room, we realized that our bar area was swarming with ants. I called the front desk and instead of offering to switch us to another room, she promptly said she would send up housekeeping and ended the call. Okay, fine. We'll try that first. Maintenence comes up with a can of bug spray and a cloth and sprays the entire entry of our room and wipes up. Except now, our room is full of fumes and smells so strongly of bug spray, it's making me feel sick. I had both balcony doors open and the wind was strong, but still, the fumes were stronger. I asked the guy if ants is a problem in every room, and he said yes, "this side of the hotel has ants, but that side doesn't". So I called front desk and told her about the fumes, and she curtly says (words seem nice, but tone was rude with annoyance), "What would you like me to do about that??...Would you like to leave the rooom while the smell dies down?" I said, "No, can you just switch us to a new room on the other side of the hotel where there are no ants?" She says she'll check and call me back. While I was pacing around the room waiting for her call back, I realized how dirty the room was. The floor was unvaccuumed for I don't know how long - it had an extremely thick coat of dust. There were dead moths by the balcony door. The hamper in the bathroom had a bunch of toe nail clippings in there - DISGUSTING. The room is not luxurious. The furniture and decor are old. The bathroom grout is cracked all over. The shower fixture is something you would find in a motel. Breakfast Buffet: The breakfast buffet area is swarming with birds. The guy at the table next to us said it best. "You feel like you're in an Alfred Hitchcock movie." There were birds perched all around all the guests just waiting for someone to get up so literally ten or more of them can land on your plates and peck at your food. It's gross and very UNSANITARY. These birds are fearless and will sometimes even go for it while you are sitting there eating. We, as well as other guests, were constantly keeping watch for them and shooing them away. The waiters aren't fast enough for the birds, so throughout our meals, we witnessed tables next to us covered with them as soon as the people left to get more food before the waiters could remove the plates. Granted these are wild birds that the restaurant has no control over (is it unlawful to put up some kind of a bird detracter?), but it makes for a very unpleasant dining experience for the guests, and I don't see the hotel doing anything to change it. The grounds: The grounds need maintenence! The signs around the pools and jacuzzis are all faded and barely legible. The walkways and steps around the pools are dirty, cracked and unmaintained. The outer walls of the villas need to be pressure washed and coated with new paint. The "luxury" villas currently look like apartments in a developing nation. I would definitely NOT call this a "luxury resort". It might have the facade of one (the lobby), but after my stay as a guest, I very quickly found otherwise. I just cannot believe the lack of care Fairmont gives this place, and the galls to charge as if it is a 5-star resort. It was definitely not worth it. I wish I took my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: lflower4
Reviews.Content: the renovations were more extensive than the website said, but altogether it was a very nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: destinationhunter
Reviews.Content: We went back and forth deciding on whether to stay at the Fairmont or the Four Seasons. Ultimately, we decided that a room at the Fairmont with a better view was preferable than a parking lot view at the Four Seasons (the price difference for an equal view at the Four Seasons was out of our price range). According to several reviews, the rooms at the Fairmont are not as nice as the Four Seasons, that being said, we had an amazing time at the Fairmont and the resort is second to none including the restaurants, pools, beach and staff. The prices at the restaurants were moderate (given that it is an expensive resort), and you can walk along the beach path to the other resorts if you want to dine there. We were upgraded and given a free bottle of wine at dinner on our first night. We were not dissapointed with the Fairmont. Additionally, the reviews about how bad the rooms at the Fairmont are don't seem to be accurate - our room was quite nice, spacious and very clean. They could use an updating, but really how much time are you spending in your room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at close to 20 or 25 Fairmonts and after being to Maui multiple times, it was high-time to try the famed Kea Lani! Hawaiian hospitality did not disappoint! Service Having just returned from Maui this past weekend, the experience was synonymous with Fairmont's high level of service. The service at the Kea Lani was similar to the Fairmont Masai Mara's ~ which has become my benchmark service experience. Being greeted by friendly and genuine valet and bell staff offering leis and a cool mango-guava concoction sets the tone for your stay. Details are not missed including a mini tour of the facility when you're brought to your room, as well as an extensive overview of the room's amenities and features. The staff we interacted with were 99% friendly and those we encountered more than once had excellent guest recognition, always greeting us by name asking specific questions about our day. Although this detail is somewhat expected at a resort of this caliber, the conversations were genuine and caring, unlike some other resorts whose staff just ask to ask, and don't care about the response. Grounds The grounds and buildings' Arabian-like architecture are stunning. Large grassy areas and strategic placement of the hotel's main structure and pools make for an expansive sense of space. Three pools offer kids and adults separate 'play' areas and the beach is just the right size with waves the perfect 'family' size for body boarding and other ocean activities. Included Most resorts in Maui charge resort fees, but Fairmont does not. Everything is included, from self-parking (first night free valet), to morning yoga, to beach umbrellas to guided outrigger canoeing. Renos Currently the resort is going through extensive renovations to all three pools and guest rooms. They finished the adult pool renos during my stay and I was among the first guests to indulge in the refreshed pool area. The renos don't make the pool look much different, but the new quartzite stones surrounding the area are lovely and don't heat up in the sun. Other Hints & Tips: - A lot of people complain about the hotel's internet charge. FYI - the Fairmont's free-to-join guest loyalty program offers members free internet access at any of their hotels and resorts worldwide, take the 3 mins to join to avoid paying $14.95 per day. - Yes, the food at the resort is expensive...but you're staying at a Fairmont Resort, what did you expect? There is a Safeway a 5-min drive away, the resort's cafe offers a host of sit-in or grab-and-go items and the Shops at Wailea (1-min drive from resort) has an ABC store and Whaler's General Store/Cafe with lots of food.
