The poolside bar's food is decent but not great (believe it or not, the Marriott's poolside bar has way better, fresher food). - The Kea Lani is an all-suite hotel (each rooms sleeps at least 4) with the opportunity to partition the spaces. Yes, the decor in the rooms is not the freshest out there, but they are renovating.... - Apparently, there are 5 complimentary washers and dryers at the hotel.... - The Fairmont's complimentary transportation/shuttle service (within Wailea) is such a fantastic perk (available at most fairmonts). We were driven to and from dinner every night. - The poolside cabanas cost between $75 - $100 to rent daily (include water, spritzer, pop, fruit, magazine...)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a Total Renovation”
Reviews.Author: cranstongoodfellow
Reviews.Content: I belong to the Fairmont President's Club; we stayed here not only because of that but because this property is one of only three in Wailea: the Grand Wailea (huge, many crazy pools and slides; maybe fun if you have kids - we don't); the Four Seasons: lovely, a little LA, but newly renovated and very nice) and then the Fairmont. While the Fairmont is technically the newest of the three properties, it has not been renovated since being built in the 80's, and it REALLY needs it. To their credit, Fairmont is renovating the pools as we speak - we booked an enormous, corner suite with an amazing ocean view and huge terrace for half price because of the renovations. But even the savings was not enough to make up for the general dumpiness of the hotel. The location is by far the best of the three hotels; it's the last in the row with sweeping grounds, large trees (some sort of pine, weirdly) and a lovely large beach - gorgeous. But the hotel is just so in need of sprucing (walking in the dark, cavernous halls was like being in a large concrete parking garage) that I cannot at this point recommend it. And even when they do upgrade it, the suite I mentioned above looked out over the beach, yes, but also out over the rooftops (hideous brown ones) of some structures below. Whose bright idea was that? Maybe if you are on a very strict budget that would not ordinarily allow you to stay at a property such as this, you might think it ok, but if you are accustomed to staying at Fairmonts and 5 star hotels in general, you will not be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: SKS4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and the Kea Lani. This was our 6th visit to the island and our 2nd stay at the Kea Lani. This is definitely our favorite hotel on the island. The rooms are unbelievable and the service is attentive without being stuffy. The hotel is undergoing renovations and we were a little concerned, but in true Fairmont style they did everything right. The rooms were discounted as they should be due to 2 pools being worked on all day long. It wasn't a problem because the hotel offered beach chairs and umbrellas at no cost. This was awesome. We typically don't spend the day at the beach, but will do so from now on. Loved it. They also provided updated details of the renovation on the website. It was nice they were so transparent. The service was exceptional. Everyone from check-in, to the folks at Ciao, to the guys at the beach and the shuttle driver were great. Details- The Good... -Rooms-by far the best on the island. Having a suite is so nice. And wow, that bathroom is huge. -Service- mentioned above. Tips were definitely accepted, but they didn't stand awaiting them as they do in some places. And everyone was just so friendly. -Grounds are beautiful -Free self parking close by -Luana Lounge for lava flows at sunset -Quiet and beautiful Polo Beach -Shuttle to shops of wail The only bad thing is the lack of wireless in the rooms. This is truly unacceptable at a Fairmont. In the age of iPads and laptops, this is crazy. We bought an iPad for the trip and had to go to the lobby to use it. Also, sign up for the presidents club prior to your trip for free Internet. They still charge which is odd. All in all, a fab place that we'll return to on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Large suites, great service”
Reviews.Author: lblahnik
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont while attending a wedding a few weeks ago. It was a great experience. Even though there is currently construction going on (they are re-doing the tile around the pool) I had a nice time. When I was there, only one pool was open, but to be honest,I didnt spend much time at the pool. The beach is great- there are plenty of chairs with umbrellas to reserve (I had no problem getting one) and you can check out a body board to surf the waves right in front of the hotel- a lot of fun. The suites are very large- the bathroom-- amazing. The decor in the bedroom/living room could use a little updating, but it's not totally outdated either. There is a refrigerator adn breakfast bar which is really useful. There is a (very pricey since it's Hawaii) 24hr grocery store not far away. The staff could not be more helpful or friendly. My only complaint is -no cell phone service or wi-fi in the room!! There is wi-fi in the lobby and there is a dial up connection in the room. Sign up for the Fairmont president's club online and wi-fi is free. Even though I didnt get to enjoy all of what the Fairmont had to offer due to the construction, I still had a great time. If you are planning on staying soon, dont worry, the construction is not at all disruptive (and I got a great deal on a huge suite). I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: malav08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and the rooms are large, with a separate living room and bedroom area. The microwave and small refrigerator are very handy, as is the free guest self laundry (washing machine & dryer) on every floor. The hotel employees were very friendly and our room was spotless, and included nightly turn down service. One minor thing they could improve would be to have wireless internet access in the rooms. It seems old school to have to connect via a wire at the desk and I could not have used my iPad in the room on WiFi (there is no way to connect a wire to an iPad) except that DH set up a wireless network for me with his MacBook Pro. Bring an Airport Express if you have one! There is wireless access in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SFmom88
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was great and me and my son loved the fact that we could leave our room and be on the beach in minutes. The room was amazing. We had a corner room with a wrap-around lanai. I love that all rooms are suites, which is very important when you have young children that nap. Also, when you close the curtains and doors during the middle of the day, the bedroom is pitch black- also great for napping kids. The suite has a living room, with an office area and tv and then a bedroom. The bathroom was large and had dual vanities. Everything was very clean and comfortable. We only had breakfast at the hotel but the breakfast buffet was great and had everything you could think of. The hotel is in the process of renovating its pools so we did not go in any pools but despite the renovations, our room was extremely quiet and we had a view of the ocean that was amazing. On the beach you can get an umbrella and chairs for no extra cost. My favorite beaches on Maui are not exactly kid-friendly as I prefer the beaches with bigger waves. Now that I have a kid, Polo beach was pretty good for his age (3) because the waves are small. Wailea beach is probably even better for kids since the outside reef keeps the water still but Polo beach is not crowded at all (which I hate about Wailea beach) so it is great to just get a chair and watch your kid play in the sand or play with your kid in the waves. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff/service were great.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest hotels I have ever stayed at. A true resort property. Everything from the size of the rooms, proximity to the beach, shops, golf etc, to service and restaurants was absolutely fantastic. This is not inexpensive, but absolute paradise. Highly recommend. Although similar, I prefer this over the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: hellomachka
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Orbitz for airfare, hotel stay at the Fairmont, & rental car. Service was superb and the suites were large and very clean. Another nice feature in the rooms were the 2 televisions, microwave, and fridge. We left the hotel at 5:45 am and needed towels for a snorkeling trip; the front desk was more than happy to provide them. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others as well as stay there again. The only negative is that 2 of the 3 pools were closed for renovations. However, the beach is on the property and friendly to swimmers. Snorkel gear and boogie boards are free to rent for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Luxury While in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TheScarlett
Reviews.Content: We had never been in Hawaii and my husband did considerable research. My only requirement was that I wanted to relax under an umbrella on the beach. We also wanted our 3 children to be comfortable and to be guaranteed a room close to ours. We found the perfect choice by staying the Fairmont Kea Lani in Maui and opting for a villa. We paid extra to be closer to the ocean and it was worth every cent. We had magnificent views, could hear the roar of the waves to lull us to sleep and could run out to walk along the shore spur of the moment at night. Our villa had two bedrooms, two extremely roomy bathrooms (as large as the bedroom!), a nicely equipped kitchen and living room all situated on two floors. We used the upstairs as the master because it had a very large walk-in closet and had a balcony/lanai. A wonderful bonus included in the villa is a washer and dryer which came in handy so that our family of 5 could always have a fresh bathing suits. The villa has a nice little 'plunge pool' off of the villa's furnished patio. We could have not asked for a better layout for our group! My only complaint about the villa itself is that washer was extremely noisy as if it wasn't in balance but I never got around to call to let management know about it. The beach is simply beautiful. If you want to use an umbrella on the beach you will be charged for it and they need to be reserved in advance (we quickly learned this the first day) but it is well worth this to guarantee that you won't be disappointed - if they were free they would go immediately I'm sure. You are also charged for any 'rentals' such as snorkels or boogie boards. I would have really liked it if they had had a bar set up near the beach because there were many times I would have liked a frosty drink but that is a small complaint. There a couple of pools - one large and noisy one for families (we never used it) and one quiet one for adults (our older girls used it in the afternoon when the wind picked up on the beach). One thing we really loved was this Caffe Ciao Deli on the property because you could dash in and get something to take out and even purchase items only found in gourmet markets. It was definitely an upscale deli! We ate breakfast on the property every day in the restaurant and it was delicious although the service was slow if you opted to order off of the menu instead of using the buffet. We could have saved money and cooked in our kitchen but really one of the perks of having a vacation is to not cook and to eat out every day. We did find out that if we had dirty dishes in our villa that the cleaning staff did them for us - a lovely surprise! We visited other properties (including the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons) on the island for dinner and always congratulated ourselves on really having found the best place to stay. It is a visually stunning hotel and the grounds are impeccably maintained. The staff was always courteous and helpful - I got the sense that they really cared about our comfort. We saw several weddings performed while we were there and honestly this is a wonderful destination wedding venue. And the tiki torch lighting each night is extremely charming - you have to see it at least once while you're here. Would I stay here again? In a heartbeat. Is it expensive? Absolutely but you are paying for paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Gorgeous Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: JK1117
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here over Labor Day weekend. The hotel is currently in the middle of renovations, but truthfully we didn't even notice, other than only having one pool open. The hotel was quiet -- the renovations may be a deterrent but if you are looking for a romantic place...stay here! There aren't as many kids! The sunsets from the beach are the best I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: DennisUSA
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. Sunsets are gorgeous. A short swim from the beach and you are snorkeling with sea turtles. But. For the price they charge you it is amazing they charge an additional $14.50 per day for internet access - either in the room or wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleeclub
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kea Lani a couple of times before and were not dissappointed. The accommodations are nice and spacious, the suite with the pull out sofa worked well for a few nights for the 4 of us. The beach is nice, pretty crowded, but not as jammed packed as in front of the Grand Wailea Theme Park crazyness. Snorkeling was very good in the cove in front of the 4 Seasons, but rent the gear in town - much less expensive. The reserving of the pool chairs with pool towels that are there by 6:30am and then not used for hours is very annoying. Not to mention the folks that are too lazy to pick up their used towels when they leave, the hotel staff is not doing a good job of staying on top of that as some of the other properties that we have stayed at. The restaurant prices are insane, way over the top. Even the deli isn't cheap, but a bargain compared to the other hotel eateries. We had a partial ocean view room, we did see the ocean from our veranda, which was spacious as far as balconies go. Higher floors would offer better views, especially of the sunsets. Staff was pleasant and cheerful, it was a nice way to ease into Maui before heading over to the Kaanapali side for a week. The Kea Lani is always a good 2nd choice to the 4 Seasons, which is still our favorite at Wailea. I believe that the Kea Lani will be doing pool renovations starting at the end of Aug, so best check directly with the hotel what all will be affected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for young families....”
Reviews.Author: dcwanderlust2
Reviews.Content: Yes, the kea Lani is expensive - did anyone think anything nice on Maui would be cheap? I have no problem with the expesne. My only critisim would be for the Kea Lani to increase prices such that they could avoid the silly nickle and dime stuff like charging for cabannas. The Pros: * The villas are fantastic, just amazing. They are expensive, but the location and amenities are well worth it for young families. The plunge pool worked great for our 3 year old, and the older kids had easy access to the beach and pool. * The selection of restuarants and shops were really great. Liked that we could have fine dining and simple fair at our discretion. * Loved the beach. About as private as a beach gets in Hawaii. Waves fun but not too much for little kids (most of the time). * Place remains well maintained and not 'tired' at all. Cons: * The free lounges by the pool get snatched up by jerks who put there stuff down and then leave for hours at a time. Resort should have a better policy of monitoring this issue. * Charging for cabanas is nickle and diming guests. Do what the four seasons does and simply make them free.

Reviews.Title: “great, and not”
Reviews.Author: cmsknyny
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, and a gorgeous setting, beach, pool, etc. the rooms are very large and well priced. The problem is in the pricing of everything else. The food is OUTRAGEOUSLY priced, ($30 breakfast and $28 sandwiches), the pool canopies are $150/day, etc. It just seems wrong to price so high, I can understand a premium for luxury, but this is over the top. The gym is also so small for all the poeple, really needs to be redone and expanded. Of all the Wailea properties, this is certainly one of the best- The 4 seasons looks very stuffy, The Wailea is crazy with kids. If they would rationalize the pricing, add some more activities, and expand the gym - this could be great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, large rooms, nice beach”
Reviews.Author: winecountrytravel
Reviews.Content: Room size was great for our family - 11 year old twins. Beds are very comfortable. Love the beach and nearby snorkeling. Kids loved the water slide. Partial ocean view was just that - partial only from the Lani. Room looked out a neighboring codos. Request high floor. Rent your snorkel gear at a snorkel shop, not the hotel. Hotel seems a bit dated, but there is a renovation about to get underway. Generally we prefer smaller places with more character, but this was very nice. Booked through Costco - liked the package rate. Not sure would stay there again, but would recommend as a great option. Many guests must snag the best pool chairs at the crack of dawn. Also stayed 2 nights at Kapalua Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kojc
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Fairmont Kea Lani. The suites were spacious, clean and well equipped with everything you would need. The pool and beach areas were fabulous plus you didnt have to run down to the reserve beach chairs at 5am! They also have a courtesy shuttle to different areas in Waliea which is a nice extra. Great time, great fun and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodstar40
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is an excellent hotel for singles, couples or families. Great location in Wailea for driving to other areas of Maui or staying within the Kihea/Wailea/Makena beach areas. The Fairmont suites are very spacious and comfortable (great beds, bathroom/shower, patio, kitchenette, living room). It was very peaceful and quiet at this hotel. The quiet/adult pool was so awesome and the family pool had a fun water slide -- adults enjoyed it as much as the children. Great beach - although it looks small it was never really crowded and there was plenty of room to swim or grab a chair for sunbathing. Great sidewalk path goes behind the hotel and neighboring hotels which allows you to walk/jog along the beach and enjoy beautiful views. Take advantage of the hotel activities such as yoga, water aerobics, and definitely do the paddle canoe experience. The canoe guides took us out to a reef where we swam with turtles and could snorkle to see the beautiful reef just left of the beach area from the hotel (no experience with canoeing or snorkling necessary - perfect for beginners). Nick's Fish Market has excellent food and the deli was convenient as well. We enjoyed everything about our stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: circlegirl15
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent had said the Fairmont was the place for us and she was right. First, the hotel is beautiful. It has a plantation-era feel with enormous lobby, big white pillars and open spaces. View of the Pacific, especially at sunset, is breath taking. Second, the staff is unbelievably nice. Everyone there is pleasant, helpful and friendly. Our rooms were impeccably cleaned twice a day. Wait staff in all the outlets were great with our kids. Next, the room set-up-perfect for families. We are a family of four and fit well in the large two-room suite. Enormous bathroom was easy for four to share. We all enjoyed the big tub. Very large, wrap-around lanai (balcony). I agree the main deficit is the TV situation. The living room had a nice flat-screen set, but the one in the bedroom was small. The pool arrangement is also well thought out. There's the adult pool and then another two-level pool that has a kiddie pool on the lower level and a slide on the upper level. The setup naturally places families with very young children on the lower section and those with older children, or wanting more privacy on the upper portion. The food at the pool was expensive but they have a well-priced kikei (kids) menu available with many options for $6-$8. We took advantage of the advice to stop at Costco right out of the airport and were able to stock our wet bar with snacks and drinks for the kids. The beach is right there and I recommend renting an umbrella early in the day and enjoying the ocean before the winds kick in. The surf gets pretty rough as the afternoon progresses. We visited some of the public beaches, but always came back to the one right at the hotel. The convenience can't be beat. All in all, we loved the place and would highly recommend. Our main complaint would be that there's no casual option for dinner at the hotel. We loved the full-out breakfast buffet, especially the Asian section which included our family favorites-miso soup and steamed pork buns. It's pricey, but if you eat well there, you can get quite a lot of activities in before you need lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all-suites resort with perfect beach and great service.”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler5210
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this all suites resort. Our room had a phenomenal layout with a tremendous amount of space, incredible bathroom with tub and walk-in shower, 2 sinks, place for bathing suits and sandy items to stay. There was a fridge and microwave and room to make breakfast and lunch. Balcony had a table with 4 chairs AND 2 chaise lounges. As we had a corner room we had another two chairs and small table. The pools were very nice but the highlight is a magnificent beach with chaise lounges being complimentary. We knew that beach umbrellas were expensive so we brought our own which worked great. They also have very nice lawns with chaise lounges spread out. Water is brought around as is pineapple at 3PM each day by the pools. Service was great and we were called by name by multiple staff members. We would highly recommend eating at Ko and strongly recommend against eating at Nick's Fishmarket. They also have a nice Italian deli for gelato, sandwiches, etc, which is convenient although a bit expensive. Overall one of the best resorts I have stayed at and is a must for those wanting large rooms with great balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: rumbeam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in an Ocean View Suite. I wasn't lured by the spaciousness of the room but ended but loving it. It's great to have two separate living areas vs one in traditional hotel rooms. The bathroom was spectacular. The first night we stayed in 218, and the balcony was right up against its neighbor leaving zero privacy. We asked for a new room the next day the the staff was happy to oblige. The cleaning crew did an awesome job each day. The adult pool was very comfortable -- great place to read a book all day. The beach is wonderful -- clean, roomy, etc. We pretty much avoided the on site restaurants due to excessive cost, but loved the cafe for easy takeout. A few tips: 4 pm by the adult pool is half price appetizers but ends very quickly. Definitely sign up for Presidents Club before you go and ensure it's noted on your reservation -- if even for the free wifi. If your rental car is bigger than mid-size, self parking will be a challenge due to stall sizes and very narrow lane. All in all, the Kei Lani is very comfortable with touches of lux, a great value. We'd stay here again for sure. P.S. Wailea is very sleepy so if you want action packed night life, you prob want to stay farther north, i.e. Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: BalmainSydney01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from eight nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani and were delighted with our choice of hotel. The Four Seasons was a little too grown up for our requirements (we travelled with our 20 month old) and we tried to check out the Grand Wailea when we were there but were going to be charged a valet parking fee so gave it a miss. For a family, an all-suite hotel is such a good option and the space in our room was excellent. We had an excellent view of the car park! but were high enough to enjoy some mountain views. The lobby is impressive and the staff polite and helpful. The cafe/deli is a godsend for families as it sells fresh milk, single-serve cereal and other basics so that you can cater in-room for breakfasts and lunches. The microwave in the room is also excellent - we often had take-out from the Ko restaurant or the deli and were able to warm it up for our son the next day. The pool options are great especially for a long stay and it was nice to know that there was an adult pool option for those who wanted some time away from the families. The wading pool was excellent, the beach also lovely. There is lots of space for little ones to explore at the resort - lawn areas, fountains and the beach walk. The food at the resort is pricey but we were expecting this. All in all, a wonderful resort for families on a long stay. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Kea Lani was pefect for our family!”
Reviews.Author: Family-Vacation-Time
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as a 38 yr. old mom and wife...my husband is 40 and our children are 9 (daughter) and 12 (son). I will review the hotel and share some tips on how we made our trip economical but with touches of luxury. The reasons I chose Kea Lani over other locations was the 1 bedroom suite (separate living room from bedroom - a little privacy from the kids at times), it's price ($340/night), and it's location being in Wailea (upscale and quiet). The Kea Lani definitely has a very impressive entrance and lobby/terrace area. We were greeted with leis and in addition my children received beautiful necklaces. We booked a garden moderate room which did happen to have a partial view of the ocean and mountains ($340/night). There is a refrigerator and microwave in the suite. We also purchased (next time I will just pack it) a single burner and skillet (purchased from ACE Hardware) and food from Safeway. The hotel suites are in line to be updated the end of August. Presently they are tastefully decorated in a green/mauve color scheme. The new decor will be more of an earthy color scheme. Everything was very comfortable with our unit. The cleaning crew did a wonderful job of cleaning every day and also stopped in for a turn down service in the evening. My only gripe would be our socks did get dirty from the carpet. My husband and son's gripe was that we did not have wifi for their iphones...they said you would need a room closer to the lobby. We did bring a laptop and the internet was $14.95/day. The large balcony was a nice plus as we enjoyed many meals overlooking the beautiful views of Maui. There are 5 complimentary washers/dryers at the Kea Lani which I did utilize several times (you do need soap which can be purchased at the hotel or Safeway for $1.50 for a small box of Tide). We always had breakfast in the room, except for one day enjoying the breakfast buffet for $100 for our family. We had lunch in the room as well unless we were on traveling trips to Haleakala (ate at Kula Inn - great views and reasonably priced) or Hana. We made dinner in our room as well except for 3 nights. Those nights we ate at Matteo's Italian restaurant ($75/for our family and we had dessert - outside with great views looking over the golf course), picked up great baked chicken and pulled pork and avocado sandwiches at the Whalers General Store at the Shops of Wailea, and ordered pizza (Dominios - Delivered to the hotel - not my favorite but the kids loved it!). We also enjoyed the ice cream waffle cones at one of the Kea Lani stores and at Lammperts (sp?) at the Shops of Wailea. The pools were very nice and my children enjoyed the water slide. We didn't use the pools but 2 days since we have a pool and water slide at home - so we were more into the beach. We brought our own snorkling equipment which we used at Wailea Beach and saw many fish and a very large turtle, and lots of coral. The surf at both the Polo and Wailea Beach were fun for the kids to use their boogie boards and ride the waves. It was convenient to park your car yourself if you didn't utilize valet parking. We enjoyed many evenings sitting in the lobby overlooking the pools and ocean and listening to a fantastic guitarist and had a drink (about $15/drink). If you like to walk, there is a wonderful paved walking path between the ocean and the resorts that extends from the Kea Lani passed the Shops at Wailea. The Kea Lani is a keeper, Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service in Maui”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler783
Reviews.Content: This hotel was expensive, but it was worth it. Within 10 minutes of reaching the hotel lobby, we were greeted and taken care of by 6 different staff members. The suite was great, beds were comfortable, and they had many swimming pools to choose from. We had an issue with our first room and they quickly changed and UPgraded us to a new room. The beach was also great. Food at the restaurants and room service was also really good. Yes, this is a costly place, but to get the best it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Service is Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Tgrbait
Reviews.Content: Every employee at the Fairmont should be commended for how well they take care of all of their guests. This was a great hotel for honeymooners, special occasions, or families with children. It is large enough that you feel like you are the only ones there. The views from all over the resort are beautiful. All of the restaurants were excellent. The cafe has great coffee and on the run breakfast...a great option to the sit down breakfast which is $25+. There are several pools, one with a slide for the kids and kids at heart; one with a swim up cocktail bar; one just for adults. There is also a beach bath that is great for morning runs, evening strolls, and connects to the 4 seasons resort, and Marriott resort.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Luxury with No Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Mohammedyu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an oceanview suite. After considering the Four Seasons, the Grand Wailea, we decided to try the Kea Lani as a compromise - not as expensive as the former, and not as humongous as the latter. That is what it turned out to be. There were some concerns because some reviewers noted lines for the pool and the drab furniture. On the furniture, the reviews were right -- some of the furniture was drab and could use some remodelling, but the fact is for a beachside resort, it appears they need furniture that would last all the sand and seawater that guests would bring to the room. Overall the suites were adequately appointed and there was no disappointment. The room had a small sink, microwave and empty fridge, which was great for my son which allowed us to keep all his food in the small kitchenette area. One minor issue is that the beds appear to be exceedingly high. My 4 year old son sleeps Asian-style on the floor so it took him a bit to adjust to the high beds (after some unfortunate falls). The pools are great. There are generally three pool areas and during the times we went for a swim, it was not excessively crowded. There is a great water slide, but they didn't allow my son to ride it as he was too young. Breakfast was included in our rate and so we had the breakfast buffet every morning at the same restaurant. Not much variation between different days in terms of food offering, which made breakfast not necessarily something one looked forward to. Generally I spent the five nights at the Fairmont thinking that something would come up that would make me regret not having booked at the Four Seasons next door. Thankfully, nothing of the sort happened, and so I am relieved. A close call happened during check out when the lady at the front desk was apparently having some difficulties with the computer system and apparently triple charged my card for the same USD 800 for my room tab. Thankfully, the manager, a Mr, Matt Smith, stepped in an assured me that the matter would be settled after I left and that he would check with the hotel's bank to make sure that I was properly charged. I have now returned home and checked with my credit card company and it turns out all the false charges have been deleted. I think if the charges were incorrect, this review would have turned out to be very different. The only detraction of note was that on the second day of our stay, my wife reported cockroaches in the room (I have to say I never saw any). She duly reported this to housekeeping and neither she nor I saw any cockroaches thereafter. On the plus side, the Kea Lani has a couple of Lincoln Navigators parked out front, which are used as shuttles to the nearby Shops at Wailea and hotels around there. My mom used them to go to the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Take My Nickels'n'Dimes, But Please Don't Nickel'n'Dime Me!”
Reviews.Author: srp99
Reviews.Content: I'll just cut to the chase here. The Fairmont Kea Lani is a nice enough property, though clearly it is a refurb of some other hotel chain (given "Kea Lani Hotel" is still stamped on the sliding doors). The lobby is beautiful, as were the spacious bathrooms and the grounds in general. The valet/car service/bell staff were equally wonderful as well. Now for the not-so-goods: 1) The rooms are just a tad dated; not what I expected given we were a) in the prestigious Wailea area and b) this was The Fairmont! 2) We seemed to have a minor issue with little mosquito/gnat thingies in our room. Possibly due to being oeanside (well, at least partially)? 3) The food at Ko unremarkable, though the price is quite remarkable, if-you-know-what-i-mean! 4) $10/hr for a beach umbrella - from what I hear, all the resorts do this, so guess I can't whine too much; but, please, just up my daily rate to cover this cost...what is this daily resort fee for? 5) Water - looks like it used to be complimentary (emphasis on the "used to be") 6) When we asked about a late checkout, we were told "Sure, it's $150 to stay until 3p" "Any other options?" "No, so sorry, no other options"...Really? I wasn't born yesterday. Of course, we asked someone else and they secured an hour extra for us for no charge 7) Day 3: Wake-up call at 5am. "Uhh...I think you have the wrong room; we didn't ask for this wake-up call!" "Oh, okay, please disregard!" Please disregard? Can someone please tell me how to DISREGARD a 5am wake-up call??? 8) My personal favorite. I had a raging headache, so called the front desk to see if they had any aspirin/ibuprofen. "Yes, we sure do, but it's only for emergency purposes. Now is this a REAL emergency, or are you just looking for some aspirin?" What the...?! Did she think I was on a recreational scavenger hunt for aspirin?! All-in-all, I walked away feeling like the Fairmont Kea Lani was not up to Fairmont standards...and more of a "wannabe" Wailea-esque resort...with some much-needed upgrades in service/personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...Great Location...You will need a car 2get Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: quonlove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for vacation and it was beautiful resort. I believe all the rooms are suites with large upgarded bathroom. The rooms are upgraded too with a seperate living room from the bedroom which was very nice. As everyone states it is pretty expensive for meals so we went to walmart which was only like 20min drive in the city and purchased snacks and cereal for breakfast and snacks so we would buy lunch and dinner. There are cheaper resutants not too far like Outback and the Grand Waliea mall has some cheaper places to eat and there is a Italian/pizzarian family placelike right across the waywith excellant food and a great price. The staff was very helpful in booking tours if you ask for discounts they will give it to you because they have special rates. However, you will need a car to drive to the tour it self and to get everywhere on the island which we found out once we got there. Every tour we did was well worth the money but the 4tours we did total $1000 for the both of us. Though expensive it was worth it we did the helicopter, laual, zipline, and surfing. Bring allergy medicine too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: dkauffm1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for our 10 year anniversary and stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Before buying , we had shopped for several weeks looking for the perfect place to stay as well as sifting thru review after review trying to decide which resort we wanted to stay at. Not only did we find paradise the moment we stepped off the plane, we found it again when we arrived at the Kea Lani. This hotel is absolutely beautiful! The suites are very nice and clean. We stayed in the moderate suite, which was about 850 square feet. The room furnishings were were nice and comfortable. The bed and pillows are so comfortable that you want to find a way to get them on the plane and bring them home with you. The staff were so nice and accommodating. Our room was cleaned every morning after we left. Each time we came back, our bed was made and we had fresh clean towels. Huge bathrooms. They also have evening turn down service. You couldn't have asked for better service. The grounds and pools were beautiful. Very well maintained and manicured. Abundant supply of clean towels and lounge chairs. They have 3 separate pools to choose from. The beach was breathtaking at sun rise and sunset. Very clean. We couldn't have asked for a more romantic vacation while in Maui. Maui is heaven on earth and the Kea Lani is everything we hoped for and more. This is a beautiful resort that we will be going back to next year and the next.

Reviews.Title: “better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: spoiledinaz
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is sandwiched in between some impressive resorts and it distinguishes itself from the others with its staff and overall outstanding experience. From the moment I arrived, my family was greeted warmly in its beautiful open-air lobby. The view to the ocean below was breathtaking. We were checked in expeditiously and given a quick tour by the bell staff. Our room was a deluxe ocean view suite (all the rooms are suites). Our room had a very spacious bathroom and the bed is more comfortable than my own. The parlor was spacious and well-appointed. The dining options are all wonderful, we experienced all of them and enjoyed each one. Nick's is as good if not better than its reputation. Kea Lani restaurant has an outstanding buffet and the service to back it up. The concierge staff is outstanding. We will be going back to the Kea Lani, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “No Ka Oi”
Reviews.Author: SandyBeaches09
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani is paradise. There is only heartfelt genuine high level service and accommodations. Everything is impeccable. We have stayed here at least 8 times over the course of 15 years and have always experienced consistency and pure pleasure. Negotiate directly with the hotel for longer stays and better rates. Remember these are all one bedroom suites, so the kids have their own space. You are worth it!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious comfort”
Reviews.Author: Netmaj
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Kei Lani and we will return. The hotel upgraded us to an ocean view room on check in. The one bedroom suite is spacious with a lovely lanai, and the bathroom is luxurious. We also had a microwave and frig in the room which was handy for quick breakfasts and lunches on beach days. The public areas are all, without exception, attractive and well maintained. We ate in several of the restaurants and the service and food were great. We appreciated the turn down service at night and the helpful beach staff. We had absolutely no complaints and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bruce_donnovan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon trip to Maui. From the moment we pulled the car in, we were welcomed with aloha. The check in was easy and our lanai had a great view of the two main pools. The hotel grounds are beautiful and make for easy picture taking. Every employee we met had a smile on their face and was willing to help us. We would definitely go back more often if it were a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: WarrenJames
Reviews.Content: It was my son's 9th birthday the day we arrived in Maui and experienced a "Fantastic" vacation from the time we arrived at Fairmont Kea Lani Maui. We were greeted with leis and drinks, and smiles by everyone. It was a great feeling after a 5hr flight from SFO. Without any additional charge, we were upgraded to an ocean view suite and since our flight on our departure is at 10 p.m., they offered a late check-out until 8 p.m. Our marble bathroom was huge and housekeeping made sure my son's bed which is a pull out couch was made by 7 p.m. Everybody is so nice with a special mention to Elise who provided us with helpful information for our 8d stay in Maui. My son wanted to go back and stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: holly32999
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Kea Lani. Grounds were beautiful, rooms very nice and suite arrangement worked very well for our family of four. Flexibility of kid/adult pools was a plus and Polo beach was very private. Wailea beach up the path was much busier. Pool service at the Kea Lani was very good, and there is decent snorkeling off Polo beach, although it requires a little swimming out to. Stayed in Wailea for the first time, really enjoyed the quiet feel of the area as well as the weather. Took in Hana, Haleakula, Iao needle, Lahaina, and Big Beach. Our best meal on the island was at Sarento's on the Beach (Kihei). Also, Nicks Fishmarket at the Kea Lani (sister restaurant) was quite nice. Matteo's in Wailea is a good choice for a casual dinner (pizza/pasta).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: TPAdiver79
Reviews.Content: Our stay and entire experience at the Kea Lani was excellent. My wife and I traveled to the Kea Lani on a wedding package and we were married at the resort. There were two nights in a deluxe oceanview suite included in the package, and we also purchased an additional three nights at the hotel in a lower room category. Upon our arrival, we were cheerfully greeted and given leis. We were upgraded to the deluxe oceanview suite at no extra cost and without even asking. The suite was nicely decorated and very roomy. The bathroom was just wonderful, with a large marble walk in shower and garden tub. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets of high quality. There was a flat screen LCD television in the living room of the suite but only an older box television in the bedroom. A small refrigerator and microwave were also in the room. I thought the furniture in the room was of good quality, however the patio furniture was extremely cheap. I would have thought that a hotel the caliber of the Kea Lani would invest in better patio furniture. The service that we received from all of the hotel's staff members was excellent, from the bell staff, to the courtesy car chauffeur, to our wedding coordinator. It was customary for the employees to greet you with an â€œAlohaâ€� when you walked past them in the halls or on the grounds. Speaking of the grounds, they were picturesque and very nicely manicured. In all, a great location to have a wedding. I especially liked the adults only pool, as I don't much care for being around screaming children splashing all over the place when I'm trying to relax. The pool chairs were comfortable and staff members routinely walked around to take drink orders and bring by cups of water (and pineapple). At the beach there is an attendant who sets up your chairs for you. I also liked the relative privacy of Polo Beach. It is not connected to the main Wailea beach, and although all beaches on Maui are public it does not seem as crowded as Wailea beach. My wife was very impressed with the staff and the quality of her bridal hairdo that she received at the Juvenal hair salon at the hotel. The pacific terrace was a beautiful place for a wedding and the staff was great during the cocktail reception that we had following the ceremony. Nick's Fishmarket was where we had our reception dinner, and everything there was also excellent (I'm posting a separate review of Nick's as well). The worst part about staying at the Kea Lani was having to leave. I would suggest anyone thinking about staying at the resort to join Fairmont's free President's Club, which gets you things during your stay such as complimentary internet access and use of golf clubs (which rent for about $50 at the local courses in Maui). I know that a lot of people compare the Kea Lani to the Four Seasons, and I'm not sure that it's really a fair comparison. A comparable room at the Four Seasons is about double the rate at the Kea Lani, so it's understandable that you're going to get more for â€œfreeâ€� such as cabanas and beach umbrellas. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Kea Lani again, and am especially looking forward to going back and seeing their renovations to the pool areas after they take place this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - outstanding family getaway experience”
Reviews.Author: tawana23
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I read the mixed reviews about this property. So i'll start with the things that I agree with - the place could use an upgrade in areas like paint, carpeting, flat screen tvs (this only mattered during the Ghana vs. USA soccer match yesterday). There are also areas of the property like the lanai's (terraces) that are not as clean as they could be but.... Having said all of that we had an OUTSTANDING time at this property. I Loved the room, our view (a garden view overlooking the whole property plus a view of the ocean from the terrace), the amount of space between the living room, extra closets, huge bathroom, snack bar area. The grounds were immaculate, the 3 pools were perfectly set up - the kiddie pool was great although the Grand Wailea kiddie pool with sand tops this one. Polo beach was so clean, the lounges, the awesome main lobby, the 1.5 mile walking path - I could go on about the property. Every person on the staff was excellent from the point of check in to check out. We traveled with our 23 month old daughter and I reserved a pack and play and would you believe it was in our room fully set up when we arrived - if you travel with children you know this is not always the case. They even set up a diaper genie! There were no early morning cleaning service experiences where you have to ask them to come back, in fact they cleaned our room at 6pm one evening by our request. When we checked out not only did they allow us to stay until 2pm (our flight was leaving at 9pm) but they offered a hospitality suite to use while we stayed on the property for showering/changing once we checked out. The Concierge team was amazing in knowing not only the basics of sights to see but they really catered to our specific interests in traveling with a toddler. It was truly a peaceful oasis, beautiful property with outstanding service. Having visited the 4 seasons and Grand Wailea while there, no question the Faimont was the best choice for us. I would give this place a 5 but they honestly should upgrade a few elements to be considered a 5. Finally Wailea was also a good choice for us but it is definitely out of the way from most off property restaurants and other towns. It is truly a place to simply rest and relax, towns like Lahaina on the north west side have more liveliness to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - 8 days wasn't enough”
Reviews.Author: discontenteddiva
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani is ideally located in Wailea, Maui. The grounds we really well appointed. Our garden view suite was clean, large and very comfortable. Yes, the furniture could have used an update - but the layout was perfect. The bathroom with a deep soaking tub, double sinks and rainwater shower was one of the highlights. Our four-year old delighted in taking long baths prior to bedtime each night. The buffet breakfast was of excellent quality and we sure appreciated that our daughter could eat for free. The package we booked through Alaska Airlines included a daily food and beverage credit and that helped take the sting out of the resort pricing. Being a member of the Fairmont president's club got us free internet access and a daily newspaper - an additional perk. We spent most dinners out and was pleasantly surprised with the Tommy Bahama's restaurant at the nearby shops at Wailea. The hotel had a free shuttle service to the shops and nearby restaurants, so that meant we could enjoy some wine with our dinner - worry free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TannerandDi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Fairmont June 14th for eight night stay. Upgraded to Corner Oceon front with wrap around Lanai. Room was amazing and gave us plenty of room for my wife and 2 teenagers. Great meal at Nicks and enjoyed the pool and beach. Great snorkling and saw turtles. We loved the space we had in the rooms with multiple seating areas on the lanai. Staff was excellent. Dane at the pool bar is great for local info.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the beach.”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBradley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 5 times over the last few years. Our last visit just a over month ago. We have stayed in Ocean front suites, partial ocean view suite, the 2 bedroom Ocean Front Villa and twice in the pool "walk out" suites. All the rooms are suites with large bathrooms and a decent bedroom and a living room with pull out couch. Our kids all sleep together on the pull out and they are totally happy with that. Now we are "sold" on the pool walk out rooms and will not stay in any other room. We usually take another family or extended family and have them stay in a suite there too. The walk out to pool rooms are " Specialty Rooms" and they sell out very quickly. In my opinion they are the best for families like us with little kids. My kids are 9, 6, 4 and 5 months. So "technically" one of us is in another suite. This is our favorite hotel in Maui. It is comfortable and in a beautiful location and the beach is right out your door. Literally, if you stay in a Villa or a walk out room. More later about why we prefer the walk out over the Villa. The hotel has a fabulous views from the lobby. Like a postcard beautiful. The minute you get there you feel good. They give you a lei and a cold drink. And an warm Aloha welcome. OK.. so the low down.. as I put it. The Good, The Bad and The Ugly: The good: I love this beach! It has never been crowded even when the pool is packed the beach seems to never have too many people on it. You can walk from the hotel and especially the rooms I mentioned above. This is the best part. You walk on some grass down a cement path down about 15 stairs and Volia! Sand! It's heaven! The pool is not huge like some of the other hotels in Maui. We like that. It isn't small either. I call it manageable. I feel like my kids can go down the water slide and run, um I mean walk back up the stairs and I can feel like they are not going to get lost. There is a swim up bar and the same staff seems to have worked there forever. All super friendly and super kind to the kids. The restaurants have excellent food, but I prefer to eat with a view while in Hawaii and none of themon site have much of a view. Nick's Fish Market has wonderful service but your view is of the pool. I think a peek a boo of the ocean. I would go there when it's dark out so you can see all the tiki torches lit up all around the property. That makse it pretty. If you go at Sunset it is not worth it. But it is fun to be outside at sunset because a man runs around and light the tikis. He is hawiann and clad in a little get up and that would be it. the kids love it. He literally runs from tiki to tiki with a torch in hand. Like a pied piper with a bunch of little kids chasing him. The other restaurant is called Co. Good food, stinky view, outdoor cafe style with very uncomfortable chairs and wobbly tables. However, excellent service. The breakfast is actually in another area. Again, decent food. Average buffet but no view. Lot's of little birds fly around because it is open. Watch your plate! Lastly there is a store cafe with pizza parlor. It stinks. Plan to eat at the overpriced buffet unless you want to eat off property. Eating off property means rounding up all the kids, car seats and stroller.. so we grin and bear the "no view" for breakfast and lunch. Oops... almost forgot there is a small restaurant by the pool. Food is ok but limited menu. It gets "old" fast. Like one day and you are done with that food. The kids of course think it is super cool to eat food at the swim up bar and will order a million smoothies if you don't stop them. Waliea has a ton of good restaurants so the concierge can help you get a table at Serrento's on the Beach (Nick's sister restaurant) or Five Palms for breakfast. Also fun to walk to nearby hotels. The food at Four Seasons is good food, but again I don't like the views. A fun and beautiful view restaurant is Humuhumunukunukuapua'a at the Grand Waliea. I would not eat at the shops of Waliea unless you are there shopping and happen to be hungry. We like Tommy Bahama's restaurant when we shop. Every one raves about the restaurant downstairs "Longies" but after several tries we prefer Tommy's. Cheese Burger in Paradise is another restaurant at the Shops (a few blocks from the hotel) and every time we have had poor service there. The bad: Hate to say it but the rooms need updating. This is not a huge factor for us so we really don't care that the room looks the same year after year. They did repaint the lobby recently though. lol Restaurant service is excellent but all other service is pretty average. The spa is not luxurious at all. If you want to Spa.. stay at the Grand or even The Four Seasons. The shopping in the hotel very limited and not fun. The Ugly: The time we stayed in the beachfront Villa was well.. so bad I can't write about it or you might not want to stay at this hotel. It was gross. I forgive them for the unclean, broken down, stinky ( I mean it) Villa because they made it up to us. Don't they get it that anyone paying for a Villa expects it to be really luxurious? I would rather sleep in a hut (minimal and simple with no phone and no TV yet "Clean") at Kona Village then these smelly Villas. We stayed away from the hotel for quite a while and then came back for another try and now we are hooked on the "walk out to pool suites" which really are walk out to pool and run to the beach rooms. So since the hotel made it right after a disaster week in the Villa. We still love this hotel. They should just tear down the Villas and redo them. Really they should. It would be nice if they gave all the other rooms a face-lift too. Ok.. there you go! Have fun and don't forget the Sunblock. They ran out at the store of the kind we like (spray on) and they don't have many choices for diapers or wipes so stock up. The ABC store at the "shops down the road" doesn't have good diapers or wipes either so bring more than enough! Ok.. good enough. Book it now.. but save a "walk out to pool" Suite for me!

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel choice in many years of world travel”
Reviews.Author: teachgeron
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in May. There to celebrate my daughters fortieth birthday. Problems began at check in when staff person indicated we were booked into a suite with king bed when I had reserved two double beds. Problems occur all the time in life but it is how they are handled which makes the difference. Staff person after much hesitation indicated they could make the "change" but could not tell me how long that would take. Her attitude was one of annoyance and unconcern. Took a seat in the lobby and room was available in about 20 minutes. After some touring, returned to room to take a bath only to find that the closure for the tub was not working. Spoke to Elise at front desk who presented with annoyed attitude and reluctantly offered to send maintenance person. Declined this offer and requested a change of room. After some time the room was changed which was quite interesting since the hotel was far from fully booked. My basic review of this hotel can be summed up by The Good, The Bad and the Ugly. 1. The Good - Beautiful physical structure, luscious grounds, lovely pools. There is free self parking on site within close walking distance. The layout of the suite is excellent, microwave and refrigerator are an asset. The bathroom had been renovated and had a great soaking tub, two facebowls, plentiful towels, very nice bathrobes. The furniture on the balcony is adequate for watching the beautiful ocean view. The beach is wonderful and very private. 2. The Bad - The hotel seems to be living on past reputation. All of the furniture in the rooms and the public areas are old and seedy looking. The electronics should be an embarrassment to The Fairmont business. The televisions are big box, small screen appliances; unbelieveable in 2010. Even moderately priced hotel chains have big screen LCDs. A complete renovation is more than in order. There is no elegance or luxury to this hotel. It is overpriced for what is offered. 3. The Ugly - Except for the bellmen, the staff was not friendly are welcoming. The hotel did nothing to acknowledge my daughter's birthday. We did not feel special, valued or appreciated during our stay. Our visit did not offer the luxury or comfort one would expect from this category of hotel. As a result of my disgust with this hotel, we spent most of our time traveling and spending money throughout the rest of Maui which we enjoyed tremendously. It goes without saying that I would encourage you to look elsewhere if you are seeking a luxury hotel with quality staff and service in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation at the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: Rubybiercans
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Fairmont. We looked into many other hotels on Maui, including some located in Kaanapali and other hotels in Wailea. After walking through the grounds of the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea, we were very pleased to have chosen the Fairmont. As other reviews have noted, the Fairmont's beach is more private (and nearly as big) as the beach in front of the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. We also preferred the grounds/lobby of the Fairmont, which seemed more relaxed and less "over the top" than the two neighboring hotels. A few additional impressions: 1. Service was very good and seemed genuinely friendly without being too much. 2. This is a great choice for families traveling with young children. Our (approximately) 5 year old ate free at most hotel restaurants and spent several days in "kids camp" which she loved. There were a number of families traveling with children of a similar age, which was nice for our daughter when she played in the pool and beach. I don't think that the number of children at the hotel would detract from an adult-only vacation - we would be happy to return even if our daughter was not traveling with us. 3. As others have noted, the rooms are quite large and represent a great value compared to other hotels in the area. We were in a Deluxe Ocean View room on the 4th floor and were very happy with the room, the view and the price we paid (through Costco travel). Yes, the decor of the rooms would benefit from some updating, but on the whole the rooms are extremely nice and on par with other luxury hotels that we've visited recently. 4. The grounds and pool are beautiful (lots of shallow areas for kids) and the beach is the best we saw in the area. 5. The hotel's location in Wailea is great - close to many good (but not cheap) restaurants and shopping. In addition to the good restaurant offerings at the Fairmont itself and other hotels in the area, we particularly enjoyed watching the sunset over dinner at Capische and listening to live music on the porch at Mulligan's on the Blue (which had surprisingly good food for an Irish pub). For a less expensive change of pace, one of our best meals of the vacation was at Amigos in Kihei - a modest restaurant in a strip mall with some of the best Mexican food we've had in a long time. We also really enjoyed the lua at Old Lahaina Luau in Lahaina - if you are choosing among luas, do this one!

Reviews.Title: “Our second Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: boysXs3
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Was debating between 4Seasons or Fairmont. Glad we chose Fairmont. I enjoyed the fact that it had more land and everything was spread out. You could always find some where quiet to go. The other resorts in Wailea seemed very busy and compact. The service by the adult pool was great. Cold cloths, pineapple slices and someone always around to take drink and food orders. You can also have your own food and drink by the pools. It was a very romantic spot. My hubby and I went down to the beach at night with wine at about 9pm and were the only 2 on the beach. Ate at all the restaurants and was not dissappointed with anything. Nick's was great and the service was FUN. Rooms were very clean and I did not have a problem with the decor. We booked a ocean view and they upgraded us when we checked in to a deluxe ocean view. We had a LCD tv in the living room and an older one in the bedroom. Did not watch TV at all. I can't wait to go back and bring my kids. I loved it. For those who are worried about the decor, get over it. Fairmonts are known for understated elegance. That is what the Kea Lani is. They are fixing up the pool floor areas putting in new material. I cannot wait to see what it will look like. FABULOUS.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay...but the Kea Lani needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerJournalist
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2nd stay at the Kea Lani, the last time was 5 years ago. Overall it was a great stay, but like a lot of the previous reviews state, the hotel needs some renovation, it needs to bring back the sparkle! May is a great time to go--the hotel was very quiet, so we were surprised at the high fee for an upgrade. But what was more disappointing was that our honeymooning friends weren't upgraded either. I don't get it--if you want the guests to come back, and the hotel is half full, why can't you upgrade? However--that said, the rooms ARE nice, I'm mainly talking view here. The large suite-style rooms are great, especially useful for families. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. And yes--large bathroom! If we're nit-picking here, yes the rooms could use a freshening-up, the lanai furniture needs to be replaced, and it's time to remove the large TV cabinets and replace them with plasma/LCD's. You can't call yourself a luxury hotel in 2010 and still have box-set televisions. But did I come to Hawaii to watch TV? Nope. A great feature of these rooms is the microwave and refrigerator. Stock up at Safeway before you arrive! Turndown service could be improved--I remember when we stayed the first time we received a treat--chocolate, flower petals, a Hawaiian prayer etc (wasn't a honeymoon or anything) I believe it's the small details which set luxury hotels apart, and it just seemed that some of these details were lacking. Service was great. Not over-the-top Four Seasons great, but still there are some wonderful people who work here and they were always kind and helpful. No problems with housekeeping, they were excellent. Also--there are free washers/dryers, just ask and the front desk will tell you where they're located. They're nothing fancy, but they do the job. We didn't use the concierge. Valet guys are great too. Pools-Three large, clean, beautiful pools. (And I hear they're getting worked on soon?) Great family pool, adult pool, and for those of you who want a swim-up bar, that's there too. Service is good by the pools too. That might be different during high season, but we never had a problem and the staff was efficient. Beach-Great beach. Family-friendly...small waves, great for babies/toddlers. The great thing about this beach is that yes, it's smaller than Wailea Beach next door, but it's isolated from other resorts, no sharing w/other resorts, and the public tends to go to Wailea Beach. It's just as pretty--just not as busy. However, charging hotel guests for a beach umbrella is absurd. The chairs need to be replaced and service at the beach needs an improvement. Not bad--but def not as good as it could be. But it's a beautiful, clean beach., with spectacular views...yes, even sunset views. We had a great meal at Nick's Fish Market. Fantastic service and food was delicious. Buffet breakfast in the morning was fresh and tasty too. Yes the birds are annoying, but try to sit further inside. The hotel's hands are tied because the state protects the birds, there's nothing they can do. But it's not like dozens of pigeons land on your table---the workers shoo them away and it's small birds that usually...usually...wait til you're gone. A bit annoying, yes, but breakfast was delicious. Fitness facilities--Needs improvement. Definitely not up to par for the size and quality of the resort. They need a larger space and newer equipment, cardio machines, yoga space, etc. However, it was clean and everything was functioning well, so it did the job. Just not as good as it should be--like there's no one staffing it, handing you water/towel, cold washcloth, etc. Oh-a note to walkers/runners--the hotel is in a great spot for walks and runs--Wailea is beautiful. Not a busy, touristy area---it's just perfect for a run at dawn, which we did every morning along the ocean path. Other random things: --self park is free! no hidden fees there, and no, it's not a long walk to the hotel. --the pool areas and gardens/ landscaping, etc need some work, but I hear that they are renovating and polishing up those areas. However, the pools themselves don't look like they need work, they were clean and sparkling, so don't think the pools are a dump--I think they're just trying to spruce up the whole area. And in general, the grounds and gardens are stunning, and the workers do a good job of maintaining it! --some reviews noted drab hallways, chipped paint, etc. Yes, this is true--while the structure of the facility is gorgeous--white Grecian-looking, open air lobbies/fountains, etc the halls to the rooms need a freshening-up. But please don't let a less-than-sparkling hallway ruin your vacation, it's hardly noticeable and frankly---just a hallway! --Make sure you join President's club before you leave for your vacation. You get freebies like free in-room internet. -they have paddle board rentals for $40 an hour, $80 for 2 hours w/one hour lesson. We wanted to do this but never got around to it. (they have other rentals too) --there is a good little cafe/sundry shop if you need it. Pricey, yes, but if you want to grab a Corona on the run, a sandwich, or some advil, gelato, or a good cup of coffee...there is a place to do that. We did not bring our 3 small children with us, but we saw many families enjoying their stay--and they were not loud by any means. If you were there on a romantic trip you could easily be far from children at the adult pool area, and the beach is large enough to have your own cozy area to yourself. Because the grounds are so spread out, there are lots of areas to lounge. Overall we had a great stay--no problems at all. But was it over the top? No. A pleasant stay, no real complaints, but it could be better. If they put a lot of TLC into the place and bring the "Wow" factor back, and kick the service up a notch, I'd probably stay here again. I prefer the Four Seasons, while my husband is perfectly happy at the Kea Lani. And because we received such a great deal on a package to stay at the Kea Lani, there was little debate...especially if we'd save a few bucks in this bad economy! Feel free to contact me with any questions. Mahalo!!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with our stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: skline312
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Maui at the end of April 2010 was our first time to Hawaii. We had trouble deciding where to stay (in the end, it was between the Four Seasons and the Fairmont) and I am so glad that we picked the Fairmont. Our room had a deluxe ocean view and was located on the 6th floor. We couldn't have been happier with our view of the resort, pools and ocean. Our suite was roomy, clean and very functional. We could have paid slightly more at the Four Seasons (right next door) for a nicer, more up to date room, but we were glad to have to extra space and a large balcony to spend time on. My only complaint about the room was the bathroom. We had a nice big tub, but no jets and the nice walk-in shower didn't have any type of step or ledge to rest your foot on to shave your legs. (I know, this is petty). The hotel was quiet at night and the staff was all very friendly. Everyone said "hello" to you while passing in the hallways and everyone made us feel welcome. The pools were all very nice and not over crowded. There were times when you maybe couldn't sit exactly where you would have liked, but you were never without a chair. The staff at the pools were great - they brought cold water, slices of pineapple and cold washcloths around every so often. We spent the majority of our time at the adult pool which was very relaxing. Breakfast was included with our stay and the buffet was great. The variety of food could please anyone and everything always seemed to be fresh. It was nice to sit pool side and enjoy breakfast every morning. The only drawback of sitting outside was that the birds were pests. It you left your table or plate unattended for only a second, they were eating your food! The staff tried to keep them away, but didn't always get there quick enough. We liked that we could come and go from the hotel as we wished and didn't have to vallet park if we didn't want to. Although the parking lot was a bit of a walk from the hotel and the parking spots were extremely tight, it was nice to not be nickel-dimed with daily vallet charges. There is a deli type restaurant in the hotel which we went to on multiple occasions to get a snack, a sandwich for lunch or even dinner one night. We loved that this was available to get good food that was a little bit more reasonably priced than the hotel restaurants. We felt very at home at the Fairmont and completely loved our trip to Maui. We felt that staying in Wailea was the best spot on the island for us. It was more upscale and not as "touristy" as some of the other areas. Other areas of the island can be really windy and Wailea seemd to have great weather when even when it was cooler or windier on other parts. All in all, we were very happy with our stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani and will probably stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LT2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful week at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We planned the trip about 6 months ago and brought along my 2 yr old and my mother. The fact that every room is a true one bedroom suite, made it easy to travel with a child and additional family. Upon arrival, we had a small run in with the front desk regarding our reservation and the rates. According to my husband-who is also a President's Club member- the manager was a bit rude and seemed annoyed with his questioing of the rates. We booked a Partial oceanfront room and were upgraded( at a small fee) to a Deluxue Oceanview. We;ve stayed at the Four Seasons twice before and you really can't compare the room size for the money. Once we got passed the front desk, we were onto enjoying the beautiful grounds of the hotel. All the staff, concierge and pool side attendants were quite nice and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool area and the private beach. The pool area was perfect for our two year old and also fun for us- as we could venture up to the swim up pool bar and enjoy some adult time while my daughter played with her grandma. The resort is expensive-but you should not come to this area if you are not willing to pay. I believe Wailea is a much more upscale area compared to Kihei and Kaanapali. We felt it was worth paying a little more to not feel like we were being overrun by teenagers and millions of kids. We will certainly stay here again and look forward to the updating they will be doing on the rooms this fall. This is the best kept secret in Maui-you could never get a one bedroom suite at the Four Seasons for what you pay at the Fairmont. The grounds are beautiful and expansive with three pools each geared towards either adult only or family. The beach is also perfect as the water is calm. Overall the Fairmont is a really nice resort and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cookiesbjr
Reviews.Content: I just returned this week and am ready to go back to Maui already! I will definantly stay at the Fairmont again because it was beautiful and the people were delightful, everything was perfect! The food was wonderful, the service was prompt and everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was very clean and the beds and pillows were wonderful! I can't wait to go back! Barbara from Mooresville NC

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but could use some renovations”
Reviews.Author: TravelAllOver123
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd time at Kea Lani in 9 yrs. Same furnitures in the rooms and balcony. After flying in all day & night from Boston, at check in they tried to give us a pool view room depite booking a "Deluxe Oceanview Room". Mind you were returning guests and Fairmont Presidents Club Members! We were even married on the property! We complained and they gave us a suite overlooking the ocean. Don't really know why they did not give us this room to begin with. We booked some dining reservations and luau with the concierge. One of them actually seemed annoyed with our simple request, but overall most of them were somewhat friendly. The crew at Cafe Ciao Deli are just fantastic and genuinely friendly. The pool crew were also great. Kids loved the pool and the waterslide. If it was not for pool, waterslide and washer and dryers we would probably try the Four Seasons next time after being so distastefully treated at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: eschwets
Reviews.Content: Went for a 40th birthday trip with my wife. Initial ocean view room was on second floor with better view of pool than ocean, but after asking at front desk, Tami, who was extremely helpful moves us to a much better view from 4th floor. Nice room with sitting area and large balcony, huge updated bath, but older appearing furniture/decor. A/C would not cool room much below 70 and my wife likes to sleep with it freezing so a small problem. Staff and grounds were wonderful. $23 for a breakfast omelet was a bit much.... Lots of small kids during spring break period, but did have 'adult' pool area which was quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Dated resort aging beauty”
Reviews.Author: phxdoc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several fairmont resorts in the past The Kea Lani is an aging hotel It seems that fairmont is Trying to pass it off as an equivalent to the four seasons. It falls short on multiple counts . We had an oceanfront suite .In theory that would be an upscale room. Wrong, it was 80s decor low pop corn ceilings with a ventilation system that barely functioned. I went to the desk as we left for dinner to tell them that the room was uncomfortably warm .We returned and the room was unchanged.I called again what happened next was unbelievable. An " engineer" showed up and told me nothing was wrong . I asked him to measure the temperature it was over 80 degrees. . He changed the settings on the thermostat to go lower than you could set it on check in . After 5 hours the room was habitable. Note to guests do not let them save a/c costs at your expense.Complain and they might do something. Another annoying habit is the constant nickel and diming. An umbrella is $ 10 an hour or $45 a after you paid big bucks for the room. It is just plain rude. Net Net would I recommend the place no.Would I return no.

Reviews.Title: “very nice family vacation”
Reviews.Author: luau2010
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I went to Maui a little bit scared by bad reviews I read before we left. For NO reason! Very nice hotel.We we're greeted with lai's when we arrived and taken to our room with explaining all the stores and rooms we passed on the way there. YES, the hotel needs some TLC. The lanai furniture are worn out and a little paint here and there wouldn't hurt.The rooms are very nice and clean and have TV and DVD player, which helps a lot if you travel with kids who get up at 5 in the morning, because of the time change.Take DVD's. Yes there are lots of birds by the breakfast restaurant, but they usually invade your table when you leave. The beach is right in front of the hotel and you have to pay for an umbrella (45$) which is kind of steap, after we already paid 6000$ for a week. You don't have to pay for a pool umbrella, but make sure you reserve one, before you go to breakfast. The pool guys do a really good job and provide you with fresh towels all the time. They need more service for the food by the pool. It takes a while until you get it. If you're kids are super hungry, go to the deli. They have good pizza and you can take it to the pool. Nicks fishmarket is a must. They brought a "bed" next to the table made out of 2 chairs including bedding for my 4 year old, which I'm still speechless about. They are super nice and the food was awesome! We booked the sunny side breakfast package through Costco, which includes a rental car and saved us a bunch of money. If you want to save some more, go to Foodland in Kihei or Walmart to stock up the fridge and provide your kids with inexpensive Sand toys and boogie boards. Join the presidents club before you leave and you get free internet access. It's free to join.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms, all suites and villas, are huge. It was great when traveling with kids. The pool was nice and the beach very secluded. We'd heard a lot about the Grand Wailea and how great it is for kids. We walked over there and it looked like an amusement park--loud, huge and teeming with people, like disneyland. In comparison the Fairmont was an oasis. Housekeeping was amazing as well. We'll be back. It is a great location, a great beach, and our kids loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: SKandVL
