Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights during our 11 day trip to Hawaii on our honeymoon. The rooms were large but that's about it. I rather have quality over quantity. The furniture and decor is ancient looking. The hallways/corridors were dirty and beat down. We were put in the basement because the price we paid from Orbitz was $650 per night and the front desk lady told us that because of the low rate we paid...they can not move us to a higher floor without paying more. I mean, if I had known at time of booking that I was going to get stuck in a basement room and get treated like second class citizens during my honeymoon, I would have paid $650 and stayed in a deluxe suite at a Marriott or a Westin and we would have gotten the first class treatment. The concierge lady, Noki, was so rude to my husband. She rolled her eyes and gave him the nastiest attitude when he was asking for information. We expected a lot more than this from a 5 star hotel. Or, so they claim.

Reviews.Title: “Once you've stayed in the suites at The Fairmont Kea Lani Maui you'll never be happy with a mere hotel room again”
Reviews.Author: CitationExcel
Reviews.Content: We stay annually in a Kilohana Suite at the Kea Lani. These suites face the beach and have large wrap around balconies with additional views of the resorts three pools and grounds. I don't understand the reviews saying the rooms aren't updated. We come every year and our suite was updated from even a previous update when the hotel was sold to Fairmont. New mattress, new lamps, new paint. The hotel lobby has also been repainted with much of the white replaced by earth tones. The lobby bar furniture has been replaced as well as breakfast area furniture and all of the pool furniture has been dramatically upgraded with padded wicker lounges. MUCH more comfortable and no more backaches. Our only complaint was the conversion of Cafe Ciao (the restaurant not the deli) to a restaurant called "Ko." The menu at Ko is far more limited and the food didn't come close in quality of preparation to Cafe Ciao. This wasn't just our opinion - virtually everyone we ran into had eaten there once and never returned and the common refrain was that people used to be able to eat at Cafe Ciao two or three times a stay but one meal at Ko and you're done with it. The restaurant, normally requiring a reservation when it was Cafe Ciao ... had tables available and never looked more than 50% full. We ate off property more than usual and at Nick's Fishmarket more than usual as well. That's the hotel's loss. Otherwise an incredible place and we will continue to come back. Staff is wonderful ... a lot of old familiar faces which speaks well of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Perfect”
Reviews.Author: paris4awhile
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and had a great time. The rooms are very nice, the pools are fantastic and the beach is gorgoeous. The kids loved the waterslide and the swim up bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and updated. The kitchenettes are spare...a very small fridge and microwave. The restaurant choices are slim, especially for families. Caffe Ciao's take out is pretty decent. The big drawback here is that everything is expensive, almost 2x what you would pay for similar things on the mainland. When you eat at the Fairmont, you are not only paying for the food (which is very good), but you are also paying for the convenience, the view, and the ambience. Another note to families. The rooms come with either a King bed, or two full size beds that are very very small. The pull out sofa is also small. We asked for a rollaway bed to give everyone more room and that worked really well. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Suites”
Reviews.Author: MastermindDSM
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Fairmont is geared more toward adults, although they have a waterslide, etc. If you have kids, you probably want to go to the Grand Wailea next door. The Suites were very large and well equiped. the Lanai's were large as well. The Concerige helped with our suseet cruise which was fantastic. Took off from the the Maui Prince south of the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “People stay at places like this to be seen and pay a lot for it”
Reviews.Author: SaskNess
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice don't get me wrong but the beach was terrible...and that is why we came to Hawaii. So many better beach front locations at way better price. I don't recommend getting food from the store by the main restaurant either, apparently the Fairmont doesn't have a standards. For $7.50 USD you can get a slimy luke warm breakfast sandwich that will make you want to throw up. After two bites I couldn't do it and threw it out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel on Maui, Hi”
Reviews.Author: tuanadaisy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful surroundings, secluded beach, wonderful food, peaceful and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend to anyone to stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: danjoKihei_Maui
Reviews.Content: Last Dec. I called the Fairmont Kea Lani Maui to inquire about the Kamaaina rate for my wife and I for our 39th Wedding aniversary. I was ready to book 2 nights stay when the receptionist told me that they will only accept a Hawaii Drivers License. I told her that I have a Hawaii State Picture I.D. She told me that is not acceptable. I tried to explain to her that the requirments to get a Hawaii State I.D are the same as a Hawaii Drivers License except you don't take a drivers test. Besides what about people that don't drive? She said that is the Hotel's policy and that was that. I then asked her to get a manager on the line and she said that their wasn't one available. She then connected me to the managers voice mail and I left a message in which I never got a return call. The next day I called again and the same receptionist answered and at that time she said that a manager was not available so she connected me to a different managers voice mail and I left a message but never recieved a return call again. The day after that I called the receptionist to get the corporate phone number in which I left a voice message and never recieved a return call. I have lived in Maui for 4 years now and work for a good company and make a very good salary. I have never been treated this way by any business until now. I do know what customer service is all about and I think that the Fairmont Kea Lani Maui could learn some lessons on that subject. Are they so important that they do not need local residents business? Especially in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “It's Wailea. Nuff said.”
Reviews.Author: sunshineseeker425
Reviews.Content: We had dreamed of staying in Wailea for years, but could never afford the rooms here. Well, thank the bad economy because we managed this year. We got an amazing deal for a week's stay in a suite. We were upgraded to an ocean view, and had a lovely, but distant, view of the ocean over the gorgeous grounds. The other reviews say plenty about the nicely appointed suites and baclonies. We had two young children with us, and there was plenty of room for the adults to enjoy the room and lanai while the babies slept. The roooms were great, if maybe not as posh as I would have expected for the usual rates at this hotel. But, we're spoiled by timeshare stays. The beach and waterfront trail were wonderful, as were the pool and grounds. The staff was amazing. They figured out when nap time was and managed to avoid making up our room at that time, even without being asked. The first day, they discovered my son sleeping and somehow managed to make up the entire room without waking him up. I know I couldn't pull that off. And to top it off, we never had small bills, and could only tip on the last day. Even so, our service never suffered. We tried to make up with it with a good tip at the end. The food on site is pricey. The deli had ok stuff, but the only thing I really liked there was the pizza. The casual restaurant was one of my favorite places. Nick's Fish House has somehow managed to disappoint me every time. I probably won't go back there. Make sure to walk the waterfront trail, visit the other resorts, and splurge at Mamma's Fish House. Overall a wonderful vacation and I hope we can afford to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Kea Lani was delightful”
Reviews.Author: MelissaMcCoy
Reviews.Content: As I sit here in my Signature "Kilohana" Suite, watching humpback whales come flying out of the water like giant torpedoes, I am once again in awe at how wonderful a stay at this hotel can be. All the rooms are suites at the Kea Lani, and I LOVE these suites (Signature) with the extra square footage in the suite, the bigger balconies and more views! I especially love laying in the comfy bed looking out to a perfect Wailea ocean and listening to the sound of the waves on the shore. I have been here for 3 nights with many of my staff and their families for our annual company weekend. We call it our McCoy Travel holiday party, always planned in January after the holiday rush before the winter rush (February - Spring Break). It's a perfect time of the year with cooler nights, less wind, flawless mornings and spectacular sunsets. Oh, and the whales! We all enjoyed mouth watering dinner at Ko's on Friday night. It is great to have everyone together including the kids. We spent Saturday and Sunday lounging around the pools, swimming and listening to the humpback whales song underwater (in the ocean) and letting the stress of the last very busy 4 weeks just melt away. On Sunday morning, I rented a kayak and ventured out on the placid ocean hoping for a whale encounter of the close kind :) A mom and baby did come by fairly close to me and it was a thrill. Sea kayaking on sit on top kayaks in the morning hours here is stellar. I had 2 excellent turtle sitings and gave my upper body a good work out (my arms are sore today!). Last night I enjoyed Nick's Fish Market and met fantastic people at the bar. Nick's is known for creative food and amazing service. It never fails, that I meet the most fun and wonderful people whenever I go in. I order the "original" escargot (it's not on the menu, you have to ask for it by name). Soaked in garlic butter with a pastry puff over the top. Yum Yum (I just got hungry again). Well, it's time to head to the office. We say, a bad day on Maui is better than a good day anywhere else! Going to work, although we are so very busy these days, is a joy. In the "old days" they use to say Maui No Ka Oi ( Maui is the best). Now they call Maui the Magical Isle. These both work for me and have for 35 years. From our beautiful beaches to the top of Haleakala at 10,000 feet, and everything inbetween, this is a lovely island in a stunning chain of Islands. The Islands of Aloha, that have had me smitten since the day I got off the plane September 12, 1974!

Reviews.Title: “For Business ok, Pleasure go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: amennyc
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at this hotel 5 years ago. Same old tired place. Dated TV's, phones, furniture, attitude, etc., Why I go to Asia for my vacations. Hawaii has no clue about 2010. Was here for business. Have also stayed at the Fairmont property in the Big Island. I prefer the Maui location of the two. It's not as bad. As a President loyalty member I noticed that it's a curse to even mention it. The don't even consider an upgrade. Even if you have the coupons. Regardless of the hotel occupancy. The hotel insults your intelligence by giving you the worst rooms. If you ask to change, it goes downhill from here. Yes, they are kind and "friendly" as they play this game. Sad to see what used to be an honorable chain go downhill. If you do go to Maui, there are way to many options. As a previous, reviewer noted, do yourself a HUGE favor and stay at the Four Seasons next door. You will be sorry you didn't. That is truly 5 start, not a wanna be.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: bryce623
Reviews.Content: You will love this hotel. The bathrooms are as large as some hotel rooms in other parts of Maui! Fab walk around shower, huge soaking tub and double sinks. Sitting room and double lanais. This is a great property. Adults only pool and nice beach with access to boardwalk. Love Cafe Caio, the deli is fantastic. We stayed at this hotel so many times over ten years, we fell in love with Maui and bought a condo down the street. Can't say enough about Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: thefamilytraveler007
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel went above and beyond service when ever we needed something be it extra towels, foam pillows etc. I'd like to give credit in particular to the staff at the front drive they were helpful and great whenever we had a question or needed a recommendation. Also our housekeeper was great our room was spotless even with a two year old leaving a trail of crumbs in our living room. I read some reviews before going about the condition of the hotel on this website and frankly was concerned . Our room was a little worn, but everything and everyone made our stay really nice. We are sure to return we also stayed the Marriott down the street and even though I am a loyal Marriott customer(platinum) I don't think we will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A year later and same OLD Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: pdxlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in 2008 for business/famiiy vacation and stayed once again in October of 2009. We were traveling with small children so we decided to stay there once again as all of the rooms are suites. If you're looking for a large room to accomodate a family this hotel is an acceptable property. If you're hoping for a hotel befitting the Fairmont name I think you'll be terribly disappointed. The property is beautiful and well maintained but the entire resort has old tired feel to it and the rooms feel like they haven't been touched since the 1980's with worn carpet, beat up furniture, and outdated electronics. To make matters worse, despite the fact that the hotel was at about 50 percent occupancy and we are Fairmont Presidents Club members, they put us in possibly the worst room on property. It featured a wonderful view of the parking lot, cigarette smoking pit, and the hum of air conditioners. We ended up paying for an upgrade but were shocked that they wouldn't offer a nicer base room considering the fact that the hotel was so empty. We travel a30-40 days a year and stay at Fairmont's on occasion and I think it's deplorable what they are doing to properties with such a fine name. You have a certain expectation when staying at a Fairmont property but unfortunately current management seems intent on milking the good name and letting the resorts fall down around them. If you're looking for an elegant property with an amazing staff, spend the extra $100 per night and go next door to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Kea Lani was a fantastic experience.”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler20102010
Reviews.Content: I visited Maui for the first time last summer, and my trip was unforgettable. The Fairmont Kea Lani was the by far the best choice for a trip with family. The hotel lobby is all outdoors overlooking the beautiful pool. The beach is about a two minute walk away, and great for snorkeling (we saw sea turtles!). They have a couple of different restaurant s for dinner (all which were fantastic). Also, the room service as well as the deli/market were just a great. The free breakfast buffet every morning was a perfect start to my day (they had absolutely everything!). The suite I stayed in was huge, and overlooking the island. It was relaxing sitting on the balcony watching the sunset. This hotel was perfect for an extended family trip because it was not to loud, but had enough action going on for everyone. Overall, the Kea Lani was a fantastic experience for all, and when I go back to Maui (which hopefully will be soon) I'm staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rdie_Mark
Reviews.Content: We are just back from the Fairmont Kea Lani and the suite we had was out of this world (normal suite) with huge bathroom, living room, bedroom and balcony big enough for a party with an ocean view. Other reviews stated that the rooms did not have flat screen TV's but I have to say given the standard of the rooms I cared not a jot. But best part of the hotel has to be the staff, it is very hard to get service at a level required for a 5 star hotel and not be fussy or stuffy but they managed it perfectly and nothing was too much trouble. Only very slight negative point was the cost of eating at the hotel but I suppose that goes with the territory and there are lots of options outside the hotel. Tips would be to use the hotel shuttles for local trips as they are tip only and also for longer journeys from Wailee to places like Lahana car hire is a must as it is over $100 each way. Also enroll for the Presidents CLub (Fairmont Loyalty Club) before you go which is FOC and you get free

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas treat”
Reviews.Author: jacknmacksmom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Kea Lani and once again it did not disappoint. The rooms are wonderful, even though all we could get was a partial ocean view. I was very happy to see that the hotel now has coffee makers in the room and a microwave and fridge. I know they want people to eat at their restaurants, but these things make my stay more pleasant overall and more likely for me to come back. Check-in was quick and the staff are overall very friendly and attentive. The resort is not cheap to stay at, and lunch generally ran us nearly $100 a day for four (that is simple fare around the pool). Still, the food is good and fresh and if we wanted there were cheaper alternatives out there. We chose to hang out close to home and pay a premium. There was a Christmas buffet that was offered while we were there and it was quite good. Also, Santa arrived by outrigger on the beach and met with all the kids on Christmas Eve. That was a nice touch. This was the first time we used the Keiki Club for our two children (5 and 6) and they loved it. I would have preferred to see a bit more outdoor play, but with lots of kids I can see the rationale for keeping them in a safe and contained environment. This was also quite expensive, but what a wonderful day we parents had lounging in the peace and quiet of the adult pool. Highly recommend. My only real complaint, and honestly it's minor and somewhat petty in light of real problems, is the pool chair system or lack thereof at the resort. If you want you can rent a cabana for an outrageous sum of money, or hang out right next to the cabana in a free-of-charge lounger. However, getting a lounge chair is next to impossible. The official line is that you can't hold chairs and if you do reserve some, you can't hold them for more than two hours unattended. There is nothing more frustrating than taking your kids to the pool for the day and not being able to sit near them when they swim. All around are empty lounge chairs with towels indicating that they are being used. However, they sit empty all day sometimes. We grabbed a couple chairs one day not even realizing someone had "saved" them. He and his wife showed up THREE hours after we had been sitting there and demanded we give them back to them. As if they had actually invested any time in using them. I say, first come first serve. If you leave, you forfeit. That should not be a problem if everyone else is under that same system. I would love to have the best seat in the house too, but that only works when you pay for them. Free chairs should be open to all. That, or get some more chairs. At the Four Seasons next door you can stay in a cabana or lounge chairs free of charge - or as free as anything is when you pay the amount of money both hotels charge for a room. I mean for $700+ a day don't you think a lounge chair or cabana should be thrown in for good customer service? I hate being nickel and dimed. Still, don't want to end on a negative. It was a lovely stay and I plan on going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmfitz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui and stayed at the Fairmont and we loved it. The staff was friendly and the location was great. It was right on the beach so you had the option of the pool or the ocean. Our favorite restaurant was Nicks Fishmarket it was one of the best meals we had there. Keep in mind it is expensive to eat and drink there but when we go away we like to enjoy and not worry about prices. You can stop at Costco or Walmart which is right outside the airport and stock up which would save you some money. We highly recommend this hotel is was a great family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: meglara
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for 10 days in November for a family vacation. In the group was myself, husband and 14 month old daughter, my parents and my husbands parents. We had 3 rooms all next door to each other in the M series overlooking the gardens and adult pool with a view of the ocean. The rooms were spacious with plenty of amenities for a family, huge bathrooms, bedroom & living room and the lanais are spacious with seating for 6. It was the perfect spot for a family vacation. The pools were clean and warm with plenty of seating all around - we spent the majority of our time in the kid pool area. The pool service was great with a large menu. Polo beach is beautiful and perfect for kids to play and adults to relax and tan - not overcrowded at all. Great snorkelling and plenty of marine life - including sea turtles! The restaurants were all tasty with great service, and the cafe was perfect for breakfast and snacks. The hotel has great proximity to the local mall and the next town. There is a boardwalk along the ocean that passes right by the hotel which is great for a early morning walk with the kids or a late night walk to check out the nightlife at the other hotels. Overall we had a fantastic trip and would definitely go back to this hotel! While in Maui, check out the Old Lahaina Luau - great experience. The town of Lahaina warrants a day & evening to walk & dine. The road to Hana is long and windy but some really amazing sights (black sand beach, blowhole, waterfalls, etc) - allow a whole day for this trip. The town of Paia was our favourite with some really neat shops, great local food, and the beach at Waimea is awesome to watch the surfers. Check out the crater - pretty neat sight.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: TLCGolf
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in Maui and we had a discounted rate. The rate was $225 for partial ocean view but we were upgraded to a full ocean view. If you want an unobstructed view of the ocean, ask for the highest floor (5 or 6) so that the tall palm trees do not interfere with the view (not that it's bad either). We saw whales from our balcony breaching. The hotel has a beach and is quite nice. If you are going to snorkel, try to go south side of the beach and south the rocks where you may have chance encounter with green turtles feeding. Staff is wonderful and attentive. Rooms are clean, although slightly dated. However, the suites are spacious. Beds were wonderfully comfortable. Did not try the restaurants on site as we took advantage of having a rental car and drove to the nearby town of Kihei for all sorts of restaurants. If you like golf, it is close to Wailea and Mekena. Definitely, try Mekena North Course....view is actually much better than Wailea golf course. Can't wait to go back to Maui and definitely would stay at Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: shazl55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Fairmont for our xmas/new years vacation with our adult (21 & 25)girls. We had 2 suites that were partial ocean view. We definitely could see the ocean and had a decent view, but we could not see the beautiful sunset from our terrace. If we ever return to this hotel I think I would spring for the ocean view although I don't think my kids would care. The rooms/suites were very roomy and lovely. The bed was extremely comfortable and the housekeeping staff was top notch. They never disturbed us and our suite was always cleaned when we got back and at night the beds were always turned down and room cleaned. The hotel itself is beautiful and well maintained. The staff was very nice and very accomodating. The conciemrge staff was very helpful and there were plenty of them. There are 3 pool areas. One is just adults the other 2 are for all. There were a lot of kids there but it was not a problem. Most were well behaved and having fun. It is a little tricky with the chairs at the pool although there are a lot of chairs. You have to get down at the crack of dawn to scope out a good lounge. Then you put some stuff on them and go to breakfast. They have a 2 hours rule but I never saw that enforced. You could always get a lounge at the beach but umbrellas at the beach cost $45 per day. The pool umbrellas are free but are hard to get and don't really block out the sun. They could use more help at the pool but the workers there are really nice and attentive when they are available. The beach is also very pretty and they keep it very nice. The hotel is expensive so be prepared to spend $$$. The drinks at the pool are a fortune and don't have much alcohol in them. We ate at two of the restaurants at the hotel Ko the first night which was very good and Nicks for New Years eve. Nicks had a priced fix menu with good selections but the price was crazy at it did not include drinks. The food was quite good though. All in all the hotel was great and we would definitely consider staying there again if we go to Maui in the future. They are supposedly doing a renovation this year so when that is done I'm sure the hotel will be amazing. It is in need of an update although we found it very comfortable and beautiful. If you go you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes this hotel great”
Reviews.Author: alaska7133
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful and really makes this hotel great. Without dedicated hardworking, caring staff, where would a great hotel be?

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbalz20
Reviews.Content: The resort was awesome, great ocean view, friendly staff who would go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable!! Sure the food is pricey but where in maui is it not. Rent a car(free self parking) and drive to big beach in Makena~ AWESOME!!! get a bananna split at Ko restaurant---not on menu but excellent, had one every other night for two weeks!! I would go back in a heartbeat..no complaints and we travel a lot...great pool, good beach, exceptional service and great ocean view room!!

Reviews.Title: “Truely A White Heaven”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Kea Lani, which I found out translated to white heaven just blew me away. It was a beautiful hotel in Maui and when my husband and I return to Maui, we will definitely stay here again. From the moment you drive up to the hotel to the moment you reach your room, you will be blown away by the service. We were offered mango/guava juice and cold face towels to cool off and promptly brought up to our suite. The lobby and basically the whole hotel is open except for your room. Everytime we left the hotel, we were greeted by our names and in a friendly manner. Staff even came by after the first night to our suite to make sure everything was ok. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. Everything from the size of the suites, pools, service, cleanliness, gardens and centerpieces all over the hotel were beautiful. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the beach. It was really small, but that's ok. Not a big deal. Also, I love the fact that internet, laundry and self parking was free. Love the Italian bakery downstairs too. Great lattes and sandwiches. My husband and I had a wonderful time! If you decide to stay in Fairmont Kea Lani, we hope you will have an excellent time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, exploitative prices”
Reviews.Author: Traveler6_2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, with children, stayed at the Fairmont over Thanksgiving. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site. Unfortunately, we were not as charmed as many of the other guest-reviewers. Pros: Very convenient and excellent beach. Fantastic weather. These are features of Maui, however, not the Fairmont in particular. The resort grounds are open and not as crowded as some of the neighboring hotels. Cons: The furniture in our room (ocean view) was old and knicked. This is not "Hawaiian natural," it is just plain old. The upholstery on the couch was noticeably stained, and the carpet was dingy. The mattresses are not best of class, left us sore. The elevators to our level were shabby, with exposed electronics and soiled walls and floors. There is evidence of deferred maintenance throughtout the facility. Although the locale is great, this is not a romantic resort. The grounds, while open, are much too crowded by sunning adults and playing children. The adult's only pool looks boring. Finally, most irksome is the high cost for every item here. Of course we expect exaggerated prices at a Hawaiian resort. The prices seem whimsical, elevated inventions: $12.50 for the simplest drink, $100 for a simple snack for the family; the examples are endless. This is just greed.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: jerbic
Reviews.Content: Just finished a seven night stay for Thanksgiving week. Great room, great service and spectacular times on the beach and at the pool. Our kids loved the waterslide. On our last day a monk seal decided to nap on the beach. Great photo op. The TV's need a little updating but we did not come to Maui to watch TV! We loved the suite type room for parental privacy after the little ones conked out after a full day of swimming and boogie boarding. Be sure to dine at the General Store and Roy's in Kahana.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly spectacular”
Reviews.Author: max88s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here to celebrate my birthday. We wanted to do it right and we chose the Fairmont. We've not had a single regret. We had a gorgeous and large suite with a direct, full view of the Pacific, seven stories up! We had a very large lanai where we took our breakfast each morning, beautifully set up by the room service staff. There is NOTHING about the Fairmont that is not first class: from the exquisite suites to the fantastic restaurants to the huge and meandering swimming pools to the perfectly manicured lawns. It is the perfect place to totally escape from the world and to feel as if you have entered the Garden of Eden. Our ONLY regret was having to leave. We will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Service far below other Fairmont Hotels”
Reviews.Author: heraclius
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times since Fairmont took over. Room service is appallingly slow. This happens every trip. Right now I have been waiting for a sandwich for over 75 minutes. Calls result in brainless apologies. The movie system reboots at random. Same thing happened last year. This hotel has possibilities but it desperately needs better staff or better management.

Reviews.Title: “More than enough luxury...”
Reviews.Author: life2short
Reviews.Content: It was our 28th anniversary, and my husband and I had always stayed at different Marriott top line (like JW) hotels. We found the Fairmont to be lovely and very good at customer service. As indicated on other posts, they did indeed greet us with a lei. We were upgraded (partly due to their relationship with our travel agent). We had a small issue with the room and they upgraded us again when we moved - so we had an ocean and pool-facing room, facing the sunset. We were walking distance from a semi-private beach and very close to Wailea and the shoppes there. The room was a full suite where the bedroom had a separate closed door, and there was a "living room" with a couch, chairs, desk. A huge advantage is the wrap around "lanai" (balcony) with lots of chairs. In addition, there was a sink and a refrigerator and coffee maker. The bathroom was HUGE and had widely-spaced separate sinks, a walkin shower and a separate tub. The towels were thick and soft, and the pillows were great. The bed was a little harder than I like (I like the top-end Marriott better). The pools were great fun (a separate adult pool) and we had no problem getting chaise lounges. There actually is a swim-up bar in the main / family pool (which some might see as misplaced but having had three kids on vacation before - not this time - I can surely see the need for a drink). I had an outdoor, poolside massage that I would HIGHLY recommend. The rooms were clean and quiet and smelled great and had no mildew issues. We spent so much time on snorkel and beach and shopping trips that we did not take full advantage of the hotel. Next time we might stay at a place that is a little less high class (we spent about $350 per night) and is closer to the ocean where the waves are louder (not sure that is even possible with the zoning in Wailea).

Reviews.Title: “Fake luxury - go to the Four Seasons instead”
Reviews.Author: teafortwosf
Reviews.Content: I wish I read Bkelley1974's review before coming to this hotel. I'd have normally chosen the Four Seasons but was talked into the Fairmont by another couple travelling with us -- 800 Sq. Ft Suite! 3 pools! 30% off Special! Little did I know that: 1) the suite has cheap/old fixtures, dusty air conditioning vents, dirty carpets. 2) the resort reminded me of Las Vegas - large but done on the cheap. The cabanas at the pool cost $75 per day. The location of the adult pool is such that there's basically no shade unless you rent a cabana. The cabanas at the Four Seasons are free, btw. 3) everything's extra - newspaper, wifi access, no courtesy bottles of water. It's well worth the extra $100 for a much better experience. 4) The "full ocean view" suites look out at the building across. You see partial ocean from inside the room and more if you're on the balcony. 5) The food is typical terrible hotel/resort fare at pretty high prices. The coffee at the breakfast buffet is litterally undrinkable. Well, if you normally stay at the Hyatt Regency or the Marriot, and book the Fairmont because of a good price, then you'll enjoy it because you get the same experience but bigger rooms. You can go to Walmart or Costco, stock up the fridge, and use the microwave. If you usually stay at the Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental or the Peninsula, and are considering going for the Fairmont, DON"T. Spend the extra $100 and it'll be worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejsiervo
Reviews.Content: i dont know where these past 2 reviewers stayed, we had a wonderful trip. check-in was a breeze, took 2 minutes. the room was clean, spacious and we had a ocean view. the breakfast buffet was ok, i only did it once, i ordered off the menu the other days, but my husband did the buffet all the mornings we ate there. we had dinner at Ko and Nicks fishmarket and they were both very good. Nick's was the best meal of our whole trip. the adult pool was great, hardly anyone there and very quiet. never had a problem getting a chair (and we never arrived before 10am) . never went to the other pools the beach was very nice also, yes maybe it was a little crowded but getting chairs/umbrellas wasnt a problem. we didnt do valet, self-parking was free and it wasn't a bad walk. overall i would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars...maybe”
Reviews.Author: BKELLEY1974
Reviews.Content: DAMN,DAMN,DAMN....I was chossing between Four Seasons or top of the line suite in the Fairmont. Big mistake. Fairmont grounds(very nice), Adult pool(big plus), Beach(so crowded),resturants(really bad), ROOMS(Absolutly horrible). The hotel needs a HUGE room facelift. Pay the extra 100 a night at the Four Seasons(It is fantastic). Do not be fooled by the all suite....I was.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoNewlyWed
Reviews.Content: I staying here with my husband on our honeymoon in late October/early November 2009. I chose this hotel because it received a positive review in a travel book that I bought. The travel book made it seem like this was the kind of place that celebrities stay at. It was not cheap and we paid approximately $330 per night for an oceanview room. I have never been so disappointed. This place is an outdated "dump". The pool area was filthy and you can't get chairs next to the pool unless you pay extra for a cabbanna...$75 for two days. Otherwise, you are in the second or third row away from the pool. Barely anyone ever came by to take our drink orders either. I had a mai tai and it was terrible. The rooms are hideous and had a foul odour...of dirt and mold. They were completely outdated. They have not been refurnished since 1970 it seems. The hotel had only tube tvs and no flatscreens. What kind of hotel that claims to be a 4.5 star still has tube tv's in 2009???? Regarding the restaurants, as soon as we arrived, another couple approached us and advised that we should not eat at the restaurants at the hotel. They said the food was terrible, including Nick's Seafood. They said that most of the guests were driving to the local Safeway and buying microwave dinners (the rooms have microwaves). I couldn't believe it! I'm sorry but I don't want to eat microwave dinners ever actually, but especailly not on my honeymoon! I repeat again, this hotel is a complete, complete dump! I cannot believe this hotel claims to be a 4.5 star. It is not more than a 2 star - but not with a 2 star price tag! Trust me, no celebrity would stay here. Fairmont: here is some business advice for you.....UPDATE your hotels!!!!! Invest some money in your product and stop ripping off your customers. I don't mind paying a higher price tag, but only so long as the quality is there. At the Fairmont Kea Lani, the quality is not there. We left after the first night...we couldn't take it anymore and went to the Four Seasons which is next door. We paid about $50 more per night for the Four Seasons but it was worth every penny. The Four Seasons is fabulous! The difference between these hotels is night and day. Don't stay at this hotel if you are looking for an upscale, romantic vacation. Go the the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to splurge”
Reviews.Author: jvaicecream
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani is the best property on Maui that I have stayed at. It is an all suite hotel with unobstructed views, multiple modern pools and beach access directly from the property line. There was one glitch on the trip, but the attention of the staff and their willingness to bend over backwards to assist us was incredible. The decor of the building is a bit Mediterranean (doesn't have that compete Hawaii feel too it), but that is a tiny drawback to what otherwise is an incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne_of_Oxford
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the receptionist upgraded our suite from a partial ocean view to an ocean view, which was wonderful (and actually, that is why I reserved a partial instead of an ocean view, because I suspected that they might do that). Service everywhere was excellent, except once at the adult pool, where I was ignored by the bartender/waiter. It took a very long time to get a drink that afternoon. The next day at the same pool I had a different server, and she was great. Everyone was friendly, and the entire resort was immaculate and so pretty. Pictures are better than words, so I've posted as many as TripAdvisor will let me.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, Loved Everything”
Reviews.Author: ACMC75
Reviews.Content: I personally think this hotel is much better than the reviews or photos led me to beleive. Beautiful tropical grounds, several pools, excellent restaurants, beautiful beach. Nice walkway on the beach that connects you with Four Seasons, Grand Wailea hotel and Wailea shopping center - so lots of restaurant and shopping options. Our room was huge, a suite. Decorating is a bit basic but very comfortable and clean. Our room had amazing ocean view. All the hotels in Wailea on this strip are luxery hotels. I honestly like Fairmont the best because the pool area is much nicer than Four Seasons. We had a corporate event at the hotel and the evening activites and dinners they set up at the hotel were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “I'd live there if I could!”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Kea Lani and we just LOVED it. The service was amazing; from the housekeepers to the golf cart guys, everyone is both helpful and nice and oh, those villas! We had one right on the water and it was wondrous--were it not for that darn Hawaiin heat (being a Pacific Northwesterner, it was rather daunting), I would move in tomorrow! Suggestions: try the adult pool after 4pm when it is mostly empty and wonderful to swim in...don't miss the lighting of the torches and do try the spa if you can...their massages are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “tips on staying at Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: goodvibestoyou
Reviews.Content: Kea Lani is incredible! We were fortunate to stay in the off-season so the property was not busy and we really felt we had the place to ourselves. Most of the reviews are accurate as to what the hotel offers so here's my take on making the most of a stay at this wonderful property: Arrival/Departure - there are airport shuttles but we recommend you rent a car unless you plan to stay at the Fairmont for the duration of your trip. There's lots to do and see in Maui and I'm told bus service is inconvenient so bite the bullet and rent a car - you'll be happy you did. Rooms - all-suites means every room has a bedroom with seperate living area. I believe all the rooms have sizeable lanais. The layout, amenities, and comfort are amazing. High-speed internet (free for Fairmont Club members) and iPod docking stereo available. If you can afford an ocean-view all the better, but if not, don't worry about it you'll be more comfortable here than going to a lesser property because of the view from a room. Go for it if you can shell-out for a private villa: you only live once! Food - quality and service are top notch, but pricey. All rooms have a fridge so we bought lots of fresh fruit and breakfast/lunch food and took care of most of these meals ourselves. Stop in at Foodland or Safeway in Kihei and remember to get their discount card the first time you're at the till. Big savings. prepare to pay lots for drinks, especially pool-service. We spent most of our time by the beach and took our own booze with us each day. No problem. If you only have 1 meal at Kea Lani make sure you go to Nick's Fishmarket. The other restaurants are excellent but Nick's is world class. Their sister restaurant in Kihei is also delicious: Sorento's on the Beach. Other Maui restaurants to try: Wok Star in Kihei (a wonderful suprise, great red Thai curry), Sansei in Kihei (good sushi), Mama's Fish House in Paia (broke the bank here but worth it - go for lunch not dinner or you'll miss the view.) Activities - the Fairmont offers a weekly schedule of onsite activities. We did yoga 4 days in a row. The gym is fully equipped. We didn't go to the spa. The on-property highlight was definitely the snorkelling. You can rent gear there if you don't have your own. Swim out from the property to the right (toward Four Seasons) and if the water is calm enough go to the 2nd and 3rd set of rock outcroppings and there is lots of fish. We swam with turtles every day! The concierges are very helpful and can help book golf (Wailea Gold is good), scuba-diving (definitely go to the Molokini Crater), etc Have a great trip and remember to share the good vibes!

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani suite was our nicest room in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: mikesmyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 5 nights beginning on August 29th and were very pleased with our hotel choice. We were upgraded to an ocean view room when we checked in (after reserving the cheapest) and LOVED the room, which was huge. There's a kitchenette right when you walk in with an empty fridge (we stocked up at Walmart ahead of time), sink, microwave, etc. The bathroom is huge and it was really nice having a separate living room from the bedroom, both equipped with nice TV's and DVD players. The Lanai was gigantic and had an awesome view of the adult pool area and ocean. We were staying there with our toddler and the hotel provided a nice crib. The restaurants were all great, especially Nick's Fish Market which was one of our favorites. (We went with our little one and they brought him lots of fun snacks). The wine list was huge and the food was incredible. We really liked lunch at the Polo Lounge next to the "upper pool", but the prices were kind of steep. (Try the nachos!) The regular breakfast dining area was closed for renovations, so the daily breakfast buffet was moved to a function room near Ko. Didn't love the location, but the food was pretty good. I liked the little market they have there, was convenient to be able to run down and get things that we needed. The beach and the pool at Kea Lani are both perfect. I've read reviews about the beach being too small, but it is a lot bigger than we expected (And it's not shared with other hotels like at the Four Seasons!), we ended up spending every afternoon playing in the waves and making sand castles. The pool is really nice, but could use an update at some point in the future. The waterslide is fun and we were glad that they had a shallow "baby pool" where our little one could play with other kids his age. The staff around the pool is always walking around with fresh pineapple and offering drinks to all the hotel guests. As for negatives about the hotel, I was disappointed with the fitness center which is really tiny and not well-equipped. The parking lot (which is free) has a weird layout making it difficult to park when it's really full. We had problems with our room keys not working and it was annoying that the breakfast room was in a weird place, but this seemed like just a temporary thing. Overall, the staff was first class. The girls at the concierge desk were always willing to go above and beyond and helped us with lots of restaurant recommendations. Only bad staff was the mean bartender at the bar outside Ko - would it kill you to smile once in awhile? This was our first trip to Maui and I think we would definitely stay at the Fairmont again when we go back. I'mnot sure I would pick it for my honeymoon, but it is beyond perfect if you're heading to Wailea for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: eelexis
Reviews.Content: We used the Fairmont as a central location/hotel for our family of 15 to stay at for our wedding. We had children under 6, teenagers and adults. This hotle had every amenity one would need. Nick's Fishmarket is located in this hotel and is one of the best seafood restaurants in all of Maui. This hotel also had one of the most exclusive beaches compared to the neighboring hotels. All around we were very please with our 6 days stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: kmaude
Reviews.Content: Going into trip and viewing the website for the hotel wasn't sure what we were getting into. From the moment we arrived to the time we left it was great. The staff was one of the nicest and friendly staffs we have encountered in our travels. The room was great for a family. The views were amazing and most of all we got to relax and enjoy the time there. They really have a great atmosphere for kids to enjoy water and foods. Our 15th month only had one great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Kelly8809
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for our honeymoon. We first went to Oahu and were very happy we went there first, as we would have been very disappointed staying there after being in Maui! Maui was so much more beautiful and more relaxing for a honeymoon! Upon arrival we received a lei and a cup of POG juice, delicious! Our room was spacious and well cleaned everyday. We loved the turn down service! On our first night we returned to the room to find the music turned on, the lights dimmed and a letter and picture frame waiting for us as a honeymoon gift. We also loved the buffet breakfast everyday, however, we would not have eaten there if it were not already included in our room rate. It was 30 dollars a person, not worth it otherwise! Birds were waiting for you to leave your seat to feed on your left overs. It was pretty obnoxious, especially when I was the one sitting there when my husband went up for seconds. The staff was very prompt in removing plates, as they knew about this problem. The hotel was crowded with children but we hardly noticed since we spent most of our time at the adult pool. Sunsets could not be beat! This was by far a memorable stay and the nicest hotel we have ever stayed. We hope to come back soon but it is quite expensive. I recommend staying in September or October when all the kids are back at school, that is if you are staying on a honeymoon. Also, we highly recommend booking the free outrigger canoe excursion! This was one of our favorite things we did and it was only a short 15 minute trip. The man who runs this was amazing. He taught us Hawaiian language and history. We paddled out pretty far and then he provided us with goggles and we all jumped out into the ocean. We had already taken a snorkel trip to molikini but this was pretty fabulous and it was free!! Sign up as soon as you arrive, it books up fast! Pros: *Beautiful grounds * Adult pool *Yummy drinks *peaceful *Beautiful beach *outrigger excursion *Waliea is the best spot to stay in Maui! It's definitely more of a ritzy area compared to Lahania. *friendly staff *breakfast buffet Cons: *Many children *expensive room service and restaurants on the grounds *expensive drinks by the pool. $12 to be exact. *Don't waste your time eating at Mulligans at the Grand Waliea. There was lots of hype about this place but our service was absolutely terrible and we were clearly not the only ones complaining! Not worth it for the food or price! *Rooms smell a little musty on the bottom floors. *

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: cruisernut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite and the room is large and comfortable for a family of four. Nice amenities like fridge and sink. The patio was a great place to watch the sunset. The true highlight of the resort was the grounds and pools. The main pool gets a little busy but is big enough to accommodate everyone and the slide was pretty fun. We spent most of the time in the upper pool or adult pool. The beach in front of the hotel was nice and there were plenty of chairs all over the resort so it never felt crowded. Snorkelling was pretty decent but better on the left side. The only issue I would raise is that you had to pay for beach umbrellas and cabanas. Otherwise, it was a great stay for a week getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Just like paradise”
Reviews.Author: londoner1964
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a business rewards vacation. We were incredibly impressed with the entire property. From the moment you step into the lobby you are aware of the attention to detail and the absolute beauty of Maui. Customer service was clearly a priority. Food, drinks, pools were all wonderful. Highly recommended. We had a partial ocean view and were quite satisfied. Do see a sunset in Lahaina and most definitely take your camera and do the Road to Hana trip. The spa was impeccable.!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Location - Not Cheap But Mostly Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Zwhite
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, clean and very well kept. Given a free up upgrade to semi ocean view, but was in a regular garden view and the view of the grounds was quite nice. Over sized bathrooms were great allowing room for more than one to use at the same time i.e. a shower and a tub, two pedistal sinks, plenty of room in the suite. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent with a nice sandy beach out front and small rocky - reef type point on the edge. There is a good walking path that fronts the beach side of the hotel that allows you to walk just off the beach and along the other resorts near by and access the other resorts and beach areas. The hotel grounds are roomy and very well kept. The lobby and lounge area are also very nice. Had a fellow playing music each evening in the lounge, he was good. This is not an inexpensive hotel, nor area. All the other resorts along this strech are also somewhat pricey and the area as a while relects that. Streets, medians and all are perfectly groomed, with a couple golf courses too. There is a nice shopping area up the street with a mix of shops and 3 restaurants. Stores do range from modest T-Shirt type stores to upscale clothing and jewlery. We found the breakfast (buffet) over priced at $30 per person, for $30 dollars you should get more than an omelette station, waffles and pancakes were premade and in their buffet serving dome. I would also like something other than a 4oz glass for milk and juice. The upper pool side cafe food good in my opinion, service was good also. We ordered a burger that comes with fries to split . They brought it out, half on each plate with a full portion of fries and pickle on each plate... which I thought was nice touch. Also had Ok hot dog, good onion rings and good salad on other occasions. Didn't try the two formal resturant at the facility. We did find that the deli - cafe it had some meal type items posted on a board outside. Well we had spagettii, cesear salad and garlic bread that was very good. Come to find out, it comes from one of the formal resturants that is next door. So you got great food, for a more reasonable price. Service lower pool side was very friendly, but sometimes slow. Pool cafe and surrounds did have daily drink specials Mai Tai one day, strawberry Daquari's another for $10. Great - Location Service (mostly) Staff (all very nice and more than helpful) Decent deals on food and drinks if you look for them. No charge parking. Just Ok- Little nickel and dime for stuff like cost of cabana pool side or umbrella at the beach and things like that. But if you got an umbrella they would bring it to where you wanted set it up with towels and all, so just for a couple hours it was fun and didn't really break the bank for $20. Not so good - Price of Buffet Breakfast for what you got. A premium TV channel (HBO-Showtime) would be good for the price. We selected the time of year so most children would be back in school and this was generally the case. I think most (and there were not very many) kids were from Australia and New Zeland. I could see where this would be a popular place for families and there could be lots of kids during other times of the year. Suites had microwave and small fridge, to keep things reasonable hit the Safeway 10 minutes up the roads for snacks and drinks. Other dinning options within 15 minutes included everything from local food to fast food to very fancy dinning. Overall, this was a resort and priced liked it, but generally you did got what you paid for. Enjoy the facility how it fits you, watch them meal prices and extras if it matters to you. If you don't want a bunch of kids around, don't go when schools out. This is a great place to stay, you just have to make the most of it... how it will best suit you. For whatever reason there was never anyone at the beach or pools once the sun went down. The pools are open 24 hours a day(which was great), not the water slide though as it requires someone to keep an eye on things for safety. A couple evenings we had a pool pretty much to our self. The beach is easily accessible and we had it to ourselves a couple times too. Hotel was about half fully, but still couple hundred people, but no one really at pool - beach at night. We- Day 1 - (arrive) Just hung around hotel area. Day 2 - Volcano Crater and evening time around pool - beach Day 3 - Hana Highway Day 4 - Beach (surf was up) and Luau (off site) Day 5 - (depart) Scuba trip and pool area Our flight out was at 8:45pm and hotel had suite that you could use for an hour or so to freshen up (wash - shower...) after the days activites and before the flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Special Occasion, Special”
Reviews.Author: outof714
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 nights and days at the Kea Lani to celebrate our 5th anniversary. Arrived on the last flight and the lobby was empty at 11pm, but upon entering our rooms we discovered that we had been upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View with a wonderful Anniversry gift from the staff. We had our 2 year old in tow and they had his crib all set and ready for him to wind down. it was a great arrival after 7 hours of flying. Room-Great for families with sitting room and master. Bath is wonderful with separate shower and bath. Double vanities are great and the walk in shower allowed our toddler to experience his first. Great 42 inch LCD in living room, but no HD. DVD was a life saver for the little guy and stereo is nice Denon unit. Beds are very comfy with pillowtop mattress. The lanai is huge with table for 4 and a lounger. Spent a lot of time out there as son napped. View was amazing as we could see the sunset and hear the waves crash with the sliders open. Wet bar, microwave and mini fridge are huge help with a little one to make his breakfast and quick meals. Outlets-First off, the Keiki program is great. Kids under 5 eat free at all outlets at hotel!Tried the Kea Lani for breakfast the next morning. Was being renovated so we were at a ballroom with outside location. Prices are moderate and the buffet is the way to go. Great selection and Omellete station. The birds are all over the seating area though. be careful if you leave food at your seat! Polo Grill-Great burger and ahi. The location is by the upper pool and has great views of the property. Darn good MaiTais here as well Luana Lounge-Happy hour scene is really nice. Great Sunset and the Pupu selection is wide. Try the tempura skewers or lumpia Koa-Our fave! Great local flavors. The Sake Mojito is the winner here. The groups faves were the Ahi on the rock, Fried Rice, and ahi tuna crunch roll. Seating is all outside so can get warm if the winds stop. Nicks Fishmarket-The best service around. They gave us a great view table even with a little guy with us. This is the place to be pampered. I dont think there is a miss on the menu here. Very Pricey though! In room dining-Cant beat a meal on the lanai. Great for after a long day around the island. Service was fast and on the spot. Set it all up even a table cloth on the lanai! the dim sum sampler was tasty. Cafe Ciao-Great place for a quick coffee and pastry. Also has some neccessities and came in a pinch when we ran out of milk. Had gallons of milk alon with other items you may have forgotten to get at your Safeway stop in Kihei....top dollar though! Beach- Polo beach is super convenient and never crowded. The waves are mild and our toddleer loved running in and out. Hotel provides lounge chairs and has a small rental booth for scuba, surf, unbrella rentals right there. Staff was awesome. Great place for sunset too! Pool- Great pools! Lots of lounges and cabanas (cost?) available. Lounger towels for the chairs and pool towels are readily available. The toddler pool is great and my little guy was able to walk around waste high with no fear. The adult pool is a nice getaway and the poolside service is convenient and not overbearing. No chlorine is used, saline system of some sort so you never smelled like a pool. The waterslide is super fun but not too long. The swim up bar is pretty popular in the afternoon. Off Site Dining- Lots of great dining around the Island. We had our reception at SeaWatch 5 years ago and went back to celebrate. They are in the midst of a takeover from the General Store (Bev Gannon) so it wasnt the same. Im sure it will be top notch in no time. SanSei-Sushi in Kihei...this is the spot! Go Sunday or Monday and your order before 6pm is 50% OFF! It was premium fish and done really well. We would pay the regular price here the quality was that good Kihei Cafe-Great breakfast spot, and not too expensive. Great biscuits and gravy, fried rice and corn beef hash. great local scene too across from the beaches of Kihei. Maui Brewery-We are big fans of the Kona Brewery on the Big Island and hoped to find something similiar. It was a bust as far as the food goes. The beer was good though but not as finished as Kona. They had a Chipotle Ale that was really tasty and different. Kula Lodge-great place upcountry on the way to Haleakala. The views of the valley are awesome. The brick oven pizza is the best we had during our stay. Random Stuff- Self Parking is free and a short walk (20 or so for valet). We had the red-eye out and the staff was awesome to give us a late late check out. The beach walk is a goot jaunt. Check out the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. Wailea beach is nice but a little more crowded. Definitely hit Costco/Safeway/Foodland to stock up the mini-fridge. Great stay and Fairmont Service is the way to go in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TXHoutraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip with a great rate that I found on Costco travel. The service is impeccable. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite upon arrival (all suite hotel). I recommend joining the President's Club. There is no cost involved but the perks are definitely worth it for the stay. We mainly chose this resort because of the "adults only" pool. We will definitely give The Fairmont strong consideration when returning to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, nice room and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: cdaworld
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4 girlfriends traveling in late August. We spent 3 fabulous nights at the hotel. The service was great, the rooms clean and bright, the layout of the rooms were nice and modern, and the grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The pools are really special and are not chlorined. They use a special sea salt cleaning system to keep the pool clean, so you can stay in the pools for a long time without feeling like you are being bleached. I guess it was off-season and tourism is down because the hotel is definitely under-occupied at this time, which means you can feel like you have the hotel and the pools all to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great family destination - especially in late August”
Reviews.Author: Sid124
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont the last week of August with our two young boys, age 3 and 1. The timing of our stay couldn't have been any better as the resort was not very busy since many schools have started the school year. Therefore, there was never any trouble getting seats with umbrellas at either the poor or the beach. With regards to meals, it is expensive, but keep in mind that children under 5 eat for free at a few of the restaurants, which made it more reasonable. Additionally, one of the restaurants, Ko, is offering a special for a three course dinner for $39/PP which is also a very good deal. We also went into town to eat at Pizza Madness which was very reasonable and offered great pizza. Overall, this hotel is excellent for familes as the rooms are huge. My wife and I were able to let the boys go to sleep early in one room and still enjoy the evening in either the living room or the lanai. This is the primary reason why we chose the Fairmont and it definitely exceeded our expectations. We also took many walks to the Four Seasons and the Grand Waialea and would also definitely recommend both hotels; however, in my opinion the Fairmont is the ideal choice of the three for familieswith small kids given the rooms. However, I would definitely stay at the Four Seasons for a more romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: pirk
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Fairmont Kea Lani. The first time was for our our 10 year anniversary... but we decided it would be great to bring the kids back. The rooms at this hotel simply can't be beat when traveling with kids. The suite set up is perfect and allows everyone to have space. We really took advantage of the mini-fridge with the kids -- breakfast in the room everyday which is helpful. My husband and I still went down to Caffe Caio each morning to get lattes and a scone but it's nice be able to keep snacks in the room. There was also a microwave. Yes, things are expensive. If you've done any research at all then this shouldn't be a surprise. There are lot's of ways to cut corners without feeling like you're depriving yourself on vacation. We brought a little cooler with us and took it to the pool everyday. We filled it with various drinks & snacks (water is complimentary at the pool in large coolers -- bring a water bottle so you can refill). Eating off property for dinner will help out too. We ate at KO one night and thought it was delicious. We also got pizzas from Caffe Caio one night and brought them back to the room. They were also really good. They messed up one of the pizzas and I felt like it wasn't handled well so I called and talked with a manager. They immediately made another pizza and delivered it to our room and paid for the pizza. I was impressed. Don't believe all the comments on here about rude staff. The front desk was a bit stiff but I noticed that the day shift was friendlier than the evening staff. The Valet and Bell Staff were amazing! So friendly and upbeat! The pool staff was very accommodating in my opinion. We rented a Cabana with our friends ($75 for the first day with the second day being free and it includes a fruit plate each day and complimentary sodas & juices all day long) which was awesome! With the price of drinks it felt like we were making money off the deal :-) Not to mention it was reserved each day so we didn't have to get up early to reserve a spot at the pool. My complaints are minor. The music in the lounge is WAY too short... just when we're returning from dinner and thinking about maybe having an after dinner drink the musician would be packing up each night (plays from 7-9). The lack of "Hawaiiana" is really, really lacking in Wailea. We could've been anywhere tropical. I was really missing that Hawaiian feel -- mostly through the Hawaiian music. There really wasn't any playing. Like I said these are minor! Last tip... pack a picnic, get some pool towels and go sit on the lawn in front of the Villas to watch a sunset one night! We did a wine and cheese picnic one night, the kids tossed the football and it was one of our best nights! Great photo ops. Overall I wanted to write a review because I think this hotel is the best overall option in Wailea for families. I'm sure the Four Seasons is lovely but to have a room over there like you get at the Kea Lani you'd pay thousands a night. We got a deal through Costco that was amazing! Be sure to check them out for packages. We will come back here time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel â€“ only niggle was a constant feeling of up-selling.”
Reviews.Author: VariousTrips
Reviews.Content: Room was a good size and had a nice view; we met great people and the staff were friendly. Location is good, trips organised by the hotel were at market rate and there was plenty of space to relax. Gym had good kit but was depressing - no outside light or view. There was no pool to really swim in i.e. even the adult pool was <20m. Beer/food seemed pretty expensive (acceptable quality) although a visit to the supermarket on the way from the airport solved that problem. Our room had a little 'fridge and microwave. I did feel they were always trying to squeeze the extra $ out of us.

Reviews.Title: “really not what i had in mind...”
Reviews.Author: mama1213
Reviews.Content: i checked out the website booked with the hotel directly... booked a delux ocean view suite.... what i got was a veiw of the pool with an angled view of the beach... i even talked to the hotel on the phone and they assured me that it would be a great view of the ocean...and that just didnt happen...it was hard trying to get the staff to listen to or care about any of my concerns...and there is only so much eye rolling i can take from people... we ate at one of the hotel resturants (KO) and it was ok food that took way to long to get to us... we really just wanted to go after dinner so we asked for the desserts to go and our check.... about 30mins later.... still no check or dessert.... its WAY over priced and really really not that great... really really dissapointing... we tried to spend a little time by the pool and its not that we even minded the kids.... it was that the staff just did not care about anything! if you asked about snorkel spots on the beach you are met with another eye roll and a snoody remark.... if you ask about ANYTHING thats what you're met with... the only thing good i can say is that the spa was great! the therapists are professional and really do know what they are doing and really they were the only friendly people i spoke with at the resort..... it just was not good.... charging 20 dollars to park was the thing that got my hunnie up set... he ended up just parking the car himself..... it was not worth the money we spent and we should have just stayed at the four seasons like i had planned to in the first place! but the spa is great!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ncdadws
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. great beach. great snorkeling off beach. uncrowed pool area. expensive food. great rooms/suites. great service. can't miss with this place. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: Rickny9
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms. All are suites 500+ sq ft each. Two nice pools plus one adults only. Nice resturants and top shelf service from entire staff. Beautiful gardens, A true Polynesian treat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with large rooms and amenities”
Reviews.Author: gcxc
Reviews.Content: First time Fairmont guests here.. Overall the hotel is lovely. We have stayed at other luxury class hotels/resorts on other islands. From the other selections we could find on the island, and we had friends staying at nearby hotels (Grand Wailea), this hotel is very nice - the rooms are spacious, and the service prompt and friendly. Since there aren't 10000 kids running around like some of the other resorts, it's more relaxing and enjoyable for a family not looking for a Disney theme park vacation. The spa was good. The workout room was well kept and only a short wait for machines on occasion (but it's open 24 hours). The food/room service was as good as we've seen at places like the Ritz. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience. The rooms were pricey (about $500+/night for oceanview).

Reviews.Title: “A Great island with a hotel to match”
Reviews.Author: NW69
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on Tripadivsor we were a bit nervous.This was not a cheap holiday and we were traveling over America before traveling to Maui for a relaxing week. My wife and I traveled to Maui with our 2 daughters (12 &10) . We shared a Sea View suite and thought the hotel was excellent overall Rooms were spacious and immaculate. Sofa converted into a double bed so the Girls had the lounge and we had the main bedroom â€“ separate entrances to the bathroom , but lockable from both sides so excellent for the 4 of us. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Free hotel car that would take you anywhere in the local area ,Shops , Restaurants , Golf Course etc. It was always available and drivers knew a lot about the area , where to snorkel , surf etc. Food was excellent in Nickâ€™s fish market and not as expensive as others make out in their reviews. Drink was more expensive however and once you had added a cocktail or 2 in the evening the overall dining experience was good but pricey. The other restaurant we used at the hotel was KO , they did a good 3 course menu for $39 , which was good value. Breakfast was excellent both in terms of Volume and quality â€“ Just watch the birds ! Overall we had an excellent stay and the pools and beach were used extensively. An excellent experience we would look to repeat one day

Reviews.Title: “Amex Plat Fine Hotel- Well Worth the cost!”
Reviews.Author: ganmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani from late July through the 1st week of August. I was upgraded to a deluxe ocean front as part of Amex Plat Fine Hotels, which also includes two passes for the breakfast buffett ($30 a person plus tip/tax) each day, 1 lunch (Order from pool, bar and care- incl 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and 2 deserts), upgrade at chekc in and many other benefits. The rooms are perfect for families, a seperate bedroom and large bath room, with seperate toilet. The shower is a bit annoying because it is not enclosed, just a step up from the tile floor and 2 year olds love to play in it and turn the water on and off. The rooms were very clean and well maintained, plus the large balconies provide one more place to go to se[erate everyone in the family. The grounds are very nice and well maintained, the pools are busy, but chairs were always available, even though people go down at 7am and leave their things. At abvout 12 noon, they clear off some chairs, so that is a good time to head down and get some reserved chairs that just opened up. The Nick's Fish Market is not very good in comparison to Mama's Fish House, while they have great service (Always a full drink), they are snooty and if you dont plan to order cocktails and wine, they make odd faces and snide remarks. The food is not all that great in comparison to Mama's, some dishes are great, other, not so much. For the price, drive to Mama's and enjoy the whole package. The Fairmont as quite attentive to guest needs and even goes out of their way to greet and acomodate customers. However, they had issues with the phone systems voice mail and never told any guests, instead many guests had to call/go down to the front desk looking for a "package being held", only to be told of the issue. All it took was either a call or letter in each room explaining the situation. If you have a family and want to stay in Wailea, this is your hotel. If you are single, dont like lots of kids, but enjoy the finer things, stay at the four seasons. If you are a family, looking to sacrifice space and some extra $ for nice pools, then Grand Wailea is you cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “3 years in a row and we love it!”
Reviews.Author: magntman
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Kea Lani 5 times over the last 3 years and we love it! We have 2 young children and the suites (it's an all-suite hotel) are perfect for a family. The bathrooms are huge with a huge tub. I recommend to pick up some food & drinks from Safeway and store it in your mini-fridge. As with every resort in Wailea, the food at the hotel is crazily overpriced, however the hotel has a sandwich/coffee shop that has some good sandwiches for relatively good prices. *Tip to parents with young children: The bar at the upper pool serves free kids meals at lunch for children under 5 (it may be 4, can't remember the exact age). They don't advertise this too much, but ask the bartender to make sure. I've never seen the pools overrun with people like at Grand Wailea. Every once in a while you'll get an obnoxious kid, that's why there's an adult pool. The beach is smaller, but less crowded than some of the others in Wailea. It's free to sign up for the President's club before you go. There are alot of perks including free wireless internet, use of a loaner car, free golf club rental, free use of adidas athletic wear, among other perks. Overall, in my opinion the Kea Lani is the best value in Wailea. If you want to pay an extra $200/night for someone to spray Evian on you and get free popsicles, then feel free to go to the Four Seasons. But I would rather have the space to spread out and really enjoy my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: djbarnes
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Fairmont with our two children (6,9). The location is great. The resort is on Polo Beach which is a small nice beach, but you can walk to Wailea Beach or drive to Big Beach in Makena. The pool was OK but nothing great - the kids enjoyed it although it seemed crowded at times. The adult pool looked nice but we had kids so we never used it. You have to reserve cabanas by the pool (we didn't), but chairs are free if you can find them. At the beach, umbrellas and boogie boards must be rented but the chairs are free. The grounds are very nice - our kids enjoyed the tiki torch lighting and feeding the Poi fish. The room we had was a suite which was good with children. The bathroom was huge, but lacked privacy (too many mirrors and no separate area for the toilet). The lanai was large and comfortable. We had an Oceanview room on the first floor which overlooked the adult pool and was nice. I wouldn't splurge on more expensive rooms - they showed us the next room rate up which would have added $1200 to our bill and didn't offer any better a view. The hotel appeared to be very clean. Washer/dryers are available for free which was very nice - you just need to buy detergent and bounce sheets. With kids and a long stay, this was beneficial since we could pack less. The concierge was helpful, but beware that you are paying additional if you book thru the hotel. We realized that when comparing rates with other people at various activities. If you know what you want to do, I suggest booking yourself to save money. For food, the grill by the upper pool was good and we used it for lunch many days (and the service was very good). We tried Ko's one night and the food was amazing but the service was awful. We did one breakfast but the service was awful and the birds were quite annoying. We used the cafe many days - it is expensive but it was a cheaper alternative for some meals. We did note that cookies that you could get at the grill for $7 were at the cafe for $3.50 which annoyed us once we noticed this. All in all, the hotel was very nice. The staff is friendly and the location is good. It is expensive, but most of Hawaii is expensive. I wouldn't mind returning, but we would probably opt for a condo in the future so we could cook our meals ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream”
Reviews.Author: maria1012
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont lives up to its star rating and name - this hotel stay was amazing. I've stayed in quite a few nice hotels and this tops the list. We booked during the first week of June and the island was relatively deserted. The first two days of the stay, we felt as if we had the pools to ourselves. The staff - hands down the best I've seen. They remember your name and are always there to help. My fiance asked for an upgraded room and they happily obliged at no extra cost. We were put in a giant suite with a wrap around balcony.
