The location couldn't be better. Wailea has a very upscale and private feel to it - moreso than the rest of Maui. If you are looking for peace, tranquility, and romance, definitely stay in Wailea and at the Fairmont. Can't wait to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cathleenmarie
Reviews.Content: This was the final place we stayed on a 2+ week trip to Hawaii. At that point we were tired of being tourists and just wanted to relax. The Kea Lani is lovely. The rooms have separate sitting areas, spacious bathrooms, nice balconies and comfortable beds. The property has lots of open space with absolutely beautiful grounds. The pools are lovely though there are not enough cabanas and people seem to reserve chairs early in the AM--kind of obnoxious, but seems to be the Hawaiian resort thing to do. We ended up renting an umbrella at the beach every day and it was very relaxing. We ate dinner at Nick's Fish Market and were not wowed, though it was a festive atmosphere. In my memory the prices are about the same for Ko but the atmosphere was a little too low key for the price. If we did it again, we would not have breakfast included. The buffet is overwhelmed by birds who have become very smart. When parents leave their toddlers at the table to return to the buffet the birds sweep in. The birds descend as soon as the table is vacated--whether to leave, greet friends, or return to the buffet. We would have opted for the coffee and breakfast options at the nice little store in the hotel. We ate lunch at the pool bar each day--the staff was delightful and the food very good. In the evening we enjoyed drinks in the lobby bar and wished there had been a food option there. (We loved the restaurant at the Four Seasons--Ferraro's Bar e Ristorante.) The fitness center was well equipped. One day we were there and the place was scorching. There were many calls to the hotel operator but no a/c. My husband is a runner and enjoyed the path that ran along the beach in front of all of the resort hotels. We also walked the path several times and decided that the Kea Lani was the prettiest and place along the walk. It has a relaxing calmness that we wanted...the other places seemed a little too frenetic. Also, there were amazing sunsets every night. This is not an option at every hotel! Tip: Join the Fairmont club to get free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool and views”
Reviews.Author: TadW
Reviews.Content: The architecture of this hotel is beautiful--reminiscent of an exotic Eastern palace. The pool is a blast for the kids with a serious water slide (maybe too good--hard to get them out of the pool). The rooms are all suites and very spacious. The view from our room (and even from our floor's elevator lobby) was worth a picture that could be made into a postcard (I will try to post one soon). The service was extremely friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: DaveColorado
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 days at the Fairmont and loved it. The large suites (hotel is all suites) was perfect for a longer stay and the rooms were done well and comfortable. We didn't eat in the hotel much outside of Nick's Seafood (which was great), as we like to get out and see the area more, but menus looked good and price is what you would expect for a Fairmont. We don't have kids and while there were a lot at the resort, it was nice that the hotel offers a adults only pool so you can get away a little bit from it all - for those with kids it did look like there were enjoying themselves! Pools and beach were nice, well maintained, and clean. In short, excellent hotel, staff was nice and helpful, and we will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alovestravel
Reviews.Content: Once we decided to stay in Wailea, we deliberated a long time whether to stay at the Fairmont or the Grand Wailea. We were not disappointed by our choice. There were no problems finding chairs by the pool, the beach was very close, and it never felt too crowded. Everything was more expensive at the hotel, but Kihea was so close that we did quite a bit of off-site shopping (and eating). The main advantage was the room: sofa bed, microwave, fridge that was empty on arrival, and very large lanai. None of these were extra charges. Because there are so many deals right now, with the free breakfast and free night, it was very worth the stay at this beautiful, friendly hotel. Great: We received an upgrade on check-in. We also received a fruit plate with cheese and chocolate on the day we checked-in. There are plenty of pools - including one with a slide and one for adults. The beach was so calm most of the time that we saw people out there all the time. Everyone we met except for maybe 1 male server at breakfast was friendly and put in more than they had to do to make our stay really fantastic. Wierd things: There's a "do not disturb sign" but not "please clean now". No conditioner (although a little box with cotton swabs, etc.). The evening turn down often came around as we were getting ready for dinner and didn't include anything like a chocolate (or a shell as the Halekulani). Other notes: We did the free parking (as recommended by some of the reviewers here). President Club members get free internet. You can find the connection to plug between your computer and the internet plug in the desk if they wireless doesn't work for you. They have a little store downstairs where you can get some food items: You can go in and order/pick up from the shelves or you can call down - it's cheaper than calling room service. We did stop at various stores in Kihei for our needs, though.

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay here”
Reviews.Author: cpapa84
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The pool was nice and relaxing and I was glad that they had a pool that was for adults only. They also had umbrellas by the pool at no cost, so you didn't need to rent a cabana if you didn't want one. The poolside lunch service was great and the guy (I think his name was Matt?) was SO nice and helpful, not just to us but to everyone. He knew everyone's names and was really just a fantastic employee... so friendly. I don't think we even ventured down to the beach, we loved the pool so much!! I saw some people commented about the price of food, we did not eat dinner here but I did not think that the lunches and breakfasts were that bad. We got breakfast each morning at the coffee shop and they had fantastic muffins for maybe $3-4 each. The poolside lunch was about $20/entree which is pretty standard for poolside food. I loved the size of our suite... it was huge and we had a huge balcony also. Lots of closet space. Housekeeping did a great job also. Negatives: we were a little disappointed that we did not get leis at check in, and no one asked if it was our honeymoon, as the other hotels did. Also, the place is definitely dated. The lobby is just gorgeous and so is the adult pool, but if they could rehab this place they would probably get a lot more business. I read something that said it was last redone in 2001 and I was honestly surprised even from that. The rooms do look like they are from 2001, but many of the outdoor areas look MUCH older than that. After the first day, I didn't really mind it (I guess I saw the charm in it) but I could see a lot of people being picky and not liking it. I also LOVED the location of the hotel - staying in Wailea was the best. We stayed in Kapalua for our first few days on Maui and it was night and day. Wailea is so much better and has everything right at your fingertips. We loved going to the shops at Wailea every day to eat - we ate at Ruth's Chris, Longhi's, Tommy Bahamas, as well as a few trips to Lappert's.. all were great. I definitely recommend it for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff, some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: achaudry
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone with kids. since all rooms are suites, you are not constantly on top of each-other. pros: bathrooms are huge, hotel is well maintained, most of the staff is friendly, and they <mostly> don't nickle and dime you for everything cons:some of the staff like to make up their own rules when it comes to charging you. ex. our 2.5 year old likes to drink milk first thing in the morning. at checkin we were told that kids under 5 eat free and we can order/pick up food for them at anytime from any of the restaurants (pretty standard for a high class resort as this). so the first day, my husband picked up milk for him in the morning no problem. the next day, i went down to pick up milk for him and the frizzy haired cow (aka hostess) condescendingly told me that they have to see the child drink the milk in front of them (implying that i was somehow trying to steal the milk and drink it myself). on another occasion at dinner, we were charged $8 for our son's drink. when we asked the waiter about it, he told us "kids eat free not drink free", nobody else charged us for our son's drinks so i don't know what that was all about. other minor grievances, not sure how well the bathrooms in the room are cleaned on a daily basis. $20 delivery charge for room service - what is that about. $30/person breakfast buffet - ludicrous.

Reviews.Title: “great stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lisaandbart
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - view is fantastic, nice spacious rooms, clean. Staff is friendly but non-intrusive. Great breakfast buffet. Nice selection of swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: XanXanMama
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families!! The suite set up is perfect for 2 adults and 2 kids (not sure you could squeeze more kids in or not). The place is expensive, so bring your wallet. Couple of tips... * Valet parking is $20 per day. Self parking is FREE. * The breakfast buffet is good, but not great. I preferred the coffee shop (Cafe Caio) that has breakfast sandwiches and coffee. * If it is crowded, splurge on the cabana. It holds your spot all day in a nice shady location, plus you get unlimited water and non-alcoholic beverages (again, very kid friendly). * The Spa is fantastic! The Lomi Lomi massage was one of the best I'd ever had...well worth the money. * Skip the Hair/Nail salon. It has nice Aveda products, but that's about it. * The rooms have dorm-size refrigerators and microwaves, so buy snacks at the local grocery store to keep in your room. * Ask about the drink of the day...usually delicious and a few bucks less. * The kid activities on the lawn are pretty lame, except for the lei making. This was a blast (and free). My daughter made a huge lei and wore it around for days. * Everyone needs to go down the water slide...very fun for all ages! We were there in a "down market" so there were deals going on at most of the restaurants and even at the pool (2-for-1 cabanas). Overall...fabulous place to stay! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, smaller resort”
Reviews.Author: eric3000Burbank
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other resorts in Wailea, the Kea Lani is small and intimate. We were upgraded to an ocean view suit and the view was amazing and the big patio made it easy to enjoy looking at the ocean and the island of Kohoolawe. The staff are very friendly, the pool is nice, and the self parking is good. The housekeeping was excellent; we would come back from breakfast in the morning and our room would be done! That was nice. This hotel really nickels-and-dimes you to death so you may want to get things elsewhere. The cabana rentals are expensive, room-service food is not worth the expense, and we rented our snorkeling equipment at the Maui Dive Shop at the Shops at Wailea, instead of at the hotel. We also got groceries at Safeway in Kihei and were able to use the kitchenette in the suite, although they are not equiped with dishes and flatwear, for some reason. I didn't think this was the nicest beach. The beach and snorkeling was better at other locations nearby. We didn't try the restaurants but we did eat at the buffet for breakfast every day because it came with the room. I thought the buffet was excellent. I also got a spa treatment and I really enjoyed it. Internet service was good. A friend used the fitness center and said it was terrible. I think this resort may get more children because all the rooms have a separate bedroom, which makes it nice for families. But there is a separate adult pool. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rocco21
Reviews.Content: It was gorgeous! The lobby is breath-taking with a view of the pool grounds and ocean from it. We are a couple who travelled with our 10 year old son. Our room had a comfortable king size bed and living area with a fold out for our son. It was roomy, clean and comfortable with a great view of the pool and the ocean from the 3rd story. Friends of ours traveling with us booked a villa but then moved into the hotel finding it more spacious and comfortable too. The hotel lobby bar makes the best Mai Tai's we have ever had!! Get the "original" and you will want one every evening at cocktail hour! A very talented solo guitarist played music every evening from 5-7pm in the hotel lobby cocktail bar....we found ourselves breaking stride to get there before he ended just to hear a few songs if unable to be there for the whole set. Our 10 year old loved the pool and the slide...he was not too old for it at all! Service at the poolside is slow, but that was our only notable complaint. We just walked up to the outside bar and got our own if we didn't want to wait for a drink to arrive 20 minutes later. The staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. At sunset each evening, an outstanding Hawaiian male dressed in island regalia came outside to light all the torches around the grounds, blowing the conch shell horn in celebration of the sun setting. The children followed him. The hotel's beach is private and lovely with easy access for chairs, towels information on the current conditions and safety of the water. There is an excellent walking path on the hillside along the beach in front of the subsequent properties, so bring your jogging shoes. We loved being so close to the little town just 5 minutes away (by car) where we could eat delicious local fare at a reasonable prices, take surfing lessons and shop in outside markets for odds and ends. There was also a shopping mall just a skip jump down the hill from the hotel where we could find anything and everything we could possibly need. We would definitely go back to this hotel in the future. It was fantastic. If you stay here, be sure to notice the rugs on the floors of the elevators. They change them to say "Good Morning", "Good Afternoon" or "Good Evening" at each different time of the day. You will make others think you are super observant by pointing it out. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably maintained”
Reviews.Author: midwest19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for our 20th anniversary trip. It was beautiful. Our room was spacious, clean, and everything you would expect in this class of hotel. Food at the hotel is very good but crazy expensive. We bought lunch food and snacks and kept them in our mini-fridge. The only part about the hotel that made it less than perfect for our romantic trip was the number of kids. I swear 50% of the guests were kids. We have three children ourselves, so we're not anti-kid, but some places were a little noisy and crowded--like the main pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HankD
Reviews.Content: It is safe to say this was a wonderful hotel and all of my fellow travelers felt pretty much the same way. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. My only complaint was the prices for food and drink were excessively high.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Mark
Reviews.Content: We have been very lucky to stay at many Fairmont hotels, like the Banff Springs, Chateau Lake Louise, Jasper Park Lodge, Royal York, Chateau Frontenac - each one individual and unique, but this has to be our favorite! The first thing that amazed us was when you enter the lobby and see no doors or windows, just a view through the hotel and the grounds towards the clear blue ocean. We had an ocean-view room on the 3rd floor, fabulous view, incredibly spacious room, and wonderful comfortable bed. Staff were extremely friendly, always smiling, a lot of Aloha's. They seem to love working there! Used the Cafe Ciao Deli a few times, best raspberry muffin ever, really nice fruit and yogurt granola, nice ice-cream, great coffee - we liked getting a few items for breakfast then eating them on our Lanai overlooking the Pacific. Had the Kea Lani buffet breakfast once which was really good, great selection. Hotel grounds are immaculate, nice small beach which we really liked as it was generally quiet - good place to watch the sun set. Weather was perfect, sunny every day we were there (Apr 23-30), seems to be the best part of the island for weather. Will definitely stay here again next time we visit Maui!

Reviews.Title: “won this trip but would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: TYSKO2K
Reviews.Content: don't know if I would pay this much to spend nights in a hotel as opposed to a nice condo that has a full kitchen fo rmuch less, but this is a very nice hotel. we only got to stay 5 nights and were on the go a lot. However, the free canoe ride is AWESOME so do that, the hotel sets it up on certain days. The pool is very nice as is the beach. Warning, your credit card at check in is "frozen" at $100 a day all at once until check out.

Reviews.Title: “.Beautiful Resort, Excellent Customer Service, Wonderful Rooms with Outstanding Sunset”
Reviews.Author: trotter13
Reviews.Content: I really really enjoyed my stay at the Farimont Kai Lai. It was one of my relaxing trips I had in a long time. We stayed in the Ocean Front Villa and was greeted warmly by two Fairmont fabulous employees and one drove us to our room. The room was simple beautiful with contemporary furnishing, outstanding views out every window, a welcome gift bag, immaculate clean, just a gorgeous villa. Throughout the 5 days stay I was treated very well with attention to detail with every employee. When we called to have our rental car they always insisted on picking us up via of golf cart. I loved they had a adult pool just wish they had a Jacuzzi in the adult area, restaurants are excellent with great tasty selection. Enjoy a morning walk along the trail along the ocean side, also a short walk to the shopping center that has great restaurants and shopping. The bed, did I talk about the comfortable bed, feather top, 1000 thread sheets, we found ourselves taking naps. The villa had it own plunge pool, that could be warmed by request. This is a truly a 5 Star luxury hotel with excellent customer service and a beautiful location

Reviews.Title: “Splurge on a villa if you have kids in tow.”
Reviews.Author: jonaburd
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 kids (ages 5 & 8) to the Kea Lani for spring break. We originally booked a deluxe ocean view suite, but ended up spending a couple of nights in the suite then upgraded to a 2 BR ocean front villa for four nights. There was a last minute vacancy in one of the villas and we negotiated a great rate (the villa rate includes a rental car from Avis). Our take on the suite was that it was nice to have all four of us in the same room (and not have to pay for 2 rooms) but with the pull out couch and roll away bed it was a bit cramped. The bathrooms are very spacious (separate tub & shower) and there was a mini bar fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Nice balcony with ocean view. The villa was like staying at a completely different hotel. Similar to a 2 story townhouse, the villa had 2 very large bedrooms (one on each floor) and 2 very large bathrooms. I believe the living area also had a pull out couch. The kitchen was small, but had everything you need for a week. The full size washer/dryer was a godsend for a family of 4. The large patio area had a dining table with 4 chairs, 2 nice chaises and a very nice gas grill. The best part....the 3 ft deep plunge pool! All this within a few steps of the beach and a great ocean view. We ended up cancelling some dinner reservations so we could grill dinner and hang out on the patio in our swimsuits. There's a Safeway nearby in Kihei and several ABC stores that sell groceries, etc. It was like renting a condo but with the resort ammenities (terrific resort pool with waterslide). The Kea Lani is a great choice for a family -and if it's in the budget- a villa is definitely the way to go. We visitied several other resorts in Wailea and across Maui and felt that Wailea had the best weather. Kapalua was way too windy & had rough surf. The Four Seasons was lovely, but the pool looked small compared to the Kea Lani's (no water slide either) and the beach wasn't quite as private since they share a beachfront with the Grand Wailea. The Grand Wailea is the other end of the spectrum- an over the top mega resort with an enourmous water park. If I had pre-teens or teens that could go off on their own in a water park then this would have been a blast- but my kids are 5 & 8 and it was just too big & busy for them- and there are height requirements on some of the slides. Another note about the Kea Lani- my daughter is on a restricted diet and the staff was absolutely wonderful about her needs. Kids 5 and under eat free at the Kea Lani, and even though her meals were free, the chef went above and beyond. On our second morning we went to the breakfast buffet (very good selections) and the manager remembered us right away and put in a special breakfast order with the chef. When we moved to the villa the food & beverage director sent over a brand new toaster for us to use so that the old toaster wouldn't contaminate her food. Little things like that make a vacation more relaxing for a mom! We've stayed at "more upscale" reosrts (Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons,etc) that aren't as accommodating. 2 other tips about Maui- don't miss Mama's Fish House for dinner and Hali'imaile General Store is great for lunch on the way up/down from Haleakala. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Easystreet
Reviews.Content: Just the kind of resort you would expect in Maui. Beautiful location, weather, first class accomodations and staff. But is it worth the $ 700.00 + per night???? Well.....I guess if you go there for a special occassion. We were there for my wife's 50 th. I got a break on the price thru Costco, got a free night and free breakfast. At $ 30.00 a pop for buffett breakfast, it was a welcome savings. Don't pay for the chessey Lei and greeting at the airport, you will be greeted with a much better one (free) when you drive up to check in. Definitly, spend the extra $ for the Deluxe ocean view room. Ours was awesome! Food was good at Nicks, but WOW, pricey. Pool service was good too. Good place for families or w/o kids. If you Golf, play the Wailia Gold across the street... world class track. But don't eat the food there. Great beach at this hotel with staff for there to accomdate your needs. All in all a very great week at the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in this posh setting”
Reviews.Author: RkCkJhk
Reviews.Content: If you want to blow it out, this is the place to do it. We had an active agenda planned in Maui, but blew a good bit of it off because we couldn't pull ourselves away from the balcony, pool and beach. The property features three pools (adult, upper, and kids) and a great beach for lounging or boogie boarding. After taking the walkway to the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea, you'll have seen three of the finest resorts on Maui. For others prone to looking first at the right side of a menu, I recommend the $9 hot dog at the Polo Beach Bar and Grill on site. That's where the value ends however! Tommy Bahama for happy hour at Wailea Shops and Sansei's in Kihei offer great deals as well. I would also suggest heading to the Kapalua Plantation course for an amazing breakfast experience (the resort buffet is crazily priced and the birds freaked me out). Mulligan's across the street at the Wailea Blue Course is a great spot for a pint or two. The NFL player's association held their meeting during our stay ,so that was an added bonus seeing some players chilling with their families. If I had to knit pick, the self park lot is not conducive for vehicles larger than a SmartCar. This is a fantastic resort due to its location as well as its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine, food terrible, coffee.........where's the coffee”
Reviews.Author: AussieingAround
Reviews.Content: I'll admit that I'm a coffee addict, nothing disappoints me more than waking up and not having decent coffee on hand, I could find a substance that had the chemical composition of coffee but that was it. The Fairmont Kea Lani has forced me into withdraw, usually I'd compensate by finding comfort in a decent meal, but The Fairmont will push my credit card to the limit finding that glimmer of happiness. Luckily the rooms are relatively quite and roomy, even if I can hear the family above at times. The pool bar is over run with kids, quashing any thoughts of a quite beer in the pool. If you have kids go to the Grand, if your a couple, like myself the Four Seasons looks the goods.

Reviews.Title: “So Wonderful, but So Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: canadamumCalgary
Reviews.Content: I searched all over the internet to get a "deal" on this very expensive hotel. We have 4 kids so always need two rooms. I ended up booking through a third party because Fairmont did not have the cheapest rooms left to sell me. Booked two "moderate" suites (read, cheapest) and was upgraded to deluxe ocean view by manager when I had emailed some questions over my reservation. Lovely check in with fresh leis, and fruit juice, staff is all very friendly and welcoming. Suites are very large and comfortable, huge spa like bathrooms, comfortable beds, and our lanais had perfect views of the ocean, could even see whales! Our last two nights I decided to break the bank and ask how much to upgrade to a 3 bed villa. The occupancy was very low at this time, hello recession! So I paid 500 extra per night to live the high life. Now I am spoiled forever! The villas are splendid, private plunge pool, which was very warm, without the pee of the kids pool! The washer and dryer was handy, (again 4 kids) full size fridge and microwave and stove top. Only after coming back from Safeway with pizza, did I realize, no OVEN! oh well. Also had a barbeque. Handy because as expensive as the rooms are, the price of food at Kea Lani, even HIGHER. A hot dog at the pool, $9, fries at the pool, $8. We went to Safeway and loaded up, the moderate suites have a bar fridge and microwave so you can at least get drinks and snacks. The resort offers free shuttle (via very nice Suburban) to the shops at Wailea. Hit up the ABC store if you don't rent a car. More reasonable than the the deli at Kea Lani. Renting a car is so worthwhile, the sights of the island are amazing, the drive to Hana is a must see. And at the very least, you can drive to Kihei which has normal priced restaurants. The food savings will cover the cost of car rental. This hotel has seen some better days, the doors need refinishing, the couches are a little tired, but the views and the luxury of the resort overall, make it worth blowing the kid's inheritance. The staff treated us like royalty and the 1/4 price deal I got on the cabana, made me feel like a Hollywood Star. Save up and go, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, not couples”
Reviews.Author: rohl
Reviews.Content: I ' ve read all the other reviews and I will simply add this: no it's not the Four Seasons, and the service or lack there of was frustrating and the pool bar/cafe, which is the only real place to eat lunch and have snacks while you're pool or beach-side is lacking in aesthetic and is overpriced. I've stayed at 3 other comparable resorts on Maui and they were all better. However, if you are traveling with kids you really can't beat the "all suites" rooms which are great. I have not found another hotel in Hawaii where my family of 4 can stay without getting an expensive suite or two rooms which in both cases at the Four Seasons would be more than double the Fairmont room price. Also, the beach is perfect for children. In any case - I will not go there if I don't have my kids - I will be somewhere where the service is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise....but at a cost”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: On a whim, a friend and I decided to stay at the Kea Lani for a couple nights because the weather looked promising in Wailea (rainy on the North Shore where we had intended to stay!). The property is expansive and well cared for in typical Fairmont style, although the building itself is showing its age a bit. The orchid lei greeting is a nice touch, and the service staff were always friendly and welcoming. All of the rooms at the property are suites - being that we booked a friends and family rate, we were in the "fairmont" class of rooms...the lowest...but at over 800 sq feet it was hardly roughing it. The rooms are spacious and sensible - there was a mini-fridge and microwave, in addition to a separate living area. Our lanai was great - albeit with partial "parking lot" view. The downside...the carpeting is worn, and the furniture is a bit tired. The decor is a bit shabby and could use a makeover - we had some very strangely upholstered armchairs that didn't really seem to fit, and the paint on the ceiling was chipping a bit. The hotel grounds are immaculate. The adult pool was relaxing (and quiet), however we tired quickly of the costly add-ons. $12 for a poolside drink, $20 for a sandwich. Even the cafe was pretty overpriced, with $10 smoothies and $5 lattes. Internet is $15 per day and the room service menu borders on ridiculous. Luckily there is free parking if you do not want to use the valet service! Wailea is VERY quiet and not a good base if you are looking for lively goings on after about 9 pm....upon arrival at 10pm we had no dining options on site, and ended up ordering a $20 fruit plate from room service. Ouch. The walking path between the Wailea resorts is nice, and if you are so inclined, the resort is located close to Makena beach. Overall....a nice experience, but not one that I will dream about when I return home.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Red
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 days at the Kea Lani in early February 2009. We've stayed at the hotel before ... and we'll be back. Our room was on the 6th floor of the main building with a "deluxe" ocean view. Each of the rooms within our suite were spacious & the bed was comfortable. A free membership to Fairmount's President's Club got us free wireless internet access and the room safe was large enough to fit our laptop & other stuff. The entire resort was clean & very well maintained. All of the staff members who we encountered; the valets, front desk people, the concierge staff, housekeeping and the beach staff, were pleasant, helpful and always at our service. The hotel has a great beach and Wailea is a beautiful, upscale, low key area. We took full advantage of the beach walk that hugs the shoreline from the Kea Lani almost to Kihei. Its a short walk to the Four Seasons, Grand Wailea and the Shops at Wailea ... so we were able to walk to lunch and dinner on several occasions. For our taste, the Kea Lani is the place to stay in Wailea because of its great beach, its understated luxury and its just the right size so it doesn't take you but a couple of minutes to get from place to place within the resort. Oh by the way, we had 2 great dinners at Nick's Fish Market Restaurant, which is in the hotel. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - Spacious Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani was in room 660. This hotel features accommodations that are all 2-room suites or villas. My suite was beautifully decorated, well-equipped, and spacious. The living area featured a comfortable sofa, well-lighted desk area, and wet bar with microwave and refrigerator. The bedroom and bath were thoughtfully laid out every possible amenity was provided. The balcony with table, chairs, and lounger spanned the entire length of the suite and had ocean views. I was even able to see whales in the distance. Internet access was available for a fee, but, I was able to connect to a nearby wi-fi signal for free. Morning newspapers are delivered each day. Although my room was clean and fresh, the hallway areas are in need of some attention. The lobby area is spacious and has a beautiful cocktail lounge with comfortable seating and views of the ocean. During my stay there seemed to be a few corporate meetings and dinners scheduled at the hotel. One outdoor dinner was held under my balcony and was quite noisy until about 9pm. Each employee that I encountered was helpful, friendly, and ready to assist in any way possible. I appreciated the lei greeting which was accompanied by a welcome drink. The Business Center has complimentary internet access/printing availability and there is a 24-hour fitness center. The fitness center has a variety of Techno-Gym cardio and workout machines, as well as a selection of free weights. The Fairmont is located at the end of a very pleasant beach walk and it is possible to walk to the other hotels, resorts, and shopping mall on the sidewalk along the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “mildew smell in the room, black mold in pool caulking”
Reviews.Author: AlexTLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani was recommended to me as a great family vacation from someone who claimed to be a hotel snob (as I confess to be). The great thing about this hotel is that all the rooms are suites which is fantastic if you have kids. And this was a nice aspect. I was disappointed, however, the first room we were assigned to had an overwhelming smell of mildew (perhaps a common problem in an environment like Hawaii--- however, at five star prices, I expected better). We asked for another room and were given a comparable room which I thought smelled ok, but later realized the mildew smell was just more subtle. The other thing that was really disappointing was that the caulking around the edge of pool had that black mold stuff in it, like you find in an old bathtub. I was really kind of grossed out by this and it made me not want to hang around the pool, kiddie pool too, which of course our son wanted to spend the whole time in. Basically, it seemed like the pools needed to be redone and the resort just hadn't spent the money to do it yet. We had a good time at the resort anyway. But if I had to do it again, Id skip the suite and get one a room at the Four Seasons next door, we had a drink there and it was really spectacular. We still talk about the mojitos we had there. I think their golf-view or garden view rooms are pricewise comparable to our "partial ocean view", which we had to lean out over the side of our balcony to see the water anyway. And to be at the Four Seasons would have been worth it. We did use a hotel babysitter to take care of our 2 year old one night and we were very pleased with her. She brought games and stickers and our son had a great time with her. Overall, I didn't love Maui. It was super touristy and crowded compared to Kona where we had been several times and loved.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort property”
Reviews.Author: SFRookies
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay here was the second time in the past year and we absolutely love the Kea Lani! We have found the service at the front desk to be consistently outstanding and if the previous reviewer had the gentleman who works at the front desk yell at him, he must have pushed some very serious buttons because i can't for a minute imagine this happening! The suites are spacious and the huge lanais are our favorite part, especially if you have an oceanview room. I do have to agree that the charge for a beach umbrella is quite cheesy and the Fairmont would do well to do away with this charge as it does anger alot of their guests. Also the cabanas are very pricey but we found lots of pool chairs and free umbrellas so it was not an issue with us but they could probably do away with many of them since they seemed to be used by so few guests and thus just are there taking up too much space. I also feel that if they priced their drinks poolside more reasonably that they would find more guests would purchase but we as well as many other guests just took care of most of our own refreshment needs. Other than that we found service to be very good, yes there did seem to be more mingling amongst the pool staff this last visit but to be honest it wasn't all that busy and there is only so much they can do for you. Seems some people think perhaps they should turn them over and apply their sunscreen perhaps?? We noticed alot more families this visit and lots of kiddies and the majority of the guests seemed to be from Canada. In my opinion the Kea Lani is the loveliest and most welcoming of any resort we have stayed at in Hawaii in our 8 visits to the island and they will be our first choice again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort but didn't love Maui”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelluv
Reviews.Content: West first of all let me say. If you are a young person and like the nightlife.....Don't go to Maui. There was really nothing to do at night other that go have dinner or a Luau. THe resort was huge and had great pools. THe room was great and the staff was also great, very nice. EVERYTHING was so expensive at this resort. I strongly suggest you go to the store and buy some drinks for your room. If you wanted a soda there was no drink machines, you had to go down to the bar or shops to get it. A can soda was $4. By the end of the week we must have spent $100 just on drinks. The breakfast buffet was great but cost $68 for me and my husband. But the thing that was tough was that if we wanted something else we would have to get in our car and go get something. It was not like other resorts where you could walk downtown and get something. So while I give the resort a 10......I give the island of Maui a 6. Go to the Big Island. If you do go to Maui...go to Mama's Fish House, Five Palms and Humahumanukanuapua.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: Richjendiaz
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from Maui after staying at the Fairmont Kea Lani and I have to say that I coud not have been happier. I had the best time at this place and the service was absolutely amazing!!!!! The staff was extremely accomidating as well as the place is just beautiful. The buffet was great and the restuarants were really great as well. I would have to say this was the best time I have ever had on a vacation. I would reccommend if you are going to Maui and staying at the Kea Lani, if you want to snorkle M you should go to Molokini, you should look into snorkeling with the Kai Kanani they are absolutely amazing ... my 7 year old son had never been snorkeling before and the staff made him feel very comfortable they even let him hangout on the surf board while me and my husband snorkeled and the sea turtle snorkle was great. The also have some pretty amazing pools 3 to count very nice :-) I would recommend the Kea Lani to everyone I know as well the Kai Kanani I really had a great vacation this past week and look forward to going again!!!

Reviews.Title: “If service matters, then best to avoid”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has drawn mixed reviews, and for a reason. We had been on the property several times before, and we had seen a room on more than one occasion--so we thought we would check in as an experiment. In past years, we had stayed at the Four Seasons in this neighborhood. We got a good deal for a room, but that was the only thing that was good about our stay. The room was fine--not as luxurious as some say, but certainly comfortable. The views were OK, but nothing spectacular. But the property's weak point is its service. We had a problem with our room at check in, and I thought we got it resolved, but the new room was worse--and so we went back to the original room. The front desk staff was unpleasant, and basically yelled at me, saying that there is no comparison with the Four Seasons, and basically saying the only room change he would discuss was a paid upgrade. We called his manager, got an apology, and a (sort of) nice amenity. And that was the extent of the service. The property was not crowded, but the staff was pretty non-existent. On multiple occasions, we saw groups of pool/beach attendants just chatting, while the pool area was not being kept up. Used towels were everywhere, and so were food and drink plates and cups. No one came around to offer to help with chairs, towels, or even food. At the beach, there is a charge for an umbrella ($9/hour), and this on a beach with no shade. Similarly, the hotel rents cabanas by the pool. Even so, none of this guaranteed service. And, in fact, when you add up the cost of the beach umbrellas and cabanas--the Four Seasons is a much better deal, since you get service, umbrellas, cabanas, and nice service with a smile to boot. At this property, no one bothered to say hello at any point or even acknowledge that there were guests around. The staff just looked unhappy or, at best, indifferent. Customers seemed to get in the way. But the real eye-opener was on our last morning. We complained to the President's Club staff about the service, citing specific examples--they offered us a free breakfast. When we went to get it, we were promptly seated and then no one came to take our order for over 15 minutes. So I complained to the hostess, who was deeply embarrassed, moved us, and then made sure we had a server who paid attention. So the stay ended as it had begun--with indifferent service and a lack of attention to detail. We were glad to leave when we did. The property could be really nice with minimal renovation but a lot of attention to improving the service. We now know that we will never stay here again, that the Four Seasons is worth the extra money, and that Fairmont is not a brand that inspires much confidence--the President's Club perks can not overcome the bad attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixreviewer
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani was just absolutely fabulous. From our pre-trip e-mails with great response from the staff and during our stay. We stayed the week of October 27, 2008 for our 20th wedding anniversary. There were 2 conferences going on at the hotel (a large Lions club meeting and a smaller Radiology Meeting), we hardly noticed as there was plenty of room for all to enjoy. We were on the 3rd floor in room 394 with a view of the ocean from inside and outside on lanai, I believe the odd rooms had a full ocean view. Room 394 faces the interior of the resort. Television in Living room had a sleep timer remote with an LG flat screen, Living room has a Denon DVD player and radio and the bedroom had a zenith with no sleep timer remote, although you could use the remotes interchangeably. There was a cordless 2 line phone on the desk which was nice. Internet access at the time of our stay was $14.95/day- but free if you join the â€œfreeâ€� Fairmont Presidents club prior to your stay. There are complimentary (2) washers & (2) dryers on floor 3 near room 350. There may be a set on every floor? The closet in the living room has a complimentary safe, big enough to hold a laptop. In the bedroom there are his and her closets. Not much drawer space though. The rooms underwent refurbishment in November 2007, and the hotel is kept up very well. The bathroom is truly very large. It was nice to have a refrigerator and a microwave. We stopped at Wal-Mart and picked up some items to have in the room on the way from the airport on arrival. The breakfast buffet was fabulous for us, there was only I believe 1 open air restaurant open at the resort for breakfast. You could order from a menu or the buffet. The buffet was included in our room rate with the gratuatity already included as well. If purchase separately it would have been $58.00 for two people (adults) + tax and tip. The Wailea Point condos are right next door as the Polo Beach club condos. The large island that you can see from the Kea Lani is Kahoâ€™olawe and smaller one is Molokini. When you sit around the adult pool they bring fresh pineapple and cold very fragrant wash cloths. Not sure if they also do this around the kids pool, but we really enjoyed this touch. We ate at Nickâ€™s Fish Market on the premises and took lunch from the deli (Ciao) to eat while at the pool. We also ate one day for lunch at the pool restaurant. The first night of arrival we ate at the restaurant on the patio. We enjoyed all the service. Every day in the morning, afternoon, and evening the rugs in the elevators were changed to reflect the time of day with a greeting. It was very nice and relaxing away from the hub bub of Lahaina. From the airport it takes about 30 min. to get to and from hotel. There are many nice restaurants a 5 min. drive in Khei if you donâ€™t go on main highway, go along the beach/ocean. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: C-Suite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for the first time a couple of weeks ago. The hotel seemed only 50% full and it shows that the staff has been cut back. Although we didnt have to wait too long for most services there was usually a delay. This hotel is not on the same par as a 4S or a Ritz Carlton but is classier than a Hyatt or Marriott. Ko was disappointing in service and food, Nicks Fishmarket was a happening place and actually exceeded my expectations. However I couldnt get a decent piece of Sashimi for the life of me at any of the Resort Facilities. The Spa is very small and doesnt offer the usual amenities found at most spas. I did enjoy the adult pool. However placing towels at 700 am to reserve a chair is getting tiring and to be honest quite rude. The Beach walk was a treat as well as the small but quaint beach outside the resort. I did enjoy my time there but if given a choice I would stay at the 4S next door any day over the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but beware your tab!”
Reviews.Author: headsinbeds
Reviews.Content: We loved our time here, but it adds up quickly! Our suite was spacious and gave us ocean views, evening turndown service was appreciated, and the pools were fun and not too crowded. We and other guests were spotting humpback whales breaching, from the shore! The food prices were definitely high, but our dinner at Ko was delicious (rack of lamb & lobster tempura), as was Nick's. My only "beef" was the All-American burger I ordered poolside - for $20, I got a big slab of meat with potato chips. Quite the markup, considering what little labour it involved. I also thought that charging $20 for Fairmont brand hand creme was a little much. This hotel seems to welcome a lot of corporate groups who can easily sholder these rates. Overall, a gorgeous property with gracious service.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont is worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: RascalRatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one week for our honeymoon here, and were more than pleased with our pick. On our first day, we had a light lunch by the pool, and the bill was $125. Needless to say, we ate out the rest of our time there.The hotel is immaculate, and the staff could not have been better. Our room was on the first floor and we had a small sitting area outside. I HIGHLY recommend the Fairmont Kea Lani!!

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated & Dis-Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SunnyTimes10
Reviews.Content: In April, we visited Maui and stayed at the Four Seasons and the Ritz. However, while at the Four Seasons, we walked down the beach to check out the Fairmont for a drink as I thought "maybe next time." I was initially torn between booking the Four Seasons and the Fairmont. Well, there is no comparison! I agree with the reviews below saying "This is not 5 stars." First of all, the beach is tiny, crowded and loud! Second, they did not get nice beach chairs with umbrellas like we did at the Four Seasons and I didn't see any service. Also, it looked like a dilapidated Miami hotel from the outside. I didn't even think I was in Hawaii. And the fitness center is on the side of the hotel and not very nice. And then the inside was worse! We were just grabbing a drink and the service was downright rude! In Hawaii?! Anyways, we tailed it out of there as fast as we could. I would actually stay at many of the resorts in Wailea before this one. Simply nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but definately not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: emichele22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in Maui, the Hyatt in Kauai, and the Fairmont in Maui for our honeymoon and the Fairmont was our least favorite hotel, by far. Granted it was the least expensive, but I expected more from a 4 or 5 star hotel. The room was nice, but seemed dark and outdated. The bathroom was large and up to date. It was a nice feature to have a shower and spa tub. We stayed in an ocean view suite and we did have a nice view of the property and ocean. We ordered room service one night, and it was the most awful room service food ever. The staff was friendly and helpful and the property had a swim up bar which was a fun feature. This hotel is much more "family-oriented" than honeymoon, and I would not recommend coming here for a romantic stay. Nothing is really luxurious about this property, its not romantic, and there are way to many kids running around the pool and beach to get that feeling. I think this hotel would be a great family option but not for your honeymoon. If I come back to Hawaii, I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: lwengle
Reviews.Content: First off, disregard the first review! This hotel is great! Nice lobby, beautiful beach, great scenic views and a clean overall environment. Adult pool and main pool are separated enough to prevent excessive noise. Food is a bit pricy but so is everything on the island due to its isolation. They offer a introduction to scuba course in the pool (as well certification courses). Location is great. close to main malls and plazas. 2 minute drive from WAILEA GOLF COURSES!! EMERALD COURSE IS INCREDIBLE!! things to do in maui: -snorkel molokini crater -if you are a diver, DIVE THE BACK WALL OF MOLOKINI -golf the emerald course in wailea - get plenty of beach and ocean time -surfing lessons (very close by)

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: sunnysky62
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Four Seasons so I can't compare the two, but this is definitely a first-class hotel. I was in heaven the entire time--the room was beautiful and room service kept it spotless, even leaving an orchid on our pillows with the next day's weather forecast during the complimentary turndown service each night. The property is gorgeous, the staff was very friendly, and the beach was heavenly. We like to workout, and were thrilled to find that the hotel gym was spotless and very well equipped! And there is an awesome trail along the shore for running. Food and drinks are expensive, of course, but that comes with the territory. I highly recommend both the Fairmont Kea Lani and the Fairmont Orchid on the Big Island for honeymooners--worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think!”
Reviews.Author: mikesanfrancisco61
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is not the Four Seasons. It wants to be the Four Seasons but fails. For example, pool service is infrequent, offers of fresh fruit and iced towel comes once. Pool food is quite expensive for what you get. Sandwiches over $20 presented in a biodegradeble paper box. You can get sandwiches for 1/2 the cost in the cafe but the sandwiches come with 2 inch thick bread on both sides! The adult pool is beautiful: royal blue and gold trim and the lounge chairs are wide and very comfortable. You have to grab your own towels from a stack. There is no assistance. At the beach there are lounge chairs but the hotel charges for an umbrella at $9/hr. Many of the sports activites cost. All this at the Four Seasons is free. The beach is staff is young and stupid. Simply just ignore them. They have no idea they are dealing with people who are paying $700/night. The hotel is all white and modeled after the Las Hadas hotel in Mexico. After our stay the hotel is ugly and an embarrassment to the Islands. There is a lot of concrete and open spaces for functions with fake green grass. The KO restaurant is over priced. An order of Lumpia is $17; however, service was excellent. Tried Nick's Fish Market. The staff is run by kids. No clue about wine and they try to impress you with their verbal description on specials. Food was awful and for the prices very dissapointing. Bread was stale! Last note: when we checked in we had to wait 15 min before a clerk became available. One clerk was checking in a guest and the other was on the phone. Neither called for help. Recommendation is to stay at the Four Seasons - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: blauer_goldfisch
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults/2 kids) stayed at the Fairmont the very first time. We liked the suite-like room, which give you more space if you are traveling with kids. We had an ocean view room and it is really worth it's money, because the daily sunsets are awesome! The service was nice and friendly. Just the turndown service arrived always a bit late for a family with little kids: 8 p.m. - so we had to schedule it for an earlier time. The furniture is a old fashioned but it was in good condition, the rooms also have kitchenette and big balconies. we always prepared a quick cereal/milk/coffee breakfast in our room, had it on our balcony and then headed to the beach. So we felt very comfortable there. We liked the spacious grounds and pool area that is easy to overview, and we appreciated the easy beach access. Polo beach is really nice, if it is not crowded - so better do not travel there in the high season. You can do snorkeling, kayaking and even watch turtels. Do not rent your equipment at the booth down on the beach: if you want to go kayaking or paddel surfing just go to the booth in front of the Grand Wailea (it's just a 5 min walk over the beach path fronting the resorts) and get all your gear for half the price. Same thing with snorkeling: get your gear at Maui Dive Shop in the Shops at Wailea for half of the price Fairmont charges you. It is also cheaper to buy a beach umbrella at Long's, K-mart or so than to rent one from the hotel just for one day. We also hated to do self-parking - but at least it was for free. We appreciated that kids under five eat for free at the resorts restaurants. But the food wasn't that outstanding when you don't want to eat the fast food/sandwich stuff every time. The Deli shop doesn't have a good price/foodquality ratio, too. But most of all - save the money for the breakfast buffet. It was included in our roomrate for the first days of our stay, so we took it but we would never pay for it seperately. It's expensive (30 bucks) and even the food selection may be good, you can't enjoy it because of the many birds flying around your table and trying to pick a crumb. They are really a plague and the hotel isn't doing very much to "protect" their guest against them. Birds are hopping over the buffet, where the offered dishes aren't covered to prevent the bird's piking! To say it clear: if you like birds pooping on your breakfast plate (be sure that happened to us) and picking the raisins out of your muffin when you just sip your tea, then go ahead and have your breakfast there. We found it more than disgusting and as I said I cannot understand why the hotel doesn't do a thing. Once we had breakfast at the Fourseason next door just to see if they also got this serious situation, but see - they don't! The food on the buffet was well protected, they had plate covers just in case you had to leave the table to get another butter or so. And if a lonely bird appears a waiter immediately took action and made him leave. That's what I expect from a 5star hotel. Overall we had a great time in Maui and the hotel has its pros as well as its cons. if you know how to surf around the cons (breakfast) you could really enjoy a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Expected”
Reviews.Author: captaindynamo
Reviews.Content: Nice property but not a 5 star hotel. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and most are what you would expect, exceptional service, beautiful grounds, luxurious rooms ect. The only part of that that the Fairmont Maui has is the beautiful grounds. The rest of the hotel is a 3 star rating at best. They charge 5 star prices though. Our first morning we ate at the buffet (the food was good) but we thought $30 each for a breakfast buffet was a bit much. And don't do the valet parking, most of the 5 star hotels we've stayed at have complimentary valet parking, the Fairmont charges $18 a day without telling you, there's no signage and no mention of a fee anywhere except on your bill. We booked the largest room they offer at the hotel and were very disappointed. The room is said to be 1100 sq. ft. but felt very cramped. In the bedroom there was about 18 inches between the end of the bed and the cabinet holding the old large tube TV. The furniture in the living room was old and outdated. We had a large wraparound balcony with a beautiful ocean view (very nice) which I now realize was part of that 1100 sq. ft. they quote for the room size. The only problem was the green lizard we had visit us on day 3. You wouldn't think we would have those type of guests on the 7th floor. And don't leave anything out in your room that's edible or you will have hundreds of small spider ants as inside guests as we did. We had to have our frig changed out because that didn't work, only one elevator was working for 3 of the 7 days we were there, things like that don't happen at 5 star resorts. This is the first bad review I've ever done on a hotel but I think we overpaid bigtime and want to save someone else from being disappointed as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: jenlev
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Kea Lani after having had a bad experience elsewhere. What heaven! We were upgraded to an ocean view suite which was a nice suprise. The suite was huge and well equipped. The decor and property could use some updating, but overall, no complaints. An added bonus was the hotel's attention to my son's food allergies. They were very accomodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous large suite style rooms and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: Puravida59
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th return to this property and it's always a treat. I booked an ocean view room and when I checked in they said I was on the 3rd floor so I knew the view wouldn't be that great. The property has 7 floors so I asked if there was anything higher. She said if I'd take 2 beds I could be on the 6th or 7th floor. I was traveling alone so I waited 15 min. and had a wonderful room right in the middle of the property on the 7th floor (rm 732). The view was spectacular and the rooms have one side with a sofa, TV, and desk area. There are doors that close to the bedroom area and a large verandah. Bathroom is stone and beds are very comfortable and very nice linens. Service was great other than the one time I ordered room service and told them I had to leave for airport in 45 min. They said they'd get it there fast. Waited almost an hour and had to leave. They didn't charge me and raced down to lobby to give it to me in a take out bag. They apologized but I ended up missing my flight. Crazy lines at the airport on Sunday's so be prepared for that if you have an a.m. flight. Also, the service at the pool was almost non-existent. I think they have a skeleton crew due to the season and occupancy being down. Still love the property regardless of the two service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Shanga La!”
Reviews.Author: BAM-St_Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea lani for 5 nights beginning on 10/3/08. The hotel is beautiful! The service is outstanding and the location cannot be beat. Each room is a true "Suite". Almost a mini condo! There is a seperate living room, bedroom and bath. All rooms are accsessed through closable doors with two TV's and alarge balcony. The balcony has a table with 4 chairs and a lounge chair. There are two pools. The serenity pool is reserved for adults and strictly monitored - a real plus. The breakfast buffet is great! We also ate at "KO" which is their casual dinning room. Food was good creative with a mixture of dishes. A big plus is the free business center. I recommend you take a helicopter trip through Blue Hawaiian Helicopters - great service, new equipment and very professional flight crews. Also drive to the lavender Farm and to Lahaina. A rental car is a must. Ther is much to see. I recommend at the shopping mall up the raod Tommy Bahamas, Joe's and Longhi's for Italian Food. Th road to "Hana" is overrated, very curvy and tight for most drivers. Take the snorkle trip to Molokai for a real adventure. I recommend asking for a room over the serenity pool for quiet . The main pool is busier and much noisier. For a great sunset view ask for rooms #756 - 761!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: MCHCA
Reviews.Content: Kea Lani is the best hotel in Wailea. The only hotel that comes close to it is the Grand Wailea but the GW is so big that it's difficult to navigate through and the people staying there are much more snobby. The Kea Lani feels more like a boutique hotel. The little market was incredible, my husband and I got food there for either lunch or dinner almost everyday. The pool was beautiful, the beach was unbeatable. Service was excellent and the rooms are all suites so worked perfectly for us since we have a baby. I highly recommend this hotel. It may not feel as luxurious as some hotels of the same price but makes up for it in personality, size and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation...”
Reviews.Author: RTangent
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani -- we were a little hesitant about trying this hotel, as we've stayed at the Maui Four Seasons several times and LOVED it. But the Four Seasons has raised the prices on their rooms about $200 a night -- and the Kea Lani's "all suite" setup seemed like a much better deal. And we needn't have been worried -- overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Kea Lani! Some pros: The property is beautiful, including the pools and beach area. Some reviews have mentioned feeling "crowded" by the pool or at the beach, but we never experienced that at all -- everywhere we went, from the pools to the restaurants to the beach, it seemed we had plenty of room to ourselves. Perhaps the hotel is more crowded during the summer months, when more families are traveling -- but this time of year it was perfect. The suites are roomy and comfortable, and the bathroom was large and clean -- great showers! We had an ocean view room with a huge lanai, which was nice for watching the sunsets -- but I noticed that the views of the mountains on the other side of the property were lovely, as well. So I can't imagine any room would have a "bad" view. The service was wonderful! Everyone we met -- from the people at the front desk to the valet parking attendants to the wait staff in the restaurants -- was friendly, helpful, and gave us great tips about the island. A few cons: The property IS a bit dated, which was evident now and then in small details -- but nothing so obvious that it ruined our overall positive experience. The food at the hotel restaurants was only so-so -- the best meal we had was actually at Spago next door at the Four Seasons. However, we loved the buffet breakfast at the Kea Lani, and the pool bar and grill was great for lunch or snacks. Overall, we had a very relaxing vacation, and would definitely return to the Kea Lani -- but we would probably head over to the Four Seasons for dinner...

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Character and Charm”
Reviews.Author: WorldTourBlog
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Fairmont for 4 very pleasant nights. I have absolutely no complaints although there are areas they can improve. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are comfortable and large with a nice private lanai and a small kitchenette with a fridge but no cooking facilities. Everything was very clean, but the furnishings and drapes could be updated, and the mattress was quite firm. The bathrooms are modern and huge with separate shower and bath and 2 sinks. The hotel is big but not overwhelming and never felt overly crowded. It has the feel of an old Hawaiian plantation, very open and airy, with large open grassy areas and easy access to the beach. We never had any problem getting a chair at any of the pools or the beach. The adult pool is great for swimming- never crowded- and all pools are open 24 hours. The waterslide was a lot of fun. The food at the restaurants was pricey but good (Nick's) but there is a nice little cafe with more reasonable prices and good coffee drinks. The hotel is a short walk from the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea, and we did go check those out to compare. The Four Seasons is definitely a step up in appearance and has the feel of a modern, 5 Star resort, but perhaps at the expense of feeling a bit more generic and perhaps smug. The game room and fitness center are both a big step up from the Fairmont, and they have free internet which is not available at the Fairmont. You will have to pay for self parking here, not at the Fairmont, and there is no resort fee at the Fairmont either. A coffee drink here is smaller and more expensive as well. The pool was clearly more crowded, with really no empty space and chairs packed in everywhere, and seemed to be more suited for adults than kids. I did notice more single people around the pool, whereas at the Fairmont it was mostly young families and honeymooners. The Grand Wailea is absolutely huge and has the feel of a Disney water park. It was packed and kids were everywhere. I couldn't wait to find my out of the place and go back to the comfortable and friendly Fairmont. We also took a drive up to the Ritz. Beautiful and modern, on the windy part of the island, has the feel of a golf resort/conference center, with beach access more of a hike and rather remote in that it sits by itself on a large peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Murdoc10
Reviews.Content: we stayed here at the end of june for 10 nights as part of our honeymoon. the hotel and location are amazing. we had previously stayed in Vegas for 4 nights before coming here and it was just like paradise compared to the hustle and bustle of Vegas. the staff were superb in their efforts and there was nothing to big a chore for them. the pool areas were fantastic with a seperate pool for adults where you were served fresh pineapple throughout the day. the beach was absolutely beautiful and the views amazing. i cant think of anywhere else i would have wanted to spend my honeymoon- and my expecteations where high as we had stayed in the bellagio in Vegas and had flown half away around the world to get there! for a perfect honeymoon- this is definitely the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed the Kea Lani Maui”
Reviews.Author: yahblo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani Maui several years ago (late review, I know). The resort was fantastic. We booked a suite, and it was large enough to accomidate 4 adults easily. The beds were very comfortable, giving us full relaxation. I especially enjoyed the walk-in shower that had no door. For some reason, I just thought that was cool. The bathroom was huge, easily the size of the master bedroom. The resort grounds were very well kept. I enjoyed walking around, seeing the sights. The only downside to the resort was the small beach. Granted, that part of Maui has beaches at a premium, but the beach was rather lackluster. Not a huge problem, but worth noting. The food at the resort was very good, albeit a little on the expensive side. All in all, the Kea Lani was one of the best resorts that I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: Exodus1
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a beautiful location. The service was great and although it is a rather large hotel, you would not know it as there was never a crowd anywhere (unlike the Westin Maui which we stayed at for 2 nights following). I loved the swim up pool bar and the view from the lobby. That being said, you are getting what you paid for which is a premium. We paid for an upgrade to a poolside room and loved every minute of it. We were able to save some money by having breakfast and lunch in the room which was steps from the pool area. I highly recommend strolling on the beachside trail which offers views you will never forget as you walk past many resorts.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Five Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: world_citizen61
Reviews.Content: We knew within a few hours of arrival at the Kea Lani that we did not want to stay there but could not move until the following day. Our room was extremely large and with a huge, beautiful bathroom but the furniture and carpeting were old and smelly. The hotel was so overcrowded that the pool area resembled a water theme park. There were beach chairs lined up all around the pools and overflowing into the grassy areas with elbow to elbow people and screaming children. At the entrance to the beach, there was an overflowing trash bin with dirty towels on the beach chairs and no available shade. After the first night, we moved to the Ritz in Kapalua, which was less expensive, and definitely of higher quality. Unfortunately, they had the same problem with lack of shade but at least the resort was cleaner, more beautiful and relaxing. The only redeeming quality of the hotel was the staff who were very accomodating and polite. Regardless, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: JanePNy
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this wonderful hotel. From the moment you exit your car and receive your lei to the moment you leave the facility, everyone you encounter is cordial, helpful and goes the extra mile to help you. The facility itself is beautiful; open air, easy to navigate from one place to another, immaculate. ( Early one morning we saw three men in waders cleaning the fish ponds in the hotel). All rooms are identical; the cost difference is location. All rooms (aside from villas) are spacious suites with separate bedrooms, sitting areas with sofabed, bar/microwave area and enormous marble bathrooms that would rival any Ritz Carlton facility. They have double sinks, snail showers and deep bathtubs. Maid service is twice per day with unlimited plush towels provided. We were traveling with a teenage granddaughter who was very liberal with her towel use and this was an appreciated perk. All rooms have a spacious lanai as well with table and four chairs as well as two chaises. The pool area is extensive. There is an upper and lower pool area connected by a waterslide as well as a separate pool in a separate area for adults only. There were activities provided near the family pool i.e. henna tattoos, lei making, etc. every morning. The beach was private and in a cove with beach chairs provided by the hotel. Food is pricey but that was the case all over the islands. The breakfast buffet was phenomenal and the service impeccable. The concierge (there were THREE) were helpful and solicitious and we utilized them extensively for insights and information i.e. the best day to go to Haleakala given the weather report at six am. The concierge called us at six am to wake us and tell us to go that morning. One night, my granddaughter had a stomach ache and the sundry shop was closed. Security got some pepto bismol for us and brought it to our room. This took a total of ten minutes from the time of my phone call. That's what I call service. The adage, 'you get what you pay for' comes to mind in reference to this hotel. It definitely is pricey but you are paying for the extra amenities and service and in this case, they deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort”
Reviews.Author: jacknmacksmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks with our two children under 5 years old. The rooms are all suites, but ours did not have a kitchen. The pools are nice as well as the beach. I don't think there were any kids programs specifically, but an entertainer came on Sundays and there was a small pool and waterslide for kids available. Food was very expensive on site and we took exception to some of the extras they charged to our room while we were there ($30 a day for a cot, charges for self-parking, etc.) However, with a little complaining, they removed some of the more superfluous charges. Still, the location is beautiful, the hotel is well maintained, the staff are very nice and everything is done very nicely. It's not quite as swanky as the Four Seasons next door, but then it costs a lot less. It's also not as noisy and expensive as the Grand Wailea, although for older kids I would recommend that hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: lglass
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was perfection! The location was great, the staff was the nicest, most helpful staff I had ever encountered. There was no detail too small. The rooms were gorgeous (we had an ocean view), the food fabulous (if a bit over the top price wise) and the amenities were delightful. i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a wonderfully memorable experience (so long as you had a high budget for the trip).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: vktang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and at the Four Seasons Wailea on Maui. We liked the Fairmont better. From the open air feel of the entire hotel and the gorgeously maintained property to the friendliness of the staff make this place a true haven and a great place to relax and get away from everything. The level of service was incredible. You are greeted with orchid leis for the women and nut leis for the men, along with some pineapple orange and guava juice to drink while you check in. Since our room was not ready, the front desk staff provided us with a hospitality suite that we only used for 5 minutes before our room was ready. The staff always said aloha with a smile and will go out of their way to help you. Once concierge staff member in particular was extremely helpful (her name is Missy and she is amazing! She made us reservations at a restaurant, booked us on a snorkel tour of Molokini, provided us with towels for the tour, as well as a laundry bag to keep our wet clothes in! All in a matter of minutes!) The adult pool is one of the nicest pools I have ever been to. While we were there, there was hardly anybody using it, so oftentimes, we felt like we had it to ourselves. The food was also very good on the property. Caffe Ciao has been replaced with an Asian fusion restaurant named Ko, which was delicious. The room itself was beautiful. We had an ocean view suite (room 338), and we did not want to leave! While, compared with the Four Seasons, the Fairmont may not have had some of the same amenities (e.g., no L'Occitane products, no sunscreen at the towel station), we thought that the hotel was a lot quieter than the Four Seasons. We much preferred the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: mhpTexas
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was absolutely perfect! We have just returned from a wonderful stay with four children, ranging from 3 to 13. The Fairmont was really wonderful in every way! We stayed in a two bedroom villa....highly suggest this route! It was fantastic having our own kitchen and laundry area, and I would definitely do it again! We had family staying at the Four Seasons, and although it is lovely, the grounds nor the rooms were as nice as those at the Fairmont! We cannot say enough about how great it was!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: barne123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon, and it was heavenly. We had a beautiful ocean view and enjoyed eating breakfast on the balcony each morning while watching the ocean waves breaking on the shore. The open air reception area is clean and inviting, the grounds were immaculate, and the staff was EXCELLENT. Cheerful, helpful, and hospitable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Truly outstanding. We had a delish dinner at Nick's Fishmarket right on site, and enjoyed the pools, beach, and walkway to the other beaches. The Fairmont is a bit smaller than some of the other nearby hotels, but we liked it that way. It felt less hectic and crowded. Just a note...to do most of the guide book activities, you have to travel a bit away from the Wailea area. So rent a car...or, in some cases, the Fairmont shuttle can take you. Would highly recommend the Fairmont Kea Lani. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: smnlefty
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Maui last week after being in Hawaii for 2 weeks. We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 5 nights at the end of our trip. The Hotel is in south Maui in the Waliea area. This area is much nicer than the Northern area and it appeared to be less crowded as well. We had a partial ocean view suite which was great for the three of us. With only one child; a 10 yr old boy, the suite was sufficient. The suite is nice but not the most luxurious. The bathroom is great and the shower is very large and doorless. I have noticed that some have written that the suites are showing their age and that is probably a fair statement. However ,the resort and suites are clean and are what you would expect from the Fairmont. We found the front desk staff and the valets very friendly and willing to do anything for their guest. The hotel also provides local transportation within the Waliea area from the hotel, 24hrs a day, free of charge. The main pool is large and has a one water slide. There was also an adult pool close by. At first sight the beach area is small but I did not feel crowded at anypoint. If you walk down the beach path toward the Four Seasons and Grand Waliea the beach is much larger. We would definetly stay here again and loved the hotel, the staff and the Waliea area. We ended our trip with dinner at Spagos during sunset which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Just like paradise...”
Reviews.Author: g35girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the privilege of staying at the Fairmont for 5 luxurious nights the 2nd week of June. I can't say enough about this resort. Everything was as expected and more.
