We experienced only one slight snafu at check-in (the room type I had reserved was only available for 3 of the 5 nights) and the manager on duty quickly upgraded us to a corner suite which had panoramic views of the mountain, beach and pools - it was absolutely breathtaking! The suite itself was more than comfortable and in my opinion nicely decorated in a Hawaiian theme. Housekeeping was exemplary and the bathroom amenities wonderful. I would stay at the Fairmont again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars?! NO WAY!!”
Reviews.Author: JSJJ
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with the quality and cleansiness of the rooms. The grounds were beautiful, the pools are great, service was good, but the rooms are in desperate need of remodel/upgrade! This hotel is not five-star caliber. The carpet was filthy, the sofa smelled, and our room had a bad odor to it. We did complain and requested a room change. Our new room was not any better. It was the same!! Also, we had company of a few "friends" in our room...cockroaches! UGH! Do yourself a favor and stay at the Four Seasons Resort. Wish we did!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: tmm03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for our honeymoon in October. When we were picking a hotel, we were debating between the Fairmont and Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea. Ultimately, we chose the Fairmont for a variety of reasons, some based on our friends' recommendations who have stayed at all three. What won us over was the fact that all of the rooms at the Fairmont were suites with a front sitting room and a separate bedroom. It was great to come back to our room at the end of a day at the beach or at the pool and relax in our room without having to jump into the bed. The bathroom is GORGEOUS. I've seen New York apartments that could fit in there! It's wonderfully appointed and the soaps, etc are absolutely refreshing. The service at the hotel is amazing. We were greeted with cool towels, juice and leis - tremendously relaxing and welcome after a long long flight! Everyone, from the room service and cleaning staff, to the bartenders and front desk staff, were amazing and friendly. They are SO good with honeymooners - everyone kept calling me Mrs. LastName - it was so fun. The dining options at the hotel are also fantastic - pricey (but what isn't in Maui), but delicious. We spent one night just restaurant/bar hopping at the hotel and had a great evening. The Fairmont beach is FANTASTIC - heads and shoulders above some of the others in Wailea, mostly because it is exclusive and doesn't get a lot of the public beach traffic that many of the other beaches have. It doesn't have some of the amenities as some of the others do (padded lounge chairs on the beach, guys with sunscreen greeting you before you hit the sand, etc) - but for the privacy, it's worth it. There is also great snorkling right off the beach and you can rent gear right from the hotel. We went out a few times. Whatever option you choose, you are guaranteed to have a wonderful time in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kookygal
Reviews.Content: my husband and i booked our trip throught costco and got a really great deal. about 3 days after i booked it costco called to tell us that the adult pool was going to be closed for resurfacing. i was a bit peeved as this was our belated honeymoon and the adult pool was a plus. i called the fairmont directly and spoke to a manager and he was awesome. he upgraded us from ocean view to deluxe ocean view. this was just the start to the incredible service we were treated to. upon arrival we were greated with juice and cold towels. the open air lobby was a siht for sore eyes looking out onto the beautiful grounds and clear blue ocean. everyone working there was so friendly starting with the bellman who brought our bags to the room. the manager who we had spoke to several times before arrival had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our very clean and inviting suite with an amazing view from everywhere in the room. the bed and pillows were absolutely comfy. the bathroom was sper roomy, with double pedstal sinks and a huge open walk in shower. every suite has an expansive lanai. so even though the adult pool was closed the other pool was lovely. polo beach was private and terrific. the lobby bar was great for sunset watching. i think we lucked out and the hotel was only about half full so it seemed we were almost doted on. our waitress at the excellent buffet breakfast remembered our name after the first day. the alhoa spirit was all over this place. it is not cheap but we went and looked at the four seasons, grand wailea and the big hotels in kaanapali and for the money i wouldn't stay anywere else. it was magical and truly hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: slw71881
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days for our honeymoon -- a wonderful trip. We started in a suite about the ballroom, but after a particularly noisy night when we couldn't open the balcony door due to cigarette smoke, they upgraded us to a gorgeous room close to the ocean on an upper floor for our last two nights. The resort is extravagant. We loved the free yoga, and just missed the free canoe rides multiple times --bummer (honeymooners = not punctual, apparently). We took advantage of the free car service to go to the shops at Wailea and buy juice, snacks, and rent fins (we brought our own snorkels and masks). Definitely a good choice. We snorkelled straight off the beach three times, and went further south (again, via car service) once. We took the car service to the Four Seasons for an amazing dinner. (Oh, wow. Sunset, perfect beach views, we watched a wedding, and the food and wine were spectacular. We were sated.) Walked back along the lit ocean path afterwards, and then went for a swim in the deserted but lit pool -- amazing evening. Meals and pool side drinks were impressively expensive (maybe not for Maui/resorts, but compared to Seattle they were something else). We'd budgeted ahead of time and just tried to ignore it. Pineapple slices and cold towels brought around at the pool were lovely. Pool people watching was quite amusing. Views were amazing. Food was quite good, if expensive, and occasionally exceptional. Coffee and a bagel from the ground floor cafe was the way to go, but the full-service brunch was a yummy alternative. Loved the pretty bathrooms in the rooms. The grounds were amazing. We left feeling extremely pampered and that all of the money was worth it. Great memories and amazing photos. All and all, we completely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lindsinic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for our honeymoon. It is, to this day, one of my favorite resorts. It is very large with adult-only pools, which was nice. The short stroll down to the beach was beautiful. There were many things to do at the resort alone...watersports, sunbathing by the pool/beach, numerous restaurants, shopping, entertainment, etc. I would definitely go back to this resort, maybe for an anniversary. Our room was beautiful with a full balcony, open marble shower, garden tub, his and her sinks, separate living room/bedroom and a wet bar with sink and small refrigerator. I was pleased with the service and friendliness of the staff. I have no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - loved the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: NCTravelMouse
Reviews.Content: This is one gorgeous hotel. The grounds are breathtaking! We were greeted after a 16-hour journey with immediate curbside service to park the car and take our bags. While we checked it we were presented with leis, fresh juice, and cool towels - lovely! The bellman was very friendly and gave us tips on the hotel and things to do in Maui. I just donâ€™t understand the few reviews saying this hotel was rundown?! How could you possibly say this hotel was rundown? I saw no evidence of anything worn, broken ,or old? I donâ€™t know where these people are used to staying but Iâ€™d like to stay there! We stayed in the north section, room #617. I liked the room layout. Our kids (9&12) were with us so having a separate bedroom was a must. The furniture looked new and nice, as did the bedding, the carpet, etc. The bathrooms are very nice (huge & marble) as was the lanai. I loved our view, even though it wasn't oceanfront I think I preferred it because you could see the ocean one-way and Haleakala the other. And it was quite, no pool noise or conference people noise. We ate breakfast out there almost every day to the sounds of the birds. I really canâ€™t imagine spending extra for an ocean-view room. We found we were hardly ever in our room. Weâ€™d normally be up and out by 7:30 or 8 to enjoy the cooler morning and wouldnâ€™t be back until after sunset (which is ~6 pm). I would rather have the extra $200+ a day for an ocean front room to spend on eating out and other activities (spa, helicopter, etc.) The only drawback to the room was the beds. The sleep sofa wasn't comfortable (most aren't) but the king wasn't much better. Didn't bother us too much until we moved later in the week to the Westin and slept on the Heavenly Bed to compare. The beds were MUCH better at the Westin. (And the Westin doesn't charge $30 a night for a rollaway as does the Fairmont. They provide a rollaway Heavenly Bed for free - our 12 yr old liked that after the sleeper sofa.) Pools were great and the kids loved every minute. And the beach was wonderful - my favorite part. I read some other reviews were people complained that it was small but I LOVED it. It was secluded and beautiful - light sand, black lava rock, and the views! I much preferred the Fairmont beach to Ka'anapali later in the week. It was very peaceful and private. We snorkeled right off the beach and saw the best turtles of the trip. We rented our gear from Snorkel Bobâ€™s (much cheaper than the resort) and kept it all week. Only other negative for this resort are the food prices. REALLY expensive!! I was expecting expensive but $22 for an omelet is out there, especially when you are a family of 4 and there for 9 days. We only ate one meal at CafÃ© Ciao on our last night. It was good but nothing life-changing for the high price. We bought groceries (which are expensive enough) and ate breakfast and a lot of lunches on our own. We also ate in several restaurants off the resort in Wailea and Kihei. Resort cocktails were $12-$16 a piece. We had a few then bought our own at the ABC store. However, I did think the coffee from the resort coffee shop was reasonably priced and very good. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Example: when I called for extra pillows they were at my door in minutes. When my child got sick at 12:30 am one night (yuck) I called the front desk and they had fresh linens at my door in minutes, removed the soiled ones, and even offered to come in and make up the bed. The gentleman was very gracious and didnâ€™t make me feel bad. We did have trouble accessing the internet in our room. It was a free service as members of the Fairmont club, but we were never able to get it to work (could be on our end) but we were able to access it in the outdoor bar area via WIFI. Overall, this really is a grand hotel. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Wailea is lovely and felt like pure paradise. As mentioned, I liked South Maui a bit more than West but the whole island is great. I mean it is Hawaii after all! A bad day there is better than a good day almost anywhere. So if you are stressing over choosing a resort, donâ€™t. Every one I saw looked amazing so it would be hard to go wrong. Aloha! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fffaaazzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 17 to May 20. To sum it up, we booked another trip to the Kea Lani as soon as we returned home. Donâ€™t believe the other reviews. I'm very surprised from some of the reviews about the Kea Lani; the hotel is in great shape. Our room was perfect and very well-maintained. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We stayed at the Four Seasons about three years ago. Our room at the Kea Lani was much biggerâ€¦ itâ€™s an all suites hotel. Also, the grounds are much larger than the Four Seasons, and the pools are much bigger. Don't miss the free outrigger rides, and be sure to rent a sea kayak for an early morning paddle. I would recommend the Kea Lani if you're planning to stay in Wailea. Also, a good place to eat in Kehei is CafÃ© Olei; and of course, Mamaâ€™s fish house in Piaia. Thanks to the staff of the Kea Lani for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not Even Close to 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: beauoli
Reviews.Content: Great location..nice grounds...Hotel in need of a MAJOR RENOVATION..very run down..no personal touch for a 5 star rating..I would only give it 3 stars at the most...My husband and I wanted to stay at The Four Seasons which was located next door but our friends insisted on staying at this hotel. We went over to see The Four Seasons and I was truly sorry I had not been a little more insistent.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: cmcroxanne
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui - were there for an incentive trip - and we absolutely loved the Kea Lani!!! The suites were awesome - it's so nice to have a huge room with the bedroom and living area separate! The bathroom is also very big, with a walk-in shower and a nice big bathtub. I never used the shower because I loved the tub so much! There was plenty of closet space, too, which is so nice when you have as many bags as we had. I had read the previous reviews where some of the people talked about how the rooms needed to be "updated" - we actually stayed in 2 different rooms and both were beautifully decorated - everything was very nice! The hotel grounds were beautiful and the pools were very nice! We didn't get to eat at Nick's Fishmarket, but we heard it was fabulous! We ate at Cafe Ciao restaurant and it was very good!!! I don't know what the other people ate there that they didn't like, but we both stepped out of our Texas comfort zone and ate things we otherwise would not and it was excellent. Yes, everything is pricey, but you have to expect that in Hawaii! We learned that when we were in Oahu a few years ago. Polo beach is actually bigger than it looks in pictures and they have activities for you to do from there. My husband and I went out on a double kayak and he went snorkeling. They also have umbrellas that you can rent for the day - not sure how much, but I don't think it's that expensive. The resort is located in Wailea, which we thought was the nicest place on the island - that and the neighboring Makena. It never rained there and the water was gorgeous - hardly any wind on that part of the island. We suggest renting a car - we rented a jeep for the week and really got to see a lot of the island. We took the Road to Hana - quite an experience! We also went up to Lahaina and ate the Hard Rock there. We did a Rainforest/Waterfall Hike which was okay - If I had my choice again, I would probably pick the Snorkel Sail excursion over the hike, but the hike was still okay. All in all, it was wonderful - we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great fof little kids, service needs work”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Mommy78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our 2-yr old son. The grounds were easy to navigate, crowding wasn't a problem and the kid's pool was terrific. However, if you are not a 2-yr old, it lacks a lot for the price. Our first room was directly over the conference room and at night the conference room hosted a party with live band until midnight. The music was incredibly loud and rendered us unable to sleep. After we complained to the front desk they offered to move us and the next day we moved to a room at the other end of the property, near the pool. Note: if you have kids that like to play outside, request a room on the ground floor near the pool. There are no enclosures so the kids can run around on the grass and you can watch them from your patio. Other than being overpriced as many other reviewers have mentioned, my only other beef was with the staff. With the exception of the Concierge, they were generally disinterested in helping, lacking kindness and enthusiasm. We also noticed this at other places on Maui (restaurants, stores) so it may just be a Hawaiian thing but we don't recall this kind of careless attitude from past trips. We've stayed at the Grand Wailea as well and our family agreed that we will go back there or try the Four Seasons before we come back the to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Worth EVERY penny!”
Reviews.Author: SaremyTravels4Fun
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani was expensive no doubt-- but it was worth every penny!!! The suites were beautiful with lots of space, updated, and clean. The bathrooms were wonderful- a huge bathtub and two sinks. The views were great!!! The parking was easy... the location was IDEAL!!! The food was delicious!! The pools were amazing, a little crowded, but very nice. And the service was unparalleled-- by far the best place we've stayed. If you're going to go to Maui-- don't do it on a budget (you'll blow it anyway when you get there and see a cucumber selling for $5!) haha Spend the money and stay at the Fairmont-- you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family getaway”
Reviews.Author: merc3gem
Reviews.Content: I've been to the kea lani before, in a suite, last november. I thought the service was great then. When I decided to take the family there I rented a villa. It was definitely a splurge. There were nine of us, 4 adults and 5 kids. A villa was a great idea because of the toddlers. When we arrived, I felt like they knew us. We were wisked away in a golf cart by Travis - we didn't go to the front desk - to our villa. There were two great welcome baskets of snacks and fruits waiting for us. The kids had a note from "Auntie Jazz" for a free treat in the deli. The gellato in the deli is yummy. Room service was great.

Reviews.Title: “All I can Say is WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tvince23
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed at. From the moment we arrived we felt like kings and queens. The Staff is unbelievable and the grounds are amazing. We walked into the lobby and the ocean was right there. The pools were not only large but there were three of them and some were only for adults. The slide was also alot of fun and it was a great thing seeing both my parents enjoying this luxury. My brother got married here during february and his wedding was so beautiful. They were married right on the beach with a beautiful sunset in the backdrop. By the way one of the most amazing sunsets also. Everytime we went somewhere (Haleakala, Road to Hana, etc.) the staff always asked how was the trip???? It just seemed that they cared about you a little. If you go to Maui don't leave without seeing Haleakala, the Road to Hana, snorkeling turtletown, or going to a luau and If you can afford to stay at this hotel ($500/night+++) it is totally worth the money.......

Reviews.Title: “NOT FIVE STARS”
Reviews.Author: StudioCityTraveler54
Reviews.Content: My DH lived in Maui for 9 years and I visited monthly for 4 1/2 years, so I am very familiar with the area. I was greatly disappointed in the Kea Lani. The suite was very large, but dated and needs a complete renovation. The bathroom was also huge, but had no shelves at all. The prices for everything were the most outrageous I have ever seen. I will not stay here again. The grounds are very nice, but not worth this kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an amazing place!!”
Reviews.Author: tank11
Reviews.Content: 1st we were there on our honeymoon and went through costco travel agency and found the best rate for us. we had a side room with a view of a mountain, beautiful landscaping and barely a view of ocean. however the room was amazing! just beautiful! great service. food is pricey but that is par for the course in hawaii! everywere you go! pools gorgeous, the entire landscape of the property is amazing! it was a little crowded while we were there but nevertheless the service, room, and concierge desk was great and helpful! we would definitley recommend this place! it was breathtaking, and a place we WILL RETURN TO! honestly there was so many amazing things about maui and this resort that i could write a book! GO GO GO GO GO

Reviews.Title: “Still Like the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: noname36
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Spring Break vacation in Maui, kids aged 11, 9, 7. We stayed at the Kea Lani two years ago (in the villas) and loved it. This time we also stayed in the villas and still enjoyed it very much... POSITIVES: location - we prefer Wailea to the other areas of Maui size - the resort is not a mega hotel and doesn't feel too overwhelmingly crowded even during holiday times cabanas - you have the option of renting cabannas at the pool or umbrellas at the beach if you don't want to worry about getting up to save a spot food - restaurants/food are on site if you choose not to cook as opposed to condos accommodation - villas offer excellent size accomodation for a bigger family and the plunge pool/patio is hours of fun for the kids layout - villas are close to the beach and very convenient to get in and out of, front and back door right onto hotel grounds, no elevator hassels resort layout - excellent, lobby, grounds, beach staff - mostly friendly and accomodating (not all but most) family friendly NEGATIVES: -cafe ciao restaurant..average food/service-high prices -pool loungers are getting very tired, and uncomfortable, feeling the metal through the pads. -hotel seemed more crowded this time as opposed to spring break two years ago, still not unbearable, but busy - wailea in general is feeling more touristy than it did two years ago - to be expected i guess. -breakfast restaurant did seem a bit nutty at times and the staff there seemed to take forever to serve us even though it was buffet - all they had to do was drinks?? we often went elsewhere. -villa kitchen cabinets could use an update and no the living area is not huge, it's quite narrow, but we tend to be spread out between the patio/pool and three tvs..so it doesn't bother us...our utility room/laundry room, was extremely noisy - i.e. sounded like there was always loud laundry going even when there wasn't, we had a water back up of some sort in there they had to come clean up on an evening when we had company so there was maintenance traipsing through with clean up vac and towels etc during our BBQ. It bothers me to think they are just neglecting these minor things because they can (quite frankly) and they know the tourists will keep on coming. Overall we do love the Kea Lani VILLAS and will continue to stay there because we haven't found anything to match the experience in terms of space, plunge pool and convenience, but if i were booking a regular room or two and wanted a pampered overall experience I would give the four seasons next door a try. We went there for dinner twice and remembered why the four seasons always stands out so much compared to most hotels...they just take everything up a notch in terms of service...they have a kids menu, a teens menu, an adult menu, oh let us bring your kids something to nibble on before dinner is served, they must be hungry, it's too long for them to wait..impeccable service both times and this was their casual restaurant..as i said if it weren't for the villas...I'd be steppin out on the Kea Lani just to see if the grass is greener on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MBLMcLean_Virginia
Reviews.Content: Reading a critical review of a hotel I usually take it with a grain of salt and think the writer is a littly cranky or just thinks being hyper critical is being descerning . That said, we hated this hotel. We were there for one night during spring break. Our teenage daughter liked that there were other young people there and she liked the pool. Otherwise, we were disappointed with the hotel and could not risk ruining our hoilday by stay for more than one night. We hated the thought of losing our depost, but were willing to risk it, we wanted out. We did not lose the deposit. The hotel looks lovely, and is sited beautifully, but it is run down, badly worn, and in desperate need of renovation. We stayed in a two bedroom ocean front villa, with a pool, we thought how wonderful and beautiful until we went in. The villa smelled horribly, a musty unclean smell, the furniture was shabby, unfashionable, and worn, we were uncomfortable, and didn't want to sit on the furniture. We paid over $2000.00 a night, it was the absolute worst hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. The beds were lumpy, no one slept well, it was noisy, and the smell made us feel sick, we just wanted to get out of there, so we didn't pay attention to other things. The beach was nice but crowded, people packed very close together, literally you sit almost a foot away from someone else. To close for my comfort and not my idea of a upscale resort atmosphere, nothing here seemed upscale, or worth the price. I hope if you choose this hotel your stay will be better than ours, we tried to like it but we couldn't. We have stayed at the Four Seasons Maui, many times and love it. During this trip we also stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Maui and found it to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Horseymama
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great service and clean, manicured grounds. We stayed in both the villas and the rooms. The villa was convienient and close to the beach, but I thought the living area in the villa was small. The bedrooms and bathrooms were big, however. The rooms in the hotel were huge and the living area in our room in the hotel was almost bigger than that in the villa! We had our two sons, 8 and 14 with us and the 8 yr. old had a great time, but the 14 yr. old was bored. I have to say, this hotel was beautiful, great service, great layout, but there is not a lot to do if you like to be active. The beach is cute, but small and there are no waves for surfing, just a little beach break that the little kids play in. So we ended up driving a lot to get to other places to surf, hike, dive, etc. Also, it would have been nice if there were some kind of night life other than just a bar scene, i.e. music or dancing or something! The pool was great, there are all-ages pools, and then an adult pool, which is a nice idea. The water slide was fun. They do nickle and dime you a little with the price of food and other things here, but we just went to the grocery store and got lots of drinks and snacks. I did go to the spa, which was very good. They have a great variety of treatments and are very flexible with schedules and canceling and re-scheduling things at the last minute. The spa area itself is small. If you want to relax and do nothing, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “V Nice Hotel, Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: cityNeil
Reviews.Content: Went for a week's holiday with my wife, 4 kids age 6,5,3 and 1. We had a great time. The hotel is spectacular, the pools are nicely kept and appeared clean and the beach was lovely. The buffet breakfast was spectacular and good value (for kids at least). Under 6 yrs old do not pay and 6 and over pay half. My honest assessment of the rooms: They are a good size, a bit tired, and in need of refurbishment. The sofa beds were uncomfortable and there was a bit of a damp smell. The doors were incredibly heavy and slammed shut. My honest assessment of the service: Outstanding, without fault The food: Cafe Ciao was good but expensive and room service was excellent, especially the kids menu. The pool side cafe was only average. Nicks Fish Market was very good The pool: V nice but became too crowded around Easter weekend. A chronic shortage of shade for us pale-skinned British! It was a real struggle to get an umbrella. One morning I went down to the pool at 7 am and all the umbrellas were taken. There were some nice activities for the kids and overall we were happy with our stay at the fairmont but feel they should pay attention to the pool (shade) and decorate the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: binz26
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel during Spring Break, and I would say that the staff was a bit overwhelmed with the number of guests. However, this hotel is supposed to be a resort hotel capable of providing 4-5 star service to a huge number of guests, because it really is a huge hotel, and they were definitely not up to the challenge. The staff was very businesslike, but not friendly. We were awakened twice in the middle of the night by the overnight cleaning staff below our ocean view room. Coffee service is provided in the morning, but only until 6:30 AM, when it is removed so that guests can go downstairs to PAY for their coffee. The ocean view path is very nice, but it is very crowded in the morning with hell-bent joggers. A woman actually ran into me jogging while trying to squeeze through the traffic. Beautiful landscaping and view (it is Maui, after all), loud and noisy lobby, salamanders in the motel-like rooms. The Grand Wailea and Four Seasons might be better options based on our visits to those properties.

Reviews.Title: “No Paradise here!”
Reviews.Author: boomerScottsdale
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a spring break stay here and we were incredibly disappointed. We arrived and were told our room wasn't ready yet even though it was 2 pm. The desk suggested we have lunch at the poolside cafe while we waited for our room, when we went there the tables were filled with dirty dishes and kids running all over like it was Disneyland. Believe me I've been to Orlando over spring break and this wasn't the atmosphere I was looking for or led to believe the Kea Lani was. We weren't informed our room was finally ready at 4pm even though we were told we would be called on cell when it was. When we did get to our room, which was very large and roomy by the way, it had a musty smell to it and our "oceanview" room was really only a partial oceanview even though we paid for a full oceanview. The staff seemed too overwhelmed with the crowds to provide any "personalized service". Pools were crowded, there were waits at all the restaurants, birds eating and pooping on the brunch, were unable to rent a kayak the whole time we were there because they were spoken for by 8 AM. We actually tried to find another hotel to stay at but were told by the manager that we would be responsible for the full stay at $699 per night if we left and she was unwilling to try to make things better. The hotel doesn't offer any nightlilfe except a guitarist who plays from 6-8pm and than there is nothing to do and Wailea is far from any areas that have nightlife. I'd suggest a hotel in West Maui which is close to Lahaina if you're looking for some evening fun.I've stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels all over the country and this is nowhere in comparison, even faxes weren't complimentary at $3 a piece. Staff hardly smiled and seemed to be just as miserable as we were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely would recommend the Fairmont Kea Lani!”
Reviews.Author: jaycee72
Reviews.Content: The Fiarmont Kea Lani, is an amazing hotel.. Everything was so clean, and beautiful. The rooms are HUGE! All of the food was delicious! Eat at Nick's fishmarket, every appetizer was mouth watering. They gave fresh sweet pineapple, and cold washcloths at poolside. It definetely took a bit long for the one waitress to get the drinks to you.. They do not have a large poolside staff, but they girl did work very very hard to keep everyone happy. The staff was extremely knowledgeable, and very helpful.. The only thing that made me a bit disappointed, was booking excursions/dinners. At the time of check in, we were not advised that the card you leave for incidentals may be contacted for authoriztaion. I had left my debit card for incidentals, and after booking over $2000 in dinners and excursions, the front desk contacted me for authorization. The problem was easily remidied, but just more on the annoying side! I would definetly recommend renting a car, it is easy enough to find your way around. There are some cute places to eat on S. Kihei Road if you want to venture off the hotel site. I would most definetely recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with Everything You Could Want”
Reviews.Author: pj24169000
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed that the Fairmont as a week vacation and we loved the resort. About 2 hours after checking in, most of the staff we came in contact with remembered us and talked to by name. There wasn't anything that you could want that this resort didn't have. There were gyms, spas, great food, and nice entertainment. This resort was a little more expensive than we expected but the service that came along with the pricetags made it worth the price. The only complaint I have is one that cannot be fixed by anyone at the resort. We were the youngest people at the resort. Only a very few people on the staff were as young as us, which made it hard for us to hang out with other people. That did not change how good of a time that we had. We did do a lot of shopping at the Shops at Wailea which have some great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: kengyen
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani on Maui is a beautiful hotel. Check in was done quickly. The hotel and it's grounds are beautiful. The beach was nice too. Thought the beach up from the hotel was nicer though . But everything was very clean. Staff pays attention to a lot of details and are very polite. Said hello everytime they saw us. Highly recommend the poolside candlelit dinner. It was very romantic. We had a suite. It was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: Niteout
Reviews.Content: Selected the Fairmont Kea Lani after reading reviews. The resort seems to have updated everything by now. Our room was beautifully decorated with both living area and bedroom with balcony overlooking grounds and ocean. (Pay the premium for an ocean view room it's worth it.) Service by everyone was genuine and friendly; small hotel atmosphere in such a large place. Hotel and grounds were immaculate. Very expensive, but the best overall resort among top hotels we've stayed at in our ten trips to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugSoCal1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Fairmont for a company-paid conference/retreat last month, and I was more pleasantly surprised than I have ever been with a hotel. All of the rooms (I believe) are suites, with a huge bathroom, living-room type area, kitchenette, and a large balcony. Our room also had his and hers closets with a nice white bathrobe hanging in each, which was a really cute touch. The grounds are also amazing. The architecture is a blue and white Moorish style which is really soothing and makes you feel like you are in the Greek Islands. Pools were great with one having a swim-up bar with TV's. The service is fantistic - especially Dillon, our pool waiter who didn't fail to keep our drinks topped off! One thing I noticed about this hotel was that there were fewer kids than at the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. We walked over the the Grand Wailea one day and I was shocked at the amount of people, and all the kids running around and screaming. I was so happy to be staying at the Fairmont which was a little more secluded and more quiet and romantic. I am pretty picky about where I stay, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: squirrelnibbler
Reviews.Content: Shipwrecked! We were brought here late one night after our cruise had left without the passengers due to stormy seas! What a treat! We've stayed in luxury hotels all over the world. This place was gorgeous. The bathroom was a proper room into itself. We had a suite, with bar/kitchenette. The pools and gardens were spectacular, (I'm an avid gardener) The buffet at breakfast had wonderful fresh juices, beautiful presentation! We wished we could skip the cruise and stay there. The beach was smallish, but with a wonderful view of Molikini, it doesn't get much better! Wish we could return soon. Only issue, the bath products were pretty packaging, but you can get better conditioner from Suave, small sacrifice. (we were without any clothes/toiletries so it really mattered)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: krislecl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Kea Lani. No complaints here. First off, the hotel is located in Wailea. At first we weren't too impressed with Wailea then we ventured to other areas of the island and realized it is probably the nicest part to stay at in Maui. The hotel is really pretty. Our room was very large. We had a wet bar with sink and fridge when we walked in then a separate living room area with large couch, tv and desk area. Our room was spacious with two closets. The bathroom was really nice. We had a large tub, stand up shower and two pedestal sinks. The terrace off the room with a table, chairs and also chaise loungers was really nice. We are a young couple and found that after dinner there really isn't much to do. The majority of people there are older couples or families. The staff was very nice and helpful. We liked that there were choices where we could eat. I used the exercise room twice and the machines & equipment are all very new and up to date however I highly recommed taking a run along the Wailea path instead of running on the treadmills, the scenery is very beautiful. Just like all large resorts, everything is very expensive ($10 for visine eye drops! in the hotel store!) If you are going to Maui, definitely rent a car so that you can explore all the other beautiful areas of the island. My fiance golfed on the Emerald and Old Blue courses and loved the Emerald Course. He said it's up there on his list of favorites. All in all good experience at the Kea Lani would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani is nice but not great!”
Reviews.Author: JMM1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the villa's at the Kea Lani. The size and layout of the villa is excellent and location to the beach cannot be beat. They are, however, just a bit outdated. The pools themselves are nice but do not have a beach view (something I find important). This is definitely a family friendly hotel and I would not recommend it for a couple looking for a romantic spot. I do have to say that the service was EXCELLENT. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant balance at Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: oregoncoastie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for about 10 days (end of January thru 1st week of Feb). We had a suite on the 6th floor with a beautiful view of the sunset, Molokini and Lanai. The room was very comfortable, open and breezy. The bath tub was huge - perfect for bubble baths! While there we had meals at all of the restaurants. Nick's Fishmarket was one of the best meals ever! Exquisite food, very romantic setting. We enjoyed watching a special dessert prepared on the plate by the server who was 'painting' chocolate designs on each diner's plate. Their breakfast buffet had a nice selection, food was ok, not great, but adequate. At Cafe Ciao we ordered pizza which was again, OK, not great. Their poolside service and food was very good. We especially appreciated the service at the Fairmont. The staff was always courteous and friendly without being obsequious or intrusive. We were addressed by name and greeted warmly. We especially appreciated our bellman, Dennis' friendly greeting and advice about local attractions. The Kea Lani shows great attention to detail in the design and maintenance of the facilitiy, and in the level of service, yet it never feels institutional or imposing like the some of the large nearby resorts. It was a lovely 'homebase' for our trip and we would enjoy staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with a swim up bar”
Reviews.Author: Juneflo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Kea Lani and were greeted with fresh flower leis and cold beverages. We self parked as it is complimentary and very close to the hotel. It was several hours before check-in and our room wasn't ready so we left our bags with the Bell Desk and went to use the pool. We checked back with the Front Desk a few hours later and the room still wasn't ready so they upraded us to a partial ocean view room that was ready. The room was amazing! It's an all suite hotel and the rooms are huge. The bathroom was seriously my dream bathroom. There was a fully furnished balcony, a large comfortable living area and one big ol' comfy bed. The room was not tacky at all as someone mentioned below. The accommodation was so great that I almost wanted to spend more time in the room than outside. The housekeeping service was perfect and they even did our own dishes that we had in the room from camping. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful, probably the best grass my feet have ever been in. The pools were very well maintained (loved the basketball net!) The pool attendants were perfect. They were there when you needed them and gone when you didn't. They even walk around serving fresh pineapple. Everything was perfect about the Kea Lani except for one thing and that was breakfast in the morning. The food was great but everything was outside so I was attacked by birds! Make sure you guard your food or they will take it! It was actually pretty funny. The service here was fantastic. Everyone was very friendly and professional and I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Go Back”
Reviews.Author: new2n
Reviews.Content: I travel often to higher end hotels and the Kea Lani was incredibly disappointing. Although the lobby is nice, the rest of the property is very tired and outdated. It started in the grungy dorm-like hallways with loud slamming doors, green and pink floral curtains and popcorn ceilings. The property is poorly layed out with villas that look like condos separating the hotel/pool area from the ocean, so you feel very far from the beach. The pool area isn't really that nice and they charge $150 for a cabana which are free at the four seasons. We were assigned a room that was occupied and although it was changed shorty after, the bellman was not notified so our luggage was delivered to the wrong room and a piece was lost when tranferred. They did little to help and we never heard from them even after my husband just went ahead and called the original room the next day and retrieved our things. I could go on but won't. Let me just day that after 2 nights we left and went to the Four Seasons next door. For a litte more, the contrast was startling! Don't waste your time at the Kea Lani - just go straight to the Four Seasons for a vacation you'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Fairmont experience”
Reviews.Author: ckm1956
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a week at the Kea Lani. Our room, a garden view, was wonderful. 800+ sq feet. The furnishings were clean and up to date. We were particularly pleased at the quiet. No elevators, no carts, no door slams. The staff was warm & friendly. They were attentive, but not overwhelming. If we needed anything, it seemed like there was always someone around. Yes, the restaurants aren't cheap. BUT, this is Maui and you are at at 4-5 star resort. We won't be back to Maui for a while, but we'll return to the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: purselady1
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from an 8 day stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We love Wailea and have stayed at the other hotels and villas several times. This was our first visit to the Kea Lani. The staff was wonderful--they were all friendly and helpful. Our suite was a fifth floor prime ocean view and the view was indeed lovely. The large lanai was a plus. The room's decor looked very dated and the mattress was terrible. The average highway motel has better bedding these days. For the money Fairmont charges, the beds should be top-notch. In addition, our room was terribly noisy. We could hear housekeeping carts rolling on the tile hall floors all day and part of the night. In addition. if the sliding door was opened, the children's noise from the pool below was loud, so the a/c was on nearly all the time. We ate at Cafe Ciao, which was very expensive for their "casual" restaurant. We didn't try Nick's Fishmarket, preferring to eat off the grounds for most dinners. Lack of regular maintenance shows. One night we had the inconvenience of the water being turned off from 10pm-6am in the entire resort. I had 2 excellent massages at their spa--definitely recommend that. With a little effort, the Kea Lani could be so much better--Wailea is a wonderful area to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Hurricanearv
Reviews.Content: We were at the Kea Lani the week of Jan 6th, as part of a large group (680 I'm told) from all over the US. The hotel is not only beautiful, it has a warm, relaxing atmosphere that you never want to leave. Even though the hotel was fully booked, it never felt crowded and service was not delayed. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. One morning we woke to a flat tire on our rental. The valet and front desk were quick to assist and shuttle me to Avis to retrieve another vehicle. The shuttles by the way aren't the usually smelly hotel vans. They use a Cadillac sedan and a Ford Expedition as their 'courtesy shuttle' vehicles to the surrounding area. That same morning my boyfriend lost his wallet. Again, the Kea Lani staff sprang into action and in less than an hour security delivered the wallet to him. A guest had found the wallet on the walkway that connects the hotel to the Four Seasons and left it at the front desk. He was pleasantly surprised to find his cash ($460) and credit cards intact. We wished we could have personally thanked the individual with a gift certificate for dinner to Nick's Fishmarket, but they did not leave their name. Nick's is wonderful, by the way. Be sure to make reservations for the patio at sunset. The Polo bar is also a great place to take photos at sunset. Although the bartender was busy trying to close up for the evening, he stopped to ask if we wanted him to take our picture. This is typical of the wonderful service at this hotel. The beach is incredibly relaxing. You can rent snorkel and scuba gear beachside as well as kayaks. Whales also frequent the area this time of year - there were so many sightings it seemed as if they are part of the staff. We visited the other hotels in the area but none better than the Kea Lani. It is really nice that you can valet at any hotel in Wailea for no charge. Not true at the West coast hotels. Naturally, the Four Seasons is beautiful and their service is impeccable - yet it did not surpass the Kea Lani. The Grand Wailea, a/k/a the "Big Unfriendly" is another story. It is massive and rambling. We tried to go to the beachside restaurant to watch the sunset and ended up lost in a maze through the kiddie pool area. The return to the lobby was more confusing. By the time we found our way back, we just wanted OUT! As an aside, we are not directionally challenged. We once put 1700 miles on a rental in Costa Rica, where there are few road signs. Yet we needed GPS at the Grand Wailea. The rooms at the Kea Lani are spacious, which gives them the edge over the Four Seasons. Just like the hotel, you feel comfortable in the room the minute you arrive. Unlike many of the chain resorts, the Kea Lani has personality which is unique to its location. This is accomplished not only through beautiful decor, but through their amazing staff. One of the hazards of traveling for work, is waking up in a Westin or Marriott and forgetting what city you are in. When you wake up at the Kea Lani, you know you are in Maui, and you smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels38
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely fabulous time during our recent stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Wonderful beach and pool facilities and the room was amazing. The staff were extremely helpful. You felt like they really valued your business. The front desk attendant who checked us in even remembered our onward travel plans 3 days later. Very personable and professional service. My wife and I would highly recommend the property... if you get a chance you won't be disappointed. Enjoy Maui! Port Moody, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a great oart of a great island = Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: TheinBomb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group of people in the same profession (water well drillers) as part of a prize/promotion package paid for by our industry's biggest (and best) supplier. Most of us (well drillers) are hard working business owners who do not have "fancy" tastes - but we do know a nice place (and a good time) when we see it. This is that place. To start with, the whole area (Wailea) is posh - full of very fancy resorts and expensive homes. You probably could not go wrong at any of the resorts. They all looked very nice from the outside (although I can say that the rooms at the Kea Lani are twice as big as those at the Grand Wailea). The beach, asphalt beach and street-side walk and landscaping are great at all of these places. Also, if you like one beach better than the other - no problem, they all appear to be public beaches (with chairs owned by the resorts and saved for their customers). You will be amazed at all of the "beautiful people" on these beaches (and the number of not so beautiful people who have got some big bucks). On to the Kea Lani itself, the grounds are just beautiful. They are lush and well kept. The lobby itself is wide-open and classy. The staff (all of them) are about as friendly and helpful as can be. Our maid service was especially outstanding. Each room is a two-room suite - with a large patio (accessible from both the living room and the bedroom). The bathroom also has doors from both rooms and is especially large. It has both a full bath and a tiled walk-in shower that was very nice. Each room also has a small fridge & microwave built into a cupboard area that is large enough to store a week's worth of food. The king-sized bed that we had could not be better. It is obviously a quality mattress that was not too firm or too soft (which would've given me back problems). The living room had a couch and a work desk. If I could change one thing about our room (and all the rest, most likely) it would be to update the decorating in this room with newer carpet and couch that show more of an island spirit. It did not take away from our appreciation of the room though as it truly was a nice room. The resort has three pools - an upper pool with a bar and a waterslide connecting to middle pool (largest pool) and a separate pool. It is a little odd that the pool with the swim-up bar is the same pool that has the waterslide. In other words, the kids pool is also the adults pool and the totally separate pool is the "quieter" pool. All were nice looking - although I did not swim even once as I can do that at nearly any hotel. We spent most of our free time around the hotel at the beach and using the beach walk to walk to see the beaches of the other resorts (a very nice walk). I snorkeled every day (saw lots of cool fish and several very large turtles). I think drink service was better at the pools but I think most of the people hanging around the pool were more into that service than those that were enjoying the ocean/beach. As I mentioned earlier, service is excellent at this place. Although they never reach out their hands to ask for it, you do feel obligated (rightly so) to tip often. The Kea Lani does offer free (plus tip) transportation to places in the area (not sure what marks the end of the area). We rented a convertible for our trip (recommend it) and they have plenty of free parking on site. My wife and I had a great time at this beautiful place. We met lots of people and also treated this trip as a second honeymoon. Maui is beautiful. If possible, forget about how expensive it is (not just here but everywhere in Maui), make memories and enjoy life!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Experience!”
Reviews.Author: #1Vancouverite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for our...you guessed it...honeymoon! Four nights and then we rented a condo elsewhere. While we are not "high brow" we have also stayed at some excellent four and five star hotels and resorts around the world. The Kea Lani is certainly in the top 5 for us. The food is a little expensive if you are not prepared for a luxury hotel stay but we were really not shocked at what the prices were. Really, what would you expect in one of the ritziest vacation destinations in Hawaii? We did find the hotel was filled with families and kids but it never really bothered us at all. In fact, we found it kind of lightened up things a bit, gave the place a bit of sincerity instead of stuffy and overdone. Incidentally while we're on it, while I liked dinner at the Four Seasons (Ferraro's - worth a reservation) I did find it to be stuck-up there - just a bit too rigid and overdone for us. Food quality at Fairmont was excellent. I am kind of shocked to see some people having problem with Nick's Fish House? You would really have to be watching and waiting for a screw-up to have a less than stellar meal here. Grounds were absolutely stunning. Pools weren't overly crowded and service pool-side was great, responsive. Even the Fairmont Store there had a great deli and array of staples if you needed them. View from the room was excellent. Maid service was superb - seemed to go the extra mile. We left notes making request and they were followed up in spades. Ya know, I gotta tell ya, I would hate to be someone who is so over-the-top in their scrutinzing of a vacation experience that they would condemn their experience here - where the heck do they have fun, I wanna go there?!?! Anyways - we had a great time. I'd say that unless you're a Conde Neste reviewer or a foodie this place is gonna blow your socks off!!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Musty smell in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: philanj
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kea Lani for our honeymoon and were very excited to stay at the resort based on the description, website and recommendations. When we arrived we thought that the registration area was beautiful as were most of the common areas. However, this initial impression did not last after we were brought up to our first room. When we entered it appeared that this room had not been used in a while because it was very warm, the air was stagnant and there was a musty, damp smell there was also a slight dampness to the older carpeting. I have very bad allergies and react negatively to this type of smell so it was unacceptable for me to stay in this room. We called down to the front desk and spoke with the manager and they seemed to be accomodating enough because they immediately moved us to another room. Although this one was now cooler it still had the above mentioined stench (and now my usually smell-less husband was able to smell what I was talking about). By this time I was getting very upset and upon further communication with the management they were going to clean a third room for us and have us come back later to see or more accurately smell the room. We waited for approximately 1.5 hours to go into the new room and when we did there was now a terrible floral smell on top of the existing musty, dampness which was already present. At the end of the day we decided not to stay at the hotel which was a very upsetting decision given the all the planning that went into the trip. Luckly were able to get into another resort through our travel agent and because we had traveller's insurance (I will never travel without insurance again) it didn't cost a dime in fact we got some money in return.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani is Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Farimont twice and both times were amazing. The view is incredible. The service is outstanding. The beach and pools are awesome. The breakfast buffet is delicious. The spa services are great. If you are looking for a special place to enjoy yourself during your vacation, you can't go wrong with the Kea Lani. Staying in one of their oceanfront villas will make your visit all that more fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetiepie19
Reviews.Content: this hotel needs some updating staff was accodmating, beach was amazing snotty guests. but we minded our business and had a great time, definetly order room service relaxing romantic. best lanai and living room we have had

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous just GORGEOUS!”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationer78
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our wonderful honeymoon in paradise at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea, Maui. We booked our honeymoon about 6 or 7 months in advance and got a pretty decent deal. First thing to remember is you are in Hawaii everything is more money... and my advice is if you are going to make the trek over there then do it right! I researched a ton of hotels on the internet and in trip advisor on Maui. I kept hearing great things about the Wailea area and about the Fairmont. When we were ready to get serious about booking we went to Liberty Travel to book everything. Keep in mind I did my homework and found rates online before I went in there so I knew what the "best rates" were. The travel agent actually found a cheaper rate ( approx $50 cheaper a night). She booked us in the parking lot or street view room. When she did this she told us that almost always you are upgraded to a better view and pay the cheaper price! (She was correct we were upgraded to a pool/garden view... but I have to say even the parking lot view if we had it would have been fantastic!) When we arrived at the Fairmont it was gorgeous everything was perfect. We were greeted with smiling faces and fresh flower lei's that smelled amazing! We were given the key to our room...on the first floor in the 170's... when we opened the door we could hardly contain our excitement! The room was great!! Every room at the Fairmont is a suite and has 840 square feet of living. It had a fridge a microwave and mini bar area, a living room and work space area, a large bedroom and a HUGE bathroom! Oh and did I mention the extra large lanai?? it had sliders from the living area and from the bedroom. It was fantastic and CLEAN!! The Fairmont property is great, right on Polo beach with its beautiful soft sand and gorgeous views of some of the other islands. The pool areas are wonderful there is even an adult pool area that always had chairs available. The attendants were always there to help and there was also always someone there to take your drink and/or food order. The service was great!!.. We were given cold towels periodically and pineapples were passed around as well...delicious! I really cant say anything bad about this property... Wailea is the most beautiful area in Maui... though it is a 45 minute ride from Lahaina and Front Street it is much more lush and beautiful than the northern area. Wailea is a bit more "ritzy" so you will find things to be more expensive... for instance buffett breakfast at the Fairmont is $30 a person... its a GREAT spread but pricey... if you want to go up the road about a mile to the Wailea shops there is a Longhi's there that has a fantastic breakfast for about half the price!! so there are definitely deals to find... We also ate on the property at Nick's Fishmarket. The food was excellent.. we suggest the snapper it was awesome!!.. the other resturaunt on the property cafe something (cant remember) was just average. It is a bit pricey and the food was not nearly as good as Nick's so I would skip this place... head over to the Wailea golf course next door to the Sea Watch restaurant... they have excellent views and GREAT food!.. dont forget to have the Kona ice cream pie at the end.. YUM!!... When you are in Maui some things we suggest doing... the Trilogy sunrise trip over to Lanai!.. It was worth every penny.. (about $140 a person). This leaves out of the Lahaina Harbor about 45 min from the Kea Lani... it includes breakfast and lunch and some snacks. It's a catamaran ride over to lanai to check out there beach do some snorkeling eat some great food and get acquainted with the locals and there "little city". It was fantastic!! This was probably our favorite day of the trip. We also did the Eco Adventure zip line tour in Haleakala. It was pretty decent and fun! If you are a beginner then this tour is great if you are an advanced zip liner they offer one in the west Maui mountains that is supposed to be better. We also did the Old Lahaina luau. Everyone has to go to a luau when on the islands... though the food was not the greatest the drinks were included and the entertainment was good. The people were friendly and put on a great show in a gorgeous location off of Front Street in Lahaina. Another thing my new husband wants me to mention... if you are a golfer and want to golf Kapalua be prepared to wait and encounter rude people. While the property is amazing and the views are unbelievable the staff there is less than par!... For a great golf experience and a great course try 18 holes at the Wailea Gold Course right across the street from the Kea Lani... the course is gorgeous and the staff is friendly! If you have any other questions feel free to let me know.. I would be happy to help with whatever I can... Enjoy Maui.... it is my FAVORITE island!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: retindall
Reviews.Content: Great resort! Exceptional staff! Well appointed rooms. Absolutely enjoyed our week long honeymoon. There is not a bettter place on Maui to stay. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: RealEstateDiva
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kea Lani several times and have always been very pleased. The rooms are ideal with children due to the spaciousness and suite floorplans. It is a very quiet place with several pools and a beautiful beach. It does get pricey when everything is added up at the end of your stay and the pools could use a little more activity for children. (We stayed at the Grand Wailea the last time for the pools since our son is old enough now, but the rooms at the GW cannot compare to the comfort and ease of use at the Kea Lani, nor the sense of relaxation. GW is very noisy!) Although it is expensive and the slide gets a little old for the kids by the third day there is still the beach and there is just something about the Kea Lani that is truly special. We find ourselves comparing all other hotels to this one. We probably won't be back until our son is past the "love the pools" stage, but we will definitely be back someday! And, look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms with roaches”
Reviews.Author: teif2be
Reviews.Content: This review is a little past due, as we stayed at the Fairmont in September for our honeymoon. We were very excited for our stay, as we have heard and read great things about the size and luxuriousness of the resort. Unfortunately, once we arrived, we were disappointed with the resort, specifically the pools and overall room quality. Our biggest issues were with the room. We anticipated large luxurious rooms, but once we were finally brought up to our room (it was not ready when we arrived, as we were early), we were disappointed. We walked through the room, and thought it was large with a great bathroom, but the furniture, upholstery and carpeting all seemed outdated and worn through. At times it also seemed as though the air conditioning was not working well and the air in the room felt a bit damp or musty at times, as did the couch the few times we sat on it. Once I got up and my shirt was slightly damp! But worse were the un-welcomed guests we discovered on our first day. As the bellhop was putting down our luggage, we saw a small roach. I pointed it out to the bellhop and he just said, â€œOh, okay.â€� Then he stepped on it and my husband had to clean it up himself with a tissue. We were not thrilled to see a roach, especially since we were on the 5th floor. But we were both exhausted from traveling and hoped that it just got in from the outside (it was near the lanai door) and did not complain. The second one I did not know about. My husband saw it the next afternoon, after the room had been made up. Apparently a small roach was crawling across the pillow but he did not tell me, as he did not want me to throw a fit. Then, two days later we saw another roach on our bathroom floor. At that time, my husband went to the front desk to complain. The woman he spoke to said she would make sure housekeeping thoroughly cleaned our room and that we would not have to worry about it again. The next day, we saw another one but this time it was outside one of the rooms around the corner from ours, fortunately, it was our last night at the hotel and we were leaving the next morning. When planning our trip, we knew we wanted to stay in Wailea. Several friends,travel books and advisors suggested the Fairmont Kea Lani, as they had stayed there years ago and spoke highly of your facilities, rooms, and pools â€“ which were a big factor. The cost was a little more than we had wanted to spend, but decided it would be worth spending the extra money. We were also considering the Marriott, as it was a little less expensive and had newly renovated rooms. However, we were told that one of the Marriottâ€™s pools would still be under renovations during our stay, so we decided to splurge on the Fairmont. Unfortunately, when we arrived, we were told that one of the pools was currently under renovations and would not be available for use, as well as the water slide. The concierge did not seem very surprised when we stated that we were not informed of this prior to our visit. We were not happy that the pool was not available but did not make a fuss since the other two pools were open and weâ€™d just spend more time at the beach. We did spend a bit of time at the pools that were open, mostly later in the day. We were surprised at how crowded the pools were at that time â€“ usually around 4 pm. The adult pool was full and we were unable to find an open chair nearby, so we went to the other pool instead. There were a few kids, who were fine, but there were not many open chairs available. At both pools, we noticed there were quite a few cabanas that had open chairs but we were not allowed to use them unless we paid $150. We found that to be ridiculous. We could understand if it was earlier and we could make use of it all day and others were being used. But 1 out of 8 or 9 of them were in use and there were hardly any open chairs otherwise. Not to mention, the chairs around the pool were old, dirty, and some were falling apart. At one point, the woman next to us suggested we get extra towels to put on the arms of the chairs, as she did, since the arms were so filthy. We felt we were getting nickel and dimed on everything (I think we paid $25 for a small turkey wrap and small iced tea!) Overall, we enjoyed our trip to Maui but we were extremely disappointed in the quality of our accommodations for the amount of money we spent. We expected a high luxury resort and rooms and we were shocked to end up in rooms that would be found in a 2-2.5 start hotel, not a 4 or 5 star hotel. If we knew what we were getting in the beginning, we would have not booked our vacation at the Fairmont; we would have booked at the Marriott or another resort within the same price range in the Wailea area. Although weâ€™ve have heard great things about the Fairmont chain overall, after this experience on our honeymoon, we probably would not stay at or recommend a Fairmont hotel or resort in the future. When we returned from our trip, we submitted our complaint online AND sen them a letter through regular mail, explaining our dissappointment and all we received in return was an email response saying it was received.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip in 3 years over Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: kacnjmcsdad
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thanksgiving day and stayed for 5 nights. Part of our stay was during their 5th night free promotion but they refused to give us our fifth night free because we arrived before the official start date of the promo even though we left during the promo period. I tried on several occasions with different people to get the fifth night free and they didn't budge. I recommend their website outline the rules a little more clearly in the future. Regardless of having to pay $475 a night for ALL five nights, we had a great time and loved the resort. I attempted to get an upgrade at check in and they indicated the hotel was at capacity even though it didn't look or feel to me like it was at capacity. I don't feel like it's crowded there compared to say the Grand Wailea. The beach is smallish but beautiful and can get crowded if the hotel is doing something like a sand castle building contest. Cafe Ciao had great food and was reasonably priced compared to some other restaurants in the area. The water slide was great for my 9 and 6 year old. I did see a dad get angry at the pool Manager because there were kids swimming at the bottom of the slide and his child landed on them then hit his head on the pool floor. At other Fairmont hotels I have seen a hotel employee at the bottom of the waterslides to keep people safe. I'm not sure why they don't do it here. The food at the swim up bar restaurant ( I cant remember the name) was really good. As you can expect, drink prices are outrageous. I'm not ashamed to admit, I went to the grocery store and stocked up on drinks and just went back to my room to get a drink. I estimate I saved $200-$300 doing this. My wife said the gym was nice. They let me use the business center for free to print my boarding passes. I left my camera in the room and returned later to find it gone. I continued to call Lost and Found periodically over the next 16 hours to see if my camera turned up. It did not. By the time I got home, Kea Lani Security called and left a message it was found and they mailed it to me within a week for free and it arrived intact undamaged. This was my second trip and I will return next year. I find it luxorious and comfortable and it doesnt have a crowded feel.

Reviews.Title: “All 5 star impressive but could improve...”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: Arrived on our first visit to Hawaii and Maui and wasnt disappointed. Check-in very professional though the front desk couldnt recognise it was a special occasion but did give us a complimentary upgrade to ocean view room. Got lei'd which was a nice touch but Australian customs confiscated my nuts which i got lei'd with ;) upon return. Room was outstanding and was 5 star in every way. Lounge room very spacious not to mention the balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. TV's could do with an upgrade to LCD flat screen but no complaints too much with the entertainment being very extensive. But wanted to connect my laptop to screen a movie off it but the TV was too old. Bathroom was amazingly overdone with too much room!! Bathroom amenities were very cute with the extra necessities of q-tips but no toothbrush. The shampoo amenities werent doing the environment any favour as the bottles were too big...though we put it to good use by taking it with us. I have slept on better beds in Sydney and India and will need to upgrade to the more comfortable 5 star pillowtop beds but again no complaints. It was comfortable enough... Highlights was the pool bar. Being a virgin to poolbars and giggling like a kid when I saw it, it didnt disappoint. The pool was amazing so didnt end up making it down to the beach. No opportunity to try breakfast but the overnight room service was ordinary with pizza looking like it was brought in from somewhere else and the wrap feeling like it had been in the fridge for days. BLACKOUT !! Consistent with the other post, the hotel is NOT at all prepared for emergencies. The storm was not at all that serious but was enough to take out the hotel. Thankfully we checked out the same morning as the power outage but received no apologies or compensation for the outage.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing property”
Reviews.Author: BVIlovers
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Kea Lani and not my last. I am sure we will be staying at this property every December for years to come. It is beautiful, well located with great service and amenities. My two sons, aged 6 and 8 love it, my kids spend all year asking about when we are going back again! I almost dont want to review the property and have more people discover it :) It is surperior to the crowded and too big Grand Wailea, which always gets the top accolades but I suspect they have a better PR department and advertising budget. The Kea Lani rooms are all suites, all nicely apppointed with huge bathrooms, perfect for families as everyone has a space, separate TV area for the kids and a tasteful kitchenette. The kids pool is large and never crowded, making it fun for adults too, if you want more space you can rent a cabana, we do everyday and you get complimentary drinks and fruits, as well as magazines. The slide is great fun for all ages. I find the pool staff a little aloof, last year was better than this year but they are still helpful. The beach is small, and has gotten busier over the years as people from outside properties learn about it. Fabulous boogy boarding and calm enough fro children. You can also rent umbrellas here and the beach staff is superb. kudos to all the staff, all smiling and helpful, booked all our excursions, helped the kids. The Kids Camp is so much fun the kids look forward to it. They watched videos one night and had popcorn and pizza while we went to Nic's for dinner. I could go on and on and on, we love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Kea Lani, not a Five Star Resort. Not prepared for Emergencies.”
Reviews.Author: resortexplorer
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Maui with my fiancee, and I was very eager to impress her. Perhaps my expectations were unrealistic. We had a late arrival (about 1:00AM) and the front desk clerk was rather bland in his personality, not the first impression I was expecting. The rooms were very nice, and spacious, and I had one of the better views in room 474. The resort was nice, but smaller than what I was expecting. It could definately use a facelift here and there. The lower level staff was very respectful and curteous, However, the staff that had the most contact with the public was just OK. I had a particular bone to pick with the lady taking reservations at the breakfast buffet. I noticed a line being formed so after adding my name to the list, I followed the crowd and lined up. She told me that there was no need to make line, because her system was based on a first come first serve basis, and names would be called. About 25 folks were seated (the ones making line), and a new line of about 30 more came and my name was not called. When I approached her to ask if I understood her correctly, she forcefully told me: "Sir, you are all going to get in, you need to please wait and be patient". The problem is I never got a chance to say anything to her. She must have read my mind or something. She was cold and unresponsive. I felt like Adam Sandler in "Anger Management" when the flight attendent told him to calm down. Not cool! I just walked in and politely ( I had been polite earlier also) asked one of the waitresses about their seating system, and she finally had us seated. We had a storm that came thru on Wednesday, and we lost power to the entire resort. I was surprised at how unprepared the staff was to deal with this issue. There were only a few generators working and they were only for the lobby and other hotel areas. The rooms were pitch dark, and there was essentialy nothing to do. Even their selection of board games was rather dissapointing, and of course they wanted my credit card to borrow a worn out incomplete game of Rummy-O, that I was unable to use do to the fact that the instruccions were not in the bent tin box. The food was bland, except for the food at Nick's Fishmarket, which was expensive but good. Once the resort lost power, the cuisine went from bad to worse, and the service went from bland to outright unfriendly, even hostile in the case of the waiter who refilled my friends glass of whiskey with water, and then blamed my friend for not informing him about it. A simple I'm Sorry, we'll get you a new one" would have sufficed. Overall, I felt that the storm and the lack of power were the main reason why all these problems were intensified. The staff seemed totally unprepared for this emergency, and the pressure was surely on them from management. A little preparation ahead of time would have gone a long way to prevent these wrinkles in their customer service. It's necessary to mention that the resort next door, lost its power also, but the generators kicked in and all rooms had at least some power. Many folks got stuck in elevators because no one had the foresight to block access to elevators running on limited generator power. I hate to think how my experience would have been if there had been a serious emergency (ei: tsunami, fire or something else). I would advise anyone planning a stay to check on weather conditions prior, and hope and pray for beautiful sunny days with no problems. Maybe like that the Kea Lani Resort might be better, as long as they are within their comfort zone. Overall, I have received service like the Kea Lani Resort's at some Motels. Not bad, but not that impresive either. Its more like the Motel Kea Lani, not a Five Star Resort. And no, I will not book my upcoming wedding at the Fairmont Kea Lani Resort in Maui. Westin, here I come.

Reviews.Title: “Not crazy about it....”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and the grounds are very nice. the room is huge and the bathroom is amazing. There is just an intangible that made me uncomfortable. I think the hotel is just not very warm and cozy. The hallways are institutional. It just does not have a very inviting feeling. We stayed at the Kea Lani after a stay in Kauai. Our hotel in Kauai just felt so warm that it was hard to get used to the Kea Lani. We spent a lot of time away from the hotel. We really liked the Grand Wailea. Yes, it is larger, but it was much nicer. Of course the Four Seasons was gorgeous too. I would stay at one of these if I returned. As for the trip we loved Maui. We did the road to Hana early one morning, but I would HIGHLY recommend that anyone who goes to Hana stays the night there at the Hotel Hana-Maui. What a special place. We also loved Lahaina and the beaches on the west. Maui is definitely more developed than Kaui and has a little less magic in my opinion, but it is fun to see the surfers out on almost any beach!!
