The shops at Wailea are great for shopping! Also, there are some reasonable restaurants in the area if you do not wan to pay $50+ a person for dinner. We ate at the pizza/Italian restaurant on the golf course that was great as well as Roy's and a bunch of others.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but needs a little help”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. We were and are currently still on the island, bad storm hit and lost power. The staff is fantastic from check in to dealing with the emergency. The manager Scott is a hands on person who makes the best of everything. The rooms if you have an ocean front suite is beautiful. We had suite 302 with a wrap around lanai that was very nice. Our issue was with Fairmont on not updating the property. It is 7 years old and needs some TLC. I read other reviews and thought it was a bit over the top to complain on this but it just was not relaxing. The breakfast area feels like you are at disney very loud and busy not relaxing. The lobby bar feels worn as does Nicks the restaurant. It is too bad because they have an amazing staff. We found ourselves going next door to the four seasons so we check out early and into the four seasons. The room view is inferior and price much higher but is worth the change for us. Depends on your budget but the neighbor has them beat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Fairmont Kea Lani in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe the wonderful experience at the Fairmont Kea Lani on Maui. The hotel staff was superb in greeting us as we arrived. They immediately took care of all our luggage and other items as we proceeded to check in. They offered to valet the car regardless of the whether we chose to valet (self park is free and very convenient) or not. They provided very quickly tags for the luggage and car and off they sent us to the explore the hotel grounds and check-in. When greeted at the check-in desk, the employee greeted us by name and already had our reservation pulled up and discussed any special needs or events we were celebrating. She indicated that our room was not ready yet, but went ahead and selected a very special room for us on the top floor with an incredible view. She had my cell phone from my reservation process and sent us away to explore the grounds and have some lunch. The check-in process was excellent and one of the most pleasant experiences at any hotel I have visited. Once contacted that our room was ready, we received our keys and proceeded to our room where our luggage was already being delivered. The room was an incredible location on the 7th floor and had the most amazing views of the entire property and ocean. The room was a very large suite with great amenities. The foyer had a spacious closet with iron and board and perfect for storing luggage. The space also had a hidden microwave and refrigerator with space for storing snacks and other items. This area also had several AC outlets for chargers for mobile devices that always typically clutter up other areas of a room. The living area had a very comfortable sofa with great lighting for reading and an awesome view through the glass doors. The room was equipped with an entertainment center that housed a large TV, surround system, DVD player and extra speakers. The remote was very intuitive and worked all of the electronics with the single remote. Although the TV was not a LCD, it was a very high quality Sony system. The room also had a very comfortable desk for working at a laptop with a phone and high speed internet access (for a fee). The balcony was very large and expanded the full length of the bedroom and living area. The balcony was equipped with a round glass table with four comfortable outdoor chairs. The balcony also included a chaise lounge chair and table. The views were incredible from this room and every day provided an awesome location to view the sunset. A nice feature was that when the sliding glass doors were opened, it automatically turned off the air conditioner inside the room. The balcony was very large and provided an incredible atmosphere to have morning breakfast or any meal while viewing outdoor activities and recreation. The sliding glass doors also had full screens to experience the incredible weather without any bugs (which are pretty rare in Hawaii). The bedroom was very spacious with excellent furniture and decor. There was plenty of storage space in the 2 closets and drawers in all the furniture. The bedroom had a TV, two clock radios, and phone. Another nice feature of the room was the mirrors on the closet doors. One of the closets was fitted with a wall safe that has a Medco key entry. My only real complaint about the room was the size of the safe, which was quite small and limited on what could be stored in the safe. This is one of the first rooms that I had experienced with a key entry safe. The hotel provided additional safe downstairs for guests storing valuables, but was very inconvenient. I did not feel as safe with a key entry as a digital code, but that is probably a personal preference. The bed was very comfortable, but quite firm. The bedding was excellent and there were a variety of pillows from hard to soft to provide flexible and configurable sleeping comfort. I was expecting the bed to be more comfortable, but after one night of sleep, we got adjusted to the comfort of the bed. The bathroom was awesome - period. One of the best layout and functional bathrooms that we have experienced traveling. The shower was spacious and open which meant no door. It was excellent! The bathtub was very large and had a large mirror over the length of the bathtub. The room was configured with two white pedestal sinks. There was a large mirror across the full front length of the bathroom that provided my wife and I both access to mirror anytime in the room. The additional door from the foyer provided access to the bathroom without having to enter from the bedroom. A portable mirror with light was also provided. There were plenty of AC outlets along with a hair dryer. The hotel provided plenty of towels for use and they were refreshed during daily cleanings and nightly turn-down service. We absolutely loved and enjoyed our hotel experience at the Fairmont Kea Lani! The grounds were impeccable with 3 pools, outdoor cafes and restaurants. The hotel has plenty of walkways and the grassy areas are some of the best you will find. The outdoor chairs were comfortable at the pools and plenty of towels were provided to guests. The pool cabanas were very expensive ($150 per day) and were available due to low demand for their rental. The hotel also provided outdoor poolside massage service. The beach was very convenient, but not very large. The beach was private for the hotel and was not crowded, but was not very conducive for beach walks due to limited size. There is a 1.5 mile concrete trail across the beachfront of some of the Wailea hotels and properties. Although the Four Seasons is regarded as a top 5 star property, I would rate the Fairmont as high from our experience and also the incredible grounds as compared to the Four Seasons. I have not stayed at the Four Seasons and cannot compare the entire hotel experience, but we did like the Fairmont's grounds, location, pools, beach, etc. better that the Four Seasons from our walks by the properties. If we are fortunate enough to visit Maui again (twice in 5 years), we will definitely stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani again. I highly recommend this 5 star hotel for your experience.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: savoytruffle79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our honeymoon, and the staff did everything they could to make it a wonderfully memorable experience. Most notably, we had booked a standard room with them, but when they were notified that we were on our honeymoon, they upgraded us (at no extra cost) to a beautiful suite. In addition to the spaciousness of the suite (with lots of balcony space for sitting with a cocktail in hand watching the sun set), there are laundry facilities on-site. Although you have to leave the resort at some point, you could make a vacation of exploring the nooks and crannies of the property. It's very beautiful, the staff is lovely, and we couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “A one night stay that I wanted to make last forever!”
Reviews.Author: ak2outside
Reviews.Content: As an anniversary present, I was able to make a stop over between flights in Maui and we stayed at the Kea Lani. The place is gorgeous, the staff is attentive, the grounds are immaculate and the walk in front of the hotel is some of the best views on the island. Did not eat on property, so I cannot comment on that, but what sold me was the spacious bathrooms and the soft, soft linens on the bed. The views didnt hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha from Oregon!”
Reviews.Author: Lorribird
Reviews.Content: My family of 7 recently returned from a really nice week at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea. We arrived with a flat tire, which turned out to be the only negative of the entire trip. We rented from Dollar, who was most unhelpful. We ended up having to arrange the tow truck, tire change and tire repair ourselves, which was time-consuming and irritating. The Kea Lani is limited to dealing with Avis, so that's important to note for next visit. We were greeted with leis, a cold cloth and an icy guava/orange juice drink. The bell boys then loaded our luggage and us into golf carts and drove us all over the property to get aquainted with the area and the amnenities. Soon we were at the main pool drinking Lava Flows at the swim-up bar where bartenders Dane and Noe took great care of us all week long. The service here is amazing. From the front desk to housekeeping, they treat you like family. No snob factor here. That's refreshing for a 5 star resort. The concierage booked many reservations for us several weeks before we arrived. The Old Lahaina Luau is worth the drive to Lahaina and really invokes the spirit of the Islands. On property, Nick's Fish Market was terrific, as was Caffe Ciao. My favorite dinner on the island was at Mama's Fish House in Central Maui. Pure Hawaiian Deliciousness. We stayed in an ocean front 3 bedroom Villa. Be sure to request one in the front row (numbers 1-12, I believe). The view from the private lanai was spectacular. We also used the BBQ and the plunge pool. The refrigerator was stocked with juices, milk, soda, fruit and other goodies. The turn down service included slippers, a fresh orchid on your pillow and a cold bottle of water at each bedside. They even emptied the dishwasher and tidied up the kitchen every evening. We had so much fun and made many new friends, most of whom were returning guests to the beautiful Fairmont Kea Lani. I can't wait to be one of them! Aloha from Oregon.

Reviews.Title: “Fab service”
Reviews.Author: LoopyBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: The last destination of our 3 week honeymoon & all I can fault is the weather (a little cloudy for the first two days of six). The service was top notch, the hotel itself was excellant & as for the suite, it was bigger than my first house. I would happily return here & would recommend it to anyone who wants a relaxing romatic trip. Don't forget to ask at the front desk for your free car journeys to & from the shops at wailea & also the other local hotels, something we only found out from one of the other guests but took full advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Bruced4
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this property. The service was top notch and the grounds are breathtaking. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, and it was worth every penny! Maid service twice a day! This place is just wonderful - best property on the South Shore!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: jinglecat
Reviews.Content: There is probably nothing I can say about this hotel that has not already been said. It is by far and away the best hotel I have ever stayed in, and it is worth every penny. The food at the hotel is expensive, so go to a local grocery store and stock up. Each room has a mini-fridge. The pools are perfect, and they have a serene adult pool with cabanas for peace and quiet. The beach is clean and the staff keep it full of beach chairs to relax. I just can't think of anything wrong with this hotel. It is absolutely perfect. We will definitely go back another year

Reviews.Title: “Not worth what you're paying for it!”
Reviews.Author: amymcseattle
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by saying that my husband and I just arrived from a fabulous six days at the Four Seasons Hualalai on the Big Island where we loved everything about our stay and also got married last Saturday. Standards coming into the Fairmont were thus obviously very high. However, I have to say, we have been at the Fairmont for two days and continue to be very disappointed. Though the lobby is impressive, the rooms feel STICKY, musty, and generally not well cared for. I've read some of the other reviews that indicated how "big" the rooms are and although it is an all suite hotel, the rooms give off a distinct 1970s vibe. Decor and furniture look old and worn, bathrooms were only moderately clean (I found several long hairs twisted around the sink knobs), and the hallways outside the rooms remind me of a mental institution. The hotel itself appears to be a cross between a Moroccan inspired theme park and old and outdated Hawaiian decor. For over $400/night, I do not think this hotel lives up to the rate. At $200/night, this room would feel reasonable. We've eaten at both the Polo Lounge and had room service. I would classify both experiences as below average with a sandwich that included potato chips as a side costing upwards of $30. Overpriced and poorly delivered. Everything is served in plastic cups here and makes you feel a bit like you're at a frat house pool party. On a positive note, the beach (although very small) is lovely and the water is quite kid and adult friendly. I was irritated by the fact that we had to pay $10/hour to rent a beach umbrella. The sense that you're being nickel and dimed by your hotel CONSTANTLY is rather unsettling. This is our first time to Maui and we really regret choosing the Fairmont. We will definitely be looking elsewhere for luxury lodging on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us!”
Reviews.Author: Pepper58
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our one week stay in Hawaii. We stayed in Honolulu one night, but then on to the jewel of Maui and the Fairmont Kea Lani. The grounds are beautiful and the room was huge! We were upgraded to a Ocean View room since it was our anniversary. The staff greeted us warmly with leis and took care of our every need! The room was really big, plenty of room for our family of five (although I wished the beds were Queen, not Double - pretty small for my tall husband). The pools were beautiful and not crowded at all (probably because it was the fall)! The water slide was closed, but they provided an inflatable water slide for the kids. The beach was nice - we saw big sea turtles often! The hotel also offers free laundry facilities, which was wonderful. (Buy your detergent at the gro store, not the hotel sundry shop). We went snorkeling out of Lahaina (up north near Kaanapali) Our catamaran owned by Trilogy Tours went over to the neighboring island of Lanai, one of the prettiest places I've EVER been to. Wonderful trip-- would highly recommend this excursion. Kaanapali was different, but nice - it seemed more of a tourist place; much busier; it didn't seem exclusive like Wailea does, but very nice as well. We went to the Haleakala volcano crater -- Wow, what a sight! It's very high, so the drive is not for those scared of heights! My son did the Eco-Tour Zip line near the base of the volcano- great experience there! Overall the Fairmont was great. It was expensive like everyone says, but we went to the grocery store for food for breakfast and lunch since the rooms have a small fridge, coffee maker, sink, and microwave, and just went out for dinner. Parts of the Fairmont were a little dated, but overall, very nice and clean. Again, the staff was very personable, not stuffy, like at other five star hotels. We would definitely return to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Hotel - My Tips”
Reviews.Author: ScottsdaleAZ
Reviews.Content: September 29th to October 4th. My wife and I really wanted to stay at the Grand Wailea as we have stayed there before, but it was completely booked so we got the Fairmont. The bottom line is that you will not go wrong with the Grand Wialea, Four Seasons or the Fairmont so don't stress. People who have had bad experiences I feel are just hard to please in general or it was flat out a fluke. From the moment you pull up, your car doors are opend and the bell captain unloads your luggage. You are then greeted with a lie and guava juice. Check in is friendly and fast. TIP: Join the Fairmont President's Club as you will earn points and get free in-room internet and access to the business center. You can also check in through the speacial President's Club line, if there are any lines at all. TIP: If you are from an area with an ocean anywhere near then a deluxe ocean view room is not that important. Get a ground floor room on one of the pools. We had room 116. Your door opens right up to a manicured grass area that surrounds the pool. Grab a couple of loungers under an umbrealla and come and go as you please back and fourth to your room through the patio. Get up in the morning, make a pot of coffee, open your sliding glass door and walk down to the beach to watch the waves for a few minutes. Relax, you're in Maui. The enitre staff is awesome and just as good as Four Seasons or the GW. If you want your car, call down to valet and it will be waiting for you when you walk up. If you want a later turn down service, simply write houskeeping a note and they will accomidate you. Nick's - Okay, this was my only negative but maybe they just had an off night with the food and service. Both were lacking. Our favorite restaurants were Spago and Duo.at Four Seasons. Ask for tables outside on the patio and go right before sunset. They make some mean mojitos in the Four Seasons lounge if you want to take one in along with some live music before dinner. Pool Loungers - Okay, I lied...this is my other bone to pick with the Fairmont. The pool longers need to be updated so that they are on par with Four Seasons and GW. Grab a couple of towels and a cocktail and you will soon forget about the loungers. The actual pool is better at the Fairmont but nothing tops the GW pool. All are luxury. TIP - Go to the shops at Wailea and hit the ABC store for water, mags, snacks, etc. It's inexpensive there and fun to walk around. Icecream at Lamperts is awesome too. TIP - Cheap eats in between Sapgo. Hit Maui Tacos in Kihei or Denny's for breakfast. If Woody Harilson can go there, so can you. Get Tacos to go and bring them back to your room to eat them on your patio. Hope this helps. Fairmont is awesome and you wont be disappointed unless you are just really hard to please. If that's the case, get a penthouse at the Four Seasons with private butler service.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: TShort
Reviews.Content: Sept. 8 â€“ 17, 2007. We had a terrific time at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We chose it because of many positive comments we saw on Trip Advisor as well as from travel agents. I had visited the Four Seasons on a previous trip and found the clientele to be â€œstuffyâ€� as another review stated. Upon arrival we were greeted by name with leiâ€™s, cool towel and juice. When we checked in we were advised that we had been upgraded to a villa (we booked thru American Express Platinum and upgrades are automatic if available). We were taken to our unit with our luggage via cart and shown around the villa. It was a two bedroom ocean view villa with our own private dipping pool. We found the staff to be gracious and responsive. We had maid service twice daily replacing towels as you need and changing linens upon request. The master bedrooms and baths were very nice and large. We had a nice kitchen, washer and dryer and a nice clean gas grill on the patio. They do offer to bring a meal packed for you to grill to the room, which we should have done. We found the entry and grounds to be well manicured and beautiful. The hotel is white stucco and didnâ€™t appear dirty to us. I think salt water and humidity can cause the stucco to look more aged, but the hotel is not in disrepair as some comments suggest. We watched the sun set from the open air lobby bar most evenings. Beautiful view. The hotel is hillside with a short walk to the beach; the villas are the closest to the beach. The hotel has an adult pool and a family pool. They were refurbishing the lower family pool and slide while we were there, but that still left an upper family pool as well as the adult pool open. The adult pool is ideal for those who want to relax in quiet and for honeymooners, etc. There is a beautiful walking path along the beach that stretches from the FKL to the north end of Wailea. It is a great way to start the day with a vigorous 4 mi. RT walk and to check out the other hotel properties along the way. The restaurants in the hotel are excellent. Breakfast is choice of their buffet or off the menu at the Kea Lani restaurant. We had lunch most days at CafÃ© Ciao which is an outdoor restaurant near the adult pool. The food is very good, especially the tomato bisque and the calamari. For dinner, we ate at Nickâ€™s Fish Market which is the best dining we have had on Maui. Ambiance: Romantic and a beautiful outdoor setting with tiki torch lighting and a beautiful view for sunset. Service: impeccable. Food: outstanding. You must have the snapper with parsley mashed potatoes. The menu is so appealing that a decision on just one item is difficult. Another plus about going in September, we always got a table at Nicks. We used the complimentary car service provided by Kea Lani to visit the Shops at Wailea and had an excellent lunch at Tommy Bahamas (located at the Shops at Wailea). There is also a Ruthâ€™s Chris, Longhiâ€™s and Cheeseburger Island Style at the shops. As this was our fourth visit to Maui, we chose not to rent a car and just hang out for a change and it worked out well. The staff was prompt in driving us and picking us up, a nice tip is always appreciated by the staff. We used Wailea Limousine to and from the airport and found them to be prompt, polite and very friendly. As a general note to first timers in Maui, Wailea is a more upscale area and is about an hour away from Kaâ€™anipali and most activities (except for Haleakala and Hana). So, if you plan to do a lot of planned activities such as boat trips, etc, you could end up doing a lot of driving. In the mornings you will find yourself in the middle of Mauiâ€™s rush hour on this drive. If it is your first time to Maui and/or you have kids West Maui may be the best choice (Kaanipali and Lahaina). Although, you will find that area very busy with traffic and crowds in comparison. From check-in, dining, in room dining, room maintenance to check out we found the staff to be extremely warm and helpful. If you can, plan your trip after Labor Day when all the kids go back to school. It is quieter at most places and you are more likely to get upgrades. We always go in September and find that service and all is always better when the hotels and restaurants arenâ€™t packed to the brim.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: rodeo2244
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani when it was added as an overflow hotel to a conference at the Grand Wailea. We were given a room on the 4th floor with a full view, and once we spent time at the GW for the conference were thrilled to be able to go "home" to the Kea Lani at the end of each day. It's a great walk along the water between the hotels. The service was friendly, and we were made to feel very welcome by all of the staff. The beach is great, and if you like to snorkel, rent equipment from the beach hut and go along the reef to the right. You can go all the way to the GW and see turtles and tons of fish. I highly recommend the Kea Lani to anyone staying in the Wailea area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ilikedmaui
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent honeymoon at this hotel. The staff was friendly and the grounds were very well kept. It's a great hotel in an area loaded with high-end hotels! Between the Fairmont, Four Seasons and Grand Wailea, the GW had the best kept grounds hands-down but everything else there seemed rather average when comparing these three hotels. The Four Seasons was very crowded when we went over to that property, but is worth seeing since the artwork and designs are pleasing. Quite frankly, I think it's overvalued as I'd much rather have the suite at the Fairmont or the large grounds to walk at the Grand Wailea and I would not stay at the Four Seasons if I did have the option to choose again, it just seemed crowded and closed-in (no privacy). Besides, we were mostly floating around Maui and Molokai during our stay as do most people, so it's best to balance the value in my opinion. The bathrooms at the Fairmont (as well as the balcony) really make the room and the stay quite comforting. The kids pool at the Fairmont is separate and the presence of kids was minimal, unless we went over to the kids pool to use the water-slide (it was wild). Breakfast buffets at the Fairmont are really nice to have in the morning, I understand that sometimes breakfast packages there are the way to go (we had this) as the cost to be nearly $60 a day per couple, but the spread is quite nice. There's a gourmet cafe at the hotel to shop for other food items that might complement your meals. Coming from New York, I actually did not find the gourmet shop or other areas of Hawaii to be expensive, but if you're not familiar with New York or Southern California prices, you could potentially think it is. My only complaint about the hotel would be when we arrived, the bell staff was unable to take our bags to our room, as they were either short-staffed or just too busy as we waited 5-10 minutes before taking them ourselves, but it was not a huge deal for us. For dining out, I would recommend Nick's Fish Market at the Fairmont if you stay or don't stay at the hotel (our favorite), Huma Huma at the Grand Wailea and Mama's Fish House (on the north side of the island at the beginning of the Road to Hana, which is awesome). This hotel is excellent and we posted some generic pictures too! If you stay at this hotel, be sure to visit the activity desk for some good ideas about efficient activities and rent a convertible or a jeep, it's excellent and worth the extra dough.

Reviews.Title: “very good value, pretty hotel, service / maintenance just okay”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. We have stayed at the Four Seasons prior trips. We decided to try the Kea Lani b/c it seemed to be a very good value compared with a Four Seasons suite. The suite was nice and well-priced but neither the service nor food at bkfst was great. The grounds are very spacious affording lots of personal space if you would like. This is definitely a pro. The hotel service just does not respond very quickly to things nor give you a very pampered feel. That said, you get what you pay for and an equivalent suite would have been about $500 more at the Four Seasons. I would go here in Maui if I were trying to get the most bang for the buck, not the ultimate experience, but pretty good just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We chose Kea Lani because our daughter's wedding was at the nearby Keawala'i Church (wonderful, memorable service & minister). Our room was beautifully furnished. The bathroom is huge. Only small complaint was that hotel actually sits quite far back from the ocean and we had the Polo Beach Club in our "deluxe ocean front" view. You do want to book a high enough floor to see over the palm trees. We had last minute get togethers for the wedding party and last minute requests when the photographer showed up for pre-wedding pictures (John Henry...great photographer and Kea Lani is a wonderful venue for photos of the bridal party) - staff never let us down. Whatever we needed was provided quickly and with a smile. I cannot say enough about the customer service at Kea Lani. We had a horrible experience with Carey Limousine and the concierge manager went out of her way to help us deal with them (terrible customer service at Carey). As others have said, dinner at Nick's is not to be missed. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home at the Kea Lani,Maui”
Reviews.Author: ganlengleng
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the unfavourable reviews we considered other resorts but since we have a one year old we needed more room and decided to take a chance and what a good choice it was.Yes,some of the reviews on the up keep was valid but the whole experience and most of the aspect s of the resort superseeds what I consider small issues that can be fixed easyly they are such as the room doors,the rome safety box,some cracking of the lobby floor,the white walls which looks a bit too plain for a fairmont property. But let me tell you why it's one of the best resorts I've stayed in.Having been in the hotel development business I see the true value of a home away from home resort.Most of all the service was immaculate,the property in all is gorgeous,the rooms were newly upgraded and does look like a fairmont style suite ( if you know Gump's of san francisco,the suites look like it's designed by Gump's),the bathroom was spacious and stylish with his and her's sink.The beach was lovely and clean and suitable for most even babies.They have kiddies pool as well as adults pool so that honeymooners would not have to endure the screaming kids.The lobby design was gorgeous and surely a picture taking spot.These are just a few features I consider a good pick. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise.....”
Reviews.Author: LovesParadise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned this trip with my two daughters, son-in-law, grandson and my youngest daughter's boyfriend for over a year. Usually when you build something up for so long it doesn't live up to all the expectations.....not in this case. The Fairmont was absolutly beautiful. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive to all our needs. We loved the swim up bar, even though it cost us a fortune (drinks are $12.50 up). Be sure to get down to the pool early to get a spot under an umbrella, or if you want a cabanna be sure to put your name in as soon as you check in ($150.00 per day ). The grounds are so beautiful and well maintained. The rooms were huge and very nicely decorated. Easily sleeps four. Loved the views. We ate there a couple of times....very expensive. But we knew this before we went. Who cares, your in paradise. By the way my youngest daughter became engaged while we were there (very romantic)....good thing we went this summer cause now we have to save for a wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: My new husband I stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights during our wedding/honeymoon. Let me clarify that we not only honeymooned there, we had our wedding there. This hotel does not live up to the Fairmont name. I was not disappointed with the wedding arrangements, just the hotel itself. Like some reviews on Tripadvisor explain, it is in desperate need of an upgrade/make over. When you walk the halls (which are outside) they are covered in dirt. It is very noticeable since the entire hotel is white. The slide at the pool had cracks on it. The grounds were maintained just up to par. Not what I expected for $580 a night for a very partial ocean view. Even though we had our wedding and honeymooned at the hotel, they did not even upgrade our room. When we went to the Fairmont on the Big Island, they upgraded us to an executive suite just being honeymooners. The ONLY great thing about this hotel is Nicks. This restaurant cannot be missed. Yes, it is expensive, but we ended up comparing every single meal we had on our honeymoon to the dinner we had at Nicks.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: kimmie49
Reviews.Content: After being in Honolulu at the Halekulani, the Fairmont was a real letdown. While the facility was beautiful, it was unkept, the grounds were "littered" with fallen leaves, and the marble floors were unswept. We were greeted with leis which was nice but our room was not ready until 4:00 p.m. The room itself while adequately large was not plush by any standards. The wireless internet connection was very sporatic so you had to connect via a landline and pay a daily charge for internet use to be reliable. THe sheets on one bed were ripped on the side and never replaced(while we did not ask for them to change the bed linens, the rip was very noticeable and thus should have been changed without having to ask). They did have a little cafe where you could purchase food for the room, while it was pricey, it was fresh and tasty. NIck's Restaurant on site was worth a visit although it was very expensive. Bellmen, housekeeping, wait staff were nice but nothing exceptional. The only two other restaurants in the area were Cheeseburger in Paradise and Ruth Chris Steakhouse so your eating out choices were limited. The "Shops at Wailea" was a very nice upscale shopping center with some basic shops like a local ABC, Gap, Black & White, etc. My teenage son did prefer this hotel over the Halekulani because it had 3 swimming pools and because it was a much larger faciltily, there were more "kids" for him to hang out with. Overall, I feel like we were too far from other "activities" on the island and would not choose this facility or any other facility in the Wailea area of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CK007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani, during August, for a few days and had a great time. We arrived at the hotel just after lunch and were greeted with a lei and juice. Check-in was simple however our room was not ready yet so the attendant took down our cell number and promised to call us. We walked around the resort and up to the Shops At Wailea and got the call around 3:30pm that our room was ready. We checked in and the room was fantastic. It had a partial mountain / ocean view which was quite scenic. The room itself was well laid out with a monstrous bathroom. We took some pictures in the hope that one day, we would have such a bathroom in our house. A couple of things to note are that make sure you reserve in advance for dinner at Nicks. We were not able to secure a dinner reservation on the night we arrived but obtained a slot for the next night. I agree with a previous comment that the person taking pictures was a turn-off. She walked away in a storm when we did not want to purchase her pictures ($20), thanks but no thanks. Dinner was fabulous however bring some sunglasses along if you have an early reservation as the dining areas are not completely enclosed. We woke up around 8am most days and when we arrived at the adult pool, all the chairs around the pool were usually already taken up by people leaving newspapers / towels. The pool boys are supposed to take the towels off the chairs for people who vacate their seats for more than 60 mins however we never saw this happen therefore go in early and reserve your seats and then have breakfast. All in all, a great stay and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE best hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssbutler36
Reviews.Content: WOW...this hotel is amazing, everything from the service, front dest, activities cordinator, food, rooms, and grounds. The grounds were huge, 3 pools, plenty of room to lounge on a char over looking the ocean. After reading some of the negative comments I was a little concerned about it. The hotel could not have been any better, period. I read another comment saying the grounds are small, and the pool was small. It was larger than the Four Seasons, provided more room, a swim up bar, and many more lounge chairs. I did not use the spa or work out facilities, but I did use the beach, and pool areas and they were kept up wonderfully with incredibly nice staff. I got a breakfast package and i would recommend it. Otherwise breakfast is almost 30 bucks a person, I prefer to get it for free myself. Beyond the price, it was great, a full pot of coffee, omlets, fresh fruit, pancakes, french toast, it was great. We ate at Nicks, cafe Ciao, and the Polo Beach Grille. Nicks was incredible for the price, not as bad as I thought. IN fact, Cafe Ciao was just as bad as Nicks, and Nicks has much better food. Beautiful setting as well and views. Wailea is a great area, not too many people around, including at the hotel, and it is beautiful. I will also say that the staff was incredible...we were honeymooners and they had a bottle of champagne and fresh chocolate strawberries waiting for us in our room and gave us the best seat in the house at Nicks, for a sunset view...not only that but everyone said congrats and called us by name. The beach was incredible, crowded, but not that bad and the staff was amazing. We had plenty of room to lay out and take a few walks, sunset was amazing. Also...for activities we did the Snorkling trip at the hotel south of the Fairmont, it was nice, smaller food portions, but nice and the fish and tirtles were great, so was the staff. Also, went to a Luau at the Renicance, it was nice, overpriced, but all of them are...the prices are tough. Definately recommend going to Lahina for cheaper places, especially the Lahina Fish Co, it was OK...and even Tommy Bahama at the Shops at Wailea (Wed night live music) was cheaper and good. Do NOT go to Spago at the 4 seasons, the worst service I have ever had, we got there at 8:30 and did not get our food until 9:55, the waiter did not even get our order until after we had been there for 45 min. I would recommend the fairmont hotel to everyone, beautiful place with great service. The one time they screwed up on my final bill they felt so bad they gave me a free bottle of wine in my room!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: WebboLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for the first week of our two week honeymoon in May 07 and unfortunately it was a fairly disappointing stay. We arrived just behind another couple fairly late at night and while they were treated to a Lei greeting and cold towels, we were just ignored......just what we needed after a 20 hour flight from London. Our room was large but the decoration was quite old fashioned. The bathroom was lovely but I thought the sofa's in the living room were better suited to a 3 star hotel in the Costa's. Our room constantly felt damp which we put down to the over zealous air con! We were lucky to be facing the beautiul fountains and thought we had a great spot. However, we were awoken at 4am on the first night of our honeymoon to the sound of water pipes banging as someone was showering upstairs. The next morning we told reception and the lady's response was "what do you want me to do about it?". Charming. We were eventually moved to a room where the standard was less adequate than the room we had just left, i.e view of a brick wall and a very small bathroom!. I told reception that I did not want to stay in this room but we were then told that all of the rooms at this level were taken and we would have to pay so many hundred of extra dollars a night for the next room up. At this point I felt very let down. My husband 'expressed our disatisfaction' of travelling thousands of miles, paying $600 a night to be woken up by their shoddy plumbing on the first night of our honeymoon. An occasion we can never replicate. We didn't want a free upgrade, we just wanted a room that was the same standard as the first one, with pipes that didn't rattle at 4am! We then asked to see the manager and were swifly placed in another room with a lovely view of the sea and a lovely big bathroom. This aside the resort was nice and big. Three pools to choose from was great, especially the adults only pool. A bit shocked at the $100 price tag for the cabana's especially as they were free at the Four Seasons. We dined at Nick's Fishmarket on our first night but were not that impressed. My husband's lobster was overcooked, however, my scallops were fantastic. We thought that the lady coming round taking pictures of couples was a little tacky for a resort of this standard and she was fairly pushy in her manner. We had lunch at the Polo Grill a couple of times which was very nice. The beach here (Polo beach) was nice and secluded. We snorkelled just round by the rocks and saw lots of turtles, fish, eels and even a white tip reef shark. At this point I promptly swam back to shore even though I know they are really quite harmless! Be careful here though as the ocean gets very rough very quickly. On the first day I was knocked off my feet by rogue waves on several occasions. Keep an eye on any little children. The Fairmont has all the makings of a perfect resort but unfortunatly the dated decor and our experience of appalling service on reception let it down. We spent the second week of our honeymoon at the Four Seasons which, for $150 less a night was far superior in service levels and quality of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Suffering from its success??”
Reviews.Author: sadie5120
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Kea Lani. We selected the Kea Lani again because we didn't want to risk staying somewhere that wasn't as nice. Unfortunately, the Kea Lani was not as nice as it was on our first visit several year's ago. First, the positives: great suites; having two rooms lets those who wake up early (me) not disturb those who prefer to sleep in (my husband), and the bathrooms are spectacular, proximity to the best snorkle spots (although Polo Beach is not a snorkle beach); a separate adult pool. The negatives: too many people crammed into too small of a space -- the beach is small; the pools and pool grounds are small (lounge chairs now cover every inch of the pool areas, including all the grass); the "gym" can accomodate around 10 people, which is too few for such a world-class hotel. Ironically, the resort has the largest rooms, yet the smallest recreational facilities. Perhaps if it had not built the extra wing, the recreational facilities would not be overwhelmed. The Kea Lani is probably great for families -- we took our children with us on the first visit, but I would not recommend it for couples!! I love the Wailea area, and much prefer it to the Kaanapali area, but next time I'll stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality / Highest Value in Waleia”
Reviews.Author: GarthCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Waleia for a wedding with a number of co-workers. My wife and I stay at 4-5 start hotels in the world typically on our many travels. I'm generally a cheapskate where my wife likes living large. The Fairmont was a great value while at the same time a great experience for her. The rest of my co-workers stayed at the Grand Waleia and paid much more than we did. We also had dinner at the Four Seasons and visited the other hotels in Waleia. The best part of the hotels are the HUGE rooms (about 800SF) with separate living room. We could have had a party in the room. The other absolutely great part was the adult pool - separate from children (which we didn't bring on this trip) Compared to these other hotels, the Fairmont was: 1. Better value especially given the MUCH larger rooms 2. Much quieter - less children - more intimate than the Grand Waleia more similar to the Four Seasons. 3. More secluded beach (Grand Waleia and Four Seasons share) 4. Better pool set-up for adults 5. Less restaurants (but nice nonetheless) 6. Much nicer "curb appeal" from the beach with large lawns My wife and I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, nice accomodations, needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: sjrbt
Reviews.Content: The good: beach--small but nice bedding comfort pool--nice--smaller water slide--separate adult pool drinks-good but pricey the hot dogs from the vendor Ability to park for free Fairmont President Club membership--rents you golf clubs for free! Guest relations manager--Lawrence Free washer and dryer on each floor View from the Deluxe Ocean View room The bad: The food by the pool The prices--everything was more here than in Kaanapali The quiet--yes---it is tooooo quiet, no music, no life Lobby is very unimpressive--nice view of the ocean but a pathetic little fountain in a cold, sterile environment The rooms other the the upper end are not very nicely decorated The ugly: The dirty rugs in the elevators The dirty grout in the tile in the common areas The lack of light on the walkways at night No activities going on The cheap, cheap, cheap pool lounge chairs--I've stayed at lesser properties with better chairs Summary: We paid up--way up for a deluxe ocean view room and the view was fabulous (see photo), Prices seem out of line--Four Seasons prices were the same, but quality and service there are worth the upcharge. Here there is no real perk for the upcharge except, I guess the extra room --there is a separate bedroom and living room area. This hotel is not kept up as it should be---it is mostly stucco and it looks dingy--the carpets need replacing as does the tile. Room decorations are sparten and non-appealing. Bad hair care products (bring your own). View of sunsets are amazing

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Kea Lani!”
Reviews.Author: Manning10
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani was 5 star all the way! The rooms were clean and posh. The pools were sparkling and beautiful. The beach was wonderful and the ocean fantastic! The staff was phenomenal in booking dinners and excursions. The grounds were lush and well manicured. The breakfast buffet was lovely and filling. We would definitely go back and plan to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Thought the Kea Lani was a great place”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTravelSeeker
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back yesterday from 12 wonderful days at the Kea Lani. We had a great experience there. The room was clean and a great size for our family of four. The front desk staff, housekeeping, room service, etc. were all very friendly and courteous. I went to the spa and had a wonderful facial. Is every little thing expensive? Absolutely. Can you completely break the budget? Easily. We used the microwave and refrigerator for some lunches & breakfasts just so we wouldn't twitch when the Am Ex bill arrives. I don't think they're any more expensive than the other hotels in the area, however. Wailea is a great area, the beach is post card perfect, the pools need new cement, the pool furniture probably needs to be replaced, but we did have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont! July 7 - 13”
Reviews.Author: lgw
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Maui while "residing" at the Fairmont. Our room was spectacular - large, clean, updated - and the bathroom was something to write home about! And the lanai was also roomy with a lounge chair and table with four chairs. My husband and I have nothing but good things to say about our stay. The staff was friendly, and we especially loved the "lack of a crowd" feeling of the Fairmont. We never had difficulty finding a chair and umbrella at the adult pool, and the adult pool was always empty for our evening swims. The breakfast buffet (our reservations included the breakfast package) was always good, with a huge variety of items. Beware of the birds, though! Never leave your plate unattended! My husband and I didn't do the complimentary canoe excursion that the hotel offers, but my sister-in-law and her son did. They said it was a great excursion, so I do recommend you take the Fairmont up on this freebie!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Fairmont. We enjoyed the property, the location, the staff, the room, the pool, the slide, the restaurants (especially those around the hotel in "The Shops at Wailea" [favorite = Longhi ***** but TommyBah. **** was also great]. Quote "An ultimate family holiday"... I expect we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TxTxAustin
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here! Although our room wasn't ready at 2PM, they upgraded us to a full ocean view and we were in by 3:15. The prior week we had stayed at the Grand Wailea - then zipped over to Kauai for a week, and then returned to Maui for a few nights. I decided it would be good to try the Fairmont, and I'm so glad we did! The rooms are very, very large: large sofa, tv/stereo, desk, kitchenette with fridge/micro/sink, double balcony with table and lounge chairs. Best of all, the bathroom is also large and has GREAT WATER PRESSURE and separate shower/tub. Nice soaps, etc.... The suite was clean and had good quality sheets and towels. I booked the suite at 475.00 per night, and it was definitely worth it. At that rate, I could have booked 2 Fairmont suites for the price of one night-one (smallish) room at the Grand Wailea. the atmosphere at the Fairmont is very different from the Grand Wailea. Hey, how about this for a concept: it was EASY to get lounge chairs by the pool/ocean when we wanted at the Fairmont!!! You'll search for ages for one at the G.W. The view is great, the beach is great, and NOT as manic/crowded at the G.W. I had two teens with me and they enjoyed the basketball goal in the pool, and the game room. The mini-market is great for staples, laundry soap, cereal/milk, ice cream. We enjoyed winding down our trip with the amazing views and super-relaxed atmosphere at the Fairmont. We sat out every evening for sundown, and it was EMPTY at the pool/lawn although the pools are open late each night. Overall, I would absolutely stay at the Fairmont again, especially with kids. Other than our room not being ready early, we have no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Villas Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TSEP
Reviews.Content: Our family booked a 2 Bedroom ocean front villa the week of June 29,2007. While, the grounds were beautiful and the staff of the Kea Lani helpful, we found the villas to be very disappointing. We chose this hotel as we wanted a kitchen and a pool, but to still be near the beach and at a resort. The villas are near the ocean, and came with a plunge pool and outdoor grilling area. The pool needed to be cleansed throughly. We had daily maintenance, however it was pretty built up with residue. The bedrooms in the villas are large and the bathrooms are great. There is a huge closet upstairs that seemed to be an after thought. The living room area and kitchen are not accpetable for this standard of hotel. We found it to be quite run down and in need of a major updating. There is a couch and 2 chairs, the floor is tile with an indoor outdoor rug. The furniture is worn and the decor is thrown together. The kitchen has grantie countertops, but the cabinets appear to be the originals. There is very limited cooking supplies, pots, pans etc.. The floor is tile and is in need of repair, lots of dents. Eventhough the staff did clean daily, we still did not feel like the place was clean. It's just showing age from lots of people staying there and it is not good. As we have a 1 1/2 year old we booked a day room before our flight home. The rooms inside of the hotel were much nicer than the villas. If you do not need a kitchen, this could be an option. We felt that for $2500 a night the Fairmont needs to do some major renovations in order to retain customers. We will not be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel for Us”
Reviews.Author: 949beachlover
Reviews.Content: My husband, kids (9 and 6) and I just returned from a week long stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani, and we were incredibly sad to leave!! We definately consider ourselves to be hotel snobs, and we never settle for anything less than 5 stars. We seriously considered both the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. However, the Grand Wailea looked too crowded and cattle-call-ish for us, and the Four Seasons would not allow us to book a Partial OV room with our 2 kids - they required 2 rooms or a $1000 per night suite (which we were not willing to do)!! We are soooo glad we chose the FKL. The service was top-notch, pool was beautiful and relaxing, yet fun for the kids (water-slide, basketball hoop). The breakfast buffet was great, but we actually got a few boxes of cereal and utilized the in-room refrigerator for an easy breakfast on the lanai most days, and saved ourselves $100 a day that we of course spent on other things - like a pool cabana (fabulous) and nice dinners. Dinner at Nick's was the best we had on the island - much, much better service and menu than at the Grand W. The best thing about the Fairmont are the very large rooms that are perfect for a family - it was like getting a suite without paying the $1000 per night!! We actually did check out both the Grand W. and the Four Seasons and found the Grand W. to have great architecture and nice gardens, but with a very dirty, over crowded pool. The Four Seasons was gorgeous, and would be great if we were traveling as a couple, but not a place for kids (and we often stay at other Four Seasons properties that are very kid-friendly). The Fairmont was wonderful ~ not inexpensive, but Nothing on Maui is if you want luxury....we definately felt it was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: LAND1
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids (12 & 14), mother, and mother-in-law just returned from 8 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani. There isn't one aspect of our experience that doesn't deserve an "excellent" rating. If you're looking for the perfect place to stay in Maui, this is it. What sets the FKL apart from other top end Maui resorts are its beach, villas, and service. We had booked a 2BR ocean-view villa so the six of us could stay in one room. When we checked in we were upgraded to a 3BR Ocean Front villa. Spectacular views, beautiful bedrooms and bathrooms, and a private lanai with our own pool. The breakfast buffet got our days off to a delicious start and the beach and pool areas were perfect. And best of all, every employee of the resort treated us first class. We hated to leave and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great, very expensive...”
Reviews.Author: The_Whiz
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from June 22-29, 2007. We arrived on an early-afternoon flight and drove directly to Wailea. I knew check-in was late afternoon, but hoped that we would be able to get into a room before 4pm. We arrived about noon, checked our bags and registered. The front desk clerk took my cell # and said that we would be called as soon as they prepared our room. We had lunch at Ciao, service was great, food was OK. We killed a 2nd hour strolling the grounds checking things out. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea but wanted to stay at the Fairmont this trip having heard good things. The grounds, pool area, landscaping, etc... don't hold a candle to the Grand Wailea, but I don't think many places in the islands do. We checked back in at the front desk at about 2pm and were told "Check in is at 4pm". At about 3:45 as my kids were melting down I asked to see a manager. She was apologetic and within minutes led us to our room, a deluxe ocean-front. The front desk clerk that I had dealt with was completely indifferent, it was obvious that rooms had been available earlier than 4pm. In fairness the rest of the staff was very good to excellent for the duration of our stay. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The ocean view was fantastic, but I thought it was unusual that there is a condo complex close to the water that is included in your view from this property. One of the wings of the hotel would have views staring directly at this other building... We had an excellent meal at Nick's, the premier restaurant, dinner was approx. $275 for 2 adults, 2 teens. The rest of the food at the resort was just OK. You expect meals in the islands to be expensive, but I thought $28 per person for a mediocre breakfast buffet was too much. There is a deli-coffee-bakery-little store place where you can buy small meals & snacks. You'll get a much better breakfast at Longhis if you walk (fairly long walk, or short drive) to the Shops at Wailea. The Shops, by the way, is a nice center with everything from a general store to a Tiffany's. Good breakfast, good cheeseburger-lunch-type place, swimwear, sunglass & clothing stores, Lapperts Ice Cream shop, too. My overall impression was that with a pre-tax room rate of $775 per night, $45 per day for a beach umbrella and expensive dining & drinks the Kea Lani is a 2nd tier hotel charging top-tier prices. It is a very quiet, low key stay, not much going on. If this is what you're looking for it is a good, not great hotel. We will return to Wailea, but only to stay at the Grand Wailea which charges top-tier prices, but, at least in my mind, is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 2 hours and went to Four Seasons ”
Reviews.Author: brennamt
Reviews.Content: Maui was our last stop on our 2 week honeymoon. After staying the Halekulani in Oahu, one can understand why our expectations were high. I will warn readers that I stay at some great hotels in the US that set my standards - Pennisula, Four Seasons and Ritz. If you are used to second tier hotels, this property will probably be great for you. If you are used to staying at the top hotels, you will be very upset what you get for the price. The minute we walked into this hotel, I had a horrible feeling about it. It is set up poorly and the staff is lethargic, bordering on pathetic. At the front desk, the gentleman was extremely rude when checking in. Another note, I am from New York and I do not mind rudeness very much. However, this guy was really a jerk. We waited for 2 hours for the room, after being told that there were no upgrades available - without even checking. Had a medicore lunch at the pool restaurant with weak service. While there, we noticed maybe one server walking around the pool. We booked a full ocean view room for a hefty rate and told them that this was a honeymoon trip. Once we got our room, we realized that the view was once of an ocean...45 degree BUT it overlooked a construction zone - dirt mounds and all. It was the weakest room that I have ever been put in for that kind of money. We called the Four Seasons and booked a room there. This is probably the worst part of the story...when I went down to inform them that we would be checking out, the guy ONLY said, "OK, we hold a two night deposit and we will send a bellman up to your room in five minutes." That is it! Not a question about what was wrong or if they could do something. NOTHING, just see ya. Upon our arrival to the Seasons, they immediately upgraded our room to an ocean front, huge room and sent champagne later in the evening. The scary thing is that price was the exact same! The property is utterly beautiful and food is great. You never need to leave the grounds. The Fairmont, however, could be fine for a large family. All the rooms are suites and they have a large water slide etc. At teh same time, if you can afford it, the Four Seasons has an amazing rec room for kids complete with a video game room. I spent only two hours at the Fairmont and knew it was not for us. I would not recommend it to anyone, not will I ever stay at a Fairmont in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont wedding”
Reviews.Author: JJJTC
Reviews.Content: We had our daughter's wedding here on the Polo Lawn. We were suppose to have it at the gazebo, but the film festival was having a cocktail party near there and we were worried about the noise, so the hotel was nice enough to move us to the lawn. I am glad they did because it was beautiful there looking out on the water. They were very helpful with phone calls through the months and never got tired of my questions! The pictures on the grounds turned out beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: meladd
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was one I will remember for a long time to come. Our room was absolutely unbelievable. I don't understand the negative reviews about the dated furniture. You're in Maui -- chill out and just get over yourself. As with the review before mine, my husband also earned this trip to Maui through an incentive program at work. We are already planning our next stay at the Kea Lani. (He doesn't know it, but I'm thinking next year!!) The staff was very helpful and accomodated us with whatever we needed. We enjoyed an excellent dinner at Nick's -- you have to try the strawberry flambe dessert -- it was beyond words. We golfed at both Makena South and Wailea Emerald. Both were challenging courses and well maintained. Wailea did have better views, but Makena's #15 was breathtaking. The Fairmont Kea Lani was without a doubt - first class. The grounds were immaculate. The pools were exceptional. The drinks were great. What more can I say? You WILL enjoy your time here. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: AFairmontFan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Fairmont for my wife and I to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I must say this was the best trip we have ever had together! The Fairmont is absolutely beautiful, the staff was friendly, the food was excellent, and the pools are exquisite. If we return to Maui, we will definitely be booking the Fairmont again. It also helps that Maui is beautiful and we had perfect weather the entire week we were there. If there are any negatives, it would only be the expense of staying at this property. Nick's is very good, but pricey. The food that you can order by the pool is also quite expensive. One great option if you are trying to manage your food budget is to eat breakfast and lunch at Cafe Ciao Deli - while still expensive not nearly as much as the main restaurant. The Cafe is right by the adult pool so it is easy to walk to the Deli and get your own food and drinks. Overall, I think the Fairmont is a good value for the money - after all, you expect your vacation to be expensive if you choose a 5 star property!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: bamagirl216
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Kea Lani is a beautiful resort in Wailea. Service is outstanding! Quiet rooms and beautiful surroundings. All rooms are suites with a huge bathroom and small refrigerator/microwave bar area. Pool area is fabulous and beach area is good for snorkeling too. Self parking is free. I would highly recommend this resort. Check out the hotel website for specials. Our plane did not leave until late at night and they have complimentary hospitality rooms for you to shower and clean-up. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful (and expensive) place!”
Reviews.Author: OhioCounseller
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, I was recently at the Kea Lani due to an incentive that I earned through work. My wife and I were there from June 17-22, and we had a great time! In all honesty, this review is tempered with the fact that we did not pay for this trip, which may have made me less picky??? We stayed on the 3rd floor in an oceanview room, and it was "updated" and huge. My wife said that she woke up every morning, walked out on the huge lanai, and said "another day in paradise". We were treated very well by a knowledgeable and friendly staff. Let's face it - the place is beautiful, but it should be for $600+ a night! Be prepared for EVERYTHING to be expensive... $19 hamburgers at the grille by the pool (not including cheese?). We ate banquet style with our group at each meal, and the food was excellant. We did not eat at Nick's, but chose Mama's Fish House on the North Shore for our "expensive" meal ($100 lunch for 2 w/ no drinks). The scenery at Mama's just can't be beat and the food was great! To sum it up, if you can afford it, it is a gorgeous place. But if were my tab, I would never pay this much. At $600+ per night, it makes my Marriott timeshare look like an even better deal! Another FYI - If you are going to stay here, join the "President's Club" at the "Fairmont.com" website. It costs nothing, and you get a free daily paper, hi speed internet, and discounts in the Fairmont store.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here. Not Four Seasons!! Save Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: lawlass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmount Kea Lani for our honeymoon at the urging of my aunt who owns a travel agency and raved about the Fairmount. I'm a lawyer ,my husband an engineer. We had the money to stay at the Four Seasons and we wanted the very best for our honeymoon. The Four Seasons was in our budget and we seriously considered it, though my aunt kept swearing we'd love the Fairmount. I was nervous about going with the Fairmount because I knew the Four Seasons was rated as the number one property on the island. I was made even more nervous by the reviews of some people here. But let me tell you, we loved the Fairmount from the moment we arrived. We chose a suite rather than a villa because we'd just spent a fortune on our wedding and didn't want to dig that hole deeper. We still wanted something higher end, but not over the top expensive.Our room was spectacular. The lani is enormous -- stretches the length of the entire suite from bedroom to living area. It has a chase lounge, full-size dining table and four chairs (we ate multiple meals out there). Ocean views as far as the eye could see with views of the pool and torch lighting ceremony below at night. The bathrooms are just amazing -- marble everything and bigger than most people will see in a hotel. The cleaning staff was fantastic -- everything was always clean and tidy every day. The rooms were quiet -- we never heard people on either side of us. The food at the resort was good, and they have a cafe/store where we often bought and split a hot sandwhich for lunch, or a salad, brought it back to our room and ate on the lani. The staff is amazing -- they do everything you would expect at a high end resort -- set up your chairs on the beach, lay out your towels, set up the umbrella. Even the younger staff was courteous and friendly. The lobby is beautiful -- ocean views from the minute you arrive. Comfortable chairs by the bars. Great location on the island. We had no complaints about the rooms. We cannot say enough good about this resort! We were thrilled that we saved the extra money by staying at the Fairmount instead of the Four Seasons -- we didn't feel we missed out on any luxuries. It gave us that much extra spending money to blow on shopping (The shops at Wailea, ladies,) or dining out and entertainment. Do yourself a favor and find the Waterfront restaurant near the Maui Ocean Center. The best seafood in Hawaii -- hands down; Zaggats agrees. It's a hidden little place, but has stellar service, the most delicious ways to prepare your fish, and charming views of the boats docked oceanside. They also have several non-fish choices. The Seawatch is seconds down the road and it's a well priced restaurant with breathtaking views of the ocean and golf course -- good breakfast food. Enjoy your stay at the Fairmount and feel good that you're not paying what the guy next door is for the same thing! Even our beach was nicer! And closer! Bravo Fairmount for a fantastic first week of our honeymoon! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on paradise island”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymakerUKnowLA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing week in Maui staying at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Rooms are very large, plenty big enough for us and our two girls aged 6 and 3. Recommend a King suite with the children on the sofabed and a rollaway. Privacy for all and the housekeeping staff set everything up and clear it all away in the morning. All staff were very attentive and service was excellent at all times. Yes everything is amazingly expensive at this hotel. You even have to pay $30 a night for the rollaway. This was definitely our most expensive family holiday to date but if you want a luxury holiday where everything is done for you and you are surrounded by beautiful grounds, a fabulous beach and great restaurants at the hotel and in nearby Wailea, then this is the place. We spent the first day being a bit shocked at the price of everything but decided we just had to forget that and enjoy ourselves. If paying $8 for a fruit smoothie by the pool offends you then none of the five star hotels in Wailea are probably for you. Poolside cabanas are $100+ per day but they are still fully booked every day! If you get up reasonably early (by 8.15) you can still get a good spot with an umbrella for free! We walked along the beach and checked out both the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea. Four Seasons grounds and pool are no match for the Kea Lani and Grand Wailea was just too busy with sunbeds in rows as far as the eye could see. Kea Lani grounds are spacious set back a little from the beach. We felt we definitely made the right choice. Good trips with the kids are the Tropical Plantation and Iao Valley. You can do both in a day easily. All our kids really wanted to do was stay at the pool and beach. We went to the Luau at the Marriott which was very good and is just a 15 minute walk along the beach path or a 2 minute trip in the complementary hotel shuttle. Also recommend Blue Hawaiian Helicopters (leave the kids with a nanny from the Nanny Connection) for an unforgettable trip across the crater and to Hana. It's just as spectacular as the road but without the 5 hour car journey! I woule have to struggle to find any negatives. The elevators could do with some new carpet and some of the paths around the pools would benefit from good clean with a pressure washer but that's about all I can think of. Already checking availability for next year and can't wait to go back to Maui and the Fairmont Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every day at this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityTravelFan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a week at this hotel last fall, and I've told people that it probably spoiled me for any other hotel on the planet. I was actually surprised to see any negative reviews; however, everyone is entitled to his or her own opinion. My only quibble with the FKL is that it should have more choice as far as restaurants are concerned. Other than that, our suite was lavish and comfortable; I could probably fit most of my NYC apartment in the enormous bathroom; service was fast and competent; the lobby was incredibly beautiful; and everything was immaculate. Food was definitely expensive, but we found that buying a couple of casual meals at the ABC store in the Wailea shopping mall was a cheaper alternative than the deli in the hotel. We didn't rent a car, so the Cadillac service back and forth in the area was a delightful perk that we didn't expect. In short, we loved it and I'd go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This Hawaiian gem has lost its luster”
Reviews.Author: nicatnite81
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Fairmont many times over the last several years, and I'm sorry to say it's gone a bit downhill since our first visit about eight years ago. Back then, this place was the epitome of luxury. We were in awe of the pristine white buildings and lush green grounds, and the rooms were impeccably appointed with gorgeous furniture and marble bathrooms. Kip, who greeted us on our first day there, was one of the most personable and helpful bellmen we'd ever met. On our most recent trip last summer, however, we were less than impressed. The grounds are still beautiful, but the accomodations leave much to be desired for such an expensive hotel. We booked two rooms, a deluxe ocean view suite and a regular ocean view suite. Oddly enough, the "deluxe" ocean view barely had a view at all due to some overgrown palm trees. After numerous calls to the front desk and two room switches later, we finally got the view that was promised (which was quite lovely). But the rooms themselves are definitely dated - in particular, the furnishings and wall treatments are in dire need of an upgrade. Also, the elevators consistently smelled musty and we did not experience the outstanding customer service we had become accustomed to in years past. Overall, it was by no means an unpleasant stay, but certainly did not showcase the excellence we'd come to expect from the Fairmont brand. This summer we're trying our luck at the nearby Wailea Beach Villas, which are less expensive and seem to have most if not all the amenities of the Kea Lani. Stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: “Royalty, even just for one night!”
Reviews.Author: princess214
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for our 3 year anniversary and we decided to spend one night at the Fairmont. We stayed there when we got married, and thought it would be nice, even if it was for just one night. We were greeted by the valet who took our car and the overzealous juice lady. She offered us leis and juice and while we were checking in she "sidled" up to us (scared the crap out of us) and offered us more juice. Matt checked us in and we had mentioned that it was for our anniversary and imagine our surprise when he mentioned that he upgraded us. We had originally booked a partial ocen view and we got upgraded to a deluxe ocean view! Yay! We had to wait for a little while for our room to be ready, no biggie, we went to the pool bar for lunch. They called us when our room was ready. Danny was the bellhop who was so very nice and he was the same bellhop who assisted us 3 years ago! Our room was wonderful! Beautiful view! I headed out to get my spa treatment and the hubby headed out to the swim up pool bar....We reconvened at around 6 and we had champagne waiting for us from the hotel in our room! Thanks Fairmont! A little later, all of housekeeping showed up to give us a nice picture frame. We got room service (a tradition of my hubby and I, one night we splurge and get room service). All in all, the Fairmont treated us very well and one day we will stay more than one night. I promise! Thank you Fairmont, for providing us with a wonderful memory!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: F1GP
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani was just wonderful! We stayed here 4/28-5/5 in a Deluxe Oceanview Suite. Very large corner room with tons of windows and wrap-around lanai. From the moment we arrived the entire week was First Class. The staff was friendly and inviting and the hotel was immaculate. It is pricey, but we stocked the fridge in the room with water, snacks and wine from Safeway. Much cheaper than room service or the store onsite. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madie01
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed 1 night at the Kea Lani. Our room was fairly large and very nice and clean. The Bathroom was huge and beautifully decorated. We had a leaking toilet but was repaired within an hour. Management and staff were very friendly and attentive. Renovations going on in an area of the resort. Nice, BIG pools. We did not go to the beach. Great food through out the restaurants on the resort. Must try the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EK08904
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were just at the Fairmont for 5 days and we had a wonderful time. It is a gorgeous resort, with every amenity you can think of. The service is also the best I have ever seen. The only negative is that they charge you for EVERY extra. We visited the other hotels on the Wailea strip, and this is by far the nicest and classiest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, yucky food”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: I picked the Fairmont for a week long stay during our wedding/honeymoon. We were married at TBR on Oahu and after that, there was a lot to live up to. First of all, the grounds are gorgeous. You walk in and you're transported. We loved sitting in the lobby area--we dubbed the Tommy Bahama room---during sunset and having a cocktail. The rooms were really nice. I didn't notice any dirty spots or wear and tear. We were greeted with champagne and strawberries upon arrival and were upgraded to an ocean view suite, which you could see the ocean in the distance. We also had the breakfast package and we had omlettes in the morning. I would recommend this otherwise you'll be spending $50 per day on breakfast. We had room service twice and while the service was good, the food is less than average. We had to call and complain b/c the food was inedible. They were kind enough to take the food off. We rented a cabana one day which costs $100 for the day, but you get free fruit, water and soft drinks. Which by the pool you're going to spend that anyway. I bought some lunch one day at the deli and it was pretty good. We went to Nick's for dinner one night and it was ok, but not great. My favorite places to eat on Maui are David Paul's and Mama's Fish house. The food and atmosphere are amazing. The server's at the pool are awesome and remember your name. We hung out at the adult only pool and it was more mellow than at the kid pool. We were kinda bummed that the swim up bar is on the kid side, so we went to check it out. It's a great side for people with kids and the rooms are great for people with kids as well because you have two separate rooms. We will come back when we have kids, but until then, we're gonna stick with the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - But watch out for those extra fees!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieSeattle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've been to the Kea Lani, the last time was about 5 years ago. I like the location and I love the rooms. They are good sized suites with a bedroom and a fold out couch in the living area as well as enough room for a cot. Large bathroom so you're not running into each other. There is a microwave and a small refrigerator as well so you can easily buy food and drinks and keep them there. The lanais are large and we had an ocean view that was very nice on the south end of the hotel. Overall the staff was very friendly and helpful. What I don't like is the fact that they charge you $45/day for an umbrella or $20/day for a Boogie board! And their food and drinks are also outrageous - $11 for a Mai Tai, $39 for a rib eye steak - and that's at the casual restaraunt? I just think that's taking advantage of the situation! We ended up going out and buying cheap boogie boards and umbrellas ourselves! Combine that with buying breakfast and lunch foods and drinks and keeping them in the fridge helped us keep costs down. I also found that the quality of food and restaraunt service had gone down since the last time we were there. The pool restaraunt was fine, but the casual restaraunt was marginal. We didn't eat at the fancy restaraunt - Nicks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to spend Spring Break!”
Reviews.Author: cradlemom
