Reviews.Content: We took our four children to the Kea Lani for week during spring break. It was our first time to this resort, though we have stayed at many of the resorts on Maui. It was a fabulous trip. The weather was perfect, and our experience at the hotel was also great.There are many resorts that are beautiful, lush and on the beach. What set the Kea Lani apart from them were the following: First, the staff were extremely competent and friendly. They noticed that there was a birthday celebration that week in our family and sent up a bottle of champagne and dessert, with flowers. Second, there was a free washer and dryer, complete with detergent, right on our floor. We werent in a villa, just the regular rooms, but to have this added convenience right there was terrific! In addition , although we were there during spring break, with the hotel filled to capacity, the place didnt seem Crowded! It was not difficult to find a spot at one of the pools. There was room to run around. We could make reservations at the restaurants, though we did make our reservation at Nick's while still at home, and I would recommend this. The rooms are huge and accomodate parents and kids very easily. Its nice to have a refrigerator and microwave also. Finally, unlike the Westin Kaanapali, we werent barraged around every corner to buy a time share. The tempo of this resort feels relaxed. As one employee said when I asked her why everyone seemed so nice here, "What's not to like? Its beautiful here and everyone seems to be having a great time. " We will return.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT has happened?????”
Reviews.Author: PhillyKid
Reviews.Content: This was our family's third trip to the Kea Lani. It's been one of our very favorite places to go. The rooms are all suites, the staff couldn't be nicer, it's extremely well set-up for families with its own beach, two separate pools, a swim-up bar, several restaurants and a deli/market to buy things when you get tired of those restaurants. It's a large hotel that doesn't feel too large. But what has happened to the prices????? It was always expensive. I mean, you expect that from a beachfront hotel in Wailea. But it's gotten grotesque with charges for everything. A poolside cabana now costs $109. An umbrella on the beach - ONE umbrella - costs $45. We didn't have a meal for four (2 kids and 2 adults) that was under $150. Smoothies at the pool are $8. I don't know but it seems to me if you are paying $1000/night (which we did for a larger end suite during spring break) you should be able to get an umbrella at the beach for, maybe $10 or $15. The whole experience was so over the top that, when we left, we knew it was our last trip to the Kea Lani.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like cattle”
Reviews.Author: JJBJW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two teenagers stayed at the Kea Lani over Spring Break. We felt like cattle from the moment we arrived. Average check in, service, lines everywhere, crowded. Our room was partial ocean view. Quiet, but not too big with the rollaway down. The cleaning staff was the best part. They did a good job. We found the food average and expensive. Parking is free but tight with a SUV. I did wash laundry as this was the second half of our stay (the first half on Lanai) and it was nice it was free. The beach was nice. We liked Big Beach on the south end. Learned to surf at Cove Park. We were able to use a suite to shower in the evening prior to our red eye flight, which was nice. We were, however, disappointed in the Fairmont considering the price and reputation. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani Rocks”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in February with a small business conference. This is a beautiful hotel with fantastic grounds, pools, restaurants, bars and even a bit of shopping. The beach is rather small, but the pools make up for that. We would always watch whales offshore with a Mai Tai around sunset. It's pretty expensive but we felt it was worth it. We found the service to be outstanding, truly. We only left the resort 2 times to go to the Wailea shops down the street (the hotel will drive you over there gratis in their Caddy). We loved this place and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time for our family!”
Reviews.Author: kwagmeister
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay - and loved it! This was our third trip to Maui and the first to this property. I had considered the Grand Wailea as we wanted a suite for our family of 4 - our travel agent, knowing how much we appreciate a less crazy kind of trip, encouraged us to consider this property. I'm so glad we did! I'd read some iffy reviews and wondered how we'd feel -- but our attitude was simple -- we were on vacation with our kids in paradise - as long as the hotel was nice and the staff nice, too we knew we'd enjoy it -- and we sure did. We arrived very late after a delayed flight, so missed the leis on arrival -- but the kids were delighted to get them the next day. We were very impressed with the beautiful, open lobby and quick check in. Staff was extremely accomodating, which we appreciated after travelling from Indiana. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The pools are lovely and well kept as well. I run every morning and really enjoyed the path from the Kea Lani down to the Renaissance (saw whales from it several mornings!) and I liked the chance to check out the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons. The Grand Wailea was a zoo -- people were staking out chairs at the crack of dawn and I noted staff policing the groups to keep folks from getting a bit crazy -- which shouldn't be necessary. The chairs are stacked one on top of each other too, which reminded me of Atlantis (we were there for spring break last year). We sure didn't need that. The Four Seasons is nice but not nearly as open in feel as the Kea Lani -- it won our raves hands down. Yes folks stake out chairs at the Kea Lani, too, but it's not nearly as bad. You can rent a cabana for the day (which means a higher level of attention) or find an umbrella (we did that) and folks do move around from beach to pool etc.. There were quite a few families but what would you expect? If you want an adult only vacation then I'd look at the Four Seasons or one of the condos throughout the island. Our hectic lives (my husband is a heart surgeon) mean that when we vacation we don't mind paying for quality - and we expect it. This hotel lived up to it and then some. The mini fridge conked out on day 1 - within just 5 minutes of calling there was a new one at the door. One evening we returned a bit early from a whale watching cruise to find housekeeping (and by the way there are two staff per room) finishing turndown. They were very nice and made a point of asking if we needed anything else -- using our names -- THAT impressed us. My daughter liked the orchids on the pillows. We opted for the breakfast buffet - the kids really liked that though my husband and I aren't big eaters - but the fruit was fabulous! Lunch for us was around the pool and the kids again liked the menu (again, my husband and I tend to skip lunch). We couldn't get a reservation at Nicks earlier than 8:30 pm so we visited their other restaurant, Sorrento's , which is down the street -- it was very good. Our favorite dinner restaurant was Pacific O's in Lahaina -- the best fish we had by far (we are seafood fans) This time of year is prime whale watching season, and we went on the Pacific Whale Foundation's cruise, which was terrific - they really know their stuff and you can tell they are passionate about what they do. We stopped counting at 14 whales! We'd read tips about stopping at Safeway for sodas and snacks - we did that and filled the mini fridge - beats paying the small fortune for sodas time and time again. Save your $ for the great shopping at Whaler's Village or the Shops at Wailea! I would encourage visitors to sign up for the President's club -- you'll find that you get free internet access (vs. 14.50 per day), speedier check in and check out, plus you can earn rewards after a 10 night stay -- and it's free to sign up. I needed to check email each day so that free sign up was a great thing to do -- do it before you leave and make sure your travel agent gives the hotel your number -- and bring it with you in case that person forgets. Do the same with your car rental company. We really liked this hotel and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “miss the fairmont”
Reviews.Author: cnett25
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after staying a week at the Fairmont. It was my husband's retirement celebration so we booked a 3 bedroom villa for our children and granchildren: 5 adults and 3 little ones. My husband and I (how smart are we?) had an oceanview suite in the hotel. Everything was wonderful. The staff is so accomodating and friendly. We really felt like it was home. The pool area was perfect for us. We walked over to the Grand Wailea a few times and it was so big and so busy. We could keep track of everyone at the Fairmont pool. And the adults could easily escape to the adult pool and hide out awhile. We had dinner at Nick's and enjoyed it (prices were high, but, hey, you're in paradise). Loved IO in Lahaina and, of course, Mama's Fish House. Did not like Buzz's Wharf; service was really bad (we waited 20 minutes to order a cocktail), the food was mediocre (except for the tahitian prawns) and it wasn't cheap. From the looks of the place, you'd think they'd have outside seating but they don't so you've got nice views but not sea breezes like you'd expect. Back to the Fairmont. We really liked the Polo Grill. Get the Caesar Salad with Fish of the Day, delicious or the Ahi tuna salad. And be prepared to pay $22. for them. Everything is so expensive and we too have traveled extensively. Our first trip to Safeway for breakfast things, juice, beer, wine, milk and snacks was $400. We shopped again for steaks, baked potatoes, and salad for 7 people and it was another $200. Be prepared. Things can be 3 times as expensive. When we were checking out, I noticed many shell shocked people checking their bills. Lava flows are $13.00. One afternoon, my husband, my sons in law, and my son racked up a bar bill of $200., not proud of that but it's the truth. For us, it was the trip of a lifetime and we thoroughly enjoyed it. My husband (who is difficult to please) said it best when he said that there is nothing he would have changed. Now we're just jet lagged.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, would go back”
Reviews.Author: hugemauifan
Reviews.Content: Feel obligated to write a review, I've used this website so much to make travel decisions. We stayed at this resort from Feb 17 to 26th 2007. I have stayed at every Wailea resort in the last ten years on this stretch, the Grand Wailea, the 4 seasons, the Marriott, and now the Kea Lani. We really enjoyed the rooms, they are absolutely huge. We booked two deluxe ocean front suites, about $800 per night, took my in-laws and two of three children. My wife and I paid the whole bill, six first class airline tickets and two deluxe ocean front suites, almost $24,000, so we are not afraid to spend for a vacation. I say that so you are aware of our budget, we are not bargain shoppers. You never know when reading a review if the person writing it is used to meager accomodations and is then blown away by a resort experience. Check-in was very quick, with baggage service also very quick. We were greated with leis and cool towels, and after 13 hours from Ohio, and then another two getting out of the airport and to the resort, it was very welcome. The rooms again are very spacious, nice bathrooms, with two sinks, large soak tubs and a walkin shower, no door on the shower for privacy. The room has awesome balconies, or lanai (sp), we really enjoyed looking for whales from the lanai. We were in room 408, and also had 404 rented. The rooms do have a nice sized fridge, we would recommend getting soft drinks away from the resort and keep in the fridge. We didn't want to go to Costco like others recommend, the shops at Wailea have ABC and Whalers General, you can get soft drinks for $3.69 for six cans, beats paying $4.00 per can. We don't sweat the small things, but I won't throw money away either. The breakfast buffet is really good, however after eight mornings gets old, and if you are on the package they would not let us order of the menu. Lunch was generally at the Polo Grill, the service leaves something to be desired, the staff seams a little distracted. When the place wasn't that busy, we sat for at least ten minutes before our order was taken a couple of times. We did not eat at the resort for dinner, after breakfast and lunch there we needed a break, so we went offsite. The Italian place just down the road across from the shops at Wailea is incredible, we went there twice. Can't remember the name now though, but the location is the old pro shop of the Wailea Blue golf course, try it you will like it. The pools are very nice, and bathwater warm. Plenty big for all the guests, and the water slide is just ok, nothing spectacular, but we've been to Atlantis is the Bahamas four times and that will spoil you as far as pools and water slides go. The resort is loaded with families, so if you are a couple looking for peace and quiet, try the four seasons. If you have kids, this is definately the place I would go, it isn't the zoo the Grand Wailea is, we went down and walked through the Grand again, and I was glad we were at the Kea Lani. However my wife and I were at the Four Seasons last February, and we missed the resort, we will go back to the four seasons again next year when we go alone. The Kea Lani did nothing wrong, it is a fabulous property, but when we go alone we have found our place and when we take the kids we have found our place. One knock is the beach it is small and gets very crowded, I like my space and you can't get alone really on this beach, there is always someone within ten to fifteen feet from you. Love this part of the world, will go back every year if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nancy2121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a Thanksgiving trip with family but when everyone else pulled out, we decided to go-it-alone. If only we were alone! The place was packed, full of families as one might expect over the holiday, but it certainly wasn't packed with staff. We're frequent guests at the Fairmont and when we arrived we asked about upgrading to a higher class room. Even though we were paying $480 a night - we were told that we'd have to pay another $180 a night for the better view. Booked for 6 nights, I was astonished that they priced it so cost-prohibitively when otherwise the room would go empty. We then checked with the concierge about about golf and scuba outings. They did have our tee-time scheduled, but made no arrangement or presented options for scuba even though we called a week in advance to get a dive trip arranged. We heard nothing about the dive the next day so we called to check on status. They advised us that all boats were full (a fact we learned was simply incaccurate when we ultimately booked ourselves on a dive trip the day after). We actually pulled out the yellow pages to look up dive shops since both the concierge and activities desk were basically incompetent. It actually gets worse. We lounged by the pool on a couple of afternoons and found them cluttered with used towels, plastic water bottles and completely devoid of any staff. When you're paying $12 for a rum and coke slushy, you certainly expect to get it without walking up to the bar and flagging a waitperson. Really . . . gets even worse. We decided to golf again (at the Emerald Course - which was definitely a highlight of our trip and highly recommended). Concierge arranged our tee time and we asked that they have the bell staff bring my husbands set of club and a loaner set of clubs (compliments of the hotel - nice) to lobby. We pulled our rental car around and the bell staff placed both golf bags in our trunk. When we arrived at the golf course and pulled out the loaner set for me, we realized they'd actually given me another guests clubs. We then contacted that hotel to have them retrieved and another set brought over. When the driver from the hotel arrived, he stepped out of the car and said to me "you should have checked the bags before putting them in the trunk." Really . . . he said that to me, even though I had nothing to do with placing the bags anywhere, and even it I had, he was totally unprofessional and rude. I couldn't believe it! For prices this high, there are much better options down the beach - like umm, the Four Seasons. They really need to get their act together and start acting a little more like a Four Seasons if they want to charge Four Seasons prices. Staff need to be better trained and managed. Upgrades should be standard for frequent travelers paying rack rates. Better service needed everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: lovetrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for a week in February and loved it! The staff was very friendly, the rooms were awesome, and the pools were great. Some reviews I read talked about the hotel showing its "age"; my comment to that is you have way too much time on your hands if you notice the woodwork peeling! Instead of finding the negatives, sit on your patio/deck and watch the whales, take a walk, etc. The rooms were really nice in my perspective. The bathroom was huge; the bed was really comfy, and the deck was awesome. We would sit out there for hours and watch the whales, sunset, and stars. Pay the extra to get an oceanview because it's worth it. We stopped at the ABC store to pick up munchies, etc to have in our room which was great. When we there, the hotel was full but we never had a problem finding a chair at the pool. If we did, all you need to do is ask someone to get a chair for you and they will find a place for it. The beach is a little small but there are other beaches to visit. The cold towels and pineapple was great, especially on the really hot days. We enjoyed the upper pool as many adults were having fun on the slide! Nick's was great but expensive; pretty much everything in Maui is expensive but if you are worried about cost then don't go. Mama's Fish House is awesome also! They are so many great restaurants that you really can't go wrong. Overall, I would definately stay at the Fairmont again. If you join the Fairmont President's Club you get some "extra" perks. It's free to join. Great resort!

Reviews.Title: “The Epitome of a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTA_Member
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY recommend the Fairmont Kea Lani. The hotel staff makes everything easy so you donâ€™t have to lift a finger. Service is a high priority and the hotel makes sure their guests are happy. For instance, there was a mix-up in our room reservations and we were pretty upset. The front desk person was terrific and really took the extra effort to honor our request. She handled the problem efficiently and we got an ocean view room that we were very happy with. We stayed 5 nights over the President's Day long weekend and were looking forward to a quiet, relaxing vacation. It was perfect; a perfect place to do absolutely nothing and get spoiled. I can vouch that the hot rock massage at the spa is fantastic. The guests at the Fairmont consist of young families and couples. I was a little concerned that with young families there would be a lot of noise and I wouldnâ€™t be able to sleep. Fortunately, there was no need to worry and I slept really well. I think the glass doors and walls in the room are fairly well-insulated or sound-proof. What I liked best about the hotel was that it never felt crowded. There's so much space!! You could always find a lounge chair and there weren't people hovering over you, unlike the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons where there's just people all over the place. There is a kidâ€™s pool and a separate adult's pool, which was perfect for a young couple with no kids. Servers come by and take your drink or food orders so you never have to leave the pool or your lounge chair. They also sometimes come by with pineapple slices and cool towels. Itâ€™s heaven!! Also, try the breakfast menu at the Kea Lani Restaurant. Itâ€™s delicious! The suites are quite spacious for two people and could comfortably fit four. The pictures of the suites on the website are accurate. The furnishings and decor are somewhat dated in that it looks like it was designed with a 70s style in mind. But I wouldnâ€™t get too hung up on that. You still get all the modern conveniences and comforts: refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, large comfy beds, etc. If youâ€™re someone who wants more modern looking rooms, then you may be happier somewhere else like the Four Seasons. However, you should note that the standard suites at the Fairmont are larger by at least 200 square feet. Housekeeping is fabulous and the rooms are kept super clean. The hotel has one free washer and dryer on each floor. They get taken quickly so you need to get there EARLY. If you decide to stay at the Fairmont, you must sign up for the President's Club. Thereâ€™s no charge to join and as a member you get a lot of free perks: daily newspaper, high-speed internet, usage of the gym. Also, take advantage of some of the complimentary activities the hotel offers. They have kidâ€™s activities, a morning yoga class for guests (which I took advantage of). Of course, to get such first class treatment and accommodations, it costs you. But it's worth every penny. I canâ€™t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alchu
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 weeks at the hotel. We enjoyed this part of Maui because the weather is better, and it is not the hustle and bustle of Lahaina area. Maui is still pretty undeveloped and has some very beautiful drives one can take. We stayed in room 302 a corner suite, it had a spectacular view, but I feel 1000 a night was too high. We could watch the whales frolicking in the ocean, and we always had a wonderful cool breeze on our patio and room for sleeping, was wonderful. We did not like the food there, that is the negative. We booked Platinum American Express so we got the breakfast buffet included, and one lunch meal. We usually drove to the next little town Kihei to eat, they have a Outback, Roy's, fast foods, and some good deals on small cafes and diners. The Blue Wave had great early bird specials.... We also, went to Costco and picked up a rotessiere chicken, was delicious and a welcome change from restaurant food..... I think Nicks is expensive and not that good, ala carte. We did not find Hawaii anymore expensive then the cost of living in Omaha, that is groceries, etc...Costco had the same prices as elsewhere.... Hotel food is expensive in any city you go to..... All in all, this was the best vacation we have had in years, and we travel the World.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Maui”
Reviews.Author: SBgirl2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day stay at the Fairmont and it was an awsome honeymoon. I was impressed that after meeting or talking to you once, all the staff remembered your name. We booked a garden view and I was going to inquire about an upgrade but my husband wasn't feeling well after our very turbulant flight so we took the room assigned to us. I was so glad we didn't switch. We were on the first floor with a patio lanai that opened onto a large grassy area with lush tropical plants and overlooked a great fountain. We could just exit our patio and walk to the pool or beach without having to walk back down the hall, up the stairs and through the shops and deli area. The kids club was right next door but didn't pose a problem for us as we were out most of the day and then the room was empty at night so there was no one next to us. Even though we were set pretty far back from the beach, we could still hear the crashing waves at night. The one downside about the beach is that it is soooo small and pretty packed during the day, but big beach is about 1 mile down the road and we found a nice small but uncrowded beach less than a quarter mile down the road between some new homes that are being built. The resturants and deli are a bit expensive but I expected that, and the food and coffee drinks were very good. The hotel also had an in house bakery and i would definitly suggest picking up dessert in the deli - heavenly! I loved our room, it was large and well appointed, but the bathroom was my favorite part. Because the room was a suite, it felt more homey to come back to at the end of the day with plenty of room to spread out and relax. Everything looked new and very clean and well maintained. We were also there when they were doing alarm testing and they said they would start at 8 am, but we didn't hear anything till much later and it was not a big deal at all. As for wear and tear around the hotel, I didn't notice any. The Four Seasons is next door and I personally did not like it near as much, so glad we picked the Fairmont. I have stayed at other Four Seasons properties and found the hotel and staff to be comparable at the Fairmont. As for the clientel, Four Seasons has a more well known reputation I think and draws a higher matinence crowd, Fairmont seemed much more laid back and unpretencious. I could go on forever, I LOVED IT! one last piece of advice for travelers, don't plan too much. We didn't do 1 thing we planned to (volcano, road to hana etc.) Once you get there, just enjoy the Aloha spirit and go where the day takes you.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed out Stay”
Reviews.Author: ESH07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kea Lani from Feb 6-11th, 2007. Overall the hotel is great. Lobby is open air and breezy, service impeccable and the rooms are all a very generous size (around 800 sq feet). Here's a breakdown of my opinion...... Rooms: I arrived to the hotel sick with what I thought was a cold and turned out to be pnemonia so you could say that I spent a lot of time in our room. All rooms are suites with large bathrooms, separate large tub and walk in shower. Rooms have two televisions, small refrigerator, microwave. Rooms were cleaned daily and were immaculate. The cleaning people were so nice, and even brough me tea and chicken soup one morning when I didn't leave the room. Each evening the rooms are refreshed with new towels, overall, turn down service was wonderful. Our rate was $325 and I really felt we got a great value. Service: Overall service at the Kea Lani is great. Concierge, bell hops, and pool staff were all very helpful and attentive. There is food and beverage service at each pool, I found the service at the adult pool to be slower than at the "kid" pool and the upper level pool. Throughout the day, people come by with large pieces of pineapple...such a nice (and easy) touch for the hotel to do. Food: You must eat at Nick's Fish Market (make a reservation or eating at the bar is great too)....it is truly outstanding. It's worth the $$$ as well....and you should know that you will pay through the nose for food at the resort. This is where I didn't feel we got a value (aside from Nick's which is awesome and worth it). The Kea Lani has pool side service for lunch as well as the polo beach grill (same menu and prices as eating poolside) and sandwiches were upwards of $23/each. There is a deli that we ate at a lot, which wasn't cheap, but you could get a sandwich or breakfast foods (it's sort of a gormet deli, so you can get everything from cereal and bananas to yummy cheeses, tuna and chicken salads, pizza,fruits, etc) to lunch to snacks and beer. I would say for breakfast and lunch we spent most of our money here and felt we got great food at a better value. Pools and Grounds: Clean and nice, but teaming with people. Very kid friendly resort. There is a kid pool where the majority of families are, as well as an adult pool which is (obviously) adults only. I actually found this pool to be somewhat boring. The "upper" pool was our favorite, and we found it to mostly consist of adults. Great service up there too. Overall, this is a very busy resort, don't come if you want quiet...there are people everywhere! Beach: Beach was nice, not very large, this isn't a resort you come to to "walk the beach". There is a beautiful, winding nature walk (for lack of a better title) that winds around in front of many of the other resorts in Wailea (Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Rennaisance). The walk is great for exercising and checking out some of the other hotels in the area. Beach itself (in front of the Kea Lani) is free of rocks and good for swimming and boogie boarding. The surf is moderate and it doesn't get very deep. Because I don't like the crazy, busy resorts I don't know if we'd return. The value for the rooms (in high season) at $325 I thought was reasonable, but the cost of food or doing ANYTHING else was so expensive....then again so is most of Hawaii in general! I have to say that while my review of the hotel is accurate, because I was sick I really didn't get to go around and see much of Wailea or Maui, so it's hard for me to comment on more. I did make it over to the shops at Wailea (large open air shopping Mall and it's great and worth the trip (you can walk on the nature path or along the road fairly easily). My husband played golf on two occasions and LOVED the Emerald course (about 5 min from the hotel by car).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property and Outstanding Services”
Reviews.Author: BCgurl
Reviews.Content: This property is first class all the way. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the twice daily maid service is a treat! All of the staff of the hotel are so friendly and address you by name...... We loved the restaurants and the complimentary car service that would take you throughout Wailea for free. only nit picky thing was the fact that the hotel charged $10.00/hour for an umbrella at the beach, a bit nickel and diming I thought, but we still paid for one! Loved this place, would recommend to families and couples, not over run with kids, and there is an adult pool if you dont want to be surrounded by kids. I would stay here again in a second, it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel with 5 Star Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DanCooper
Reviews.Content: I write this from the Fairmont. We stayed 4 days at the Fairmont Kai Lani corner suites and 3 days at the Ritz. Unbelievable view in an incredibly spacious suite. But for $1000+ a night, I expect that. Lobby is spectacular. Service is for the most part first rate. Nick's Fish Market is incredibly good. But the hotel lacks things you expect in a true five star hotel. if we had not spent $1000 a night, I would probably overlook the following: 1. Lots of wear in common areas and in wood in rooms. Paint smudges, dirt etc. The concrete around the outside pool and gardens is worn and full of dirt. Walls are dirty and smudged. The hotel has a tremendous amount of heavy wood trim. Its all aged terribly. Cracks, scratches, peeling. The cabinets in our room look like they needed replacing five years ago. Same with the wooden elevator trim. Apparently all rooms were renovated recently. I suspect for budget reasons, they skipped redoing the wood. At the rates they charge, that is not acceptable. 2. Internet access for wireless has been out for 30 days. I mentioned to the manager that wasn't really in keeping with what they should have and she shrugged her shoulders, politely smiled and apologized. 3. A notice arrived in our room that audible smoke alarms would be going off from 8 am to 3 pm every day of our stay, as part of maintenance. So far we haven't heard them so maybe its away from us. But why would they start this at 8 am? 4. Room service items left out by maid after clean up were not picked up all day. 5. Sound proofing could be better. You can hear plumbing and some noise from surrounding areas. Having said all this our room is unbelievably nice. But its also a corner suite with the best views. My guess is that we could get similar views at other hotels at this price. All very little things but given the price unacceptable. We walked throught he Four Seasons and unquestionably the common and pool areas are much better maintained. Its ironic that the service and condition of the Ritz was better than the Fairmont. The reputation of the Ritz in Maui suggested the opposite but our room there was impeccable, albeit dated in decor. Everything worked. The grounds were meticulously maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sgood1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we felt pampered and thought we were in paradise. The staff was first class all the way as was the hotel. Our room was on the fourth floor with a full ocean view and also overlooked the pool areas. The room was wonderful, clean, and the king size bed very comfortable. The bathroom was perfect with a large marble walk-in shower and a very large tub. We enjoyed having a fridge and microwave in the room as we went to Safeway and got some breakfast rolls and bagels and had them with our coffee(in room) on the balcony which had a full size table and chairs. Pure Heaven!!! One morning we actually watched several whales and their calves frolicking not far off the beach. BEAUTIFUL CREATURES!! Take your binoculars!! The buffett at the Fairmont was also very good as was the food at" Nicks Fishmarket". Great service there too!!! The hotel has three pools(one is an adults only) and we could always find a lounger near the pool. We enjoyed the personal service here too such as the cold washcloths and the fresh pineapple. Only complaint here is that they allowed people to reserve loungers practically before dawn and often times those people wouldn't show up for hours. Or, one person would stay with about five chairs and hold them all day just in case rest of family joined them. I am so glad that we stayed in Wailea as it isn't as windy or rainy on that side of the island. We were there for ten days and never got rained on--not even on the drive to Hana!!! One of the highlights of our trip was the "Warren and Annabelle" show in Lahaina. Best show we've seen in a long time!! We booked the "Royal Flush" and you don't need to eat dinner before the show as the appetizers, drinks, and dessert are enough to qualify as a meal!! Great food and service. Book this show before you leave for Maui as it is booked at least two weeks in advance. We ate at some great restaurants but felt the best food was Buzz's wharf Restaurant. Their Tahitian Prawns are better than any lobster I've ever eaten!!! Prices are reasonable and portions are generous!! Their lava cake is "to die for"!!! Mamas Fish House was also excellent. All in all, a great trip except for the "Feast of Lele" Luau. Horrible food and service. NOT a traditional luau and is the most expensive luau on the island!!! Will stay at the Fairmont again ASAP!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lgcoto
Reviews.Content: We come to Maui twice a year with our teenagers.This where we stay and we just couldn't ask for better accomidations, friendly staff and they food is just..well, the best! They have a wonderful bartender by the pool, his name is "Dave". I just can't say enough nice things about the Kea Lani!Except, look no where else.You will be so glad that you stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Stay Anywhere Else in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: VenturaCountySurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont the week after Thanksgiving. We're a big fan of "low season" vacations, and again we picked the perfect time to go. As soon as we checked in the kids darted for the waterslide. They practically had the pool to themselves, so they were in heaven. Here are the reasons I choose the Fairmont above the other luxury resorts in Maui: 1) Service Service Service! Employees of all levels acknowledged us as we walked by, making sure there wasn't anything we needed. 2) Price! The huge 800 sq ft suites are much more economical than getting 2 rooms at the Hyatt or The Grand Wailea. My husband and I had a king bed in the bedroom, my 9yr old son had the sofabed, and my 7 yr old daugher slept on the extending part of the large sofa in the living room. 3) No resort fee or self parking fee! These can range up to $26 per day plus tax! That could add up to over $200 for a week's stay! 4) To me, this was a huge surprise....There are free laundry facilities on each floor! We bought a little box of detergent and were able to wash and dry our swimsuits; AND we went home with clean clothes! 5) Free activities: free yoga classes, free kayaking and scuba classes, free entertainment (torchlighting ceremony and live entertainment in the lobby.) 6) The humongous bathroom and the bath amenities! YUMMY! 7) This is definitley not a pretentious resort; anyone will feel so comfortable here. Such a great accommodating staff...I can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Suite”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: I hate to rain on the parade...but unfortunately our experience was not good at this resort. The positives are the grounds are impeccable, nice beach, long nature path leading to other resorts (Grand Wailea, etc.). Service was ok. The negatives were that the first suite they put us in must have been right next to the generator...unbearable noise. We asked to be moved, so they moved us to another garden view room on the first floor, but it was in an unrenovated room...the mildew smell was unbearably obnoxious. We were told that they would "refresh" the room, but it had no impact on the nasty smell. I was just so blown away by the circumstances we experienced with our suites. I had such high expectations of this resort, but unfortunately we were let down. We had to fight for a lounge chair at the pool as well. Before arriving to this resort, we spent a wonderful 4 days at the Royal Hawaiian. We enjoyed Oahu actually more. Maui is nice, but has grown so much and become so commercialized. If you do the kea lani, do the private villas if your budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: California_Family_3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont Kea Lani at least 4 times already..and are planning to go back this spring. It is a *wonderful* hotel! Rooms and spacious and beautiful, pool is wonderful, beaches are lovely, scenary is romantic, service is fantastic...food at Nick's Fishmarket is delicious! There is absolutely nothing about this hotel that we do not love...which is why we keep going back. I would highly recommend Kea Lani to anyone with children (much better than even Grand Wailea with all of their pools, given how horrendous service at Grand Wailea is). You cannot go wrong with Kea Lani - it's relaxing, it's fun, yet not overly crowded! The only travelers I would not recommend this hotel to would be people looking for complete peace...with kids around there is always some noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelnas
Reviews.Content: I like to call myself a hotel junky, with that said, the Kea Lani was spectacular, The propoerty was gorgeous. The rooms were huge, I think they are all suites. Granite bathroom, living room, balcony, ocean view, you really can't ask for anything more. The lobby area was completely open air and the staff was extremely friendly.Fantastic restaurants. I would choose Fairmont over Grand Wailea because it is more exclusive. Grand Wailae reminded me of a resort you would find in Orlando, Florida,It was still nice but not quite as unique as the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort; A must Stay”
Reviews.Author: eviek12
Reviews.Content: This resort is a beautiful, fantastic place to stay. The service is excellent. The food is also excellent, especially the breakfast buffet, and Nicks Fishmarket was amazing. The pools are great and there is a waterslide for kids. There is also an adult pool, which is very nice. The beach is not the best, very small and you have to make expensive reservations a YEAR in advance to get an umbrella or a beach chair, therefore we never got to sit on the beach the week we were there. The rooms are mediocre. Not beautiful like the rest of the hotel, but definintly not bad. They are much smaller than the pictures make them seem, i was expecting a very big room, but it is a little tight. The grounds of this hotel are absolutely incredible. There are also very cute shops inside the hotel that are fun. Cafe Ciao is also really great. It is a market and also a restraunt and is really nice. We also had cousins staying at the Grand Wailea, which was nice but had a million kids running around everywhere, and super crowded. I am not at all saying at all that there are no kids at the Fairmont, because that is not at all true, infact there are a lot, but it is a much quieter, nicer, more relaxing place to stay. There is also a nice kids club, however it is 65.00 for a full day, so kind of expensive, and the spa is also very expensive. ($86.00 for a peticure) So although the rooms aren't incredible and the prices are a little high, and it is impossible to get a beach chair and hard to get a pool chair, we overall loved our stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani Maui and would go back in a flash, and highly suggest it as a place to stay in Maui for any kind of family!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: cmorgen
Reviews.Content: We were at the Kea Lani for six nights in mid-December, what a treat. The staff was amazing, the hotel was wonderful. The suite was perfect since we had our 23 month-old daughter with us. She went to bed early and my husband and I sat on the lanai with a bottle of wine and enjoyed the weather and the view. I highly recommend renting a cabana if you can, the service is just great, all of the pool staff that we came in contact with were wonderful. The restaurants are also wonderful. Cafe Ciao has a great Ceasar salad with fish, and Nick's....well, it's in a class of it's own. The only glitch we had was with the concierge. We went to the aquarium for the day and asked for a recommendation for a restaurant between the hotel and the aquarium for dinner, they couldn't recommend a single one! I take that back, they suggested Stella Blue's, which is a fine diner for breakfast but not a place I would want to go for dinner. It was quite odd. All in all though, we were thrilled with our stay and will definitely be repeat customers! We walked to the Grand Wailea on our trip, and while it was nice I am very glad we decided to book at the Fairmont. It was much more subdued and mellow...which is the feeling I wanted for this trip!

Reviews.Title: “treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: mauiprincess
Reviews.Content: The Kealani was amazing,not only because we happened to get engaged on the beach at the resort, it was truly remarkable. we stayed for 3 days in oahu which I did not like at all, It was like NewYork City with a beautiful view, too busy busy, Then we flew over to Maui for 9 days at the Kealani, We had booked an ocean front suitte but when we arrived they upgraded us to an even better room on the 6th floor with an amazing view of the ocean off the balcony and mountains out of our door, unbelievable. The staff were so polite and gracious,the only complaint was it was sooooooo quiet, If you are looking to party at night at the Hotel forget about it, rent a car and drive to Lahaina, its worth it. Lahainai is a very cool artsy little town with great shops and the coolest banyan tree you will ever see, While at the holtel you have to eat at Nick's the service was amazing and the food delicious small portions very expensive but far worth it, Oh yeah I almost forgot the best part Will from Will and Grace was there, very cool just hanging out like everyone else, I did not find it pretentious at all, very quiet and relaxing hotel, loved it, Ciao cafe has great sandwiches and coffee we were there every morning, the buffet wasn't so hot and for $28 a person I wasn't impressed, also the shops at wailea are great beautiful stores like Gucci,Louis Vuitton, but also an abc store and a gap. If you don't know what an abc store is you will once you get there, they are on every corner on Waikiki beach and a few in Maui they are cheap souvenier and any thing else you need stores. And for every $100 you spend they give you free stuff we spent a total of $400 over the whole nine days and they gave us 3 MAui coffee ecups and a beautiful calendar of Maui, Staying at the fairmont and happy about free coffee mugs, silly but i liked it, have great time it's almost imopssible not to

Reviews.Title: “Far from beach”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: Property is far from the beach, lots of walking. Had two bedroom suite. GREAT BATHROOMS!! Great bath products. Slept six people comfortable. Lovely views/sunsets. Good food.

Reviews.Title: “A winner for the SECOND time!”
Reviews.Author: SweetHomeAL83
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Fairmont Kea Lani; my husband and I went two years ago and loved it. This time, we took my 80-year-old mother-in-law because it had been her dream to go to Hawaii all her life. We knew the Kea Lani would more than meet her expectations, and we were right. The first night, I wasn't pleased with the view we had, so I spoke with Victoria, who I believe was the front desk mgr, and she moved us to a deluxe ocean view when it became available. That was quite a nice touch and made my mother-in-law extremely happy. It was tough to get her to leave the terrace because she loved the view so much! The suites are perfect and gave us plenty of room for three people. All the staff was friendly to us and genuinely seem to want to please, the grounds were immaculate, we had twice a day maid service, the buffet breakfasts were to die for, and we loved splitting our time between the beach and adult pool. We again enjoyed the shops, Cafe Caio, Nick's, and the swim up bar at the Kea Lani grill. My mother-in-law spent some 'alone' time reading in the extended lobby area which had a comfortable lounge area that overlooked the grounds. She said she felt like she was in paradise. We had all our needs met and then some. I also want to make a comment about the spa. One afternoon my husband pulled a muscle in his back and the following morning, he could barely get out of bed. The spa took him asap that morning and did a great job on a massage for him. He felt so much better afterwards! The trip to Haleakala was fantastic, our day trip to Hana was also beautiful (go to see the black sand beach!), I recommend the Old Lahaina luau, playing golf at Kapaluah, and if you like sushi, definitely go to Sansei's! I also recommend the pineapple tour and going to different floral gardens around the island. There is one on the way to Hana called the Garden of Eden that is beautiful and another called Enchanting Floral Gardens that drove my mother-in-law around in a golf cart so she wouldn't have to walk. Next time, we'd like to go to another island since we've been to Maui twice, but I just wanted to give the Kea Lani another well deserved positive review. I simply LOVE that hotel! It's smaller than the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea which I like. I don't want to feel lost in a sea of people. I'd recommend it to anyone! For additional questions not answered here, you can write me at hey_jen@bellsouth.net

Reviews.Title: “Traveled with kids and LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: johnandellen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont over Thanksgiving. My husband and I and our 3 kids had an ocean view room overlooking the pools, sunsets, ocean. From the moment we arrived, we loved this hotel! The rooms were such a nice size-we had our own time at night. The service was Impeccable. The Conceirge staff saved me on several occasions. My husband played golf 3 days and my kids and I loved the pool. I signed them up for the kid's camp, and it was merely a converted room, so I decided to opt out of the full day I signed them up for, and pick them up at noon for lunch. They were so mad at me! They had an awesome time searching for lizards, doing crafts...They went back for a second day! I missed them, but I had a great time at the adult pool! Although it was Thanksgiving, we did not have too difficult a time finding chairs by the pool. On the day I did have a hard time, we asked someone to move one for us, and it was there in a jiff. Thanksgiving in Paradise (Fairmont's dinner), was magical. After 5 days, we went to the Hyatt. I upgraded to the top floor corner suite. The kids loved the pool, but it in NO way compared to the Fairmont. The Breakfast was yuck, and we had to wait in a line going down the stairs for 40 minutes. I also stayed at the Westin, which was better then the Hyatt, but the room are tiny. When we go back, we will stay at the Fairmont. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Warmly Suprised!”
Reviews.Author: gogowomen
Reviews.Content: We totally agree with the assessment of the previous reviewer! Our Fairmont Hotel stay did not disappoint! We stayed at the Four Seasons resort next door on our honeymoon a few years ago and thought it was outstanding. We decided not to stay there this time because of the reconstruction going on there. We decided we would try the Fairmont property this time. My husband and I were warmly surprised how helpful and accommodating the staff was at the resort. We loved the spaceous rooms. We also enjoyed the open shower/bathtub design. Even the little ledge along the bottom of the sliding glass door did not bother us. The bed was a bit on the firm side for us, but not a big issue. We took advantage of the sunnyside room package and loved the buffet for breakfast. Even saved the leftover muffins/fruit for later snacking. The refrigerator and micro wave oven were convenient devices to use during our stay. They even adjusted our bill when we realized that ordering over the menu was not included in the sunnyside package deal, they still applied all our breakfast costs as though it was. The facility and pools were elegant and serene. Loved the quiet beach with gentle surf! We especially enjoyed the Pro Dive outfit that helped us with all our scuba diving needs at the lower pool. The Dive Masters were both professional and knowledgeable! I even earned my scuba diving certification in just three days because they made it so easy and comfortable to go at my own pace. The excursion (off property) dives planned by the Dive Master were perfect for both my husband and I! The restaurant, Nicks Fish Market, was decent and the fish was well prepared and fresh. We are from the Wine Country area north of San Francisco and know something about good food. The big difference being that the prices are significantly higher at a luxury resort on Maui. Worth a dinner none the less. We were also accommodated with a great table location on the two nights we dined there. note: The restaurant at the Four Seasons "Fagarros" is our favorite place for dinner! Great views of the ocean and a wonderful menu! The Fairmont Hotel will give you a complimentary drive there if you call the concierge desk. Disneyland it is not! We would enjoy staying at the resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: Rach727
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted by leis when we walked onto the property to the time we checked out there was no doubt that we had made the right decision by choosing the Fairmont. The hotel itself is stunning, and manages to be immaculate and elegant without being pretentious. When we checked in we were offered a complimentary room upgrade without even requesting it. The rooms are huge two room suites and well appointed, and the kichtenette was a big plus becasue we ate breakfast on the balcony almost every morning. Somebody complained about the open shower but we loved it. There have been some complaints on TA about renovated vs unrenovated rooms, but all the rooms I saw were renovated so that shouldn't be an issue when booking. The great thing about the Kea Lani is that the three pools offer something for everyone. We spent most of our time at the hotel hanging out at the upper pool which has a swim up bar that overlooks the ocean. The pools and beach never felt over crowded and the service we received was excellent. One of the best features of the Fairmont is the canoe adventure which is complimentary to all hotel guests. It was a great way to experience Hawaiian culture first hand and get close to the sea turtles, sea urchins and other fish life. While we were there, we celebrated our first anniversary at Nick's Fishmarket in the hotel. We were given the best tyable in the restaurant, and when we went upstairs after dinner our suite had been filled with rose petals (see pictures). I just think that the Fairmont Kea Lani has the full package and we will definitely be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “If you like Disney land.....”
Reviews.Author: Tizzylishe
Reviews.Content: I took my 80 year old mother to Hawaii so I was looking for a nice hotel that would be quiet yet comfortable for my mother. I was really disappointed with the Fairmont. Since the Four Seasons were doing renovations, our travel agent told us about the Fairmont. He mentioned that the Fairmont was an elegant hotel, not a family hotel. I did not want to be in the middle of large families with children. I wanted a quiet vacation to spend some quality time with my mother. Well, it ended up like being in the middle of kiddie DIsneyland. Since the hotel is built around the large children's pool, one has the feeling of being in the pool with the children. For 3 mornings in a row, a man brought his 4 year old to the pool. As the child screamed for the father's attention because the father was working on his computer, the whole west side of the Farimont was awoken. Mind you it was 5:30 am. I found that the service was good at the Faimont, but did not merit the prices they were asking for. The grounds were beautiful but the pool area was a bit chaotic. Lots of used plastic glasses wating to be picked up. I also found it appalling that after it took me 18 hours to arrive at the Fairmont, they asked me to pay 10 dollars an hour for a beach umbrella. Now, how classy is that??? I agree with the other reviewers that the Fairmont is in dire of renovations. It seems a bit used...the paint, the cottage cheese walls hallways... The Spa is fine. A bit small but I was happy with my $145 massage. The yoga classes will keep you in shape. I went over to the Four Seasons to have dinner and to check it out. I was really sorry to have not booked my vacation there. I would of rather of stayed at the Four Seasons, even during renovations than return to the Fairmont. The Four Seasons was elegant without being snobby. It is definitely above the rest . I think the Fairmont is perfect for families but not for adults that are looking for a little down time away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Tropically Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: sonicglitter
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited the Fairmont Kea Lani on our very first vacation together. We had very high expectations of the hotel before arriving and they were all met. Likes: - Being greeted with pog juice and lais upon checking in. (this made our travelling nightmare so much better) - Quick and prompt service to our room with very friendly staff. - Room service was remarkably fast and still really good. The view from our room looked out over the pool and the ocean. Absolutely beautiful!! - The landscaping and upkeep of the grounds is spot on. - At night, a man blows into a conch shell and lights all of the tiki torches on the grounds. It really sets the mood at night. - The tour desk is very helpful in assisting you on picking tours. They offer really helpful and good advice. - The location of the hotel is ideal. Its right near the shops at Wailea and there are many great local restaurants around the area. - The pool staff come by with fresh pineapple and cold water. Great service!! - The room was amazing. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom is huge and the tub is big enough for two. Extremely soft bath robes are also provided. - There is a large selection of teas in the room. We loved the pineapple/orange tea. - The lobby is open air and gorgeous. - The pool is refreshing and the water slide seemed really cool. Dislikes: - The shower has no door or curtain...its just open...its a little awkward. - The restaurants were on the expensive side (but that is the type of hotel that it is). We ate off the grounds most nights. We also ended up going to the local supermarket and just buying stuff for lunch for ourselves and it saved a lot on our budget. - You have to pay for the chairs and umbrellas. Every other place I have been...its just included. Overall: We adored staying at the Fairmont Kea Lani. It is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever been too and if we get the chance we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: msilvers50
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani this past week, our second visit there since 2003. The grounds, pools and beach are beautiful and the staff was very attentive. Nickâ€™s Restaurant on site is a great place for a special romantic dinner. The breakfast buffet is pricey but good, arrive before 8:30am to avoid the short wait to be seated, and ask for a table where Venus or Tamantha will be your server. They had top notch â€œalohaâ€� spirit compared to the other servers. Wish we could have stayed longer and weâ€™d definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea's best resort”
Reviews.Author: TravellingsAMust
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Fairmont Kea Lani on Oct. 2nd and stayed for a week. This was our 2nd time staying there. We got a wonderful ocean view suite. We stay at the Fairmont because all the rooms are suites, and with our 2 kids, it gives us the breathing space we need. We return to the Fairmont because it is not overly crowded and we've never had to fight for lounge chairs by the pool. It never feels "touristy" with a bunch of people crowding you like we've witnessed at other resorts. Lawrence (President's Club manager) made us feel welcomed and the room service was done twice a day. The on site food there is average, but much better than the Grand Wailea (which we always check into for 2 days at the tail end of our trip so the kids can access their pools and slides). The Fairmont offers free transportation anywhere in Wailea. We really didn't even need our rental vehicle as they "cheuffered' us everwhere! We took advantage of it to go to the Shops of Wailea a few doors down. We walked over to the Four Seasons for a massage and also took a nice stroll over to the Marriott for a Luau (probably our last as we've already done two of them in the last 4 years). There is a nice sidewalk located behind the resorts and beach. The breakfast buffet was much better at the Fairmont, than at the Grand Wailea. We recommend eating at Tommy Bahama's, Sansei (for sushi and japanese cuisine), Spago's (at the Four Seasons next door), and Mama's Fish House (what a nice view if you request a table by the window). Bubba Gumps is a fun place to stop in for a bite if you are in Lahaina doing a little shopping on Front Street. We love the Wailea side of Maui as it is less windy and they don't get as much rain. If you want to snuba/snorkel, we recommend Aqua Adventures as it is family owned and holds no more than 35 people on their boat. The service is much better and they don't pack you in like a bunch of sardines on another boat where we witnessed people fighting for water space as they were snorkeling! Air Maui is a great experience if you choose to do the helicopter ride. We felt like we were on the travel network! We capped off our trip at the Grand Wailea for the kids, but knew (as we've stayed there before) it would be a down grade for us as far as room space and service. They were quite busy in the pool area (as expected, even though it's off season), compared to the Fairmont. You are not waited on as often by the pool. Not a big deal, but they come around more often at the Fairmont to ask you if you need anything. Plus at the Fairmont, you are offered fresh pineapple and chilled face towels by the pool. Not so at the Grand Wailea, but understand that it's a bigger resort, and they also hold large groups for conferences. They do have a nice spa though. Our kids always enjoy their water facilities with all the slides, rope swing and pools. Great beach property too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: agolds
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here by the pool of the Kea Lani writing this review on the last day of our holiday here in Maui. We have had a superb time and have really enjoyed our stay in this excellent hotel. We booked on Ocean View Room which in our opinion is worth the extra. The view is beautiful and just adds that little extra to the room experience. Our room was a refurbished one and very nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel is occupied by lots of couples having a romantic break and lots of families. In my opinion, the hotel does a good job of catering to both sets of client. We have spent most of our time round the family pool but it is certainly not a kids playground. A lot of couples spend their time here as well hving fun on the water slide. There is an adult only pool as well. Although the hotel is quite full, there is no sense of crowding and it has been easy to get sun loungers etc. The service is first class and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. When the breakfast team found out about my wife's allergy to wheat they were off finding gluten free bread off their own back - so helpful. The hotel has wireless internet (you need to be a fairmont presidents club member to get it for free - a quick enrolment required). Wireless is only available in the foyer and out by the pool.The rooms have a cable connection. Thr grounds and foyer of the hotel are very nice indeed, well looked after and a nice feeling of space. We walked along to the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. I liked the Four Seasons and that would be a good choice for a couple. The Grand Wailea by the pool just felt so overcrowded compared to the Kea Lani that my wife immediately was put off it. Dinner at Nicks Fish House at the Kea Lani was a highlight for us. A wonderful meal. Well worth a trip is Mama's Fish house on the other side of the island on it's own private beach. Book early for this experience. Maui is lovely, Wailea is expensive but we loved it. So many temptations in the shops and if you are a lover of art then this is the place for you with art galleries everywhere seliing many fine pieces. This was our first trip here and we will be coming back next year, with the Kea Lani a definite potential for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Complaining”
Reviews.Author: Malibujack
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani is amazing. I am a picky traveler and I must tell you the service is outstanding. Super friendly staff make for a great stay. Everyone at the hotel has the ALOHA spirit. Super clean and spacious rooms and the best housekeepers I have ever experienced. Beach is great, pools are perfect temp and the hotel was full and we never had to fight for a chair or shade. Just loved our stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “will not go back”
Reviews.Author: tamcarol
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in wailea five times and had excellent experiences at the grand wailea, outrigger (now marriott), and elua beach. This trip we decided to stay at Hyatt in Kaanapali (loved it) for first half and moved to Kea Lani for second half of trip. Love the beach for body boarding so decided to stay here. Major complaints: Hotel does not feel hawaiian, rooms are good size but lack atmosphere. there are cockroaches in bathroom woke up at night and found them crawling up large glass mirror. We booked a suite with two double beds (there were three of us) and when we arrived were told it was not available. I had to sleep on very uncomfortable sofa bed in living room. told to ask next day if room became available but my daughters did not want to have to move again so just put up with it. First day at the pool left my bag with room key and favorite shorts on a lounge chair near my daughters and went for a swim in adult pool. Came back thirty minutes later and all my stuff was gone, including room key. Waited over an hour in room before front desk sent new keys. First night I was lying in bed in living room and security unlocked door and walked straight into room. I did not feel safe at this hotel. No apology from management for any of these incidents. Also buffet breakfast was mixed. Food was good but location had no atmosphere and was crowded. Buffet at Hyatt swan court was far superior and service at Hyatt was outstanding. Good things about hotel: Take out deli was excellent, staff at deli were very friendly and helpful, only members of hotel staff that were really nice. Food was good and not too expensive. Overall negatives far outweigh positives. Other properties in Wailea are much nicer and with teenagers Hyatt in Kaanapali was oustanding.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: evoltravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms we very spacious, Beach was very nice with no rocks. The bed had great linen and big long body pillows. The staff at the pool was very friendly (Matthew and Katie). Stay away from the swim up bar, Marty the bartender hates his job. Overall the hotel was a great time. Bring some things to put in your in room refrigerator because the store in the hotel is super expensive i.e.: $5 beer and $40 bottle of inexpensive Chardonnay.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Wailea”
Reviews.Author: kmfthea
Reviews.Content: Wailea is absolutely beautiful. The Fairmont is a nice hotel. Please let me start out by saying that we usually stay at small hotels, 60 rooms or less. The Fairmont has somewhere around 400. We knew this going in as we had a special occasion to attend at the hotel. Although the rooms are large, clean and have a nice bathroom they are very average. The beach was great but very crowed. The adult pool was nice and quiet, no kids were swimming and playing marco polo. Reserving a cabana by the adult pool was a very good idea and we did that while making our reservation with the hotel. I recommend that if you are going to rent a cabana you request one that is pool side as they do have other cabanas not so close to the water. We had a great dinner at Nicks Seafood restaurant in the hotel. The wine list was extensive and we were able to have a wonderful botthe. Keep in mind our dinner for 2, after tipping, was almost 600.00. We did have 2 bottles of wine with dinner. Breakfast was usually a buffet and there is a great little store which has cheese, wine and snacks but they are pricey. We each had massages at the spa and felt they were medicore. We booked a couples massage at the Four Seasons and the whole spa experiance was much better. I also heard that the spa at the Grand Wilea was impressive but that was such a huge hotel 700+ rooms that we did not bother. The Fairmont was nice but if we were to visit again we would stay at the Four Seasons. Probably more expensive than the Fairmont but clearly nicer all around.

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani caters to many people”
Reviews.Author: buffgray
Reviews.Content: The lobby is open air and has a good view over the resort Recommend paying extra and getting at least a junior suite. The extra space and much larger bathroom are worth it The beds are firm and the pillows are soft and squishy Room cleaning service comes 2-3 times a day Room service meals are not fast The beach at Fairmont Kea Lani is small, but has some decent snorkeling for fish, but the ocean floor life is torn up. The gym/exercise room is located next to the spa and is average. There are more people in the gym in the mornings. There are multiple hot tubs and a swim up bar There is free parking for vehicles staying at Princeville including a parking garage. The valets know a lot of great places to experience Four pools to choose from including an adult pool and a water slide pool Spa at Kean Lani is good. Offers many types of massages and services. If you fell tight or stressed, try the deep tissue massage The concierge desk was easy to work with and very responsive Beach Reviews: Five Graves or Five Caves Beach - very rocky entrance from beach, but beach is remote enough where there is usually sea life nearby. Saw multiple sea turtles Black Sand Beach - Rough dirt road to access beach area. Beach is remote enough to still have a lot of coral and greenery in the water, perfect for sea turtles. One evening, saw five turtles at high tide in the shallows feeding. Various fish life are present, including blowfish, cowfish, and tangs. This is not a good beach for families and playing in the ocean, very rough and rocky bottom White Rock Beach â€“ Good sized beach with two rocky areas protecting the edges. Great snorkeling on left side of beach, but tide can get strong. There is a significant drop about 50 yards out near the rocky areas. Green Sea Turtles and various fish in this location (cowfish, humuhumunukunukuapuaâ€™a, tangs, and various larger fish). Great beach for families and a picnic. Plenty of parking near path to beach Restaurant Reviews: Polo Bar & Grill at Kea Lani Resort - Food is good but not cheap ($15 sandwich). View of resort and pools is good. Nickâ€™s Fish Market - Best meat on the island. The ahi steak and NY Strip are amazing. The bread is excellent. The deserts are first class. This place is worth all of the praise it gets. Reservations are recommended. Recommend sitting outside in the evening Kea Lani Restaurant at Kea Lani Resort â€“ Average food for the masses of people staying at the resort. The breakfast buffet offers a lot, but it is all in a small area and gets crowded and messy. Hard Rock CafÃ© in Lahaina - Everything you would expect. Open air bar setting with good food and view of Lahaina Bay Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse in Lahaina - Great meat and side dishes. Good view of Lahaina Bay Tommy Bahama CafÃ© in Wailea Shopping Center - Excellent and very large salads and drinks Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina - Open air hamburger joint and bar with good view of Lahaina Bay. Very busy near any meal times. Hagen Daaz in Lahaina - Ice cream different from the thicker, less creamy Hawaiian style ice cream Spago in the Four Seasons Resort in Wailea - Great appetizers and great meat. Deserts were average. Setting was beautiful. CafÃ© Chiâ€™ao at Kea Lani Resort - Great place to pick up a sandwich or drink. They also do a good breakfast. There also have a coffee specialty shop that will freshly grind beans for you. Jawz Stand/truck - Great mahi mahi tacos. The pink salsa used adds a surprising bite to the tacos. Hakkone in the Prince Resort - Great sushi and tempura. Extensive Asian menu. Great red bean ice cream Activities: Warren and Annabelleâ€™s Magic Show in Lahaina - Great show. Not your usual magic show. You are served pou pou platters and drinks while listening to piano before the show. The show itself is hilarious and worth the cost. Parking can be validated for 4 hours at the show. Recommend booking well in advance (show books up 7-8 days before show) This is the only magic show I would go back too. Wailea Shopping Center - Great shopping for upper end stores (LV, Fendi, Gucci) and other stores. Tommy Bahama, Tori Richard, Gap, Benetton, ABC stores are here. Feast at Lele (luau) in Lahaina - This luâ€™au provides food and dances from four Polynesian areas (Hawaii, New Zealand, Tahiti, and Samoa). Great variety and loved the Samoan fire dancer. Notes: There is a Costco, K-mart, hardware store, surf shop, and Krispy Kreme Donuts located near the airport. Everything is more expensive in Wailea and Lahaina If planning on driving the road to Hana, plan on 3.5 hours each way driving time from Lahaina. The road is very curvaceous with some ridiculous angles and very few places to pass. Hope you donâ€™t get stuck behind a minivan going 10 MPH or it gets old real quick. Gas was $3.55 gallon for 87 grade Recommend joining the Fairmont Presidents Club before booking. It is free to join and you get additional benefits At airport -Your luggage will have to go through US Agriculture scanning before you can stand in line to check in. The line for the US Agriculture scanning is a different line from the check in line. Remember to go through the US Agriculture line first For United Airlines customers, recommend using a porter for $2.00 bag at airport versus checking in at counter as the lines for United are the longest and busiest Humuhumunukunukuapuaâ€™a - State fish of Hawaii. If you snorkel/scuba, you will see them in the water Green Sea Turtles are abundant in the water off of remote beaches The best advise I can give is to buy the book â€œMaui Revealedâ€�. It is a great guide book for Maui. Includes restaurant reviews, various activities (shopping, flying, hiking, snorkeling/scuba), and maps. It is available in any major book store

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time with kids...”
Reviews.Author: threelittlechickens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea for 7 nights beginning of August and it was a wonderful experience. The room was spacious enough for our whole family to spread out in. We have 3 children (2, 4 and 6 years old). We ordered the rollaway bed (which they charge $30 for). My oldest daughter slept there. Then we took the advice of other members and ordered the foam pad for the pull out couch. My 2 younger daughters slept on that. The room was very clean and the bathrooms are AMAZING. The snail shell shower was terrific. We requested, but did not get, a renovated room. But, from what I could tell by peeking in rooms that were renovated as we passed by, we weren't missing a whole lot. The lanais are very large and the lip on the door referred to by other members didn't make any of us trip or stub our toes. I guess we all just pick up our feet just in case when we walk outside to a deck or patio. Anyway, we did the breakfast buffet and it was wonderful. Anything you can imagine they have for you. Wonderful fruit, juices, pastries, omelets, pancakes and on and on. That kept us satisfied until we had an early dinner (with the kids being so young they play hard and get tired early). HOWEVER, the "bird situation" is very bad. Request to sit inside (which is still open air, but has a roof) and COVER your plate if you have to get up or it will be covered in birds. Really gross, but the birds don't go in by the buffet area. Just protect your plate and table. The beach by the Fairmont was quite rough while we were there, but the beach in front of the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons was perfect for our kids' ages and a short walk or drive. The water was clear and warm and the bottom was sandy. Perfect Hawaiian beach (at least for our needs). We had so much fun playing in the pools at the Fairmont and then going to the beach each day. I thought the service at the Fairmont was excellent. I do think, however, if it had been myself and my husband without the kids that we would have chosen to stay at the Four Seasons. The Fairmont is the best in Wailea for kids. On the flip side, the Grand Wailea seemed to attract a real "water park" crowd (think the Griswolds) and we were glad we didn't stay there. See my other review on our experience at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a at GW. The staff at the Fairmont was great. They have a car waiting to take you anywhere you need to go in Wailea (shopping, dinner, etc.). They respond quickly if you call for a ride back. Very nice people. I found the "Aloha" spirit alive and well at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “They know how to treat you!”
Reviews.Author: kph
Reviews.Content: Recently, my wife and I, after a week at the Marriott Ocean Club, reserved our last evening at the Fairmont Kea Lani. I wasn't sure of what to expect as the hotel seemed very opulent, less than Hawaiian and risked being impersonal. My thoughts were ill- conceived. The staff at the Fairmont was extremely well trained, personable and very professional. I found this from the front desk, to the bell staff, to the waiters/servers and to the pool staff. It's incredible to have found a hotel that is really all about the guest! Our reservation was last minute in a "moderate" room (840 square feet) which would put most competitors' product to shame and I do mean most five stars! Deluxe doesn't start to explain this place -- imagine if I had requested something better than their lowest graded room. At this Fairmont, you really feel special, almost celebrity-like, they actual care that you came to their hotel and want to impress upon you that you made the right decision. We were cautioned that our view would be just OK, but in Hawaii, even an island view can be idyllic. The service at the Fairmont is impeccable, the architecture unique and now I have learned is Moorish and Hawaiian, combined, not unlike the parts of the historic Royal Hawaiian Hotel on Waikiki Beach. Nick's Fishmarket was good, yet not over the top, as was the breakfast buffet. Somehow this hotel brings the best of all things together: adult pool, spa, 24 hour fitness, good food, relaxation, beach and sunsets... what else would you like? Just ask!

Reviews.Title: “It's Pretty Nice I Guess”
Reviews.Author: garyfong1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani and because we were reserved with the Amex Centurion card program, we got a room upgrade to a really nice wrap-around balcony with ocean view. The service was good. Our room did not have a do not disturb sign, and we had to ask two different times before we got it. The rooms are nice, the color of the draperies was very loud and floral and therefore weird. The pools and the common areas are the weak points. The hallways are lit with flourescent lighting and they're dim and spooky. The flooring is Wal-Mart ceramic tile. And I believe they use flourescent lighting in the main lobby. We compare this to our recent stay at the Grand Wailea and while the rooms there were much smaller ( no suites) the Grand Wailea was way more opulent in the grounds. The cabanas are $75 a day and reserved a year in advance, but less than half of them were even used. Paid for but not used. So that was kind of weird. The lounge chairs are standard "Target" issue loungers, and are so uncomfortable that we only were able to relax on them by laying upside down so the metal bar doesn't kill your back. The pools are smallish and 80's. In short, the rooms are great. Huge, opulent with freaky drapes. The grounds are 80's and you feel like you are staying at a Hampton Inn in Schenectady when you walk the hallways. Oh do take advantage of their car shuttle service. They drive you anywhere in Wailea, and pick you up too. Honestly, I would stay at the Fairmont but try to fenagle a wrist band and use the pool and spa at the Grand Wailea. Oh about the Spa - the people are nice and the therapists are very good. But the spa is so small and boring. The gym is kinda silly because it is like in a row of small shops... so there you are buying a candied apple and watching people on ellipticals.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: deep-in-texas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kealani a number of times, over 4, and it has always been the best.
