Check in can be slow if you check in at peak times, since flights usually come in about the same time and it is a drive to get to from the airport but once there, you are greeted with a smile, a drink and some of the best service on the islands. The rooms are all suites, and the majority of them are ocean view some more than others, if you are lucky enough to get a good ocean view room, you can guarantee yourself the best time just with that fact alone. Watch for the whales during season. I would highly recommend taking binoculars. Yes it is expensive, yes it does cost to eat there but if you are driving (which most people do) there are stores and cheaper places to eat not that far away, they have fridges in the room and areas to store non perishibles, so having snacks on hand is not problem. We usually stock up at the store either on the way to the hotel the first day or the following day. The restaurants are all superb, Nicks is out of this world, ask for a tour of the wine celler. The service in this hotel is outstanding, we never had to ask twice for anything and the staff is always eager to please. They keep the grounds in immaculate condition and there is never trash, or other debri lying around, they are constantly cleaning. The beach is in trouble, it was washed out recently and is still recovering but it should be back to its usual self soon. There is snorkeling in a couple of areas not to far a drive from the hotel that is great, lots of fish, turtles etc. I would most certainly recommend this Hotel to anyone that would listen. We have stayed at other hotels in Hawaii and what were billed as 5 star did not compare in service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “mostly all very good at kea lani”
Reviews.Author: bigharp9
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Maui with my wife and two 10 year old twin boys. I was a little nervous because I had read some mixed reviews in the weeks before I left. I will try and give you an honest opinion of the hotel. First off, most services at the hotel are expensive, but I think most people are prepared for this before they go. After all, it is a five star hotel (definitely worthy of that rating). Chris Rock was a guest while I was there. Sure, some of the pricing is a little over the top. I dont think they need to charge $18 for a hamburger or $27 for the buffet breakfast, but they got you, and to their credit, there are other less expensive options available at the hotel. They have a really nice coffee shop that you can have bagels & coffee for $5 if you want. As for dinner, the restaurants on premises are not really any more expensive than most others on the island. We ate at Nicks at the hotel, Sarrentos, Spago at the four seasons (talk about expensive), and the seaview at the golf course across the street. Its hard to complain too much about the pricing when you are eating dinner overlooking the pacific and dolphins are jumping out of the water. There is a reason it is expensive. We went to a luau at the marriot, it was good, not great, but it was what I expected, and we had fun. Some of the complaints I read about the hotel from other reviewers seem a little trivial. I requested and received a renovated room, and it was absolutely beautiful. I read complaints about the lip on the sliding patio doors, and I have to tell you, it is a ridiculous complaint. Open your eyes and you wont hurt your toes. Yes, there are a lot of kids in the main pool, and it is noisy, and they do let you throw balls around and play water basketball. They also have a huge, quiet, adult only pool, so I dont really understand how anyone can complain about that. With that said, the hotel is certainly family oriented, and the four seasons would be better if i was honeymooning. The grounds of the hotel are really beautiful, the beach is really beautiful, the staff is very friendly and accomodating. The only glitch that we had was that we requested a pool cabana a month before our arrival, and they lost our request. To be honest, we really didnt need it. Overall, it was a great experience, and we would definitely return and reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this fairmont kea lani let us down”
Reviews.Author: lobem
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Maui and our second stay at the fairmont. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for the first 6 days and the fairmont kea lani the next 6 days. We will never return to the Fairmont - even if they comp our stay. It was worse than horrible. We arrived at the fairmont at 2:30 - room not ready (as was the problem all week with guests checking in). The front desk gal put us in a room on the 4th floor overlooking the kids pool and over the lobby that had no view. We paid for a deluxe ocean view room. After protesting she arranged a room on the 5th floor - again the entire view was blocked by palm trees and it wasn't available until 6pm. I actually walked in on a guest still in the room at 3:30. After that didn't work out the front desk manager arranged for us to stay in a room on the 6th floor in the far tower closer to the four seasons hotel. We finally got in the room at 6:30. We walked in and the room was FILTHY. There was urine around the toilet, mold all over the bathtub and shower, the air filter was black with stuff hanging through the grate, the tile was clean on the walls and black on the floor (I ran a washcloth over the grout in one area and it came off completely black), the lamp shades had at least 5 layers of dust, the bed was short sheeted, etc. They returned to clean the room 3 times and when we left 6 days later - the urine was still hugging the grout around the toilet, the mold was still around 2 sides of the bathtub and in the shower, and they short sheeted the bed 3 out of 6 nights. After arriving from the Ritz my entire family was upset. The Ritz was immaculate, the staff more than friendly and accomodating, the grounds clean, every lounge chair given a terrycloth pad with towels, etc. The fairmont has lounge chairs by the pool that have no padding left in them and wont give you a terrycloth pad to help cushion unless you rent a cabana. Maid service was erratic - sometimes not cleaning the room until 4pm or later. The staff was "trying" to be friendly (and it was obvious). The bartenders short pour the fruit drinks at the pool. The parking is worse than AWEFUL. They are forcing guests to use the valet parking at $15 day plus gratuity. They should just make it all valet and list it on the website as such. My best advice is stay at the Ritz Carlton for less money - more discounts on golf - better tennis facilities nearby - friendly relaxed environment - and for less money. Ritz provided bottled water in the room, in the lobby, complimentary while the fairmont charged $3 bottle each. The cost of the room at the Ritz was $200 less per night (and that was on the concierge level!). If something isn't on the menu in the dining room - they will make it or get it for you. My daughter wanted chicken noodle soup (no problem), my husband wanted a certain type of cake (they offered to make it for the next evening). Wherever you choice to stay in Maui be sure to check out Aroma D'Italia in Kihei for AWESOME italian food and Fred's (also in Kihei) for fun relaxed atmosphere and really good mexican food. Both restaurants very reasonable. And of course - Ruth's Chris is always exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: dpryan14
Reviews.Content: I checked on this site regularly prior to my honeymoon. I have to say I was a bit nervous at some of the bad reviews since I am on the picky side when it comes to hotel/food/service. We stayed at the Kea Lani July 24 - July 29th. With that said, The Kea Lani met all of our expectations and then some. We booked our room 6 months in advance, and I called a month prior to our arrival to ensure our "deluxe oceanfront" was in fact oceanfront. I now realize there are some rooms that are billed as oceanfront and may only have partial views - but the deluxe rooms were certainly all oceanfront (see pictures). The staff was unbelievable. We arrived at 1pm and got right into our room (I realize this may have more to do with luck then the staff). The pool staff was great as well. We didn't go near any pool but the adult pool - the staff at the adult pool was great. Drinks are expensive, but that's to be expected... the service was fast and courteous. We ate at both Cafe Ciao and Nicks, and ordered room service one night. All the food was fantastic and I can't complain about the service in any manner. We pre-booked a poolside cabana prior to our arrival. I did so based in part because some of the reviews on tripadvisor mentioned a crowded pool. The adult pool was never crowded - so we probably didn't need the cabana, but it was a nice touch nonetheless. The other pools looked crowded - but not nearly as bad as the pool at the Grand Wailea. We walked the coastal trail one day and stopped in the GW and the 4 seasons. 4 seasons looked nice - but you would have to give me a free room to stay at the Grand Wailea... what a zoo!!!! If you are a honeymooner and are concerned about this resort - don't be. Expect to pay a premium for food/drinks - but you won't notice the kids at all (if you don't want to). The rooms are huge, and are very well kept. The maid service was great (always met with a smile and an "aloha"). I would certainly return to The Kea Lani without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Toss up between the Four Seasons or the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: Need2ski2
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a family of six holiday. I am suffering from jet lag but I wanted to write. I stayed there 8 nights on a pool view room/suite. Did not witness one bug at all anywhere. My daughter goes into spasm at the sight of a bug. Highly recommend the pool view walk out levels rooms. They are simply fabulous. The condos look amaziing too with the tiny immersioin pools. The whole hotel is spotless. The staff eager to bend way over backwards to make you happy. Did I mention trade winds....It was way way warmer in Chicago and we didn't miss that at all as we were enjoying our Chocolate rum smoothies at the swim up bar. Note at the pools-go directly to the pool boys and they will get you a spot at the pool. They make sure that the chairs are being used by people at the pool at that time. We would swing between the pool and the beach and we just let them know and they would watch things for us. Highly recommend the surfing. First -what to wear for surfing lessons: Important-wear rash guards that cover your whole arm. For bottoms where the border shorts that come down to the knee if you can get it. You know that whole look of Billibong. From football we used under armour. The boards are styrofoam and they scratch as you are learning to work the board. You might come away with mean little rashes. Otherwise, buy it at ABC cheaper. My daughter who is a swim team strong swimmer-was up and on her board in one hour. I opted for the private lesson. Shop around and find the company that will pick you up and drop off. Make sure you get what you pay for-these surfer boys are good but unorganized. Your kids will love this........trust me on this. I believe that these two properties are neck and neck in ratings. I would choose who ever had the best deal for your needs. Side Note: My latest top and best hotel is the Fairmont Orchid. We spent four nights there staying in garden rooms with amazing views of mountains and golf courses. Left there wanting to do more but had to pull our selves away kicking and screaming. This is a classy and simply elegant hotel that has been lovingly cared for. The volcano tour rocks.....in more ways than one....Do a combination of the above hotels mentioned and you will be happy you did. Food is expensive. Try sharing meals and having salads instead. It's too hot to stuff yourself. The Safeway on the Pilani free way down the road has a good selection of wines and beer and mixers. The Kea Lani has a refrigerator so that way you can save. Your decks are wonderful to sit out on at night and soak it all in. Price for that nothing....

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite but lacked that little extra”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Hack
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 6 nights at the fantastic Kahala Mandarin Orinetal on Oahu, I was a little disappointed the Kea Lani on Maui. Overall, the hotel is very nice, with large suites, a private beach, decent pools, including an adults-only infinity pooi but there was something extra just missing to make it exceptional. It was probably the quality of food in the restaurants that let it down. Although ok the food didn't match the 5* billing. In Oahu we found ouselves returning to the hotel restaurant night after night because it was so delicious. In the Fairmont however, we walked along the coastal path to the other hotels in search of something superior and generally found it. Still a very nice place to stay but with slightly better food this could be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Dreams”
Reviews.Author: trojanking
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a week at the Fairmont. I am pretty picky when it comes to resort hotels and this was a bit of a flier as I had no real knowledge of this property. I have stayed at over 10 resort hotels in Hawaii so I have a pretty good idea of what works. The Fairmont worked! Our family of five stayed in a private villa so the accommodations are unfair to compare, however, our good friends stayed in an ocean view standard room so we were able to witness the spacious room there. Not plush and a bit dated, but very spacious. Our villa was wonderful. Location was ideal (center area of villas is my recommendation), view extraordinary (don't pay extra for ocean front, our ocean view was just as nice), and service ideal. We took advantage of the food buying service for villa guests so our room was well stocked with provisionals. We also took advantage of the Fairmont President's Club perks (golf club free rental, free internet service, etc.) The service and friendliness of staff here is top notch. The facilities are spotless and the beach and pool area are wonderful. A couple of observations: 1. The cabanas must be reserved and they must be reserved way in advance. I tried 3 weeks prior to arrival and had no luck securing them through "the waiting list". 2. Money talks here as it does at any high end establishment. If you really need something, you must be prepared to "take care of the messenger". 3. If you need to communicate prior to arrival, do so directly with whatever service department that is involved, and, get their personal names. Two messages sent through our travel agents "concierge" service fell on deaf ears and we had no real proof of receipt or compliance. All in all, a top notch resort and one we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Alani - Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mike1318
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Alani is truly a great, but very expensive hotel. I would highly recommend it. Positives Great Service Great Beach Great Room Quiet Nicks Negatives Pool is not as great as other Hawaii Hotels Wailea is a little sleepy Pool was cold! We stayed here in May and upgraded to one of the 2 bedroom villas with a private plunge pool. This condo is very nicely furnished and big. We were travelling with our 3 kids (6/4/2) so the extra room and plunge pool were nice. The villas could use a better view deck but other than that they are great. They are spendy however at over $1500 per night. The grounds are nice but not like the Grand Wailea, the banana jungle was fun and the beach is nice. The service at this hotel is perfect. Check in was a breeze, pool service is good, Nicks is great and we're seafood snobs being from Seattle. Really my only complaint with this hotel other people may find a bonus. It's a quiet, sleepy place that is a little boring for my tastes. The pool area is nice by mainland standards but is small by Hawaii standards. The waterslide was great for our 4 and 6 year old but would be slow for older kids. The pool area is very quiet. There is nothing in Wailea but the Shops at Wailea, which is very boring. Kihei adjacent has more to do but is a little sketchy so we avoided. All in all Kanaapali has a lot more going in if you are looking for more things, people seeing, etc. Wailea is much nicer though. All in all if you are looking for a quiet, 5 star hotel I can't think of a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but not the cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: Lraep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 4 nights in July. We arrived the Hotel at around 2:30 p.m. The front receptionist was very polite & friendly. We reserved a Partial Ocean View Suite Sunnyside Breakfast Package & were extremely delighted to receive a double upgrade to a Deluxe Ocean View Suite. The lady said our room was not ready and she would call us on our cell phone. We rec'd her call at exactly 4 p.m. It would have given us a much better impression if she actually said our room would not be ready until the official 4 p.m. check-in time. The suite was like the size of 2 connecting rooms. The "Full Ocean View" was magnificent. The washroom is big & has a utility box which include useful items like cotton balls & buds, mouth rinse, small packs of Woolite, sewing kit, etc.. On our third day of stay, when I opened the utility box, a small cockroach was there! I didn't want the cockroach to crawl around, so I wrapped the whole utility box with layers of towels and put it into a laundry bag. Both Housekeeping & Front Reception didn't seem to care much and no one come to pick up the box for until at least 15 minutes. There was no apology, nothing was done, and the utility box was not even replaced. On the fourth day, when I opened one of the closet, another cockroach was there! Again, no one seemed to care. Breakfast at the Hotel was of acceptable quality with reasonable variety of choices. We especially like the egg/omelette freshly made to your order. The chef was efficient and the line-up was never too long. My son & I loved their Miso Soup. Service quality varied dependent on the server. I made reservation for a Cabana before my trip, but decided to cancel it. It seemed awkward to have to pay for shelter when you have already paid for your stay. The same is true for umbrellas at the beach. Tips for your stay: 1. Join the Fairmont President's Club for priority check-in and free internet access. 2. If you arrive early, visit (a) Costco (right outside the Airport) for mac. nut souvenirs (their prices are the cheapest), wine, or boogie board (around $20). The Hotel's Polo Beach is excellent for boogie-boarding. Both adults & kids will love it. Hotel rental is $8/ hr or $20/ day; or/& (b) Saveway (on the way to the Hotel). 3. If you do want to check-in early, after you check-in (you will, most likely, not get your room b4 4 p.m.), go to Shops @ Wailea (close to the Hotel) instead of hanging around at the Hotel. Have a nice lunch at Longhi or get some water, snack, etc. from the ABC Shop there, instead of hanging around at the hotel. 4. Spago, at the Four Seasons, has nice ambience and okay food. Reserve a table at the Lanai via OpenTable (for dining points). Spago has kids' menu and kids receive an appetizer pizza free. If you have 2 kids, you probably only need to order one kid's meal. The Fairmont Hotel has a driver who can drive you anywhere in Wailea free. We took the service to go to Spago as we did not want to drink & drive, and used the same service from the Four Seasons to go back to the Hotel. 5. Mama's Fish House at Paia had the best food and service among all the restaurants we tried in Maui. It was right by the sea, and thus the scenery was also great. 6. Old Lahaina Luau was a 45-min. drive. Food was mediocre as in most dinner shows. Atmosphere was good, but service was poor. I regret not choosing one which was in Wailea area. My son loved the Hotel. But I doubt if I would choose the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!.... with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Stefsims
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Kea Lani on July 18th and 19th (we spent 5 nights on the other side of the island). This was our 3rd time at the Kea Lani and we really enjoyed ourselves. We requested a "renovated suite" when we booked, but found out once we got there that the "renovated suites" were not as beautiful as the original suites (the curtains were straight out of the Red Roof Inn or Motel 6). The furniture also left a lot to be desired in the "renovated suites." The coffee tables looked like they were from a garage sale (very 80's looking) and were not of the quality of the original rooms. AND I have to mention AGAIN the HORRIBLE CURTAINS(80'S hawaiian floral green)! After we saw the "renovated suites" we requested an original suite which was absolutely beautiful (very white and airy.....and very relaxing). Overrall, we enjoyed the Kea Lani, but alittle disappointed in the cheap renovation that has taken place. We will stay at the Kea Lani again (even more so if we get a good deal....it can be really expensive) and will request an original room (if still available).

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and then some!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kea Lani Maui was everything we hoped for and more! The staff was always friendly, helpful, and willing to make our stay the best it could be. The staff usually greeted us by name and always asked us if there was anything they could do for us. We were upgraded to a full ocean view corner suite. The view is spectacular. The grounds are beautifully maintained. Polo Beach is absolutely wonderful. Not all the hotels have such a beautiful beach on the grounds. This hotel is all about luxury.

Reviews.Title: “I had higher expectations”
Reviews.Author: BirdingIsFun
Reviews.Content: Our Kea Lani stay got off to a most inauspicious start when I was kept waiting for more than 3 hours to check into our room. My advice: don't arrive a minute before the so-called "guaranteed" check-in time (4:00), and, if they offer you an upgrade, don't expect it to be ready when promised. Given that we were paying $650/night for the room, I was infuriated! The desk clerks were unapologetic. The desk manager was courteous, but he didn't finally turn the upgraded room over to me until just minutes before I needed to go back out. He also comp'd us a dinner at Caffe Ciao ($75 for pizza, 2 glasses of wine, bottled water, and a dessert), but that did not make up for the missed promises and the delay - and, when I checked out, the dinner charge was on the bill! I had to relive the whole situation with the desk clerk before the charge was removed. Based on past stays at the Grand Wailea and Hyatt Kaanapali, we expected a level of "aloha" that was lacking at the Kea Lani's desk. The desk clerks and concierges always seemed to be on the phone or avoided making eye contact with waiting guests. The bell and valet staff, however, were pleasant, prompt, and always eager to help. Our 1-BR suite was clean, pleasant, quiet, and comfortable (except for the sofabed) and had a distant partial ocean view. The DVD player was not working, but an engineer came right away when we called, and, after fooling with it for half an hour, ended up replacing it. We thought the nightly turndown service must be a joke. The maids seemed to wait until we'd put out our "do not disturb" sign before putting one of those little "we couldn't get in to give you service" signs on our door every night, no matter how late we were up. We had booked a "sunnyside" package, which included a bountiful, tasty breakfast buffet. The Grand Wailea and Hyatt's buffets are served in beautiful surroundings, but at the Kea Lani, the rather small, narrow breakfast room is next to a pool, and it gets messy and crowded. The Caffe Ciao deli serves up good sandwiches and desserts, but it's overpriced - $36 for a turkey sandwich, 2 bottled drinks, and some crackers, a meal that runs less than $15 at the Whaler's General Store in the Shops at Wailea. The Kea Lani's dining options are convenient, but they're not a good value. Restaurant service is strictly on "Hawaii time" (slow). We had an excellent meal at the Grand Wailea's Bistro Molokini, an open-air restaurant with a beautiful ocean view, for about the price of the breakfast buffet at Kea Lani ($56 for two). We also had a great dinner at Tommy Bahama's Tropical Grill in the Shops at Wailea. We won't stay anywhere but Wailea when we're on Maui - Kaanapali and the whole Lahaina scene is much too crowded, too much traffic - but I doubt we'll stay at the Kea Lani again. It didn't live up to our expectations. I only mark it "above average" because the suite accommodations are such a cut above the typical hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families -- like home, but better”
Reviews.Author: sfwork
Reviews.Content: Maybe there are older rooms and newer rooms? Because OUR room was FABULOUS. Not only were all the furnishings new and modern, but the place was clean and had every amenity we needed -- refrigerator, bar, microwave, extra sink, coffee, vcr/dvd player, cd player, two tv's (we watched the World Cup while our kids watched Tom and Jerry) and on the day we arrived, they even sent up a big plate of fresh fruit (grapes, bananas, lichee, apples, pears, and peaches). Our kids (2 and 4) loved our room and we hung out on the balcony every morning and evening. Every one of us absolutely loved the place. The service was also fantastic -- from the front desk, to the valets, to the pool attendants -- they seemed to anticipate our every move and make our stay so enjoyable. It's the little things: Like at the breakfast buffet (which is fabulous) the waitresses would give us plastic containers so we could take extra fruit for the kids to eat later; the pool attendant that blew up our son's swim raft with an air tank; the man who installed two bed rails literally 10 minutes from the time we called to ask for them; and the car attendant who played with our kids until they went wild, and the other random staff members who gave us spot-on tips for eating and exploring around the island. And finally, the facilities: the pools are lovely, great for kids, the beach was BEAUTIFUL and had great attendants that brought you towels and umbrellas if you needed them. Also, all throughout the water areas there was drink and food service and on more than one occasion a person came around with cold pineapples. Hello, can you say luxury. I'm sure the Grand Wailea or the Four Seasons has these same services, but it takes me back to the rooms -- they are really suites, so once we put the kids to bed, we could close the bedroom door and watch a movie, or enjoy a drink, or just hang out without huddling under a blanket with a flashlight. We'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont is great!”
Reviews.Author: C-Note1021
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont from June 18th - 23rd and found it to be very nice! Is it a 5 star property? No, but definitely a 4 1/2. Our room was wonderful - newly renovated and on the back side of the hotel but with a nice "yard" and a beautiful view of the ocean. I'd request this room again (room 209). Room service was exceptional and prompt (even early one day and called in advance to ask if it was OK to deliver the food). Housekeeping did a fantastic job as well. The only complaint was tiny brown ants on the desk and wet bar......not a nuisance but definitely not acceptable for a Fairmont! I felt the staff was terrific other than the concierges.....they could have an attitude at times..... We ate both at Nicks Fish Market and Cafe Ciao. We all LOVED Nicks including my 5 year old who got a bowl of goldfish crackers to munch on while he waited for his dinner. The service was amazing and the food impeccable. Cafe Ciao - while we were disappointed to find out we could no longer take pizza back to our room, we were pleased with the food. The service however was awful. We had to ask the busboy for our son's dinner that our waiter (with zero personality) had forgotten..... oh, well. We ate at Joe's and found it to be incredible - one of our best meals on Maui! If you snorkle, some of the very best snorkeling was right off Polo Beach in front of the Fairmont. To the right an awesome reef with huge beautiful fish and a few small turtles and to the left great tide pools but that's where the giant sea turtles "hang out". It was amazing to watch. We were in waist deep water and the turtle swam right up to us!!! Also worth the walk - "White Rock" and worth the drive "5 Graves, 5 caves beach". It's a black rock beach but once in the water - WOW!!!! We also drove up to Makena Beach - right in front of the Maui Prince Hotel and if you go to the rocky area to the left and swim out and then towards the cove it's awesome! I LOVE Wailea. We were in Kaanapali for the 1st 5 days and at the Fairmont for the last 5. I love that each resort has it's own little cresent of beach, I love that it's more laid back, I love that the hotels are more "removed" from the beach and I love that the weather is hotter and less rain. Overall, we were all VERY pleased with the Fairmont. Would I stay there again? Definitely. I feel it's worth the money to have a beautiful suite with a microwave, fridge, and enormous bathroom as opposed to a very small hotel room (I've seen the 4 Seasons and for what we had you'd pay $1,000 a night for what we had for $515). Enjoy your stay.....regardless of your hotel Maui is just down right paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani quite lovely”
Reviews.Author: surferchik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Fairmont orchid Kea Lani in Wailea. We had been staying at kanapaali previously and thought it would be nice to explore wailea. The hotel is beautiful, the architecture is interesting and it looks like a cross between an arabian nights fantasy and a greek villa. The lobby has a bamboo garden and chinese stone sculptures, very serene. Our room was very large, bed was good with soft pillows, bathroom was fantastic with huge tub. Everything was clean and housekeeping was prompt and immaculate. We stayed on the top floor and had a 'garden view' which faced the hills, I think it was probably better than paying extra for the ocean view (I can't imagine how much of the ocean you would end up seeing anyways). Food is very expensive at this hotel, so we bought our own bottled water, juice, banana bread from costco. Internet costs $15 a day and sometimes the connection doesn't even work- fortunately we weren't charged for this. I think its strange for a luxury hotel, the grand wailea next door had wireless internet, so did the two star condo we rented in kanapaali. They should get with the program. Cafe ciao had very good service and some healthy dishes, tasty salads. I liked the bento box at the polo lounge, especially the coconut prawns. I noticed the pineapples sold in the hotel store was 3 times more expensive than it is in safeway. Pools were nice but extremely crowded. Even the adults only pool was crowded and barely anywhere to sit during mid day. Cabanas have to be rented for $75 a day. the other pools were infested with screaming children. Kids were everywhere, even in the restaurants late at night. This was quite a shock given how pricey the hotel is and the number of weddings and honeymooners that go there.... definately not as romantic as I'd thought. The beach at the hotel is so-so, quite small, better to walk down the nearby path to neighbouring beach or drive to nearby Big Beach and nature preserve. some amazing animals and birds there, and excellent snorkelling nearby. We bought our snorkelling gear at the Kmart in kahalui for $15 which worked out well, considering snorkel rental is $8-9 a day at the hotels. Shops at wailea were interesting as well. i'd recommend going to Lahaina for souvenirs instead because the same goods are priced much cheaper there. Kiehi had great restaurants including Sensei for sushi. Everyone at the hotels, shops and restaurants in this area were very friendly and welcoming. Definately an upscale area. It's a nice place to stay, but I would make sure and visit other areas of maui as well to get a better appreciation of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon location!”
Reviews.Author: fishbowl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 7 nights in June 2006. While the drinks are expensive and the extras cost a bit (like umbrella rentals, ect.) it was the perfect place for a honeymoon. There were some small children around but they were restricted to the kiddie pool while the adults-only pool was all adults. The rooms are wonderful suites and the service was excellent. The hotel staff went out of their way to accomodate us and were helpful in every aspect of the trip. I think it depends on the time of year if you decide to stay here for your honeymoon as we went when children were still in school, and thus less of them! Overall, expensive but worth the cost for a hassle-free fun week in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Liked, but not loved the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and stayed a total of 10 days in Maui. Our last 3 nights were in Wailea at the Fairmont Kea Lani(the first part of our trip we stayed at the Hyatt in Lahaina which was great!) Our experience at the Fairmont was good. We tried to check-in at 2:30 even though we were given a 4:00 check-in time, and though we were initially told our room wasn't ready they quickly found a room for us and told us we would be upgraded from partial ocean view to an ocean view suite. The suite itself was nice. Large marble bathroom, tub, shower, 2 sinks, separate living room and bedroom. I don't believe, however, that we were upgraded to an ocean view room even though that's what we were told. It was more a partial ocean view, which overlooked the adult pool, grounds, the detached suites, and then the ocean. I didn't complain only because we booked a partial ocean view anyway. The pros of the Fairmont Kea Lani was the beach, which was beautiful and not too crowded, chairs included; the pool bar and grill's smoothies were very good; Nick's Fishmarket restuarant had excellent food, service, and atmosphere; it wasn't really too crowded at the hotel compared to some others; and the breakfast buffet was good. The cons were that it was very expensive and having stayed in Maui before (including the Hyatt Regency for the other part of our honeymoon), you can stay at other hotels less expensive for better or equal accomodations. Other cons were that housekeeping was erratic in terms of cleaning times. The second day of our stay, we were out of the room all day and came back to relax in the room around 4pm and it still hadn't been cleaned. It was a little annoying to come back to a dirty room. We really wanted to relax, and housekeeping did come, but we didn't want to leave the room, so they cleaned around us, and didn't do a great job, because they were trying to clean as fast as they could and get out of there. The next morning they were knocking on the door before 8 am and we were still sleeping. We did notify the front desk when were going to be out, and they said they would send someone to clean, but when we came back 2 hours later, it still hadn't been cleaned. So, it was frustrating having to deal with that, when we really shouldn't have been worried about it. Also, the rooms seemed to have thin walls. You could hear the housekeeping carts going down the halls, and the last night we were there, people checked in the room above us and you could hear them walking around, etc. Also the beds were uncomfortable(after being at the Hyatt we were spoiled with their comfortable beds). The gym was very small, and hot. The grounds were well kept, but really nothing special. Overall, we were happy, because we were on our honeymoon, nothing could have ruined our amazing time together. Wailea is a beautiful area, and we are definitely goiing back to that part of Maui again. However, given the nummber of excellent hotels in the area, we will probably try someplace other than the Kea Lani next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Bring Your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: rodeman018
Reviews.Content: Where to begin...? The Fairmont Kea Lani is a beautiful facility. We stayed there from 5/31 to 6/5/06. Had an ocean view suite that was fabulous. The staff was very friendly, courteous and friendly. The gounds meticulously maintained. Now where in the hell did all those children come from?? I've never seen so many small ones at any kind of resort hotel. I expected expensive restaurant/bar prices from a hotel of this class, but the Kea Lani seems to go over the top in this respect. We did most of our eating away from the hotel. We spent a lot of time in Lahaina dining and drinking and shopping. Would I recommend this hotel....? Yes, if you're a young couple with small children. If you're honeymooners or simply a couple seeking privacy and quiet. Stay a the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for families”
Reviews.Author: Lhurston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui twice and stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea. This year we planned to take our kids ( ages 12 & 14 ), and after much research and debate, we decided to try the Fairmont Kea Lani because all of the rooms are suites, and they come equipped w/ a frig. and microwave. We absolutely LOVE the Four Seasons so this was not an easy choice, but we were glad we made it. Let me start by saying that if you are going as a couple, I recommend the Four Seasons. Their service and facilities are just unbeatable! However, if you take your kids, the Fairmont is a great choice. FOOD We saved alot of money on breakfast and lunch by buying foods at the local market and keeping our frig stocked w/ bottles of water and drinks that would have cost $2 to $3.00 each. We did go to the Costco, but I recommend just going to the Saveway instead. The Costco was a zoo when we were in there, and most items come in bulk. We did eat at Nick's on our last evening and it was great, but very expensive. We enjoyed the deli and Cafe Choi alot. The tuna and chicken salad in the deli is great as well as the pizza . We thought the $6. per slice was rediculous until we got it the first time ,and it was at least the size of 2 slices. It fed two of us! We ate at Bubba Gumps in Lahaina one night for the kids. I don't recommend it. Fun place but terrible food. Lunch at Longhi's in the Wailea Shops was really good . There is also a great Cheesebuger place in there. For a great meal , go to the Four Season's Pacific restaurant. ACTIVITES The bike trip down Haaleakala was awesome. It was my 14 yr. old son's favorite activity after surfing. The road to Hana was not enjoyable for my family. The scenery was beautiful, but the kids got bored real quick! If you are prone to motion sickness, take dramamine before you go!! We went to the luau ay the Royal Lahaina Resort. It was the least expensive on the Island. The food was ok , but the show was fun for the kids. Next time I would pay a little more. GO SNORKELING!! The kids saw alot of tropical fish right at the resort's beach. Renting equipment from the resort is too expensive. Go to snorkel Bob's or bring your own. Surfing was fun. We drove close to Lahaina for the best waves. We also enjoyed watching the windsurfers on the north beaches. Resort We received fresh flower leas and a nice fruity drink upon arrival. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and big and pretty, though not really luxurious. We did have ants a couple of days so keep food wrapped tight. Our room # was 209 and we will probably request it again. it had a bit of an ocean view, but also had a little yard where we fed the birds in the mornings. Make sure you get a renovated room. We used the hospitality room after checking out, and the old rooms are very dated! All in all this resort worked well for our family. The Wailea area is just the prettiest,and a suite at the Four Seasons was twice the price. I definelty would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont from 5/27 - 6/2/06. When booking room, try and get the top floor - ocean delux room. Beautiful views and could see the sunset from our balcony. The room was spacious and very comfortable. (Pillows are very hard though - thick but hard). Service was always wonderful and staff very helpful. The hotel lobby bar is great way to relax after a day of sight seeing and has beautiful views of the grounds and sky from very comfortable chairs/sofa's. I loved the adult pool. Kids were never around, and there weren't rows of lounge chairs to get through to get to the very large pool. As for food, the room service is pricey and if you order a bottle of wine, make sure if it's a half or full bottle. The room service menu isn't specfic with the bottle sizes and prices. The hotel also tacks on a room delivery charge. Cafe Ciao was delicious but don't bother with Nicks. Unless you book weeks in advance, you won't be seated on the patio, and then your shuffled inside by a rude hostess and a wait staff that seem to be on crack. You can never get their attention and they are constantly running away from you while you're asking questions. Plus, the food isn't that great. Fish was dry and steak was over cooked. By the end of the week, we were very relaxed and content. The hotel is in a great location, the bottom of Waliea, so you're not stuck in the middle of large resorts. It's a short drive to Makena Beach -- much better beach than Polo. Overall, enjoyed our stay very much and plan on visiting this hotel again. Great place for lunch and/or dinner: Mamma's Fish House (on the North Shore). Don't miss the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience all the way around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kea Lani for 8 nights. Everything went smooth from check in to check out. Loved the adult pool, and the hotel room was great (had a garden view, which was actually garden, ocean and mountain view) The grounds are immaculate and the pool/beach staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. The same is true for the concierge staff. The only problem I encountered was when I was dealing with the concierge manager! She was complaining about customers making reasonable request in front of me. I thought this was very unprofessional. The beach was great, not too crowded, but they did charge for umbrellas, FYI. I though it was a great vacation and would recommend it. The breakfast is very good, however the restaurants in the hotel are not as good as others on the island, but are priced comparably. The wait staff for anything relating to food was off as well. I would pass on the restaurants at the Kea Lani and go next door to the four seasons for dinner. The Kea Lani is a good place to stay, I had a great vacation! The staff is friendly, helpful and made the trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been reading reviews of this hotel for months. So, when it was finally our turn to take our dream vacation, I admit I was a little nervous. We were so unbelievably surpised by how much we loved this hotel. I truly don't understand all the bad reviews. I suppose everyone has different expectations and taste. But, we were more than happy with our accomodations. We paid for an ocean view room and we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view. Definitely ask for a renovated room We had a gorgeous suite. We had such a beautiful view of the pool area and the ocean, as well. Housekeeping was perfect. Never had better service anywhere, when it came to cleaning our room. We heavily tipped them for their efforts. We didn't order room service because prices were indeed over-priced . We went to the market and bought breakfast muffins, cereal and milk. For dinner, we went out. We even went and got pizza at Shaka Pizza. Not bad pizza for Hawaii. I will say that if you want a quiet, romantic vacation then you should go to the Four Seasons. Though we saw lots of couples and they all looked happy. We were there with our very well behaved 5 year old girl and she met lots of kids her age. We met lots of really nice families and we all went down the slide and hung out in the pool and sipped on mai tais together. We had a wonderful time. One little complaint I have is the sliding doorway to the balcony. There's a lip that sticks out and we all tripped on it at least once. My husband thinks it was there to prevent noise, but really, there's got to be a better way. Other than that, we had a perfect stay. We will return for sure. My daughter is still crying about having to leave .....I am too!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: diva452
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani from May 13 - 20th. I can't' say enough about how great our experience was. We had a party of four (me, husband, 20month daughter, 80 yr olld mom). We had a pool suite which is perfect for families as you can walk out of your room right to the pool (no dealing with elevators or long hallways which is great when you have kids). The room was huge and the bathroom exceeded my expetations. The tub was huge but we didn't use it. The shower was wonderful especially for washing our 20 month old daughter. We had 2 double beds in the bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room. The sofa bed was terrible but I called housekeeping and they brought up an eggcrate mattress pad and then it was fine. There was plenty of closet space and the entertainment center was the best set up I've ever seen in a hotel. Full stereo/dvd/vhs set up. The wet bar/micro/fridge area was small but useful enought to heat up left overs and make baby meals. It's not a full kitchen so we didn't expect full utensils, dinnerware, etc. It also had a coffee maker with enough coffee for all three adults each morning. We rented a cabana for the whole week. I booked it a month in advance which is necessary to make sure you get one. It's $75 a day which when considering the price of the room is not bad (the Four Seasons is free but a comparable room is over $1000 a night). The cabana staff was wonderful except for one day is was less than stellar but I spoke to one of the managers and they comped us a free day. Again, they took great care of making sure we were satisfied. The upper pool is quieter than the lower pool and the kiddie pool is great. We didn't go to the adult pool. The pool bar and restaurant are located in the upper pool. It was nice being able to just walk a few feet out of our room to the cabana. The beach was nice but it rained the day we went down there so it wasn't enjoyable for us. We stayed at the pool. You can rent an umbrella for $30 a day (again it might be free at other hotels but they include it in the higher room rate). We ate at Cafe Ciao most nights and the food was superb. We ate at Nicks one night and of course it was excellent as usual. Nicks is your average 5 Star restaurant with excellent service, great wine list and fab food. We spent the $20 for the photo just for fun!!! The best part of our trip was when we called for a late check out on Saturday. As presidents club members we get a late check out anyway but since our flight wasn't till 10pm we wanted a later check out. They allowed us to check out at 7pm that evening without any extra charge (I've paid extra at other hotels for late check out). The walk to the Shops was a bit of a hike and I would only do it again if we were in better shape. The hotel has a driver that will take you anywhere in the area for free so we used that for trips to the Shops. All in all our experience was positive and we will be booking another stay for 2008. We stay at Fairmonts frequently and have always had great service and an excellent experience. This hotel, even though it is all suite should not be compared to a timeshare where you get more of a condo so don't expect full kitchen set up. It's just a much larger hotel room with some nice conveniences. If you want a condo experience then rent a villa or stay elsewhere. If you want an excellent hotel experience and want to be treated royally then stay at the Kea Lani. One more piece of advice. Bring your own ethernet cable!! Internet was great but it worked best with our own cable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel...for those that can afford all it has to offer...”
Reviews.Author: asmit4
Reviews.Content: I would love to say that this place lived up to our expectationsâ€¦but it didnâ€™t. I think itâ€™s because we had such a fantastic time at the Hapuna Beach Prince/Big Island that it was hard for this resort to live up to it. CHECK IN: While driving from the airport we were very disappointed in Maui. All we saw were strip malls, grocery stores and what we like to call â€œsuburbiaâ€�. Traffic was bad, and drivers were rude- people honking horns, driving fast, cutting people offâ€¦.the big island was SOOO much more peacefulâ€¦relaxedâ€¦. Upon arriving, the entrance to the Fairmont disappointed also. At Hapuna you drove for like a mile to get to the resort- it was very set back and along the way you saw the golf course, flowers, greeneryâ€¦.just a nice drive to the resort. At the Fairmont you drive RIGHT to the entrance- no leisurely drive to the resort. It was right off of a main street. You could see the balconies of the resort from the streetâ€¦ which for us was disappointing. We felt right in the thick of things. We pulled up and our luggage was immediately removed by a bellman which was nice. my husband went and parked the car- valet was 18 a day here and we just didnâ€™t see the point in paying it. It would have been nice to have it freeâ€¦we were after all paying over 400 a night for a room and we were spoiled at our previous resort (Hapuna Beach Prince) with free valet. We knew this coming in to the resort though so while it wasnâ€™t a surprise to us we didnâ€™t realize just how much we would miss it. Upon check in I informed the Fairmont that it was our Honeymoonâ€¦I got a congratsâ€¦.end of story. Once again, I knew the Fairmont didnâ€™t do anything special for HM erâ€™s but having gotten a nice bottle of champagne at the HBP and a free upgrade we were once again spoiled. ROOM: The room was FANTASTIC overall J We loved the size of the room! HUGE! The bathroom was very nice but once again didnâ€™t live up to the HBP. We didnâ€™t like not having a door on the toilet and while at first thought the open air shower seemed like a great idea- having used it for 4 nights, we didnâ€™t like it. The reason was that we liked to have our room air conditioned like most peopleâ€¦however, when you take a shower most people like to have the warm air of the shower surround you. With there not being a door the cold air is right thereâ€¦I often got cold while taking a shower- not fun. Also- there wasnâ€™t enough space to put all our shower stuff so I had to step over to the ledge of the soaking tub to get some of my shower products- also made for colder showers. The shower pressure and hot water was great though! The deep soaking tub was nice- my husband and I soaked in it once with bubble bath- lots of room. The double sinks are also nice to have. We had a renovated room and the furniture was brand new. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept on- so comfy that we plan on calling the hotel this week to find out what kind of bed it is- we want to buy it! We went with a room without a view b/c we didnâ€™t want to spend more than 500 a night. When booking we didnâ€™t think the view would matter but having come from the Hapuna Beach Prince premium oceanfront room- it matteredâ€¦.A LOT. Once again, we werenâ€™t surprisedâ€¦we knew what we paid for but we were just spoiled by the other room- which was 200 bucks less a night too. POOL/BEACH: The beach was nice, but once again, canâ€™t compare the Hapuna Beachâ€¦.the beach was rather small and the sand wasnâ€™t as soft. We didnâ€™t spend much time here. The pools are the one area that outbeat the Hapuna though! We rented a cabana one day and the service was SUPERB. We were catered to the whole timeâ€¦.we felt like royalty- 75 bucks but I HIGHLY recommend it! We ordered one about 4 weeks before we left to make sure we got one. The slide was fun and even though there were children around- the adult pool was just that- only for adults and therefore very quiet and relaxing! So relaxing that I fell asleep in our cabana for an hour. FOOD: We didnâ€™t really eat here much- we got lunch by the pool one day which was one of the best hamburgers Iâ€™ve ever hadâ€¦for 18 bucks it better be We also went to CafÃ© Ciao a lot for snacks and sandwiches. We would have gone to nicks but the views couldnâ€™t compare to the other places we had gone- you donâ€™t see the ocean- just the pool area so we didnâ€™t see the point in spending 200 bucks on a meal without a good view. Iâ€™m sure the food is superb and the service is supposed to be beyond compare but we decided to skip it. We also missed our â€œfreeâ€� breakfast that we had at the prince hotel- sure we could have gotten the breakfast package here but it was very high in price. On a side note- Yes, you can order pizza and have it deliveredâ€¦.just pick up the phone book in your room- at first it was hard to find b/c they put it in a fancy case- no yellow phone book for this place! Heeheeheeâ€¦.Ours was in the side drawer next to the bed. OVERALL: To be fair, we REALLY scrutinized EVERYTHING here. Having come from the Hapuna Beach Prince, which was fantastic, it was easy to be VERY picky at the Fairmont. The things we didnâ€™t like were nitpickyâ€¦.the view (we knew what we paid for), no free valet (once again, we knew this), the shower (had we not had such a great shower at HBP we would have loved this shower), the views at the restaurants (we knew this too before booking), the beach (once again hard to compare to HBP)â€¦..anyways, you get the point. We had a great time here, we just had a better time at a resort that was much less $$$ and we felt that we got so much more for our $$$ at the previous resort. In the end, it was our fault. We just didnâ€™t know that we would miss things like a â€œfree breakfastâ€�, a view, free valet, an amazing beach, a room with a viewâ€¦.we wanted the feel of a â€œtrue 5 star resortâ€� and I thought that if we skipped out on some of the above items that we could get the â€œfancyâ€� feel without the high cost. Had we done valet and the breakfast package with a room with a view we would have easily hit 600 a nightâ€¦double what we paid at the HBP. We came here for the beauty of the resort, the size of the suites and the pools- particularly the availability of an adults only pool and the things above didnâ€™t disappoint us- it was the other things that we didnâ€™t know we wanted that we were disappointed with. Would I recommend the resort? SURE WOULD!â€¦but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to anyone that couldnâ€™t afford the room with a view, the breakfast package, the valetâ€¦.basically, if we had 600 a night to spend we would come back to this resort and I bet we would LOVE every inch of itâ€¦but we went to a 5 star resort on a 4 star budget and ended up disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time...some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay despite a few problems. The Kea Lani is in the Wailea area of the island, which was much nicer than most of the other resort areas we saw. The Wailea is very upscale, while nearby Kihea seemed to be a cheap hotel row crawling with teenagers and unpleasant drunken locals hanging and hollering out of their cars. The Fairmont property is impeccably maintained, and the views are spectacular. All public spaces were beautiful and connected to nature, and very clean. The pool areas were clean, open and offered free lounges and umbrellas. There are cabanas available for daily rent, and they had the audacity to charge for an umbrella on the beach ! The kids loved the slide, and spent most of the day in or around the pools. We did not take advantage of the "kids program" and we were not aware prior to our arrival that there was an age requirement for admission. We did use a local babysitter one day for our three year old, and she was awesome ! $16/hour seemed a bit steep, but since he loved his time with her it was well worth it. Upon check-in we were assigned a room with 2 twin beds, a side-angle view of the ocean and a direct view into the neighboring condos' living rooms. Not exactly what we expected as a married couple that still sleeps together. When we expressed our disappointment to the front desk agent, it was apparent that he was not interested, because an alternative room shown to us was on a lower floor with a view of the pool and an outdoor dining area. He also said that we were not guaranteed any specific bed arrangement, even though our reservation through Apple Vacations designated a king bed and ocean view. Never heard that excuse. Despite the offer, we opted to wait until the next morning after some guests had checked out, to see if there were other room options. Indeed, a very helpful and concerned Luz found us a great room that met our expectations, and did not require a mile walk to the pools etc. Housekeeping was great and friendly, but there were some negatives on the room: the balcony floors were so filthy that the bottoms of our feet were black after walking outside for a minute.......there were no utensils/plates etc needed to take advantage of the fridge/microwave/coffeepot set up in the suite. We were encouraged to call room service for that stuff, which was interesting because every time they brought food up to the room there was a $4 charge, but they were happy to walk a fork or spoon up for free ! Otherwise, their food was way overpriced, but tasty ($6 lemonade at poolside...$16 sandwiches...$4 room delivery charge plus automatic 18% gratuity...$5 single scoop ice cream....$22 breakfast buffet....etc). Dont know how this place compares to others in the area, but we met many return visitors who couldve gone anywhere yet claimed the Kea Lani was the best of all. We ranked this place 4 stars because of the lovely proprety, the overall positive vibe there, and the state of relaxation we left with after our 6 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant suggestions”
Reviews.Author: kmuller
Reviews.Content: 5/8-5/15 stayed at the Kea Lani. Stop at Costco as you pull out of the airport and get water, cereal etc... this was really a nice option. They have coffee in the room so you can have breakfast on the balcony. Dining at the hotel was good, mai tai's are best in Maui. The swim up bar has was nice for the guys to watch baseball and still feel like you're in the islands. If you are going to eat a nice breakfast, lunch, or dinner, I would highly recommend going to Seawatch (a five minute shuttle ride from the hotel). The view of the water and the grounds (it's on a golf course overlooking the ocean) is great. We had amazing eggs benedict for $11 which was the avg of most items. Very reasonable compared to $27 buffet at hotel. We wish we would have gone here several times for breakfast. We did also have lunch one day and it was very good as well. Sarrento on the beach is really good and you can reach out and touch the waves! They have a photographer w/ the option to buy your photo (they take it on the beach) which is a nice touch. Rent a car and go to Lahiana for the day. Great shops and worth the time! Alli Nui was a very nice sunset cruise for adults! We also had dinner at Spago's and it was very good (red curry my fav). My husband had a great lomi lomi massage at the spa. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort... but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: DCJamie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long stay at the Fairmont. My parents treated my fiancee and I to the trip and we were all staying in the same suite because the hotel said that the suites comfortably slept 4 adults. While the hotel did in fact have a sofa-bed, it was the worst and most uncomfortable sofa bed I have ever slept on (hard as a rock, our feet hung off of it at least 6 inches, smaller than double bed, etc.) We ended up moving the "mattress" onto the floor after the second night. The bathroom was spacious and well appointed, and the lanai / balcony was a good size too. Hotel grounds are beautiful and well maintained - everything is lush and tropical. Kids are everywhere... except at the adult pool which was peaceful and had attentive poolside service. Poolside food and drinks were good, but of course overpriced (like every nice hotel). Cafe Caio offers a slightly cheaper alternative and has an assortment of food and beverages (we got breakfast there some mornings - coffee, yogurt and bagels). The biggest downfall of the Fairmont is the Spa Kea Lani. It is very obvious that the spa was an afterthought at this resort. It is in a space designed for a retail shop, and, as such, it is extremely small and lacks the features that one expects at the prices they charge and at a resort of such prestige. There is not even a relaxation room to wait in or relax in before or after your treatment. The locker rooms are VERY small and the whole spa only has around 7 or 8 treatment rooms. My mother and I also went to the Four Seasons spa (right next door) and this spa charges around $10 less per treatment and has a much better facility. If you are interested in having a spa treatment, I would highly recommend the Four Seasons spa over the Kea Lani. The spa at the Grand Wailea (the soon to be Waldorf Astoria) is also very nice, but it charges $30 extra for non-guests. Don't miss out on Nick's Fishmarket - one of the best meals we had in Maui, and they same owners have a place down the street called Sarento's, which was also very good. Overall it is a great resort and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetbear
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Hawaii, where we had stayed 4 nights at the Kea Lani. Upon arrival we were told that our rooms were not ready. This was checking in around 3:30pm. We were aware that check in was at 4:00 and wanted to get a drink and a bite to eat anyway. We were told that they would call us when our rooms were ready on our cell phones. We went to find some food and beverage, but had to walk all the way to one of the pool bars, as all the other places were not open until 5:00pm. (But most of the staff there did not know this for whatever reason). It took forever for the food to come out. There were birds everywhere eating scraps of food and making things very messy if you know what I a mean. I ended up with bird poo all over a jacket and purse. And that was trying to keep it sheltered!!!! We get our room and it was nice. However, when I pay over a certain dollar amount I expect to have a mini-bar available. Maybe I'm in the minority on that one. The accoustic ceiling was very dated. We all ran our feet into the big lip on the sliding glass doors there OUCH!!!! The fan click clacked the entire time, bed and pillows were not comfortable. Bathroom, was nice and big. We also had a hard time with the internet acess, but lucky for me I travel with a spare ethernet cable and was able to plug into the wall. There were what seemed like a million kids on the property. We had indeed traveled with our son who I signed up for the Kids Program for two of the four days. He enjoyed it very much, the staff was great with the kids. And it was a nice break for him to be able to hang out with some kids his age and expend some energy!!! It was also nice for us as we were then able to indugle in a few spa treatments for my husband and myself. The spa was small, the treatments top dollar. They and the facilities were not worth the price. I have had much better for less. The food was not great either, and we did leave the property to eat all of our evening meals. However we did do the breakfast buffet every morning....which wasn't great but was included in our package. The staff was hit or miss...just like in life..... We will never stay at this hotel again. And I now never have any desire to stay at another Fairmont property. I will spend my travel dollars elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: feeshmonCA
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd trip to the Kea Lani with young kids. The hotel is a great destination for families, plenty of room for the kids to run, but not too big to feel you are at a conference hotel. The rooms have been remodeled and are very comfortable. The pools are perfect for kids and adults alike. The pool side staff is very attentive and helpful. If you want to rent a poolside cabana, be sure to call well in advance of your visit. The service is among the best at any hotel, with a major exception being food service. Room service is painfully slow, if the order is even correct. Pool side service is even slower. And Cafe Caio is a true execrice in patience. I am not sure why they cannot get this right, bringing in your own food to your suite is cheaper and much faster. That said, Nick's Fishmarket is excellent. Quality of food and service. We will be back... and stopping at the grocery on the way in/

Reviews.Title: “What A Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: eightydegrees
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful stay here last year that we booked it again this year for six nights. This experience was by far the worst of any hotel we have ever had, except for a previous stay at this resort several years ago. We kept trying and now we finaaly learned to stay away. I called this resort a few weeks befoe we arrived just to find out what section of the hotel we would be in. We like a quiet area and suggested that. They gave us a Kilohana signature suite. I was told that we were in the 01-02 section, which is a Kilohana. It was an upgrade but not worth the $700 a night we paid even for an ocean view. Upon check-in we got some real attitude from the woman at the front desk. We have always found them to have an attitude even if you are very friendly. We aksed her what room we were in and she said she had an ocean view for us. My husband and I just looked at each other. I told her that I had called previously andI was told we were in the 01-02 suites.She became flustered. She asked us what room we had last year and we told her we were in a kilohana room 401. She then decided SHE was going to upgrade us to the kilohana. I aske d about my husband smoking a cigar on the lanai and she nastily told us that "there IS NO smoking in the kilohana suites". I asked when they changed the policy and she said it had been that way for quite some time. hhmmm...he smoked on the lanai last year and they provided the ashtray. We asked to speak to the rooms director. After an hour he appeared. We asked him why the front desk had us booked into an ocean view instead of the kilohana we were told we were going to get. He had no idea why she would say that because he blocked off our room personally. We decided to sit in the lobby lounge so my husband could have a cigar before going for a drive until our room was ready. We got there VERY early as we needed to escape from the Kapalua floods. We wern't expecting to get an early check-in. At about 11:30 the rooms director came out to us and told us that the guest had checked out a little while ago and that our room would be ready in 1- 1-1/2 hours. He put a rush with housekeeping on it. He told us to be discreet with the smoking. We were ready to take a nice ride but decided to go get lunch and then get to our room. We came back from lunch about 1 1/2 hours later but the room still wasn't ready. We waited for another 1/2hour and asked to see the rooms director again. When he finally appeared he said it should be ready any time. Another hour went by and we were steaming by this time. We asked to see him again. He actually told us that the guest that checked out had gone back to his room to lounge around! If he put a rush on the room, why did houskeeping wait for two and a half hours before going to clean the room? We travel enough to know that once you check out your room key is invalid. Allrighty then, are they going to play us for stupid? We finally got to our room at about 4:00 PM (not 1 minute before check-in time) Last years room was decorated in nice, pretty, bright florals. This room one floor down was all in very dark green and dark mustard colored rug. It was dreary. We went out onto the lanai and noticed that it was very sticky. You could see where juice or soda hadn't been cleaned up. When we went back inside our feet were literally black on the bottoms from the lanai. That was gross enough, but my husband went to open the bathroom door and there was a lot of a sticky substance on the edge of the door. eewww! The noise was intolerable. The place was full of conventioners and thier families. These kids were animals. The people above has their kids playing on the lanai, screaming and yelling as early as 6:00 AM. They were actually dragging the furniture on lanai this early. The people downstairs had at least two babies screaming most of the time. We had kids in the hallway playing basketball in front of our door and we had parents watch as thier little monsters played and splashed people in the adult pool! I realize that the suites doors are very heavy but all we heard day and night was slamming doors. I mean hard slamming. The resort really should fix the doors. I had gotten hurt going out onto the lanai because the slider has a 3-4" lip on it (i am not used to the old fashioned sliders like these) I tripped and cut and bruised my toes and twisted my back. I didn't say anything to anyone about it. I asked for a heating pad about two days later and they asked what happened. I told them and they were all hush, hush from then on. I am not in the habit of suing people and I was rather the clutz, but it would have been nice if the manager would have asked if I was OK. We asked to be moved because of the noise issue. He was going to put us in back of the Polo Beach Club. We decided to leave at this point. We went elsewhere and had a wonderful stay without any complaints. My warning is that if you are not a conventioner with family in tow or a family of eight then you may want to go elsewhere. I don't know what happened this year. We had the most wonderful stay last year. We will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the beauty of Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: RLFord
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were able to enjoy the beautiful Fairmont Kea Lani Hotel in Maui from March 26th-30th. The rooms are all suites. Our garden-view room still had a glimpse of the ocean. Entering the room, there is a foyer with wet bar, fridge, and closet to store luggage. Straight ahead is the well appointed living room, with sofa, chair, coffe & end tables, TV, stereo, DVD & CD. Immediately to the right is the door into the master bath, which has both shower and bath tub, double sinks, and beautifully done in marble. The bedroom accesses the bath from the opposite end, and the king-size bed was very comfy. There is a double lani, off both the living room and bedroom. We found the staff to be professional & helpful in every way. The food is excellent, and the lounge bar affords great views of the grounds and the ocean in the distance. Between the main hotel & the beach is a cluster of small executive beach cabins (?), each with their own mini-swimming pool. Boy, those units must be spendy! Two swimming pools are on property, one for adults only. There is a narrow paved walking path along the beach, that allows you to walk north, past many of the other Wailau properties. Be careful if you choose to take the walking path, as it is narrow, and used heavily by joggers! The Fairmont is a beautiful property. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Had it's pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: 1trillium
Reviews.Content: Front desk was friendly upon check-in. The hotel has a great location on the beach. The room was nice although a bit uncomfortable. The air conditioning wasn't working nor was the ceiling fan so I called guest services and they said they would send maintenance up right away to fix it. I also called housekeeping to clean the room. 4 hours later nothing had been done. While the services at the spa were nice, which I took advantage of daily, the spa itself was small and very cramped. You had to change right next to the door with about two feet between the bench and the lockers. You can imagine how nice that was when you're naked and people are trying to get by. There was one bathroom and a small sauna. The waiting area was just as uncomfortable with four chairs and a bench to sit on; with all the seats occupied the wall was the only space available. The area was probably 4x4. They really need to redo this facility; especially since the prices are those of a high end spa with ALL the amenities. My daughters went ahead of me to get a table at breakfast and for some reason the hostess kept bypassing them for the people behind them. No, they weren't tiny but rather a 15 and 12 year old. When I asked why the question was ignored and another hostess came up and sat us. By the time all this happened we made one round of the breakfast buffet and then they started clearing all the food without letting us know but still charging the full $27.00 per person. This was really overall a disappointing stay for the price we paid. At $800.00 plus a night none of these things should have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: tracybraylina
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is expensive. Even overpriced. However, it is a beautiful hotel with excellent views, top notch restaurants and the most beautiful sunsets I have ever seen. My husband and I stayed at 8 different hotels during our trip to Maui. Some places are overpriced with nothing much to offer (like the Sheraton). The Kea Lani is expensive but worth every penny. Nick's Fish Market is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to! I still dream about that lobster! The rooms are huge and clean with beautiful views. The beach is beautiful and not overcrowded. The staff is friendly. Can't beat this hotel. Spend the extra money and stay a night or two (or more if yuo can afford it) in this awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Rocco1109
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Fairmont Kea Lani, myself, wife, two kids. The best thing about this hotel is that all the rooms are suites. With four people, I did not feel like we were on top of each other all week. Plus our room had a great lanai and that added to the spaciousness. Our room had a microwave and small fridge. There is a small shop on site where you can buy breakfast and eat in your room (cereal, milk, yogurt, bagels, etc). I guess I'm cheap and found it a bit excessive to pay $20 for a two egg, bacon breakfast in the restaurant! Also there is an ABC store within a 5 minute drive to stock up on inexpensive bottles of water and other supplies. All the amenities are great except that I would agree with an earlier post that the gym is too small. My wife and I took the free morning yoga class each day it was offered (I think Tues-Sat); just show up at the gym @ 8am and sign up. It was never full so we were able to get a spot each day. The kids loved the main pool which includes a slide and two hot tubs. For adults, there is a separate adult pool that offers all the serenity you could want. Each afternoon by the pool someone came by with free slices of pineapple--nice touch but not as nice as the free Evian spritzes at the Four Seasons. The beach was great and there seemed to be ample chairs/umbrellas each day we went. A couple nit-picking points: 1) on the day we arrived we went to the pool around 4pm but they were out of towels! That surprised me. I had to go back to the room and get the towels. 2) When I'm paying $500+ per night, I don't like being charged $9 for a mask/snorkel. We also paid $18 for a boogie board. This seems petty on Fairmont's part. These things should be all inclusive. 3) while there we decided to book a cabana by the pool only to find that all cabana's are booked thru April. So if you want a cabana, book it well in advance of your arrival. Overall, if you have a family, you'll find that the Fairmont is probably the best hotel in the Wailea area because all rooms are suites. If just my wife and I were going, I'd probably book the Four Seasons (they don't cater as much to kids).

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani No Ka Oi”
Reviews.Author: David_Edward
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying in some of the finest rooms available in the world. I travel extensively (New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Rome, Madrid, Hong Kong, Bali, etc.) and have had the pleasure of staying at the Kea Lani twice in the last 10 years. It ranks up there with the very best of them. My first time at the Kea Lani was in 1996 in one of their two bedroom / two story ocean-front villas. The villa itself was spectacular with it's own private splash pool, kitchen, laundry and split-level floor plan. If you are travelling as two couples or as a family I would highly recommend the villas. On this most recent trip (March 11th - 19th 2006) I spent all of my 8-day trip to Maui in one of the Kea Lani's "Kilohana Suites'. 1100 square feet, enormous wrap-around lanai, spacious sitting room, marble wet-bar, modern clean and eminently functional marble bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in outside of my own home. The service, from the valet parking / bell desk to the front desk to housekeeping is par excellence. We were in the main building which not only afforded a spectacular panoramic view of the impeccably manicured / landscaped grounds and both pools but afforded us the ease of a two-minute trip from the front desk to our room. Spa Kea Lani is a beautifully appointed and professionally staffed facility. My girlfriend and I enjoyed side-by-side 80 minute massages and I have to say they were likely the best we've ever had. Not sure what some of the other reviewers were talking about re: the public areas being a bit "tired". The hotel was built in 1991 but the rooms have almost all been renovated and the public areas are as gorgeous now (if not more so) than they were when I first vacationed here in the mid-90's. The Four Seasons is nice but did not strike me as anything truly special. If you are travelling on a budget, the Kea Lani is not the place for you. But if you have the means and the sophistication to appreciate the very finest things that life has to offer, the only places to even consider when vacationing on Maui are the Kea Lani or the Grand Wailea (right next door.) (I know some would argue for The Ritz Carlton Kapalua but their resort really does look tired and in dire need of a major face-lift and I don't play golf!) Even though the Kea Lani was *completely* booked during the time I was there, I never once had the slightest bit of difficulty finding a perfectly positioned lounge chair nor ever felt the slightest bit "crowded". This truly is a world-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location for diving”
Reviews.Author: rkr727
