After staying in the first two world class resorts, the Fairmont was a real downer! The carpets in the elevators were dingy. The rooms were musty. Ice buckets were never filled, and the ice dispenser on the fourth floor didn't work. Housekeeping would just rinse out the sink instead of washing it...also didn't clean out dirty glasses all the time. It is not a place for getting pampered. It is however, a very good hotel for families because it offers a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. But having been well pampered in other high-end hotels, this ranks as a 3 to 4-star. The dinner at Nick's was delicious, but the pizza and chicken parm gave us serious heartburn! Save some money and eat at Canton Chef's (excellent, very casual Chinese) in Kihei and get dessert at Lappert's in the same mall instead of wasting your money in the hotel's restaurants. (For hearty breakfast eaters, the morning buffet was very good and worth the money.) All in all, a big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Maui hands down!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my honeymoon of 5 nights at the Kea Lani and 5 nights in Kauai. We went to Maui first and stayed in the Kilohana suite offered by the Fairmont. It was the most beatiful and comfortable room I have ever stayed in. I don't know what those people giving this place bad reviews are talking about because I am one of the most picky people about my accomidations, I need everything to be perfect. The Kea Lani has unbelievable service inside and outside the hotel. We had breakfast every morning, and the breakfast was there exaclty on time for five mornings straight and the food was top notch. Then we watched the sunset from our balcony every night. The hotel is looking west and we had a corner room with a rap-around balcony which allows anyone with an ocean view room to watch the sunset. I did extensive research before I went to Maui and It looks like it paid off. Me and my wife visited the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea to see if we made the right decision, and we could not have been happier to go back to paradise at the Kea Lani. The Four Seasons is nice but a little stuffy (people were not as friendly), and forget about the Grand Wailea it does not even compare to the other two. There are a lot of teenagers and family's with young children, so honeymooners stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani and if you can reserve the Kilohana suite. This place makes you feel like your a King and Queen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: cotogal
Reviews.Content: I read Trip Advisor for a month leading up to our trip to Maui, so I wanted to write a review to help anyone else looking for advise. We just returned from Maui last night, and had a wonderful time. I really did not want to leave. We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani in an ocean view villa. It honestly could not have been nicer. Everything was first class. The room was perfect; large, clean, quiet and extremely comfortable. Our favorite meal was Nick's. Again, perfect. It is a beautiful setting. The food and service is wonderful. Another of our favorite meals was Mama's Fish House. We went for lunch after hiking to Twin Falls. What a beautiful setting!!! I could have spent the entire afternoon there. Overall, everything was great. The only meal we were disappointed in was the Pacific Grill at the Four Seasons. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't great. The service was fair, so if I had to make a choice I would go to Nick's twice before going to Pacific Grill. We went to many other restaurants and places so if you have any questions please feel free to ask. Chris from Orange County

Reviews.Title: “Who is Handing out the 5 Star Ratings?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and four good friends just returned from 4 nights in Waikiki (at the Hilton Hawaiian Village -- see review) and 3 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani. We were really looking forward to the 5 star experience the Fairmont offered for $665/night. All six of us were uniformly disappointed. At first glance, the resort looks decadent. A closer look reveals a worn and dingy appearance. The rooms were nice sized, but had a lot of wasted space. The deluxe ocean view was very nice, if only slightly worse than the view we had on Waikiki at less than half the price. The private beach was tiny with an unpleasant shore break. The pool was pleasant, but the chairs and grounds were somewhat dilapidated, with peeling paint, chipped furniture and average common areas. I was put off by the $75 price tag on the poolside cabanas. The service was cool and aloof; the staff was never overtly friendly and lacked the Aloha spirit that makes Maui so charming. In general, we were made to feel like strangers. The spa services were wonderful (the massages were high quality), but the spa itself was miniscule and unimpressive, consisting only of showers and a steam room. The restaurants were only average. Breakfast buffet was $28 per person and was pretty good. My only complaint is that they ran out of hot tea and didn't bother to obtain any during my four days there. What 5 star resort runs out of tea bags? In contrast, we visited the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea for dinner. The Four Seasons definitely gave off a classy, clean, elegant feeling throughout. The Grand Wailea appeared equally nice, abeit massive, and catered more to families with children. Both of these resorts made a better impression than the Fairmont. As far as the island, the beaches were magnificent. The Haleakala bike ride was worth the 2:00 a.m. departure time (really!). Eat at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a (Grand Wailea) for a beautiful sunset and great food. In short, it looks like the Fairmont's 5 star rating was handed out decades ago. Time has not been kind to the Fairmont. When I return to Maui, I'll choose the Four Seasons for a more intimate, upscale experience. Either that or the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. For truly discriminating travelers, believe those who questioned the 5 star rating. I only wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Kea Lani and it was just as amazing as 3 yrs. ago. It is my favorite hotel in Wailea. The rooms have all been newly remodeled. The service was excellant. The rooms are huge and the ocean view was worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights of our honeymoon at the Fairmont in July 2005. It's a great place, probably the best resort/hotel I've ever stayed in. I can't really think of any negatives, except the cost of food was on the high side. But they were not out of line compared with other places and Maui. We found the service throughout the resort to be excellent-the front desk, activities desk, poolside, housekeeping, etc. As you would expect, the grounds, rooms and lobby/common areas are immaculate. The beach is picture perfect. The pools are large and well kept. We had a mountain view room, which had a large balcony, DVD/VCR players, walk in tiled shower, etc etc. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I stayed at the Fairmont Maui for five nights. In our opinion, the Fairmont has set the standard. Elegant, comfortable, never pretentious perfection. The grounds are stunning. The restaurants outstanding. The service exceptionally friendly and accommodating. The rooms are almost too nice...we had a hard time leaving each morning! We can't wait to return. When we left the Fairmont for our five evening stay on Kauai, we only wish we could have taken the hotel with us.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spacious, 800 sq foot suites. Excellent, attentive staff. Do not miss the pricey spa services. Well worth the price to leave all the Mainland woes behind. Onsite food is expensive, except for the breakfast buffet. Do not miss the macadamia nut sticky buns. Within walking distance of the Shops at Wailea, where you can get everything from a Tiffany bauble to a juicy Hamburger in Paradise. Beautiful walking path along the ocean between the neighboring resorts. Free outrigger canoe ride early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: texasaggie84
Reviews.Content: Just got home from our stay from 7/4/05 - 7/14/05. This is a great family vacation hotel because of the suites. We have 2 children ages 6 and 9. We had a moderate room with a view of the front grounds, room 353, for $385 night - don't forget the extra $40 tax per night (approx.) which added about an extra $400 to our bill. The staff and service were excellent - housekeeping always arrived promptly as did engineering (we had a small problem with the stereo). The carpet needed changing out in our room and the air conditioner was a little too loud but other than that I have no complaints about the resort. I did request a renovated room when we checked in and was told that the moderate suites had not been renovated yet - not sure if that is true or not. There are 3 pools (1 adults and the other 2 for everyone). The 2 for everyone are on two different levels with a water slide connecting the 2 pools. We all liked the water slide. Yes, if you want a chair right by the pool get there really early but we never had a problem getting a chair because there are plenty of grassy areas with palm tree shade that we liked better. We ate at Nicks one night and had reservations the food was very good as was the service. If you are a light eater an appetizer is enough for an entree. Our last night on the island we decided to eat at Nicks impromtu. First we went to the hotel lobby bar and ordered drinks my husband had already been to Nicks and they said yes they could accommodate us. We went back down in the 5-10 min. that they said but we weren't allowed to enter the restaurant with our drinks. It turns out the restaurant has nothing to do with the hotel and only leases the space, they have separate liquor licenses and you can't bring a drink into Nicks. For about 30 min the hostess kept telling us a table would be ready in 5-10 min. At one point when I checked on our table she said "...oh yea no reservations." with an attitude of how dare we expect to eat here without reservations. They finally sat us in a booth behind the bar (my husband said these booths had been open the entire time) it is so hot in this part of the restaurant that we left. They said they could not accommodate us with another table. Note this is an open air restaurant and unless you are sit outside or very near you will not get a breeze - no air conditioning. That second night I thought the hostess had a rather rude attitude. If you want to eat here make reservations before you leave home. We ate at Cafe Caio in hotel and same prices as Nicks. If you are going to spend the money for Nicks you may want to consider David Pauls we went there one night (yes we had reservations) food is outstanding as is service and about the same price as Nicks. Kehei Cafe is a good place for breakfast and lunch and very reasonable prices. Great huevos rancheros with homemade salsa. We also ate at Stella Blues in Kehei and an Italian place Aroma de Italia all were good but left hungry from the Italian place entrees were on the small side and not inexpensive. If you go to Lahaina and love pizza you have to eat at BJ's great deep dish. We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning but $80 for breakfast for 4 is a little steep for me. After staying at the Fairmont I would agree that it is probably not the best place for honeymooners. A word for families unless you kids just love ocean swimming (mine don't) I won't take mine back to Hawaii for a long time there just isn't enough to do on the island for the kids and we picked Maui over Kauai because we thought the kids would enjoy it more. Personally my kids would rather have gone back to Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Kea Lani....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the Fairmont Kea Lani. We booked 5 nights several months back for our honeymoon. While the resort does have some things going for it, there were some issues that I think are worth mentioning. Hopefully this will help some of you couples that may be planning a getaway. Pros: - Rooms are all suites so you can expect to have spacious accomodations including a living room area, and a wet bar. - There is an adult pool area to get away from the chaos of the kids pool. - Decor is simple, yet tasteful. - Upon arrival, you are greeted with juice, a lei, and friendly bell service ready to take your bags off your hands. - In general the service was good. There was one time that we called ahead for our car and they lost our request. The poolside service was decent. All in all, I'd rate the service a B (some of the front desk, and concierge staff had chilly attitudes). Cons: - Resort has clearly made an effort to accomodate families with children. This can be a con for those of you that may be looking for a little more solitude. Since we were there in June (school just getting out)...it seemed that there were many, many families with small children on vacation. While the resort does have an adult only pool, you can hear the screaming and yelling from the kids pool from time to time. If I were a parent, I would be excited to have a high quality resort such as this cater to me like this, but as a honeymooner...it was a let down. - The rooms located on the lower levels (K, M) have somewhat of a musty smell. Our room was nice, but I did get the feeling that it was an older room that had been refaced. There was a basementish odor about it that contributed to this feeling. In the end, if we were going back to Maui as a couple, I'd think about the Four Seasons in Wailea. We walked through their resort and it seemed a little more quaint, and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next trip already!”
Reviews.Author: OnlineMom
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort! My family and I went for a week in June, 2005. We flew in on an early flight from Los Angeles and when we arrived, our suite was not yet ready. (We, admittedly, arrived hours before the stated check-in time so the hotel was not at fault.) We were given cold water and leis - flowers for my husband and me and candy ones for the children - and spent time exploring the grounds and Polo Beach. When our room was finally ready (suite #670), it did not disappoint. It was towards the southern end of the building - facing west - a deluxe full ocean view ($665/night). Beautiful! We loved having the separate bedroom so that the kids (who slept in luxury in there!) could go to bed but we didn't have to. The pull-out in the family room area wasn't amazing - but it did suffice. We were so tired most nights that we could've fallen asleep on the floor! The lanai was gorgeous and we used it often. We ordered in-suite dining 2 days for lunch and the food came quickly and was really, really good ($53 for 3 of us one day and $75 for 4 of us another). Housekeeping was always friendly and came when we called and requested service while at breakfast. The nightly turn-down service was great too - they'd turn down the kids' beds and set up the pull-out for my husband and me as well. While my husband golfed at Wailea one day, I decided to take the kids to the Keiki Lani kids camp from 9 until noon so I could enjoy some quiet time to myself. Bonnie was wonderful and the kids had a great time. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to any parent with little ones. The spa was nice. I had a lomi lomi massage one day and a citrus scrub another. The facility is decent - the waiting room isn't very large, though, and ended up with standing room only at one point. Too - the steam room (which I usually enjoy before a treatment) was the loudest I'd ever been in and there was no ice water or chilled towels for those of us using it. This isn't a necessity, obviously, but it's a small thing that would've made the experience more enjoyable for me and it is done - I've seen it at half a dozen other resort spas in the past few years. The massage technicians were both great - very courteous and skilled. We had breakfast daily at the Kea Lani Restaurant. The breakfast buffet ($26 for adults and $10 for kids) was incredible. The kitchen was very accommodating and never hesitated to help and/or send the chef out when we had a question about something. (My son is Autistic and on a wheat and dairy free diet so we have to check labels and verify ingredients often.) The terrace is gorgeous and the perfect way to start a day in Maui. We had lunch at the Polo Beach Bar & Grille one day and it was great. We did not have a chance to eat at Caffe Ciao but enjoyed a wonderful dinner at Nick's one evening. There couldn't be a prettier spot on the property! We were not able to enjoy the adult pool as we had our 5 and 6 year olds with us - it certainly looked lovely, though. There never seemed to be a shortage of chairs. The main (kids) pool was always fairly busy but - again - we never had problems finding a chair or two. The slide was fun and the children (as well as their Father) enjoyed the shallow-end basketball net! We enjoyed many a lava flow by the pool and the servers were always quick and friendly. The pineapple slices and chilled towels were much appreciated as well. Cabanas (that fit 2 lounge chairs and a small table, I think) were available for $75/day I think but we didn't feel the need for or use one. The beach - ahhh - what can I say about Polo Beach? We absolutely loved it. The attendants were always more than willing to help drag chairs through the sand for me and we spent hours upon hours enjoying the sand and the surf. It's a great little beach. We did not do it this time (but will on our next visit!) - but they had boogie boards available for rent - $9/hour or $20 for the day. There were umbrellas available for rent down there as well as chairs with "hoods" to protect you from the sun. We did not have any complaints whatsoever and I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to even my pickiest of friends. We are hoping to go back next year and enjoy time in one of the villas!

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani Honeymoon....not all that great!”
Reviews.Author: Foodiegrl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Kea Lani for our honeymoon. I did much research on the hotel and Maui before deciding on where to go. We decided to do 5 of our 10 nights at the Kea Lani and the first half at the Kappalua Villas (next to the Ritz). Negatives: (1) We had to wait almost 2 hours to get our rooms "ready". They told us they would call us when it was done, finally almost 2 hours later, my husband had to go ask the front desk what was taking so long and they finally had it ready....when we did arrive to our room (which was a Deluxe Ocean Front), there was some else's bags in our room. SO, we had to go all the way down to the front desk again and tell them there's someone else's belongings in the room. The front desk girl tells us the room is ours, but they need to move those bags, which belong to another guest to another room. The original guests in that room decided they wanted to upgrade. Well, when we did get to our room, it was nice, clean, spacious, all what you expect at a 5 star resort. However, our ocean front room was not really ocean front. So again we went to the front desk and asked them why we didnt get the room we're paying for and to the hotel's standard we did have deluxe ocean front...but we were facing the Four Season's villas as well as the ocean, so honestly we felt we did not get our money's worth on the room itself! (2) The concierge's desk was a joke. The attitude at the concierge's was not helpful, but rather half --- when you asked them to do anything (i.e. my husband asked if they could give him some change...so we can tip the valet...but the response he got was "the front desk can give you change". the front desk had several people waiting in line to check in and out but the concierge's didnt have anything else to do) (3) The pools are average at best, nothing spectacular....seen better pools at my friend's backyards! (4) Service over all was a 4 out of 10. I dont feel they go above and beyond what they should at a resort area like this. I felt like the service was like a Holiday Inn (at best!) Positives: (1) The food was good, not great, but good. It is not that expensive considering you're at a resort and in Maui. (2) The valet and bell desk service was great, that was the only service at the hotel worth praising. They actual gave the island hospitality that lacked everywhere else on the island! Over all I am not a person that gets hung up on 'status' or '5 star' places, but I do expect a certain level of service and quality when I do pay for these things...and the Kea Lani did not give us that quality service one should expect. The resorts in Waiela in general was not that great, we went to the Four Season's, Grand Waiela and they weren't anything spectacular either. MAUI IN GENERAL: As I mentioned, we did stay at the Kappalua Villas (next to the Ritz) and those villas were great! We had a 2 level ocean front (real ocean front, literally we can walk up to the beach...so beautiful!) 1 bedroom, 2 bath villa. This was far less costly than the Kea Lani and 100 times better! Also, the Ritz was beautiful, the resort was amazing and the service and food was great! We should have stayed there after our stay in the villas, instead of the Kea Lani! As far as food....we ate at almost every single resturant in Waiela and nothing was worth really mentioning except for Longhi's. The food at Longhi's was great, espeically breakfast....which we ate next to Magic Johnson & family...very nice guy! We had been there during the Waiela Movie Festival so a lot of Hollywood was there. Roy's in Kiehi was OK, probably the next best to Longhi's. In Lahiana we loved Aloha mixed plate, cheap & good! Can't go wrong with korean bbq! I'O is where we had our reception dinner (on front street) and I'O is the BEST food we had while in Maui. The food, service and atmosphere was excellent! Definately recommend I'O as the place to try dinner during sunset...as they have an ocean front view outside for lunch, dinner or drinks! We also went Parasailing and did the helicopter ride around the island, which was both very fun! We wanted to go horseback riding but those book quickly, so do it a few weeks ahead of time! Road to Hana...I'll pass! We did do this, but it is not for those who dont like looong car rides and are not really into 'nature'. Yes there are beautiful waterfalls, and the seven pools are nice...(they were closed when we went so we didnt go in..too bad! as that was what was motiviating me to end of the ride) and the black sand beach....nice, but not 'sand' more like lava rocks! All in all, Maui was nice....although we found it boring sometimes (being we're in our early and mid 20's)....more ideal for families or older couples. The food was nothing amazing, we've had better in Oahu and the locals were not as friendly as they are in Oahu....next time we'll be in Oahu or Fiji...Maui maybe in another 10-15 years when we dont want much of a night life or fun!

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Ava007
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Kea Lani is an absolutely beautiful 5 star luxury resort. Starting with the dramatic entrance, the resort slowly reveals itself as you descend upon it. The grounds are impeccably maintained and we were warmly greeted as we drove up to valet which is free. We arrived in Maui much earlier than the 4PM check in. Lani at the front desk was extremely accommodating and allowed us to check in early and upgraded our room! We were very pleased with our room. There is a small kitchenette with a microwave and mini fridge which is excellent for snacking. We actually stopped at Costco based on the many suggestions on this website and stocked up on beverages and snacks. The macadamia nuts are priced very reasonable compared to the mainland. The bathroom is huge and nicely appointed, all of the toiletries are provided including woolite to wash your bathing suits which I thought was a nice touch. The bed extremely comfortable and plenty of pillows are provided. Two televisions, one in the main living area and one in the bedroom and even his and her closets (really). The buffet is very good, nice variety ($25/person). We ate dinner several times at Cafe Ciao and once at Nick's Fishmarket - both are very good. My husband and I enjoyed the adult pool, it is a lot calmer than the other pools however we never had problems finding a lounge chair. Everyone we dealt with at the resort demonstrated the Hawaiian hospitality and truly went out of there way to please. My husband and I have travelled extensively and I can honestly say the Fairmont surpassed my expectations. Other recommendations, try the snorkeling at Blackrock which is in Kanapali near the Sheraton - the visibility is amazing and we actually saw sea turtles. Really enjoyed the snorkel tour to Molikini, went on the Four Winds II - great staff. The luau at the Hyatt in Kanapali was excellent, food was great and not so unusual that you will not eat it, I actually had seconds. There are several nice beaches in Wailea that we went to that were awesome for snorkeling, don't know the names of them but they are going towards the Maui Prince resort. We met several locals there. If you follow the signs you cannot miss it. Hope this helps. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirl78
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Kea Lani. We got married on Maui and stayed at a different hotel with our guests the first week, but chose this one for our honeymoon week. It's in the Wailea area, which is our favorite part of the island. There seems to be a great staff-guest ratio and we felt really spoiled with the service. We were given leis, cold towels and guava juice at check-in and were upgraded to a deluxe oceanfront suite. It was very clean and the view from the huge lanai was incredible. The bathrooms are huge and the sitting area was very nice. There were nice robes to use and a fridge and microwave as well. They provided vases for all of our flowers and the flower petal turndown was a nice touch. The restaurants were very good, we especially liked Cafe Ciao for dinner. The grounds are beautiful at night (very romantic) and we used the pool every single day. It was never very busy and they came around with fresh pineapple late morning, early afternoon and provided cucumber water as well. The slide was fun - I think the adults had more fun than the kids! There are cabanas for rental, otherwise there are plenty of umbrellas/palm trees to shade you from the sun. The beach is smaller than Wailea beach (next door) but there were plenty of beach chairs and it's a pretty calm beach and very swimmable. We bought fruit and pastries at the gourmet store downstairs and enjoyed them on our lanai every morning. They even offered soy milk - which is nice for us vegetarians! There is a complimentary outrigger canoe experience for those interested. The Kea Lani shares an oceanside walking path with the Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Marriott Wailea and Renaissance. Great walk in the morning or evening - three miles total. The only downside to the hotel is that it is quite pricey but for a special occasion it's worth it. There are also no screens off the lanai, which would have been nice to leave open at night. The torch lighting was fun to watch in the evenings. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Keiki Friendly Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mburns
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 month old son, and I just returned from our glorious stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea. It was a tough flight from Chicago, but well worth it once we arrived. Thank goodness for portable DVD players! We rented a car and drove a short way to the Kea Lani. All of the roads were really well marked; we didn't even need the maps I had printed out before leaving. Once at the hotel, we were greeted with cool towels, leis (a candy lei for our keiki), and POG juice. We requested a renovated suite and were upgraded at no charge to a partial ocean view room. (Be sure to join the Fairmont President's Club before you go. At no charge, you are given some upgrades and perks.) What a room! Our 840 square foot room consisted of a huge marble bathroom with two sinks, sunken tub, and an open shower, kitchenette area with fridge and microwave, living room with large comfy sofa (sleeper), and spacious lanai with chaise, table, and four chairs. Both the bedroom and the living room had televisions and there was a stereo system, DVD player, and VCR in the room. The rooms were remarkably clean as there was twice daily maid service. The hotel provided us with a crib and a pack 'n play for the pool. There are four pools at the Kea Lani. The adult pool is set off by itself. It looked lovely and quiet. The other pools are grouped together. There is a baby pool which our son loved! It is perfect for toddlers. The other pools are spacious and wrap around the grounds. The water slide is a blast. My husband got lessons from many 7 year olds as to how to get down really fast (stick your belly out). There is a small waterfall in one of the pools. They were giving scuba lessons in the pool at the hotel. We reserved a cabana for our keiki. Shade is hard to come by at the pool. There are very few umbrellas (they go fast). They provide you with a roomy cabana, two chaise lounge chairs, a cooler with juices, waters, and an Evian atomizer, and a fruit bowl. We had great service: fresh towels, pineapple, cool washcloths at the pool. All in all they are expensive, but we felt it was well worth the money so we could have our little guy in the shade. We had a hotel pack 'n play at the pool and our son was able to nap in the cabana while we enjoyed a little down time. We were lucky to have been at the hotel when it was not too crowded. There were many horror stories about fighting for chairs during high season that sounded awful. We ate a couple of lunches at the pool area. It is pricey, but convenient. I am still dreaming of the "Pirates Treasure" - a yummy mango/pineapple rum drink! One day we ordered pizza from Shaka Pizza at the pool. Good stuff! We used the Nanny Connection for three nights of our trip. All of the hotels use this service. We requested a sitter that had been with them over five years and who had lots of experience with toddlers. Our son wound up never even meeting our nanny. He went to sleep each night before she arrived. Nevertheless, she was pleasant, prompt, loaded with toys and activities, and truly seemed nice. We were able to have a few dinners to ourselves with complete confidence that he was being taken care of. (Down at the pool we met a few more sitters from the service and each one was nicer than the next.) As far as restaurants go, we loved so many places! The breakfasts at the Kea Lani buffet were great. If you can get the buffet included in the price of your room you can save some money. Kids eat free. Don't miss Mama's Fish House in Paia - great food, atmosphere, and sunsets. We loved the menu. Each fish lists the fisherman, boat, and location caught. The town is really funky, too. Good people watching and surfing. We also loved Roy's and Tommy Bahama's. We ate at Nick's one night in the hotel. We enjoyed it, but it didn't hold a candle to the one in Chicago. Funny story: We watched the waiters move our salt and pepper shakers around all night. My husband decided to move them around himself to see what would happen. They kept moving them back to a different position on the table. We finally asked one of the waiters about it. Apparently, they use the shakers to tell the other wait staff what has been ordered, what has been asked, which position each person is, etc. Sansei for sushi was good, but we have had equally good or better sushi at home. We didn't like Joe's Bar and Grill, but heard their other restaurant Haliimaile General Store is excellent. We also loved the coffee at BadAss Coffee Shop in Kihei. There are so many great places to dine on the island. As far as shopping goes, the Shops at Wailea down the road were nice. Good souvenirs. We actually found great stuff for our nephews at Longs and Safeway of all places! If you venture out to Lahaina try to avoid it when there is a cruise ship docked. Very crowded. Our favorite place was Makena. It is gorgeous, peaceful, and unspoiled. Drive down all the way to end (even where the road is one lane). The water is magnificent and the lava fields are spectacular. Maui is amazingly beautiful, relaxing, and laid back. We can't wait to return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons v. Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2006
Reviews.Content: I read through the reviews of both hotels and could not decide which one to stay at during my time in Maui so I decided to split between the Fairmont and the Four Seasons located next door. It is difficult to say which one is better because both are really exceptional resorts. There were good things and bad things about each one. The positives of staying at Fairmont are: all rooms are suites, pool area is much larger than the four seasons, the resort itself is much bigger than the four seasons, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The biggest positive about Fairmont for me was the beach! I don't think the hotel owns the beach but the location is such that only hotel guests have access to it so it is really private, not very noisy, and not crowded. Upon arrival we were greeted with leis, cold towels, and juice. We are members of the presidential club so we were upgraded to a nicer suite without even asking. Room service was prompt and efficient. We noted that I had left my lei on the couch and when we returned, housekeeping had taken the lei and put it in a heart shape on the coffee table. The bathrooms are huge and recently renovated. Although the restaurants are good (especially Nick's fishmarket), there are good but limited food choices so one can get bored eating the same type of things more than once. It is a tropical climate and the fairmont has open walk ways so there are some areas where the carpets have dark mold on them in the corners but it is not really noticeable. The only real negative was that the Fairmont really nickel and dimes you for everything. $75 for cabana rental!! There is also a charge to rent dvds. At the four seasons, those things are free. We did not rent a car but apparently parking is also very expensive, that is free at the four seasons. The spa is ok and over priced, not that great of a facial and it was nearly $300, but I am an avid spa goer with really high standards so that is my disclaimer. If you want to stay at the fairmont, use the spa at the four seasons because it really nice and the services are better priced. The Fairmont also offers some complimentary activities, the canoe experience is great and I recommend that because the four seasons does not have anything comparable to it. Overall, we had a great time at the fairmont and will most likely return but we will divide our time again between the four seasons and the fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani 5 Star attitude!”
Reviews.Author: SC/BTravels
Reviews.Content: As previous guests at the Kea Lani we feel our experience needed to be given to others who are looking forward to an upcoming stay. From the moment we arrived the staff and accomodations were excellent. We were booked into a renovated room on the 7th flr. overlooking the adult pool area. This is a great location if you are looking to relax in your own room on the balcony during the day. Since this was above the adult pool (18 and older allowed) it was not noisy, but pretty sedate. With all the families staying at the resort, noise was never a problem, it seems everyone from staff to guests are friendly (just that aloha spirit). The renovated room was updated with new carpets, paint, window coverings and bedding. The lighting was improved in the bathroom also (they used to be really dark). We ate at Caffe Ciao and Nick's twice and enjoyed both for different reasons. You can't compare as they are totally different restaurants. We also had drinks and appetizers in the lobby bar one night as our dinner. We had a couples massage at Spa Kea Lani...sooooooo relaxing! Cabana's are expensive ($75 perday) but do include a cooler with waters, juices, mints, evian spritzer, magazine and fruit bowl. You are offered a refill too. The pool staff couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating. This resort has it all, you can check in and get everything you need or want right in the hotel. Don't hesitate to book at Fairmont Kea Lani, you will be glad you did.....you'll be ready to book your next trip when you get home!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fanatastic time at the Fairmount”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 60% of th rooms are now renovated there. We didnt get one - but didnt matter it was really nice just the same. Nothing like other hotels that need a reno. The suites are really nice with large bathrooms and balconies. Service was great. Bell hop gave us the info tour on the way to our room. Everything was very personal and the staff were the best. Highly recommend the Twilight Dinner for 2 - book ahead it is worth it. Private cabana with surf & turf - amongst the best lobster weve ever had. View over the adult pool towards the ocean as we watched the sunset. We do plan on returning to this resort. We have done alot of travelling and this one does land on our favourite/repeat list. Highly recommend -

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at the Fairmont and loved it! The luxury suites gave us plenty of room. The bath was the largest I have seen at a hotel. The resort was quiet and the separate pool for adults only gave us the peace to honeymoon. So did the romance package that came with a picnic lunch, in-suite breakfast, sunset cruise, and a special candlelight dinner served poolside just for the two of us. All of this made it a very special stay. Service was excellent particularly in helping us find our way around the island and locating places off-the-beaten path. We also loved the Wailea area of Maui where the hotel was located. Very upscale and ritzy. If you want quiet, understated luxury, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kea Lani!”
Reviews.Author: 360GUY
Reviews.Content: Aloha! These trip advisor rewiews were helpful to me, so I should like to share the following nuggets with you prior to your trip. Maui is expensive! The best times to visit are the spring or autumn, when rates are generally lower for rooms, rental cars, etc. The taxi fare from the airport to the hotel is $38.00 plus tip. Go to the taxi kiosk near baggage claim to get a number (if not renting a car). Costco is near the airport if you need to load up on any items. The air around the airport is polluted from a sugarcane factory smokestack bellowing effluent, but the coast near the hotel is clear and beautiful. Join the President's Club by registering for free on the Fairmont website. The bellhop greeted us as if we were old friends and frequent guests. There is a special reservations desk for the President's Club where you are greeted with chilled guava juice, chilled washcloths, flower lais for the ladies and nut necklaces for the men. We had a renovated deluxe oceanview room that was a spacious suite of approximately 900 sq. ft.. The foyer entry has a granite wetbar with a large microwave, coffepot and small refrigerator. The living room has a complete Sony stereo system with DVD, CD, tape players and gamestation. The king sized bedroom (non-smoking) has dual closets and safe w/ key. My wife liked the large bathroom and amenities. We were lucky with our timing because there were no conventions during our stay at the third week of April. The hotel was only at 60% occupancy, so the service was prompt, relaxed and comfortable. For golf nuts like me, I suggest using the hotel's clubs which are free to President's Club members (Taylor made RAC OS irons and R-5 driver, 3W & 5W and a free sleeve of balls). I prefer the Gold and Emerald courses at the Wailea golf course (******) - $150 per round or use Wailea's Triple Play Pass $375. The Plantation course at Kapalua was closed for repairs. Food at the hotel was very good. Nick's Fishmarket is best ($100 per person with alcohol and tip). Caffe Caio restaurant and Deli / Bakery was good. Buy wine at the Deli and enjoy dinner on your room's balcony at sunset. The Kea Lani breakfast buffet is excellent ($25 per person). The Polo Beach is nice. There is a 3 mile roundtrip beach sidewalk for morning walks. You can cross through the Marriott Hotel and walk directly into the Shops at Wailea. For additional restaurants, I suggest Sarento's (owners of Nick's Fishmarket) at sunset. The waiters were so good they changed our water glasses at mid-meal. Ferraro's at the Four Seasons is better than Spago's. Longhi's, Tommy Bahama's and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse at the Shops at Wailea were all good. The Four Seasons has a small pool and doesn't have the same Hawaiian feel as the Fairmont or the Grand Wailea hotels. Breakfast at the Four Seasons (Granola w/ fruit and an egg white omelet) was $50 with tip. The Grand Wailea hotel is beautiful, but loaded with children and families. The Fairmont has three large pools, including an adult only pool which is good for lap swimming. The Kea Lani is shaped like a big "W" facing the ocean, with moorish, arabesque tones and a Greek island setting appearance. Maui is one of the most popular island resort destinations, and the natives are friendly. Our Fairmont experience was very comfortable and positive. Another nice aspect is the Fairmont's free shuttle service to local restaurants and hotels, so you save on cab fares. To paraphrase a golfer in our foursome who said: "You pay a lot of money to have them blow smoke up your backside," Take a lot of $1 and $5 bills for tipping. We hope these insights will make your trip to the Fairmont Kea Lani as pleasurable as ours! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from the Kea Lani Resort. Our room was beautiful, and the maid service couldn't have been better. All balconies face the ocean, so the view is breathtaking no matter which room you have. Even watched the humpback whales from our lanai one night. We loved Nick's restaurant, but make reservations at the beginning of your trip if you want to eat at a decent time. The only complaint we could see was that there isn't enough help around the pool for bar service. It was very slow. A recommended trip---- the road to Hana. It was breathtaking, and everyone should try it just once. We even got our pictures taken at Charley's in Pa'ia with Willie Nelson. That's where he hangs out. Exciting!! We would definately stay here again. Truly Paradise :)

Reviews.Title: “The Dream Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an experience. I would just like to say if you want an experience of a lifetime stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani , Maui. I can not say enought about the wonderful service , the awesome ladies(Maria and Beth)who work in the Fairmont Gift Shop, the beaches,food, sunsets. Should I go on more. My sister and brother in law have stayed 2 different years at your resort. They loved it enought to go back again.I would definitely recommend it. Thanks for an awesome time Mike and Janie.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for the second part of our honeymoon. It was a beautiful hotel and the experience was somewhat positive. We stayed at the Hyatt on Kauai prior to arriving at the Kea Lani and I was a bit surprised at some of the service issues at the Kea Lani. In all fairness, the resort was very busy and I think that this definitely could have impacted our stay because the resort was highly recommended by many other people. We arrived around 3:30 and our room was not yet available. I think we got in around 4:30 or so. The room was very nice and spacious. We had requested one of the rooms that had already undergone the renovations but unfortunately, that request was not honored. Oh well, it was still nice. We went to Nick's that first night. They were pretty busy. They seated us and brought out our drinks. 2 rounds of drinks later, I had to find someone to see if we could see a menu and order. They were pretty flustered as they thought we had already ordered. (We had been there almost an hour) but it was our honeymoon and we were trying not to be uptight. The food was good though and I thought they had a nice wine selection. When we got back to our room there was a gift there. I opened the card and unfortunately, it was for another couple. When I called the desk they told us to keep it. I let them know that it was actually a personal gift from a person not from the hotel. They said they'd be up to get it but almost 2 hours passed and we wanted to get to bed so I called back and they told me to just leave it in the hall. I hope the other couple got their wedding gift. . . We had a difficult time getting any drinks etc at the pool so be prepared for that if they are busy. We also were unable to get help from the concierge on restaurants. She instead told us that it would be best for us to just drive and look around. We also requested a later check out time by 2 hours and the Fairmont wouldn't allow this. They offered a courtesy room but wouldn't allow us to keep ours for 2 hours longer. . . Overall, I did truly like the hotel. It was very nice and the people were nice. I did however want to write an honest review of what happens when they get busy and are renovating at the same time. I still think even after our experience that most guests will have a fabulous time and really enjoy great service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this hotel and the layout. The rooms are beautifully clean and presented, The pools are great and fun for kids and adults (there is even a seperate adults only pool which is of course, less noisy). If you are considering a villa, do! They are really quite neat. The hotel looks like it has a mediterranean twist with white concrete and rounded edges on the rooftops. The sunset views are stunning from this resort and the beach is even not too bad. If staying in Wailea, I would highly recommend your stay with the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Villas just Okay - Won't return...”
Reviews.Author: seabreezer
Reviews.Content: We were there last week (Spring Break) and I think the difference in opinion about this hotel must have to do with the timing of one's stay. I think the quality of service must decline with the rise in occupancy. It was packed when we were there and we experienced very mediocre service all around, at Nick's, Cafe Ciao, Concierge and pool attendants, especially. Food was mediocre as well and Nick's seems to be overated. These peak times should be an opportunity for a hotel to really shine and provide a wonderful experience but the Fairmont is not yet up to the task. The fitness center needs to be at least three times the size to accomodate the demand and the pools need to be enlarged somehow. Yes, there were enough chairs but not enough shade and it all felt too crowded. Also, considering the competition, (FS) the Fairmont should not be charging for cabanas and beach umbrellas (or boogie boards for that matter). Just build it into the room rate if you have to so there is at least some perceived value. We were so underwhelmed with this hotel in general that we only ate three meals there and had our Spa treatments and most meals at The Four Seasons. On the plus side, we stayed in a villa and it looked to be recently renovated and the beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping also did a nice job. There could have been more kitchen supplies since we do like to cook so that was a little disappointing. There was also something odd about the sofa in the living room - it made us itch when we sat on it! Was it fleas or a chemical in the fabric? We couldn't figure it out but we didn't spend enough time on the sofa to be too worried because the living room TV didn't work very well (!) so we watched TV in the bedroom. On the plus side, the Hawaii Canoe Experience was fabulous and complimentary and it was actually the highlight of our stay. Next time, it's the Four Seasons for us - they know how to treat their guests and have it down to a science.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there!”
Reviews.Author: nancymb
Reviews.Content: We have been home for 3 weeks and still miss it. We were there the first week of March. We stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights and the Four Seasons for 3 nights because based on other reviews we could not decide. THE ROOM. We were clear in our reservations that we wanted a "renovated" room and we got one above the pool with an ocean view. Great. The suite was key since we have a 3 year old. The bathroom was spacious and everything clean. The balcony was big also and had both lounge chairs and a table with chairs. The room had a microwave and a small fridge which can be handy. THE SERVICE. The service was great from check in to departure, from the valet to the pool and restaurants. Friendly staff. When we checked out we forgot my daughter's small blanket, one of those things that can not be replaced and that she sleeps with, and I did panic a bit when I realized it at the Four Seasons. I called and spoke with the housekeeping manager. Within 24 hours, the blanket (clean) was wrapped in paper and brought to our room at the FS with a hand-written note. Very nice touch! THE POOL. Cabanas were nice but did charge a fee. The sides will close though to provide plenty of shade. Overall the pool was not too crowded and we could find a great spot every day. Swim up bar was great also. Slide and kiddie pool good for the little ones. THE BEACH. Nice. They have a hut with staff so we had help setting up our chairs. It is downhill from the pool and hotel and the walk up can seem long if you have little ones to carry or that get tired. NICK's. Wow. We have been to many nice restaurants but the service was unbelieveable! We brought our 3 year old and they had crayons and goldfish crackers delivered within a minute of being seated at a nice table outside. A child at a neighboring table spilled hers on the ground and it was no longer than 15 seconds before it was cleaned up. The service was fast but not rushed. Attentive but not stalking. And the food? Delish. Make sure to save room for the Bananas Foster. BREAKFAST BUFFET. Some complain about prices on Maui. I try not to think about it but this is one break.... small children (I think under 6 but don't quote me) are FREE. Lots of choices and everything good. (Not quite as tasty as the FS) OTHER. We miss it. We are planning to go next March and will stay at the Fairmont the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: VacationBound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for 5 nights (March 21 - 26th), we loved every aspect of this resort! The 840 sq feet rooms were perfect, especially traveling with kids. We stayed in a terrace view room, which is their lowest end, we knew we probably weren't going to get a renovated room and we also expected to face a parking lot. Needless to say, we were very surprised that our view actually faced the Wailea Point Condos (I think they start at $1.5 M), and if we stretched hard around the corner we could see the ocean. The room was very clean, granite countertops, microwave, fridge etc. The bathroom was simply outstanding! Two sinks, private toilet, walk-in wrap around shower and tons of space, made it ideal vacationing with two teenage girls! Our room was not renovated and the only thing that was needing updating was the couch (though the girls said it was a very comfortable sleeper) and the drapes. It was minor though compared to everything else! The service was exceptional, everyone from the bell hop, front desk, pool guys, etc. always went out of their way with a friendly Aloha, etc. The best part were the number of pool chairs, you might not have a prime location, but the Kea Lani had plenty of chairs and the guys at the pool were happy to set them up for you if need be. The beach is a great body surfing or boogey boarding paradise! It's pretty private too! We ate one night at Nicks and two at Cafe Ciao. Both were wonderful with exceptional survice. We have stayed in the past at the Grand Wailea, if I had young kids, I would lean towards it, just because you can't beat the pools! However, there are a ton of kids, especially during spring break. We'll be back to the Kea Lani for just a great overall experience for everyone. It is the little things -- they don't make you check out towels, you can grab as many as you want and get new ones whenever. Very nice not worrying about towel charges etc. You just can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 8 nights with my family. I cannot stress how amazingly wonderful the hotel is. The rooms are very large and very clean. The beds have feather beds on them so you will sleep great. Every room is a suite so you have a HUGE patio, a large sitting room with TV and DVD player. The bathroom is massive with walk-in shower and a nice baththub. The service is also wonderful the chambermaids clean the room 2-3 times a day for bed turn down and towel replacement. The grounds of the hotel are great. There is a huge lagoon pool with swim-up bar and slide for kids to play on. Then there is an adults only pool if you need to get away from the yelling. Plenty of chairs everywhere to sit by the pool or if you want to sit in the grass under the trees. I have to say that for the value it is the best on the island. Rooms way bigger then four seasons and the grounds are WAY better. Also the beach area is huge and the chairs down there are nice too. Nick's fishmarket is good but over-priced. The concierge's are very competent and eager to help. I would stay here again in a heart beat. After reading a review from this website I requested to get the newer renovated rooms and they are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for our honeymoon in August 2004. Upon arrival, we were greeted with Lei and fresh guava juice. It was great. The architecture of the hotel was amazing. I dont agree with other reviews that the Moorish architecture did not fit the hotel. It had dome shaped ceiling and marble floors, which reflected a lot of light. We were upgraded to a corner suite with a wrap around balcony. We were however, disappointed that the room wasnt on a higher floor as we ended up having a view of another hotel. The suite was AMAZING!!! It really makes one feel special. They turned over the room 2X a day and had fresh orchids on the bed. The suite always smelled fresh after they clean it. The maid service was way above average. They were very pleasant and attend to your every whim. The one negative thing about the Kea Lani was their beach. They have a TINY beach area. We got a honeymoon goodie basket courtesy of the marketing director with wine, chocolate covered macaroons, macadamia nuts, brownies, chips, water etc. Overall, the Kea Lani is definitely worth every penny. It is the best hotel in Maui and probably costs the most as well. If I were to go back to Maui, I'd probably want to stay at the Four Seasons or the Grand Wailea since they have a larger beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Super Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were nervous about the "embassy suites" comments in other reviews, as we had rooms in the NON-renovated section. While the room decor was average, it was absolutely reasonable in all cases, and the bathroom seemed far far above what I'd expect in an embassy suite. We had two rooms in the cheaper portion of the hotel, and have ZERO complaints to lodge about the rooms themselves, we would happily return, and we're picky. Walked thru the Grand Wilea (which seemed like "vegas" meets hawaii), and the Four Seasons (which seemed like "country club" meets hawaii) and were extremely satisfied we ended up at the Fairmont. Things, especially food, can get expensive(sandwiches were $10 at the deli, poolside burrito was $18), but with a small fridge and a toaster we bought for $14 at Longs Drugs, we had virtually all of our breakfasts and lunches in our suite and never felt like we were being dumb with our money. Another surprisingly expensive thing were the spa treatments... I didn't expect a bargain, but $190 for an 85 minute massage is, well, aggressive. We had wonderful dinners out, and would strongly recommend the "Pacific Grill" at the Four Seasons (a 15 minute walk) for dinner or brunch. Both were terrific and the service was remarkable. We took a 21 month old baby here who was reasonably well behaved, but the staff was incredible. Recommended. Pools and slides were fun for the kids and parents... True there isn't much shade in the area, but we never rented a cabana or anything and didn't have an unpleasant time at all. Plenty of umbrellas were around. Final notes: Reasonable snorklening is off the north end of the beach. It turns fantastic as you swim north towards the four seasons. Don't be afraid to explore the outer reef a bit, you'll find turtles! Concierge desk at the hotel was fantastically helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani on our honeymoon in June 2004. I was just daydreaming about our trip when I remembered that I never wrote a review. Before booking the trip, I looked at several reviews on this site (most of which were good, but some that were scathing). And after staying there, I'm not sure how anyone could have posted a bad review. I loved every minute. The staff was friendly and helpful (especially the activities person who helped us book our bike trip and luau). Our suite was spacious and the view was spectacular. It was so nice to have a refrigerator so we could grab a quick yogurt and fruit before heading out for the day and to have a bottle of wine chilling for our return. My only gripe was having to pay extra to rent a beach umbrella daily. Considering the room rates, I don't think that's too much to ask. But, as soon as a waitress came around with eucalyptus-scented cold towels and free fresh pineapple, I forgot all about the umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there!”
Reviews.Author: stumpie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani from January 28-31st........too short of a time. Our check in person, Yumi, was so sweet and managed to get us a corner front room on the fourth floor with a wrap around balcony since we were celebrating our 40th anniversary. We could sit on the balcony and watch the whales. Took a complimentary canoe ride one day right off the beach out front. Had a great time at the swim up bar (Polo Bar) with Dane and all the people we met. Enjoyed being served fresh pineapple at the pool also. The breakfast buffet was extensive and tasty. We ate at Nick's Fishmarket the night of our anniversary, and they gave us a wonderful spot. Service and food were outstanding. After dinner we returned to our room to find a bottle of champagne compliments of Dane and staff. We also received a beautiful picture frame. Turndown bedtime service every night included goodies. We felt so pampered. This is a very special place that we will never forget. Try it if you go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindylynn3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kea Lani for 8 days/7 nights and it was PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani is tops”
Reviews.Author: kbuttler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week's stay at the Fairmont and must say that we were very pleased with our choice. I've spent countless hours on this website and believe the Fairmont deserves all of the praise it's been showered with on this board. (I'm still trying to understand how one could not have a good time at this hotel). We've traveled all around the world and stayed in several 5 star resorts, this was one of the best! A couple of recommendations. Go for a room with a full ocean view. We started with a partial view and asked for an upgrade. Yes, it's more money but well worth it. We could see the entire ocean, the island of Molokini and humpback whales from our balcony. Be sure to get a room on the 5th or 6th floors. The pools are great and slide is a blast. The beach is very nice and try renting a boogie board from the poolside desk...lots of fun. Before you go, sign up for the Fairmont President's club (-------). There's no cost to sign up and you get frequent flyer miles for your stay. I was able to rent a brand new set of Taylor Made clubs at no cost for being a Presiden't club member. We were also given a complmentary welcoming basket and free newspaper every day...again no charge to sign up...no brainer, right? We did the breakfast package and thought it was well worth it. We saved Nick's for our last night on the island and it was definitely the best we had in Maui. Overall, great experience. Yes, expensive...but this is Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We began our trip up at the Hyatt Regency in Kaanapali, but only lasted one day before coming down to the Fairmont. Hyatt was OK, but so crowded. Hardly any room to move. Fairmont was great. The room could have used some new carpet, but we could not find much else to complain about. The grounds were incredible. From the beach to the pools, we were happy just hanging around the hotel. Food was a bit pricey, but expect similar at any resort in the area. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Kea Lani Hotel and we loved everything about it. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a friendly worker who offered us cool towels and guava juice. The entire staff was extremely friendly and commited to making out stay as enjoyable as possible. The room was gorgeous, with a sitting area seperate from the bedroom and was decorated cleanly and tastefully. The bathroom was exquisite, and the balcony view only enhanced the experience. One of the hotel's restaurants, Nick's, had excellent service and food, but seemed a bit overpriced. The hotel has a delicious breakfast every morning, consisting of foods ranging from smoked salmon, to made to order omlettes and everything in between. The architecture and landscape of the hotel is gorgeous, palm trees and exotic plants cover the hotel's property and make the multiple swimming pools (particularly the the swim-up bar!) seem like an island oasis of their own. If you get a chance, take a quick scuba diving lesson and head out to sea with an instructor, you may find yourself swimming with ocean life like I was. I cannot think of one thing that would ever deter me from staying at the Kea Lani a second time, and would recommond this hotel to travelers of all types.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: kanrok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful week at the Fairmont. We had a corner suite on the 7th floor. We saw whales spouting directly off our balcony. They appeared the same time each afternoon. The staff at the Fairmont was friendly and very competent. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We ate dinner one night at Nick's. The service was unbelievable, but the meal was fair. I highy recommend Mama's Fishhouse near the airport. It was the best fish I've ever had, bar none. Had the macadamia encrusted crabcakes and the Opakapaka in white wine and garlic. Fantastic. I would return to Maui solely for the chance to eat there again. It was that good. The adult pool was outstanding. We never had trouble finding chairs at this pool. We did get there relatively early though. A cabana by the adult pool is a waste. It is a necessity at the upper pool, where the slide is. There is very little shade there, and if you bring the kids you can relax and keep an eye on them at the same time. Definitely get a cabana at the beach one day. Very relaxing. Try to get the last one on the north side of the beach. It is much quieter there. The only downside was that it rained for two days. The hotel is magnificent. We will definitely be back. If you are worried that you made the wrong choice by reserving a room here, rest easy. You will have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Maui Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having travelled a fair amount, I would have to say the Kea Lani was very classy, from the decor to the attention. It began with a lei greeting by a pleasant and warm staff member and continued on through our effortless departure. The valet staff RAN to get our car. The open air atmosphere was wonderful, the Arabian decor only added to the sense of being in another world. The grounds were immaculate. A nice touch were the approach to the hotel, complete with burning torches. I will forever carry that image as it was wonderful to return daily to our room. It is pricey to be sure, but worth it when compared to what you get for less at most places. It definitely ranks in the top two with places we've travelled thus far.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the fairmont. Two nights with a poolside suite and two nights with a moderate suite. There was a 230 dollar difference in price per night and possibly not worth paying extra unless your kids are older and you want them to be able have immediate access to pool outside your room. Check in was nice with leis for adults and candy leis for the kids. Fresh guava juice is offered to you as well. Valet is very very helpful and nice. The poolside room was decorated very nicely and has beautiful linens. It is more noisy when you have this type of room so keep this in mind if you would like to stay poolside. The moderate room is just as big but in the older section which not as nicely decorated. Since it is all white the stains tended to show and there was more wear and tear but it was much more peaceful and quiet there which was very nice. The breakfast buffet is worth the 25 dollars price but you must be hungry. My girls loved the miso soup japanese bar they had. My favorite place was the caffe ciao that had amazing pastries, snacks and little gifts. Try the ice cream there and you won't be disappointed. The pool area was nice. They have three pools. One pool is for adults. One is the general pool for everyone and very large. The last pool is smaller and in an upper lagoon that has a small slide that goes into the general pool. They have a swim up bar at this pool. My only complaint is the cabanas are 50 dollars to rent per day and there isn't much shade unless you rent one. Bring a hat in case you don't like being in the sun all day long. Lunch at the POLO GRILLE was very nice and overlooks the ocean. If you want a big room 840 sq feet and have kids this is a very nice hotel. Dinner at NICKS was just wonderful. The food was excellent and service was unbeatable. We were hesistant to bring our kids 9 and 4 but they enjoyed it as much as we did. Not as expensive as I thought it would be. Try the fish or scallops. The sunset was gorgeous as we had our dinner and this is great for a special occasion... The service here is very good and the property is beautiful and expansive. It is not the FS but I am very biased. Overall a nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Chiefmo78
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Kea Lani as recommended from a couple that stayed there on their honeymoon. We decided to copy and do the same. The resort wasn't too far from the airport and let me tell you we were exhausted from the flight. The grounds are magnificent and the staff made us feel right at home. We did get a deluxe ocean view suite and let me tell you it is a little pricey but extremely worth it. We had a panoramic view of the ocean, Molokini and the grounds, wow was it amazing. We loved our suite and the bathroom is beyond big. We didn't check out any other resorts in South Maui so we have nothing to compare it to but it made me proud to pull in everyday. The only complaints we had was the South Maui area, it is great but very pricey and a lot of the Maui activities take place in Lahina which is a good 30+ away from the resort. We did go the week after Christmas and this seemed to be the busiest week on the island. When we didn't have a couple nights of reservations the 4 concierges helped tremendously to get us in to some great restaurants. We were told to sign up for the Fairmont President's Club online before we left and there are some great perks for a free club membership, we are so glad we signed up. We did find that a lot of the travelers staying at the hotel were very snotty and we felt more inclined to deal with the staff then any of the visitors, but it could be the week we chose to travel brought different travelers to the resort. Another bummer was that since it was a busy week the free buffet wasn't included so for two to enjoy it, it was around $60. I would strongly recommend people to stay at the Kea Lani but other weeks then the Christmas holiday. We loved the beautiful grounds, the helpful staff and the extraordinary room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got married at the kea lani over the christmas holiday and stayed for 5 nights. The staff was amazingly helpful and polite. They bent over backwards to get my parents an early check in, even though the hotel was booked to capacity. The staff in the wedding department did a wonderful job- every thing was even better than I had expected. The only thing that I could complain about was other rude guests. My husband and I did enjoy laughing at some of them, but other times it actually created really uncomfortable atmosphere when certain guests would start to throw temper tantrums and berate the staff. The hotel staff actually had to call security to remove a guest and his family from the area we had reserved for our wedding! Then later the same guests made rude comments to my husband and I. Overall, our stay was great. Loved the large suites, large balconies, 3 pools, Nick's Fishmarket, and the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “One of the World's Great Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just finished our fourth bi-annual Christmas at the Kea Lani and it remains a great hotel. The rooms (all suites) have been redecorated and are beautifully done. The facilities are superb--family and adult only pools, a small water slide, fantastic beach, game room for the kids and beautiful public spaces. The staff is what sets the Kea Lani apart; they consistently go the extra mile to make the guest experience special. While I sensed a small slippage in quality from my last stay in 2002, it was only a small change, and the level of quality and service is still amazingly high. I wouldn't stay anywhere else on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very average holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: rbwinston1
Reviews.Content: We (family of four - kids 11 and 13) stayed at the Kea Lani over Christmas holidays. Based on all the positive reviews, I really expected more given the price. Good - the rooms are large and comfortable for families. Its one of the few places that you get a full two room suite, full balcony which was great for in room dining - and large two sink bathroom. I'm not sure whether it was a renovated room or not (see next) Average - our room was clean but dingy, as was the rest of the hotel. Looked like it hadn't been freshened up with paint, carpet, etc in years. The bed was uncomfortable and the sheets paper thin. Hallways seemed superficially cleaned, but in need of paint and a real cleaning job. Food was a challenge and amazingly there are really no good casual evening options. If you want to hang out by the pool in the evening, forget it. Ciao deli has breakfast items - but they are very slow and disorganized, which is quite amazing. Even on non-busy mornings, it took a long time to get simple service of coffee and pasty. We had room service two nights - first night was good, second night the food was cold, congealed and late (took well over an hour and 15 minutes), it had been promised in 45 minutes or less. Bad - we found the staff to be surely, unfriendly and generally not inviting or welcoming. Best staff was at the valet, worst at the pool. Concierge treatment was the worst of any hotel I've been at (and I travel a lot). The pool/beach staff spent most of their time talking amongst themselves and pushing each other around. If you've been to the Four Seasons (pick one), the difference is night and day. Finally the spa and workout room are a dirty, outdated disaster. Go next door to Four Seasons or better to Grand Wailea which has amazing facilities. Overall, hard to recommend the Kea Lani and we would not stay again. Four Seasons is very cool - good choice for couples. Grand Wailea is good for kids, a bit Disney-ish but a huge very crowded property. For the price, I'd consider elsewhere unless you really want the larger format rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Kea Lani for our honeymoon mid-December. After much debate between it and the Four Seasons, we opted for the Kea Lani due to it being all-suite. We appreciated the space and were glad we did. When we checked in, I asked for a renovated suite at the suggestion of someone on this site, and we were given a suite in the back overlooking the parking lot. I am not knocking the suggestion to ask for a renovated room - the decor was very different and very nice, but when the manager offered us rooms with better views, we opted for a non-renovated, all white suite with views of the resort and ocean. It was a vast improvement, and we were appreciative of the upgrade. We ended up sitting on our lanai every night enjoying cocktails and the view, something we would not have done looking at the cars. :) We bought the romance package and thought it was a fantastic deal! The candlelight dinner was a highlight and spectacular. I don't want to give away all the secrets of it - you'll be pleasantly surprised yourself. The spa treatment was great, but the spa is not all that decadent compared to some others. If you are big spa people, this one is a bit on the small side. Again, the treatment was wonderful, however. We booked a snorkel trip with Blue Water Rafting, and it was perfect. What a great guide, and we saw many whales. One even swam right under the boat. It was awesome. I highly recommend that outfit. Very nice people. If you choose the Kea Lani for your honeymoon, you will definitely NOT be disappointed. The service was excellent, the pools beautiful (although the one with the slide was closed for renovation), and the resort itself immaculate. And mid-December seems like a great time. The place was empty. No problem getting a chair at the adult pool, restaurants empty!! Have a great time in Maui. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic adventurous trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 days at the Kean Lani over Thanksgiving. Me, spouse, and 2 pre-teen daughters. As per everyone elses comments, the hotel was great. Great service from everyone we made contact with. Of course for this price you expect that, but they delivered. Pool areas are great. Adult pool stays very quiet, other 2 pools are alive with both adults and kids. Water slide is very cool, but does take some technique to get a really fast ride(arch your back and go down on only the heels of your feet and your shoulder blades !). Many adult men having way too much fun competiting to see who get get the fastest ride, and yet it's tame enough young kids can enjoy it also. My 12 year old old ended up with slide burns on her shoulder blasdes from go down the slide so many times. There's a nice swim up bar, but as with everything else in Wailea, prices are a little high. We did splurge and get my wife a drink in an actual pineapple, she loved that. The kids could get smoothies, they really got a kick out of sitting at the bar. We had a garden veiw room, NOT a newly renovated one, but still fine. All beds were comfortable, and everything was clean. Maids took very good care of us. Make sure you join Fairmont Presidents Club so you get a newspaper delivered to you door every morning. Our view was simple but great, very well groomed garden area, and fountains in the background. Slept with windows open several nights, no bugs at all while we were there. (you would think in such a tropical area mosquitos would be out of control, but didn't see a single one the whole trip). They offer free valet parking, but it's not really free since you are supposed to tip the Valets. I'm a cheapskate, so I parked for myself most the time. Parking spots can be hard to come by (I think Thanksgiving week is one of there busiest of the year though), but I felt it was very convenient always knowing where the car was and being able to come and go without interacting with anyone if I chose not to. As for activities right at the hotel, if you have young kids (or are young at heart yourself), the koi feeding every morning is kind of fun to do once. Good video opportunity. They also offer a free intro Scuba lesson in the pool, and it was one of my daughters biggest highlights. Just be prepared that they give you about a 30 minute scuba tutorial before letting you put on the gear and get in the pool, but still well worth it if you've never scuba'd before. Then you have the opportunity to do guided dives with the instructors on the reefs right off the beach (not free anymore though). You should also make sure to reserve a spot ahead of time for the complimentary Canoe trip experience. It's not that it's something you can't miss, but it is fun and different, and takes only 30-40 minutes (and did I say I was a cheapskate, and it's free !). If they come across Turtles, they let you jump out of the canoe and swim with them for a while. Speaking of Turtles, if you snorkel out on the north reef on the hotel beach, you may come across a few big ones, my daughter and I saw 2 of them, and got pretty close up and personal. Very cool to see that right on the beach of the hotel. As for the beach, nice and clean, water is of course very warm. In a former life I was an avid body surfer, but the waves break way to close to shore for good body surfing. Applies to all beaches I saw in Wailea. Good for some boogie boarding, but not surfing.
