Waters are very safe for swimming and snorkeling, and you'd be surprised how little you need to swim out to see some cool fish and formations. I've heard people say the beach(Polo Beach) is small, but plenty of room for sunning and sand castle building, so I'm not sure what peoples concerns were. If you need a bigger beach for a broader view, drive a few minutes south to Big Beach, same quality/features as Polo beach, just much bigger. OK, enough on the hotel related stuff, let's talk about the fun stuff. If you are the adventurous type, a great snorkel trip is one with a group called "Blue Water Rafting", take the 5.5 hour trip. It's not your normal everyday snorkel trip. Instead of just going to Molokini like most the other snorkel tours, they go south down the Maui coast. They pick you up at the Kihei boat ramp(only a few minutes way from the Kea Lani). They take you south down the coast, onceyou get past Wailea the going gets really rough. But you get to see sea caves and rock formations you will not see on other trips, and in fact they even back you in to one of the sea caves, definately a highlight. Be prepared they aren't kidding about not taking this trip if you have a bad back/neck or are pregnant, the first part of the trip is extrmmely rough going. But my 12 year old was thrilled with it, she thought it was just like riding a roller coasteron the ocean. It was fun for me also. But one women actually started having a panic attic, and if you are susceptible to seasickness, this is NOT the trip for you. Otherwise it will be some of the best money you'll spend on your whole trip. After going south down the coast, they also do a free float at Molokini, which allows you to see different things that what you see with the bigger boats that anchor in Molokini. During this trip we saw breaching whales, 2 different types of Sea Turtles (Green and HawksBill), octopus, and bottlenose dolphins. The 2nd snorkel trip we took was one of the tamer ones, with the Pacific Whale Foundation, which leaves out of Maalea harbor. Really big boat, lot's of inside covered areas for those like my elderly in-laws, but lots of good views outside too. And they teach a lot about what you see, even a special kid oriented session near the end of the trip. Cheapest trip for the kids, and on this trip we saw a ton of spinner dolphins on the Lanai coast and big sea turtles right outside the Harbor. Another trip I'd highly recommend. As for places to eat, Maui is very expensive for food and drink, shouldn't be a surprise to anyone. Wailea is even on the high side for Maui. Make sure you stop by a grocery store, or Walmart, for some cheap snacks, sodas, alcohol, etc you can keep in your hotel room. The best restaurant we went to was Nicks. Just incredible service, wonderful food, great presentation. Very, very expensive, but even for a cheapskate like me, was worth it for a one evening splurge. Leave the kids in the room though, that's what we did. HINT: bring your own DVD's from home to keep the kids busy, all rooms have a DVD player. The Kea Lani morning buffet is fantastic, but you'll never eat your money's worth unless you sit and chow for hours. We splurged on it once, and I ate a ton of smoked salmon. The kids and wife loved it too, but just couldn't pack away enough food to make it worth it for them. We also ate at several places in Kihei, and Pizza Hut Express will deliver to the hotel. There is an Outback Steakhouse near theSafeway, and the prices aren't much different than in the mainland US, so a good place to go when you want a known quantity for a reasonable price. Other places to try: Antonios for simple italian at reasonable prices. It's basic italian, small place next to Longs Drugstore, but good. We also thought Longhi's in "Shops at Wailea" was pretty good, but contruction in front of it means you no longer have a ocean view. Other restaurants in that same location looked good, just didn't have time to try them all out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly people, free valet parking, and great golf nearby. The concierge dept. is excellent helping to provide info for side trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Kea Lani during T'giving week for our honeymoon. In retrospect T'giving week wasn't the best time as there were families and children everywhere, at the Fairmont, Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, everywhere (we're not anti-child but the amount of kids was overwhelming, and although the majority were very well behaved, it only takes a few to make a ruckus) but overall we had a great time. The adult pool area was fantastic and the grounds in general were superb, the grass was like a golfcourse and the common areas were very well designed. The children's pool looked great and the kids and parents there seemed happy, and the waterslide was great even for adults. Wait staff was courteous and for the most part expedient and there was little problem finding a good spot to lounge at any time of the day. We're not big "ocean" people but the beach area was quaint, if not a bit small but if its too small for your tastes there are many other beaches nearby. As for restaurants/room service/bar, we weren't overly impressed with Nick's. Perhaps we didn't order the right dishes but we've had much better in NY. Service was great and atmosphere was pretty good (not much of a breeze so dining was a little stuffy). Room service was quick and satisfactory. The lobby bar was ok, one night they didn't have food service but it had a great view of the grounds/ocean and drinks were good. We were very happy with the room given some of the earlier reviews I've read. They didn't have a king bed available our first night so they gave us a $100 credit for putting up with a double and for having to switch the next day, but that didn't bother us too much. The room was spacious and the bed (king) was very good, better than I thought it would be. The bathroom was large and luxurious, although the first room we were in didn't have very hot water in the shower. It wasn't overly decorated but it was certainly nice. The lanai was large and although we didn't have an ocean view (we were rarely in the room) was nice to have. Check in/check out/valet was all good, and although we weren't given towels and juice at check in we were supplied canned juice later and a frame for our honeymoon (yeah, they could have done more but we're not picky). Overall it was a great experience in a great location in Maui. Lots of honeymooners and lots of families, but as mentioned above the adult pool did a fine job for privacy purposes. Now, if we were to go back it would be tough to decide between the Kea Lani and Four Seasons (really can't go wrong--the Grand Wailea is great for families but we're not ready for that yet). The Four Seasons likely offers better services (we had a fantastic dinner there one night) and is on Wailea beach but the pool area was surprisingly extremely cramped. If you can have Four Seasons service on the Kea Lani grounds you'd have the perfect hotel, but then I probably couldn't afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing,fun family experience....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had checked out trip adviser several times before making our decision on what resort to stay at in Maui. We decided on the Fairmont not only because of the reviews, but also because we have stayed at other Fairmont properties in the past. We planned our trip around the Thanksgiving holiday and weren't sure what we would be walking into with it being a holiday week, etc,etc.. When we arrived we were greeted with a fresh lei and juice. Our room wasn't ready at the moment but the guys at the valet (who by the way where so very nice and informative) put our belongings in a area that where accessible for us to change our clothes and also a secure spot. We drove over to Safeway and got a few grocery's that we wanted and by the time we returned our room was ready. Our room was a renovated one and it was really,really nice. The bathrooms where big and clean with several bath towels,washcloths and handtowels enough for 4 people. Light beach robes where hanging in the bedroom as well as slippers . We decided to eat at Cafe Ciao our fist night and it was pretty good. Our waitress was very plesant and after inqiring about there bean soup, she compe'd us a bowl. The pizza was ok, we like a really crisp crust and it was a little soft, but the host made up for that with his outgoing personality . I had booked prior to our trip the canoe ride the resort offers 3 times only in the A.M . That was a really fun morning. The guys that take you out tell you about the history of the canoe. They take you out and chat old Hawaiian songs... then let you hop out of the canoe and snorkel for about 15-20 minutes. The whole trip lasted about 45 minutes and like I said the kids had a ball. We rented a cabana for both the ocean and the pool. The pool cabana was bigger with more privacy but kind of noisy. The beach cabanas were smaller but really quiet depending on where you wanted to be. If your going to hang at the pool ask for #13,it overlooks the pool and the ocean. We also went to Nick's for dinner. My kids got room service (which they were really happy with and the movies which run from $9-12 per movie depending on how new they were) Anywhoo.... Nick's was nice. I believe our total dinner bill ran about $240.00. I had the Filet and it was good ,my husband had a fresh fish that was very good. I'm not a person who likes alot of waiters running around me and we did had about 3. It was a bit much when I ordered fresh berries and Grand Marnier and a waiter did a spoon-spinnig routine that made me dizzy....(just kidding) One of the waiters I talked to told me people really like that. To be honest we have traveled many places and thats the first time I got that kind of entertainment. But It was fun and we had a good time. We went to the Rennaisance Laui and the Fairmont drove us there which is great,they will drive you to any resorts in the immediate area . That was a fun Laui. Our kids our 11 and 13 , we got in line early and got a close seat, the food belive or not was really good. I would say that the best thing at the Fairmont was the customer service. Anything, (within reason) is attainable at this resort. I needed plastic cups with lids for the room, they brought them to me in less then 10 minutes as well as the S.F Chronicle every A.M. Everyone at this resort seems to calm and friendly. The staff knew us by name and I have to have to the valet ,who always put that darn top on our jeep for us! As far as resaurents, try Sansei for sushi (fun sushi bar, buy Hide(aka bob )a beer he will turn you on to some really interesting dishes. Go toThe Maui Prince Hotel, Ivan isa secret sushi chief that will blow you away . We met a few locals and ordered the "Hurricane Ivan" , it will put you back some bucks ($17.00 a roll) but it's not only out of this world for taste but a piece of art to look at. He is really incredible . In closing ,the Wailea area is pricey but you know that going in. The Fairmont has a nice "quiet busy" feeling. You know there's people there but the grounds are laid out do you really don't hear the noise,your kids won't get lost and you will really have a relaxing wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fam27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Fairmont Kea Lani (Nov 8th to Nov 15th) and had a wonderful time. We arrived at the hotel late at night and were greeted with cold towels, drinks and lei's for both adult and kids. We had requested a renovated room and were not disappointed. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was huge and gorgeous. The grounds of the hotel were amazing and beautiful. Everyone who works at the hotel are extremely nice and very helpful. The tour desk helped us arrange the best tour of Maui (considering that we were travelling with a 3 yr old and 5 yr old). Overall, the hotel is expensive but worth every penny for the quality of rooms, pool and service. The service at Nick's Fish Market restaurant was unbelievable. Would recommend this resort to anyone travelling to Maui who is willing to pay the extra money. Only downside, rooms get very cold with the air conditioning--you have to keep moving the temp. Other issue is the expensive food on the resort-very expensive to eat dinner on the resort but you will find that everything is expensive in Maui. We would go back to the resort and Maui anytime.

Reviews.Title: “It was unbelievably perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani for 7 days in October 2004 for our 25'th wedding anniversary. Our flight from Houston was very long and tiring and included a glitch in the Honolulu airport that delayed our arrival in Maui by several hours. When we FINALLY arrived at the Kea Lani we were very tired, frustrated and frazzled. The Staff at check-in were exremely pleasant and greeted us with leis, a cool glass of fresh tropical fruit juice and a cool wash rag. How WONDERFUL it was to be pampered after such a long, frustrating trip. During our entire stay, we found the staff to be EXTREMELY pleasant and always quick to greet you with a friendly "Aloha" and end every interaction with "Maholo" (thank you.) The staff was probably 3/4 "Hawaiian native" to 1/4 "non-native." Our room was the larger suite - the "SIGNATURE KILOHANA KING SUITE" which features more square feet and a VERY larg wrap-around lanai (patio). Our first day at the hotel, we went snorkeling - and immediately saw many tropical fish - right in front of the hotel's beach. The folks that said the water was unclear, must have been in the water where the waves break - which will always be less clear. If you go out a little - and especially by the lava rock - the water is very clear and full of life (I have the underwater pictures to prove it). We also enjoyed the pools of the Kea Lani - the pool area was kept perfectly clean and the grounds are well kept and manicured. There is a nice walkway that likns the Kea Lani to other nearby hotels (4-Seasons, Grand Wailea - and others). We spent some time at those hotels as well - and NEVER regretted chosing the Kea Lani. The rooms were MUCH bigger, the bathrooms are HUGE and you get much more for your dollar. Is it expensive? Yes - but this IS Maui, where EVERYTHING is expensive - but we feel we got a lot for our money. There are a couple of shopping centers nearby where you can stock up on inexpensive gifts - or food and liquor for your refrigerator. The restaurants are good. We had the breakfast included in our package and took advantage of it (except for a couple of days when we had to leave early for touring). The deli is a great place to grab a sandwich - and Nick's Fishmarket was a first class restaurant where we enjoyed a wonderful dinner. But here is a little tip which we enjoyed MUCH more. Our suite was overlooking the ocean and every evening we had beautiful sunsets. On our last night, I ordered room service from Nick's. We fixed our own drinks from our liquor stash in the refrigerator. Room service came up and fixed one of the tables on our balcony (we had 3) with a linen tablecloth. They brought up silverware, dishes, a wonderful salad and steak dinner. My wife and I sipped our drinks - ate a FANTASTIC dinner by candlelight and watched the most beautiful sunset we had ever seen - while the ocean waves soothingly crashed below and the gentle Hawaiian breezes blew across us. I had the sliding glass doors open to the suite and we listened to Hawaiian music playing over the speakers of the stereo (which is included with the room.) It was the most perfect dinner we have had in our many years together. We actually enjoyed it MUCH more than our dinner at Nick's... and it cost less. As we sat there and contemplated what a great week it had been - the moon crossed the sky - reflecting on the water below. (we also have gorgeous pictures of the sunset and moon on the water) This was truly heaven and we both agreed that this trip would likely NEVER be topped (and we have travelled a LOT.) The following morning, we packed up - and nearly cried at having to leave the Fairmont Kea Lani. Any other questions or wish to see pictures - feel free to email.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Fairmont for our honeymoon from October 20-28. The grounds were beautiful and clean. The staff was gracious and always professional. We had the breakfast buffet included in our plan and was astounded at the quality of food and the incredibly wide selection that was offered. Although children are welcome, there is an adult pool available for those that do not wish to interact with them. We would highly recommend the Fairmont for honeymooners. Our room was large and very clean. Although we did not have the most expensive room in the hotel, we still had beautiful view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our honeymoon at the Kea Lani. Decided on the Fairmont property after much research on this website. Lei greeting was fun and the cold towels & POG juice were refreshing, especially after the long flight from the east coast. We had booked a deluxe ocean view suite but was initially placed in a non-renovated room with a wonderful view of a smaller condo and a construction site. The furniture was very outdated and worn down. There was also a pungent mildew odor behind the bed that actually infiltrated the pillows. When we notified the staff in the morning, they were quick to move us into the renovated section of the hotel. Unclear as to why we were even placed in the original suite when a renovated room was available. Anyhow, the renovated room was much better. The room was tastefully furnished without any foul odors. Overall, a delightful suite with a much better view of the pool and the ocean. When booking, make sure you ask for the renovated rooms. Don't purchase the breakfast plan - although tasty with a decent selection, its still the same selection. Would defintely check out the 4 seasons before making my final decision.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of our honeymoon here and it was delightful. We took advantage of the breakfast plan and were very pleased, it was fabulous. We were originally put in a room in the section of the hotel that has not yet been renovated. This room would have been fine in a four-star hotel yet was completely unacceptable four paying over $400 a night. The bellman told me that those rooms had not been touched for 15 years! The room we were moved to was very nice, and the attention to detail was impressive. My husband and I are in our mid-twenties and we did notice other guests recieving a better level of service than we did. I think this was due to our age and that was frustrating. We were debating whether to stay here or the Four Seasons, and went here because of friends reccommendations. The Four Seasons is more sophisticated but when we were there in the day it did seem very crowded. The Fairmont was full when we were there and we still felt like we had plenty of privacy and room. There is also an adults-only pool at the Fairmont, which the Four Seasons does not have. The food at the Four Seasons is much better, but also right next door. My advice for Maui would be five nights (fifth night free) at the Fairmont and five at the Ritz in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned, 0ct 22-28”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our vacation and after all the time I spend going to this site to plan my vacation I thought it would only be appropriate to post a traveler review. I spent countless hours trying to decide between the Fairmont, the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. They all seemed to get excellent reviews but for different reasons. They also seemed to have very different atmoshperes and that was important to my wife and I. We eventually decided on the Fairmont and here are some of the good and bad of the stay. -Upon arrival we did use the valet. They were very nice and professional. Since the service is free, except for the tipping its a great benny. -When we checked in we were informed that the King size bed that we requested wasn't available until tomorrow. I did request a newly renovated room and that was available but only with 2 full beds. The front desk advised that a king size bed in the catagory that we requested would be available the next day. We said that we would look at the room when it was available. The room wasn't newly renovated and had a downgraded view. We stayed in the 1st room, despite the 2 fulls. Definately ask for the newly renovated rooms. They are considerably better! -Bugs. We hunted and killed several cockroachs in the room during our 6 nights. Too many for such a short period of time. The hotel was clean and so was the room. Not too sure why they were around but they were. -The pool is OK. Nothing to get excited about. The pool staff is above average. Towels were plentiful. No real problem finding open seats. If you have kids I would consider the Grand Wailea. We walked through the grounds at the Grand Wailea and there is no comparison to the Fairmont. The kids will be excited and want to spend most of their day at the pool at the Grand Wailea, not so at the Fairmont. -The hotel bar is pretty quiet. Not much going on and not fun. -One bit of advice. If you plan to spend your time in Lahina/Ka anapali area (shopping/restaurants/nightlife). You might want to consider staying in that area. It's a good 45 minute drive from the Wailea area. That's with no traffic, with traffic look for an hour plus. There was always traffic when we were driving around. It's pretty heavy and the speed limits are on average 40 mph. Slow going. Overall, the hotel is good. The rooms (newly renovated) are very nice and the pool is nice but your paying alot for it. Too much if you ask me. I have no problem paying for a hotel is worth it but this one, in my opinion, is overpriced and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's All Good”
Reviews.Author: maryfw77
Reviews.Content: I'm VERY happy with the Kea Lani. We stayed from October 9-14th with our 4 year old daughter. Although the hallway floor to our room was covered to protect it while the wing across from us was being renovated, we didn't come across anything else that the prior reviewer had. We were on the 2nd floor and didn't see any bugs on any trays left outside rooms. Our room was beautiful and we requested a renovated room upon check-in and received it. Even though we had a partial view room, My husband and I were thrilled to see ocean and the beautiful grounds and swimming pool from our balcony. Maybe because we arrived in the morning, but we had a nice welcome with POG (Passion/Orange/Guava) Juice, lei greeting. Although we had to wait for our room, we were prepared and changed into bathing suits and hung out at the pool until the front desk called us on our cell phone, letting us know our room was ready. We had the breakfast plan and was quite please with the selection and quality of the food each morning. Food at the hotel restaurants were good and we knew it was going to be expensive, but we helped our budget by shopping for snacks, etc at Safeway. All rooms come with a refrigerator & microwave which was nice since my daughter still likes to drink her milk warm. The nightly torch lighting ceremony was beautiful, the ocean was warm and calm and the beach was uncrowded! Because of the off-season, there wasn't much activity planned for kids, but my daughter had a lot of fun feeding the koi fish most mornings. I do have to say that the person in charge of bringing out the koi food at 9 wasn't very prompt and one day didn't show at all, a little annoying, but hey.. there's the fun waterslide. Most every employee we encountered asked us how our vacation was going and one of the managers, Todd, who seemed to be everywhere, was very nice and remembered our names, etc.. My daughter had a great time, the room suite was quiet (even though we were next to the ice machine) and private. I personally liked the picture frame we got for our anniversary and it was fun having a present to open one night. My husband raved about his massage at the spa kea lani. The Kea Lani has many comforts and we hope to make it back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “I must be missing something!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, am I missing something? Everybody raved about this place. I just returned from a trip Oct. 13-18th. Arrived at the hotel about 8:30pm, valet no where to be found, finally appeared, very nice person. Went to check in, no lei greeting, no fruit juice or cold towels. Check-in guy pleasant but informed us no upgrades available, hotel sold out (really, hum, could have made reservations for a army of 20 and still had no problem!, whatever). Bellman showed us to our room via a very stark baron institutional looking hallway. Notice dirty tile hallways, the same pieces of scraps were never vacuumed the whole time we were there!! People would leave their room service plates outside their doors and ants and bugs would be crawling all over them. Service doors in bad need of paint. I'm sorry, maybe the upper floors are nicer/cleaner, very disappointed!! Rooms are nice and spacious and bathrooms are very luxurious. The pool is nice, however, you have zero view of the ocean from the adult pool. Had to sit on a grassy hill to know I was by the beach. I normally wouldn't complain about a vacation in paradise but I think people should be aware before forking over $600+ dollars a night. Everything else about our stay in Maui was wonderful, it is truly a must visit place. Just would spend my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani in May for our Honeymoon and I have to say, the place was top notch. As you pull up, the consierge are there greeting you with a smile, and as you walk in they greet you with a lei and POG juice (definately a refresher after a 11 hr flight). Check in was easy and fast and the room was absolutely breathtaking. You do have to get to the pool early to get a chair but its not too difficult if you arrive a little later. Staff was friendly and fresh pineapple by the pool every so often was an added touch. Jacuzzi at night was great with a bottle of wine..no one is really around and we were able to have the jacuzzi to ourselves mostly every night (added bonus for honeymooners) Food is pricy but not too bad. We ate dinner at Nick's one night and in asking for my meat well done and it came back a little undercooked, our waiter in asking us how dinner was, didnt even let me respond, took my food away, had the chef cook it more and gave us two complementary desserts because they were embarrassed. I love the fact that they were keeping there well known reputation. We had dinner at Spago in the Four Seasons next door which didnt impress me much. Food was ok, not the greatest. The Grand wailea was pretty nice when we ate at humahumas. All in all , the Fairmont is the way to go if planning a trip to Maui. Will definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing memories at The Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research trying to figure out which resort would be perfect for our Honeymoon, I decided on The Fairmont Kea Lani. And we were thoroughly pleased with my decision. We were there from 9/13-9/24. The staff was so friendly and pleasant to work with. Both the hotel and the grounds were immaculate. We were in heaven from the moment we stepped onto the resort grounds to the day we left. The housekeeping was great and we loved the little added touches like flowers on the bed and a congrats gift for our wedding. That was so sweet. The pools are awesome although there was maintenance being done to the top pool for the first week of our visit, so we weren't able to use it then. But that was no big deal to us. The beach was very nice altough I think with the prices you pay to stay at this resort, the beach cabana's should be included. (They were, I believe $30 per day.) Nick's Fishmarket was one of the best seafood restaurants on the island, ( Mama's being our favorite). The service was unbelievable. Cafe Caio was very good also and we did enjoy the breakfast buffet quite a few mornings (very expensive, $25per person for breakfast). The conceige desk was very helpful with anything we needed...a cooler for the road to Hana, or a CD to narrate it. They were fabulous. All in all, we highly recommend this resort and we had such a wonderful experience to last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overrated/poor value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were overpriced and not on par with other Fairmont resorts - not a luxury room at all. We were in a renovated room that looked like something you would expect at a Hilton. The decor was terrible. The furniture looked cheap. The bathroom was the nicest part but there wasn't even a whirlpool tub. The robes were cheap - not nice terrycloth robes. We too had bugs in our room. the service was good. Nick's fishmarket was great. The management wasn't that great...the manager actually admitted to us that 20% of their guests had the same opinion we did and complained. He offered to call the 4 Seasons and see if they had any availability for us!!! What manager would do that. After much argueing about how unhappy we were I got a complimentary spa treatment (the spa is lame) and we got dinner at Cafe Ciao on the hotel. The room that is featured online at their website says it's a standard suite, but we found out it's their extra special suite...very misleading! For 600 bucks a night it's totally overpriced. I expected much more! We were on our honeymoon and people gave us very nice complimentary things everywhere we went. We had come from the Hilton on the Big island which was half the price and much nicer suites plus we got breakfast and snacks included! The Hilton sent us a bottle of Moet champagne and cheese and fruit tray since we were honeymooners. You know what you get at the Fairmont - a lame picture frame! We will stay at the Four Seasons next time - the rooms there are nicer and the service is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon on Maui after rough start on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For almost a year before our honeymoon I had been reading reviews on this website. I chose the Kea Lani, partially because of the good things people had to say about it. We were at the Fairmont from Sept. 18-24 after spending 4 horrible nights at the Waikiki Parc on Oahu. The Fairmont was wonderful! The grounds are immaculate, the food is fabulous, and the staff are extremely helpful and courteous. We stayed in an oceanview suite after a complimentary upgrade from mountainview, and were simply thrilled by the accomodations and the gorgeous view. We received a bottle of champagne and picture frame in our suite the first night we arrived, and enjoyed the champage on the balcony. (One hint, we went into Kihei and bought juices, rum,etc. and mixed our own drinks at night, drinks at the resort are very pricy, but make sure you try a lava flow, you wont be dissapointed!! ) The best view in the resort was from our balcony and we tried to catch the sunset and torch lighting each night we were there. The 3 pools are all very well maintained and we could always find a lounge any time of day. Usually cabanas would be reserved, but we would rather be in the sun. The beach was nice, we snorkled near the hotel and saw beautiful blue and yellow fish only about 8 ft out into the ocean. We highly recommend the road to Hana (buy the cd to play while you drive, it tells you were the waterfall are. You will need to hike to see some, so dont wear sandals like I did!), and Haleakala at sunrise, what a view!!! We checked out the four seasons and Grand Wailea while we were there and were sure we made the right choice honeymooning at the Kea Lani. I really hope we get the chance to go back someday, It was an amazing trip!! Ps. Take a word of advice, if your honeymooning and want to see paradise, Do Not stay on Waikiki beach and avoid Honolulu. Its a beautiful, clean city, but is a city and is very loud, very early. The people are also much nicer on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: SpiroPa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Kea Lani for our Honeymoon over Labor Day week. We stayed in a Mountain Garden View suite. The room was nice, but was in need of renovations, which they are in the process of doing to the whole resort. Overall service was very good. Employees of the Kea Lani were friendly and helpful in giving you advice on sight seeing around Maui. We were given a nice picture frame marriage gift, a very nice gesture. The beach front is nice, though it is small. You can find nicer beaches in other parts of Maui. The pool was very nice, three pools all together and it was never crowded. They even offered cooled towels, but never water at the poolside as mentioned in previous reviews. We never had any problems getting a chair by the pool. I think this was a combination of kids back in school and the renovations going on which meant less people there. As expected things are very expensive in Maui, but that is expected. Had dinner one night at the Caffe Ciao, the food was good. In addition Caffe Ciao Deli is a nice place for a snack, but expensive. We ate at Nick's Fish Market one night. The food was good, but felt the waiters were on edge, being overly cautious not to make a mistake. This made the dining experience a little uncomfortable. We also ate at Spago's located next door at the Four Season's. It was excellent, everything from the food to the service. In addition I would highly recommend Vinoâ€™s located in Kapalua, great italian food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation at the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a great Maui vacation at the Fairmont Kea Lani. Stayed 8 nights with my wife and baby daughter. Requested and received a renovated suite with ocean view. Very, very nice. Huge bathroom, king bed, wraparound lanai. The suite also had a entertainment system equipped with VCR, CD, and DVD players, as well as a full stereo system. Impressive. The Kea Lani is a fabulous hotel. Wonderful grounds, and a very accomodating and helpful staff. We spent a lot of time researching Wailea resorts before selecting the Kea Lani over the Four Seasons. Key factor was numerous reviews that described the Kea Lani as more child-friendly. I think this is a very fair assessment. The hotel staff always made sure our needs were met (i.e. crib in room, extra items for baby care), and they really doted on our daughter. Plus, there were lots of other families, which made us feel even more comfortable. One thing we really enjoyed was the breakfast plan at the Kea Lani restaurant. Very good value for full buffet breakfast every morning. Normal price is $25 per person, but we prepaid as part of our vacation at approximately $17 per person. The buffet is extensive and scrumptious! Well worth the expense, especially compared to ordering ala carte or room service. Make sure to enjoy the passion orange guava juice (POG) because we've been unable to locate the delicious nectar on the mainland. All in all, we loved our stay and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: SBATustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 year-old stayed at the Kea Lani the week after Labor Day. We had a really good time--although not as relaxing as it was before the baby was born. It was fairly quiet. Most of the kids on the water slide were over 21. There were lots of chairs everywhere. So, I guess if you don't want to be with the rug rats, go to Maui when they go back to school. The hotel was not perfect but it was pretty nice. If you ask my 2 year-old if he like the Kea Lani, I'm sure he would say he did. He loved the baby pool, the beach and the the spaghetti from Caffe Ciao. My son is allergic to dairy, nuts and eggs. We communicated this to the manager of Ciao and he personally came to our suite to talk to us and show us the pasta they would use for his meal. When his spaghetti was cooked, Frank, the manager, personally came back with the room service personnel and made sure everything was as we requested. Now, we thought that was special. It's nerve-racking to travel with a kid with allergies. We had dinner at Nick's one night and the waiter was so absorbed in memorizing the menu. I told him about my son's allergies and he brought my son's fish swimming in butter. Guess we didn't have fun there. Breakfast was included in our package so we didn't feel the pain of losing another chunk of our money every morning. The deluxe ocean view suite was sweet. We asked the reception staff to show us the villas. She showed us #15. Yuck! The tile looks old, the carpet old. The sofa looked like many wet behinds have sat on it. The ocean view should be called "Tip of the ocean view". Not worth the $1900. Liked our suite better. If you're facing the beach, some of the villas on the right side were being renovated. So if you are rolling in it and want a villa make sure yours is newly renovated. There's a walking/jogging path that's a 3-mile round trip along the beach. This is worth doing every day(okay, so I didn't do it everyday)--especially if you know that it will be very likely you will sin on the the dinner table. The views are awesome--even my little rug rat loved it. Don't go crazy about the prices in this hotel or anywhere in Maui. You know it was expensive. Have a great time. Give yourself a break. If you go to Makena beach--south of the hotel, be careful under the trees. The small pieces of the branches that fall have thorns. On the way to Makena there are some taco vendors. We ate some good tacos from one of them. Wailea is totally cool. It's beautiful and clean. Makena is quite and natural. Kihei is a kick back town. If you like seafood or Japanese, go to Sansei. We went there for Yellowtail cheek and great sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: bistecca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Maui. Stayed at the Ritz Carlton and the Kea Lani. Some hybrid of the two would have been perfect. (As a point of reference, on previous trips to HI we stayed at the Princeville resort, the Royal Hawaiian, the Lodge at Koele, and Kona Village.) Problem with the Kea Lani was with the check-in experience. Arrived, impressed by valet, lobby, and reception. My wife had told the reservation person we were in Hawaii to celebrate our anniversary. This information was never conveyed to staff. (At Ritz we received much love.) Anyway, still high on the check-in experience we came crashing down to earth when we saw the room--a mountain view that was actually a parking lot view. Room looked worn and dingy. So depressing. We complained and were led to another room, this one in the renovated section of the resort, which was nice, but what a journey. What was the guy thinking? We saw the bowels of the resort, construction workers ripping up carpet; the cold towels, lei greeting, and juice were a very distant memory. This new room was much better than the first, but was a double, not the king we had requested--at least we were spared the parking lot view. Why couldn't we have been offered this room in the first place. (We changed to another room the next day, which was very nice--if they had offered this room at the start all would have been great.) Ate at Nick's; had braced for ridiculous prices and Nick exceeded expectations. We had a very pleasant evening--excellent service, good food, but wildly overpriced. All in all, service at the resort was very good, bathroom in room is great, the beach is lovely, grounds are beautiful. If you have read this far, let me say this, the Ritz strived to make us feel special, the Kea Lani was terrific, less the awkward beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to the Kea Lani over Labor Day. I wanted to post my review as I have referred to this site often for opinions, etc. The resort is fabulous, plain and simple. The service is outstanding from the valet to the housekeeping staff. The grounds are beautiful. The suites are spacious and very ideal for families with children. I traveled with my 2 young children and the suite was perfect. The bathrooms are huge! Housekeeping does an excellent job and "services" your room twice daily......turn down service in the evening includes replenishing of everything in the suite once again. Our check in service was friendly and efficient. My husband and I both received leis and our children received candy leis. We were not offered fresh juice or cool towels as I have seen mentioned in these reviews. We NEVER had a problem finding a chair poolside. Perhaps the resort was not as busy over Labor Day as it is other times of the year. There is an ample supply of lounges all over the resort. If you can't find one poolside, there are some located a few steps away all over the lawn. We were never offered fresh pineapple, cool towels or water poolside. They have cucumber/lemon water stations set up at various points around the pools. I have read where people find the kids to be numerous here at the resort. There is an adult pool and area that is very serene and quiet where you can relax and not be "bothered" by the noise of children enjoying themselves on vacation. The activity pool doesn't compare to the Grand Wailea, but the one slide was fun. If you are looking for a more relaxed pool area and non water park atmosphere, this is it. Rentals poolside were ridiculous....$12 for an intertube per day! Everything is pricey, but it's Hawaii and to be expected. Cafe Ciao was excellent for dinner. Great food and service. We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning. The food is average and can be found at any resort in Wailea. It's mostly convenience. The birds at that particular restaurant are terrible. They will steal your food right in front of you! We did not eat at Nick's as we had 2 children with us. It was busy every evening and the people we met had good things to say about it. If you are staying for more than a few days, I recommend stopping at Safeway in Kihei to stock up on essentials for the morning or light lunch as it is cheaper than dropping $50 on the same breakfast and lunch food every day. I would highly recommend this resort to ANYONE.....honeymooners or families. You won't be disappointed. You get what you pay for. I will be returning in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for the family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Kea Lani. My husband and I usually stay at the Four Seasons when we visit Maui each year. But with two young children, we were looking for a hotel that would better suit our needs. The Kea Lani was perfect. Not as frenetic or massive as the "disney-esque" Grand Wailea, yet more to do that the more sedate Four Seasons.... the Kea Lani was the perfect mix of service, luxury and fun for the family. The suites were spacious (make sure to request a renovated suite) with a fold out queen size sleeper sofa in the living room. We were able to put my 2 year old in the sleeper sofa and had plenty of room for the crib for our infant. The suites have mini kitchens (microwave ovens, small fridge, sink) and entertainment systems with TV, DVD/CD players. Each floor has complimentary washer/dryers (4 machines per floor... you can buy detergent at the gift shop). The bathrooms are huge... large soaking tub, large walk-in shower. The pool area was great. There is a lovely, quiet adult pool (no one under 18 allowed) and the two-level family pool. There is a water slide...great fun for kids (mostly 3 and older) and the upper pool has a swim up bar. The lower pool has a basketball net for water play and a separate wading pool for the littlest ones. Be warned, when we were there at the end of August, most of the chaise lounges by umbrellas were spoken for by 6:30AM. There are cabanas that rent for $50 a day (they supply you with as much chilled bottle water as you want) but you would have to reserve well in advance of your stay. The pool hut has all sorts of float toys for rent. The beach is lovely and the staff will set you up with chaises and umbrellas (rented at $9 an hour). They also have sand toys for the kids that they will lend you. The restaurants were a mixed bag. The Beach Grill was okay, Nick's Fish Market was excellent and Ciao Tratorria was just okay. They do have a deli which is great for getting good deli sandwiches. There were activities every day for the kids (They have a kids club for children 5 and older for a fee). Every afternoon they set up a big bounce on the lawn. And they would have a juggler/magic show, face painting, hula lessons.... all free. Every morning at 9AM they allow the children to help feed the koi fish. And every evening, the guy who lit all the torches was followed around by a group of children... it looked like the Pied Piper....adorable.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend over, and over again....”
Reviews.Author: Muneca6270
Reviews.Content: I went to the Kea Lani 5 years ago and it was absolutely beautiful. I went back recently and I was pleased to see that nothing had changed...It was as lovely as the first time. The property is spectacular, as was the service. I have recommended the Kea Lani to just about everyone I know who wants to vacation in Maui and also honeymooners....I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, didn't love it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I stayed at the Kea-Lani from 8/17/2004-8/24/2004 for our honeymoon. The check in was nice, we didn't have to wait and the rooms were beautiful. We had a garden view room and it was fine for us. The resort itself is beautiful and the adult pool is key. There were so many kids at the resort, had they not had the adult pool it would have been tough. We ate at Nick's the first night there and didn't like it. It was probably the worst place we ate during our stay. We did love Soprrento's, the sister restaurant, located 2 miles from the resort.We had a late reservation and felt we were being rushed and the wait staff was very cautious, almost scared to make a mistake. I recommend you go to breakfast elsewhere. There are numerous spots to go that are cheaper and the food is better, unless you want to spend $50.00 for the same breakfast buffet every morning. As for the pool, better get there early to claim a seat or you will be stuck monitoring the pool for chairs all day. Take advantage of the resort car service. The service will take you to any place in Wailia, just in case you want to have some drinks for dinner. Not much of a night life there, but very relaxing. We stayed in oahu at the Royal Hawaian before going to Maui and we felt the staff at the Royal Hawian was much nicer to us. Some of the staff at the consigiere at the Fairmount was more business like compared to the much friendlier staff at the Royal Hawian. We also went to eat at the Four Seasons one night (right next door to the Fairmont) and the wait staff there was great. All in all the Fairmont was a great place but if you don't like kids it's probably not a honeymoon spot for you. Would we go back there? Probably, but would like to try the Four Seasons on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Super Excellent Review”
Reviews.Author: LisaPerlman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon at the Fairmont Kea Lani. In fact, we hadn't planned on it, but we were unhappy with a neighboring hotel we had booked and switched. On a days notice we got a garden view (faceing the back of the hotel) but it didn't matter (really it didn't), it was all beautiful. The suite was big and light. We had a romantic dinner served to us on our private pateo. We also enjoyed the large tub big enough for two. I love that part of their turn down service is leaving a card on your pillow with local facts and history about the island. The service was beyond excellent. If anyone working at this hotel has a bad day, you'll never know it! We felt like V.I.P.s. There are three pools, one exclusivly for adults, which was nice when we wanted quiet time, but we also couldn't resist the water slide at the other pool! The hotel has great pool service and they bring around pineapple slices to everyone. The thing about this side of the island is that it goes to sleep early. Very quiet, which can be nice. Don't think you can get dinner too far after 9:00pm. Plan accordingly or you will have to drive up to Lahaina if you really want a night life. The only bad part is that we eventually had to leave. We look forward to returning for our two year anniversary (because it could take us that long to save up to go back - - pricey but the expense is worth the experience).

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sacarmic
Reviews.Content: WOW, what can I say about this place. We went their for our honeymoon. This place is 1st class all the way. It is beatiful, the staff is super friendly, they don't nickel & dime you. When we go back to Maui, we won't even think about staying anywhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: loritSantaBarbara_CA
Reviews.Content: Wow! Where do I begin? We had an incredible vacation experience at the Fairmont Kea Lani! During our stay, we walked over to the Grand Wailea, and if you are looking for an amusement park atmosphere, stay there! If you are looking for a nice compliment for adults and children alike, stay at the Kea Lani! The service and staff were amazing, I really got the feeling these people truly enjoy what they do...even housekeeping always had a smile on their face! Everything we could possibly want or need was available to us. After every excursion or return to our hotel, we were always greeted back warmly by the valet attendants. We went the week of August 10th and I'm sure they were booked to capacity, but it honestly never felt overcrowded. The grounds are spacious and gorgeous! We never had a problem getting lounge chairs by the pool, however finding one with an umbrella posed a bit of a challenge. Most lounge chairs were "reserved" with people's belongings by 6:00 am. But, here's a tip, people cannot "reserve" lounge chairs and go off to shower, have breakfast or generally take their time coming to the pool all awhile leaving their belongings on lounge chairs. If they are away for more then 1/2 hour, their spots are up for grabs. Ask a pool attendant to come and remove their belongings and they will keep them in the kiosk...and deal with them when they come to claim their spot. We did this a couple of times. The cabanas are available for $50.00, but you have to rent these months in advance! We ate at Nick's one night and it was very, very good...also very expensive. My husband and I enjoyed a nice, romantic dinner there one evening while our kids ate pizza at Caffe Ciao. We also enjoyed massages at the Kea Lani Spa...another wonderful experience, one of the best spas I've ever been to. Our room was perfect, especially with two teenage kids, it never felt too small or cramped...a suite is the ideal way to go. We picked up some juice, water and beer and kept them in our fridge. The bathroom was gorgeous! All of us were able to get ready with plenty of room to spare! Two sinks, huge soaking tub, marble shower and a separate toilet with it's own door...it was great! We relied heavily on our Maui Revealed book for restaurants as well as picking a Luau and snorkeling trip...I highly recommend it! I would definitely come back to the Kea Lani without any hesitation! This is a first class resort...you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Family Trip - mostly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 8/14-21 at the Kei Lani... And didn't want to go home. Here's what worked and didn't... Check-in Horrible experience. Was offered a room 3 floors below our reservation at no discount... or a 2 hour wait. We took the wait which turned into 4. Pool Great family pool - ridiculous policy of reserving your poolside chair with a towel - all chairs gone by 6:30am... 30 minute vacancy rule is a farce. To avoid this rent your cabana well in advance (months) Beach Rocked. Great for the kids, mellow for the adults. Decent boogie boarding and snorkeling... not world class - but good family vacation stuff. Bring sun-screen with you as the $25 tube is more than a rip-off. Food Nick's was decent - waitstaff was creepy (seemed very anxious... scared of screwing up?). Ciao cafe is bad - service and food. Ciao deli is THE way to go for cheaper breakfast and lunch - very good. Polo Beach Grill (at the pool) is good but expensive. Best food is Sansei and Roy's in Keihei, and Mama's across the island. Room Deluxe Ocean View - worth every penny... make sure to enjoy dinner or breakfast on the lanai - beautiful views. Hana Not good for my kids - 4/7 - bored to tears... Though beautiful in every way... Be warned the road all the way around is still VERY rough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but missing Hawaiian Spirit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I feel obliged to add my impressions to tripadvisor since I have received wonderful advice on these pages in the past. The Fairmont is indeed a beautiful hotel and luxurious as any available. We managed to get a really nice room although if you are partial to a good view from the room, you should confirm that your room is not facing the parking lot. I think it is designated as a garden side or standard room. Don't be fooled, it should be labeled as a parking lot suite. The suite itself was impressive and satisfactory. I especially liked the network internet service which is also available via the TV console if you don't have a computer. Definitely five star. However since this is my 4 trip to Maui over a period of 9 years, I have to say this is also a very bland hotel if you are interested in experiencing the Polynesian spirit. I felt this hotel could have been located in any Caribbean, Southern California or Cabo San Lucas luxury resort as it could have been Hawaii. Outside of the Leis and juice at check-in, from the dÃ©cor right down to the personnel could have been present at either of those places without seeming out of place. The service was very busy although competent but not very friendly and in some cases downright cautious and stressful. I often felt I was imposing if I had a request.

Reviews.Title: “You will ADORE this place!”
Reviews.Author: Wingnut57
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10-day stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani and we couldn't have been more pleased with it. As soon as we drove up, someone from valet parking (which is FREE) greeted us by name. When we went to check in someone else greeted us with leis and cold juice and even an offer of a cool towel. We were rather early so our room was not ready and even when it was, they had it wrong so we had to wait longer than usual, but still, the staff were nothing but accommodating. We had trouble with the air conditioning in our room and they were so quick to fix the problem it was amazing - even offered to give us another room while they repaired it. We chose not to move and they offered to foot the bill for our breakfast at the Kea Lani buffet the next morning for our inconvenience. It was fabulous! The folks at the Kea Lani treat you like royalty - literally. It is a very beautiful and magical place and they truly cater to everyone from what I could tell. Families, honeymooners and people like us who were celebrating our 26th anniversary. They gave us a lovely frame as a memento of our stay. Be warned though: everything is pricey. My son got a cold and I went to the store in the hotel and bought him some Vicks vaporub and Dayquil and it cost me $24.00 just for those two items! Restaurants are pricey too but everything n HI is overpriced. It is still a fantastic place to come and relax. Just be prepared to overpay or pack what you might need in the way of little necessities to avoid those costly last minute things. The grounds are gorgeous. The staff is fantastic. The hotel itself is just too beautiful to describe. If you want to be pampered, come to the Kea Lani. It's not really near too much but that can be a GOOD thing if you just want to stay out of the busy places. I highly recommend it. I would definitely go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: AJSG
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights (July 19-24) and we just loved the place. From the moment that you arrive (free valet parking, lei & drink) the staff make you feel special. I have been to many luxury hotels but this one is truly special. The beach and pools are lovely and you can always find a chair. The restaurants are a little pricey, and having 2 hungry teenagers it was good that there was a Safeway to stock up on snacks. I plan on returning to the Fairmont one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of our Best Trips!”
Reviews.Author: lvblackie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, everyone was so gracious and helpful. When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade to a room with an ocean view. It was well worth the extra dollars, the sunset view was amazing. The hotel itself is very beautiful with a great pool area and terrific beach area. We would go to the beach and then go to the pool. We had no problem getting a chair, if we couldn't find one, we asked for assistance and someone was able to help us. Food is pricey everywhere on the island. We went to the recommended restaurants outside of the hotel. Beware! You are paying for atmosphere. Since a lot of the restaurants were recommended by the big hotels, we found them to be extremely overpriced, quite noisy with the food being just okay and met its expectations. We did however, have one of the nicest meals at the Kea Lani at Caffe Ciao. Our table overlooked the adult pool area and the grounds of the hotel and there was a gentleman playing guitar. The price for the food was moderate but we really enjoyed the italian cuisine and it was very peaceful and relaxing with the music playing in the background. It was a great evening at our hotel. The staff at the Kea Lani were amazing with the exception of the activities desk. I didn't quite care for the staff there. Most of the time they were on the phone and they didn't even acknowledge you sitting in front of them. They would acknowledge you only when they were ready. So we booked actitivities through other resources and had no problem. But again, everyone else throughout the hotel were friendly, gracious, and very receptive to any needs we may have had. The spa facilities are just okay. On the women's side there are two showers, a cold shower and steam room. Not much in the facilites area. However, the massage I had was probably one of the best massages that I have ever had. So despite what the facilities lack, the masseur and masseuse will make up for it. We are extremely glad we stayed at the Kea Lani and we recommend it highly. We appreciate the special touches that the staff at the Kea Lani provided for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful resort! We were married on the resort at their lovely gazebo and it was absolutely memorable. Their resort's service was impeccable, every room is a suite, and the attention the staff gives to details is something that made our stay truly enjoyable. If anyone is thinking of staying here then let me be the first to say that you can't go wrong by picking this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Westin Resort on July 1st and then stayed at the Kea Lani for our honeymoon. We had the most memorable time. The rooms were so amazing....very spacious and beautiful. We had an incredible view of the pool and ocean. We had the "romance package" which included champagne and flower petals in the room, a couples massage that was awesome, and a private dinner in the cabana by the pool that was very romantic. We loved the adult pool: the waitstaff came by frequently and we had no problems getting a chair even though it was 4th of July weekend. Britney Spears was staying at the hotel at the time and we figured if it was good enough for her, definitely good enough for us! Nick's was by far our favorite restaurant on the island....immaculant service and delicious food. We cannot wait to celebrate our one year anniversary next year at this same resort! We definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britsabroadSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon here and it really is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We have chosen luxury hotels around the world and this equals, if not surpasses, all of them. At first we thought we should stay in the Four Seasons next door, but we definitely made the right decision staying here. The rooms are huge!!!! The hotel caters for families and couples with both an adults only and kids pool and a beautiful beach and walking path. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place we have ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the Kea Lani. We had stayed in Kaanapali some years ago and wanted to try another 5 star place as well as trying Wailea. What a great decision we made. The service was top notch. The complete ocean view room was amazing with the great views and cleanliness. Food was expensive - but expected. Nick's Fishmarket was fantastic as was the food and service. I would recommend Ferraro's in the 4 Seasons as another fantastic place to eat !! Try to get a table up front near the beach and sunset !! Nga , Dane and Bianca made our stay nice with their fantastic service. Secnted towels near the adult pool , sliced pineapples and poolside service - GREAT !! The Guava juice and towel upon check in was also neat. I would recommend the Kea Lani to anyone - they would not be disappointed.... It was really difficult to check out...

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable, unlike anyother hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: first class hotel that is great for families and singles. Food is expensive, but so is hawaii. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but bring your own food.”
Reviews.Author: gatrgrl0015
Reviews.Content: This resort was so much better than the Four Season down the street. We walked over and looked at the Four Season's room and resort to see if we want to stay there. We were not impress at all with the Four Season. Fairmont has sooo much more. Come on...If BRITNEY SPEARS rent a villa there you know you are staying at the best place in Maui. No lie.. However we all do not make Britney Spears type of Salary so beware of the overprice food. You can drive into town and get something to bring into your suite. Every room at the Fairmont has a wonderful suite. The stuffs was very helpful and friendly. We stayed there for our honeymoon and can't wait to go back. The most beautiful sunset you will ever see from the beach or from your balcony. Try Nick's Seafood its the best of the best seafood in Maui. The Perk is Nick's is right on the property. Make sure you make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: london02
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my family at the Fairmont Kea Lani for the first time on July 9 for 3 nights. The lobby may not have been as grand as the Grand Wailea might have been, but it was still grand. Lovely flora and fauna everywhere. We were greeted with a fresh lei, cold juice and a cold wash cloth which was much appreciated as it was quite warm and humid. We received adjoining rooms without having to fight for them which was a plus. We were in deluxe oceanview rooms which were huge, 2 seperate rooms really. They were absolutely stunning, beautiful white couches, nice armoir, TV, minibar, wet bar, armchair, table and floor lamp. All very tasteful. The 2nd room had a king, armoir, TV etc.. The bathrooms were marble, very large, 2 pedestal sinks, seperate toilet room, bathtub, seperate marble shower and vanity area. The view was amazing, ask for the 6th floor. There was a pretty balcony with a nice round table, chairs and chaise lounge that spanned the distance of both living room and bedroom, again not your average balcony. Service by the pool was great and the beach help went above and beyond the call of duty for me on several occasions. Beach was fabulous, perfect for bodysurfing. All in all a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did the first leg of our honeymoon in Kauai for 6 nights, and then stayed at the Kea Lani for 8 nights. When we first arrived, we were definitely underwhelmed, mainly because we had just been staying at the Hyatt in Kauai which is sprawling and gorgeous. The Kea Lani really didn't compare to the Hyatt. After we got settled in, it started to grow on us. The Kea Lani is a very pretty hotel, with a very nice indoor/outdoor lobby and three pools including an adult pool (an adult pool is a must for honeymooners). We had considered staying at the Four Seasons so we walked over there to see what the hype was about (a lot of great reviews on trip advisor). When we got there, we were so happy we had not stayed there. Their pool area is a joke. It is so small and crowded, it really feels like a cruise ship and not a hotel. There was one tiny pool full of adults and children, and that was it. If we had stayed at the Four Seasons, I don't think we would have wanted to spend much time at the pool. Overall, we loved our stay at the Kea Lani, and from what I saw, it is without question the nicest hotel on Maui. My wife and I really loved Kauai more because we loved the Hyatt, plus it had a much more magical feeling than Maui. We think it's because basically all of the employees at the Hyatt were native Hawaiians, while there are a lot of Americans working in Maui. It just didn't have the same "aloha" feel. It might sound silly, but it makes a huge difference. Also, Kauai is more beautiful. There are more touristy activities in Maui, though. After reading all of the great reviews on trip advisor about Nick's Fish Market, we at there, and both of our meals were terrible. Everything was over-spiced and tasted bad. The service was very bad, also, but I am much less concerned with service than I am with how my food tastes. It's one of those restaurants that tried so hard to be "fancy" and they use all kinds of exotic spices and ingredients, etc., but they forgot to make the food taste good. We had dinner nearby at Spago at the Four Seasons, and the food was awesome. Overall, I would highly recommend the Kea Lani to anyone, and I would definitely stay there again if I went back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: BB8689
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Fairmont. My only regret is we didn't stay for at lesast 7 nights. We had two suites on the north wing, third floor. They were not ocean views but from the balacony there was a nice view of the ocean and the landscaped grounds. Both rooms were very nice, no mildew smells, no stains, very clean, largest bath rooms I have seen in a hotel. The service was superb. We were there during a very busy July 4th weekend and never had a problem with the valet parking service. The activities desk really knew their stuff and the deep-sea fishing charter and snorkeling charter they recommended were great. The dining experience at Nick's was probably the best in my 49 years. The filet mignon was probably the best I ever had and the Mahi-Mahi was first rate also. Service was unsurpassed. If you are at all budget conscious be aware it is not cheap and the soft drink refills are not free. The pools were great and the beach was fun also. We had two 18 year old boys and a 14 year old boy with us. They had a great time. I think the 18 year olds would have preferred a more lively social scene so perhaps something in the Lahaina area would have suited them more. This was our best vacation experience ever. Anyone who isn't satisfied with this hotel has extremely high standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Resort”
Reviews.Author: Globus2222
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 night stay at the Kea Lani. The service is outstanding,suites are luxurious, breakfast buffet is par exellance.Its removed from the tourist traps like Lahaina and Kaanapali. Luz at the front desk and Tod and Gerrard at the bell desk go out of the way with tips on what to see etc Road to Hana And Halakalea are a must do. Also take a hiking tour,one can really immerse themselves in the surroundings(go with hike maui). I would go back to kea lani in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: 3104KAH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Kea Lani. We were lucky to get the 5th night free and Sunnyside Breakfast packages. We are not buffet people, but the daily breakfasts exceeded our expectations. Also exceeding our expectations was the high level of service we received at the resort (we also had high expectations going into it). There are lots of kids at the resort (as there were at The Four Seasons & Grand Wailea too). If you are looking for some quiet time, I recommend planning to be at the adult pool. The only negative that I found with the resort was having to get up early to "claim" a spot at the resort pools (adult included). They fill up by 10:15 every day. The grounds are beautiful and suites are amazing. They even offer a free Outrigger canoe trip in the mornings. Book yourself early if you can. Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alive&Kicking
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent 6 nights/7 days @ the Fairmont Kea Lani and we ENJOYED ourselves immensely and wld recommend it to anyone wishing to go to Maui. The hotel staff were First-Class, esp. Pat and Michelle @ the Concierge desk. The food was good at ALL of the restaurants. Our room was spectacular w/lovely waterviews. The Bell Desk did an outstanding job at all times! Maid service was good. The spa was very relaxing. I cld go on and on! Highly recommended. Also, check out Mama's Fish House on the drive to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, ok service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights with the fifth night free for my one year anniversary at the Fairmont Kea Lani. After staying at the Halekulani in Honululu, our customer service expectations were a little high, and so we were disappointed not to get the same service. The Fairmont is a beautiful hotel and the suites are great! We had an oceanview with a terrific view of the pool, garden, and ocean. The a/c was a little loud, but that's the only complaint about the room. We loved the suite and the beautiful property, but we probally won't go back because after spdning so much money you expect more, perhaps our standards are too high for service, but again the Halekulani spoiled it for everyone. We loved Maui and we will go back, but we'll do a vacation rental and spend the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kimjLombardIL
Reviews.Content: Can't get any better than this. While expensive for lodging and food, this hotel is beautiful and the service provided by everyone was fantastic. Met so many wonderful people who have left the mainland for a slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I had a fabulous honeymoon at the Kea Lani! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The woman that handled our baggage gave us great recommendations for restaurants and surfing lessons- all of which we thoroughly enjoyed. We also enjoyed having a "suite" instead of one bedroom, especially since we were there for the whole week. The pools are beautiful and the snorkeling off the beach was the best we saw. We highly recommend this hotel and our new favorite restaurant- Sansei in Kihei. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: TexasGma
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, with attentive staff and luxurious surroundings. Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. The marbled baths are quite elegant. We stayed 5 nights in an Ocean View suite. Our suite had the added benefit of seeing the adjacent islands, so our view was spectacular. We also overlooked the pool and grounds, which is very nice as well. After reading some negative reviews posted here I searched for something but I can't honestly think of anything, except maybe the price. However, all of Maui is expensive, and you get what you pay for. I would highly recommend this hotel, and will stay here if we return to Maui. Five stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum”
Reviews.Author: Rkyman
Reviews.Content: After much reserach, I set up my 5 night honeymoon at the Fairmont and was underwhelmed by the Fairmont as a honeymoon destination. While the grounds are beautiful, the resort is oriented towards kids and conferences, and the spa is only average. ROOM: Our room was on the north wing overlooked the kid's pool...which also has a bar serving lunch and drinks to the party crowd. Also, the rooms on that wing do not get a sunset view. To get that, we would have had to go to the middle or south wings next to the construction. It was nice room, though. SPA: I went to the Fairmont spa to get a tandem oceanside massage, but they only had a tent set next to the adult pool....fine if you want to get a massage with your new wife and 100 of your best friends. We ended up going to the Four Seasons spa instead. They have beautiful private huts next to the ocean, so you can enjoy the sound of wind, birds, and the surf. The spa there is fantastic and beautiful. The waiting room there offers dried Hawaiian fruits, tea, water, etc. as you relax waiting for your treatment. RESTAURANT: We also went to Nicks because we had heard so much about it. We ordered oysters on the half shell as an appetizer. I tasted a funky one. I mentioned it to my wife, and she said one of her oysters tasted bad, too. We didn't get too discouraged, laughed it off, hoping not to get sick. Then she found a bug in her dinner salad. At that point, we called the head waiter, who did nothing except keep asking us if our meal was ok through the rest of the night. Even average restaurants will offer a free desert or coffee to make up for bad quality, but they barely apologized, and I left a very substandard tip. The guy with the pepper mill did a nice job, though, and could really twirl it. If you're looking for a honeymoon, stay at the Four Seasons. If you want a family vacation or a fun conference site, stay at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Just paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Aniaset
Reviews.Content: We went to the Fairmont for our honeymoon from May 19-25. Months beforehand we debated on which hotel to stay at. We are extremely please with our decision. The first night we arrived we were placed in a supposed oceanview suite. As we looked out of the window, we saw the ocean beyond the parking lot and construction trucks. The bellhop immediately suggested to call the front desk for a better room. Although there were no better rooms available for that first night, we were upgraded the next day to a deluxe oceanview suite for a small fee. Our next room was beautiful with stunning views. Our stay was perfect. All the restaurants in the resort were wonderful. The pools were not overcrowded and very relaxing. The beach was small but I was able to complete my scuba certification there. Very good spot for snorkeling and scuba. The staff was very helpful and gracious. The made us feel like royalty. We also checked out the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons. Although they were beautiful as well, they were not as elegant and relaxing as the Fairmont. We are already planning to come back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection! (at a price)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a late entry, but I had to chime in. My husband and I spent 12 glorious nights at Kea Lani in November for our honeymoon and we've been planning our return trip since then. Although expensive, we got a good deal since it was not high season and got 2 free nights during our stay. When we got there, we were offered an upgrade for a fee, but it was late so we decided to sleep on it. Our first room was nice, but with absolutely no view. The next morning, we asked for the upgrade, packed up our bags and spent the day on the beach. We got to our new room with our bags there and with an absolutely gorgeous room - large living area, 2 lanais, huge bathroom and bedroom. Our room was above the restaurant and main pool (not kids pool) and we had a great view of the ocean every morning and night. The staff was a delight - the concierges made all of our reservations at the restaurants we read about in review books. The beach was small, but beautiful and never crowded. The chair guy knew us by the second day and as soon as we'd walk up to the beach, he would set up chairs for us in our usual spot. Food: Breakfast was included in our package so we had the buffet each morning. Very good! Nick's was awesome. We had one full dinner there, then one light dinner (the Maui Wowi salad and caramel souffle are unbeatable) at the bar during sunset. Also good are Spago (Four Seasons) - ate there 2x and had the whole fish both times - and Mama's Fish House (amazingly fresh fish caught that day and macadamia nut torte). Do go into Kihei and stock up on bread, hummus, lunch meats,etc for lunch so you can splurge on dinner! We walked/ jogged the ocean trail (do this in the early morning when it's not crowded and not too hot - you'll love it!) and went to most of the hotels it was linked to. From what we could see, nothing could rival the Kea Lani. We went into the Four Seasons which we had also considered, and found it to be beautiful but somewhat too formal. The lounge area at Kea Lani is also a nice open airy place to have a drink before dinner, and there is usually music being played. Very relaxing. Spa was nice. I got a massage which was fine, but expensive. ONLY complaint was the sometimes loud noise from the restaurant below at early early hours of the morning, but at least we'd wake up for the beautiful sunrise we could watch in bed!

Reviews.Title: “Royalty?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Royalty? Well, at least that is how my family were treated during our recent 5 night stay at The Fairmont Kea Lani the week of May 20, 2004.
