I suggest renting a Villa if you are traveling with a family. We rented an Oceanview Villa and were upgraded to an Oceanfront Villa upon arriving. Call the concierge a few days before your arrival with a grocery list. For a $5.00 fee plus the price of the groceries everything will be waiting for you upon your arrival. This makes a nice feature for those arriving after a long flight and with a family. The kitchen as well as the ourdoor grill made it great for cooking our own meals or having The Fairmont Staff prepare them for us. Our Villa was very comfortable and the decor was beyond what you would expect from a beach resort. The private 3 foot pool was a nice feature that my family really used and enjoyed. The shops and restraunts are some of the finest as are the pools and the beach services. The service personnel were some of the friendliest we met on the islands. We did venture ot the Four Seasons for dinner and to look at the grounds. Although their grounds were a bit more extravagant we also found them not to be as comfortable and they didn't feel as they were family friendly. We a family of 5 voted The Fairmont Kea Lani #1 Resort in the Hawaiian Islands.

Reviews.Title: “paradise with a caveat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In a previous review, a couple described the resort as paradise. They also mentioned that they were upgraded from an ocean view room to a villa with private plunge pool. We too thought the resort was very nice with wonderful service all the way down to housekeeping. However, we had also made a review for an ocean view room months in advance with a request for a newer room with a nice view. When we checked in, we were given an older room with a view of a construction site, complete with tractors and old pickups in the mud. It technically qualified as ocean view because you could see the ocean from your lanai. We were told there was nothing else available (our stay was the same time as the couple who got upgraded), then they said they could move us to a better room the next day. We then went to them the next afternoon to move into our improved ocean view room, but it was not the one promised. Finally, after move number 3, we got a rennovated room, but once again you had to go to your lanai to see the ocean. After the initial frustrations, we did have a good time there with our 5 year old daughter, but had we gotten the upgrade to a villa or simply the room we requested up front, we, too, would have been raving about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: kerewi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont from May 15-23 on our honeymoon. We were greeted in the lobby with fresh lei's and juice. I had requested the highest floor and we got the 2nd. When I asked them if they had anything higher, they said "no" and the earliest that they could move us to a higher floor would be 4 nights later. I guess that wasn't their fault!! The property is beautiful. We stayed in their signature Kilohana Suite, which is a corner suite with a HUGE wrap around balcony!!! I mean you could have a party out there!! The view was great...wonderful sunsets!!! The housekeeping staff got to know us by name. They would come in and turn down our bed each night and leave a little flower with a card saying "Sweet Dreams" , also at night, they would replace any towles that you used during the day and leave you with clean, fresh ones. It was like having housekeeping done twice a day!! There were a few times where they even turned on our clock radio to soothing music at night when they came in!!!! We did see a small roach in the bedroom closet when we first opened it...guess there's not too much they can do about that!! The bed was sooooo comfortable. I agree with another poster in that the pillows are the best you will ever lay your head on!!!! They brought us a nice picture frame with a card on our 2nd night, congratulating us on our recent marriage!!! The valet was good and so was the front desk. The pools are wonderful..not too overcrowded, but it's a good idea to claim your chairs early!!! Nick's Fishmarket, of course, was our best choice on the island. Expensive, but it's worth it, for sure!!!! Breakfast buffet is very tasty, with TONS of choices from tortillas filled with rice, sour cream, salsa, to pancakes, sausage, hash browns, salmon, made-to-order omletts, all kinds of desserts, cereal, muffins...you name it, they had it. Beware of the birds!!!!!! They will come and eat any remaider of your food when you go back for seconds!!!!! This was a wonderful resort for our honeymoon. The Grand Wailea looked too big...The four seasons looked nice!!! We would definitly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Wailea has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely perfect! I too kept coming back to these reviews even after I had booked my vacation to confirm my decision, and if you have a bad time at the Fairmont it isn't because of the hotel. Our room was spectacular and the bathroom was very large and enjoyable from the open shower to the deep tub with plenty of room for two. The staff was very friendly and the spa was nice and relaxing. I am still dreaming of the ocean view from my room, I would recommend this place as the only place to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good honeymoon choice”
Reviews.Author: Golf_Travelor
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two week honeymoon, which included four nights at the Fairmont. For a variety of reasons, I was seriously disappointed in the hotel. First of all, the hotel needs to be renovated. The carpets are stained, the elevator near our room was our of service for our first three nights, the rooms are musty, and even the chair in our room had various stains. Second, the hotel does not cater to honeymoon couples. Not only were we not upgraded at the Fairmont (the only hotel on our trip where this did not happen) but we were given a room at the very end of the hotel with a great view of the construction next door. Service was uneven, especially at bell desk. The valet parking staff was totally overwhelmed throughout our stay. At one point they told us not to call in advance for the car because they were too busy. Rediculous. The Fairmont has large rooms suitable for families on vacation. IT IS A POOR CHOICE for honeymoon couples. Do yourself a favor and stay at the nearby Four Seasons or Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: azbound
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary at the Fairmont Kea Lani; upon arriving we were greeted with beautiful leis and guava juice, a very nice touch; we were upgraded from a deluxe oceanview to a 3 bedroom villa w/plunge pool, bbq grill, gourmet kitchen, 2 huge bathrooms with deep tubs, AWESOME surprice!; couldn't ask for anything better; the bell hops were fantastic, gave a tour of the resort, check in & check out was a breeze, thank you Luz! Room service was great, the food at Nick's Fish Market was wonderful; this resort was the ultimate in a vacation facility; I have nothing bad to say about this hotel & would recommend anyone going to Maui to stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani; very well maintained facility, with professional, courteous staff, it is just the right size facility without the over crowdedness that The Grand Wialea has, which was one of our other hotels we considered & I'm so glad we stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani; different strokes for different folks, there are more positive reviews on this hotel than there are negative; and before I decided on which hotel to choose, I went to Trip Advisor every week to check reviews on both Grand Wailea & Fairmont, & Fairmont won! Bigger isn't always better! Great location, very upscale facility, you'll love it!!! I did!FAIRMONT KEA LANI IS: OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!! Some people are talking CRAZY talk!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the heck these people were staying at who gave this place a low rating..., but we are getting married on Monday and WOW!! This place is incredible! We were greeted at the valet and they took our luggage and had it right there when we checked in. Lani, who checked us on was very sweet. Danny, the bell hop walked with us and our luggage and gave us the scoop on the Kea Lani. We received a flower lei and juice in the lobby as well! Even though we're getting married on Monday, housekeeping came by and dropped off a beautiful picture frame with a card congratulating us on our upcoming marriage. Our room is SPECTACULAR!!!! We have a corner room and the bed and pillows are sooo comfy. Our bathroom is HUGE!!! I finally got to take a bath last night and let me tell you it was AWESOME! This morning, I dropped by the concierge desk to make reservations for Nicks tonight and Lea was more than happy to help. The people at the deli were also very sweet. The bar crew was also very friendly. Making reservations at the spa was easy. Malika went over all the treatment they had to offer and was very happy to help me. I have not encountered a single problem at all at this resort. Ok, so I did see a bug on my drapes, but HELLO.... tropical island, the door was open, it's gonna happen...deal with it.... some people just over-react to the small things...I haven't had a chance to get in the pool yet, but my fiancee tried the waterslide a few (4) times and he said it was fun. Well, I am off to get ready to go to Nicks and I will write again with an update!!! Aloha!! :)

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: CompressedChi
Reviews.Content: Heaven on earth. I opted to stay here after reading a lot of reviews of Maui on this site, and all were right on the money. Having travelled extensively, this is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed at. The property is located on a spectacular stretch of coastline in Wailea just down from the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons. From the time I arrived, I received the royal treatment. They upgraded me to a two bedroom villa, even though I was travelling by myself, and what a room it was. Two levels, two spacious bedrooms with enormous baths (all marble with soak tubs and walk in showers), sitting area, dining area, kitchen, laundry room, terrace overlooking the ocean with private plunge pool--it doesn't get much better. The restaurants have tasty fare and room service is quite good. The workout facility is not quite as nice as it should be, but adequate nonetheless. The hotel provides a complementary shuttle to anyplace in Wailea, which is basically within walking distance, and the staff are super efficient and very friendly. While I was there, I looked at the Grand Wailea, which is huge with fabulous grounds, and the Four Seasons, which I felt was cramped, and was very pleased with my choice of the Kea Lani. The grounds are spacious and immaculately maintained, the pool areas are not overly crowded, and the views, especially at sunset as the sun descends over the island of Lanai, were truly memorable. The weather in Wailea is much nicer than Lahaina and Hana, and I suspect that also contributed to the wonderful atmosphere. The concierges were extremely helpful with arranging restaurants and sports activities, and offer printed directions to everywhere if you opt to drive yourself. Overall I can't think of a nicer place to stay in Maui and will certainly return there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Exeprience of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If a person can't find magic at the Kea Lani, there is little chance they will find it anywhere. The service is excellent, the rooms are gorgeous, and the location is not crowded. You will not find larger rooms for the price. I have been fortunate enough to go to the Kea Lani on business once a month and have spent time there alone with my wife, as well as taking some of the trips with my young children. I am a bit caught off guard by the last reviewer's statement about families "not minding stained carpets" as my home is impeccable as are my travel standards. I DO mind stained carpets and must be staying at a different Kea Lani than the previous reviewer. Please review the entire list of comments offered and you will rarely see a bad rating of this hotel. It would be a disservice to yourself not choose this hotel when traveling to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “STAY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my honeymoon-we spent 3 days on oahu, 4 on the big island and the remaining week at the fairmount. We researched this trip to death and I took into consideration all reviews. Well to stay I am disappointed we stayed at the Fairmount is an understatement!!! To start off, we we pulled up to the entrance of the hotel and were greeted by the guys parking the cars. They told my husband to leave the luggage and it would be sent to the room (mind you they have our car keys and last name). Check in was not really a breeze-we waited on line-man at front desk was somewhat rude when I asked if they had any upgrades- he shoved in my face the room rate card and said this will be the price to upgrade. He then started pointing and gesturing us in the direction to the room like we were bothering him--just thought for this type of hotel a friendlier attitude was expected -- and stated our luggage would be right there. We finally find the room and it was disgusting -- obviously not a "newly renovated room." It was dirty (how about killing some bugs--I hope because there was no screens on the sliding glass doors to the balcony and how about seeing hair all over the floor- it also smelled musty). In addition, we were overlooking a party and the service entrance. For the money we were paying I found this unacceptable. Now about 1/2 hour has gone by and we get a call from the bell hop saying "we lost your luggage." How do you loose luggage (that has identification tags on it) that is in a guests rental car. To make a long story short-- I decided to go to the front desk and see what was going on -- when I find my luggage sitting by itself on the curb-- TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!!! Mind you about 45 minutes has gone by now. Well after this, we immediately got in touch with the manager of the hotel who moved us to a newly renovated room (it was like night and day). The manager was very nice and he knew the old room was not up to Fairmount standards. So why would they give this room to a paying guest!!!!! He also said that it was a very busy day for them and that they were a little overwhelmed. They are a 5 star hotel, and I felt like that was a poor excuse. He did give us though a $100 credit for incidentals. The day gets better though (not really)-- we decided to go by the adult pool and order a late lunch. The waitress tell us it takes about 15 minutes for the food to be out. 1 hour later the food came out. At this point we really didn't feel like arguing because it was only making us upset and THIS WAS OUR HONEYMOON --but the waitress said the food was on them and left without even a tip. Well, over the next week we actually witnessed 5 couples get free lunch, drinks etc. Obviously, the kitchen is under- staffed. I could go on and on about all the things that did not add up to it being a five star resort. The Mauna Lani on the big island (where we stayed) was a 5 star resort. Happy traveling!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Kea Lani. We were there in August 2004 for 10 nights. The rooms are expensive but every 5th night was free. They're also all suites so the kids can have their own space to sleep and watch TV. They could use a fast food resturant specially for families; they had a hotdog stand which was very handy when we were at the pool for hours. Serving chilled pineapple slices and handing out cold towels by the pool were really nice touches. The service and people working there were great.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: misdemeanor
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong here. Breakfasts are incredible, grounds & pools were immaculate. Have stayed there 3 times now over a period of 6 years, and each time the service is as consistent as the last.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & well-maintained”
Reviews.Author: enghien
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Terriffic staff, large & well-maintained rooms. We were delighted w/the hotel choice, but had a few words on restaurants - Longhi's was a disappointment (the ahi tuna was like a thin veal pane - scallop w/ a greasy nut crust). Roy's was the best and Nick's (at the resort) was great. Try to keep the food simple and don't faint at the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: jenandgary
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks in Maui. The first week we stayed at the Grand Wailea and the second at the Kea Lani. The Kea Lani has EXCELLENT service!! Everyone we met was very friendly and helpful. The housekeepers did an OUTSTANDING job, the poolside attention was super and the concierge picked out some fabulous restaurants. We will definitley return there. It is smaller than the Grand Wailea and doesn't cater as much to the conference crowd....and if they do, they are smaller conferences. It is a much more restful resort. We have travelled a lot and found this to be a first class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Whole family loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The whole family loved it. What fun. We just returned from spring break and we had a great experience at the Fairmont Kea Lani. The staff was excellent and service was great. What we found important was the activity vendors the Fairmont recommends. From sailing, snorkling to surfing lessons, each vendor was professional and insured a great time. My 8 and 13 year old kids loved it. It was important that the kids and adult pools are kept separate and enforced. The hotel is undergoing room remodeling but we never heard or saw it. It is a beautiful resort. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: KKDFCARLSON
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 nights at the Kea Lani. Very nice! Great place for children, lots of room to run around and play, the suites are great, huge bathrooms and lanis, beautiful but less formal then the Four Seasons. However if I was on a romantic vacation or honeymoon would probably do the Four Seasons instead. Be sure to ask for a recent renovated room. Service was wonderful, truly aloha spirit. Polo Beach was great, some erosion but still plenty of sand and snorkeling was good, but even better further down the coast. We had the beach in front of the Makena Surf condos and Big Beach to ourselves in the mornings. Worth it to get up early and snorkel before the crowds and the wind picks up. Beach access and parking all along the shoreline. Watch out for currents- can be very strong. We are strong swimmers but still several days did not venture out too far due to currents and wind, earlier the better! The "Fishbowl" is great snorkel spot for kids but parking fills up fast. The Shave Ice and Fish Taco guys in their van right where Wailea becomes Makena a nice stop on way back from snorkeling. Highly recommend Paragon Sailing Charters, second year we have gone out with them. They really sail-not just put the sail up for show. Very uncrowded boat- not the cattle call you see on some of the other boats and they always seem to find lots and lots of whales! I think the whales must like that they are sailing not motoring. Cafe Ciao Deli at the Fairmont a great pinic and breakfast stop. We made several meals from their salads and cheeses and fabulous desserts. Sarrentos on the Beach was the best meal although Nick's a close second place. (same owners) Food and service out of this world! Even though fine dining don't hestitate to take the kids- very nice children's menu- many steps above the standard chicken fingers and fish sticks and the staff was just wonderful with children. Polo Grille not so good- food is average but prices very high- but it is nice to just lay by the pool and have them bring it to you. Long's Drugs and the main Maui Dive Shop have good selection of beach toys and floats and much lower prices than buying from the pool/beach concession. Best purchase we made was a shortie wet suit for our 8 year old- kept him snorkeling without getting cold and good for boogie boarding too. Enjoy your stay- we certainly did- can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Sopt”
Reviews.Author: inmadridsoon
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my honeymoon, in which I spent 4 nights at the Fairmont Kea Lani. My first impression was wow. It definately is unique, with its Morroco-ish style architechture. Does not look like any other hotel in Maui. Everything but the guest rooms is open aired. Immediately upon our arrival, we were greeted with Leis, cold towels and a great passion juice. Check in was a breeze and we were guided to our room. Just like others say, all rooms are suites, and the bathrooms are a definate high point. My view was not great, it looked into a new development which is being built. Aside from that, I dont know what things I can say bad about this hotel. Service was always with a smile, except at the pool with the slide, where the attendant was just worried about closing the slide and going home it seemed. The hotel is really nice and if you can, get the breakfast buffet package, its a good variety. Think its expensive??? The only thing that isnt is Mc Donalds, so plan on that. You will spend alot of money in Maui on food and anything else you buy. The adult pool is a relaxing place to swim, the other pools are full with kids and families playing...doesnt bother me but may bother others. I still say its a great honeymoon place b/c of the adult pools and great guest rooms. Plus, Maui itself is a great Honeymoon destination. Buy the book Maui Revealed if you can, it talks about all the good places to see, especially helpfull during the Road to Hana...... A MUST IN MAUI by the way. Sarrentos on the Beach was great, nice setting and good food, my wife especially enjoyed it. Back to the hotel, the maid service was good, the rooms were kept well. The beach at the Fairmont is a little small, but good enough. I beleive that the beach the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea share is nicer. But all in all, the Farimont is great overall. Planning our trip back already.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids !!”
Reviews.Author: bjk2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in Feb-04 with the kids..ages 6 & 8. Everything was great !! The rooms are all suites so they are large enough to accomodate a family of 4-5. Our room was very clean with a very impressive bathroom. The pool area for kids is large with a great slide that kept my 8 year-old busy for 7 straight days. The adult pool is quiet and calm. The resort is large enough to have all the amenities you need, yet small enough to be able to get around quickly. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The only drawback is that it could use one or two more restaurant choices. Make sure you eat at Nick's one night...excellent. I would highly recommend the Kea Lani - especially to families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Kea Lani(Feb9-21,2004). Truly, it is the only resort to stay with children. The all-suite is ideal for families. The small "Kitchenette" which includes a mini-fridge and outdated but functional microwave, the large bathroom, the large lanais, the separate bedroom, all help to give moms and dads a break at the end of the day. The pools and the grounds are wonderful. Staff is very attentive and polite. Service can't be beat! They go the distance, folks! Ciao restaurant has unbeatable food, and is a great place to take the kids. However, beware the deli...everything is overpriced. Take your rental car and stock up at the Safeway, which is a 5 minute drive away, and save the resort deli for when you don't want to leave the resort! Make sure when you are making your reservation, that you request a newly renovated room. Fairmont is in the process of updating the badly in need of outdated and almost bordering on shabby carpets and sofas...beware. Would I stay here again? If our children are coming with us...without hesitation. If we wanted a romantic couple vacation...I would consider the Four Seasons. (Definitely would NOT take my children to the Four Seasons....small, crowded children's pools anda beach that would be a bit too scary for small kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui---don't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance surprised me with a trip to Maui, and it was incredible! From the moment we stepped out of the car, the Fairmont staff was very accomodating. The open-air lobby is breath-taking, the pools are clean and beautiful, and the beach area is unbeatable. Fitness facilities and restaurant also great. We also checked out the Four Seasons next door---and other than the rooms, which were a little bit nicer than the Fairmont's (barely), that resort doesn't compare to the Fairmont. The Fairmont's facilities and atmosphere are the best on Maui. The Four Seasons and Grand Wailea have smaller beaches and pools than the Fairmont. The staff, guests and ambience at Fairmont is the best in Maui, bar none. My fiance proposed a day before we left, and we're already planning to go back this summer before our wedding. New Zealand/Australia will be the honeymoon.....Enjoy, the Fairmont is so luxurious.....

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home from 10 days in Maui! Our first 6 days was at the Kia lani, and the last 4 at the Hyatt in Kanapali, My wife and I loved the Kia Lani, and it was a definite down grade to go to the Hyatt afterwards. The room was fantastic, but there were some issues:This was our 1st trip to Maui, and had our 17 yr old son with us, so we chose this hotel mainly on the all suite issue. The sofa bed had seen better days the cushions were flat and the bed was like laying on bars, However they did upon our complaint changed the cushions and gave us a roll-a-way at no charge. We were told that they are in the process of replacing all the sofa beds, so keep that in mind if your bring others to stay in your room.South Maui is definitely more lay back than Lahina so if your looking for peace and quiet you cant do any better, but if your looking for a hotel that has activities, pool or otherwise your not going to find that here. Also make sure your room is on the adult side of the pool if kiddy noise is something you re looking to avoid.For hotel nightlife and socializing you re out of luck! The pool bar closes at 6pm? And it's by the kid s pool! The lobby bars only open to 11, and the piano/singer doesn t allow for socializing with other guest.Please don't get the wrong idea; this is absolutely a 1st class operation, with one of the most service-oriented staff I've seen. With many nice little touches like: Impressive curb appeal, Lobby setting and layout, guava juice and cold towel upon arrival, and many more. And when compared to the Hyatt, you get a lot more bangs for the $100 buck's a day diff. (less than that, we had to pay $10 a day for Valet, and $12 a day "resort fee" at the Hyatt).Would I stay there again? You bet, can t wait to get back.Also, on our arrival I was told by my family that we we re not going on vacation with that guide book I had my nose in on the plane ride that all changed after an awful breakfast we had right were the book said we would find the most tasteless food around! So get Maui Revealed before you go, makes the difference from having a good vacation to an awesome one!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Kea Lani - pure class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married this August in Maui, and after doing research, chose to stay at the Kea Lani. The staff and service were wonderful. We were greeted with a very classy room upgrade, and Champange upon our arrival. The staff was very helpful about giving us directions to whatever our destination. The grounds and view of the Kea Lani are beautiful. The best views of the sunsets we got in all of Hawaii came from the bench at the Kea Lani. The pools are attended by a large group of staff that will happily get you anything you wish. Polo Beach at the Keni Lan has good surf for boogie boarding, and some very fine snorkeling in the volcanic rock areas to either side of the beach. the prices to rent equipment are very high at the resort, so if you plan to do any snorkeling rent for the week from Boss Frogs, or one of the other shops close by in Khei. You will pay for the week what the resort charges for the day. I also recommend that you make reservations to eat at Nick's Fish Market for at least one night of your stay. Located on the grounds of the Kea Lani, it is top quality service from start to finish. The dishes are Mediterranean influenced seafood, and everything we tried was absolutely delicious. My wife has some food allergies, and they bent over backward to assure that the meal was prepared to her needs. You do pay for this level of service, but it is worth it to treat yourself for one night. Overall, we had a great time in our 7 days at the Kea Lani. We plan to get back to Maui as soon as we can, and will have no hesitation about booking with the Kea Lani again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Fairmont Kea Lan, celebrating our 25th anniversary. We were treated extremely well by all the staff. When we got there our reservations had been messed-up by our travel agent and the hotels front staff went to great lengths to help straighten it out. To make things even better they gave us a room upgrade at no additional cose. Something they didn't have to do because it wasn't their error. During our stay we went down to the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea to check them out. While both were 'nice', neither had the same level of class while still making you feel right at home. If you eat on property, the prices are a little high. But everything is exspensive in Hawaii. We will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at the Fairmont in October of 2003. It was a dream come true. Definately buy the breakfast buffet package - it is to die for - very fresh excellent variety of of top quality breakfast foods. Service was unbelievable, staff was soooo friendly. Rooms were very pretty, and the bathrooms were excellent, I loved the shower and never wanted to get out! The pools were great because you have the no kids option, of it being quiet, or you can go to the kids allowed pool and go down the slide. I especially loved the mint ice cold towels passed out daily by the pool and fresh pineapple. Yes it is expensive, but it is well worth it. This hotal has thought of all the details!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 days, starting on November 16 and leaving on Thanksgiving day. Overall, our experience with the Kea Lani was fantastic. We debated between Kea Lani & the Four Seasons and opted for Kea Lani based on the "suite" room--and we weren't disappointed. Both the living room & bedroom were spacious & comfortable. The bathroom was HUGE (two sinks, huge tub, separate walk-in shower), with the toilet behind a separate enclosed door. When traveling with kids, the microwave/minifridge cannot be overestimated! We received great service from housekeeping and found our garden-level patio to be a great addition (for meals, activities for our 8 year old, etc.) The grounds were beautiful, (torchlit at night) and the beach was pristine and more than adequate in size. Our son loved the pools & the slide. We were right next door to the kids club which was outstanding and very professionally run. Our son went for one day and begged to go back the next. Bonnie the person who runs it is a sweetheart and great with the kids (cost is $55 a day for one kid). The concierge service was excellent ( prepared for any request), while the sevice at the activities desk was more average (seemed understaffed). The valet (included) service was wonderful (got towels for us as we departed on snorkel trips, etc.) There was a slight change for the worse during the busier few days right before the Thanksgiving holiday holiday as the pool area became a little overcrowded people were reserving chairs. A bit frustrating was the $50 a day charge for the shaded "cabana" areas by the pool and beach (essentially two padded chairs under a shaded tent), however may be the only way to regulate their use. With respect to food, Nick's Fishmarket was superb. Pricey but worth it with outstanding food, service and atmosphere. They even made an impromptu bed for our son when he fell asleep the first time by pushing two soft padded chairs together. The buffet was a bit overpriced but we found the food to be solid. By far the best value was the the excellent italian deli Cafe Ciao. Everything we tasted there was excellent. We made many outstanding meals just by combining their various pasta salads and sandwiches etc. Avoid the attached Italian restaurant though. Really not worth it. Overall our experience at Kea Lani was outstanding, although I think it perhaps slightly more ideal for families than honeymooners. Outside of the hotel, Shaka Pizza in Kihei was a great hole in the wall for pizza, hoagies etc as a break from the nice meals. We rented our snorkel equipment from Snorkel Bob in Kihei. The woman who runs (Sue?) Snorkel Bob was incredibly sweet and helpful, giving us great tips and letting us have a free ride on our extra couple of days over the week rental. Other fun highlights included a hike to the "fish bowl" a wonderful snorkel site reached by walking 30 minutes over the lava fields about fifteen minutes south of Kea Lani ( probably only for older kids though) and snorkeling off of the Maui Prince beach where we had multiple close encounters with the majestic sea turtles. A wonderful vacation for our whole family. Thanks Kea Lani and Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at the Kea Lani in Maui and couldn't have had a better time! We were treated like royalty! The staff were friendly and helpful. Yes its pricey but I knew before I left and planned accordingly. We wanted the best and thats what we got! The only suggestion is plan your activities from the locations in Lahaina or nearer the actual departure. The activity desk was the highest prices. We planned the trip in the "off" season, the hotel was booked completely but there were no problems concerning ability to relax around one of their 3 pools. They also have a beautiful beach to relax on! I am anxious to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Kea Lani-a dissappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kea Lani for our anniversary. We were hoping for luxury and romance. We were very dissappointed. The hotel was booked to max. capacity. Pool were overcrowdwed and impossible to get chairs. For the price you literally get nothing. They even charge extra for umbrellas. The breakfast and lunch was terrible and service even worse. We left and went to the Four Seasons. What a world of difference. There we were treated like celebrities!

Reviews.Title: “Dream's do come true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother in law and father in law visited Maui October 8th thru the 14th. We chose Kea lani because of the reviews I read. I researched for a year before making this choose. It was my mother in laws dream to visit Maui. My husband and I honeymooned 7 years ago and boy did we miss alot on our first trip. Fairmont Kea lani is gorgeous. EVERYONE was so friendly. Our suite was perfect. I found it very comfortable. We did share the suite with my in laws and the pull out was horrible but what pull out is great?! We ate meals mostly in Kihei. Wailea was pricey. We also visited Lahaina for meals. Bubba gump's was fun. My biggest suggestion would be DO NOT GO ON THE PRINCESS MAUI DINNER CRUISE! Fairmonts activity desk suggested this. Actually they "highly" recommended this. It was a nightmare. I was so ashamed we took my in laws on this. Research the dinner cruises. As of right now Maui does not have a nice dinner cruise. Be careful this was nightmare. My hat goes off to the Fairmont Kea Lani. We were very pleased. ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool - versitile rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I researched reviews and hotels before I picked the Kea Lani. I had never been to Hawaii and had no idea about where to stay. The Kea Lani offered big rooms and a great bathroom. The rooms were suites and had a queen bed and a sofa sleeper. I didn't open the sofa sleeper but the rooms could be closed off from each other with separate bathroom entrances so if you shared the room people can get into the bathroom from 2 doors. There was also a mini fridge and bar sink and microwave making it easy to bring extra food in. There were 2 tvs, a dvd player, and stereo. There were 3 pools, and adult pool, one with a swim up bar and one that was more of a kids pool bec of the slide. My husband spend most our time at the kids pool because he loved the slide. There was hardly anyone there in Sept and more adults used the slide than kids. You can rent pool rafts and kids flotation devices for $15-20 per hour or just purchase your own. They even said they would help you pump them up. Most pools don't let you have a raft in the pool but they did - a plus in my mind! We passed the costco on the way from the airport to the hotel and stocked up on water and other essentials. There was also a Walmart on the way. There is a small strip mall near the hotel with an Outback Steak house, Safeway, and Blockbuster. Food was very expensive, we made sure we purchased our package with the breakfast buffet which was very good. Not worth the over $20 a day you pay off the street. It was less when in our package. The hotel is right next to the Four Seasons and Grand Wialia. We walked to each. The Four Seasons looked very beautiful and quiet. The Grand Wialia looked trashed by 6pm when we were there. It was not crowded at that time but just did not look as "kept" at the Four Seasons and Fairmont. It did look like great fun, especially if you have kids as the pools were cool. We did use the spa for a massage and the free AM yoga which was on specific days. There was a different event every AM and yoga was on no more than 2 days but was very good. The massage and spa was great but expensive. They have a gym with good cardio and weights, tv, etc. The yoga instructor said it is packed normally. We went Spent 10 - 16th, 2003 and the hotel seemed empty. The was no problem getting chairs at the pool but I can't imagine the place in the summer. They said the hotel was sold out when we were there. The grounds were beautiful, the staff very helpful. We had a partial view, personally I am not a view person and would save the money. You can see it from the beach : ) There was construction going on and on the first day I hear construction noise a 10am. I called the front desk and they said they would be doing construction our entire visit. I asked if there was a discount for being in the construction zone and they knocked $80 off our room each night with out a further comment on my part. I never saw the workers not was I in the room extended periods of time bet 10-4 but I really appreciated their concern and felt compensated. There is not too much near the hotel. There is a very upscale shopping center very close buy with another restaurant and a good breakfast place (I heard). I would definitely stay at the hotel again. There are nice villas that would be fun with a group or if you have the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: KyotoVisitor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week stay at the Kea Lani resort. I think this resort is very good value for money considering the location, beach, hotel grounds, pools and the large 2 room suites. The room furniture and decor is however not up to the mark. Due to humid Maui weather, the carpets and sofas have a smell to them which bothered us a bit. Next door Four Seasons has superior 5-star room amenities. The service is excellent and so is food. The deli at the hotel offers relatively inexpensive food options (especially for take-out meals). Ocean view rooms are definitely a must.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont in October 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from 6 days at the Fairmont on 10/19/03. We decided to stay at this property based on the reviews on this site, as well as others. I'll do my best to give you a complete overview of our stay. Location: Great location! I would not stay anywhere other than Wailea. The Fairmont is basically the farthest south that you can stay on the island (as far as large hotels). The area is generally very quiet and peaceful. There is an upscale shopping center nearby, and there's a grocery store about 10 minutes north. Grounds: Very, very nice. Not exactly what we expected, but nice nontheless. There are three pools, including one adults only pool. Beyond the pools is a large grassy area with palm trees and lounge chairs. Past the grass are the villas, and then finally the beach. The pool areas were generally very well kept, except for the very late afternoon before the pool staff had a chance to clean up. All the pools are infinity pools, so the water level is flush with the surrounding pool deck. On the top level pool there is also a swim up bar. The beach was great - very low surf and swell, with great soft sand. The only rub here was that they put away the beach chairs at 5 pm because it is a public beach. There is another beach just south of the Fairmont's, but if you go any farther you will have to scramble over some rocks. The pools were kept around 78 so they were very comfortable. Rooms: The rooms are very comfortable and large. The bed was great although the pillows left something to be desired - a little too hard for me. The bathroom is great - separate sinks, and a door-less walk shower. The tub fits two people, just barely. There is a fridge, microwave and sink in the room, which came in handy for snacks. Closet space is ample for two people, and the living area was very nice. As this is an older hotel, it did show a bit in the rooms - not the decor so much as the ceilings and trim work. The lanai was plenty big for the two of us. Staff: Very, very helpful, courteous and nice. The front desk went above and beyond the call of duty in getting us a room upgrade (our reservation got screwed up). Basically they comp'd us a double upgrade that would have run about $500 for our stay. They also sent up champagne and homemade chocolate turtles. When I say turtles, I mean that literally - chocolate turtles and a white chocolate starfish on crystallized can sugar that looks like beach sand. When our deli sandwiches got ruined in our cooler on a day trip, my wife ended up speaking with the hotel's assistant manager (Dan), who was nice enough to comp us lunch at the poolside grill the next day. Keep in mind lunch ran us 65 bucks. The bell and valet staff were equally as nice. This is not the kind of hotel where the staff hates there job - every single person was pleasant. Food: We mostly ate breakfast at the buffet as it was included in our package. It was very good in my opinions - made to order omelletes, pancakes, fruit, pastries, etc. It got me through to dinner most days. We did eat at Nick's, and it was very good. If you go to the island, you HAVE to eat at Sarento's, just up the road. It is amazing. Spago at the Four Seasons next door is also incredible. The Italian restaurant at the Fairmont was very good the night we at there. Note that the restaurants on the island are all very expensive - we didn't spent less than $100 on any occasion - that is with maybe one alcoholic drink, no appetizers for the two of us. You will not forget the seafood however - it is world class. Activities: nearby snorkeling is OK, but we are spoiled by Kauai. Even Molokini was a bummer, but we sailed over on a 47 foot catamaran run by Paragon and it was fantastic! While the power boats were crammed with over 100 people, we had 13 people on our boat including the crew. We hit 27 knots coming back from Molokini. Summary: I don't think I can give the hotel 5 stars, but it deserves at least 4, maybe 4.5. It wasn't quite the world class experience that we were expecting. Mind you there were multiple wedding per day on the property, and it did seem quite full even though it was after labor day. But it was relaxing and enjoyable. We didn't prefer Maui over Kauai, but if we were to return we would stay here or at the Four Seasons next door (even though it is substantially more expensive). We toured their hotel and even went into one of the rooms, and it is just a step up from everyone else. We were pleased with the Fairmont however. Feel free to email with questions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing-Most friendly people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 daughters spent 7 days and 7 nights in Maui at the Fairmont Kei Lani----Beautiful and beautiful gracious people.Wasnt ready to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Service is great but the hotel is more like 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our 10 day trip to Maui. Having been to maui 6 times my family has stayed in 6 different resort from Kapalua, Kaanapali to now Wailea. I've read the great reviews about the Kea Lani and it's 5 star rating was a plus in making my decision. The Lei greeting with guava Juice was a nice touch and the initial impression of the resort was good but not awe inspring like I've read from the other reviews. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade for a suite next to the pool at a discounted rate with one condition that we stay in our original suite for a night. We agreed, thinking for an extra $50 bucks a night we get such a great deal and our original room was facing a construction site next door with loud machinery . When we moved into our upgraded room the next day it was nice unitil we heard construction noise from the level above us. We soon found out why this room was such a good deal--they were renovating the floor above us from 7 am to 4 pm. If I would have know that this was going on I would have never moved perferring the construction noise next door than the annoying hammering above us. I complained to the manager a few times but they weren't really helpful. They're only advice to us was that the construction will only last a day but it went on for the 10 days we were there. The suite was nice, but not 5 star quality especially the old furniture and carpeting that needed a steam clean( if you view on expedia's virtual tour the room looks bigger than it really is). The large bathrrom was the nicest part of the suite with it's dual sinks and huge shower and tub. The intertainment system was nice as well with CD,DVD, VCR palyers in each room. All in all the rooms was 4 star at best not 5 stars. The grounds were very well kept and clean. The 3 pools were nice with a decent slide . My toddler loved the children's pool. The beach was a good size and clean--decent boogie board waves for your kids. The service was great with their complimetary pineapple slice and food servers were very attentive. And Yes, the Burgers are $15 but very good--it's huge! I have no complaints about their service and grounds. The breakfast Buffet was the usual fair nothing too impressive---pancakes , beacon, eggs etc. The outdoor restaurant has a bird problem so be careful not to leave your food unattended because a flock of birds will get to them----It almost was like watching Hitchcock's the Birds when they attacked the food! I don't want to come off as a complainer but just honest with my experience. Overall, I had a good time but I won't come back. I was expecting 5 star rooms , but what I got was a 4 star room at a 5 star price. For the same price I would stay at the Hyatt on Kaanapali or the Ritz in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience was truly wonderful from the time we arrived to that sad morning we had to leave. My wife and I spent 10 days there, so we had time to try everything available. The grounds are beautifully maintained, as are the rooms. The pools had a little something for everyone, and we opted to hang out at the adult pool, where it was incredibly quiet and peaceful. Nick's is a must for anyone who visits--the crabcakes are fantastic. In addition, a massage at the spa is well worth the hefty price tag. Although some would say that the beach is a but small, the times we went there was always plenty of room. We will definitely opt for the Kea Lani on or next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 7 (4 Adults & 3 Kids) just returned from the Kea Lani and had a great time. Our connecting suites weren't available for the first 2 nights, so they put us up in an oceanfront 2 Bd Villa for 2 days. Cabanas by the family pool are ofter reserved in advance, so think about it if you want to sit in the shade at the pool (and get a bucket of ice and water bottles brought to you) The suites are large as are the bathrooms. (Note to parents- the showers have no curtains or doors) The staff is very friendly and helpful and full of suggestions. To save money on equiptment rental we brought our own snorkle equiptment and bought sand toys at the K-mart and boogie boards at the supermarket. Since the suites have a mini-frig and microwave you can pick up snacks and drinks at the supermarket in Kihie

Reviews.Title: “Expectations were greater....”
Reviews.Author: my3sonz
Reviews.Content: After walking through hotel and grounds in 2001 couldn't wait to stay there. Just returned from 5 nights with 3 children under 10. To be honest, I was a little disappointed. We had to pay extra $$$ to stay in the view room we thought we had originally booked. Aftere the $$$ spent, view was great! Room needed a large overhaul. Bathroom was nice, kids loved the walk in shower, but I found lighting terrible and nowhere to stow bath articles. Closet space very minimal, had to ask for a few extra hangers and closet rod broke! Room definetely needed updating, 'cottage cheese' ceiling, carpets were stained, furniture was worn out. I feel they need to redecorate and it would be perfect! As for the restaurants Nicks Fishmarket was fabulous! Caffe Ciao restaurant and deli were superb! The pool was nothing, kids were bored after one day. One waterslide? If it wasn't for the 'suite' room, I wouldn't even consider staying there again with kids. Next time, get adjoining rooms at the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!...Need I say more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on our Honeymon (Feb 2003). Don't pay any attention to the picky people who would complain about receiving a million dollars. The hotel is simply awesome. The beautiful open air lobby was just breath taking. The staff was very attentive anf friendly. They always seemed to know your name. The suites are great. Large balcony. The grounds were well kept and the pools were not over crowded. The beach was small, but not crowded. Calm waters. No real negatives. The food and drinks are expensive there, but that seemed to be the case on the whole island...Drive to the Volcanoe for sunrise (do that on your second day there since you will not be acustomed to the time change), go whale watching, the helicopter tour was awesome and see the lava fields.

Reviews.Title: “BIG fan of the Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: PLimPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: We are repeat visitors to the Fairmont Kea Lani. It's definitely pricey but it's your vacation...if you want to save $ get in the car and go camping. We have two young boys and the hotel suites offer plenty of room for them to run and play AND the separate bedroom offers a little peace and quiet for cocktails, reading, relaxing or TV after they fall asleep. The small refrigerator is great to keep snacks, juice and perishables from the deli and the microwave also comes in handy for heating up a snack for the kids. Service is superb! Many of the staff greet you by name. The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day with plenty of options for large and small appetities. The toddler wading pool is key, especially for those with kids < 2 yrs. The larger family pool is great for kids, though one will find much more appealing slides and pool features at the Grand Wailea but without the benefit of a hotel suite. Polo beach is marginal in terms of a vast white sand type of beach but more than enough for young families. Bottom line: we will be back for more in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel and beach are very attractive and the rooms are quite large, although the decorating is bland and rather cold. The staff are the same - rather distant and unfriendly, unlike the many other Fairmont properties we have visited. There is very little shade on the property. Cabanas and beach umbrellas must be rented and were all booked by the time we arrived. The food is barely ok and is a rip-off. Example: a poor-quality beach-bar hamburger is $16, with french fies another $5 (cheese is extra too). The level of service is low compared to other Fairmont hotels, such as long waits for pool-side service and no turn-down service. When it was time to leave, I waited half an hour for a bell man and had to haul my luggage to my taxi myself. There are a lot of other good hotels on Maui - skip this one - we certainly will next time.
